Project: Carry Over International Assistance 2022-2023
Description:
This administrative mechanism was put in place in 2006 to carry forward into the following biennium International Assistance requests funded by the World Heritage Fund which have not been fully implemented in the preceding biennium. 
This carry-forward concerns International Assistance requests approved in 2022-2023 and not yet implemented.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: World Higher Education Conference Follow-up
Description: This workplan focuses on the follow-up to the 2022 World Higher Education Conference (WHEC 2022), namely the finalization of its enriched roadmap, development of a knowledge base, and higher education area.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED4 - Learners equipped with relevant skills to meet individual, labour market and societal demands through literacy, TVET, STEM and higher education

Project: Emergency Assistance (2024-2025)
Description:
This reserve fund established by the World Heritage Convention is part of the World Heritage Fund. It supports the States Parties to the World Heritage Convention to face severe damage that occurred to the cultural or natural sites located on their territories and inscribed on the World Heritage List.
The World Heritage Committee has voted a budget of US$400,000 under this reserve fund for 2024-2025.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: Advisory services by ICOMOS for 2024-2025
Description: Under the provisions of Articles 13(7) and 14(2) of the Convention Concerning the Protection of the World Cultural and Natural Heritage, UNESCO is requested to utilize the services of ICOMOS in the preparation of the documentation and agenda of the statutory and other meetings of the World Heritage Committee. This activity covers the Monitoring Services, Evaluation Services and other advisory services to be provided by ICOMOS in the implementation of the Convention during the period 2024-2025.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: Advisory services by IUCN for 2024-2025
Description: "Advisory services by IUCN for 2024-2025" is the budget line voted by the World Heritage Committee under the World Heritage Fund for the period 2024-2025, to finance the Monitoring Services, Evaluation Services and other advisory services it requests from IUCN in the implementation of the Convention.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: Advisory services by ICCROM for 2024-2025
Description: ICCROM's statutory functions in relation to the 1972 World Heritage Convention are to carry out research, documentation, technical assistance, training and public awareness programmes to strengthen conservation of cultural heritage. Its advisory services include training for cultural heritage, monitoring the state of conservation of World Heritage cultural properties, reviewing requests from International Assistance submitted by States Parties, and providing input and support for capacity-building activities.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: Advisory missions 2024-2025
Description: "Advisory missions" is the budget line voted by the World Heritage Committee under the World Heritage Fund for the period 2022-2023, to finance Advisory missions in relation to the state of conservation of World Heritage sites. This funding is to be used for Advisory missions in States Parties falling within the category of Least developed countries, Low-income and Lower middle income countries as well as Small Islands Developing States, or other countries on a case by case as well as cost-sharing basis.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: Reactive and Reinforced Monitoring (2024-2025)
Description: "Reactive and Reinforced Monitoring" is the budget line voted by the World Heritage Committee under the World Heritage Fund for the period 2022-2023 to finance missions by the Secretariat of the World Heritage Convention to assess on the ground the state of conservation of specific World Heritage properties under threat. These missions are requested by the World Heritage Committee; they are organized upon invitation by the State Party concerned and often undertaken with experts from the Advisory Bodies (i.e. ICOMOS, ICCROM or IUCN).
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: Federation of International Civil Service Associations
Description: UN Joint Machinery Participation towards the Federation of International Civil Service Associations
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: Joint Machinery of the United Nations system (JUNM)
Sector: PARTICIPATION IN THE JOINT MACHINERY THE UNITED NATIONS SYSTEM JUNM

Project: Enhancing human resources to improve the implementation of the International Assistance mechanisms
Description: In accordance with Resolution 7.GA 8 of the General Assembly of States Parties to the 2003 Convention, which approved the creation of three fixed term posts, this activity aims at enhancing the human resources of the Secretariat to support States Parties in making better use of the resources of the Intangible Cultural Heritage Fund and thus operationalize the International Assistance mechanism.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT4 - Member States and communities capacities strengthened to identify, safeguard and promote living heritage

Project: Practical handbook on periodic reporting and self learning tool ORF
Description: The General Assembly of the 2003 Convention at its seventh session approved the Convention's Overall results framework, as well as a transition towards a regional cycle of periodic reporting. To further enhance capacity-building activities provided by the Secretariat, with a focus on the relevance of the periodic reporting exercise and the ORF for policy-making at the national level, a practical handbook and a self-learning tool are foreseen to be developed. The handbook would aim to address the practical needs of the country focal points in the preparation of their periodic reports, while the self-learning tool would aim to familiarize relevant actors with the ORF.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT4 - Member States and communities capacities strengthened to identify, safeguard and promote living heritage

Project: United Nations System Staff College
Description: UN Joint Machinery Participation towards the United Nations System Staff College
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: Joint Machinery of the United Nations system (JUNM)
Sector: PARTICIPATION IN THE JOINT MACHINERY THE UNITED NATIONS SYSTEM JUNM

Project: UN Medical Doctors Network
Description: UN Joint machinery Participation in the cost sharing of the Medical Doctors Secretariat by the World Food Programme
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: Joint Machinery of the United Nations system (JUNM)
Sector: PARTICIPATION IN THE JOINT MACHINERY THE UNITED NATIONS SYSTEM JUNM

Project: Improving IWRM, Knowledge-based Management and Governance of the Niger
Description: The full-size project aims at improving knowledge-based management, governance and resources conservation of the Niger Basin and the Iullemeden-Taoudeni/Tanezrouft Aquifer System (ITTAS) to support Integrated Water Resources Managements (IWRM) for the benefit of communities and the resilience of ecosystems. UNESCO is responsible for the design of a governance mechanism that would take into account surface and groundwater (Conjunctive Management). The main partners of the project are the Niger Basin Authority and the OSS
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.SC2 - Water science, innovation, education, management, cooperation and governance bolstered for a water secure world in a changing environment

Project: Guiding and Supporting the Enhancement of Teacher Policies and Practices
Description: UNESCO Bangkok's Workplan for OP5 Regular Programme strategically focuses on two key components to advance UNESCO's pivotal role in teacher development across the Asia-Pacific region. The first component prioritizes evidence-based research and publications, with the goal of generating practical and implementable recommendations to enhance teacher policies and practices. Through a systematic exploration of diverse educational contexts, practices, and experiences throughout the region, the research aims to develop a profound understanding of the unique issues, challenges, and needs in different countries, laying the groundwork for targeted interventions. The second component involves the organisation of and active participation in a variety of advocacy events, most notably the World Teachers' Day celebration. These events serve as influential platforms to champion policies and practices that effectively contribute to the realization of SDG4, fostering meaningful international exchange and collaboration on various aspects related to teacher development.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED5 - Teachers trained and supported to improve learning outcomes and address the changes brought forth by the digital and AI transformation and the COVID-19 crisis

Project: Communication
Description: Renforcement des activités de communication du secteur de la culture
Output EN: CLT Programme-related, operating and staff costs

Project: Implementation of the Regional Action Plan for Africa (2021-2027)
Description: Under Global Priority Africa, the Secretariat will implement and promote the Regional Action Plan 2021-2027 and Flagship Programme 3: Fostering cultural heritage and capacity development. It will support capacity building, the increase of African experts, and involve youth. The Secretariat will primarily support 11 countries with no properties on the WH List, assist 14 sites on the List of the WH in danger, mentoring experts and support conservation to achieve targets of the SDGs and Aspiration 5 of the Agenda 2063. Support will focus on the participation of the States Parties, the African World Heritage Fund, universities, experts, civil society, youth and other partners in celebrating the 50th anniversary of the 1972 Convention.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: Supporting the implementation of the WH Convention in Europe and North America
Description: Monitoring of the state of conservation of World Heritage properties in Europe and North America will be carried out in close cooperation with the competent national authorities and the Advisory Bodies to the World Heritage Committee. Support will also be provided for the implementation of the regional action plan resulting from the Third Periodic Reporting Cycle, including through the development of expertise and tools for the effective sustainable management of World Heritage properties.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: STAFF COMPENSATION GRANTS
Description: Provision for staff compensation
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 11 - Accountable, efficient and effective management in pursuit of the Organization's results
Output EN: 11.FLD3 - Enhanced administrative and operational support by addressing existing and emerging needs
Sector: FIELD OFFICES PROGRAMME MANAGEMENT AND SUPPORT SERVICES

Project: Transforming Education for Health and Wellbeing
Description: Transforming Education for Health and Wellbeing
Outcome EN: Outcome 7 - Promote inclusion and combat discrimination, hate speech and stereotypes
Output EN: 7.ED3 - Learners are empowered to lead healthy lives, promote sustainable development and engage with the world as creative and responsible global citizens

Project: Campus Africa
Description:
UNESCO’s Campus Africa programme supports governments across the African continent in building integrated, inclusive and quality tertiary education systems. Support to local research and innovation capacities, intra-African student mobility, labour market entry and entrepreneurial endeavor, particularly in key green and inclusive growth sectors such as agriculture, renewable energies and technological innovation (including digital and artificial intelligence), will enable African higher education eco-systems to leverage their unique talents and potential for a sustainable and prosperous future.

Launched under UNESCO’s Operational Strategy for Priority Africa 2022-2029, Campus Africa will achieve its aims by: i) enhancing the general and applied research capacity of African tertiary institutions through capacity strengthening, networking, knowledge sharing and partnerships; ii) facilitating intra and inter-continental mobility and increased access to tertiary education through the take-up of doctoral studies, scholarships and study grants, and; iii) improving the relevance of the higher education ‘offer’ through partnerships with employers in key growth sectors and youth skill development to enhance employability and entrepreneurship.

Across all these areas, Campus Africa emphasizes the building of robust quality assurance systems and recognition of qualifications, as well as possibilities for reinforcing decision-making through the improved availability of quality, comprehensive data and statistics on higher education.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED4 - Learners equipped with relevant skills to meet individual, labour market and societal demands through literacy, TVET, STEM and higher education

Project: Lisbon Convention for Europe
Description: This workpkplan focuses on advancing the European higher education agenda and cooperation with other regions, in UNESCO's capacity as the co-Secretariat to the Lisbon Convention. In particular, this will be done through policy support to the Lisbon Convention Committee, ENIC-NARIC network of national information centres and Bologna Follow-up Group (BFUG).
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED4 - Learners equipped with relevant skills to meet individual, labour market and societal demands through literacy, TVET, STEM and higher education

Project: Global Convention
Description: This workplan primarily focuses on the advancement and implementation of the Global Convention for the Recognition of Qualifications concerning Higher Education. It also aims to support the operationalization of regional conventions in Africa, the Arab States, Asia-Pacific and Latin America and the Caribbean through their respective Secretariats.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED4 - Learners equipped with relevant skills to meet individual, labour market and societal demands through literacy, TVET, STEM and higher education

Description:
Education and learning reimagined through interdisciplinary research,
foresight and public policy debate
Outcome EN: Outcome 2 - Strengthen international coordination for the achievement of SDG 4 and develop the global education agenda based on research, foresight and innovation
Output EN: 2.ED9 - Education and learning reimagined through interdisciplinary research, foresight and public policy debate

Project: Support Pacific SIDS Leading Resilient Education Systems
Description: This programme provides an enabling platform for Pacific SIDS regional education cooperation through the Pacific Heads of Education Systems (PHES), a network of 15 Education Ministries for over 45 years that UNESCO supports. PHES serves as independent venue to dialogue Pacific education priorities, issues and provide direction for regional programme and resource mobilization. It supports knowledge generation/sharing, South-South collaboration, leadership and professional development of the members and their respective Ministries, with a particular focus on quality education data enhancement and its application in policies and planning. The workplan contributes to enhanced capacity, network, decision making and resource mobilization mechanism of Pacific education leaders. The workplan complements OP1 and OP7 in particular.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED6 - Resilience, quality and equity of education systems strengthened to flexibly respond to evolving learning environments and to better deliver on SDG4 commitments

Project: Strengthening resilience and effectiveness of education systems in LAC to better deliver SDG4
Description: UNESCO Santiago will carry out analytical work on the state of education in the region and coordinates the response to the needs of Member States in the areas of education planning and management, including monitoring, information systems, education statistics, and their use and impact on the coverage and quality of education. Additionally, its Latin American Laboratory for Assessment of the Quality of Education (LLECE) will support Member States in the better use of information of the results generated by the Regional Comparative and Explanatory Study (ERCE) to know where they are in the educational trajectory, to build evidence on what works to achieve greater coherence of education policies, and better alignment between policy goals and processes within and across systems.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED6 - Resilience, quality and equity of education systems strengthened to flexibly respond to evolving learning environments and to better deliver on SDG4 commitments

Project: Regional Steering Committee and SDG 4 Monitoring in LAC
Description: LAC has developed the Regional Coordination Mechanism, a technical-political dialogue strategy, to deepen educational cooperation efforts that support countries on their way to achieving the SDG 4. This mechanism, established in 2018, is led by the ministers of education of the region and supported by the Regional Steering Committee (RSC) and UNESCO Santiago as Executive Secretariat. This project aims to develop the Regional Steering Committee Workplan for 2024 - 2025 and to monitor the progress in achieving the SDG 4 targets.
Outcome EN: Outcome 2 - Strengthen international coordination for the achievement of SDG 4 and develop the global education agenda based on research, foresight and innovation
Output EN: 2.ED7 - Education policy and finance decisions to achieve SDG 4 are informed by improved coordination, data and monitoring, knowledge and innovative partnerships

Project: 3% Evaluation SC1
Description: The overall purpose of this workplan is ensure a proper evaluation coverage of the sector’s programme and projects, for accountability, learning and decision-making. The key activities are the delivery and dissemination of corporate evaluations on strategic/ global and thematic topics and an annual synthesis report of all UNESCO evaluations. It also involves support to the decentralized evaluation function by building the capacity of UNESCO staff through a dedicated training programme; financing and managing Regional Evaluation Associates in five duty stations (to start in 2025) and animating the Evaluation Focal Point Network and the UNESCO Evaluation Knowledge Hub.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.SC1 - Inclusive knowledge and capacities of Member States strengthened to advance and apply science for sustainable management of natural resources, ecosystem and biodiversity conservation and restoration, and disaster risk resilience

Project: 3% Evaluation SC3
Description: The overall purpose of this workplan is ensure a proper evaluation coverage of the sector’s programme and projects, for accountability, learning and decision-making. The key activities are the delivery and dissemination of corporate evaluations on strategic/ global and thematic topics and an annual synthesis report of all UNESCO evaluations. It also involves support to the decentralized evaluation function by building the capacity of UNESCO staff through a dedicated training programme; financing and managing Regional Evaluation Associates in five duty stations (to start in 2025) and animating the Evaluation Focal Point Network and the UNESCO Evaluation Knowledge Hub.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.SC3 - SIDS empowered with strengthened capacities in UNESCO fields of expertise to better address their specific challenges

Project: 3% Evaluation SC5
Description: The overall purpose of this workplan is ensure a proper evaluation coverage of the sector’s programme and projects, for accountability, learning and decision-making. The key activities are the delivery and dissemination of corporate evaluations on strategic/ global and thematic topics and an annual synthesis report of all UNESCO evaluations. It also involves support to the decentralized evaluation function by building the capacity of UNESCO staff through a dedicated training programme; financing and managing Regional Evaluation Associates in five duty stations (to start in 2025) and animating the Evaluation Focal Point Network and the UNESCO Evaluation Knowledge Hub.

Output EN: 4.SC5 - Institutional and human capacities in basic sciences, technology, research, innovation, and engineering enhanced to advance knowledge for sustainable development

Project: World Climate Research Programme (WCRP)
Description: IOC is a co-sponsor of the World Climate Research Programme (WCRP). WCRP provides the international and intergovernmental platform to design the research agenda on climate and climate change, on the basis of which national research agendas are developed. The discharge of such national research agendas leads to improving the knowledge base on climate and climate change, which in turn inform the assessment work of the IPCC and, ultimately, policy decisions including those of the UNFCCC and its Paris Agreement. WCRP encompasses an ocean element, of particular relevance to IOC's work and to which IOC is uniquely positioned to contribute.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health and accelerate the transition towards sustainable management of ocean-related risks and opportunities

Project: Support to the implementation of the World Heritage Committee's decisions
Description: This workplan takes in all activities of the World Heritage Centre at Headquarters level to support the effective implementation of the 1972 Convention, funded from the Regular Programme, although on an ad hoc basis, considering the amount available and the fact that this workplan also covers the running costs of the World Heritage Centre at Headquarters.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: Climate Change Adaptation in Coastal Zones
Description: One of the priorities in the context of the ICAM Strategy is to build the capacity of national and local coastal management agencies in designing and implementing coastal hazards mitigations, through the use of best practices advocated within new guidelines, as well as access to resources on the topic of hazards mitigation and climate change adaptation.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health and accelerate the transition towards sustainable management of ocean-related risks and opportunities

Project: Follow-up to SDGs, WOA & State of the Ocean Reporting
Description:
The IOC will fulfill its commitment to be custodian for two SDG 14 indicators, 14.3.1 focusing on ocean acidification and 14.a.1 on scientific cooperation/investment. 

In order to meet the increased demand by decision-makers and society at large for current and easily accessible information on the state of the ocean, as well as to contribute to the UN Ocean Decade, the IOC will develop 'State of the Ocean Report' (StOR).
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health and accelerate the transition towards sustainable management of ocean-related risks and opportunities

Project: Mainstreaming gender equality in Southeast Asia through the Transforming MENtalities framework
Description: This workstream builds on best practices of the Social and Human Sciences Sector's programming to engage men and boys in gender equality in other countries and regions. Responding to the needs, priorities, and demand identified in the Southeast Asia SHS will build a follow-on/up programme, to strengthen a) knowledge on the behavioural, institutional, and structural factors which enable interventions to engage men and boys for gender equality to be successful; 2) the scale and reach of operational activities to engage men and boys for gender equality within educational and community settings; and 3) the networks available to encourage peer-learning, good practice sharing, and coordination around engaging men and boys for gender equality in areas of SHS mandate such as inter-cultural dialogue, ethics of science and technology and youth and sports for development.
Outcome EN: Outcome 7 - Promote inclusion and combat discrimination, hate speech and stereotypes
Output EN: 7.SHS3 - Member States capacities are strengthened to scale up their policy, institutional and legislative actions towards gender equality, to eliminate gender-based violence and discrimination, gender biases and stereotypes, including in the digital world

Project: Support to the implementation of global and other related priorities
Description: This workplan will support the contribution of World Heritage to UNESCO global priorities such as Africa, gender and youth (on an ad hoc basis, considering the amount available), as well as the implementation of other priorities in relation to Historical Urban Landscapes or architecture.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: Support to the nomination process
Description: Technical assistance and guidance to States Parties preparing Tentative Lists and Nominations. Coordination and registration of Upstream Process requests, Tentative Lists, Preliminary Assessment Requests, technical analysis and focused comments on Draft Nominations and completeness check of full Nominations. Preparation of documents and presentations for the Committee, General Assembly and their subsidiary bodies, concerning nominations and related processes. Examination of nomination dossiers of already inscribed properties through the Retrospective Inventory. Provision of expertise and institutional memory regarding the nomination process to all kind of working groups, expert meetings, training courses, reflections and reforms.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: Knowledge management and information technologies initiatives within t
Description: At its 196th session, the Executive Board endorsed the Knowledge Management & Information and Communication Technology (KM & ICT) Strategy. It expressed its satisfaction with the progress made so far and recognized the need for a considerable targeted investment to fully implement the KM & ICT strategy. At the 197th session, five KM & ICT projects were proposed as part of the Invest for Efficient Delivery plan, as these investments could not be absorbed under the 38 C/5 Regular Budget. The Executive Board approved the initial phases of the Invest for Efficient Delivery plan.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 11 - Accountable, efficient and effective management in pursuit of the Organization's results
Output EN: 11.DBS1 - More integrated and properly codified project and knowledge management in support of programme delivery

Project: Semaine Africaine - Editions 2019-2023
Description: La semaine africaine est célébrée tous les ans au Siège de l'UNESCO, pour coincider avec la journée mondiale de l'Afrique (25 mai), à l'initiative du Groupe africain et en coopération avec l'UNESCO/le Département Afrique. L'UNESCO apporte à la fois une contribution financière et sur le plan du contenu pour soutenir cet événement (tables-rondes, communication, visibilité, etc). La contribution financière couvre notamment les frais techniques, l'hospitalité, l'interprétation et la location des espaces utilisés.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PAX3 - Impact and visibility of UNESCO's programmes in Africa strengthened through enhanced coordination, monitoring and mobilization of partners in relation to the Operational Strategy for Priority Africa (2022-2029), and better understanding of Africa's development opportunities and challenges

Project: Contribution to the United Nations Transforming Education Summit
Description:
The UN Secretary-General decided to convene a Transforming Education Summit in September 2022. As the world emerges from the COVID-19 crisis, the Summit will serve to mobilize action, ambition, solidarity and solutions to recover pandemic-related learning losses, reimagine education for the future and reignite global efforts to deliver the education-related SDGs by 2030.
The Summit is part of the broader roadmap of the new SDG4 Global Education Cooperation Mechanism. In this context, UNESCO has been entrusted to lead the preparations and follow-up of the Summit. This Special Account has been created to receive contributions from multiple donors for both its preparation and follow-up.
Outcome EN: Outcome 2 - Strengthen international coordination for the achievement of SDG 4 and develop the global education agenda based on research, foresight and innovation
Output EN: 2.ED7 - Education policy and finance decisions to achieve SDG 4 are informed by improved coordination, data and monitoring, knowledge and innovative partnerships

Project: Restoration of Burle Marx Patios
Description:
As part of the 10 year Capital Master Plan, the renovation project of the Burle Marx Patios is considered critical. The technical diagnostic note revealed that the constant water leakage is damaging the structure of the building and needs to be addressed urgently. 

In addition, the artistic component of the restauration of the patios is being handled in close cooperation with Brazil and Morocco Permanent Delegations. 

And a larger fundraising campaign for the project has been initiated.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 11 - Accountable, efficient and effective management in pursuit of the Organization's results
Output EN: 11.OPS1 -  Procurement and contracting function enhanced at HQ and in support of the field network and programme implementation facilities’ effective management and sustainable financing ensured

Description:
Education policy and finance decisions to achieve SDG 4 are informed by
improved coordination, data and monitoring, knowledge and innovative partnerships
Outcome EN: Outcome 2 - Strengthen international coordination for the achievement of SDG 4 and develop the global education agenda based on research, foresight and innovation
Output EN: 2.ED7 - Education policy and finance decisions to achieve SDG 4 are informed by improved coordination, data and monitoring, knowledge and innovative partnerships

Project: The Safeguarding, Refurbishment and Revitalization of the Islamic Museum
Description: The project aims to create the necessary conditions to conserve and safeguard the collections of the Islamic Museum through: refurbishment and equipping of its interior; building the professional capacity of museum professionals in various domains (conservation, exhibition development, public and educational programme development, museum management and administration, etc) through targeted training; and developing a basic electronic inventory of the entire collection, including photographic documentation and object condition reports. Thanks to this the Museum will be officially reopened with suitable visitor services.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT2 - Member States capacities strengthened to fight the illicit trafficking of cultural property and promote its return and restitution, to protect underwater cultural heritage and to promote the role of museums for societies

Project: Ocean Decade Capacity Development Facility
Description: The proposed project is for an Ocean Decade Capacity Development Facility that will build on the unique strengths and expertise of IOC-UNESCO in terms of capacity development and provide a flexible and evolutive means of supporting the capacity development needs of individuals and institutions involved in the Ocean Decade. This will include support to actors wishing to engage in co-design of future Decade Actions, as well as support to proponents of existing Decade Actions who require support on targeted capacity development initiatives.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health and accelerate the transition towards sustainable management of ocean-related risks and opportunities

Project: PROJETS DE RENOVATION LES PLUS URGENTS AU SIEGE DE L’UNESCO A PARIS
Description:
Le manque de financement des rénovations importantes des bâtiments du Siège au cours des 20 dernières années a entraîné une augmentation des besoins d’entretien, la plupart des travaux devant être effectués en urgence. 
En application de la décision 215 EX/27 du Conseil exécutif, le Secrétariat a présenté au Comité du Siège, à sa 211e session, un Plan directeur actualisé dans lequel les projets  ont été classés par ordre de priorité et d’urgence, selon qu’il s’agit de remédier à des défauts structurels ou d’améliorer le fonctionnement de l’Organisation.
Quatre projets prioritaires cruciaux ont été présentés au Conseil exécutif à sa 216e session, dont l’un, relatif à la rénovation de salle de conférence XVI a obtenu un financement de 1 225 000€ au titre du compte spécial pour les investissements stratégiques et en équipements (CSI).  Le Conseil exécutif prend note de besoins de financement sur des autres projets prioritaires notamment la rénovation du bâtiment VI (Bonvin), la restauration des façades et toitures des bâtiments I et III, et la restauration des patios du bâtiment IV.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 11 - Accountable, efficient and effective management in pursuit of the Organization's results
Output EN: 11.OPS1 -  Procurement and contracting function enhanced at HQ and in support of the field network and programme implementation facilities’ effective management and sustainable financing ensured

Project: Promoting Global Citizenship Education in the Asia-Pacific Region thro
Description: This project aims at advancing global citizenship education (GCED) in the Asia-Pacific region by cultivating the awareness of and capacity for a whole-school approach to GCED among teachers and school leaders. It will deliver a Practical Guide on Whole-School Approach to GCED for Teachers and School Leader, as well as provide capacity-building trainings based on the guide for teachers and leaders of pilot schools in the participating countries who will apply the whole-school approach to their work. The pilot-tested Practical Guide will be widely disseminated across and beyond the region.
Outcome EN: Outcome 7 - Promote inclusion and combat discrimination, hate speech and stereotypes
Output EN: 7.ED3 - Learners are empowered to lead healthy lives, promote sustainable development and engage with the world as creative and responsible global citizens

Project: SDCI Phase II
Description: At the end of the project, a self-evaluation will be conducted as part of the final narrative report, which will be validated by an external expert commissioned by WHC, in close cooperation with BSP and/or IOS. The necessary funding has been identified in the budget.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: HIV PEP Programme - UN system-wide Post-exposure Prophylaxis Programme - UN MS DOS
Description: UN Joint Machinery Participation towards the UN system-wide Post-exposure Prophylaxis Programme
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: Joint Machinery of the United Nations system (JUNM)
Sector: PARTICIPATION IN THE JOINT MACHINERY THE UNITED NATIONS SYSTEM JUNM

Project: ResiliArt Accelerator | Women's Creative Entrepreneurship in Zimbabwe
Description: Women in Zimbabwe with an existing creative business with a limited or informal capacity will join the ResiliArt Accelerator. The beneficiaries will receive customized online mentorship from African mentors and regular off-line sessions from a team of local coaches. The project innovatively responds to the existing knowledge and capacity gap in entrepreneurial skills and contribute to the formalization of creative businesses. The Accelerator programme concretely responds to the opinions expressed by thousands of stakeholders during the UNESCO ResiliArt movement.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT5 - Member States and civil society capacities strengthened to protect and promote the diversity of cultural expressions through dynamic and inclusive cultural and creative industries

Project: Secondment JAMSTEC
Description:
Under the direct supervision of the Head of Marine Policy and Regional Coordination section, the Programme Specialist seconded by JAMSTEC will be responsible to assist in matters relating to law of the sea and transfer of marine technology by: 
- providing inputs to IOC initiatives relating to UNCLOS 
- Liaising with Member States on the implementation of activities and programmes on law of the sea, transfer of marine technology and marine scientific research 
- act as technical secretary for GEBCO 
-mobilising extra budget in support of the implementation of IOC's mandate relating to UNCLOS.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health and accelerate the transition towards sustainable management of ocean-related risks and opportunities

Project: Pro-active Pandemic Crisis Ethics and Integrity Framework- (PREPARED)
Description: The overall goal of the PREPARED project is to develop an operational ethics and integrity framework, which safeguards key ethical values, supports a rapid and effective research response to crises and improves overall pandemic preparedness.
Outcome EN: Outcome 9 - Develop ethical standards, norms and frameworks for action to meet the challenges of innovative technologies and digital transformation
Output EN: 9.SHS5 - Member States’ capacities and policies strengthened to benefit from AI, gene-editing, neuro-technologies, quantum technologies and other frontier technologies, and to address the associated risks, including inequalities and discrimination, in line with international ethical standards, recommendations and frameworks
Donor: European Commission/Directorate-General for Research and Innovation

Project: Most Easy, Efficient and Low Cost Geothermal Systems for Retrofitting
Description: The project aims at applying a pan - European and innovative shallow geothermal solutions particularly targeting historical buildings, including UNESCO designated sites. The green technology to be developed will have specific characteristics, being easier to install, more cost-effective than the current solutions in the market, with drilling methodologies/machines well suited to operate in built heritage and environment and contributing to mitigate claimte change. Finally the proposed solutions will be tested in cooperation with the managing authority of the Ferrara, "City of the Renaissance, and its Po Delta".
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.SC1 - Inclusive knowledge and capacities of Member States strengthened to advance and apply science for sustainable management of natural resources, ecosystem and biodiversity conservation and restoration, and disaster risk resilience

Project: Marine Protected Areas Europe
Description: Marine Protected Areas Europe (MPA Europe) will map the optimal locations for Marine Protected Areas (MPA) in European seas using measures covering the range of biodiversity from species to ecosystems, including habitats. An atlas will provide transparency, traceability and enable reproducibility of the results. Its synthesis will show stakeholders (MSP, NGO, students, researchers) why areas have been prioritised. The use of decision support software will enable alternative network designs based on stakeholder preferences and could thus support wider MSP beyond the subject and study area. UNESCO will be involved in the species modelling and data distribution.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health and accelerate the transition towards sustainable management of ocean-related risks and opportunities

Project: GRRIP
Description: GRRIP is an European Funded project ( Horizon 2020) of 4 years aiming at embeding sustainable RRI practices in four European research public organisations and one funding body through Action Plans (AP) for institutional and cultural change. This will be accompanied by establishing a platform for engagement with the Quadruple Helix and a platform for mutual learning . UNESCO will be leading WP 3 reviewing the Status of the Art of RRI and creating a Library of actions on existing practices for public research and funding bodies to promote RRI keys: society engagement, science education, women in science, ethics and open acces.
Outcome EN: Outcome 7 - Promote inclusion and combat discrimination, hate speech and stereotypes
Output EN: 7.SHS2 - Member States capacities strengthened in applying social and human scientific frontier knowledge to devise effective policy solutions to advance an inclusive development agenda addressing the legacies of the pandemic crisis and face the social impact of climate change

Project: Inter-regional and cross-cutting action aiming to strengthen the fight
Description: This project aims at reducing the illicit trafficking of cultural property within the European Union and its neighbouring countries by reinforcing capacities and skills of key professionals and by raising awareness of concerned institutions as well as the general public in source, transit and destination countries. The project capitalizes on previous actions undertaken within the framework of two EU-UNESCO joint initiatives, whilst enlarging the scope of target groups and final beneficiaries.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT2 - Member States capacities strengthened to fight the illicit trafficking of cultural property and promote its return and restitution, to protect underwater cultural heritage and to promote the role of museums for societies

Project: Global Communication Campaign - Strategic Initiative of the DG
Description: The project seeks to improve UNESCO's visibility and core narrative, as the backbone of global communication strategy. a global communication campaign will showcase UNESCO's achievements on the occasion of its 75th anniversary.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.CPE1 - UNESCO's image enhanced and role recognized as a key solution provider for the 2030 Agenda in the Organization's areas of competence

Project: CAMPUS UNESCO ENGIE
Description: Organisation de Campus UNESCO, en ligne et physiques, dans le cadre du partenariat UNESCO/Fondation Engie pour 2022-2024
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.CPE1 - UNESCO's image enhanced and role recognized as a key solution provider for the 2030 Agenda in the Organization's areas of competence

Project: Lifelines to Learning: Towards an International Declaration on Advanci
Description: Since the start of the COVID-19 pandemic, the right to education has become-at the global level-dependent on connectivity, especially internet access. The pandemic forced policy makers, teachers, parents and learners to attempt actions to leverage connectivity for learning at a speed and scale without precedent. The pandemic has revealed the need to rethink connectivity for learning in a transformed global educational landscape. This initiative will facilitate the production and endorsement of an International Declaration on Connectivity for Education, and will involve research and consultation.
Outcome EN: Outcome 2 - Strengthen international coordination for the achievement of SDG 4 and develop the global education agenda based on research, foresight and innovation
Output EN: 2.ED9 - Education and learning reimagined through interdisciplinary research, foresight and public policy debate

Project: "Heritage and the City": Promoting sustainable, safe and resilient cit
Description: The main objective of the project is to contribute to the reinforcement of UNESCO's vision and action as regards the role of culture in sustainable urban development towards the safeguarding of urban heritage, in all its forms (built heritage, urban spaces, natural heritage, intangible heritage) and nurturing creative industries and expressions in cities. The implementation of this vision relies on the Organization's long-standing experience in this field and on its wide normative framework (especially the 1972, 2003 and 2005 Conventions and the 2011 Recommendation on the Historic Urban Landscape).
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: Intangible Heritage and Creativity for Sustainable Cities
Description: The project will promote the role of culture in sustainable urban development and address the role of intangible heritage and creativity towards sustainable cities. The first component will target knowledge and capacity building, through community-based training workshops and pilot inventories of intangible heritage in cities, a survey on creativity in urban areas as well as the review of a Chinese Database of traditional crafts and performing arts. The second component will focus on advocacy and networking through a Global Forum on "Culture and Sustainable Cities", networking workshops and guidance to the pilot project World Expo on craftsmanship and performing arts.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT4 - Member States and communities capacities strengthened to identify, safeguard and promote living heritage
Donor: Yong Xin Hua Yun Cultural Industry Investment Co. Ltd.

Project: Live from UNESCO World Heritage: Promoting Global Communication on Cul
Description: The project seeks to promote global communication on culture in the context of the celebration of the 50th Anniversary of the 1972 World Heritage Convention, notably through televised roundtables exploring key themes such as climate change, sustainable tourism and digital transformation, with a view to stimulating discussions and a global reflection on the role and meaning of heritage in the 21st century and support countries in the protection, safeguarding and promotion of cultural heritage.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: Environmental Action
Description: Activities in relation to Environmental Action, with regards to the reduction of the UNESCO's environmental footprint
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 11 - Accountable, efficient and effective management in pursuit of the Organization's results
Output EN: 11.ADM1 - UNESCO’s operational models and practices improved to ensure environmental and social sustainability, accessibility of operations and business continuity, mature risk management processes and organizational resilience

Project: Strengthening quality assurance in higher education in Africa
Description: In December 2014 the African Member States adopted the Addis Convention. The Implementation of the Convention requires human and institutional capacity building in quality assurance and development of mechanisms and tools that would ensure comparability and compatibility of qualifications through transparent, fair and efficient assessment processes. The project foresees strengthening of quality assurance of higher education structure in 10 African countries. Its activities will focus on establishing 5(five) new Quality Assurance Agencies, reinforce structures in 5 others, and consolidate the existing QA networks in Africa.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED4 - Learners equipped with relevant skills to meet individual, labour market and societal demands through literacy, TVET, STEM and higher education

Project: Supporting the Implementation of the SDG4-Education2030 Agenda in Asia
Description: This project is part of a series of JFIT SDG4 Regional Coordination projects, generously supported by the Government of Japan through Phases I to III. Given the radically changed circumstances of education in the region, the project aims at supporting and building capacity of MS in planning and initiating actions for learning recovery and transforming education and its systems beyond COVID-19. Following up on the recommendations and commitments made at APREMC- II, the overall purpose of the project is accelerating progress towards the achievement of SDG4 and contributing to addressing the learning crisis in the region.
Outcome EN: Outcome 2 - Strengthen international coordination for the achievement of SDG 4 and develop the global education agenda based on research, foresight and innovation
Output EN: 2.ED7 - Education policy and finance decisions to achieve SDG 4 are informed by improved coordination, data and monitoring, knowledge and innovative partnerships

Project: Malaysia/UNESCO Funds-in-Trust Synthesis Programme
Description: Nearly a decade after MUCP's initiation, this activity aims to synthesize the knowledge base developed by the projects as well as the results of external evaluation, lessons learnt, challenges and to share best practices for SDGs under the 2030 Agenda. The synthesis will provide knowledge base for further adoption of products of MUCP framework and the related projects. To elaborate further, identification of patterns vis-à-vis to the output and achievements, design of the projects, relevance, implementation, impact and any finding from the synthesis will be presented, debated and summarized for policy audiences at all levels.
Outcome EN: Outcome 4 - Advance international cooperation in science, technology and innovation
Output EN: 4.SC5 - Institutional and human capacities in basic sciences, technology, research, innovation, and engineering enhanced to advance knowledge for sustainable development

Project: Malaysia-UNESCO Funds-in-Trust Programme Management and Coordination
Description: The Government of Malaysia and UNESCO have decided to establish the Malaysia-UNESCO FIT where the Government of Malaysia will provide the financial contribution for supporting the implementation, through UNESCO, of projects jointly selected under the "Malaysia-UNESCO Cooperation Programme" (MUCP). The MFIT Agreement covers all areas of competence of UNESCO and stimulates South-South cooperation, while building on Malaysian institutions and expertise. As such, this activity aims to support the management and coordination of the Malaysia-UNESCO Funds-in-Trust Programme.
Outcome EN: Outcome 7 - Promote inclusion and combat discrimination, hate speech and stereotypes
Output EN: 7.SHS1 - Member States capacities strengthened to advance effective social policies and practices, addressing the social impact of inequalities, climate transition and the digital transformation, and advise on effective policies to achieve inclusive development through the promotion of human rights, scientific freedom, intercultural dialogue and understanding and by tackling all forms of discrimination and racism

Project: Digital Communication Services (DIGICOM)
Description: Enable the Director-General to receive funds and incur expenditures for services in digital communication. This includes web communication, the development of web applications and web services, web design, website evolutions, coordination of related activities, including project management, communication campaign development on digital platforms and social media, as well as the operating of related digital communication services, digital communications software and tools.

Output EN: 10.CPE1 - UNESCO's image enhanced and role recognized as a key solution provider for the 2030 Agenda in the Organization's areas of competence

Project: UNESCO World Water Assessment Programme
Description: The UNESCO World Water Assessment Programme aims to assess, monitor and report on freshwater issues to provide responses, develop case studies, enhance assessment capacity at a national and regional level and inform the decision-making processes. WWAP makes available to decision-makers, inside and outside the water box, data, indicators, background information and projections about the state, use and management of water resources. This will be accomplished through: the production of the annual WWDRs, research and projects on water assessments, water and gender, and emerging fields.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.SC2 - Water science, innovation, education, management, cooperation and governance bolstered for a water secure world in a changing environment

Description: Operational budget for the maintenance and conservation of the UNESCO collection of Works of Art

Description:
Under the umbrella of UNESCO Global Education Coalition (GEC) and in line with UNESCO Strategy for TVET 2022-2029, the mission of the Global Skills Academy (GSA) has scaled up to support 10 million learners by 2029, connecting GEC Members to offer free high-quality training programs to improve employability skills toward more inclusive, sustainable, and resilient economies in a rapidly evolving and demanding labor market, leveraging the UNESCO-UNEVOC network. 

The JPO will contribute to the efficient implementation of the GSA mission in the framework of UNESCO Global Education Coalition.

Under the authority of the Assistant Director-General of the Social and Human Sciences Sector and the supervision of the Chief of the Executive Office, working within a competent and dynamic team, the JPO will:

HRM/LPD is responsible for attracting and training a diverse, competent, and performance driven workforce. The JPO will play an essential role in providing learning & and career development opportunities to ensure that the staff of the Organization have the skills they need to deliver on SDGs and meet their full potential. The JPO will also participate in setting up outreach events and establishing HR Partnerships with governmental, academic and private sector entities.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 11 - Accountable, efficient and effective management in pursuit of the Organization's results
Output EN: 11.HRM1 - Staffing, learning and development and staff well-being policies developed and implemented in support of a more diverse, inclusive, efficient and agile working environment, as described in the Human Resources Management Strategy for 2023-2027

Description: As part of the enhanced Crisis Response coordination, the JPO will support the preparation and assist in the follow-up of ad hoc crisis response Taskforces and Cells, such as the Mosul Taskforce and the Ukraine Cell, within the Crisis Response Unit being established

Description: Under the overall authority of the Director of World Heritage, and the direct supervision of the Head of the Arab States Unit, the JPO will assist in coordinating the implementation of World Heritage Convention in the Arab States, including the follow-up of the Third Cycle of Periodic Reporting, the enhancement of site management and sustainable tourism development at World Heritage properties, the organization of expert meetings and capacity building workshops, and, contributing to drafting and preparing statutory documents.

Project: Cooperation with other conventions & programmes
Description: "Cooperation with other Conventions & Organisations" is the budget line approved by the World Heritage Committee under the World Heritage Fund for the period 2024-2025. It enables the Secretariat of the World Heritage Convention to participate in meetings with other Biodiversity-related (BLG) or Cultural (CCLG) Conventions, and to develop joint pilot projects within the UN system for a coordinated approach to the state of conservation or for the strengthening of management methods of World Heritage sites.

Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: Retrospective inventory (2024-2025)
Description:
- Elaboration of Retrospective Inventories of the content of nomination files of properties inscribed on the World Heritage List in the timeframe 1978-1998
- Identification of outstanding issues concerning the delimitation and the geographic and cartographic information available for World Heritage properties in those Regions
- Cooperation with States Parties in order to clarify the boundaries of World Heritage properties inscribed in the first twenty years of the Convention
- Assistance to States Parties wishing to present proposals for minor boundary modifications (including the establishment of buffer zones).

Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: Upstream support (2024-2025)
Description: Funding for upstream support is for advice on identification of sites, Tentative Lists or nomination of sites for inscription on the World Heritage List. This funding is to be used for States Parties falling within the category of Least developed countries, Low-income and Lower middle income countries as well as Small Islands Developing States.

Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: Sub-fund for enhancing the human capacities of the Secretariat (42C/5)
Description: The sub-fund to be used exclusively for enhancing the human capacities of the Secretariat was established in 2010 by the General Assembly of the States Parties to the 2003 Convention (Resolution 3.GA 9). The activity aims at enhancing UNESCO's delivery capacity and addressing the human resource needs of the Secretariat of the Convention for the Safeguarding of the Intangible Cultural Heritage.

Description: The PROCARIBE + project " is a GEF funded project to which UNOPS has been selected as Executing Entity and IOC of UNESCO is one of Technical and Scientific Agencies and co-implementing partners. Project: "One-stop  shop” for the monitoring and assessment of the implementation of standard-setting instruments
Description: At the 217th session of the Executive Board, the CR Committee noted that an IT platform was being developed within CLT to centralize the receipt of reports from Member States on the implementation of standard-setting instruments in the field of culture, with a view to preparing the first world report on cultural policies. As soon as the platform is fully operational within CLT, it can then be rolled out to the other programme sectors, with each sector adapting it where necessary to suit the specific needs of the consultations on the implementation of standard-setting instruments within their areas of expertise. Following this roll-out, a dedicated page will be set up in the section of the Legal Affairs website devoted to the first aspect of the terms of reference of the CR Committee (monitoring of the implementation of UNESCO’s standard-setting instruments), which would direct Member States to a central source of information related to the various consultations under way and provide easy access to each of the relevant platforms, thus constituting a “one-stop shop” for the monitoring of the implementation of standard-setting instruments. Thanks to a generous voluntary contribution from the Government of Switzerland, allocated in December 2023 to LA (96,000 Swiss francs), the CR Committee Secretariat will, at the start of the current budget period 2024-2025, during which four consultations will be initiated, launch a web page that will bring together the necessary information relating to these various consultations, and which will benefit as far as possible from the technical functionalities that will be developed in 2025 when the CLT IT platform is set up and extended to the other programme sectors.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 11 - Accountable, efficient and effective management in pursuit of the Organization's results
Output EN: 11.LA1 - The Organization's management and programme implementation in compliance with rules and regulations
Sector: OFFICE INTL STANDARDS AND LEGAL AFFAIRS

Project: Teacher Policy and Research
Description: UNESCO will support Member States to develop and implement comprehensive teacher policies that are aligned with education sector plans and with the provisions of the 1966 and 1997 Recommendations concerning the status of teachers. Technical assistance will include the contextualization and adaptation of policy instruments to national and regional needs, by means of research, knowledge sharing, policy learning, and the systematization and upscaling of innovations in teacher policy and practice. UNESCO will also support research on the innovative teacher professional development practices and international good practices in this field.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED5 - Teachers trained and supported to improve learning outcomes and address the changes brought forth by the digital and AI transformation and the COVID-19 crisis

Project: Supporting Teachers in Pacific Contexts
Description: The Programme contributes to Pacific member states’ knowledge base to respond to teacher shortages and retention issues, pedagogies based on Pacific cultures, adaptation and utilization of Pacific resources to support teacher training and professional development needs in particular to integrate sustainable development, global understanding, technologies, and other relevant knowledge and skills. The workplan has OP3 linkages.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED5 - Teachers trained and supported to improve learning outcomes and address the changes brought forth by the digital and AI transformation and the COVID-19 crisis

Project: Regional Teaching Strategy
Description: This project will allow the design of the Regional Teaching Strategy to be consolidated and will lay the foundations to promote its implementation.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED5 - Teachers trained and supported to improve learning outcomes and address the changes brought forth by the digital and AI transformation and the COVID-19 crisis

Project: Strengthen Data and Evidence Informed Education Planning
Description: The programme supports coordinated efforts to strengthen Pacific SIDS Education Ministries’ capacity to monitor education progress, connect local and national education data with regional and global goals, and apply data and evidence for education planning, programming and financing decisions. This includes support on SDG4 Benchmarking and reviews, national education sector analysis, sector plan development and monitoring. This will be achieved through enhancing coordinated support among UNESCO (FO, HQ, UIS, IIEP) as well as with partners both regional (SPC, USP) and multilateral (World Bank, UNICEF). The workplan works hand-in-hand with OP1 and OP6.
Outcome EN: Outcome 2 - Strengthen international coordination for the achievement of SDG 4 and develop the global education agenda based on research, foresight and innovation
Output EN: 2.ED7 - Education policy and finance decisions to achieve SDG 4 are informed by improved coordination, data and monitoring, knowledge and innovative partnerships

Project: Promoting Equity and Inclusion in ICT in Education
Description: This programme supports Pacific SIDS’ development/upgrading of inclusive ICT in Education strategies and plans and integration in education sector reviews, analyses and sector plans. It emphasizes on equitable access to technologies in teaching and learning, teachers’ professional development and support networks. It seeks replicable innovations, feasible and sustainable utilization of ICT and multimedia Open Educational Resources in country contexts, in particular in remote areas. The work plan corresponds with OP4.
Outcome EN: Outcome 8 - Foster knowledge sharing and skills development in the digital age

Project: 3% Evaluation SC4
Description: The overall purpose of this workplan is ensure a proper evaluation coverage of the sector’s programme and projects, for accountability, learning and decision-making. The key activities are the delivery and dissemination of corporate evaluations on strategic/ global and thematic topics and an annual synthesis report of all UNESCO evaluations. It also involves support to the decentralized evaluation function by building the capacity of UNESCO staff through a dedicated training programme; financing and managing Regional Evaluation Associates in five duty stations (to start in 2025) and animating the Evaluation Focal Point Network and the UNESCO Evaluation Knowledge Hub.
Outcome EN: Outcome 4 - Advance international cooperation in science, technology and innovation
Output EN: 4.SC4 - Member States capacities strengthened to improve STI policies, access to scientific and technological advancements and enhance knowledge sharing, including through Open Science

Project: Climate Change Impact on Ocean & Coastal Ecosystems
Description: Accelerating climate change and expanding human uses exert tremendous pressures on marine ecosystems. Combined effects of climate change (CC) and other stressors, in particular eutrophication and deoxygenation, were reported for marine productivity, biodiversity and species distribution. There is a need to understand/quantify further the effects of CC on the marine biota of the world's oceans, on ecosystems goods and services and on social-ecological systems. Main actions under this activity will include the implementation of the Ocean Decade Global Ocean Oxygen Decade programme, the provision of guiding principles for multiple stressor research and new assessments focusing on pollution and changing phytoplankton communities.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health and accelerate the transition towards sustainable management of ocean-related risks and opportunities

Description: Technical assistance and guidance to States Parties preparing Tentative Lists and Nominations. Coordination and registration of Upstream Process requests, Tentative Lists, Preliminary Assessment Requests, technical analysis and focused comments on Draft Nominations and completeness check of full Nominations. Preparation of documents and presentations for the Committee, General Assembly and their subsidiary bodies, concerning nominations and related processes. Examination of nomination dossiers of already inscribed properties through the Retrospective Inventory. Provision of expertise and institutional memory regarding the nomination process to all kind of working groups, expert meetings, training courses, reflections and reforms.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions

Project: Support to coordination and monitoring of Extrabudgetary-related PA ac

Output EN: 10.PAX3 - Impact and visibility of UNESCO's programmes in Africa strengthened through enhanced coordination, monitoring and mobilization of partners in relation to the Operational Strategy for Priority Africa (2022-2029), and better understanding of Africa's development opportunities and challenges

Project: Appui au développement des industries culturelles et créatives et auto
Description: L'objectif de ce projet est de doter les jeunes de compétences nécessaires dans le secteur de la culture y compris les TIC aux fins de contribuer à créer des emplois durables et décents et de renforcer leur autonomisation en qualité d'acteurs et opérateurs à travers l'entreprenariat culturel et la mise en valeur marchande des produits culturels.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PAX3 - Impact and visibility of UNESCO's programmes in Africa strengthened through enhanced coordination, monitoring and mobilization of partners in relation to the Operational Strategy for Priority Africa (2022-2029), and better understanding of Africa's development opportunities and challenges

Project: Teacher Task Force - Knowledge creation, dissemination, and advocacy
Description:
The TTF is a global alliance of partners whose goal is to ensure that teachers and teaching remain at the top of the education agenda, to enable discussions and to mobilize governments and stakeholders for the advancement of teachers and quality learning. This project aims to ensure:
1) Knowledge gaps are identified and filled, and monitoring strengthened to ensure relevant and up-to-date knowledge on teachers and teaching is available to inform the formulation and implementation of comprehensive teacher policies 
2) The critical role of teachers and quality teaching is advocated for, and key messages are adopted and amplified by TTF members and beyond
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED5 - Teachers trained and supported to improve learning outcomes and address the changes brought forth by the digital and AI transformation and the COVID-19 crisis

Project: RESSOURCES EDUCATIVES
Description: Le projet d'appui à la production et diffusion de ressources éducatives pour les établissements scolaires et les élèves du primaire et du secondaire d'Afrique subsaharienne vise l'amélioration des acquis d'apprentissage par le renforcement de l'accès des élèves et de la communauté éducative aux ressources éducatives matérielles et numériques variées, de qualité, coût-efficaces et adaptées aux besoins d'apprentissage. En renforçant l'accès équitable des élèves scolarisés au primaire et au secondaire à un ensemble de ressources éducatives de qualité, l'enjeu est d'améliorer les enseignements-apprentissages et l'acquisition du socle des compétences de l'éducation de base.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED6 - Resilience, quality and equity of education systems strengthened to flexibly respond to evolving learning environments and to better deliver on SDG4 commitments

Project: MARCO-BOLO: MARine COastal BiOdiversity Long-term Observations
Description: The MARCO-BOLO project aims to structure and strengthen European coastal and marine biodiversity observation capabilities, linking them to global efforts (e.g. MBON, GOOS, OBIS and UN Ocean Decade Programmes Marine Life 2030, OBON, ODIS, Ocean Practices for the Decade) to understand and restore ocean health, and ensuring outputs respond to explicit stakeholder needs from policy, planning, and industry.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health and accelerate the transition towards sustainable management of ocean-related risks and opportunities

Project: Implementation of the Global Convention on the Recognition of Qualifications concerning Higher Education
Description: This project aims to support the implementation of the Global Convention by supporting (i) the convening of the extraordinary session of the Intergovernmental Conference of the States Parties on 7 March 2024 (in English and French), in order to examine and adopt the draft work programme for the convention, (ii) the development of draft Operational Guidelines for the convention to be adopted at the second ordinary session of the Intergovernmental Conference (June 2025); and (iii) capacity development to countries in Asia and the Pacific in order to accelerate ratifications to the convention.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED4 - Learners equipped with relevant skills to meet individual, labour market and societal demands through literacy, TVET, STEM and higher education

Project: Strategic investment plan for the visibility and outreach of The UNESC
