Publishing The UNESCO Courier in the six official languages on different media (traditional and digital) will contribute significantly to increase the visibility of the Organization. By funding the magazine, this partnership will ensure the sustainability of this communication tool whose prestige has no equal in the United Nations system.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.CPE1 - UNESCO's image enhanced and role recognized as a key solution provider for the 2030 Agenda in the Organization's areas of competence

Project: UNESCO-Seabourn Partnership for World Heritage and Sustainable Tourism
Description:
The World Heritage and Sustainable Tourism Programme provides an international framework for the planning and sustainable management of tourism at World Heritage properties by fostering awareness, improving management stakeholder capacities and full participation of local communities.

The goal of this programme is to protect World Heritage properties and their Outstanding Universal Value, while ensuring that tourism contributes to the sustainable development of local communities taking a destination approach to tourism management.

This partnership is instrumental to the activities of the Programme providing support for strategy development.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: Rethinking and Redesigning National Smart Education Strategy
Description: The project aims to rethink about the educational ecosystems and policies on ICT in education in different countries to achieve an analytical understanding of the role of ICT in education. The initiative will pursue generating meaningful discussions and action in the context of strengthening the role of ICT in education, learning and teaching in view of the predicted, feasible and preferred futures, share a forward-looking vision of what education might yet become, and offer the most up-to-date and adequate policy agenda. It will effectively consider issues of privacy and security in a digital world with respect to learning and social interaction.
Outcome EN: Outcome 8 - Foster knowledge sharing and skills development in the digital age

Project: Supporting Member States in Latin America and the Caribbean in transforming education through digital innovations, including artificial intelligence
Description:
This work plan aims to support the efforts of Member States in Latin America and the Caribbean to achieve a more inclusive, effective, and relevant education systems by leveraging innovative and appropriate uses of modern digital resources, including Artificial Intelligence. The key focus areas include:

i) Developing teachers' digital skills for artificial intelligence.
ii) Promoting strategic partnerships for the implementation of innovations in education.

Within this context, a specialized training program on Artificial Intelligence will be designed and implemented to enhance teachers' competencies. This initiative will be undertaken in collaboration with universities, members of the Global Education Coalition and other partners from the private sector, civil society organizations, universities, and international cooperation agencies. Additionally, a regional alliance for innovation, transformation, and education recovery (ARTIE) will be established. This alliance will play a pivotal role in supporting the transformation of education in Latin America and the Caribbean by promoting innovation in education, with a particular emphasis on digital advancements.
Outcome EN: Outcome 8 - Foster knowledge sharing and skills development in the digital age
Output EN: 8.ED8 - Technologies and digital innovations leveraged to ensure more inclusive, effective and relevant learning

Project: capacity building on synthetic sciences
Description: Synthetic biology or engineering biology is a fast-moving field that embraces and drives state-of-the-art technologies for designing and reconstructing livings systems at different scales, primarily by reprogramming cellular genetic information. engineering biology raises a number of policy issues around R&D funding, Public Private Partnership, infrastructure requirements, education and training, intellectual property, regulation, and public engagement. One of the issues that need to be addressed is how engineering biology in general is taught at universities and higher education institutes in the Asia Pacific region and what are the guidelines for formulating such curriculum.
Outcome EN: Outcome 4 - Advance international cooperation in science, technology and innovation
Output EN: 4.SC5 - Institutional and human capacities in basic sciences, technology, research, innovation, and engineering enhanced to advance knowledge for sustainable development

It also involves support to the decentralized evaluation function by building the capacity of UNESCO staff through a dedicated training programme; financing and managing Regional Evaluation Associates in five duty stations (to start in 2025) and animating the Evaluation Focal Point Network and the UNESCO Evaluation Knowledge Hub.

Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: Strengthening UNESCO-EU partnership for better response on CLT in emergencies
Description: In the context of the UNESCO's partnership with the European Union (EU) Institutions in the field of culture, this activity aims at supporting the policy dialogue between UNESCO,  the EU and its Member States for strengthen strategies and programming on the protection of culture in situations of emergencies. Key EU fora and entities for this dialogue are the Council of the EU and its Presidencies during the biennium 2024 and 2025 (Belgium, Hungary, Poland and Denmark), the European Parliament, the European External Action Service (including the EU Delegations) and the relevant European Commission Directorates Generals. Outreach, visibility, and advocacy activities will be organized in the context of these fora, and their discussions on culture in emergencies, including in the follow up of the Strategy on the EU International Cultural Relations.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT3 - Member States capacities strengthened for better preparedness, mitigation and response to emergencies affecting culture, including in situations of armed conflict and disaster

Project: Policy advice and capacity building for duty bearers to improve legal
Description: UNESCO will continue to provide policy advice to and reinforce the capacities of duty bearers to enhance legal and institutional frameworks related to freedom of expression, press freedom, and safety of journalists, including women journalists, both online and offline. This will include: training judicial actors, security forces and policymakers on freedom of expression and the safety of journalists, including in times of elections; and strengthening norms and enhancing international cooperation. New challenges linked to the digital ecosystem will also be addressed, including in countering hate speech and disinformation, promoting the transparency and accountability of internet companies; and taking a human-rights based approach to technologies such as artificial intelligence.
Outcome EN: Outcome 6 - Promote freedom of expression and the right to information
Output EN: 6.CI2 - Member States have strengthened capacities and raised awareness to enhance norms and policies related to freedom of expression, press freedom, safety of journalists, including women journalists, and the right to access information, online and offline

Project: Strengthening the capacity and raising awareness on freedom of expression, safety of women and men journalists and access to information online and offline
Description: The media in the region faces different challenges and obstacles on the road to becoming a free, safe, independent, and pluralistic media environment. These includes political instability, vague or inconsistent media laws, lack of diversity of media that is partially linked to media viability issues, as well as sporadic attacks, imprisonments, and even death of journalists. There are also classic media development challenges including lack of capacity building, technology, and funding.
Outcome EN: Outcome 6 - Promote freedom of expression and the right to information
Output EN: 6.CI2 - Member States have strengthened capacities and raised awareness to enhance norms and policies related to freedom of expression, press freedom, safety of journalists, including women journalists, and the right to access information, online and offline

Project: Awareness raising and capacity building for fight against illicit trafficking of cultural property
Description:
Setting fight against illicit import, export and transfer of ownership of cultural property, as one of the priority in the field of culture, Ministry of Culture of the Republic of Serbia, will focus on awareness raising and capacity building of police and customs officers in training with the aim of having them prepared to recognized potential crimes against cultural property and use available tools. The project Awareness raising and capacity building for fight against illicit trafficking of  cultural property 
 is a continuation of successfully implemented activities within the project Capacity building for fighting illicit import, export and transfer of ownership of cultural property on local level  (Participation Programme  2021-2022). Тhis project included an online workshop and two workshops in the City of Knjaževac ( the Native Museum in Knjaževac)  and in the City of Sremska Mitrovica (the City Museum of Srem).   
The both workshops included a visit to archaeological sites (Timakum Minus archaeological site – Knjaževac and  Sirmium Imperial Palace – Sremska Mitrovica)  and constructive on-the-spot discussion. The expected results of the project have been entirely fulfilled. Through the implementation of three workshops, all relevant participants in the process of protection of cultural heritage and the fight against illicit trade in cultural property, have undergone a type of training and a comprehensive approach within this process, which includes the readiness of local structures and the establishment of a single procedure concerning activities undertaken in case of illicit import, export and trade, as well as in case of illicit excavation. Workshop participants were introduced to the applicable legislative framework of the Republic of Serbia and the UNESCO conventions concerning this matter, primarily the Convention for the Protection of Cultural Property in the Event of Armed Conflict (The Hague, 1954), the Convention on the Means of Prohibiting and Preventing the Illicit Import, Export and Transfer of Ownership of Cultural Property (Paris, 1970), and Convention Concerning the Protection of the World Cultural and Natural Heritage (Paris, 1972). The implementation of the project and the participation of all relevant actors at the national and local level contributed to the mapping of new problems in the fight against illicit trade in cultural property and illegal excavations of archaeological sites, but also to establishing previously identified problems on which all departments, each within its competence, work continuously.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particularly in Africa, developing countries, LDCs, and SIDS

Project: Artlink Festival Fortress
Description: ArtLink Festival  through musical performances and synergy with cultural heritage and nature, engages talented artists from Serbia and the Region in  Camerata Balcanica orchestra and guests from around the world, in unique art festival concept – “Festival Cities & Artists for Nature” at Belgrade Fortress, with special programs at Felix Romuliana World Heritage site. The artistic concept of a festival city is dedicated to nature, with the aim of involving artists, community, institutions, in order to raise awareness of the importance and value of the protection of the nature. Art dialogues, innovative outdoor art presentations, creative workshops, campaigns and performances takes place under the motto – “Artists for Nature".
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particularly in Africa, developing countries, LDCs, and SIDS

It will offer ways to automate document-driven processes within any work environment. It will further create an ecosystem that will support AI solutions for overall development, and improved policy-making in the nation, considering the ongoing development of the National AI Strategy by the Federal Ministry of Communications, Innovation and Digital Economy.

The Education Sector of the UNESCO Guatemala Office will promote the implementation of the Whole School Approach for Sustainable Development Education and Global Citizenship Education, integrating goal 4.7 of the 2030 Agenda into a strategy to support the strengthening of educational quality.
Guatemala is a multicultural country,   that annually faces natural disasters; where human mobility is critical; and in which gender inequalities are persistent in the education of girls, especially indigenous girls in rural areas. These factors affect access to the right to an equitable, inclusive, and relevant education.

Project: Le patrimoine culturel marocain dans le contexte de l'intelligence artificielle et l’approche identitaire africaine.
Description:
L’intelligence artificielle peut être une chance formidable pour accélérer la réalisation des objectifs de développement durable un potentiel énorme pour le bien l'humanité dans la paix et le développement. Les progrès technologiques rapides dans le domaine de l’Intelligence artificielle (IA), ainsi que d'autres avancées technologiques tels que la robotique, l’informatique en nuage et l'Internet des objets, transforment les disciplines, les économies et les industries, et remettent en question ce que signifie d’être humain.
Une nouvelle approche propose que cette sphère d’intelligence artificielle (IA) comprenne la préservation, l’échange et le partage du patrimoine culturel marocain, comme une « technoculture » visant à conserver notre identité africaine. 
L’exploitation des traces informatiques  à  l’action  culturelle en vue  d’identifier les sources  et les préparer comme données patrimoines pertinent sur lesquelles s’appuyé notre identité africaine en explorons l’intelligence artificielle pour permettre d’analyser les indicateurs de culture afin de  permettre la prévention et la préservation du patrimoine culturel marocain.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particularly in Africa, developing countries, LDCs, and SIDS

Project: Renforcement des capacités des enfants en situation de précarité par le biais de : L’audiovisuel, du théâtre et de l’IA. Slogan : L’audiovisuel et l'art dramatique et L’IA  pour une éducation inclusive
Description:
L'intelligence artificielle (IA) ouvre de nouvelles perspectives pour renforcer les capacités des jeunes. Bien que l'IA promette des avancées significatives dans le domaine de l'éducation et de l'innovation pédagogique, elle suscite également des défis et des risques potentiels. 
Dans ce contexte, l'UNESCO s'engage à guider les États membres dans l'utilisation responsable et équitable des technologies d'IA, conformément à l'Agenda Éducation 2030 et aux principes d'inclusion et d'équité. 
Dans cet esprit, le présent dossier de projet explore le potentiel de l'IA, de l'audiovisuel et de l'art dramatique pour favoriser l'apprentissage et le développement des jeunes, tout en soulignant les questions cruciales liées à leur intégration dans les systèmes éducatifs.

Le projet "Renforcement des capacités des enfants en situation de précarité par le biais de l’audiovisuel, du théâtre et de l’IA" vise à offrir une plateforme d'apprentissage innovante et inclusive pour les enfants résidant dans des centres socio-éducatifs et fréquentant des écoles communautaires. 
À travers un programme de conférences et de cours de formation en audiovisuel, théâtre et intelligence artificiel,  nous cherchons à développer leurs compétences artistiques, leurs capacités cognitives, et à les sensibiliser aux applications positives de l'intelligence artificielle dans leur vie quotidienne.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particularly in Africa, developing countries, LDCs, and SIDS

Project: Savoir-faire et entrepreunariat
Description: The ambition of the New Development Model adopted by Morocco is to create the conditions for the country to benefit from all its assets by becoming a nation of opportunity, entrepreneurship, and innovation. The training of human capital occupies then a prominent place in the recommendations which will guide, alongside the 2020-2024 roadmap, the development of Vocational Training. The objective of this project is to support the ongoing reforms notably through the improvement of the quality, the relevance, and the attractiveness of training in the Textile and Leather sector, which is of strategic importance to the national industry, aggregating 27% of jobs and 7% of the industrial added value.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED4 - Learners equipped with relevant skills to meet individual, labour market and societal demands through literacy, TVET, STEM and higher education

Project: Renforcement des capacités des enseignants enseignants à l'utilisation
Description: Il s'agit de renforcer les capacités des concepteurs - formateurs centraux et des structures pédagogiques déconcentrées du Ministère de l'Education Nationale sur la conception de contenus pédagogiques interactifs sur une plateforme e-learning, et par la suite de former les enseignants sur l'utilisation de plateforme e-learning et des tablettes
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED5 - Teachers trained and supported to improve learning outcomes and address the changes brought forth by the digital and AI transformation and the COVID-19 crisis

Project: Projet d'appui à la planification de l'éducation et au système d'information à Madagascar
Description: Les différentes activités des composantes de ce projet qui œuvre sur le plan institutionnel, organisationnel et individuel menées aussi bien au niveau du Ministère central et dans les structures déconcentrées contribuent à l'amélioration de la planification et le pilotage du système d'éducation fondamentale à Madagascar et à la pérennisation de ces fonctions.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED6 - Resilience, quality and equity of education systems strengthened to flexibly respond to evolving learning environments and to better deliver on SDG4 commitments
Donor: World Bank/International Bank for Reconstruction and Development

Project: Promoting inclusive education and equal opportunities for migrant and
Description: The project "Promoting inclusive education and equal opportunities for migrant and refugee children and adolescents and host communities in Peru" has been designed in the frame of the ECW Multi-Year Resilience Program (MYRP) for Peru, financed by Education Cannot Wait (ECW). UNICEF as grantee, UNESCO, and other allies as sub-grantees, will work together on this project to respond to the needs of the most vulnerable children and adolescents as well as working towards improving the inclusivity and quality of the Peruvian education system to include Venezuelan refugees and migrants. The MYRP is divided into four "packs", this document focuses on pack number 2, led by UNESCO Lima.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED1 - Education systems equipped to promote inclusion, address marginalization and advance rights, including in crisis-affected and post-disaster contexts

Project: TVET through UGEL
Description:
The Peru Office is concluding a TVET policy review which will make recommendations to accelerate TVET training implementation processes. In addition, we have been training teachers from secondary schools in rural areas, reaching more than 80 teachers from 35 schools.
Continuing with this effort, we propose to provide technical assistance to the Local Educational Management Units (UGEL) of 4 regions of the country and accompany their specialists to design and implement a technical education offer according to the needs of their respective territories and then provide assistance technical support to UGEL specialists to follow up on their visits to schools to verify the application of the pedagogical tools of the training received in the years 2022 and 2023. This support involves reinforcing TVET training, verifying that students receive the training in schools.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED4 - Learners equipped with relevant skills to meet individual, labour market and societal demands through literacy, TVET, STEM and higher education

Project: Strengthening of capacities in art and culture for sociocultural integ
Description: The objective of the project is strengthening the capacities of refugee, migrant and host community cultural agents, for the development of study plans that allow them to implement training programs in art and culture aimed at young people and adolescents in the city.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT5 - Member States and civil society capacities strengthened to protect and promote the diversity of cultural expressions through dynamic and inclusive cultural and creative industries

Project: Supporting LINKS Implementation in Peru
Description: This activity will explore synergies for the LINKS programme in Peru with focus on Amazonia and considering the forthcoming United Nations Conference on Biodiversity COP16 in Colombia in 2024  and the COP30 in the city of Belém in 2025.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.IP3 (SC) - Member States capacities and awareness are strengthened to protect, safeguard and promote Indigenous knowledge, cultures, and languages through inclusive policies and targeted action

Project: Development of cultural policies gender based
Description: This activity will contribute to the reduction of gender inequality and empower all women and girls in line with MONDIACULT declaration and the objectives of the Plan for the Recovery of Cultural Industries and the Arts to 2030 developed by the Ministry of Culture of Peru with the technical assistance of UNESCO. This activity will focus its efforts on building capacity in local governments in the development of cultural plans and other measures that contribute to the reduction of gender inequalities through culture.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT6 - Member States capacities strengthened to promote, monitor and measure the contribution of culture to the implementation of the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development at the local, national and regional levels

Project: Teacher training institutions in Peru
Description:
We will carry out a mapping of strengthening needs in public pedagogical institutes in two regions of the country, to learn more about the situation and challenges of these institutes. Then we will analyze experiences in strengthening capacities for in-service training of teachers, in alliance with key actors such as the KIPUS Network and the National Higher Pedagogical School of Monterrico, and considering the current in-service training guidelines. Based on these experiences and to address the main needs identified, a proposal for guidelines will be designed and validated - with key allies - to improve the capabilities of higher pedagogical institutes in terms of in-service training. The proposal must involve technical assistance to higher pedagogical institutes. We will implement the proposal in 10 higher pedagogical institutes to validate its effectiveness.
The theory of change will seek to ensure that higher pedagogical institutes can receive technical assistance to improve their performance, focused on in-service teacher training. The identified needs may be addressed with technical assistance in 10 institutes to validate the effectiveness of the proposal.
The sustainability of the proposal will be based on the participation of key allies, such as the KIPUS Network and the National Higher Pedagogical School of Monterrico, as well as the Ministry of Education and decentralized management bodies, which will have the proposal and its implementation recommendations. .
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED5 - Teachers trained and supported to improve learning outcomes and address the changes brought forth by the digital and AI transformation and the COVID-19 crisis

Project: TIC for wellbeing
Description: Rural secondary education has been one of the most affected by the pandemic in Peru and has had less access to digital resources to improve its Quality. The proposal aims to ensure a more effective, inclusive and quality secondary education by generating and updating a specialized Platform for rural secondary education. This Platform will have, on the one hand, a set of pedagogical resources and other quantitative and statistical information to improve decision-making in the regional directorates of education and UGEL where there is a rural population. We will start in two regions of the country.
Outcome EN: Outcome 8 - Foster knowledge sharing and skills development in the digital age
Output EN: 8.ED8 - Technologies and digital innovations leveraged to ensure more inclusive, effective and relevant learning

Project: Further Horizons, Rural secondary education
Description: This project is a continuation of the Rural Secondary Education Horizons Programme (onwards Programme), developed between 2018 and 2022 (BC 570PER1000 and 570PER1001). It is expected to continue with the process started to strengthen the sustainability of the intervention in 4 regions (Ayacucho, Arequipa, Piura, and Puno) and reinforce and strengthen the results in another 2 regions (Amazonas and Cusco).
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED4 - Learners equipped with relevant skills to meet individual, labour market and societal demands through literacy, TVET, STEM and higher education

Project: Rural students in Peru
Description: Rural adolescents are one of the most excluded populations in the Peruvian educational system, a situation that was aggravated by the pandemic. The objective of this plan is to provide Technical Assistance to at least 4 UGELs in rural areas of Peru to strengthen their secondary schools through a networking methodology that allows schools to implement learning projects with a territorial focus, develop prevention strategies against risk factors and work on the social-emotional skills of their students.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED1 - Education systems equipped to promote inclusion, address marginalization and advance rights, including in crisis-affected and post-disaster contexts

Project: Development of cultural policies gender based
Description: This activity will contribute to the reduction of gender inequality and empower all women and girls in line with MONDIACULT declaration and the objectives of the Plan for the Recovery of Cultural Industries and the Arts to 2030 developed by the Ministry of Culture of Peru with the technical assistance of UNESCO. This activity will focus its efforts on building capacity in local governments in the development of cultural plans and other measures that contribute to the reduction of gender inequalities through culture.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions

Project: Appui à la continuité de l'éducation de base par la mise en place d'un
Description: Ce projet a pour objectif d'assurer la continuité de l'apprentissage pour 1.285.640 apprenants de la maternel, du primaire et du secondaire ainsi que leur sécurité et leur bien-être des enfants, en particulier pur les plus vulnérables lors de la fermeture et de la réouverture des écoles, en leur créant la possibilité de poursuivre, à domicile, les activités d'apprentissage minimum, lors des fermetures d'écoles tout en mettant en place des mesures préventives contre le COVID-19.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED6 - Resilience, quality and equity of education systems strengthened to flexibly respond to evolving learning environments and to better deliver on SDG4 commitments

Project: GPE LEG Assessment for Tanzania Mainland
Description: The Purpose of the Activity is to undertake The Global Partnership for Education (GPE) Local Education Group (LEG)/ Education Sector Development Committee (ESDC) self-assessment aims to enable the LEG to reflect on their performance, identify areas for improvement, and develop a plan for strengthening their work.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED6 - Resilience, quality and equity of education systems strengthened to flexibly respond to evolving learning environments and to better deliver on SDG4 commitments

Project: Institutionalizing Whole Institution Approach (WIA) as an ESD Technique to Climate Change Mitigation in Schools
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particularly in Africa, developing countries, LDCs, and SIDS

Project: EMPOWERING YOUTHS IN CLIMATE-FRIENDLY ENTREPRENEURSHIP INITIATIVES IN MCHINGA AREA, LINDI MUNICIPAL COUNCIL
