Project: ReLISA - Restoring Landscapes in South Africa
Description: A consortium of 7 partner organisations, led by UNEP, will plan and implement the ReLISA project aiming at making the economic case for landscape-level restoration and create the conditions for a just transition of South Africa's land-use sector by restoring degraded key biomes (grasslands, savannas, thicket), while recognising the socio-cultural, economic and land tenure context; UNESCO will design and implement Work Package 5 related to ecosystem restoration in Biosphere Reserves through Payments for ecosystem services.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.SC1 - Inclusive knowledge and capacities of Member States strengthened to advance and apply science for sustainable management of natural resources, ecosystem and biodiversity conservation and restoration, and disaster risk resilience

Project: Youth, empowerment and peace building in conflict situations in Cabo D
Description: The project Youth, empowerment and peace building in conflict situations in Cabo Delgado Province (Metuge and Ancuabe districts) is aimed at supporting the development and education of youth and women by addressing their most urgent needs during this time of conflict and ensuring that they are knowledgeable and provided access to their rights. Youth and women will be at the center of dialogues and conversations on peace using the capacity strengthening they receive through this project to support addressing the emergency conflict and strive towards development.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED1 - Education systems equipped to promote inclusion, address marginalization and advance rights, including in crisis-affected and post-disaster contexts

Project: Training Workshops on Gender Equality in Education - Second Phase
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particularly in Africa, developing countries, LDCs, and SIDS

Project: Strengthening of the management capacities of the UNESCO Quirimbas Bio
Description: This project strengthens the management capacities of the newly designated first UNESCO Quirimbas Biosphere Reserve in Mozambique to effectively contribute to and benefit from the implementation of the Lima Action Plan for MAB programme and its World Network of Biosphere Reserves, thus ensuring its long-term viability. It continues the successful support provided for the implementation of the MAB Programme in Mozambique. It is to build on and sustain the momentum created to support the Government programme to support the sound management of natural resources and the protection of biodiversity.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.SC1 - Inclusive knowledge and capacities of Member States strengthened to advance and apply science for sustainable management of natural resources, ecosystem and biodiversity conservation and restoration, and disaster risk resilience

Project: Strengthening Safety of Journalists in the Context of Election in the
Description: The aim of this project is to create a safe space for journalists in covering the general election in the Philippines by encouraging press freedom and access to information in the era of disinformation. This goal will be achieved by providing capacity building for journalists in the Philippines regarding the general election that includes understanding the general election process and regulations that applied in the 2022 general election. Therefore, journalists will have a strong base of understanding, equipped with a groundwork of fact checks, and data-based journalism skills, as well as safety journalist background (physical and digital).
Outcome EN: Outcome 6 - Promote freedom of expression and the right to information
Output EN: 6.CI2 - Member States have strengthened capacities and raised awareness to enhance norms and policies related to freedom of expression, press freedom, safety of journalists, including women journalists, and the right to access information, online and offline

Project: Strengthening research capacity of MoPSE under TEACH Project in Zimbabwe
Description: The TEACH project is to build research capacity of MoPSE, Zimbabwe on use of research evidence to inform policy development and monitoring. More specifically, the project will build capacity in conducting research, analysis of data, report writing for staff in the Department of Strategic, Policy, Planning, Research and Statistics (SPPRS). in this department are staff earmarked for the Centre for Research, Innovation and Development (CERID). In addition, the project will build capacity in the Zimbabwe National Indicator Framework (NIF) to report on SDG4, CESA and NDSI indicators.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED6 - Resilience, quality and equity of education systems strengthened to flexibly respond to evolving learning environments and to better deliver on SDG4 commitments

Project: Promoting basic literacy skills in primary education in Mexico
Description: In recent assesments, Mexico has shown that primary education students do not have the necessary language skills, with school closure due to the Covid 19 pandemic, this issue has deepened. The office has been working with vulnerable populations to ensure development of literacy basic skills and competencies. In addition, we will be working specifically with migrants in coordination with San Jose an Guatemala offices to ensure a strategy for education of migrants that is contextualized to the specific challenges in this region. Finally, we are working in the response to the Hurricane in Guerrero that impacted at least 600 schools last november.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED1 - Education systems equipped to promote inclusion, address marginalization and advance rights, including in crisis-affected and post-disaster contexts

Project: Case Study: An innovative proposal for education transformation in vulnerable contexts
Description: The Social Model for Strengthening Educational Communities, is an initiative of the Alberto Baillères Foundation, following the 2017 earthquakes in Mexico. Its intention is to promote education in vulnerable areas through the construction of educational habitats. This concept integrates innovative and high-quality infrastructure, and the generation of socio-community processes involving the entire community. Since 2019, UNESCO Mexico has provided technical assistance for the development and consolidation of the model, showcasing evidence to contribute to SDG 4 and the 2030 Agenda. The purpose is to expand collaboration, consolidate the Model and develop the rural chapter.
Outcome EN: Outcome 7 - Promote inclusion and combat discrimination, hate speech and stereotypes
Output EN: 7.ED3 - Learners are empowered to lead healthy lives, promote sustainable development and engage with the world as creative and responsible global citizens

Project: Appui à la participation des femmes et des jeunes aux initiatives de c
Description: Le projet a pour objectif renforcer la participation et le rôle des femmes des jeunes dans la prévention la résolution des conflits, consolidation de la paix et promotion de la culture de la paix et du vivre-ensemble au Cameroun. Il vise à renforcer la cohésion sociale par la mise en place de mécanismes d'appui au vivre ensemble, à un meilleur respect des droits humains et protection des personnes vulnérables, au développement d'une empathie nationale pour la paix et promotion du bilinguisme et multiculturalisme. Il s'agit de donner réponse aux efforts de consolidation de paix en cours initiés par le Cameroun face aux crises qui menacent la paix la sécurité des personnes et des biens.
Outcome EN: Outcome 7 - Promote inclusion and combat discrimination, hate speech and stereotypes
Output EN: 7.SHS4 - Member States capacities strengthened to devise and prioritize effective youth policies and interventions and to scale up youth-led solutions at global, regional, national and local levels

Project: L'opérationnalisation de la plateforme sectorielle intégrée du SIGE da
Description: Le présent projet vise à opérationnaliser la plateforme sectorielle intégrée du SIGE des ministères en charge de l'Education et de la Formation et l'Institut National de la Statistique (INS) dans la perspective de l'élaboration d'un annuaire statistique sectoriel. Cette plateforme devra être hébergée à l'INS, accessible en ligne et fédérée les statistiques de l'ensemble des sous-secteurs de l'éducation et de la formation.
Outcome EN: Outcome 2 - Strengthen international coordination for the achievement of SDG 4 and develop the global education agenda based on research, foresight and innovation
Output EN: 2.ED7 - Education policy and finance decisions to achieve SDG 4 are informed by improved coordination, data and monitoring, knowledge and innovative partnerships
Donor: World Bank/International Bank for Reconstruction and Development

Project: Projet d'appui à l'analyse des facteurs favorables et à l'élaboration
Description: Dans le cadre du nouveau modèle de financement du GPE en particulier pour le renforcement de capacités, l'UNESCO, l'UNICEF et la Banque Mondiale se sont réunies autour d'un consortium sous le lead de l'UNESCO pour accompagner le Gouvernement dans l'analyse des facteurs favorables et l'élaboration du Pacte de Partenariat. l'UNESCO est chargé de gestion fiduciaire des fonds. Le présent projet s'inscrit dans ce sens et décrit de manière opérationnelle les activités qui permettront d'arriver aux résultats attendus.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED6 - Resilience, quality and equity of education systems strengthened to flexibly respond to evolving learning environments and to better deliver on SDG4 commitments
Donor: World Bank - Global Partnership for Education

Project: ATELIERS DE CAPACITATION DES ORGANISATIONS DE FEMMES RURALES SUR L’EXPLOITATION ET LA RENTABILISATION DES TIC
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particularly in Africa, developing countries, LDCs, and SIDS

Project: Projet d'appui à l'élaboration du Plan Stratégique National de Dévelop
Description: Le présent projet s'inscrit dans la poursuite des efforts du Gouvernement camerounais et ses Partenaires pour le renforcement du SIGE et de la Carte Scolaire à travers la pérennisation des actions déjà entreprises. A cet effet, il vise principalement à élaborer un plan stratégique de développement du SIGE et de la Carte Scolaire afin de doter le gouvernement d'un outil stratégique pour assurer une bonne gestion et durabilité du SIGE Sectoriel intégré. Ce plan stratégique constituera un cadre de référence pour les actions futures envisagées pour le renforcement et la modernisation du SIGE et de la carte Scolaire et un outil de plaidoyer pour la mobilisation des ressources.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED6 - Resilience, quality and equity of education systems strengthened to flexibly respond to evolving learning environments and to better deliver on SDG4 commitments
Donor: World Bank/International Bank for Reconstruction and Development

Project: Projet conjoint UNESCO-FAO-OIM
Description: Le projet proposé contribuera au renforcement des capacités des jeunes adultes (filles et garçons), des femmes ainsi que des migrants de retour au Mali relatives à la prévention et la gestion des conflits ainsi qu'à leur participation active au développement socio-économique de leurs communautés via des emplois durables. Le projet se base sur l'hypothèse déjà confirmée que l'indépendance économique des jeunes, couplée avec leur épanouissement social au sein des communautés où ils vivent en leur donnant un rôle accru dans les processus de consultation et de prise de décision, adressent les causes profondes du conflit, renforcent la cohésion sociale.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED4 - Learners equipped with relevant skills to meet individual, labour market and societal demands through literacy, TVET, STEM and higher education

Project: Empowering Adolescent Girls and Young Women through Education in Mali
Description: UNESCO Office in Bamako in close collaboration with Ministries of Education; Health; Vocational training; and Women, children and family; and under the framework of UNESCO-UNFPA-UN Women Joint Programme for the Empowerment of Adolescent Girls and Young Women will implement a project entitled "Empowering adolescent girls and young women through education in Mali" to enhance access to quality and relevant education for adolescent girls and young women. The project will be implemented in three regions of Mali (Segou, Mopti and Tombouctou) as well as in the District of Bamako.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED2 - Gender transformative education systems empower learners, ensure safe learning environments and address the educational barriers, particularly for girls and women, exacerbated by the learning crisis

Project: Ecole engagée, Développement Durable Assuré
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particularly in Africa, developing countries, LDCs, and SIDS

Project: Advancing Education in Emergencies and Inclusive Education in Egypt
Description: UNESCO Cairo will implement a range of activities that respect diverse needs, abilities and characteristics and eliminate various forms of discrimination in the learning environment. This will include interventions to develop and implement inclusive policies and programmes targeting excluded and marginalized groups in order to provide them with quality education and skills training, and inclusive curricula and teaching-learning materials. Among vulnerable groups, UNESCO Cairo will pay special attention to women, girls, refugees, migrants and people with disabilities.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED1 - Education systems equipped to promote inclusion, address marginalization and advance rights, including in crisis-affected and post-disaster contexts

Project: Enhancing Teacher Capacities in Egypt
Description: In support of SDG Target 4.c, this work plan will support the capacity development of teachers and teacher training institutions, drawing on the use of technology-supported solutions such as open and distance learning and teaching innovations.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED5 - Teachers trained and supported to improve learning outcomes and address the changes brought forth by the digital and AI transformation and the COVID-19 crisis

Project: National Campaign for Literacy with focus on Women in Egypt
Description: According to the Education for All Global Monitoring Report 2011, the number of illiterates in Egypt reached 17.8 million (34% of the total population), of which two thirds are women and girls. Literacy rates among males aged 15+ reached 75%, while that of females in the same age bracket is only 58%. Therefore, the project will target marginalized women and girls and seek to eradicate their illiteracy, aiming to reach out to the most vulnerable female groups and remote geographical locations.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED4 - Learners equipped with relevant skills to meet individual, labour market and societal demands through literacy, TVET, STEM and higher education

Project: Supporting ESD, GCED, Health and Culture in Education in Egypt
Description: This work plan seeks to help achieve SDG Target 4.7. It will design and implement a wide range of activities to advance, amongst others, the UNESCO Greening Education Partnership; the ESD for 2030 country initiative in Egypt; as well as the Revised 1974 Recommendation concerning International Understanding, Cooperation and Peace; and the Revised Framework for Culture and Arts Education.
Outcome EN: Outcome 7 - Promote inclusion and combat discrimination, hate speech and stereotypes
Output EN: 7.ED3 - Learners are empowered to lead healthy lives, promote sustainable development and engage with the world as creative and responsible global citizens

Project: Fostering Gender Equality in Education in Egypt
Description: To help achieve SDG Target 4.5, UNESCO Cairo will implement various initiatives that seek to eliminate gender disparities in education . Particular emphasis will be placed on girls' and women's education and skills development, including the promotion of gender-responsive teaching and learning practices and programmes.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED2 - Gender transformative education systems empower learners, ensure safe learning environments and address the educational barriers, particularly for girls and women, exacerbated by the learning crisis

Project: Enhancing Opportunities for Women and Youth through Literacy and Basic Education
Description: Within the framework of the Lifelong Learning Policy of the Royal Government of Cambodia, UNESCO will support the expansion of alternative and flexible learning pathways for women and out-of-school youth through literacy, skills training and basic education. This programme will be jointly implemented by the Ministry of Education, Youth and Sport and the Ministry of Labour and Vocational Training. The linkage between the two programmes will open wider access to non-formal learning opportunities among women and out-of-school youth. It will aim to strengthen the policy environment through conducting policy review and compiling recommendations to accelerate progress towards the government's set ambitions as well as to enhance the linkages between lifelong learning, non-formal education and skills development. The programme will further strengthen the evidence base for literacy and non-formal skills training programmes building a stronger case for both public and private investment. UNESCO is already a well-established and well-respected partner in these sectors and a leading partner for both Ministries. The work will complement existing funding for NFE, skills development and decent employment which is more focused on service delivery, by strengthening the policy environment to sustain these initiatives over the medium to long term.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED4 - Learners equipped with relevant skills to meet individual, labour market and societal demands through literacy, TVET, STEM and higher education

Project: Enhancing ICT for teachers and digital tranformation of Cambodia's education
Description: The use of digital technologies is rapidly growing in all spheres of life and the implications for education systems are significant. The effective integration of digital technology has the potential to address challenges in Cambodia’s education systems, as well as transform the teaching and learning experience for learners. For example, when used safely and effectively, generative AI can be used to adapt educational content to suit individual learning interests, pace and abilities to provide a dynamic and personalised learning experience and caters to diverse learning needs.  The new government’s Pentagonal Strategy places a strong emphasis on digital transformation across government ministries and have strengthened the focus on the integration of technology in education and the development of digital skills and competencies. This requires a coherent approach to ensure that ICT is sustainably and equitably integrated in the sector and that teachers are well prepared. This programme will support the Ministry of Education, Youth and Sport (MoEYS) in conducting research on the use of Generative AI, developing the ethical framework to guide any new initiatives in this area and inform continuous professional development (CPD) offerings for teachers and teacher educators in the area of ICT. This work will complement the funding UNESCO Phnom Penh is managing as Grant Agent for the GPE System Transformation Grant, in which one component is focused on ICT and digital transformation in Education.
Outcome EN: Outcome 8 - Foster knowledge sharing and skills development in the digital age
Output EN: 8.ED8 - Technologies and digital innovations leveraged to ensure more inclusive, effective and relevant learning

Project: To strengthen and promote the diversity of cultural expressions through cultural and creative industries in Cambodia.
Description: Special attention will be paid to strengthening Cambodia’s capacities to design, implement and monitor policies and measures in line with the 2005 Convention. Local and regional expertise will be mobilized through the Convention’s reinvigorated Experts Facility to provide policy and technical support to national authorities and civil society stakeholders, particularly in the fields of diversity of cultural expressions in the digital environment, empowerment of women as artists and culture professionals.  Special focus will be given to promoting and strengthening cultural and creative industries in Cambodia which requires a strategic transformation especially it has been most affected by the COVID-19 crises. The COVID-19 pandemic has also had a direct impact on the capacity of the culture sector to create and distribute new artistic expressions and cultural content beyond the digital environment, thus reducing the diversity of cultural expressions. At the same time, the growing digital divide risks aggravating pre-existing inequalities in access to culture and the diversity of cultural expressions in the digital environment, including by accentuating the gender gap. Efforts will be deployed to bridge this gap, as well as to digitally empower communities, who are often marginalized from technological advances.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT5 - Member States and civil society capacities strengthened to protect and promote the diversity of cultural expressions through dynamic and inclusive cultural and creative industries

Project: Building back better through participation
Description: Through this project, the United Nations Country team, UNESCO and UN Human Rights seek to streamline ongoing support by the United Nations, its agencies, funds and programmes, to advance civic space. It aims to empower journalists and human rights defenders to engage with the Government to address their safety and protection.
Outcome EN: Outcome 6 - Promote freedom of expression and the right to information
Output EN: 6.CI2 - Member States have strengthened capacities and raised awareness to enhance norms and policies related to freedom of expression, press freedom, safety of journalists, including women journalists, and the right to access information, online and offline

Project: Breaking Silence: enhance accountability and prosecutions for safety o
Description: The project aims to expand the impact of the Iraqi National Committee of Safety of Journalists and issue of Impunity (INCSJII), by developing the capacity of the Judiciary, Prosecution, and Justice systems in Iraq.
Outcome EN: Outcome 6 - Promote freedom of expression and the right to information
Output EN: 6.CI2 - Member States have strengthened capacities and raised awareness to enhance norms and policies related to freedom of expression, press freedom, safety of journalists, including women journalists, and the right to access information, online and offline

Project: Supporting the Digital Center of Eastern Manuscripts in Iraq.
Description:
The proposed project aims at supporting the ongoing efforts in conserving the ancient Christian manuscripts in Iraq that are currently under the custody of the Digital Center of Eastern Manuscripts, especially those salvaged in 2014 by Fr. Najeeb Michaeel at the onset of the takeover of Mosul and its surroundings by ISIL.
Specific objectives of the project are as below:
a)	To conserve a selection of the most historically significant Christian manuscripts salvaged from the Mosul area;
b)	To supply basic needed materials and equipment for manuscript conservation at the Digital Center of Eastern Manuscripts.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT2 - Member States capacities strengthened to fight the illicit trafficking of cultural property and promote its return and restitution, to protect underwater cultural heritage and to promote the role of museums for societies

Project: Supporting documentary heritage preservation in Yemen
Description: In 2019, UNESCO conducted a regional survey on the state of documentary heritage in the Arab region, including a mapping of Yemen documentary heritage institutions. The survey registered more than 2 million items, demonstrating the richness and diversity of the documentary heritage being preserved in Yemen. Nevertheless, the ongoing conflict is highly impacting documentary preservation, with 68% of the responding institutions citing conflict as the primary risk to their collections. Despite the risks aforementioned, only 10% have a disaster and emergency preparedness response plan, and less have the proper equipment and trained staff to respond to emergencies, demonstrating a strong need for support. Building on the results of the regional study, UNESCO will actualize its mapping of Yemeni memory institutions and launch a comprehensive need assessment per governorate that will be the object of a publication on Yemeni documentary heritage. The need assessment will inform the development of a capacity building program and used to support resource mobilization. It will also allow the identification of nominations to the Memory of World registry. In parallel, UNESCO office to the Gulf States and Yemen will organize capacity building workshops focusing on Preventive conservation and Disaster Risk Management.
Outcome EN: Outcome 8 - Foster knowledge sharing and skills development in the digital age
Output EN: 8.CI4 - Member States are enabled to foster universal access to information and knowledge, including through the Information for All Programme (IFAP), as well as through Open Solutions, and through the identification, preservation and accessibility of documentary heritage

Project: Providing capacity development support to implementation of 10 year plan in Viet Nam
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED6 - Resilience, quality and equity of education systems strengthened to flexibly respond to evolving learning environments and to better deliver on SDG4 commitments

Project: UNESCO designated sites as a model for sustainable development in Vietnam
Description: The workplan focus on promoting Biosphere Reserves and UNESCO Global Geoparks as sites for the localization of the SDGs, particularly in strengthening BRs management, sustainable management of natural resources and ecosystem conservation in Vietnam. Aligned with Lima Action Plan (2015-2025), the activity will also contribute to the implementation of international climate change related agendas and the One UN Strategic Framework for Sustainable Development Cooperation in Vietnam 2022-2026.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.SC1 - Inclusive knowledge and capacities of Member States strengthened to advance and apply science for sustainable management of natural resources, ecosystem and biodiversity conservation and restoration, and disaster risk resilience

Project: Support to Education Sector Analysis and Development of Education Deve
Description: The project will assist the Ministry of Education and Training in conducting an education sector analysis and developing an education development strategic plan (EDSP) 2021-2030. The Education Sector Group (ESG) which consists of development partners active in the education sector in Viet Nam will be involved in the process of the education sector analysis and the education sector plan development.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED6 - Resilience, quality and equity of education systems strengthened to flexibly respond to evolving learning environments and to better deliver on SDG4 commitments
Donor: World Bank - Global Partnership for Education

Project: Teachers (including teachers for ECCE) in Nepal
Description: Technical support will be provided to update and revise the teacher competency framework. In addition, Training of Trainers will be imparted on soft/transversal skills for school education and school related gender-based violence
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED5 - Teachers trained and supported to improve learning outcomes and address the changes brought forth by the digital and AI transformation and the COVID-19 crisis

Project: Empowering Adolescent Girls and Young Women through the Provision of C
Description: UNESCO Office in Kathmandu in close collaboration with MOE and under the framework of UNESCO-UNFPA-UN Women Joint Programme for the Empowerment of Adolescent Girls and Young Women will implement a project entitled "Empowering Adolescent Girls and Young Women through the Provision of Comprehensive Sexuality Education and a Safe Learning Environment in Nepal" to enhance access to quality and relevant education for adolescent girls and young women in Nepal. The project will be implemented in five district of Nepal.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED2 - Gender transformative education systems empower learners, ensure safe learning environments and address the educational barriers, particularly for girls and women, exacerbated by the learning crisis

Project: FNDE - National Program to Support School Transportation
Description: This Project aims to improve the institutional capacity of the National Education Development Fund - FNDE, in particular the General Coordination of Support for School Maintenance (CGAME), the Educational Actions Board (DIRAE), to become a national and international reference in public transport and school maintenance policies excellence. The proposed results should contribute to the improvement of these educational policies and, as a consequence, reduce educational inequality and achieve better access and learning rates for Brazilian students.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED6 - Resilience, quality and equity of education systems strengthened to flexibly respond to evolving learning environments and to better deliver on SDG4 commitments

Project: Expansion and update of the processes of formulation, implementation and evaluation of public policies of Science, Technology, Innovation and Communications in Brazil
Description: The project provides structural mechanisms to the Brazilian Ministry of Science, Technology, Innovation and Communications (MCTIC) to reinforce and implement the Brazilian National Strategy for Science, Technology and Innovation (Estratégia Nacional de Ciência, Tecnologia e Inovação - ENCTI, 2016-2019). The project is also an important enabler for the fullfilment of SDG 9 in Brazil, particularly its target "b" ('Support domestic technology development, research and innovation in developing countries, including by ensuring a conducive policy environment for, inter alia, industrial diversification and value addition to commodities").
Outcome EN: Outcome 4 - Advance international cooperation in science, technology and innovation
Output EN: 4.SC4 - Member States capacities strengthened to improve STI policies, access to scientific and technological advancements and enhance knowledge sharing, including through Open Science

Project: Improvement of the ANVISA technological capacity as a health regulatory agency
Description: The project is intended to enable new scientific and technological improvements for the Brazilian National Sanitary Surveilance Agency (ANVISA), capacity-building and training opportunities to its technical staff and the development of communication sanitary campaigns and other anti-COVID initiatives.
Outcome EN: Outcome 4 - Advance international cooperation in science, technology and innovation
Output EN: 4.SC5 - Institutional and human capacities in basic sciences, technology, research, innovation, and engineering enhanced to advance knowledge for sustainable development

Project: Ethics in Public Policies in the State of Goiás
Description: The following proposal is very much rooted on contemporary ethical issues, particularly ethics in public government. The project will also be an important enabler for activities and events related to other SHS topics, such as ethics in AI and bioethics.
Outcome EN: Outcome 9 - Develop ethical standards, norms and frameworks for action to meet the challenges of innovative technologies and digital transformation
Output EN: 9.SHS5 - Member States’ capacities and policies strengthened to benefit from AI, gene-editing, neuro-technologies, quantum technologies and other frontier technologies, and to address the associated risks, including inequalities and discrimination, in line with international ethical standards, recommendations and frameworks

Project: Safeguard of the Cultural and Linguistic Heritage of indigenous people
Description: This project aims to develop safeguard actions to protect the cultural and linguistic heritage of indigenous peoples living near borders in the Amazon region with another Latin America countries, with special attention to indigenous people who were recently contacted.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT4 - Member States and communities capacities strengthened to identify, safeguard and promote living heritage

Project: Further integration and coordinated efforts of the UNESCO network of geoparks and biosphere reserves in Brazil
Description: The workplan will enable further integration among the seven UNESCO biosphere reserves and the five UNESCO global geoparks in Brazil, exploring common areas of intervention, such as touristic routes, sustainable management plans, regular meetings of the sites and complementarities and synergies with other exiting initiatives of the BRZ Office with local authorities (Ministry of Environment, Ministry of Tourism, etc).
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.SC1 - Inclusive knowledge and capacities of Member States strengthened to advance and apply science for sustainable management of natural resources, ecosystem and biodiversity conservation and restoration, and disaster risk resilience

Project: Strengthened water security in Brazil with the IHP support
Description: This element will support the implementation of IHP-IX in Brazil, based on its Strategic and Operational Implementation Plans, with a focus on accelerating change towards the targets of SDG6. It will work closely with IHP working groups, UNESCO Chairs and UNESCO Centres in the country to address priority areas in (1) scientific research and innovation, (2) water education in Fourth Industrial Revolution including sustainability, (3) bridging the data-knowledge gap, (4) integrated water resources management under conditions of global change, and (5) water governance based on science for mitigation, adaptation, and resilience. It will also support regional working groups working on cryosphere and forest systems, while promoting intersectoral and interagency cooperation.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.SC2 - Water science, innovation, education, management, cooperation and governance bolstered for a water secure world in a changing environment

Project: LINKS implementation in Brazil
Description: The workplan will explore synergies for the LINKS programme in Brazil considering the forthcoming COP30 in the city of Belém in 2025.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.IP3 (SC) - Member States capacities and awareness are strengthened to protect, safeguard and promote Indigenous knowledge, cultures, and languages through inclusive policies and targeted action

Project: Shared Management of Brazilian Cultural Heritage
Description: This project aims to enlarge the social appropriation and the capacity of shared management of Brazilian Cultural Heritage, involving federative entities, private sector and civil society organizations.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: SeSu
Description: This project aims to promote Brazilian higher education by improving innovative actions implemented by the Ministry of Education's Secretariat of Higher Education (SESu). The project proposal consists in expanding new methodologies for teachers' and managers' training; studies evaluating access, permanence and insertion in the labor market; improvement of health residency programs; incentive to improve academic-institutional management; and strategies internationalization for higher education.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED4 - Learners equipped with relevant skills to meet individual, labour market and societal demands through literacy, TVET, STEM and higher education

Project: SEDUC RS
Description: The project aims to provide technical assistance for the consolidation of pedagogical, curricular and educational management practices in Rio Grande do Sul state education network through: conducting assessments, identifying good pedagogical practices and developing materials for integral education; improving pedagogical and curricular practices; promoting the updating of knowledge of education personnel; developing tools, methodologies and assessments to support pedagogical management at Rio Grande do Sul Secretariat of Education (SEDUC/RS); identifying innovative educational technologies, content and methodologies; and improving the management capacity of SEDUC/RS educational programs.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED1 - Education systems equipped to promote inclusion, address marginalization and advance rights, including in crisis-affected and post-disaster contexts

Project: Development of the technological parks and the innovation ecosystem of Goias, Brazil
Description: The project intends to help the Brazilian state of Goias to implement its mid-term STI strategy for 2020-2023 by the enhancement of the technical capacity of the seven existing technological parks of the state (parques tecnológicos) as important drivers for local sustainable development.
Outcome EN: Outcome 4 - Advance international cooperation in science, technology and innovation
Output EN: 4.SC4 - Member States capacities strengthened to improve STI policies, access to scientific and technological advancements and enhance knowledge sharing, including through Open Science

Project: Empowering men and boys for gender equality in India
Description: This workstream builds on UNESCO's programming to engage men and boys in gender equality in India (2019-2021). Responding to the needs, priorities, and demand identified in this first phase of implementation, UNESCO's Social and Human Sciences sector (SHS) will build a follow-on/up programme, 'Transforming MEN-talities II' to strengthen a) knowledge on the behavioural, institutional, and structural factors which enable interventions to engage men and boys for gender equality to be successful; 2) the scale and reach of operational activities to engage men and boys for gender equality within educational and community settings; and 3) the networks available to encourage peer-learning, good practice sharing, and coordination around engaging men and boys for gender equality in India.
Outcome EN: Outcome 7 - Promote inclusion and combat discrimination, hate speech and stereotypes
Output EN: 7.SHS3 - Member States capacities are strengthened to scale up their policy, institutional and legislative actions towards gender equality, to eliminate gender-based violence and discrimination, gender biases and stereotypes, including in the digital world

Project: Preserving Petra's Nabataean architectural heritage through the study
Description: Building on former initiatives for the improved preservation and management of Petra's outstanding heritage, the project aims at ensuring the conservation of one of the most prominent rock-cut façades in Petra by responding to the need of developing local technical skills on heritage conservation and raising awareness among the local community. The project goal will be pursued through: 1) Implementation of a feasibility study to identify priority actions for the conservation of the Royal Tombs water management system, 2) Implementation of a conservation project on the Palace Tomb, 3) Capacity development of the national authorities and the local community on heritage conservation.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: Local Communities and Sustainable Tourism in Petra and Wadi Rum
Description: The overall purpose of this project is to ensure the sustainable conservation of the World Heritage Sites of Petra and Wadi Rum, while offering local communities the possibility to take part in the preservation of the sites through limited cash-for-works activities, enhance their capacity in tourism and hospitality-related activities, and raise their awareness on the importance of their role in the safeguarding of their own cultural heritage. In addition, the project intents to promote gender equality, and will support economic growth by creating job opportunities through the development of female-owned local businesses.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: Technical assistance to support MoE's EMIS platform for enhanced evide
Description: UNESCO aims to support the MoE of Jordan to strengthen their EMIS platform in support of decision-making, policy analysis and formulation, planning, monitoring, and management at all administrative levels. The project supports the GoJ in the implementation and monitoring of their national education plans, strategies and international commitments. More specifically, EMIS is a key component of the national Education Strategic Plan (ESP) under the System Strengthening domain. The project also contributes directly to the implementation of the MoE EMIS Operational Plan Phase II (2020-2025), highlighting phase II of development and capacity building needs of the MoE for their EMIS platform.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED6 - Resilience, quality and equity of education systems strengthened to flexibly respond to evolving learning environments and to better deliver on SDG4 commitments

Project: “The competency of museum on youth education - Museums and Youth Development” seminar
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particularly in Africa, developing countries, LDCs, and SIDS

Project: Enhancing Capacity to Prevent Illicit Trafficking of Cultural Object in Pakistan
Description: Islamabad office, working closely with Federal and Provincial Department of Culture and Archaeology, will mobilize relevant stakeholders specifically law enforcement agencies, including Federal Investigation Agencies, Police and Custom Authorities by engaging them through a training workshop on the prevention of illicit trafficking of cultural artifacts. The workshop will focus on raising awareness on the potential risks associated with the illicit trafficking of antiquities online platforms and relevant international laws, specifically the 1970 Convention and the mechanism of international cooperation provided under the Convention to prevent illicit trafficking of cultural objects.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT2 - Member States capacities strengthened to fight the illicit trafficking of cultural property and promote its return and restitution, to protect underwater cultural heritage and to promote the role of museums for societies

Project: Building Institutional Capacity for Effective Management of World Heritage in Pakistan
Description: The proposed interventions are based on the findings of consultation workshop organized in the last biennium, engaging relevant government institutions. The activities aim to enhance the institutional capacity of Pakistan in effective implementation of the World Heritage Convention through supporting the provincial and Directorate of archaeology in World Heritage Management and meeting World Heritage requirements and documentation, such as management plans, maps, guidance on preparing nomination dossiers, demarcation of boundaries, impact assessments etc.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: Supporting Palestine in the effective implementation of the 2003 Convention at the national level
Description: Through this activity, UNESCO will provide technical support and guidance to the national and local authorities in Palestine for the effective implementation of the 2003 Convention at the national and local level, including in identifying potential solutions to the most urgent safeguarding needs outlined through the 2022 periodic report, and in providing guidance on how to request International Assistance from the Intangible Cultural Heritage Fund. In this framework, UNESCO will continue to provide support for the organization of capacity-building activities and the preparation of safeguarding plans for the intangible cultural heritage elements in Palestine, including in the Gaza Strip when the situation will allow.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT4 - Member States and communities capacities strengthened to identify, safeguard and promote living heritage

Project: Strengthen media development, diversity and supporting Community Media
Description:
This workplan is dedicated to enhancing media strength, independence, and diversity through capacity-building, dialogue, and advocacy. We aim to promote media development, encourage media pluralism, and foster peaceful collaboration. A key focus is on empowering media professionals with skills to cover global challenges and emergencies.

In Bangladesh, supporting improved journalism and boosting journalists' abilities to address issues like disability equality, climate change, and gender equality is crucial. About 2.4% of Bangladesh’s population are persons with disabilities, who often face stigma and underrepresentation in media. The media can help create awareness and change narratives, promoting inclusivity.
This work plan will advocate for gender equality in media content, promoting bias-free representations. We will develop a Bangla manual on disability equality in media and prioritize training women journalists. Community media, especially community radio, plays a vital role in rural outreach, education, and promoting social issues in Bangladesh. UNESCO will empower community media to locally produced programs to raise awareness on social issues, and combat mis/disinformation, hate speech.
Outcome EN: Outcome 6 - Promote freedom of expression and the right to information
Output EN: 6.CI3 - Member States and media institutions enabled to strengthen media development and media pluralism, including through the International Programme for the Development of Communication (IPDC)

Project: Study of Floristic Composition of Lawachara and Satchari forests with special emphasis on the conservation status of two Reserved Forests of Bangladesh.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particularly in Africa, developing countries, LDCs, and SIDS

Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action

Project: UNESCO Documentation and Advisory Services (UDAS)
Description:
The project UNESCO Documentation and Advisory Services for WH sites in Lebanon aims at helping the Directorate General of Antiquities in the control of works in the World Heritage sites of Tyre and Baalbek as well as meeting the World Heritage requirements of consultation and monitoring of conservation measures to be implemented. This will be achieved through :

1.	Organization of four consultation workshops and events .
2.	Supplying technical assistance to the DGA for preparing various reports to be submitted to the WHC.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: Beirut - 1% workplan
Description: Enhancing UNESCO’s strategic positioning and engagement in joint common UN programming processes in the Arab States Region
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.BSP3 - UNESCO's programmatic priorities articulated in the context of the 2030 Agenda and contribution to United Nations inter-agency work strengthened.

Project: Enhancing documentary heritage preservation in Lebanon
Description: UNESCO will strengthen the capacities, expand resources and enhance skills of different documentary heritage institutions as well as support new nominations to Memory of World registry. UNESCO will also promote preservation, protection and accessibility of documentary heritage.
Outcome EN: Outcome 8 - Foster knowledge sharing and skills development in the digital age
Output EN: 8.CI4 - Member States are enabled to foster universal access to information and knowledge, including through the Information for All Programme (IFAP), as well as through Open Solutions, and through the identification, preservation and accessibility of documentary heritage

Project: For the preparation of a conservation management plan for Oscar Niemeyer
Description: A conservation management plan, including as desk based study of the archival material, value based assessment and condition assessment of the physical fabric, in addition to some research and testing of original materials and techniques , will be developed for the International Fair at Tripoli, North Lebanon, one of the most iconic architectural achievements of the modern period in Lebanon designed by the Brazilian architect Oscar Niemeyer in the 1960s. the project will directly benefit the development of the World Heritage dossier including the identification of an outstanding universal value for the site and the definition of its authenticity and integrity.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: Ukraine - Strengthening Physical and Psychosocial Safety in Schools
Description: In alignment with the priorities identified by the Ministry of Education and Science of Ukraine and in partnership with the Government of Japan and the Government of Sweden, UNESCO supports the MoES with the transformation of the Mental Health and Psychosocial Support system in the Education Sector, and the comprehensive rehabilitation of education infrastructure in Ukraine.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED1 - Education systems equipped to promote inclusion, address marginalization and advance rights, including in crisis-affected and post-disaster contexts

Project: Support the Mental Health and Psychosocial Support (MHPSS) system in Ukraine - 1
Description: The armed conflict in Ukraine and its impact on the lives of its inhabitants pose extraordinary risks to the mental health and well-being of the population, hampering the protective capacity of education: children and education staff affected by the war have an increased risk of suffering emotional harm and developing mental health problems with grave implications. The expected impact of the project is the reduction in the negative mental health effects of conflict in Ukrainian learners through policy transformation, capacity development for key education stakeholders and direct provision of school-based mental health and psychosocial support to students.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED1 - Education systems equipped to promote inclusion, address marginalization and advance rights, including in crisis-affected and post-disaster contexts

Project: Capacity Building on Curriculum for Tackling Cross-Cutting Issues for Green Learning and Climate Action
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particularly in Africa, developing countries, LDCs, and SIDS

Project: Capacity Building Mazabuka and Chikankata Communities in Climate Change Resilient Practices through Radio
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particularly in Africa, developing countries, LDCs, and SIDS

Project: Appui a l'Elaboration du cadre normatif du secteur de l'éducation au B
Description: Approfondir l'analyse du contexte éducatif actuel du Bénin en matière de normes (inventaire des textes et des normes) réalisée dans l'étude préalable en couvrant aussi bien l'éducation formelle que l'éducation non formelle. Sur cette base, définir des normes favorisant la cohésion inter et intra blocs au sein de la nouvelle architecture avec une attention particulière sur le fonctionnement intersectoriel afin d'asseoir le dispositif de la formation tout au long de la vie à travers la diversification des lieux et formes d'apprentissage. Enfin tenir compte de la nouvelle architecture holistique adoptée dans les actes du 2eme forum sur l'Education au Bénin et reprise dans PSE post 2015.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all

Project: Appui aux partenaires sociaux dans l'accompagnement et le suivi de la
Description: Sur financement de backup-GIZ, UNESCO appuiera le Secrétariat technique permanent de la coordination du programme sectoriel éducation, dans le renforcement des capacités des partenaires sociaux en vue d'adopter une stratégie d'apaisement du climat social et de professionnalisation des enseignants. Il est prévu i) l'organisation d'un voyage d'étude au Rwanda - pays identifié pour ses bonnes pratiques; ii) la tenue d'ateliers de conception d'outils / documents cadres; iii) la production d'un guide méthodologique, iv) la mise en place d'une plateforme d'échange et, v) une communication tout au long du processus. Cet appui fait suite à la politique nationale enseignante appuyée par l'UNESCO.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED5 - Teachers trained and supported to improve learning outcomes and address the changes brought forth by the digital and AI transformation and the COVID-19 crisis

Project: Projet de coordination Accord-Cadre Bénin UNESCO
Description: L'Accord-Cadre de coopération signé entre le Gouvernement du Benin et l'UNESCO est rentré dans sa phase opérationnelle en début d'année 2020. Dans le cadre de la mise en œuvre des recommandations de la première réunion du Comité de pilotage de l'Accord Cadre Bénin-UNESCO, une mission de l'équipe technique et multisectorielle de l'UNESCO se rendra au Bénin pour réaliser la micro planification des cinq projets prioritaires actualisés de l'Accord-cadre assorti des outils opérationnels facilitant la mise en œuvre et le suivi des activités.

Project: Education Sector Program Implementation Grant (ESPIG) GPE - IMPLEMENTA
Description:
Support costs for GPE Education Sector Program Implementation Grant (ESPIG) Myanmar

UNESCO Myanmar Office will implement the ESPIG programme funded by GPE for the disadvantaged children and youth under the emergency in Myanmar. The ESPIG programme is jointly implemented by UNICEF and Save the Children. The total budget of ESPIG is USD 53.5 million. UNESCO is to implement its 20%, which is USD 10.7 million. Two sister inputs were created for USD 10 million for the implementation and USD 0.7 million for the agency fee. ESPIG has 3 main components (access, quality and system development). UNESCO activities fall into 3 components.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED6 - Resilience, quality and equity of education systems strengthened to flexibly respond to evolving learning environments and to better deliver on SDG4 commitments
Donor: World Bank - Global Partnership for Education

Project: Strengthening pre-Service Teacher Education in Myanmar (STEM) Phase II
Description: The STEM programme aims to improve the pre-service teacher education system in Myanmar through policy and institutional capacity development of Myanmar's Education Colleges. The expected outcomes and activities are designed to improve the quality of education and training in the 25 Education Colleges (ECs) through the development of a new teacher education curriculum, strengthening the planning, management and human resource capacities of ECs, mainstreaming inclusion, equity, and education for peace and sustainable development and creating strong networks to accumulate and share knowledge and experiences between institutions.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED5 - Teachers trained and supported to improve learning outcomes and address the changes brought forth by the digital and AI transformation and the COVID-19 crisis

Project: Supporting Education in Emergency through Digital Learning and Food Security for Migrant Children on Thai-Myanmar Border
Description: The project's overall goal is to ensure the continuity of education for migrant children from Myanmar living in Tak Province, Thailand. Through interventions on (1) digital learning aimed at learning recovery and immediate impact, (2) emergency food aid and (3) equipping migrant learning centres with ICT infrastructure and promotion of sanitation, the project will ensure that migrant children have safe, appropriate and inclusive opportunities to continue their learning and reduce the learning loss during the crisis with good health and well-being, mentally and physically.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED1 - Education systems equipped to promote inclusion, address marginalization and advance rights, including in crisis-affected and post-disaster contexts

Project: Learning Coin for Equitable Education (Phase 2)
Description: Following the completion of Phase 1 in 2021, the Learning Coin for Equitable Education (Phase 2) project will continue to promote literacy and cultivate reading habits of out-of-school and marginalized children and youth (focusing on non-formal education learners) in Thailand through mobile learning and conditional cash transfer. In addition to the existing four target provinces, the project will be expanded in two new provinces to support children and youth to achieve better learning outcomes and economically assist their families with scholarships based on their monthly reading performance. The target learners will also develop ICT skills through mobile learning and capacity building.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED4 - Learners equipped with relevant skills to meet individual, labour market and societal demands through literacy, TVET, STEM and higher education

Project: Transforming Teaching and Learning at Schools for Achieving SGD4: turn
Description:
The joint Project is aimed at supporting the promotion of the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs), recognizing and encouraging excellence with the use of technology in schools through curriculum design, group work, seminars, projects and global interaction, teacher development and training, collection, analysis and dissemination of best practices.
Key Project priorities:
1.	To enrich educational process and experience exchange around SDG's values and priorities.
2.	Develop and disseminate best practices on ICT competencies of schools.
3.	Promote networking and collaboration among targeted schools to meet the challenges and commitments of the interrelated SDGs.
Outcome EN: Outcome 8 - Foster knowledge sharing and skills development in the digital age
Output EN: 8.ED8 - Technologies and digital innovations leveraged to ensure more inclusive, effective and relevant learning
Regional Group: Europe and North America,Asia and the Pacific

Project: Appui au renforcement du dispositif de collecte et d'exploitation des
Description: Le projet vise à appuyer le MEPU-A pour la restructuration et l'amélioration de son système d'information pour la gestion de l'éducation (SIGE). Il est structuré en trois composantes d'appui technique et de renforcement des capacités : (1) Mise en place d'un cadre normatif et méthodologique pour une collecte, une gestion, un traitement et une analyse de l'information statistique fiable, réaliste et efficace ; (2) Mise en place d'une architecture technique matérielle et logicielle SIGE intégrée et optimisée ; et (3) Renforcement des capacités des personnels du MEPU-A pour l'exécution des activités liées au SIGE et l'utilisation du SIGE.
Outcome EN: Outcome 2 - Strengthen international coordination for the achievement of SDG 4 and develop the global education agenda based on research, foresight and innovation

Project: Promote freedom of expression and the right to information in Chile, and follow-up of the World Press Freedom Day Conference.
Description: Chile and UNESCO will host World Press Freedom Day in 2024. Thirty years have passed since the first World Press Freedom Day celebration in 1994 and of the historic Santiago Declaration adopted during the “Seminar on the Development of Media and Democracy in Latin America and the Caribbean” (May 6, 1994), which marked a new phase in promoting the right to freedom of expression and of the press, as well as the development and recognition of community media, independence, and pluralism of the media in Latin America and the Caribbean. Therefore, the WPFD event is a good opportunity to return to the city of Santiago and reaffirm everyone’s commitment to promote and guarantee freedom of expression worldwide. After the WPFDC, support will be provided to Chile to strengthen capacities and raise awareness to improve current legislation and public policies related to freedom of expression, freedom of the press, safety of journalists, including women journalists, and the right to access information, online and offline.
Outcome EN: Outcome 6 - Promote freedom of expression and the right to information
Output EN: 6.CI2 - Member States have strengthened capacities and raised awareness to enhance norms and policies related to freedom of expression, press freedom, safety of journalists, including women journalists, and the right to access information, online and offline

Project: General History of Africa
Description: Compte tenu du potentiel qu'offre l'HGA pour la connaissance réciproque, la cohésion et la paix sociales, l'UNESCO a lancé en 2009 la deuxième phase de l'HGA, qui consiste en son utilisation pour l'éducation formelle, informelle et en sa mise à jour. Ce programme se trouve au cœur de la Priorité Afrique et contribue à la mise en œuvre des ODD 4, 10 et 16 et de l'Agenda 2063 de l'Union Africaine. Pour le Biennium 2022-2023, l'UNESCO s'efforcera de renforcer la production connaissances sur l'histoire de l'Afrique, travers la publication des nouveaux volumes de la collection et de promouvoir sa vulgarisation et sa dissémination auprès du grand public.
Outcome EN: Outcome 7 - Promote inclusion and combat discrimination, hate speech and stereotypes

Project: Enhancing the Digital Transformation through TVET in Developing Countr
Description: The project will support developing countries in enhancing digital transformation through Technical and Vocational Education and Training (TVET) to enact policies to better face challenges related to achieving SDG- 4 Quality Education; and 8 Decent Work and Economic Growth to ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all. The final report will include guidelines for other developing countries.

Output EN: 1.ED4 - Learners equipped with relevant skills to meet individual, labour market and societal demands through literacy, TVET, STEM and higher education

Project: Science Outreach and Engagement for Sustainable Development in the fra
Description: The project will support the implementation of the UN Decade of Ocean Science for Sustainable Development (the Ocean Decade) which commenced implementation on 1 January 2021. The Ocean Decade is a UN-led global initiative that aims to convene diverse actors around the work to generate critical ocean science for sustainable development solutions. Structured around ten Ocean Decade Challenges it addresses issues ranging from marine pollution, ecosystem management, and climate change to ocean observations, ocean data management and capacity development.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health and accelerate the transition towards sustainable management of ocean-related risks and opportunities

Project: EU/UNESCO Expert Facility on the Governance of Culture in Developing C
Description: Building upon the EU-funded project implemented between 2010-2015, the project provides, through EU/UNESCO Expert Facility, on-demand provision of expertise including support for designing policies and implementation plans. It will build on local expertise and reinforce human and institutional capacities in order to achieve ownership, sustainability of results and policy change in developing countries through targeted mentoring, capacity-building and advocacy work. It will also facilitate peer-to-peer learning, among government officials and experts, with a focus on South-South cooperation, to share experiences and transfer knowledge on governance of culture.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT5 - Member States and civil society capacities strengthened to protect and promote the diversity of cultural expressions through dynamic and inclusive cultural and creative industries

Project: Most Easy, Efficient and Low Cost Geothermal Systems for Retrofitting
Description: The project aims at applying a pan - European and innovative shallow geothermal solutions particularly targeting historical buildings, including UNESCO designated sites. The green technology to be developed will have specific characteristics, being easier to install, more cost-effective than the current solutions in the market, with drilling methodologies/machines well suited to operate in built heritage and environment and contributing to mitigate claimte change. Finally the proposed solutions will be tested in cooperation with the managing authority of the Ferrara, "City of the Renaissance, and its Po Delta".
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.SC1 - Inclusive knowledge and capacities of Member States strengthened to advance and apply science for sustainable management of natural resources, ecosystem and biodiversity conservation and restoration, and disaster risk resilience

Project: DTO-BioFlow
Description: DTO-BioFlow will transform access to data on ocean biodiversity and the human activities that impact them, enabling the sustainable integration of these data flows into the EU Digital Twin Ocean, enriching digital tools and services thus unlocking the societal value of these data within the biological component of the DTO, i.e., the digital replica of marine ecological processes.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health and accelerate the transition towards sustainable management of ocean-related risks and opportunities

Project: UNESCO World Water Assessment Programme
Description: The UNESCO World Water Assessment Programme aims to assess, monitor and report on freshwater issues to provide responses, develop case studies, enhance assessment capacity at a national and regional level and inform the decision-making processes. WWAP makes available to decision-makers, inside and outside the water box, data, indicators, background information and projections about the state, use and management of water resources. This will be accomplished through: the production of the annual WWDRs, research and projects on water assessments, water and gender, and emerging fields.

Description: Fostering Ocean Research to combat climate change and other ocean stressors is crucial to achieving SDG 14, maintaining ocean services . Description:
Within the implementation of the UN-Joint programme "Action for Girls and Young Women in Mozambique: Strengthening Sexual and Reproductive Health and Rights" funded by the Swedish International Development Cooperation Agency (Sida), UNESCO will provide leadership on the implementation of Comprehensive sexuality education (CSE), which contributes to young people's development. 
This project will support the Ministry of Education and Human Development (MINEDH) up to 2019 to strengthen the implementation of CSE curricula, where a number of elected teachers will be trained as trainers of teachers, using a comprehensive curriculum that effectively addresses HIV and SRH.

Project: Appui à la participation des femmes et des jeunes aux initiatives de c
Description: Le projet a pour objectif renforcer la participation et le rôle des femmes des jeunes dans la prévention la résolution des conflits, consolidation de la paix et promotion de la culture de la paix et du vivre-ensemble au Cameroun. Il vise à renforcer la cohésion sociale par la mise en place de mécanismes d'appui au vivre ensemble, à un meilleur respect des droits humains et protection des personnes vulnérables, au développement d'une empathie nationale pour la paix et promotion du bilinguisme et multiculturalisme. Il s'agit de donner réponse aux efforts de consolidation de paix en cours initiés par le Cameroun face aux crises qui menacent la paix la sécurité des personnes et des biens.

Additionally, its Latin American Laboratory for Assessment of the Quality of Education (LLECE) will support Member States in the better use of information of the results generated by the Regional Comparative and Explanatory Study (ERCE) to know where they are in the educational trajectory, to build evidence on what works to achieve greater coherence of education policies, and better alignment between policy goals and processes within and across systems.

Project: World Climate Research Programme (WCRP)
Description: IOC is a co-sponsor of the World Climate Research Programme (WCRP). WCRP provides the international and intergovernmental platform to design the research agenda on climate and climate change, on the basis of which national research agendas are developed. The discharge of such national research agendas leads to improving the knowledge base on climate and climate change, which in turn inform the assessment work of the IPCC and, ultimately, policy decisions including those of the UNFCCC and its Paris Agreement. WCRP encompasses an ocean element, of particular relevance to IOC's work and to which IOC is uniquely positioned to contribute.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health an

Project: Climate Change Impact on Ocean & Coastal Ecosystems
Description: Accelerating climate change and expanding human uses exert tremendous pressures on marine ecosystems. Combined effects of climate change (CC) and other stressors, in particular eutrophication and deoxygenation, were reported for marine productivity, biodiversity and species distribution. There is a need to understand/quantify further the effects of CC on the marine biota of the world's oceans, on ecosystems goods and services and on social-ecological systems. Main actions under this activity will include the implementation of the Ocean Decade Global Ocean Oxygen Decade programme, the provision of guiding principles for multiple stressor research and new assessments focusing on pollution and changing phytoplankton communities.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health an

Project: Evaluations
Description: The overall purpose of this workplan is ensure a proper evaluation coverage of the sector’s programme and projects, for accountability, learning and decision-making. The key activities are the delivery and dissemination of corporate evaluations on strategic/ global and thematic topics and an annual synthesis report of all UNESCO evaluations. It also involves support to the decentralized evaluation function by building the capacity of UNESCO staff through a dedicated training programme; financing and managing Regional Evaluation Associates in five duty stations (to start in 2025) and animating the Evaluation Focal Point Network and the UNESCO Evaluation Knowledge Hub.
