Project: IASA 55th Annual conference - “Interdisciplinary Connections"
Description:
The International Association of Sound and Audiovisual Archives (IASA) and L’Institut Valencià de Cultura will co-host the 55th annual Conference in Valencia, Spain. The goal of the conference is to spotlight instances of cross-disciplinary interactions and collaborations, fostering a culture of creativity, innovation, and partnership, especially during times of crises.
With UNESCO support we will make possible the participation of delegates from least developed countries, countries facing conflicts or dealing with post-disasters. This support will be used in its entirety to support as many travel grants as possible for delegates from least developed countries who wish to participate in the conference.

Project: ICA-Thinking Digital in Archives: Capacity Building Workshop in Africa 2024
Description:
Since 2012, the ICA has been leading a Programme for Africa, including capacity building in the region and awareness raising activities. A survey launched in 2023 highlighted the strong need among the African Archival community for training in digitization and digital preservation. 

Based on this, the purpose of this proposal is to offer a five (5) days onsite workshop on digitization and digital preservation in a Francophone African country for French-speaking archival professionals. Participants will receive a full grant to join the workshop and the opportunity to network with their peers in the region. A call for applicants will be launched and selection criteria will include requirements regarding gender equality and new professionals’ involvement.

Project: IEA-Transforming LaNa Assessment results into relevant policy writing to improve policy interventions to facilitate policy interventions
Description: In 2023, six countries participated in LaNA, the IEA’s Literacy and Numeracy Assessment. Targeted to students at the end of primary school in LMICs, LaNA will deliver data including an indication of the percentage of students achieving minimum proficiency levels in reading and mathematics as means to monitor progress towards SDG 4.1.1.b. Country teams of most participating LaNA countries only have limited experiences in using data from international large-scale assessments for national policymaking; responding to this need, this proposal details further support in transforming assessment results into relevant policy writing in order to facilitate policy interventions in their countries.

Project: Underwater Forests
Description:
L'UNESCO (sous !'impulsion de la COi et de CPE) travaillent depuis plusieurs annees avec la fondation 1 Ocean (sous l'egide du CNRS), pilotee par le photographe - plongeur Alexis Rosenfeld, en vue de constituer une banque d'images et de videos susceptibles d'illustrer et de nourrir le discours scientifique de !'UNESCO sur l'Ocean:
•	Prevention des Tsunamis en Mediterranee
•	Protection de la biodiversite (Les Gorgones rouges)
•	Documentaire sur les grandes migrations marines
Ces images, de tres haute qualite, le plus souvent inedites, resonnent tres fortement avec plusieurs programmes de !'UNESCO (Education a !'Ocean, Programme des Biospheres, Patrimoine mondial Marin, COi). Elles ont deja permis d'assurer une belle visibilite de l'UNESCO, et une meilleure reconnaissance des actions de l'UNESCO dans le domaine oceanique, dans la presse et aupres du grand public. Elles peuvent renforcer la communication et la mise en valeur de nos activites en vue de la grande Conference de Nice en 2025.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.CPE1 - UNESCO's image enhanced and role recognized as a key solution provider for the 2030 Agenda in the Organization's areas of competence

Project: Restoration of Burle Marx Patios
Description:
As part of the 10 year Capital Master Plan, the renovation project of the Burle Marx Patios is considered critical. The technical diagnostic note revealed that the constant water leakage is damaging the structure of the building and needs to be addressed urgently. 

In addition, the artistic component of the restauration of the patios is being handled in close cooperation with Brazil and Morocco Permanent Delegations. 

And a larger fundraising campaign for the project has been initiated.

Project: Promoting sustainable tourism and private sector engagement for inclus
Description: The project addressed some of the immediate socio-economic impacts of COVID-19 on tourism and heritage, accelerating the recovery to protect livelihoods and transform the sectors to become more inclusive and sustainable. The project focused on engaging the tourism private sector to create incentives to boost competitiveness based on sustainable practices by providing training and capacity building for key stakeholders. It invested in cultural heritage preservation while creating short term job opportunities by utilizing culture and heritage as a source of resilience.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: Teacher Task Force - Knowledge creation, dissemination, and advocacy
Description:
The TTF is a global alliance of partners whose goal is to ensure that teachers and teaching remain at the top of the education agenda, to enable discussions and to mobilize governments and stakeholders for the advancement of teachers and quality learning. This project aims to ensure:
1) Knowledge gaps are identified and filled, and monitoring strengthened to ensure relevant and up-to-date knowledge on teachers and teaching is available to inform the formulation and implementation of comprehensive teacher policies 
2) The critical role of teachers and quality teaching is advocated for, and key messages are adopted and amplified by TTF members and beyond
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED5 - Teachers trained and supported to improve learning outcomes and address the changes brought forth by the digital and AI transformation and the COVID-19 crisis

Project: Strengthening GCED in Latin America and the Caribbean
Description: The proposed project focuses on developing policy objectives and providing guidance for curriculum development to expand Global Citizenship Education within the framework of target 4. The latter will include the generation of knowledge, tools and practices to mainstream those policy objectives and guidelines throughout in-service teacher preparation in two Central-American countries. By working collaboratively with the Ministries of Education and other key stakeholders, the project will establish a virtuous cycle to guide policymaking and support policy development in the field at a regional level.
Outcome EN: Outcome 7 - Promote inclusion and combat discrimination, hate speech and stereotypes
Output EN: 7.ED3 - Learners are empowered to lead healthy lives, promote sustainable development and engage with the world as creative and responsible global citizens

Project: PROJETS DE RENOVATION LES PLUS URGENTS AU SIEGE DE L’UNESCO A PARIS
Description:
Le manque de financement des rénovations importantes des bâtiments du Siège au cours des 20 dernières années a entraîné une augmentation des besoins d’entretien, la plupart des travaux devant être effectués en urgence. 
En application de la décision 215 EX/27 du Conseil exécutif, le Secrétariat a présenté au Comité du Siège, à sa 211e session, un Plan directeur actualisé dans lequel les projets  ont été classés par ordre de priorité et d’urgence, selon qu’il s’agit de remédier à des défauts structurels ou d’améliorer le fonctionnement de l’Organisation.
Quatre projets prioritaires cruciaux ont été présentés au Conseil exécutif à sa 216e session, dont l’un, relatif à la rénovation de salle de conférence XVI a obtenu un financement de 1 225 000€ au titre du compte spécial pour les investissements stratégiques et en équipements (CSI).  Le Conseil exécutif prend note de besoins de financement sur des autres projets prioritaires notamment la rénovation du bâtiment VI (Bonvin), la restauration des façades et toitures des bâtiments I et III, et la restauration des patios du bâtiment IV.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 11 - Accountable, efficient and effective management in pursuit of the Organization's results
Output EN: 11.OPS1 - Procurement and contracting function enhanced at HQ and in support of the field network and programme implementation facilities’ effective management and sustainable financing ensured

Project: Technical and financial assistance for the reconstruction of Muzibu-Az
Description:
The Tombs of Buganda Kings at Kasubi World Heritage property was added to the List of World Heritage in Danger in 2010 following a devastating fire at the Muzibu-Azaala-Mpanga, which housed the four tombs of the Buganda Kings and is considered an architectural masterpiece. 
This Japanese Funds-in-Trust project is offering Emergency Assistance to the State Party of Uganda and accompany them in rehabilitating the property in view of its removal from the List of World Heritage in Danger.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: Secondment from the Republic of Korea for BEAR II project- Ms Kim Hong
Description: UNESCO mobilized extra-budgetary funding from the Government of the Republic of Korea (ROK) to support five selected countries (Ethiopia, Kenya, Madagascar, Tanzania and Uganda) in the TVET sector through a phase II of the Better Education for Africa's Rise (BEAR). The project's time-frame is five years (2017-2022) and the overall envisioned budget is 10 million USD. Ms Kim Hongsun will work under the direct supervision of the YLS section chief to oversee BEAR II implementation, coordinate with UNESCO Nairobi office and provide backstopping to country projects coordinators.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED4 - Learners equipped with relevant skills to meet individual, labour market and societal demands through literacy, TVET, STEM and higher education

Project: Secondment of Ms. Heejeong Ahn to UNESCO Bangkok (Programme Specialist
Description: Under the overall authority of the Director of the UNESCO Asia-Pacific Regional Bureau for Education (UNESCO Bangkok) and under the direct supervision of the Chief of EISD, the Programme Specialist in Education contributes to the planning and implementation of EISD programme activities with a special focus on activities in higher education and support the Director of UNESCO Bangkok in implementing the Regional Bureau's Education Support Strategy and developing partnerships with education institutions and private sector.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED4 - Learners equipped with relevant skills to meet individual, labour market and societal demands through literacy, TVET, STEM and higher education

Project: Capacity-Building Ahead of the Third Cycle of Periodic Reporting in As
Description: This project supports States Parties in the region of Asia and the Pacific by organising five capacity-building workshops across the region, ahead of the Third Cycle of Periodic Reporting in the region (2020-21). These will ensure that National Focal Points for World Heritage are trained to take part in the exercise and master the core concepts of the 1972 Convention. Using a 'training of trainers' approach, this knowledge will be passed on to Site Managers across the region.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: IPBC Support
Description: This IPBC Support Project undertakes engagement, communication and coordination activities that support and contribute to the vision and goals of the International Partnership for Blue Carbon (IPBC). The IPBC connects governments, scientists and non-government agencies with the vision to protect, manage or restore blue Carbon (BC) ecosystems for climate change. The IPBC's desired outcome is for countries with significant BC to establish policies for the protection of BC and to be implementing management plans or restoration projects.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health an

Project: Regional Promotion of Equitable Education through Innovations (Phase 2
Description: Building on the outcomes of Phase 1, this project aims to promote and achieve equity in education for marginalized and disadvantaged children by 1) promoting relevant knowledge-sharing and exchange experiences at the regional and international levels; 2) maintaining and expanding the newly established Equitable Education Alliance (EEA) with more partners in both public and private sectors; 3) upgrading the EEA website with up-to-date resources, disseminating newsflash on equitable education, and regularly updating the database; and 4) developing an online course of equitable education with 10 key thematic modules and disseminating the contents on a learning management system.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED4 - Learners equipped with relevant skills to meet individual, labour market and societal demands through literacy, TVET, STEM and higher education

Project: IYIL2019
Description: The overall objective of the project is to implement the UNGA Resolution by raising awareness of critical loss of indigenous languages around the world and their role for sustainable development, peace building, good governance and reconciliation through organization of the International Year. The International Year is an important international cooperation mechanism dedicated to raising awareness of a particular theme of international interest or concern and mobilizing different players for coordinated action around the world.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CI1 - Member States have enhanced capacities to promote and protect linguistic diversity and multilingualism, including in the framework of the International Decade of Indigenous Languages 2022-2032

Project: ResiliArt Accelerator | Women's Creative Entrepreneurship in Zimbabwe
Description: Women in Zimbabwe with an existing creative business with a limited or informal capacity will join the ResiliArt Accelerator. The beneficiaries will receive customized online mentorship from African mentors and regular off-line sessions from a team of local coaches. The project innovatively responds to the existing knowledge and capacity gap in entrepreneurial skills and contribute to the formalization of creative businesses. The Accelerator programme concretely responds to the opinions expressed by thousands of stakeholders during the UNESCO ResiliArt movement.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT5 - Member States and civil society capacities strengthened to protect and promote the diversity of cultural expressions through dynamic and inclusive cultural and creative industries

Project: Global Media Defence Fund's Crisis Response Mechanism
Description: As part of the broader programme implemented under the Global Media Defence Fund (GMDF), UNESCO shall establish and administer an Crisis Response Mechanism (CRM) to provide time-sensitive emergency support to journalists and media in distress in countries experiencing unforeseen or sudden major crises affecting media community, with the aim of ensuring the immediate safety of media workers facing danger or threat as a direct result of their profession, with a focus on women journalists; as well as supporting the work of journalists and media outlets working on the ground to continue to safely and professionally report the news and avoid an information vacuum in crisis-affected countries.
Outcome EN: Outcome 6 - Promote freedom of expression and the right to information
Output EN: 6.CI2 - Member States have strengthened capacities and raised awareness to enhance norms and policies related to freedom of expression, press freedom, safety of journalists, including women journalists, and the right to access information, online and offl
Donor: United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland

Project: Community-based inventorying of living heritage in urban contexts
Description: To contribute to the overall reflection on safeguarding living heritage in urban contexts, this project will implement two pilot projects on community-based inventorying, a workshop summarizing the key findings and lessons learnt from the whole project and the project findings will also contribute to a position paper on living heritage and urban planning, developed by UNESCO. The Phase I of the project was implemented as part of the overall project 'Intangible heritage and creativity for sustainable cities'. Following the donor's request, this project is the continuation of Component 1 of the initial project and focuses only on living heritage in urban contexts.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT4 - Member States and communities capacities strengthened to identify, safeguard and promote living heritage
Donor: Yong Xin Hua Yun Cultural Industry Investment Co. Ltd.

Project: DTO-BioFlow: Integration of biodiversity monitoring data into the Digital Twin Ocean
Description: DTO-BioFlow will transform access to data on ocean biodiversity and the human activities that impact them, enabling the sustainable integration of these data flows into the EU Digital Twin Ocean, enriching digital tools and services thus unlocking the societal value of these data within the biological component of the DTO, i.e., the digital replica of marine ecological processes.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health an

Project: Regulating digital platforms to secure information as public good.
Description: UNESCO is organizing a conference to develop, through multistakeholder consultations, a model regulatory framework for the digital platforms to secure information as a public good. This project has the objective to support the development of the Global Conference and spark the debate on digital platforms regulations as to lead and follow up the development of a model regulatory framework for digital platforms to secure information as a public good.
Outcome EN: Outcome 6 - Promote freedom of expression and the right to information
Output EN: 6.CI2 - Member States have strengthened capacities and raised awareness to enhance norms and policies related to freedom of expression, press freedom, safety of journalists, including women journalists, and the right to access information, online and offl

Project: Meeting of the Scientific Council and Steering Committee of the UNESCO Regional Bureau for Science and Culture in Europe
Description: The Regional Bureau for Science and Culture in Europe (Venice) is unique in that it has two governing bodies to help monitor and plan the use of the voluntary annual contribution received from the Italian Government, as set out in Italian Law n.163 (1997). The Scientific Council provides advice on the design and implementation of the programme, while the Steering Committee provides oversight on both the programme and the budget. Both bodies should meet regularly once per year with additional meetings ad-hoc as needed to ensure the smooth functioning of the Office in Venice.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 11 - Accountable, efficient and effective management in pursuit of the Organization's results
Output EN: 11.FLD3 - Enhanced administrative and operational support by addressing existing and emerging needs

Project: Innovation Leading Digital Transformation of Higher Education for Better Quality and Equality
Description: The Project aims to contribute to the digital transformation of higher education, in alignment with the objectives of the 2030 Education Agenda, through invigorating the dialogue on ICTs in education and promoting open education and digital learning innovative solutions. A series of seminars and supporting materials will be held to foster international collaboration among higher education institutions and engage them in preparing a publication on digital transformation of higher education.
Outcome EN: Outcome 2 - Strengthen international coordination for the achievement of SDG 4 and develop the global education agenda based on research, foresight and innovation
Output EN: 2.ED9 - Education and learning reimagined through interdisciplinary research, foresight and public policy debate

Project: Malaysia-UNESCO Funds-in-Trust Programme Management and Coordination
Description: The Government of Malaysia and UNESCO have decided to establish the Malaysia-UNESCO FIT where the Government of Malaysia will provide the financial contribution for supporting the implementation, through UNESCO, of projects jointly selected under the "Malaysia-UNESCO Cooperation Programme" (MUCP). The MFIT Agreement covers all areas of competence of UNESCO and stimulates South-South cooperation, while building on Malaysian institutions and expertise. As such, this activity aims to support the management and coordination of the Malaysia-UNESCO Funds-in-Trust Programme.
Outcome EN: Outcome 7 - Promote inclusion and combat discrimination, hate speech and stereotypes
Output EN: 7.SHS1 - Member States capacities strengthened to advance effective social policies and practices, addressing the social impact of inequalities, climate transition and the digital transformation, and advise on effective policies to achieve inclusive devel

Project: International Assistance (2024-2025)
Description: "International Assistance" is the budget line approved by the World Heritage Committee under the World Heritage Fund for the period 2024-2025. It finances requests for assistance submitted by States Parties to the World Heritage Convention, in order to help them protect the cultural or natural heritage sites inscribed on the World Heritage List.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: The Preliminary Assessment is a mandatory desk-based process for all sites that may be nominated to the World Heritage List and is undertaken following a request by the relevant State(s) Party(ies). It provides States Parties with an opportunity for enhanced dialogue with the Advisory Bodies, and it helps to establish the feasibility of a potential nomination.
Description: The Preliminary Assessment is a mandatory desk-based process for all sites that may be nominated to the World Heritage List and is undertaken following a request by the relevant State(s) Party(ies). It provides States Parties with an opportunity for enhanced dialogue with the Advisory Bodies, and it helps to establish the feasibility of a potential nomination and avoid the use of resources in the preparation of nominations that may be unlikely to succeed. The current budget will fund the requests for Preliminary Assessment received as of September 2024 and deemed complete.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: Projet d'appui à l'amélioration d'une éducation de qualité des enfants rapatriés, retournés et déplacés internes des provinces de Cankuzo, Makamba, Rumonge, Rutana, Muyinga, Ruyigi
Description: Le projet vise à contribuer à la mise en œuvre du Plan de Réponse du MENRS et du programme d'appui à la continuité des apprentissages dans le cadre des urgences financé par le GPE. Il vise à assurer l'accès à une éducation de qualité inclusive et pertinente pour toutes les filles et garçons rapatriés, retournés et déplacés internes âgés de 3 à 18 ans dans les provinces de Cankuzo, Makamba, Rumonge, Rutana, Muyinga, Ruyigi. Il s'agit de créer un environnement d'apprentissage qui permettra à ces enfants de se réinsérer efficacement dans le système scolaire en consolidant leurs compétences pédagogiques.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED1 - Education systems equipped to promote inclusion, address marginalization and advance rights, including in crisis-affected and post-disaster contexts

Description: The purpose of the activity is to operationalize the global standards for Health Promoting Schools (HPS), through UNESCO technical assistance to Ministries of Education

Project: ReLISA - Restoring Landscapes in South Africa
Description: A consortium of 7 partner organisations, led by UNEP, will plan and implement the ReLISA project aiming at making the economic case for landscape-level restoration and create the conditions for a just transition of South Africa's land-use sector by restoring degraded key biomes (grasslands, savannas, thicket), while recognising the socio-cultural, economic and land tenure context; UNESCO will design and implement Work Package 5 related to ecosystem restoration in Biosphere Reserves through Payments for ecosystem services.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.SC1 - Inclusive knowledge and capacities of Member States strengthened to advance and apply science for sustainable management of natural resources, ecosystem and biodiversity conservation and restoration, and disaster risk resilience

Project: Strengthening tsunami early warning in the North-West Indian Ocean reg
Description: While a powerful earthquake in the Makran region could generate destructive tsunami capable of inundating coastlines within 20 minutes, most coastal communities in the region are still not prepared to respond effectively of a near-field tsunami threat. This is the phase-2 project following the achievement of Phase 1: enhancement of the scientific understanding of the MSZ and the strengthen national warning chains and SOP. Phase 2 aims to enhance the hazard and inundation mapping capabilities and strengthen capacities in tsunami evacuation planning in line with the near-field tsunamis threat for self-protection at the community level in India, Iran, Pakistan Oman and United Arab Emirates.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health an

Project: Strengthening Jamaica's resilience to food and water insecurity
Description: This Project aims to fill existing gaps in Jamaica's database and tools to inform the design of strategies and programs that assist populations affected by the food, water and financing crises, and strengthen the farming ecosystem. It will provide policy recommendation and identification of key interventions for rural development, integrated water management for food production, poverty and farmers' exodus mitigation. It will furnish elements to understand the socio-economic impacts of the crisis on vulnerable groups, namely women farmers. It will enhance existing Government of Jamaica sex-disaggregated data collection and methodology on water management.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.SC3 - SIDS empowered with strengthened capacities in UNESCO fields of expertise to better address their specific challenges

Project: Guiding and Supporting the Enhancement of Teacher Policies and Practices
Description: UNESCO Bangkok's Workplan for OP5 Regular Programme strategically focuses on two key components to advance UNESCO's pivotal role in teacher development across the Asia-Pacific region. The first component prioritizes evidence-based research and publications, with the goal of generating practical and implementable recommendations to enhance teacher policies and practices. Through a systematic exploration of diverse educational contexts, practices, and experiences throughout the region, the research aims to develop a profound understanding of the unique issues, challenges, and needs in different countries, laying the groundwork for targeted interventions. The second component involves the organisation of and active participation in a variety of advocacy events, most notably the World Teachers' Day celebration. These events serve as influential platforms to champion policies and practices that effectively contribute to the realization of SDG4, fostering meaningful international exchange and collaboration on various aspects related to teacher development.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED5 - Teachers trained and supported to improve learning outcomes and address the changes brought forth by the digital and AI transformation and the COVID-19 crisis

Project: Soutien au Comité de liaison ONG-UNESCO et engagement du réseau des ONG
Description: Conformément aux Directives concernant le partenariat de l’UNESCO avec les ONG, le Secrétariat soutiendra l’action du Comité de liaison ONG-UNESCO en vue d’amplifier l’impact et le rayonnement de ses initiatives, ainsi que la mobilisation et redynamisation du réseau des ONG en partenariat officiel avec l’UNESCO. Ceci inclut le 16e Forum international des ONG sur « Cultures durables » (Abidjan, avril 2024) et la Conférence internationale des ONG 2024 (Paris, décembre 2024), afin d’augmenter la participation des jeunes et la diversité géographique, de sorte que la Conférence soit plus inclusive, plus dynamique et plus diversifiée sur le plan géographique et générationnel.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.BSP2 - UNESCO’s partnerships and resource mobilization optimized and leveraged to strengthen the impact and visibility of the Organization’s programmes

Project: Ratification of Conventions and UNESCO Recommendation in Education: The Case of Malawi
Description: The project is aimed to raise awareness for Malawi to ratify the Conventions and UNESCO Recommendations. To achieve its objectives to raise awareness of the UNESCO Conventions to the education stakeholders in Malawi, to prepare the ratification or accession instrument for Malawi, and to deposit the ratification or accession instrument for Malawi to UNESCO. The project will carry out consultative meetings which will provide the opportunity for education stakeholders, legal experts and high-level officials to scrutinize the Conventions and weigh its implications to Malawi and their compatibility with Malawi’s laws and education aspirations, ultimately deposit its ratification instrument to UNESCO.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action

Project: Atelier de formation sur « Education aux Droits humains, à la citoyenneté, à la tolérance    et à la paix : que faire pour que cela devienne une réalité quotidienne. »
Description:
L'objectif général est d' outiller les enseignants en éducation aux droits humains, à la citoyenneté, à la tolérance et à la paix, pour permettre à l’école de jouer son rôle de formateur de citoyens responsables en:
- Renforçant les compétences des enseignants sur l’éducation aux droits humains, à la citoyenneté, à la tolérance et à la paix. 
- Réfléchissant sur les contenus pertinents et innovants de supports pédagogiques leur permettant de mieux enseigner les droits humains, la citoyenneté, la tolérance et la paix.
-Faisant un plaidoyer fort pour une prise en compte effective de l’éducation aux droits humains, à la citoyenneté, à la tolérance, à la paix, au genre et aux violences faites aux filles.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particul

Project: Séminaire sur « Jeunesse et migration irrégulière au Sénégal »
Description:
L’objectif général poursuivi à travers ce séminaire est de sensibiliser les jeunes sur les risques, de diagnostiquer les causes profondes de la migration irrégulière et de proposer des solutions pour stopper le fléau afin de lutter contre le phénomène.
•	Encourager et soutenir des initiatives de recherches sur les causes, les effets et les dynamiques de la migration.
•	Analyser les conséquences sociales, économiques et politiques de la migration pour les terroirs, la communauté en particulier la jeunesse et l’état central.
•	Examiner les politiques nationales et internationales liées à la migration.
•	Rechercher et mettre en œuvre des stratégies de sensibilisation des jeunes sur les questions migratoires.
•	Promouvoir dans les Médias et à l’école des récits, narratifs et informations vrais sur les migrations.
•	Créer des réseaux de partage d’expérience et de débats sur la migration.
•	Proposer des solutions pour la gestion efficace des flux migratoires.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particul

Project: Journées nationales d’animation pour la promotion des études scientifiques dans les écoles du réSEAU au Sénégal
Description:
L’objectif général de ces journées d’animation pour la promotion des études scientifiques dans les écoles du réSEAU au Sénégal  est de :
Contribuer à l’accroissement du nombre et des performances des élèves qui s’orientent vers les études scientifiques au Sénégal.
Il s’agit spécifiquement de :

•	Montrer l’importance des études scientifiques pour le développement industrielle et socioéconomique du pays.

•	Susciter l’ambition des élèves vers des métiers à connotation scientifiques.

•	 Identifier et Encourager les élèves de 4ème et 2nde de écoles cibles qui présentent les meilleures performances en Mathématiques, Physique-Chimie et Sciences de la Vie et de la Terre dans les écoles du réSEAU.

•	Echanger avec les responsables et acteurs des écoles du réSEAU national sur les modalités d’instaurer des récompenses annuelles aux élèves qui présentent les meilleures performances dans les disciplines scientifiques.

•	Partager les acquis de ces journées avec les communautés scolaires du réSEAU en Afrique et dans le monde.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particul

Project: UNLOCKYOUNG POTENTIAL FOR SUSTAINABLE DEVELOPMENT
Description:
The project is titled as ‘’unlock young potential for the sustainable development’’ which will be implemented in all six targeted zobas (administrative regions) by NUEYS in coordination with ministry of education. The main aim of the project is to lay conducive platform to turn promising ideas into practical social solutions and to give an opportunity to the young people with brilliant ideas through an innovative method to turn their ideas into reality. Therefore, the effects of the program will ignite the anticipated movement of encouraging entrepreneurship and stimulate young Eritreans to act on their dreams that helps their communities in the near future.
The main activities of the project are namely. exhibition, nationwide call for innovation projects, consultancy, equipping innovation center an additional activity will be providing startup budget to the best projects in order to attract youth to come up with brilliant ideas that can bring sustainable solution to the main problems of the community.it is also a plat form to cultivate inventive creative ideas among young people.
Formulation of innovation clubs will take place in all REGIONS. So as 18 clubs with 15-20 members in each club will be formulated. Further for enhancing and upgrading innovation ideas among young people competition will be organized during one-day exhibition time in all targeted zobas and the best ones will be awarded by the regional innovation committee. To this end, regional innovation committee (formulated by NUEYS in three zobas) will be in charge of all innovation activities in their respective regions. 
Innovation rooms (in existing youth centers will be equipped with different necessary materials including hand tools which can help young people to practice and a center for the development of models initiated by the youth.
Finally, the best three project will get financial support (start-up budget) to reach the desired level of production.

Project: Research and documentation of Eritrean Traditional music of Nara, Bdawyet and Tigrigna Ethnic Groups
Description:
Eritrean Traditional music is partly a living culture. Despite national efforts to promote
traditional music of all ethnic groups there is little organized information that is systematically
propagated through educational institutions and mass mediums. No publicationsof traditional
music produced by people of the profession exist. Thus,efforts on preservation and
dissemination of traditional music are ineffective. Asmara Music School is determined to
remedy this problem by imparting the knowledge and practical skills of traditional music to its
students. To do so, it is imperative for1AMS to undertake this project to acquire the
knowledge of traditional musical heritage to alleviate the shortcomings of teaching content
material in its curriculum.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action

Project: Formation des jeunes du Canton Bidyo aux techniques d’entretien, de réparation et de montage de forages manuels, électriques et solaires.
Description:
4. (a) Présentation succincte du projet
Il s’agit de doter le canton d’un corps de jeunes formés à intervenir à tout moment et partout où un forage manuel, à pompe électrique ou solaire tomberait en panne. Ce corps de techniciens pourrait également prévenir les pannes en assurant l’entretien et le suivi des forages dès leur réalisation. La formation d’une quarantaine des jeunes aux techniques d’entretien, de réparation, de forages manuels, à pompe électrique et solaire s’avère donc nécessaire pour assurer  la permanence de l’eau potable aux populations des villages du canton Bidyo bénéficiaires de ces ouvrages de production d’eau potable.

Le présent projet a pour but de renforcer les capacités de cette union de groupement Mourgan et donc de ses 72 membres par la formation aux techniques de maraichage, de  production et de transformation des fruits et légumes en grandes quantités pour les marchés des centres urbains de la région. Project: Campagne de sensibilisation sur les opportunités de la Réserve de Biosphère de Sena Oura à Pala au Mayo Kebbi
Description:
5.	 (a) Présentation succincte du projet
Grâce à une gouvernance ouverte entre la République du Tchad et l’UNESCO, la réserve de biosphère de Sena-Oura a été créée et est la première réserve de biosphère du Tchad. Elle couvre une surface totale de 173 520 ha constituant les derniers vestiges intacts de la savane soudanaise du pays et abrite des éléphants, des Elans de Derby et des girafes. Grâce à la profusion de terres fertiles et aux conditions agro climatiques favorables, l’agriculture traditionnelle et l’élevage du bétail en particulier assurent la subsistance de près de 90 % de la population. La sylviculture joue également un rôle important dans l’économie locale, avec la production de produits très prisés comme le miel et l’huile de karité.
Afin de reconnaître le rôle majeur que jouent les réserves de biosphère pour l’ensemble de la zone de Sena-Oura, l’Association des Jeunes pour l’Assainissement et la Protection de l’Environnement (AJAPE), une ONG nationale partenaire à l’UNESCO en collaboration avec le Ministère de l’Environnement, de la Pêche et du Développement Durable compte organiser des campagnes d’information et de sensibilisation, en faveur des populations (jeunes, femmes, chefs de village, chefs de canton, autorités locales…). La date précise de cette manifestation est programmée du 12 au 20 juin 2024 à Pala.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particul

Project: Projet de renforcement des capacités des radios communautaires des régions frontalières avec les pays en conflit (Soudan, Lybie, RCA, Bassin du Lac-Tchad)
Description:
(a) Présentation succincte du projet
Les radios communautaires jouent un rôle déterminant dans le maintien de la paix au Tchad. En effet, elles produisent et diffusent des émissions sur la paix et le vivre ensemble dans les différentes régions du pays, apportant ainsi une contribution importante à la lutte contre l’extrémisme violent et participant à la recherche des solutions pour une paix durable, notamment dans les régions en proie aux attaques de Boko-Haram ou dans les régions en crise.
Il se trouve malheureusement que ces médias qui sont généralement créés par des missionnaires ou des ONG nationales, sont pour certaines, gérés par les communautés elles-mêmes, parfois bénévolement et sans expérience technique. Ce sont souvent les jeunes sans emploi qui sont recrutés sans formation préalable.
C’est pourquoi, les défis auxquels ces radios sont confrontées sont généralement ceux de l’insuffisance de formation dans de nombreux domaines allant de la gestion d’une radio communautaire aux problèmes de maintenance des émetteurs ou de l’animation. Des radios communautaires des régions sensibles sont ainsi ciblées dans le cadre de ce projet.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particul

Project: Action citoyenne pour  la promotion de la culture de la paix et la cohabitation pacifique      dans la province du Guerra.
Description: Le présent projet est conçu pour mener des activités de lutte et de prévention des conflits intercommunautaires dans la province du Guéra. Les activités concernent la sensibilisation de masse, les formations des comités de gestion de conflits, la diffusion des messages de la cohabitation pacifique et du vivre ensemble à travers les antennes de radios pour toucher un grand public et un grand événement rassemblant beaucoup des gens sous forme de fête pour une communion entre les communautés vivant dans le Guéra. Ce qui permettra un développement socioéconomique de la Guéra et du Tchad en général. Le projet sera mis en œuvre dans tous les cinq départements que compte la province du Guera à savoir Abtouyour, Guera, Mangalmé, Bar Signakha et Garada. La durée du projet est six mois à compter du 1er mai au 31 octobre 2024 avec une enveloppe de 25 913 dollars.

Project: INTERVENTIONS TO PREVENT TEENAGE PREGNANCIES AND MITIGATE THE NEGATIVE EFFECTS ON GIRLS PRIMARY AND SECONDARY EDUCATION IN NAROK COUNTY, KENYA
Description:
The project will be carried out in Narok County among selected schools Learners (Girls and Boys), teachers, head teachers, local administrators, religious leaders, women and youth, through criteria that will be set out by the implementing team. The purpose of this project will be to prevent teenage pregnancy and mitigate its effects on girls primary and secondary education in Narok County. This is a key step towards reducing cases of early pregnancies and facilitating enrolment and completion rates of girls affected by teenage pregnancies in the County. 
The specific objectives include: building the capacity of teachers, parents and key stakeholders; enhance the exposure, knowledge and experiences of higher learning and career development opportunities ;create a learner friendly and supportive environment in schools to support girls at risk of early pregnancy; enhance the knowledge base and opportunities for harmonized support for the girls primary and secondary education in Narok County, Kenya. 
Main activities will entail: training teachers, Members of Parents association and opinion leaders in the Community on prevention of teenage pregnancies and mitigation the effects of the pregnancies; organizing an exposure trip for selected teachers and learners to the local university to facilitate expanded world view of the learners; establishing Family Units to facilitate mentorship, development of psychosocial competencies/life skills and homegrown solution to address factors leading to teenage pregnancies; organizing a meeting for actors on girls education in Narok County to enhance collaboration and  coordination. 
The expected outcome will be: increased awareness and capacity to prevent and address effects of teenage pregnancies on girls primary and secondary education hence enhance mitigation measures; increased motivation to  learn and complete schooling; enhanced capacity on mental health & psychosocial support , Guidance and Counselling, life skills, Value Based Education, mentorship, peer support and school- based  sustainable income generating activities; enhanced coordination among actors on prevention and management of teenage pregnancies  for girls  in primary and secondary education.
It is expected that there will be enhanced coordination among actors for girls’ education and mitigate the negative effects of issues that hinder girls primary and secondary education.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particul

Description: The United Nations Sustainable Goal 1, 2015, calls for the end of poverty in all forms. According to the World Bank Report (2023), the Kingdom of Eswatini has a population of around 1.2 million, with a per capita (Gross Domestic Product) GDP of $3,958. The poverty rate in Eswatini is estimated at 58.9% (2/3 being women); it is in this vein that a project of this nature has been incepted to empower women and girls so that they may self-sustain, alleviate poverty, and enhance social cohesion in their communities. The project will impart skills in material culture.

Project: Empowering Students as Hygiene and Menstrual Health Ambassadors
Description:
The project targets the void in hygiene and menstrual health (MH) in Eswatini. It addresses the gap in accessibility of MH services and an opportunity to improve the menstrual experiences and the various aspects of the lives of women and girls. It promotes access to hygiene information, resources, and support necessary for sustainable hygiene and MH practices resulting in: 
•	Improved knowledge and positive shifts in attitudes around hygiene and MH among 3000 students.
•	Increased access to sustainable menstrual products for 1500 girls  
•	Improved health outcomes in schools and communities through the adoption of proper hygiene practices. 
•	Increased confidence in discussing puberty and menstruation with others.

Project: Training Workshops on Gender Equality in Education - Second Phase
Description:
Provide a succinct summary, indicating key messages of the project (maximum of 100 words) 
During the 2022/23 biennium, UNESCO financed, through the Participation Programmes, the First Phase of the Training Programme on Gender Equality in Education at the provincial level covering the South and Center Zones of the Country, namely, Gaza and Tete provinces, respectively.  The training aimed to disseminate UNESCO's role in promoting Gender Equality in and through Education, as well as disseminating the advances made by the country in matters of Gender Equality based on the Report on the Gender Profile in Mozambique, an instrument produced with support from UNICEF which addresses the progress made in the country.
Using previous experiences, the NatCOM and the Ministry of Education and Human Development, through the Department of Cross – Cutting Affairs intend to expand the activity to the northern region of the country (Niassa province) and at the same time organize an event bringing together all stakeholders involved in gender matters at Central level (Ministerial level) to address the progress and challenges faced by the Education sector in achieving gender equality.

Description:
Le Burundi se prépare aux élections des législatives et des communales de juin 2025 et les présidentiels en 2027.
Pendant cette période les jeunes sont beaucoup plus sollicités, instrumentalisés et même manipulés par les chefs des partis politiques lors de la campagne électorale. A travers ce projet, nous voulons sensibiliser voir  conscientiser les chefs des partis politiques et les jeunes leaders affiliés aux différents partis politique et la société civile pour qu’ils s’inscrivent inlassablement à un climat sociopolitique apaisé, qui conforte la paix et la sécurité, qui consolide la démocratie et favorise la diversité et la stabilité politique du pays.

Project: SEMINAIRE DE SENSIBILISATION DES PARTIES PRENANTES DU PARC DES MANGROVES SUR LA GESTION ET LA CONSERVATION DES ECOSYSTEMES NATURELS
Description: Les mangroves jouent un rôle essentiel en tant que puits carbone atmosphérique et océanique pendant de longues périodes. Elles luttent contre l’érosion côtière. Cependant les écosystèmes forestiers de mangroves subissent quasiment partout dans le monde, des dégradations anthropiques de toutes sortes et diverses amplitudes. Le bois, principale ressource des mangroves des régions côtières d’Afrique, est fortement affecté par la croissance démographique urbaine de population. Raison pour laquelle, la Commission Nationale pour l’UNESCO compte organiser un Séminaire de Sensibilisation pour une bonne conservation et gestion des écosystèmes du Parc des Mangroves.

Project: Capacity Building on Curriculum for Tackling Cross-Cutting Issues for Green Learning and Climate Action
Description: In spite of the Ministry of Education (2023) reviewing the curriculum framework, teacher educators remain ill-prepared mainstreaming green learning for learners to tackle issues of national concern, e.g., climate change, environmental health and sustainable development. The Transforming Education Summit (2022) called for teaching to be transformed. It is proposed to conduct capacity development training to understand the alignment among macro level policies, curriculum frameworks, teacher education curriculum and school curriculum, and pedagogical practices at the micro level. Using three crosscutting issues as case examples, they will be supported to reimagine, design and implement model lesson and assessment portfolios for green learning and climate action.

Description:
Female journalists, like men, all over the world have contributed much to building up the society through the creation of well-informed society on different news and information. 

To create safe female journalists work environment, there is need to set up strategies for their protection. Rules and regulations for safeguarding women journalists should be advocated. This should go hand in hand with implementation of punishments in cases of their violation. 

This project unveils the existence of impunity and brutality among women journalist hence calling for the government’s efforts to minimize and eventually end all forms of oppression, harassment, neglection and any other kind of mistreatment that women journalists encounter.

Project: Sensitizing Participation of Girls from Less Privileged Areas of Tanzania in Science Technology Engineering and Mathematics (STEM) Education (in Specific the Mafia Island and around the Marine Park)
Description:
The project aims at conducting sensitization workshops in Mafia Island in Tanzania to attract young girls to opt for science subjects in order to increase girls’ participation in STEM education. The sensitization workshops will not only target girls but also parents, teachers, education administrators at local levels and the community at large.  

The workshop will provide opportunity for the participants to learn from others experiences especially those who have excelled in science world. The workshop will also discuss different barrier that can hinder participation of women and girls in STEM and the group will brainstorm and possible solution. The workshop will also demonstrate how STEM will promote Blue economy and ocean protection in the Island as we all know were in the decade of ocean science.

It is expected that the workshops will lead to positive attitudes among members of the community on the rights of girls including the right of girls to opt for science education

Project: Technological Inclusion: Teacher Training in the Use of Braille Printer in Special Education Schools in Luanda
Description:
Provide a succinct summary, indicating key messages of the project (maximum of 100 words)
In special schools in Angola, managing Braille-Printers presents challenges like limited training, technical issues, high costs, and accessing materials. Despite hurdles, Braille printers benefit by providing accessible learning materials, fostering independence, supporting inclusive education, and enhancing literacy skills for visually impaired students. Efforts to address these challenges and enhance access to resources can maximize Braille printers' potential in promoting inclusive education. A project in Luanda aims to promote technological inclusion by training teachers on Braille-Printers use, based on a prototype from INSTIC. The goal is to empower teachers to effectively use Braille-Printers, improving education for visually impaired students.

Project: NATIONAL PROFICIENCY TRAINING WORKSHOP FOR ADMINISTRATORS POLICY MAKERS, TEACHERS AND CAREGIVERS OF PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES
Description: The Project emphasizes the crucial role of education in societal development, particularly advocating for inclusive education that accommodates children with special needs. It highlights the challenges faced by such children in Nigeria and stresses the importance of teachers being properly equipped to implement inclusive education effectively. The Salamanca Framework for Action is referenced, promoting the idea that all children, regardless of differences, should have access to regular school programs. The article discusses the 2014 educational policy in Nigeria, emphasizing inclusive instruction for children with special needs. However, it points out the persistent challenges and proposes the workshop to address these issues.

Project: Entrepreneurship Empowering young men, girls and students to participate in entrepreneurship using communications and information technology in the modern era, and to contribute to achieving sustainable development goals.
Description:
Introduction
The United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) gives great attention to building a society of knowledge and information, inclusive of all, to achieve sustainable development, innovation and leadership in the use of communication and information technology for the purposes of education and entrepreneurship, and ensuring that everyone’s equal participation in the development of society is an essential factor in achieving: 
	The fourth goal of sustainable development, which is related to the quality of education, 
	The fifth goal, which considers gender equality, 
	The ninth goal, which relates to industry and innovation; by strengthening industry and innovation, new economic opportunities can be provided, and increase and speed of access to sources of information and technology can be available, which enhances economic development and contributes to protection of fundamental freedoms.
	The tenth goal, which relates to alleviating gaps in societies and between countries, 
	The seventeenth goal, which relates to partnerships to achieve the goals. 

This aims to enhance international cooperation and partnerships between the public and private sectors and civil society, to achieve the goals of sustainable development, including the protection of freedoms, and providing access to information for all. This is to enhance the capabilities of young people, achieve the principle of universal access to information, and provide opportunities for comprehensive, equitable quality education and lifelong learning for all, and for the different marginalized and vulnerable groups (women, girls, youth, and people with special needs).
The progress achieved in the field of communications and information technology and the increasing interconnectedness between the societies of knowledge will enhance work to advance innovation, entrepreneurship, renovation, and creating new job opportunities for youth, women, and girls to improve the standard of their living and income. Open resources programs of information and technology provide the opportunity to support and empower developing countries and all individuals and society. They also ensures social and economic inclusion for all, which contributes to achieving sustainable development goals and reducing the percentage of young people deprived of jobs, education or training opportunities.
The United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) has a major role in enhancing the effective contribution of women and girls in the field of using communication and information technology in the fields of education, science and culture. Due to people’s increasing reliance on digital technological means, the use of social media creates opportunities of work for young people, and at the same time creates great challenges. Opportunities that can be seized in this regard include social learning, innovation, knowledge exchange, democratic participation, and intercultural dialogue. One of the most important challenges that must be addressed is the spread of misinformation and widespread disinformation, which directly affects young people as the main users of the internet and social media globally.
Through this project, the Egyptian National Committee, as a link between the UNESCO and the concerned parties, will contribute to building an inclusive society of knowledge and information to achieve sustainable development by creating a specialized training package in entrepreneurship and making good use of modern technology and artificial intelligence tools to qualify young people for the labor market and increase their capabilities for compete globally.
Through this project, the Egyptian National Committee will provide partnerships and cooperation between:

1. Educational institutions and teachers who play an essential role in enhancing media and information literacy among learners and enabling them to acquire the necessary competencies to participate in the digital field as global citizens. It will take place at all levels of primary and secondary education, as well as in the field of adult learning.
2. Youth organizations, young people and especially young women; young people are the most active users of digital technologies, therefore it is necessary to ensure that they acquire the necessary digital competencies in the field of media and information literacy, and to ensure their ability to have effective entrepreneurship that enables them to create the desired impact to face the challenges related to the development of this field. So, the necessary measures will be taken to achieve the following:
•	Enabling young people to acquire competencies in the field of media, information literacy and digital competencies and using them as peer educators
•	Enhancing the capacity of youth-led organizations to integrate media and information literacy into their activities, policies and strategies through means that include encouraging intercultural dialogue to achieve understanding;
•	Supporting effective youth actions that enable young people to find the necessary solutions and play an active role as they are able to bring about the desired change in order to achieve social inclusion and combat all forms of exclusion, racism and discrimination in the digital field;
•	Assuring that young people’s use of digital technologies, and the impact of these means on them is part and parcel of comprehensive youth development approaches in youth policies;
•	Enhancing science-based youth organizations to have the desired impact in decision-making processes;
•	Relying on advances and developments in the field of neurotechnology to find solutions to serious mental health problems.

3. Media institutions and media workers; by establishing partnerships with digital communications platforms as principal actors to integrate media and information literacy in digital spaces.
Working with the above-mentioned groups, the necessary links will be created between them to put relevant tools on digital learning and guidelines on digital citizenship into practice. This is to cope with UNESCO’s endeavors to take gender equality into account as one of its main areas of focus, while recognizing the digital gap that exists between men and women, which prevents women and girls from benefiting from digital technology and participating in the digital field through engaging men and boys as responsible allies to advance gender equality in the digital sphere.
“71% of young people worldwide are connected to the Internet, compared to 57% of the total population.”
International Telecommunication Union.

https://www.itu.int/en/ITU-D/Statistics/Pages/facts/default.aspx (2022) 2 اليونيسف. ( ) https://www.unicef.org/media/123626/file/UNICEF_Recovering_Learning_Report_EN.pdf.pdf       2022
https://www.unesco.org/en/articles/scaling-digital-learning-and-skills-worlds-most-populous-countries-drive-education-recove
This will help the concerned authorities integrate in providing overall solutions for young people to confront economic conditions, and benefit from information, open source software, and modern artificial intelligence tools, and harness digital technological means to build peace and achieve sustainable development and build inclusive knowledge societies, through the use of open solutions (open educational resources, open access and open data);
This project enhances the contribution to the Information for All program and contributes to the endeavors aimed at achieving the two goals; universal access to information and inclusion of all in the digital era.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action

Project: Protection of Iraq's Cultural Heritage
Description:
The dramatic situation of cultural heritage in Iraq and its intentional destruction by armed groups reached an unprecedented degree and the state of deterioration of inaccessible cultural sites is very difficult to determine. This situation led to a growing phenomenon of illicit trafficking in Iraq and its neighbouring countries.
The project aims to monitor cultural sites and assess the damage incurred, mitigate the loss of cultural heritage through capacity building activities, fight illicit trafficking, raise awareness to the general public and coordinate with Italian entities which are active in Iraq's cultural heritage protection and documentation.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

-produire une série de ressources documentaires et audiovisuelles au profit des éducateurs de jeunesse. 
La somme de ces activités permettra la promotion et le renforcement de l’ECM en Algérie.

St. Kitts and Nevis is thus pursuing advanced negotiations with the Open University of Tanzania (OUT) to enable some 25 national teachers, lacking an undergraduate qualification, to gain access to the on-line bachelor’s degree programme delivered by the OUT, with courses provided remotely.

Project: Renforcement des Capacités pour Jeunes Chercheur(ses) Marocains Professionnels en Océanographie (Early  Career Ocean Professionals - ECOP Maroc)
Description:
A travers les missions de l’UNESCO et depuis le lancement de la Décennie des Nations unies pour les sciences océaniques au service du développement durable en 2021, un programme de réseau «Early Career Ocean Professional (ou ECOP) » a été créé pour responsabiliser les ECOP, qui s'identifient comme étant en début de carrière dans n'importe quel domaine lié à l'océan. 
Pour atteindre les objectifs du Développement Durable, ce programme est au cœur de la Décennie des Nations Unies pour les sciences océaniques au service du développement durable et il a été approuvé par la Décennie des Nations Unies sur l'océan en tant que programme de réseau en 2021. 
La vision de ce programme est d'élever et de renforcer les diverses perspectives des nouvelles générations de professionnels de l'océan à travers une voix collective, en garantissant que les connaissances soient transférées entre les professionnels expérimentés et les ECOP afin de promouvoir la durabilité des océans pour « l'océan que nous voulons ». 
La mission est d’intégrer de nouvelles façons de penser aux défis mondiaux en matière de durabilité et de gestion des océans. Cette mission est réalisée en offrant aux ECOP des opportunités significatives de réseautage et de développement professionnel entre elles et avec les institutions locales et mondiales dans le cadre de la Décennie des Nations Unies pour l'océan.
Messages clés du projet 

-	Renforcement des capacités des jeunes chercheur(se)s professionnels du réseau national ECOP – Maroc
-	Suivre les orientations du programme ECOP de la Décennie des Nations Unies des Sciences Océaniques au service du Développement Durable (2021-2030)
-	Mettre l’accent sur la recherche scientifique dans le domaine marin au niveau national  
-	Mettre l’accent sur l’éducation des Océans (ou “Ocean Litteracy”) pour les jeunes chercheur(se)s professionnels 
-	Appuyer les réseautages des jeunes chercheur(ses) nationaux avec ECOP au niveau mondial en general et ECOP-Afrique en particulier.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particul

Project: Le patrimoine culturel marocain dans le contexte de l'intelligence artificielle et l’approche identitaire africaine.
Description:
L’intelligence artificielle peut être une chance formidable pour accélérer la réalisation des objectifs de développement durable un potentiel énorme pour le bien l'humanité dans la paix et le développement. Les progrès technologiques rapides dans le domaine de l’Intelligence artificielle (IA), ainsi que d'autres avancées technologiques tels que la robotique, l’informatique en nuage et l'Internet des objets, transforment les disciplines, les économies et les industries, et remettent en question ce que signifie d’être humain.
Une nouvelle approche propose que cette sphère d’intelligence artificielle (IA) comprenne la préservation, l’échange et le partage du patrimoine culturel marocain, comme une « technoculture » visant à conserver notre identité africaine. 
L’exploitation des traces informatiques  à  l’action  culturelle en vue  d’identifier les sources  et les préparer comme données patrimoines pertinent sur lesquelles s’appuyé notre identité africaine en explorons l’intelligence artificielle pour permettre d’analyser les indicateurs de culture afin de  permettre la prévention et la préservation du patrimoine culturel marocain.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particul

Project: Renforcement des capacités des enfants en situation de précarité par le biais de : L’audiovisuel, du théâtre et de l’IA. Slogan : L’audiovisuel et l'art dramatique et L’IA  pour une éducation inclusive
Description:
L'intelligence artificielle (IA) ouvre de nouvelles perspectives pour renforcer les capacités des jeunes. Bien que l'IA promette des avancées significatives dans le domaine de l'éducation et de l'innovation pédagogique, elle suscite également des défis et des risques potentiels. 
Dans ce contexte, l'UNESCO s'engage à guider les États membres dans l'utilisation responsable et équitable des technologies d'IA, conformément à l'Agenda Éducation 2030 et aux principes d'inclusion et d'équité. 
Dans cet esprit, le présent dossier de projet explore le potentiel de l'IA, de l'audiovisuel et de l'art dramatique pour favoriser l'apprentissage et le développement des jeunes, tout en soulignant les questions cruciales liées à leur intégration dans les systèmes éducatifs.

Le projet "Renforcement des capacités des enfants en situation de précarité par le biais de l’audiovisuel, du théâtre et de l’IA" vise à offrir une plateforme d'apprentissage innovante et inclusive pour les enfants résidant dans des centres socio-éducatifs et fréquentant des écoles communautaires. 
À travers un programme de conférences et de cours de formation en audiovisuel, théâtre et intelligence artificiel,  nous cherchons à développer leurs compétences artistiques, leurs capacités cognitives, et à les sensibiliser aux applications positives de l'intelligence artificielle dans leur vie quotidienne.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particul

Project: Contribution à la sensibilisation sur l’eau, l’hygiène et l’assainissement dans les écoles
Description: En Haïti, de nombreuses écoles ne disposent pas d'un approvisionnement adéquat en eau potable ni d’installations sanitaires de base. Elles ne mettent non plus en œuvre des pratiques d'hygiène appropriées (UNICEF, 2017). De plus, des installations insalubres et non identifiées par genre ont été constatées dans certaines écoles ; ce qui pose des problèmes de sécurité pour les filles, constitue un facteur de propagation des maladies hydriques et peut entraîner absences ou abandons scolaires. Le présent projet entend contribuer à atténuer ces problèmes par la recherche, la formation et la sensibilisation dans les écoles.

Project: Caribbean Regional X-ray Science Toward Advancement Laboratory (CRXSTAL): A Regional Hub for X-ray Diffraction in the Caribbean
Description: A Caribbean Hub for X-ray Diffraction, CRXSTAL, will be established by acquiring a single-crystal diffractometer and launching a regional “science education for global goals program.” Under this program the region will host its inaugural crystallography training school and various workshops for primary and high schools, online and on-site. The facility will allow Caribbean scientists to collaborate and execute cutting-edge regional research, for example, the characterization of biologically active natural products and the development of new materials for energy-smart applications and environmental monitoring. CRXSTAL is a crucial resource/knowledge-sharing and capacity-building intervention toward a Caribbean STEM ecosystem, through cooperation, collaboration, and inclusion

Project: Reunión Nacional de la red de Escuelas Asociadas de la UNESCO
Description:
La Reunión Nacional de la red de Escuelas Asociadas de la UNESCO en México es un espacio de intercambio en el que las y los coordinadores de la red PEA puedan compartir sus experiencias y trabajo colaborativo en la difusión de los valores de la UNESCO, así como en sus líneas prioritarias de acción en materia de igualdad de género y formación de liderazgos juveniles.

Project: 20° Festival Internacional de Cine de los Derechos Humanos "El séptimo ojo es tuyo" - Bienal de cine invisible
Description:
El Centro de Gestión Cultural Pukañawi se fundó el 30 de octubre de 2004 para unir un centro de estudios, una productora audiovisual y un festival de cine para exhibir, enseñar, producir y archivar películas que defienden a la humanidad.

Pukañawi - ojo rojo en idioma quechua - simboliza la relación entre cine y derechos humanos, se formó en la recuperación por la democracia y en los procesos de comunicación con las comunidades de Potosí y Chuquisaca.

Antes de organizar el Festival Internacional de Cine de los Derechos Humanos "El séptimo ojo es tuyo" (FESTIMO), participó en la producción de la película "La Nación Clandestina" de Jorge Sanjinés, realizó "El Año 501" (1993), "El Anuncio de la Restauración" (2002), "Refundar el País" (2003), "Dos yotaleños en París" (2004), "El Espíritu de Tupaj Katari" (2006) y otros.

El FESTIMO invita a un jurado internacional para otorgar el Premio Pukañawi al ojo nacional, al ojo latinoamericano y al ojo internacional en las categorías corto, medio y largometraje.

Desde el 2007 inspira la celebración del Día del Cine Boliviano y hasta la fecha ha organizado 19 ediciones, ha exhibido más de 2500 películas, organizado cursos, exposiciones y ha llegado a 200 mil personas en distintas ciudades y comunidades.

Project: Improving Literacy and Numeracy at the Kindergarten Level
Description:
Division of Public Education’s focus is to strengthen the quality of the education that we offer to our students. In doing so, it is the intention to focus on the earlier age groups specifically the kindergarten year 1 and 2 classes. This is where formal education begins for most children entering the public schools, as most of the students who are enrolled in Public Education do not attend preschool (1-3 years).  Our kindergarten classes begin with the kindergarten 1- or the 4-year old’s and then the student moves on into the second year of kindergarten, or the 5- years old’s.  

The focus is to restructure the teaching instruction for this group. In doing, so it is essential to have the early childhood material which will allow the teachers to work more effectively with these students.  The expectation is not only to see that the students are academically ready, but to also see that they have developed socially and emotionally as well. Therefore, the early childhood materials purchased must be aligned with the learning standards and teaching objectives of our curriculum.  The materials should reflect diverse backgrounds, and the learning styles of students.  It is the belief that the students will be successful learners in the long run because a solid foundation for learning has been developed for these young children. 

Research shows that high-quality learning resources can boost student engagement, motivation, and comprehension.  Research also shows that if kindergarten children can explore while learning during play, it helps to stimulate their creativity and higher thinking skills.  They will not be passive learners but will be actively engaged in their daily learning activities. This is what we would like to achieve with our students. We are hoping that with this grant we can enhance our kindergarten classrooms and make them more conducive for learning.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particul

Description: Following the success of Phases I to III of the FiT project to preserve Koguryo-era tombs in the Democratic People' s Republic of Korea, this fourth phase will focus on scientific research and documentation on the tombs' mural paintings and emergency on-site conservation activities, along with training to further reinforce national capacities in the field of conservation.
