Project: International Coordinating Committee for the Safeguarding and Development of the Historic Sites of Angkor and Sambor Prei Kuk (ICC-Angkor/Sambor Prei Kuk)
Description: As follow-up of the decision of the First Intergovernmental Conference on Angkor, held in Tokyo in 1993, the working procedures of the Committee were established. It was decided that the ICC-Angkor would be co-chaired by France and Japan in collaboration with the APSARA National Authority, UNESCO provides the services of standing secretariat. The financial mechanism established on the initiative of Japan and France also foresaw that the cost of the ICC-Angkor meetings should be borne by these two countries and UNESCO. Respectively, since 2009, 2019, the APSARA and Sambor Prei Kuk National Authorities have also financially contributed to the ICC meetings. The Site of Sambor Prei Kuk, inscribed on the World Heritage List, was officially included in the mechanism of ICC-Angkor in 2019.

Project: Public Relations Project for Promoting Gender Equality among Hight School Youth in Bangkok, Thailand
Description:
Currently, the situation of gender equality in Thai society has been improving. However, challenges related to gender-based practices and sexual violence persist. Rapid dissemination of information through technological advancements exacerbates these issues. Media also significantly influences shaping thoughts and beliefs, potentially leading to biased expressions of gender-related behaviors/sexual practices, particularly cyberbullying. According to the Department of Mental Health, Thailand ranked second globally in cyberbullying in 2020, following Japan. Survey results indicate that over 91% of youth have experienced cyberbullying, with 43% considering retaliation, posing an increased risk of escalating issues.
Our project team has prior experience receiving funding from the Ministry of Social Development and Human Security, Thailand, to conduct activities promoting gender equality in 2023. To address and prevent future issues, it is essential to raise awareness and understanding of non-gender-based practices and promote gender equality among the youth in Bangkok. This includes respecting others' rights, knowing how to address problems, protecting mental and physical well-being, and being able to adapt and live happily in a collaborative society.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action

Project: Supporting documentary heritage preservation in Yemen
Description: In 2019, UNESCO conducted a regional survey on the state of documentary heritage in the Arab region, including a mapping of Yemen documentary heritage institutions. The survey registered more than 2 million items, demonstrating the richness and diversity of the documentary heritage being preserved in Yemen. Nevertheless, the ongoing conflict is highly impacting documentary preservation, with 68% of the responding institutions citing conflict as the primary risk to their collections. Despite the risks aforementioned, only 10% have a disaster and emergency preparedness response plan, and less have the proper equipment and trained staff to respond to emergencies, demonstrating a strong need for support. Building on the results of the regional study, UNESCO will actualize its mapping of Yemeni memory institutions and launch a comprehensive need assessment per governorate that will be the object of a publication on Yemeni documentary heritage. The need assessment will inform the development of a capacity building program and used to support resource mobilization. It will also allow the identification of nominations to the Memory of World registry. In parallel, UNESCO office to the Gulf States and Yemen will organize capacity building workshops focusing on Preventive conservation and Disaster Risk Management.
Outcome EN: Outcome 8 - Foster knowledge sharing and skills development in the digital age

Project: Supporting strengthening of the teaching force in Vietnam
Description:
The goal of this RP, in addition to what UNESCO Hanoi has already been implementing under other ongoing extrabudgetary projects, is to contribute to strengthening of the teaching force in Viet Nam, with the ultimate aim to achieve quality education for all. More specifically the objective is to support the process of the formulation of the new Law on Teachers of the country, which the Department of Teachers and Educational Administrators of the Ministry of Education and Training is tasked with. 

Planned activities to support include: translation and dissemination of UNESCO’s Teacher Policy Development Guide as a guiding reference; a literature review to collect and analyze selected international experiences as inputs for policy discussion and consultation; organization of a consultation workshop for relevant government officers and experts to discuss the above. Parallelly, the Ministry of Education and Training has also requested UNESCO to provide assistance to research related to and evaluation of gender impact as part of the preparation and implementation of the new Teacher Policy. This is being considered under another RP (Gender Equality).
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED5 - Teachers trained and supported to improve learning outcomes and address the changes brought forth by the digital and AI transformation and the COVID-19 crisis

Project: Preserving the Memory of World Inscription: Enhancing Access to the Rehabilitation Center Soeharso Archives – The Memory of The World of Asia Pacific Register
Description: The Rehabilitation Center Surakarta archive collection consists of information about the history of the first rehabilitation centers for people with disabilities in Asia and the Pacific. The archive contains realization of integrated rehabilitation programs involved by women as the initiator which in the 1958-1980 was hardly to be recorded in Indonesia. The records consist of textual (475 files), photographic (2157 sheets). Most of them are still undigitized. They carry a considerable risk of damage, considering that Indonesia has a tropical climate so that archival media in the form of paper will be very easily damaged due to its high acidity.

Project: Citizen Science on Natural Disaster: Raising Public Awareness through the Engagement of Vulnerable Groups into Inclusive Disaster Risk Reduction
Description: In the practice of citizen science, the way that physical, social, and digital infrastructures mediate citizen and communities to respond the natural disasters. As a consequence, reaching out these goals would have support poverty eradication and empowerment toward vulnerable groups on the disaster risk reduction context. Through this program, it will implement to the citizen science that targeted communities at large in natural disaster prone-areas, the management of citizen science through innovation and preparedness that targeted the youth as a force during the digital age in post natural disasters, and capacity building to bounce back better that targeted the vulnerable groups particilarly people who become physically disables in post natural disasters. The goals are to raise awareness of the types of citizen science on natural disaster and the activities that communities and others have engaged in, to provide guidance on how to design a project on citizen science on natural disaster and identify resources to support activities, and to facilitate partnership between various type of communities and other entities such as governments or research institutions, to carry out citizen science activities.

Project: Develop and enhance digital literacy of science, math, and multimedia technology educators in Timor-Leste through capacity building and comparative study.
Description: Information, communication, and technology (ICT) have impacted the global society on how to network and impact human life. However, for developing countries like Timor-Leste, there needs to be a gap in how to introduce and integrate it into the education system. They considered the importance of ICT in the education system and realized that capacity building for their educators and the facilities that help support the implementation process is essential. Therefore, the Timor-Leste National Commission for UNESCO (TLNCU) would like to collaborate with the SEAMEO STEM-ED in Thailand to get capacity building related to digital literacy in science and math. After that, TLNCU collaborates with the teacher's training institute in Timor-Leste (INFORDEPE) to train high school science, math, and multimedia teachers on applying and integrating technology in the teaching process. To introduce, create, and develop didactic materials that integrate with technology, TLNCU expects that at the end of 2024, six trainers will train by SEAMEO STEMED-ED and be able to conduct teacher training for 78 science and math teachers around 13 municipalities. So that, at the end of 2025, they can apply it to the students in their schools.

This is primarily due to harmful gender norms that prioritize education for boys and economic hardships that pressure families to prioritize domestic duties for girls. Project: Promoting Female Sanitation and Hygiene Awareness Through Radio Programs
Description:
The project aims to promote female sanitation and hygiene awareness in high schools in Liberia through radio programs. This initiative recognizes the importance of promoting good hygiene practices among young girls to improve their overall health and well-being. By utilizing radio programs, the project intends to reach a wide audience of high school students and educate them on proper sanitation and hygiene practices specifically tailored to the needs of adolescent girls. The content of the radio programs will cover topics such as menstrual hygiene management, hand washing, access to clean water, and the importance of maintaining good personal hygiene. Through engaging and informative radio broadcasts, the project seeks to empower young girls with the knowledge and skills necessary to adopt healthy hygiene habits that will promote their well-being. 
The project aims to address the critical issue of female sanitation and hygiene awareness in Liberia through targeted radio programs. Liberia faces challenges in promoting proper hygiene practices among females, leading to health issues according to the World Health Organization (WHO), United Nations Children’s Fund (UNICEF), and Liberia Ministry of Education give their expertise on public health, child welfare, and educational policies related to sanitation, hygiene, and adolescent health in Liberia. This project seeks to leverage the influential medium of radio to disseminate essential information and foster behavioral change regarding female sanitation and hygiene. However, the lack of adequate information on sanitation and hygiene practices among females poses significant health risks among young females in Liberia. In response, this project proposes the development and implementation of radio programs aimed at raising awareness and promoting better sanitation and hygiene practices among high school female students in Liberia.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particul

It seeks to assess the current landscape and satisfaction within the CCI sector, employing desk research, as well as quantitative and qualitative methods involving creative entrepreneurs. The findings will highlight key lessons, offer strategic recommendations for the sector's growth, and guide future financing and support mechanisms for CCI entrepreneurs. This analysis will assist the Ministry of Culture and Media of Montenegro in strategic planning for the enhancement of cultural and creative industries.

Project: Bridging Cultures: Education and Wellbeing for Ukrainian Refugees and local population through Art and Technology
Description:
The request is submitted in the context of the ongoing humanitarian crisis related to the armed conflict between the Russian Federation and Ukraine. According to UN data, more than 2.4 million people have already fled Ukraine in fear for their lives and the lives of their children to neighboring countries. According to Moldovan border control, more than 100,000 Ukrainian refugees are housed in the Republic of Moldova.

The National Commission requested US$25,522 for the project aiming to benefit the affected refugees. 60 adults and at least 120 children would benefit directly from the project, which should also have a positive impact on the host communities and families. The requested amount will be used for organizing artistic, cultural, and intercommunity activities, provide psychological support and emotional wellbeing to beneficiaries.

Project: Enhancing Vocational Education and Training (TVET) Through New Legislation for More Effective Refugee Integration in Armenia
Description:
The aim of the project is to support the implementation of the new VET Law’s provisions for

continuing VET specifically and to facilitate skills profiling and job matching to Sectoral

Qualifications frameworks, particularly in three sectors: ITC, Light Industry, and Construction.

The implementation of this project will be particularly beneficial in addressing the educational

needs of forcibly displaced refugees from Nagorno- Karabakh. The development of Sectoral

Qualifications frameworks and the enhancement of VET programs will create accessible

pathways for refugees to gain relevant skills and qualifications in high-demand sectors like

ICT, Light Industry, and Construction.

By providing structured vocational training aligned with industry standards, the project can help

refugees integrate into the local labor market more effectively. Moreover, the focus on modular

programs will allow for flexible learning paths, accommodating the diverse educational

backgrounds and experiences of refugee learners. This approach will not only support their

immediate employment prospects but also will contribute to their long-term socio-economic

integration.

Ces écoles menaient des activités qui favorisaient le brassage culturel, l’amitié, la fraternité, la tolérance entre les jeunes scolaires. Malheureusement, pour plusieurs raisons, ces réseaux ne sont plus actifs. On assiste aujourd’hui à la recrudescence des violences de tout genre. Project: PROMOTION OF GENDER RESPONSIVE AND DISABILITY INCLUSIVE EDUCATION THROUGH SPECIALISED PEDAGOGICAL SKILLS TRAINING FOR TEACHERS IN PRIMARY SCHOOLS
Description: The project has been designed to promote inclusive education where girls with disabilities are gaining the same level of quality education as boys with disabilities, and their non-disabled peers. This will include strengthening the gender responsive technical capacity of teachers in Primary Schools to promote gender responsive special needs and inclusive education. As we strive to achieve SDG 4 targets, approaches identified in the project include providing gender-responsive, inclusive education training for teachers, which addresses the intersectional needs of girls and boys with disabilities and includes instruction in gender-responsive, inclusive pedagogy, using support personnel, such as Centre Coordinating Tutors, senior women and male teachers and special needs education officials. These educators are responsible for supporting learners with disabilities and are often an integral part of delivering inclusive teaching in schools and ensuring children with disabilities can attend mainstream schools.  Working with existing community structures, families, and organizations of persons with disabilities to understand and address negative attitudes, beliefs, and practices around gender and disability and empower women and girls with disabilities to share and normalize their experiences. The intervention will promote gender-responsive pedagogy focused at leaners with special needs and such mechanism should be incorporated into any pedagogical reform initiatives in Schools to ensure that the needs of both female and male leaners with special needs are met and that they will benefit equally from improved teaching and learning practices.

Project: Enhancing the 21st Century Comprehensive Sexuality Education (CSE) knowledge and support to 12 years Basic Education students: Pilot project in Kamonyi, Nyagatare, Rubavu and Gicumbi
Description:
Project’s main overall objective 
To provide 12YBE adolescents and young people in Rwanda with an opportunity to learn more about themselves, their interests, strengths, family and personal values and the factors that influence their sexuality.

Project’s specific objectives and planned activities to achieve expected results.
1.	To reach out to 12YBE adolescents and young people and equip them with skills that help them become competent enough in the context of sex and youth reproductive health without compromising culture and religion in Rwanda. This will be done through awareness raising in terms of trainings, massive campaigns and using mass media and organizing youth competitions in writing poems and music dance and drama and sports activities. The project will also distribute pads to 300 most vulnerable girls from poor families.
2.	To equip teachers with skills and approaches that will help them tackle Comprehensive Sexuality Education (CSE) in their class. This will help student develop positive attitudes towards Boy-Girl relations and the youth will be able to cope with sex related challenges and dilemma. The Knowledge will also result in prevention of early pregnancies that many girls in Eastern and southern province have been victims of. This will be done through training teachers on CSE in schools where they have not been trained, providing monitoring tools to trained teachers to capture progress and documenting gaps and lesson learnt for future improvement. Provide IEC’s and printed curriculums to teachers who may not have received them.
3.	To ensure adolescent students and young people can freely talk about issues that affect their Sexual Reproductive Health and adopt ways and manners that help make informed decisions concerning Boy-Girl relations and sexuality. Group discussions, hands-on activities and competitions will involve them in deepening the problem and by doing so they will develop the required competences in the field of Comprehensive Sexuality Education (CSE). Trainings in form of group discussions will be given to more than 13,500 individuals. Trainees will be both teachers (60) and 12YBE students from 30 secondary schools. RWACHI is expecting to use different activities to achieve the project’s goal.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action

Project: Cultural Evolution: Empowering Community through Human Sciences and Sustainable Tourism
Description:
Project’s main overall objective
To create a platform that intertwines cultural heritage, human science, and sustainable tourism, fostering community engagement and economic empowerment in Musanze District.
Project’s specific objectives and planned activities to achieve expected results
Objective 1: Cultural Heritage documentation and Preservation Activities:
Conducting Comprehensive Cultural Heritage Surveys: The project will initiate comprehensive surveys within the local communities to meticulously document and preserve their rich cultural heritage. These surveys will encompass various elements, including traditions, folklore, rituals, traditional practices, indigenous knowledge, and customs unique to the community. Utilizing a participatory approach, the surveys will involve community members, elders, artisans, and local experts to gather in-depth information and personal narratives that capture the essence of the community's identity and heritage.
Workshops for community engagement: This includes conducting a series of interactive and educational workshops aimed at involving the local communities actively in the preservation and promotion of their cultural heritage. These workshops will serve as platforms for sharing knowledge, traditions, and stories among community members. Through hands-on activities, discussions, and presentations, participants will learn about the significance of their cultural heritage and ways to protect it for future generations.
Objective 2: Capacity building and Knowledge Sharing
Activities:
Training Sessions for Cultural Appreciation and Sustainable Tourism Practices: The project will conduct tailored training sessions aimed at enhancing the understanding of cultural appreciation and sustainable tourism practices among locals and stakeholders involved in the tourism industry. These sessions will offer insights into the importance of preserving cultural heritage, promoting tourism, and fostering positive interactions between tourists and local communities. By providing practical knowledge and tools, these sessions will empower participants to contribute effectively to sustainable tourism development while respecting cultural diversity.
Seminars for Knowledge Exchange: The project will organize seminars, inviting experts, community leaders, and stakeholders to share insights and experiences on culture, human science, and sustainable development. These events will serve as platforms for intellectual discussions, knowledge dissemination, and the exchange of innovative ideas. Through interactive sessions, participants will explore best practices, emerging trends, and strategies for leveraging cultural heritage in fostering social inclusion and sustainable growth.
Objective 3: Sustainable Tourism and Economic Development
Activities:
Development of Sustainable Tourism Initiatives: In collaboration with Red Rocks Initiative for
Sustainable	Development	(RRISD),	the	project	will	develop	innovative	sustainable	tourism initiatives. These initiatives will be designed to offer tourists authentic cultural experiences while concurrently generating economic opportunities for the local community. By focusing on cultural immersion and travel practices, these initiatives aim to attract visitors interested in experiencing the area's cultural heritage firsthand. Ikirenga Art and Culture Promotion will work closely with RRISD to identify and develop tourism activities that promote cultural understanding, preserve traditions, and contribute to the socio-economic development of the community.
Establishment of Market Linkages and Platforms: The project will create market linkages and platforms aimed at empowering local artisans, performers, and entrepreneurs within the community. These platforms will provide opportunities for these individuals to showcase their traditional crafts, artworks, performances, and entrepreneurial ventures to visiting tourists. By facilitating these connections, the project seeks to create a direct channel for artisans to market and sell their products, thereby enhancing their visibility, income, and sustainability.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particul

Project: Biodiversity Assessment of Mukura Biosphere Reserve Forest, Western Rwanda
Description:
Project’s main overall objective 

The overall objective of the study is to conduct the biodiversity assessment of Mukura biosphere reserve forest focussing on insects, birds, mammals, reptiles, amphibians, and aquatic biodiversity.  

Project’s specific objectives and planned activities to achieve expected results

The project will consist of assessing the biodiversity of Mukura biosphere reserve forest. Targeted groups of biodiversity are leaf-litter arthropods, butterflies, water macroinvertebrates, algae, birds, mammals, reptiles, plants, and amphibians. Data will be collected from the buffer and core zones and in the rivers located either in the buffer or in the core zones of the forest. Specific objectives consist of (1) sampling and identifying arthropods to the family level, and other taxa to species level. Sampled and identified biodiversity will be statistically analysed to assess (2) species richness and species diversity in the forest. Further, (3) data will be used to communicate the importance of the Mukura Forest as suitable habitat for biodiversity, and (4) a preliminary checklist of each group of biodiversity will be published to communicate the existing biodiversity in the area. Further, (5) specimens of great importance will be housed in the RNH and RZC. Furthermore, data will be recorded in the RBIS and made free accessible.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particul

Project: IAU- Promoting equitable and inclusive internationalization at universities in Africa
Description:
The project aims at promoting equitable and inclusive internationalization of higher education both in terms of knowledge and people, paying special attention to women (at all levels from Leadership to students). 
It will foster a revision of internationalization strategies and activities at two universities in Africa and will share such experiences and debate how to make internationalization more equitable and inclusive in a final conference with the academic communities of the two interested African countries and beyond.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particul

Project: ICSSPE-Stronger Together: Creating youth champions to transform communities through grassroots sport
Description: The project aims to enhance the leadership capabilities of young leaders to use grassroots sport as a tool to transform communities in Namibia, Zambia and South Africa. The project will immerse young and diverse leaders in a cross-cultural learning environment supported and mentored by international experts, empowering youth with the tools they need to harness the power of sport to transform communities. The project will strengthen the capabilities of young leaders in the intentional use of grassroots sport to connect and unite marginalised groups (particularly on women and girls, and people with disability), promote human rights, build social cohesion and promote cross-cultural understanding through sport.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particul

Project: IYCW-Meaningful Youth Engagement in Governance Structures of International Voluntary Service
Description: The goal of this project is to contribute to meaningful youth engagement, to enhance the respect for their participation in decision-making and to shape an inclusive and safe environment for them to engage. To address youth issues and needs across the different regions, members of the ICYE Youth Engagement Committee and local volunteers will participate in an in-person training where they will acquire the competences to encourage and promote youth engagement in different contexts, to engage in intergenerational and intercultural dialogue and to build their global citizenship. The results of the workshop will include a strategic plan for the Youth Engagement Committee as well as the development of practices that can ensure intergenerational succession, gender equality and socially sustainable development.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particul

Project: SMILO- La rencontre des petites îles SMILO
Description: SMILO organise du 13 au 18 octobre 2024 la Rencontre internationale des petites îles, sur l’île du Frioul, à Marseille (France). Environ 70 participants sont attendus de plus de quinze pays, des représentants d’îles, instituts de recherche et partenaires institutionnels impliqués dans la préservation de la nature et de la culture des îles. L’objectif est de partager des bonnes pratiques, en mettant l’accent sur la gestion des patrimoines, des déchets, la protection de la biodiversité, la co-création de solutions par le biais de l’intelligence collective, ainsi que l’organisation d’un échange sur le processus de labélisation « île durable ».
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particul

Project: URTI- Digitalisation de la Radio Publique en Afrique : enjeux, défis & feuille de route pour de rapides réalisations concrètes
Description:
La Radio en Afrique est toujours un média important pour l’information, la cohésion sociale, la diffusion culturelle, mais aussi, lors d’événements extrêmes - désastres naturels, mouvements sociaux, guerres - le seul contact avec les populations concernées. Et ce, dans les régions rurales, comme dans les centres urbains.

La révolution numérique touche aussi ce média si précieux. Mais tout à la transformation numérique de la télévision et des plateformes digitales, la radio est le parent pauvre, oublié des investisseurs. L’URTI propose une conférence qui mettra en lumière la numérisation de la radio numérique en Afrique et débouchera sur des propositions concrètes.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particul

Project: FMOI-Formation à l’hydrologie de quatre techniciens(ne)s en vue de la réalisation de projets de deux ONG au Burkina Faso
Description:
Le projet s’inscrit dans le cadre de l’action coordonnée du groupe d’ONGs en relations officielles avec l’UNESCO soutenant les projets de formation en hydrologie en Afrique, et que le Programme de Participation a soutenus lors des deux premières sessions en 2016-2017 et en 2018-2019. 
La FMOI soutient deux projets de terrain au Burkina Faso, portés par les ONG APESI et APS, qui ont chacun présenté deux candidats au stage de technicien hydrologue : Mme Sabine Coulibaly Ouarme, M. Marc Ouedraogo (APESI), M. Uriel Ouedraogo, M. Franck Kaboré (APS).
APESI a pour projet dans le village de Tanghin Dassouri (Kadiogo) mettre en place des systèmes d'irrigation et de pompage solaire avec Formation des acteurs locaux. APS a pour projet la formation responsables et population de 8 communes rurales (350 000 hb) de Passoré Nord et Centre sur 100 forages et pompes
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action

Description: This activity will involve providing day-to-day support to the coordination and monitoring of extrabudgetary-related Priority Africa activities, in close coordination with the team members of the Unit for Relations with African Member States, coordination and Partnerships.

Project: UNESCO Prize for Girls' and Women's Education
Description: The 'UNESCO Prize for girls' and women's education' was proposed by China, and adopted by 197EX/47 (Oct 2015). It was renewed for a second five- year cycle (2021 - 2025) at the 210Th Executive Board with continued support from China (see 210 EX/16.111). The Prize will be awarded annually to two prize winners who have made outstanding contributions in this field. The Prize, which consists of a monetary reward of US $50.000 for each of the two winners, will be given to individuals, institutions, other entities or non-governmental organizations actively engaged in identified priority areas. The Prize rewards in particular activities that are innovative and/or have a high impact.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED2 - Gender transformative education systems empower learners, ensure safe learning environments and address the educational barriers, particularly for girls and women, exacerbated by the learning crisis

Project: Ocean Decade Capacity Development Facility
Description: The proposed project is for an Ocean Decade Capacity Development Facility that will build on the unique strengths and expertise of IOC-UNESCO in terms of capacity development and provide a flexible and evolutive means of supporting the capacity development needs of individuals and institutions involved in the Ocean Decade. This will include support to actors wishing to engage in co-design of future Decade Actions, as well as support to proponents of existing Decade Actions who require support on targeted capacity development initiatives.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health an

Project: World Heritage online map platform
Description: The project aims to collect and create georeferenced maps for World Heritage in Europe and North America as a pilot region. This data will be uploaded on a newly developed online map platform, which will be embedded on the website of the UNESCO World Heritage Centre. Users will be able to access, visualize and analyze multiple layers of information related to World Heritage property boundaries and buffer zones. The platform will facilitate identifying factors affecting the Outstanding Universal Value of World Heritage properties and will assist States Parties to better protect properties on their territory.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: Strengthening Media Self-Regulatory Mechanisms in Timor Leste
Description: The project contributes to the strengthening of self-regulatory mechanisms of the media in Timor Leste and in the long term, foster an enabling environment for a sustainable, free, independent, and professional media in the country.
Outcome EN: Outcome 6 - Promote freedom of expression and the right to information
Output EN: 6.CI2 - Member States have strengthened capacities and raised awareness to enhance norms and policies related to freedom of expression, press freedom, safety of journalists, including women journalists, and the right to access information, online and offl

Project: France Secondment to the UN Ocean Decade Coordination Unit
Description: The objective of the proposed support is to contribute to the achievement of the Ocean Decade vision and mission with its ultimate aim of fostering sustainable and integrated ocean management across the global ocean. The Govt of France through this activity will second an expert to the IOC Secretariat to meet its responsibilities regarding the coordination of the Ocean Decade

Project: Science Outreach and Engagement for Sustainable Development in the fra
Description: The project will support the implementation of the UN Decade of Ocean Science for Sustainable Development (the Ocean Decade) which commenced implementation on 1 January 2021. The Ocean Decade is a UN-led global initiative that aims to convene diverse actors around the work to generate critical ocean science for sustainable development solutions. Structured around ten Ocean Decade Challenges it addresses issues ranging from marine pollution, ecosystem management, and climate change to ocean observations, ocean data management and capacity development.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health an

Project: Empowering Adolescent Girls and Young Women through Education in Mali
Description: UNESCO Office in Bamako in close collaboration with Ministries of Education; Health; Vocational training; and Women, children and family; and under the framework of UNESCO-UNFPA-UN Women Joint Programme for the Empowerment of Adolescent Girls and Young Women will implement a project entitled "Empowering adolescent girls and young women through education in Mali" to enhance access to quality and relevant education for adolescent girls and young women. The project will be implemented in three regions of Mali (Segou, Mopti and Tombouctou) as well as in the District of Bamako.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED2 - Gender transformative education systems empower learners, ensure safe learning environments and address the educational barriers, particularly for girls and women, exacerbated by the learning crisis

Project: Education Response to COVID-19 in Advancing the National Educational Broadcasting System to Ensure the Continuity of Learning in Basic Science Education for All in Timor-Leste
Description: As a post-project of Cycle 3 of Basic Education for Mathematics and Science in Timor-Leste (526TIM1000 from 14 February 2014 to 30 May, 2018) to support Timor-Leste Ministry of Education, Youth, and Sport (TL-MoEYS), this project supports Basic Education School-aged children during and post- COVID-19 for their continuity of learning Science through the National Educational Broadcasting System (EBS) enabling them to access to Free and Quality Education covering all 13 Districts across the country.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED4 - Learners equipped with relevant skills to meet individual, labour market and societal demands through literacy, TVET, STEM and higher education

Project: Preserving Petra's Nabataean architectural heritage through the study
Description: Building on former initiatives for the improved preservation and management of Petra's outstanding heritage, the project aims at ensuring the conservation of one of the most prominent rock-cut façades in Petra by responding to the need of developing local technical skills on heritage conservation and raising awareness among the local community. The project goal will be pursued through: 1) Implementation of a feasibility study to identify priority actions for the conservation of the Royal Tombs water management system, 2) Implementation of a conservation project on the Palace Tomb, 3) Capacity development of the national authorities and the local community on heritage conservation.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: Transforming Education Summit
Description: The purpose of this project is to support the engagement of children and young people before, during and after the Transforming Education Summit. Achieving the objectives of the Summit requires inclusive dialogues and meaningful engagement across the full set of stakeholders, particularly of children, students and young people. The process leading up to the Transforming Education Summit provides an opportunity to do so, building on existing initiatives to put young people in the driving seat for education, including the recently established SDG4Youth Network.
Outcome EN: Outcome 2 - Strengthen international coordination for the achievement of SDG 4 and develop the global education agenda based on research, foresight and innovation
Output EN: 2.ED7 - Education policy and finance decisions to achieve SDG 4 are informed by improved coordination, data and monitoring, knowledge and innovative partnerships

Project: Meetings with Advisory Bodies (2024-2025)
Description: "Meetings with Advisory Bodies" is the budget line voted by the World Heritage Committee under the World Heritage Fund for the period 2024-2025 to allow for coordination meetings between the UNESCO Secretariat of the World Heritage Convention and the Advisory Bodies to the World Heritage Committee (ICCROM, ICOMOS and IUCN). These meetings are crucial to the implementation of the World Heritage Convention as they allow those involved to work in synergy and deliver the best advice and documents in their respective fields of competence. These meetings are also the occasion to plan the work ahead, to anticipate issues and share the workload in the most effective manner.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: Leading global SDG4 coordination
Description: As the global lead for the SDG 4-Education 2030 agenda, UNESCO continues to coordinate the global and regional efforts to support Member States’ accelerated progress towards SDG 4. Working in close cooperation with Member States and partners, UNESCO draws on its convening power and technical expertise to strengthen advocacy around the centrality of education and its financing for sustainable development; foster greater alignment, cooperation and knowledge sharing; identify concrete acceleration strategies for upscaled impact; and monitor progress.
Outcome EN: Outcome 2 - Strengthen international coordination for the achievement of SDG 4 and develop the global education agenda based on research, foresight and innovation
Output EN: 2.ED7 - Education policy and finance decisions to achieve SDG 4 are informed by improved coordination, data and monitoring, knowledge and innovative partnerships

Project: UN partnerships
Description: By acting as the focal point for ocean sciences within the United Nations system, IOC will continue to engage in relevant United Nations inter-agency activities aimed at providing assistance to Member States in the implementation of 2030 Agenda, in accordance with IOC's custodianship role in relation to SDG 14, as well as the implementation of the Paris Agreement on Climate Change, the SAMOA Pathway, and Sendai Disaster Reduction Framework. This activity will also support the IOC role as coordinator for the UN Decade of Ocean Sciences for Sustainable Development

Project: Capacity development in Bioethics and Ethics of AI in the Arab region
Description: The activity aims to enhance national capacities to address emerging ethical issues on bioethics and AI by awareness raising, training of teachers, knowledge sharing and exploring policy responses through the National Bioethics Committees in the Arab region.
Outcome EN: Outcome 9 - Develop ethical standards, norms and frameworks for action to meet the challenges of innovative technologies and digital transformation
Output EN: 9.SHS5 - Member States’ capacities and policies strengthened to benefit from AI, gene-editing, neuro-technologies, quantum technologies and other frontier technologies, and to address the associated risks, including inequalities and discrimination, in line with international ethical standards, recommendations and frameworks

Project: Fostering preservation of and access to documentary heritage in Asia & Pacific
Description:
In its capacity as regional facilitator of the 2015 UNESCO Recommendation Concerning the Preservation of, and Access to, Documentary Heritage Including in Digital Form, UNESCO Bangkok CI unit will administer a capacity building programme to support digitization, sustainable conservation and public access to documentary collections in the Asia-Pacific region.

The RP programme will serve to increase the awareness and capacity of documentary heritage custodians to engage in the Memory of the World (MoW) Programme by supporting experience sharing and networking activities in the Asia-Pacific region and beyond.

To that end, the programme will engage with custodians of documentary heritage in Asia and the Pacific across multiple activities including information exchange, sharing of good practices across regions, training and networking.
Outcome EN: Outcome 8 - Foster knowledge sharing and skills development in the digital age
Output EN: 8.CI4 - Member States are enabled to foster universal access to information and knowledge, including through the Information for All Programme (IFAP), as well as through Open Solutions, and through the identification, preservation and accessibility of documentary heritage

Project: Upstream support (2022-2023)
Description: Funding for upstream support is for advice on identification of sites, Tentative Lists or nomination of sites for inscription on the World Heritage List. This funding is to be used for States Parties falling within the category of Least developed countries, Low-income and Lower middle income countries as well as Small Islands Developing States.

Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: Support to the nomination process
Description: The RP workplan will be affected to provide technical assistance and guidance to States Parties preparing tentative lists and nominations, to support the work relating to the revision of the nomination process, to support the reflection on sites associated with recent conflicts as well as to the implementation of the requests of Upstream Process received by States Parties.

Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: ICA-Thinking Digital in Archives: Capacity Building Workshop in Africa 2024
Description:
Since 2012, the ICA has been leading a Programme for Africa, including capacity building in the region and awareness raising activities. A survey launched in 2023 highlighted the strong need among the African Archival community for training in digitization and digital preservation. 

Based on this, the purpose of this proposal is to offer a five (5) days onsite workshop on digitization and digital preservation in a Francophone African country for French-speaking archival professionals. Participants will receive a full grant to join the workshop and the opportunity to network with their peers in the region. A call for applicants will be launched and selection criteria will include requirements regarding gender equality and new professionals’ involvement.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particularly in Africa, developing countries, LDCs, and SIDS

Project: Séminaire de vulgarisation de la convention Internationale de la Lutte contre le Dopage dans le sport en vue de la sensibilisation des jeunes sportifs sur les méfaits du dopage.
Description:
D’après plusieurs observations in situ, les jeunes sportifs congolais ne font pas de différence entre les produits dopants et les autres substances médicamenteuses. Beaucoup se livrent au dopage dès le jeune âge sans le savoir ni même être conscient des dangers encourus pour leur santé. Dans plusieurs fédérations est ignorée la liste des produits interdits figurant à l’Annexe I de la convention et renouvelée chaque année.  
  
 Le présent projet vise à faire connaitre davantage auprès des jeunes sportifs et leurs encadreurs, la Convention internationale de lutte contre le dopage dans le sport ainsi que ses instruments notamment son Annexe I, les sensibiliser et les mettre en garde contre les méfaits du dopage, afin de prévenir le dopage en milieu sportif jeune. Car beaucoup de sportifs ne sont pas conscients des répercutions des produits dopants dans l’organise, et leurs connaissances des procédures de contrôle repose beaucoup sur des rumeurs ou le récit d’expériences de professionnels plus anciens.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particul

Description: 9 départements sur 12 de la République du Congo ont été touchés par des inondations dues aux pluies diluviennes qui ont affecté plus de 336 560 ménages. De nombreux établissements scolaires, foyers et centres de santé ont été impactés.

Project: Training Workshops on Gender Equality in Education - Second Phase
Description:
Provide a succinct summary, indicating key messages of the project (maximum of 100 words) 
During the 2022/23 biennium, UNESCO financed, through the Participation Programmes, the First Phase of the Training Programme on Gender Equality in Education at the provincial level covering the South and Center Zones of the Country, namely, Gaza and Tete provinces, respectively.  The training aimed to disseminate UNESCO's role in promoting Gender Equality in and through Education, as well as disseminating the advances made by the country in matters of Gender Equality based on the Report on the Gender Profile in Mozambique, an instrument produced with support from UNICEF which addresses the progress made in the country.
Using previous experiences, the NatCOM and the Ministry of Education and Human Development, through the Department of Cross – Cutting Affairs intend to expand the activity to the northern region of the country (Niassa province) and at the same time organize an event bringing together all stakeholders involved in gender matters at Central level (Ministerial level) to address the progress and challenges faced by the Education sector in achieving gender equality.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particularly in Africa, developing countries, LDCs, and SIDS

Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action

Project: Collecte des données pour documenter et publier le patrimoine culturel et naturel  du Burundi
Description: Dans le domaine de l’enseignement de la culture du Burundi, il se pose un problème sérieux lié au manque de documents scientifiques de référence, riches et temporairement et spatialement représentatif. A travers ce projet, des données sur des thématiques clés et variées de la culture burundaise seront collectés à travers toutes les régions culturelles. Elles seront ensuite étudiées et analysées scientifiquement pour en extraire des articles et un document de référence guide dans lequel l’on puisera des données pour les enseignements scolaires et universitaire ainsi que pour la recherche. Il servira aussi de guide en matière de politique culturelle au Burundi.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particul

Project: Lutte contre les grossesses non désirées en milieu scolaire burundais
Description: Ce projet  vise la réduction du phénomène des grossesses non désirées  en milieu scolaire Burundais en vue d’atteindre l’objectif principal du gouvernement burundais en matière d’éducation: « Zéro grossesses non désirées en milieu scolaire en 2030 ». Constatant  que les  grossesses précoces et non désirées  constituent un facteur limitant des effectifs des jeunes filles pour poursuivre leurs études, la Commission Nationale du Burundi pour l’UNESCO souhaite organiser un atelier à l’endroit des jeunes/adolescents  scolarisés et d’autres personnalités ayant un rôle dans l’éducation de ces dernières  pour réduire ce phénomène. Cela permettrait de  garantir l’éducation des garçons et des filles aux mêmes pieds d’égalité  en matière d’autonomisation tels que prôné par l’UNESCO
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particul

Project: Formation et accompagnement des Encadreurs des clubs UNESCO existants dans les écoles du Burundi sur les valeurs de l’UNESCO et la règlementation des clubs UNESCO
Description: En vue d’éduquer la jeunesse  burundaise aux valeurs de la paix de l’UNESCO et du Burundi (Ubuntu, la tolérance, le genre, la démocratie, la bonne gouvernance, les droits humains, …) et la préparer pour être le gestionnaire politique de demain pour la stabilité nationale et sous régionale, la Commission Nationale du Burundi pour l’UNESCO aimerait étendre les clubs UNESCO dans 1000 écoles et universités pour leur inculquer ces valeurs. C’est dans cette optique que des supports pédagogiques de formation de ces valeurs fondamentales seront conçus et mis à la disposition de ces institutions.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action

Project: Elaboration d’une politique normative et de la loi sur l'orthographe du Kirundi
Description: L’urgence du Projet est justifiée part le multilinguisme qui augmente les interférences linguistiques en Kirundi  à un rythme préoccupant et par l’absence d’une loi portant orthographe de Kirundi, ce qui cause de nombreuses difficultés aux enseignants du Kirundi, aux écrivains et usagers de la langue nationale. C’est dans le cadre de la promotion et sauvegarde de la langue maternelle que le Secrétariat Exécutif Permanent de l’académie Rundi a souhaité la mise place d’une politique normative du Kirundi par l’élaboration d’une loi portant orthographe du kirundi.

Project: Appui aux activités des femmes maraichères de la ville-Province de Kinshasa en vue de renforcer leur autonomisation et de contribuer à la lutte contre les effets du changement climatique
Description:
La plupart des catastrophes naturelles sont dues aux effets des changements climatiques qui occasionnent beaucoup de ravages à travers le monde. C’est le cas de la République Démocratique du Congo où la ville de Kinshasa et d’autres sites, ont été frappées par des inondations dues à une crue exceptionnelle du Fleuve Congo. Ces inondations ont touché plusieurs groupes-cibles dont celui des femmes maraîchères qui vivent aujourd’hui dans la précarité et le désespoir et sont presque livrées à elles-mêmes.

Le présent projet est destiné à renforcer leurs capacités opérationnelles en les dotant de petits matériels agricoles et des intrants et en leur permettant ainsi de reprendre leurs activités qui contribuent non seulement à leur propre autonomisation et à la survie de leurs familles mais alimentent aussi la mégapole Kinshasa en légumes.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action

Project: REINSERTION SOCIO-PROFESSIONNELLE DES ENFANTS DESCOLARISES ET/OU NON SCOLARISES ŒUVRANT DANS LES MINES DE DIAMANT : CAS DE TSHIKAPA DANS LA PROVINCE DU KASAÏ EN REPUBLIQUE DEMOCRATIQUE DU CONGO
Description:
Ces dernières décennies, l’humanité entière est confrontée à des défis nouveaux parmi lesquels figure le travail des enfants mineurs.
Le présent Projet vise à la réinsertion socio-professionnelle des enfants déscolarisés et/ou non scolarisés œuvrant dans les mines de diamant à Tshikapa dans la province du Kasaï en République Démocratique du Congo.
Face à cette situation il sera question d’assurer leur  formation par des petits métiers tels que : la cordonnerie, menuiserie, maçonnerie et petit élevage.

Project: Protecting Kafue Lechwe and Human Health: Addressing Contamination of Natural Water Sources in the Kafue Flats Biosphere Reserve
Description: The Kafue Flats Biosphere Reserve faces a critical threat: contaminated water sources endanger the iconic Kafue Lechwe antelope, leading to increased mortality, reduced reproduction, and negative impacts on tourism and local communities. Open defecation and poor sanitation in fishing camps are the root causes. This project aims to address this through a One Health Approach of key stakeholders for awareness raising, planning and capacity building for monitoring water quality using citizen science or other participatory environmental monitoring approaches. This collaborative effort will safeguard the Kafue Lechwe population, improve human health outcomes, and enhance the sustainability of the biosphere reserve.

Project: Capacity Building Mazabuka and Chikankata Communities in Climate Change Resilient Practices through Radio
Description: Using Radio as the main channel of information dissemination, the project aims at building the capacity of Mazabuka and Chikankata rural communities in climate in Climate Change Resilient Practices. Its target women, men and youths involved in charcoal burning. The project shall sensitise them on the linkages of climate change, environment and charcoal burning and provide them with skills in eco-friendly income generating activities. Various activities ranging from workshops to series of radio programmes and jingles on the effects of charcoal burning and climate change, targeting not only the charcoal burners but also the general public will be conducted.

Project: Promouvoir la culture de l’anticipation avec les communautés scolaire et universitaire de la ville de Bouaké par l’éducation prospective
Description:
Il est courant d’entendre les gouvernants dire que l’avenir des Etats appartient à la jeunesse. Cette réalité est encore plus vivante en Afrique où la jeunesse représente, selon de nombreuses recherches menées sur le dividende démographique, environ 60 % de la population totale du continent (PNUD, 2023). De ce fait, l’Afrique est un continent avec une population essentiellement jeune qui pourrait stimuler le développement économique. Elle est la principale force active et éduquée de la population. Et pourtant, cette jeunesse se trouve plutôt apeurée par son avenir en raison des tendances actuelles qui n’augurent point d’un futur radieux. Si cette situation a des facteurs explicatifs liés à l’efficacité des politiques publiques dédiées à la jeunesse, elle est aussi liée au fait que cette jeunesse ne dispose pas toujours des rudiments nécessaires pour explorer son avenir, le lire et se projeter raisonnablement dans le futur souhaité. Cet état de fait a pour incidence, tant à l’échelle personnelle que nationale, d’empêcher, d’inhiber voire de détruire le potentiel d’innovation et d’imagination de cette jeunesse qui est censée être au cœur du développement des nations. Dans la ville de Bouaké, en Côte d’Ivoire, cette situation est d’actualité et soutenue par un taux d’analphabétisme estimé à 43% (Mairie de Bouaké, 2023) et 54,9% de taux de chômage (INS, ENV 2015). 

En vue de créer donc un cadre exploratoire de compréhension du futur, la Chaire UNESCO Anticipation, Prospective et Territoires Durables de l’Université Alassane OUATTARA initie le projet « Promouvoir la culture de l’anticipation avec les communautés scolaire et universitaire de la ville de Bouaké par l’éducation prospective» dans le but d’expérimenter l’éducation prospective dans les établissements scolaires et universitaires de la ville de Bouaké afin de promouvoir la culture de l’anticipation auprès de la jeunesse pour la rendre plus créatrice et prospective. Ce projet s’inscrit dans le cadre de l’ODD 4 « Education de qualité » visant à faire en sorte que tous puissent suivre une éducation de qualité dans des conditions d’équité et promouvoir les opportunités d’apprentissage tout au long de la vie.  

Pour des sociétés résilientes et inclusives, il convient de mettre les outils de la prospective à la disposition de tous. Ce projet vise à démocratiser la prospective de sorte à amener les communautés scolaire et universitaire à être lettré du futur en réactivant en elles le pouvoir de l’imagination dans ces moments d’incertitudes. Il ne s’agit plus de faire de la prospective une chasse gardée de l’élite là où l’urgence bat son plein au sein des communautés. Il s’agit de susciter une mobilisation collective pour une meilleure inclusivité de la prospective en préparant les esprits aux changements. Ce projet entend faire de l’imagination, un puissant outil de co-construction et de mobilisation collective des avenirs des communautés scolaire et universitaire de Bouaké.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particularly in Africa, developing countries, LDCs, and SIDS

Project: CONTRIBUTION A LA PRESERTVATION DE LA FORET MÔBLÔ TCHETCHE DE GUIBOUO DANS LE DEPARTEMENT GAGNOA
Description: Une forêt de 30 ha située dans le terroir du village de Guibouo, Département de Gagnoa a été identifiée par les populations et dédiée à l’UNESCO. Cette forêt constitue le seul site de conservation de la biodiversité dans le terroir du village. Au cours d’une visite sur le terrain, il a été remarqué que ce site est en proie à toutes formes de braconnage et de plusieurs intrusions dans ses limites. Il est donc urgent de trouver une approche participative et des stratégies appropriées à la gestion durable de ce site

Project: Projet de promotion d’une société égalitaire par l’éducation et la formation de la jeune fille en vue de son autonomisation
Description:
Ce projet vise à asseoir l’autonomisation de la jeune fille à travers la promotion de l’égalité des genres qui ne va pas sans prôner le principe de l’égalité des chances homme-femme. 

Pour ce faire, il y a lieu de juguler les disparités de genre qui touchent particulièrement l’analphabétisme, la vulnérabilité et la discrimination de la jeune fille. Ce sont les défis visés par l’Organisation porteuse de ce projet. Ainsi il est à distinguer deux groupes de jeunes filles qui méritent un accompagnement : celles dites vulnérables car analphabètes ou déscolarisés ; et celles qui sont scolarisées mais limités à des filières dites « féminines », donc peu représentées dans les domaines scientifiques.

Project: A TWO-DAY NATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PEACE EDUCATION AND CULTURAL REORIENTATION AS A PANACEA TO CURBING VIOLENCE IN NIGERIA
Description:
The need for the programme is rooted in the profound socio-cultural and political challenges facing Nigerian communities. As Nigeria grapples with recurring cycles of conflict and violence, it is essential to address the underlying causes and promote sustainable solutions that contribute to lasting peace. 
The programme acknowledges the imperative of addressing the root causes of conflict; instil values of tolerance and empathy; promote social cohesion and fostering inclusive societies; create platforms for dialogue, mutual understanding, and reconciliation among diverse groups; counter divisive narratives, stereotypes, and prejudices, thereby creating an enabling environment for intercultural exchange, and harmonious coexistence within Nigeria Communities.

Project: NATIONAL PROFICIENCY TRAINING WORKSHOP FOR ADMINISTRATORS POLICY MAKERS, TEACHERS AND CAREGIVERS OF PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES
Description: The Project emphasizes the crucial role of education in societal development, particularly advocating for inclusive education that accommodates children with special needs. It highlights the challenges faced by such children in Nigeria and stresses the importance of teachers being properly equipped to implement inclusive education effectively. The Salamanca Framework for Action is referenced, promoting the idea that all children, regardless of differences, should have access to regular school programs. The article discusses the 2014 educational policy in Nigeria, emphasizing inclusive instruction for children with special needs. However, it points out the persistent challenges and proposes the workshop to address these issues.

Project: World Space Day Celebration Week
Description:
World Space Week has been officially declared by the United Nations as the annual week from 4 to 10 October. It is an international celebration of the contribution of space science and technology to improving the human condition. The dates that mark World Space Week commemorate landmark events of the space age: on 4 October 1957, Sputnik I, the first man-made Earth satellite, was launched. The Treaty on the Peaceful Exploration of Outer Space was signed by UN member states on 10 October 1967.
The celebration of World Space Week is an excellent opportunity to highlight the achievements and potential of space exploration on a global level. World Space Week usually takes place in October and involves a variety of activities, including talks, workshops, exhibitions, competitions and much more.
On 4 October 1957, the launch into outer space of the first man-made Earth satellite, Sputnik 1, paved the way for space exploration. A decade later, on 10 October 1967, the Treaty on the Principles Governing the Activities of States in the Exploration and Use of Outer Space, including the Moon and Other Celestial Bodies entered into force.
Space science and technology and their applications are increasingly being used to support a wide range of United Nations activities. At least 25 United Nations entities and the World Bank Group routinely use space applications. They make important and sometimes essential contributions to the work of the United Nations, including in implementing the recommendations of major world conferences and the Third United Nations Conference on the Exploration and Peaceful Uses of Outer Space (UNISPACE III), as well as in supporting sustainable development.
Since the dawn of the Space Age, the United Nations has recognised that outer space has added a new dimension to humanity's existence. The United Nations family continually strives to utilise the unique benefits of outer space for the betterment of all humanity.
Recognising humanity's common interest in outer space and seeking to answer questions about how outer space can help benefit the peoples of the Earth, the General Assembly adopted its first resolution related to outer space, resolution 1348 (XIII) entitled "Question of the Peaceful Uses of Outer Space".
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action

Project: Zero violence and no bullying" project with awareness campaigns and school sports
Description:
The human mind is a complex system of interacting processes that generate, encode, transform, and manipulate information of various kinds. According to Almeida (1988), reasoning is associated with concepts such as intelligence, problem solving, and comprehension/thinking. It can be considered a cognitive valence, especially when approached in the discovery of relationships, comparison of elements and choice of alternatives among the answers.

In a game of chess, the use of reasoning is paramount to make well-defined moves. Vygotsky (1998) states that, "although in the game of chess there is no direct substitution for real-life relations, it is undoubtedly a type of imaginary situation". By learning chess, the student would be developing socially available skills and knowledge, being able to contribute to their self-esteem, that is, without understanding there is no understanding and without understanding there is no learning. 

It should be noted that the game of chess is a form of playful-educational entertainment capable of developing in children and young people the ability to concentrate, memory, judgment, imagination, anticipation, will win, patience, self-control, decision-making, mathematical logic, creativity and intelligence. 

The actions were elaborated in a collaborative and inclusive perspective, which constitute one of the typical principles of UNESCO and by their nature can be an important option to ensure the integration of school activities in times of social isolation and can be used as a way to form values such as respect for differences, non-discrimination and bullying, the reduction of school dropouts and the identification of talents.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particularly in Africa, developing countries, LDCs, and SIDS

Project: TWo-SuPRA - Training Women Teachers As Sustainable Renewable Energy Systems Promoting Agents In Rural Areas
Description:
This project aims to create a course to specifically train female primary/secondary school teachers in Renewable Energy, so that they can act as agents for promoting these technologies among students and local rural communities.

The course aims to provide trainees with in-depth knowledge, systemic, and strategic vision of the area, reinforcing their ability to lead change.

The trainees will contribute to the education of their students, parents, and other citizens. The course will enable the development of competencies, skills, and attitudes, through the use of diverse pedagogical practices, including theoretical classes, laboratory, and field practices, and extension activities.

Project: 6th National Meeting of Schools Associated with UNESCO "Education for Development: Sustainability at School"
Description:
The world today lacks committed people who contribute to the well-being of all and the achievement of sustainable development. This change can be driven by education, as it sensitizes, raises awareness, and shapes behaviours.

The pursuit of sustainable development requires the involvement of school managers, teachers, and families for the materialization of the SDGs and, especially, in the exercise of the right to quality education. It should be noted that Education for Sustainable Development (ESD) is recognized in the SDGs of the UN 2030 Agenda as part of target 4.7 of SDG 4, when it expresses that by 2030: 

ensure that all students acquire the knowledge and skills necessary to promote sustainable development, including but not limited to through education for sustainable development and sustainable lifestyles, human rights, gender equality, promotion of a culture of peace and non-violence, global citizenship, and appreciation of cultural diversity and culture's contribution to sustainable development." (UNITED NATIONS, 2015).

In Angola, the regulations that govern the Education and Teaching System, within its purposes, guarantee "To train an individual capable of understanding national, regional and international problems in a critical, constructive and innovative way for their active participation in society, (...)", (LBSEE, 17/16, article no. 4, paragraph c), which demonstrates the social responsibility and commitment that Educational Institutions have with the development of current and future generations.

Under the motto "The future begins with education" and the central theme "Education for sustainable development at school (Target 4.7)", the 6th National Meeting of Schools Associated with UNESCO will be held from 4 to 5 October, whose general objective is to provide education agents with theoretical assumptions about Education for Sustainable Development.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action

Description: L’objectif de ce projet est de permettre une inclusion de tous et le partage des savoirs sur tout le territoire national. Il propose de bâtir un prototype de plateforme digitale d’enseignement à distance dédiée au partage de contenus éducatifs entre des enseignants et leurs élèves, l'objectif à terme étant de couvrir l’ensemble du territoire national. Celle-ci est pensée pour s’adapter au niveau de l’apprenant, à ses possibilités de temps d’apprentissage, à son rythme tout en restant simple et conviviale. L’e-VOD est notamment l’une des composantes principales afin d’apprendre selon son emploi du temps et son niveau tout en permettant à l’apprenant de poser ses questions au professeur qui a conçu son cours en vidéo.

Project: Enhancing the concept of education for sustainable development among workers in the local development directorates of the municipalities of southern, central and northern Jordan
Description: Since Jordan was invited to present its country initiative for education for sustainable development, the Jordan National Commission for UNESCO/Education Sector began forming a national team for education for sustainable development to prepare the initiative with the five areas of work identified by UNESCO: (strengthening policy, transforming learning environments, building teachers’ capacities, empowering and mobilizing youth, and accelerating actions at the local level). Therefore, we found it advisable to work on implementing a training project in the fifth field: accelerating measures at the local level through municipalities in all governorates of the Kingdom, where directors of local development directorates in municipalities will be trained to enhance their awareness of sustainable development issues and to demonstrate the importance of their role in achieving SDGs 2030
