Project: A Series of Symposiums on "Entrepreneurship, innovation and creativity in Jordanian Universities"
Description:
A series of symposiums will be held on entrepreneurship, innovation and creativity in Jordanian universities; to educate the youth on the importance of entrepreneurship, innovation and creativity in planning for their future; through highlighting the experiences of Jordanian entrepreneurs in various fields and sectors, and addressing the social and economic challenges facing them and ways to overcome them. On the other hand, local, Arab and international success stories will be presented to inspire and encourage the youth to plan their future. 
The targeted group of this project is university students in four universities distributed in the three regions of Jordan. As this category needs to be educated about popular trends in the labour market and give ideas on how to start their own businesses in light of the high rates of unemployment in various sectors and the difficult economic conditions in the area. These conferences will inspire the youth and enable them to be creative and innovative in building their future careers in a way that suits the local and global markets' needs and achieving sustainable development goals in the long term.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particularly in Africa, developing countries, LDCs, and SIDS

Project: CINETOURATH - Cinéma du Patrimoine
Description: "CINETOURATH, le Cinéma du Patrimoine, vise à révéler la richesse culturelle et patrimoniale de la Mauritanie à travers le cinéma. Organisé à Nouadhibou du 14 au 18 mai 2024 par la Fondation MZ, l'événement met en lumière La poésie féminine, le patrimoine matériel et immatériel, encourageant la préservation et l'expression cinématographique locale. Les axes principaux incluent des ateliers de film mobile, des sessions de cinéma professionnel, des débats sur le désert comme berceau du cinéma, et une exposition photographique. CINETOURATH aspire à établir une tradition cinématographique en Mauritanie, débutant à Nouadhibou."
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particularly in Africa, developing countries, LDCs, and SIDS

Project: Second Forum on Transformative Education for ASPnet Teachers and Youth of Lebanon “Building peaceful and sustainable futures through transformative education”
Description:
The Forum will include two parallel workshops one address to teachers and another one for students that will tackle the Transformative Education areas of: 
•	Greening education based on the Whole school approach on climate change (Get climate ready)
•	Introducing Artificial Intelligence into Teaching and Learning
•	Media literacy : critical thinking , raising voices of youth, 
•	the importance of Social Emotional Learning in schools (SEL) Social emotional learning

The two face to face workshops, each one for two days, addressed to ASPnet teachers and Youth, will be followed by a national competition on the best four projects that tackle one of the areas or topic  of the Forum in line with SDG’s goals.

Project: Médiatisation scientifique : Un enjeu pour la Science ouverte et le droit à la Science
Description: La Science ouverte, telle que définie par l’UNESCO, « est une série de principes et de pratiques visant à rendre la recherche scientifique de tous les domaines accessible à tout le monde, au bénéfice des scientifiques et de la         société tout entière ».Ce projet sur la médiatisation scientifique s’inscrit dans cette démarche et mobilise les scientifiques, les citoyens, les journalistes scientifiques et les « médiateurs » actifs dans la vulgarisation et la diffusion des informations scientifiques. Une série de 10 formations sera proposée visant étudiants universitaires des facultés d’information et des facultés de science afin de devenir des journalistes scientifiques.

Project: Pilot project on Digital Resilience:  Empowering Girls against Online Disinformation
Description: In today's digital age, online platforms serve as essential avenues for communication, learning, and social interaction. However, they also present challenges, particularly the proliferation of disinformation and misinformation. Cyberbullying, misinformation, grooming, fraud... in the digital age, young people face risks and dangers from which they must learn to protect themselves. In this context, educating digitally resilient citizens can prove to be as fundamental as offline civic education
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particularly in Africa, developing countries, LDCs, and SIDS

Project: Reservas de Biosfera Costarricenses caminando hacia la autogestión de su comunicación
Description:
La autogestión de la comunicación de las Reservas de Biosfera busca potenciar las capacidades de los actores locales mediante la implementación de herramientas audiovisuales que mejoren los procesos de comunicación que se realizan en cada Reserva de Biosfera.
El proyecto define tres etapas: implementación de talleres de capacitación, laboratorios cinematográficos para generar cortometrajes y un manual para la elaboración de material audiovisual. Con esto, se busca formar las bases de un proceso de comunicación autogestionado que atienda los vacíos de comunicación actuales y sirvan para la planificación en temas de divulgación y planificación de trabajo.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particul

Project: Formación y sensibilización Integral para la Sostenibilidad y resiliencia ambiental y cultural que comprende reciclaje, huertos orgánicos y obras de conservación de suelo y agua en 8 comunidades de Suchitoto.
Description: El Proyecto comprende la formación y sensibilización en la defensa de los bienes naturales y su uso sostenible, así como, la resiliencia ambiental comprendiendo la economía circular, implementación de huertos orgánicos y conservación de suelo y agua, con técnicas de permacultura, en 8 comunidades.  Las familias de las comunidades de Suchitoto son de escasos recursos y su principal fuente de ingresos son actividades agrícolas, donde se le dará preminencia a la mujer, ya que las mayoría de mujeres están al frente de sus hogares, realizando actividades agropecuarias, sin embargo, se encuentran en condiciones desiguales en cuanto al acceso a la tierra. Para tener acceso, se conformarán comités de mujeres, jóvenes, niños, niñas, centros comunitarios y sus respectivos centros escolares del municipio de Suchitoto, donde además se fomentará la cultura entre los jóvenes de los centros educativos mediante la expresión ecológica en murales en sus centros educativos.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particul

Project: Fortalecimiento de las habilidades de educadores y educadoras de la EPJA. Hacia la  circulación social, la participación igualitaria y la cultura: la ciudad como ambiente de  aprendizaje
Description:
El proyecto se propone difundir y sensibilizar en el país la importancia de la Educación de 
Personas Jóvenes y Adultas (EPJA) de acuerdo a la definición aprobada en la Recomendación 
sobre el Aprendizaje y la Educación de Adultos, Conferencia General de la UNESCO, Reunión 38ª 
Adoptada el 13 de noviembre de 2015 y las orientaciones acordadas en la VII Conferencia 
Internacional de Educación de Adultos (CONFINTEA) en el Marco de Acción de Marrakech:
“Aprovechar el poder transformador del aprendizaje y la educación de adultos” el Objetivo de 
Desarrollo Sustentable 4: “Garantizar una educación inclusiva, equitativa y de calidad y promover 
oportunidades de aprendizaje durante toda la vida para todos”, contemplado en la Agenda 2030 
de Naciones Unidas.
En este sentido, a partir de estos contenidos fundamentales, se procurará adecuarlos a las 
necesidades e intereses de los diferentes territorios del país, donde trabajan educadoras y 
educadores, en un país donde no se cuenta con una formación específica en EPJA.
Por lo tanto, es necesario, entonces relevar el estado de situaciones particulares a tener en cuenta 
en el diseño de los diferentes módulos que integran el ciclo formativo.
Se prestará especial atención a quienes trabajan:
- en la enseñanza de las personas que no han culminado la enseñanza primaria y media; 
- con mujeres, especialmente aquellas que cursen o desean cursar formación técnica, profesional 
y superior;
- con personas jóvenes, adultas y adultas mayores, especialmente quienes desean adquirir 
competencias técnicas y profesionales, para acceder al empleo, el trabajo decente y el 
emprendedurismo;
- con personas que se encuentran en situación de vulnerabilidad.
Se relevará, sistematizará y dará respuestas a las demandas formativas de colectivos locales del 
interior del país, a través del desarrollo de acciones formativas en educación ciudadana para 
educadores/as, atendiendo a las dificultades de las personas jóvenes y adultas de esa región para 
acceder y sostener aprendizajes más allá del sistema formal de educación, donde los grupos 
postergados y vulnerables, en particular, mujeres y jóvenes, son los más afectados. 
Para responder a estas necesidades se elaborará y ofrecerá, en este primer año y con la 
posibilidad de ser reeditado en el futuro, una propuesta de educación virtual de alcance nacional, 
focalizada en los contenidos que ha sistematizado la Cátedra UNESCO EPJA en Uruguay 
teniendo en cuenta metodologías emergentes en el relevamiento de necesidades. El ciclo 
formativo virtual será una capacidad instalada a seguir siendo utilizada en el futuro por la Cátedra 
UNESCO EPJA.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particularly in Africa, developing countries, LDCs, and SIDS

Project: Tango a clase
Description:
Tango a la clase propone divulgar el valor del tango, Patrimonio Cultural Inmaterial de la Humanidad, entre los niños y niñas de escuelas primarias del Uruguay. Inspirado en el éxito de sus proyectos previos, (Bandoneón a la clase y Robots a la clase), la Fundación Cienarte proyecta la creación y 
presentación de talleres en formato de obra teatral interactiva y lúdica.

La puesta en escena estará a cargo de alumnos de Destaoriya y del SODRE. Se presentará en doce escuelas, precedidas por envío de materiales a los docentes. El cronograma va desde setiembre de 2024 a noviembre de 2025.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particularly in Africa, developing countries, LDCs, and SIDS

Project: Masquerade lives on
Description: Masquerade , an African survival is seen erroneously as a stage item. It is a costumed dance street theatre performance but the tradition is defunct. Fragmented stragglers in costume are tragically incompetent and inadequate. They appear to know little about the raison d’être for this ancestral art form and are treated as nuisances . Former Minister of Culture, Dr. Anthony said many have ‘looked down’ on this art form, maybe because they were not aware of its rich historical and traditional value and importance to Guyanese heritage. If the culture is allowed to diminish, Guyanese will eventually lose their identity.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particul

Project: Professionalisation of Youth Work in Saint Lucia (Youth Work Program for Effective Youth Work Practice)
Description:
St. Lucia, a country of a relatively young population, has large pockets of severe poverty. The Ministry of Youth Development and Sports recognizes the need for technical assistance to strengthen the strategic focus and effectiveness of the Division of Youth’s work planning, programming, community organizing and organizational coordination efforts. To this aim, MYDS, TVET (Technical and Vocational Education and Training) and Y-RIE (Youth Resilience, Inclusion and Empowerment) programme are partnering on the development and delivery of a youth work curriculum as an essential way to professionalize its youth services and secure opportunities for the upward mobility of youth workers.
The Caribbean Vocational Qualification (CVQ) Level II in Youth Development will ensure that Youth Workers have the technical competencies to effectively address youth development challenges and set them on the path to become positive contributing citizens.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particul

Project: Promoting basic literacy skills in primary education in Mexico
Description: In recent assesments, Mexico has shown that primary education students do not have the necessary language skills, with school closure due to the Covid 19 pandemic, this issue has deepened. The office has been working with vulnerable populations to ensure development of literacy basic skills and competencies. In addition, we will be working specifically with migrants in coordination with San Jose an Guatemala offices to ensure a strategy for education of migrants that is contextualized to the specific challenges in this region. Finally, we are working in the response to the Hurricane in Guerrero that impacted at least 600 schools last november.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED1 - Education systems equipped to promote inclusion, address marginalization and advance rights, including in crisis-affected and post-disaster contexts
Donor: Natura Distribuidora de México, SA de CV

Project: Plan de Fortalecimiento a la Alfabetización
Description: La propuesta apunta al desarrollo de uno de los componentes del Plan de Fortalecimiento a la Alfabetización, a cargo de la Secretaría de Educación del Ministerio de Capital Humano. La meta general es el fortalecimiento de espacios comunitarios y no gubernamentales vinculados al trabajo con niños y niñas desde la primera infancia hasta el primer ciclo de la escuela primaria. El propósito perseguido se vincula a la creación y consolidación de equipos y formación de recursos humanos para acompañar las trayectorias de alfabetización mediante centros de promoción de la comprensión lectora, la producción escrita y la expresión oral en áreas no gubernamentales, comunitarias y organizaciones de la sociedad civil.

Project: Asistencia Técnica para la elaboración de Guías Metodológicas asociadas al diseño curricular del Programa de Formación Presional y Capacitación Laboral con Culminación de la Educación Media de la Modalidad de Educación Permanente
Description:
El proyecto busca instrumentar la implementación experimental del Diseño Curricular del Programa de Formación Profesional y Capacitación Laboral con Culminación de la Educación Media en la modalidad de Educación Permanente, mediante la puesta en marcha de nuevos servicios educativos.

Las actividades involucran la participación de los actores claves (docentes, instructores laborales, supervisores y técnicos del nivel central) en la construcción de las herramientas metodológicas y didácticas para la implementación.

El producto esperado se centra en la producción de guías metodológicas, la validación de las mimas y la entrega técnica a los actores educativos implementadores, para la implementación del diseño curricular.

Project: “Danses et spiritualité des peuples indigènes du Paraguay” - documentation, registre, systématisation et diffusion de danses originaires référentiel de peuples indigènes
Description: L'Association Culturelle ACCEL, propose d'enregistrer, documenter, systématiser et diffuser la mémoire orale et la corporéité qui marquent la spiritualité des peuples indigènes, cultures ancestrales du Paraguay, en prenant comme référence les danses de 3 peuples, Guana, Nivaclé et Mbya Guaraní, de différentes familles linguistiques. Ce projet « Danses et spiritualité des peuples indigènes du Paraguay », enregistrement audiovisuel et écrit, pourrait faire partie du Conseil International de la Danse CID-UNESCO. Grâce aux résultats obtenus du Programme de Participation, le thème de la spiritualité dans la danse des communautés indigènes peut être présenté comme candidature au patrimoine immatériel du Paraguay

Project: Enhancing Grenada Heritage Tourism, A Comprehensive Approach
Description: The Grenada National Trust GNT proposes a transformative initiative to revitalize Grenada heritage within tourism. Through seminars led by cultural heritage specialists, licensed tour guides under the Grenada Tourism Authority will gain in depth knowledge of tangible cultural heritage. The project aims to enhance the quality of guided tours, provide official recognition through badges, and ensure accurate representation of Grenada unique heritage. Two heritage tourism seminars in September 2024 will focus on tangible heritage, customer service skills, and resource utilization. The project, aligns with Grenada vision of becoming a premier cultural destination, emphasizing sustainable and meaningful tourism.

Description: The main purpose of the project is the documentation and the preservation of the important archive of books and manuscripts belonging to the Meir Tweg synagogue in Baghdad.

Project: The Hague Convention of 1954 and its Protocols: opportunities for use and promotion
Description:
The project aims to develop informational materials – videos – on the provisions of the 1954 Hague Convention and its Protocols (1954 and 1999) and to promote UNESCO values through the Convention's instruments in cooperation with the UNESCO Creative Cities Network, the Global Network of UNESCO Cities in Training, the UNESCO Associated Schools Network, UNESCO Chairs and Clubs.
The project aims to raise awareness, engagement and support of the public for cultural heritage sites through communication. Objectives of this project are to familiarise citizens with the basic principles of protecting cultural property and combating illicit trafficking in cultural property in times of war and to develop and implement information materials (videos) for different target audiences on international standards and best practices in the implementation of the Convention and its two Protocols.

Project: Pushing the Boundaries: Cultivating Inclusion in Ukrainian UNESCO Associated Schools
Description: The project strives to address the post-war challenges in Ukraine by fostering inclusivity in education through UNESCO Associated Schools. It aligns with international frameworks, emphasizing inclusive education principles. The initiative empowers teachers with inclusive teaching strategies, addressing biases and unique needs of war-affected students. Student training programs promote inclusivity, resilience, and collaboration. Expected results include enhanced teaching competencies, a cultivated inclusive school culture, empowered student advocates, improved well-being, and measurable academic progress. Implemented in UNESCO schools, the project aims to create a sustainable impact, reinforcing UNESCO’s commitment to positive educational change and supporting post-war recovery in Ukraine.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action

Project: PROJET D’APPUI  A L’AUTONOMISATION DES PERSONNES HANDICAPEES AU BENIN
Description: Il s’agit d’une formation pour sortir les personnes handicapées de la précarité et de la mendicité. Ils auront droit à une formation sur la fabrication de certains savons parfumés, ainsi que sur les techniques de transformation de purée de tomate. Le tout  sera clôturé par la formation sur l’entreprenariat. Le lancement officiel des formations connaîtra une conférence publique sur : « BENIN - STOP A LA MARGINALISATION DES PERSONNES HANDICAPEES ».

Project: English Training Course for Women Scientists
Description: Nowadays possessing English proficiency is one of the prerequisites for scientists to acquire knowledge of science and technology and for taking part in international academic exchanges. In language acquisition, female scientists have less opportunity and time relative to their peer males due to some unavoidable circumstances including pregnancy, childbirth, childcare and family caring affairs. This project aims to organize an English language training courses for young women scientists by inviting a foreign professional lecturer to improve their English language abilities to actively participate in academic exchange activities such as writing research papers and presenting their results at international conferences.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action

Project: Digital cultural heritage education for children in Cambodia
Description: Cambodia faces the challenge of preserving its rich cultural heritage and transmitting it to younger generations. The Digital Cultural Heritage Education for Children in Cambodia Project aims to address this by introducing digital platforms to education programs. The project focuses on creating a digital learning game and educational material that engages children in exploring Cambodia's cultural heritage sites, rituals, and traditions. The approach involves organizing workshops for MOEY and MCFA staff, introducing educational materials, and conducting digital cultural heritage events for students in Phnom Penh. The purpose is to raise pride and appreciation for cultural heritage by students in Cambodia.

Project: Development of a management model for tourist attractions in Angkor Borie, Takeo, Cambodia
Description: The project focuses on creating a management model for tourist attractions at the Angkor Borie site. This archaeological site​does not yet have tourism management. Therefore, this project will develop the local tourist industry by training local high school students to increase their awareness about heritage and as promoters of those heritage sites to tourists.  Creating a tour circuit that facilitates tourists and getting more information by arranging tourist information signboards in each important place, especially the promotion of heritage on digital platforms is the best way to attract tourists.

Project: Research, Compilation and Exhibition of Intangible Heritages (Traditional Festivals) Around the Temple Complex of Sambor Prei Kuk, Kampong Thom Province
Description: The submission of this project aims to contribute to the protection of the intangible cultural heritage around the temple complex of Sambor Prei Kuk, which is facing constant loss. The traditional festivals of the locals around this area, whether Khmer or Kuoy ethnic group, all show a unique culture different from other areas in Cambodia that should not be overlooked. The research and compilation to publish of an inventory book and the storing of these data on the website, as well as the installation of an exhibition on intangible cultural heritage in the Kampong Thom provincial museum, that are part of this project could be a great way to protect these heritages. It is an image to promote, value and motivate people in the community to continue to worship this valuable cultural resource and it is a significant part of helping the general public to freely explore this cultural heritage.

Project: Public Relations Project for Promoting Gender Equality among Hight School Youth in Bangkok, Thailand
Description:
Currently, the situation of gender equality in Thai society has been improving. However, challenges related to gender-based practices and sexual violence persist. Rapid dissemination of information through technological advancements exacerbates these issues. Media also significantly influences shaping thoughts and beliefs, potentially leading to biased expressions of gender-related behaviors/sexual practices, particularly cyberbullying. According to the Department of Mental Health, Thailand ranked second globally in cyberbullying in 2020, following Japan. Survey results indicate that over 91% of youth have experienced cyberbullying, with 43% considering retaliation, posing an increased risk of escalating issues.
Our project team has prior experience receiving funding from the Ministry of Social Development and Human Security, Thailand, to conduct activities promoting gender equality in 2023. To address and prevent future issues, it is essential to raise awareness and understanding of non-gender-based practices and promote gender equality among the youth in Bangkok. This includes respecting others' rights, knowing how to address problems, protecting mental and physical well-being, and being able to adapt and live happily in a collaborative society.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particularly in Africa, developing countries, LDCs, and SIDS

Description: This activity will contribute to integrate UNESCO´s network of designated sites in Peru including eight UNESCO biosphere reserves and one UNESCO global geoparks, developing a shared agenda for 24-25, exploring joint strategies of intervention, and working towards the creation of a MAB Committee in Peru. The work will build on the achievements and results of the EXB project UNESCO LVMH Amazonia scaling up the achievements on the creation of RB branding, the development of touristic routes and sustainable management plans.  It will entail the organization of regular meetings amongst site managers/representatives of committees and seek complementarities and synergies with other exiting initiatives of the LIM Office with local authorities (SERNANP, Ministry of Environment, Ministry of Trade and Tourism, etc).
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.SC1 - Inclusive knowledge and capacities of Member States strengthened to advance and apply science for sustainable management of natural resources, ecosystem and biodiversity conservation and restoration, and disaster risk resilience

Project: Preserving the Memory of World Inscription: Enhancing Access to the Rehabilitation Center Soeharso Archives – The Memory of The World of Asia Pacific Register
Description: The Rehabilitation Center Surakarta archive collection consists of information about the history of the first rehabilitation centers for people with disabilities in Asia and the Pacific. The archive contains realization of integrated rehabilitation programs involved by women as the initiator which in the 1958-1980 was hardly to be recorded in Indonesia. The records consist of textual (475 files), photographic (2157 sheets). Most of them are still undigitized. They carry a considerable risk of damage, considering that Indonesia has a tropical climate so that archival media in the form of paper will be very easily damaged due to its high acidity.

Project: Strengthening Legal Education and Institutional Capacity through the Development of an Internal Quality Assurance Framework at JSW Law
Description:
Established in February 2015 under a Royal Charter, Jigme Singye Wangchuck School of Law (JSW Law) is Bhutan's first and only law school, embodying the vision of His Majesty the King and the legacy of  'Justice, Service, Wisdom.' The school, led by Her Royal Highness, Princess Sonam Dechan Wangchuck, has become a pioneer in legal education with a unique five-year Bachelor of Law/Postgraduate Diploma in National Law program. JSW Law actively contributes to Bhutan's Social Development Plan, particularly focusing on Outcome 2: "More Bhutanese equitably access and benefit from quality and wholesome education and lifelong learning by 2029." Aligned with national goals and UNESCO's mission for quality education and recognizing the importance of a dynamic education system, JSW Law envisions integrating a robust Internal Quality Assurance (IQA) framework across its operations to ensure quality, relevance, and responsiveness. 

Despite commendable achievements within a short period of its establishment, His Majesty emphasized the need for expansion beyond the LL.B./PGDNL, urging JSW Law to broaden its focus. In terms of Quality Assurance, JSW Law faces a few challenges that hinder the establishment of a robust IQA framework. One significant challenge is the lack of expertise in IQA within the institution. As a relatively young and pioneering law school in Bhutan, JSW Law does not have a dedicated pool of professionals with specialized knowledge in quality assurance processes. This shortage of expertise poses a significant challenge in developing and implementing an effective IQA mechanism. Furthermore, the institution is confronted with financial constraints inherent to its developmental phase. The lack of budget limits the school’s capacity to invest in training, technology, and other resources necessary for the successful implementation of a comprehensive IQA framework. Addressing these challenges is crucial for JSW Law to continue advancing its vision and mission, ensuring the sustained delivery of high-quality legal education in Bhutan. 

Recognizing the critical role of Internal Quality Assurance in maintaining and enhancing educational standards, this proposal seeks to establish a comprehensive Internal Quality Assurance mechanism at JSW Law. Additionally, it proposes a targeted capacity-building initiative tailored for JSW Law to develop and implement a robust IQA framework.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particularly in Africa, developing countries, LDCs, and SIDS

Project: Promoting Inclusive Sports and Physical Activities Towards Enhancing Children's Holistic Development and Education
Description:
The project aims to enhance the knowledge and skills of school sports instructors (SSIs) in advocating for and implementing sports and physical activities (SPA) using contemporary and inclusive approaches. The first National Fitness Test (FT) conducted in 2023 revealed concerning findings, indicating a significant number of students needing to improve their health and fitness levels. Additionally, the Ministry of Health has highlighted a rise in mental health issues among school youth and the prevalence of non-communicable diseases (NCDs).
While the Scouts and Sports Division continues to promote sports and physical activities, it has been observed that not all children have access to sports due to a lack of resources and sports infrastructure. Therefore, there is a pressing need to focus on non-traditional sports (free play), which are easy to organise, inexpensive, and beneficial to child development and education. The project will prioritize primary schools, as it is crucial to ensure early foundational development and progression in children's physical and mental well-being.

By documenting their lifestyle, art, and economic activities, the project seeks to promote cultural preservation, community empowerment, and sustainable development. This initiative aligns with UNESCO's commitment to safeguarding intangible cultural heritage and fostering inclusive growth within diverse communities. Through collaboration and research, the Socio-Economic Survey intends to contribute valuable insights for both local empowerment and global cultural understanding.

Project: Improvement of the legal framework in the field of tangible cultural heritage of Uzbekistan
Description:
The special status of cultural heritage objects as a unique value of the people of Uzbekistan and an integral part of the world cultural heritage requires a comprehensive and integrated approach to the legal regulation of relations concerning their protection, management, administration and preservation.
Current legislation seems powerless to resolve a number of fundamental issues related to the functioning of certain objects of cultural heritage and their status at the regional legal level (for example, problems of coordination of the actions of numerous specialized agencies, correlation of private interests and their public burdens with respect to preservation and use of historical and cultural monuments, etc.). Thus, it is obvious that in order to effectively implement the existing regulatory framework in the field of cultural heritage it is required to make certain changes in the regulatory framework that correspond to the actual situation.

Project: The 26th Consultation Meeting of the Pacific Heads of Education Systems (PHES)
Description:
The Pacific Heads of Education Systems (PHES) constitutes a network comprising the highest-ranking officials from the ministries of education across 15 Pacific Small Island Developing Nations (SIDS). The primary objectives of PHES are fourfold: (i) fostering coordination among national education systems by identifying shared solutions; (ii) facilitating SIDS-SIDS or South-South and triangular cooperation; (iii) supporting the professional development of member states; and (iv) advocating for education standards and outcomes aligned with global and regional education goals and targets. PHES conducts assessments of educational needs spanning basic to higher education and lifelong learning, encompassing continuing education, technical and vocational education and training (TVET), while also aiding in the development of pertinent programming and offering guidance to the broader education sector.
Consultation Meetings of PHES occur biennially, preceding the Conference of Pacific Education Ministers (CPEM), with each Pacific Island country taking turns to host.

Project: World Teachers Day Observation
Description:
Niue High School celebrates World Teachers Day, a UN commemoration day to celebrate teachers and the important roles they play in society.  This is observed on October 5th every year and the school organise programs and events for the day.  Events can include professional development opportunities, awareness programs and community outreach programs to promote what teachers do, fun activities and games, and more serious acknowledgements of the importance of teachers to society.  This year is extra special in that Niue will be celebrating 50 years of self-governing in free association with NZ.  The Teacher Day celebrations will coincide with this national milestone.
The focus this year is on "Empowering Educators: Strengthening Resilience, Building Sustainability." In these challenging times, teachers have emerged as beacons of resilience, adapting and innovating for their students. 
The project seeks funds to finance Niue High School’s observance of World Teachers Day 2024.

Project: Digitizing and Enhancing Accessibility of the National Atlas of Mongolia (E-NAM)
Description: The project aims to create an electronic version of the National Atlas of Mongolia or E-NAM, which consists of thematic geographical images, incorporating research findings from disciplines such as history, archaeology, paleontology, biology, geology, physics, geophysics, ecology, geography, and cartography, by recreating the thematic geographical images in English and placing them on an online platform in two languages, Mongolia and English. This comprehensive and open-access atlas will provide and enhance the science-based knowledge and understanding of Mongolia to the general public and interdisciplinary researchers of all ages, genders, and ethnicities, which aligns with strategic orientations of UNESCO for period 2024-2025.

Project: Amplifying Girls and Young Women’s Education through the Village Loudspeakers in Savannaket and Sayabouli Provinces
Description: The COVID-19 pandemic has disproportionately impacted girls' education in rural Lao PDR, with dropout rates skyrocketing. This is primarily due to harmful gender norms that prioritize education for boys and economic hardships that pressure families to prioritize domestic duties for girls. This project empowers young women to become advocates for girls' education through a loudspeaker program. After training,  female volunteers will broadcast educational content, including dramas, stories, and songs, using village loudspeakers in  targeted villages of Xayabouly and Savanneket Provinces.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action

Project: Capacity-building workshop on ‘Living Heritage’ for ASPnet Teachers in Lao PDR
Description:
The ‘promotion of a culture of peace and non-violence, global citizenship and appreciation of cultural diversity and of culture’s contribution to sustainable development’ is an important target to achieve Goal 4 on quality education and lifelong learning opportunities for all as mentioned in the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development. 

One of culture’s manifestations is living heritage or intangible cultural heritage (ICH), including music and dances, festivals and rituals, making handicrafts and agricultural knowledge. These cultural practice and knowledge that are so meaningful to communities should be preserved and to transmit to future generation. This can be done in the schools.

People with autism lack communication and social interaction. The integration of children with autism has been an important and controversial issue in the educational community (general and special education). The risk of poor school adaptation for these children exacerbates the poor adaptive behavior of these children and thus integration becomes more difficult. Teachers and support staff are the key to the effective integration of children with autism and their attitude and behavior are very important.

Project: Enhancing Vocational Education and Training (TVET) Through New Legislation for More Effective Refugee Integration in Armenia
Description:
The aim of the project is to support the implementation of the new VET Law’s provisions for

continuing VET specifically and to facilitate skills profiling and job matching to Sectoral

Qualifications frameworks, particularly in three sectors: ITC, Light Industry, and Construction.

The implementation of this project will be particularly beneficial in addressing the educational

needs of forcibly displaced refugees from Nagorno- Karabakh. The development of Sectoral

Qualifications frameworks and the enhancement of VET programs will create accessible

pathways for refugees to gain relevant skills and qualifications in high-demand sectors like

ICT, Light Industry, and Construction.

By providing structured vocational training aligned with industry standards, the project can help

refugees integrate into the local labor market more effectively. Moreover, the focus on modular

programs will allow for flexible learning paths, accommodating the diverse educational

backgrounds and experiences of refugee learners. This approach will not only support their

immediate employment prospects but also will contribute to their long-term socio-economic

integration.

Project: Scaling Participation of Creative Cultural Industries Practitioners for Strategic Market Access
Description: UNESCO highlights the vulnerabilities of the culture sector exacerbated by the COVID-19 pandemic, emphasizing the risks to cultural heritage and the challenges faced globally. Lesotho, facing potential cultural appropriation, aims to capitalize on its diverse cultural heritage for economic development through Creative Cultural Industries (CCI). While Lesotho has been active in fashion, there's a need to enhance participation in music, film, and food systems. The project focuses on learning and capacity building to promote entrepreneurship, cultural appreciation, and global market positioning. Lessons from a film production project underscore the gender disparities in powerful positions within CCI, especially in the film industry. The project aims to address this by identifying and empowering women in key roles, fostering wide consultation, and creating a pipeline for cultural creativity to access local and international markets.

Project: Elaboration d’un manuel harmonisé de formation des alphabétiseurs en charge de l’alphabétisation des groupes organisés des jeunes et des femmes
Description: Le projet « Elaboration d’un manuel harmonisé de formation des alphabétiseurs en charge de l’alphabétisation des groupes organisés des jeunes et des femmes » s’inscrit dans la réalisation des activités de l’axe stratégique 2 relatives à l’amélioration de la qualité de l’Alphabétisation et de l’éducation non formelle (AENF) du document de la Stratégie nationale d’alphabétisation et de l’éducation non formelle 2024-2028. Il s’agit de doter les acteurs du sous-secteur de l’AENF d’un premier manuel harmonisé de formation des alphabétiseurs élaboré selon l’approche par les compétences (APC). Pour y arriver, il est envisagé la tenue d’un atelier formation production regroupant les acteurs intervenant en AENF. Project: PROMOTION OF GENDER RESPONSIVE AND DISABILITY INCLUSIVE EDUCATION THROUGH SPECIALISED PEDAGOGICAL SKILLS TRAINING FOR TEACHERS IN PRIMARY SCHOOLS
Description: The project has been designed to promote inclusive education where girls with disabilities are gaining the same level of quality education as boys with disabilities, and their non-disabled peers. This will include strengthening the gender responsive technical capacity of teachers in Primary Schools to promote gender responsive special needs and inclusive education. As we strive to achieve SDG 4 targets, approaches identified in the project include providing gender-responsive, inclusive education training for teachers, which addresses the intersectional needs of girls and boys with disabilities and includes instruction in gender-responsive, inclusive pedagogy, using support personnel, such as Centre Coordinating Tutors, senior women and male teachers and special needs education officials. These educators are responsible for supporting learners with disabilities and are often an integral part of delivering inclusive teaching in schools and ensuring children with disabilities can attend mainstream schools.  Working with existing community structures, families, and organizations of persons with disabilities to understand and address negative attitudes, beliefs, and practices around gender and disability and empower women and girls with disabilities to share and normalize their experiences. The intervention will promote gender-responsive pedagogy focused at leaners with special needs and such mechanism should be incorporated into any pedagogical reform initiatives in Schools to ensure that the needs of both female and male leaners with special needs are met and that they will benefit equally from improved teaching and learning practices.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action

Project: Promote Ecosystem Approaches and Collaborative Natural Resource Management for Climate Change Adaptation in disaster-prone, high-risk and UNESCO-designated sites in Uganda.
Description:
Whereas Uganda Government has put in place a legislation called the Uganda wildlife Act 2019 to provide for the conservation and sustainable management of wildlife and streamlining the roles and responsibilities of institutions involved in wildlife conservation and management and for related matters, this law does not make any provisions, let alone mention, the Biosphere Reserves and other globally-designated sites anywhere in the document.  This unfortunate lack of domestication of the MAB principles in the law in the case of the  Biosphere Reserves  means that the principles  of MAB as a scientific Programme for promoting scientific research on human populations’ interaction with ecosystems, the cooperation between all the scientific disciplines to better understand human-nature interactions through science, through education, through training and through building capacities of communities in a Biosphere Reserve setting is not actively promoted.   

 While Section 32 of the Act provides for “Historic rights of communities around conservation areas”, the rights so granted are subject to the guidelines to be provided by the Authority like access to resources which are historically crucial to the survival of those communities. This conditional provision for the indigenous communities who are historically part and parcel of the ecosystem is however different from the Biosphere Reserve management which calls for coexistence between the community and the ecosystem in a consultatively zoned areas designated for the purposes as defined in the MAB Principles. The drive of MAB to overcome conflicts between people’s livelihoods and nature through a “rational” use of natural resources, to establish or re-establish “harmony” between people and their environment is missed out and this has made  it easy to alienate the indigenous communities in these sites from their natural environment. The conflicts between the management of these sites with the indigenous communities have continued due to the, management of these sites without the application of the Biosphere Reserve principles. Although a MAB National Committees exists, the lack of provision for them in the Law governing these protected areas makes it difficult for them to exercise the roles laid down in the MAB Strategy and the WNBR. The same problem exists with the other globally-important sites designated under UNESCO like the 4 World Heritage Sites in the Country. 

 
There are continuing complaints of communities about unfairness in the policies regulating the Biosphere Reserves as punishment is meted out to them when they enter into what should be buffer zones in the Biosphere reserves.  Whereas the communities have complaints of hostility of UWA Officials and Game Rangers towards them (See the Monitor Newspaper January 30th 2024, story below), the UWA Officials also complain of intransigence of the communities, and political interference by the leaders of the communities in the Biosphere reserves. The conservation agency counter-accused the Communities of killing 15 of its staff (rangers) and injuring 35 others between 2002 to 2023. The other BR, Queen Elizabeth, has also experience intermittent conflicts between pastoralists and the conservation managers. 

Other problems associated with land use include the emerging accounts of how nomadic pastoralists called “Balaalo” have migrated to areas of other communities resulting to conflicts in those areas. Such accounts not only depict images of pastoralism as being an outmoded and inefficient livelihood system but also pastoralists as people who are understood almost exclusively through discourses of conflict, insecurity and lawlessness, amongst others. This can potentially contribute to cycles of violence by manipulation of pastoralists against themselves and other local communities. There are also fears of spread of livestock diseases resulting to epidemic in the new areas being migrated to. Some of the encroachments have been to the protected areas of National Forestry Authority. However, all these point to the lack of knowledge appropriate land use practices for climate action, biodiversity, water management and disaster risk reduction (Outcome 3) resulting from non-inclusive development in the country where certain communities have remained excluded from knowledge and skills in  sustainable management of natural resources and disaster risk resilience.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particularly in Africa, developing countries, LDCs, and SIDS

Project: Renforcement des capacités de l’Union des Groupements féminins d’Alphabétisations aux activités génératrices des revenus par la transformation des fruits balanites égyptiac et le maraichage.
Description:
(a)   Présentation succincte du projet

Le présent projet a pour but de renforcer les capacités de cette union de groupement Mourgan et donc de ses 72 membres par la formation aux techniques de maraichage, de  production et de transformation des fruits et légumes en grandes quantités pour les marchés des centres urbains de la région. Project: Projet de renforcement des capacités des radios communautaires des régions frontalières avec les pays en conflit (Soudan, Lybie, RCA, Bassin du Lac-Tchad)
Description:
(a) Présentation succincte du projet
Les radios communautaires jouent un rôle déterminant dans le maintien de la paix au Tchad. En effet, elles produisent et diffusent des émissions sur la paix et le vivre ensemble dans les différentes régions du pays, apportant ainsi une contribution importante à la lutte contre l’extrémisme violent et participant à la recherche des solutions pour une paix durable, notamment dans les régions en proie aux attaques de Boko-Haram ou dans les régions en crise.
Il se trouve malheureusement que ces médias qui sont généralement créés par des missionnaires ou des ONG nationales, sont pour certaines, gérés par les communautés elles-mêmes, parfois bénévolement et sans expérience technique. Ce sont souvent les jeunes sans emploi qui sont recrutés sans formation préalable.
C’est pourquoi, les défis auxquels ces radios sont confrontées sont généralement ceux de l’insuffisance de formation dans de nombreux domaines allant de la gestion d’une radio communautaire aux problèmes de maintenance des émetteurs ou de l’animation. Des radios communautaires des régions sensibles sont ainsi ciblées dans le cadre de ce projet.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particularly in Africa, developing countries, LDCs, and SIDS

Project: Patrimoine Vivant : Découvrir et Préserver la Culture du Burkina Faso
Description: Pour soutenir les efforts de l’État burkinabè dans la préservation et la protection du patrimoine vivant burkinabè, la Fédération burkinabè des Associations et Clubs pour l’UNESCO a lancé un projet intitulé : “Patrimoine Vivant : Découvrir et Préserver la Culture du Burkina Faso”. Ce projet vise à sensibiliser 1 000 jeunes aux richesses culturelles du Burkina Faso et à les encourager à préserver et à célébrer ce patrimoine. Ce projet s’inscrit également dans le cadre du Plan National de Développement Économique et Social (PNDES) du Burkina Faso et du programme d’urgence de la transition. Le PNDES, qui vise à rétablir la paix et la sécurité, renforcer la résilience de la nation et transformer structurellement l’économie burkinabè pour une croissance forte, durable et inclusive, reconnaît l’importance de la culture comme moteur de développement
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action

Project: Education environnementale, stratégies de conservation de Bombax costatum et résilience communautaire dans un contexte de crise sécuritaire au nord du Burkina Faso
Description:
Le projet met l’accent l’éducation environnementale à travers la régénération d’une plante alimentaire dans un contexte d’insécurité. De par son statut de pourvoyeuse de Produits Forestier Non Ligneux (PFNL), Bombax costatum est surexploitée et éprouvent des difficultés de régénération au moyen de graines. La cueillette des fleurs de l’espèce, souvent menée par écimage presque complet, prive les arbres d’une grande quantité de semences nécessaires à leur régénération.
Au regard des difficultés qu’éprouve l’espèce pour sa régénération au moyen de graines et la pression anthropique sur ses individus, il s’avère nécessaire d’explorer d’autres techniques, notamment celles de la multiplication végétative à faible coût afin de contribuer au maintien et à la domestication de cette espèce alimentaire et économique que les populations rurales (autochtones et personnes déplacées internes) apprécient.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particularly in Africa, developing countries, LDCs, and SIDS

Project: Sensibiliser et initier les jeunes filles à la culture entrepreneuriale en milieu  scolaire
Description: L'emploi des jeunes est un défi pour les pays africains et encore plus pour la Gabon où les moins de 25 ans constituent plus de 54% de la population. Face à la capacité limitée du marché de travail d’offrir des possibilités d’emplois décents à ces jeunes diplômés ou pas, il devient plus qu’impératif de promouvoir de nouvelles stratégies permettant aux jeunes de créer leurs emplois et de contribuer positivement à l’économie. Parmi ces stratégies, l’entrepreneuriat est sans nul doute une des réponses clé pour libérer le potentiel productif et innovant des jeunes. La promotion de la culture de l’entreprenariat dès le jeune âge chez les jeunes filles en milieu scolaire serait un atout qui peut permettre de les sensibiliser à l’auto-emploi et la création des entreprises pour leur autonomisation et surtout pour surmonter les obstacles liés au chômage.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particularly in Africa, developing countries, LDCs, and SIDS

Project: Capacity Building of Women on Community-Based Inventorying of Female Traditional Dances of the Northern Region of Malawi
Description: The project is aimed at safeguarding female traditional dances in five (5) districts of the northern region namely: Chitipa, Karonga, Rumphi, Mzimba and Nkhatabay districts through inventorying. First 30 female teachers and community-based female youth, six from each district, will be trained on community-based inventorying of ICH, followed by the actual Community-based inventorying of the traditional dances both of which will be recorded on audiovisual media.  Each trained team of six will conduct community-based inventorying of dances in their respective district. Project outputs will consist of the 30 trained women, an inventory of the traditional dances and audiovisual recordings.

Project: Supporting the role of law enforcement agencies and political party leaders in ensuring safety of journalists during Elections
Description: As Malawi is drawing closer to elections period, there is need to support the role of various stakeholders such as law enforcement agencies (LEAs), political party and journalists to ensure safety of journalists in their reporting. According to MISA Malawi, Malawi registers increased number of assaults on journalists which are most perpetrated by LEAs and political parties.  This project therefore will aim to train stakeholders on their roles and responsibilities in ensuring safety of journalists. It aims to enhance working relationship between LEAs and journalists in order to promote freedom of expression and rights of journalists.

Project: Support to the development of AI ethical standards in Malawi.
Description: Malawi has embarked on promulgation of the Recommendation on ethics of Artificial Intelligence (AI) by meeting some of the stipulated obligations. To build its capacity for the recommendation implementation, the country conducted a national conference and is currently conducting a study on the country’s readiness in adopting AI ethics, also known as the Readiness Assessment Methodology (RAM).  To continue supporting development of policies for inclusive digital transformation and ethical AI standards for action to meet the challenges of innovative technologies and digital transformation for Malawi, this project will support development of AI Ethics strategy.

Project: Seminar on Research Methodology for University Lecturers in Liberia
Description: Despite the critical role of research methodology in producing high-quality academic research, many university lecturers in Liberia lack comprehensive knowledge and skills in advanced research methodologies. This knowledge gap hinders their ability to conduct rigorous research, publish impactful papers, and contribute significantly to their respective fields. Therefore, there is a pressing need to provide university lecturers with a specialized seminar on research methodology to enhance their research capabilities and ultimately improve the quality and quantity of academic output. Additionally, University lecturers in Liberia may lack adequate knowledge and skills in research methodology, which makes them ineffective in teaching and guiding students in conducting research. This gap in expertise could lead to subpar research outputs from students and faculty members, ultimately affecting the quality of education and research in Liberian universities.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action

Project: INTERVENTIONS TO PREVENT TEENAGE PREGNANCIES AND MITIGATE THE NEGATIVE EFFECTS ON GIRLS PRIMARY AND SECONDARY EDUCATION IN NAROK COUNTY, KENYA
Description:
The project will be carried out in Narok County among selected schools Learners (Girls and Boys), teachers, head teachers, local administrators, religious leaders, women and youth, through criteria that will be set out by the implementing team. The purpose of this project will be to prevent teenage pregnancy and mitigate its effects on girls primary and secondary education in Narok County. This is a key step towards reducing cases of early pregnancies and facilitating enrolment and completion rates of girls affected by teenage pregnancies in the County. 
The specific objectives include: building the capacity of teachers, parents and key stakeholders; enhance the exposure, knowledge and experiences of higher learning and career development opportunities ;create a learner friendly and supportive environment in schools to support girls at risk of early pregnancy; enhance the knowledge base and opportunities for harmonized support for the girls primary and secondary education in Narok County, Kenya. 
Main activities will entail: training teachers, Members of Parents association and opinion leaders in the Community on prevention of teenage pregnancies and mitigation the effects of the pregnancies; organizing an exposure trip for selected teachers and learners to the local university to facilitate expanded world view of the learners; establishing Family Units to facilitate mentorship, development of psychosocial competencies/life skills and homegrown solution to address factors leading to teenage pregnancies; organizing a meeting for actors on girls education in Narok County to enhance collaboration and  coordination. 
The expected outcome will be: increased awareness and capacity to prevent and address effects of teenage pregnancies on girls primary and secondary education hence enhance mitigation measures; increased motivation to  learn and complete schooling; enhanced capacity on mental health & psychosocial support , Guidance and Counselling, life skills, Value Based Education, mentorship, peer support and school- based  sustainable income generating activities; enhanced coordination among actors on prevention and management of teenage pregnancies  for girls  in primary and secondary education.
It is expected that there will be enhanced coordination among actors for girls’ education and mitigate the negative effects of issues that hinder girls primary and secondary education.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particularly in Africa, developing countries, LDCs, and SIDS

Project: Increasing scientific expertise and the prominence of females in STEM academia and research for a knowledge based economy
Description: Women in STEM form part of the vulnerable group in the COVID-19 pandemic, with challenges emanating from socio-economic aspects, gender equality, girl empowerment, and the Sustainable Development Goals. The inevitable crisis of the COVID-19 pandemic on the University calendar has disrupted and exacerbated challenges for female scientists. Due to  gender inequality, increased disproportionate domestic work and child care responsibilities, and fixed-term funding despite the consequences of COVID-!9 and beyond, the success of their studies and research are lagging. Therefore there is a need to close this gap through funding to contribute towards a diverse, inclusive and equitable quality education for sustainable development.

Project: Atelier de formation sur « Education aux Droits humains, à la citoyenneté, à la tolérance    et à la paix : que faire pour que cela devienne une réalité quotidienne. »
Description:
L'objectif général est d' outiller les enseignants en éducation aux droits humains, à la citoyenneté, à la tolérance et à la paix, pour permettre à l’école de jouer son rôle de formateur de citoyens responsables en:
- Renforçant les compétences des enseignants sur l’éducation aux droits humains, à la citoyenneté, à la tolérance et à la paix. 
- Réfléchissant sur les contenus pertinents et innovants de supports pédagogiques leur permettant de mieux enseigner les droits humains, la citoyenneté, la tolérance et la paix.

Project: Digitization of Eritrean Music Works
Description:
Eritrea has more than sixty thousand analog audio recordings of music works. Within this
collection, the history of Eritrean societies and their interaction with other societies is well
expressed and documented. In some cases, these music recordings are found to be the
sole sources of information concerning the socio-economic and political history of Eritrea.
However, the existence of this precious and unexploited intangible cultural heritage is now
endangered due to technological obsolescence and aging. The Research and
Documentation Centre (RDC) of Eritrea is therefore proposing to professionally take a
frontline initiative for its safeguarding through mapping, digitizing and processing.

Project: Empowering Students as Hygiene and Menstrual Health Ambassadors
Description:
The project targets the void in hygiene and menstrual health (MH) in Eswatini. It addresses the gap in accessibility of MH services and an opportunity to improve the menstrual experiences and the various aspects of the lives of women and girls. It promotes access to hygiene information, resources, and support necessary for sustainable hygiene and MH practices resulting in: 
•	Improved knowledge and positive shifts in attitudes around hygiene and MH among 3000 students.
•	Increased access to sustainable menstrual products for 1500 girls  
•	Improved health outcomes in schools and communities through the adoption of proper hygiene practices. 
•	Increased confidence in discussing puberty and menstruation with others.

Fun-filled science days with planned team-building activities for the young girls as well as science activities such as coding and/or robotics activities. The plan is also to have exhibiting STEM-based companies to showcase career opportunities in STEM.

Description:
Pour atteindre les objectifs de l'Agenda 2030 il faut doter les individus d’une éducation culturelle, des compétences et des valeurs nécessaires qui leur permettent de vivre dans la dignité et de contribuer au développement de leur société.
Ces jeunes déplacés et déscolarisés constituent dans ce contexte une population en direction de laquelle des actions doivent être menées dans la perspective des ODD. 
Cette formation répondra à la forte demande de formation que ces déplacées demandent à la CNMUI.
La concrétisation de ce projet contribuera à coup sûr, à favoriser les efforts du Gouvernement dans l’insertion socio-économique, éducative et culturelle de ces jeunes filles déplacées déscolarisées en situation difficile.

Project: Caribbean Regional X-ray Science Toward Advancement Laboratory (CRXSTAL): A Regional Hub for X-ray Diffraction in the Caribbean
Description: A Caribbean Hub for X-ray Diffraction, CRXSTAL, will be established by acquiring a single-crystal diffractometer and launching a regional “science education for global goals program.” Under this program the region will host its inaugural crystallography training school and various workshops for primary and high schools, online and on-site. The facility will allow Caribbean scientists to collaborate and execute cutting-edge regional research, for example, the characterization of biologically active natural products and the development of new materials for energy-smart applications and environmental monitoring. CRXSTAL is a crucial resource/knowledge-sharing and capacity-building intervention toward a Caribbean STEM ecosystem, through cooperation, collaboration, and inclusion

Project: National Commission Capacity Building Programme
Description:
The Saint Lucia National Commission for UNESCO was established on 2nd February 1981. Since its establishment the National Commission has contributed to the development of Saint Lucia in all of UNESCO’s fields of competence. Despite its obvious impact over the years, the need to clarify its roles and functions is as relevant today as it was over 43 years ago. 
It is within this context that this project proposal has been developed. 
The project will seek to provide capacity building and training to members of the National Commission’s sub-commissions and committees, as well as assist in revitalizing the Associated Schools Project Network.

Project: Professionalisation of Youth Work in Saint Lucia (Youth Work Program for Effective Youth Work Practice)
Description:
St. Lucia, a country of a relatively young population, has large pockets of severe poverty. The Ministry of Youth Development and Sports recognizes the need for technical assistance to strengthen the strategic focus and effectiveness of the Division of Youth’s work planning, programming, community organizing and organizational coordination efforts. To this aim, MYDS, TVET (Technical and Vocational Education and Training) and Y-RIE (Youth Resilience, Inclusion and Empowerment) programme are partnering on the development and delivery of a youth work curriculum as an essential way to professionalize its youth services and secure opportunities for the upward mobility of youth workers.
The Caribbean Vocational Qualification (CVQ) Level II in Youth Development will ensure that Youth Workers have the technical competencies to effectively address youth development challenges and set them on the path to become positive contributing citizens.

Project: 20° Festival Internacional de Cine de los Derechos Humanos "El séptimo ojo es tuyo" - Bienal de cine invisible
Description:
El Centro de Gestión Cultural Pukañawi se fundó el 30 de octubre de 2004 para unir un centro de estudios, una productora audiovisual y un festival de cine para exhibir, enseñar, producir y archivar películas que defienden a la humanidad.

Pukañawi - ojo rojo en idioma quechua - simboliza la relación entre cine y derechos humanos, se formó en la recuperación por la democracia y en los procesos de comunicación con las comunidades de Potosí y Chuquisaca.

Antes de organizar el Festival Internacional de Cine de los Derechos Humanos "El séptimo ojo es tuyo" (FESTIMO), participó en la producción de la película "La Nación Clandestina" de Jorge Sanjinés, realizó "El Año 501" (1993), "El Anuncio de la Restauración" (2002), "Refundar el País" (2003), "Dos yotaleños en París" (2004), "El Espíritu de Tupaj Katari" (2006) y otros.

El FESTIMO invita a un jurado internacional para otorgar el Premio Pukañawi al ojo nacional, al ojo latinoamericano y al ojo internacional en las categorías corto, medio y largometraje.

Desde el 2007 inspira la celebración del Día del Cine Boliviano y hasta la fecha ha organizado 19 ediciones, ha exhibido más de 2500 películas, organizado cursos, exposiciones y ha llegado a 200 mil personas en distintas ciudades y comunidades.

El proyecto permitirá:
Desarrollar habilidades y competencias para la implementación de políticas, normativas y mejoras tecnológicas en los procesos de gestión.
Potenciar acciones tendientes a acompañar el desarrollo y uso de la inteligencia artificial.
Promover y sensibilizar a la ciudadanía sobre el ejercicio de los derechos a la libre expresión, el acceso a la información y la protección de datos personales

Project: Student Life and Parent Life Video Production
Description: The issue of deviance, discrimination, violence and aggression in schools in Dominica and in the wider society necessitates concerted actions at various levels to reverse prevailing trends before they escalate. In this regard, a video series called Student Life and an interrelated series called Parent Life will be filmed. The intended video production aims, with the use of drama, (1) to attract the attention of children, their parents and other adults (2) to cause them to reflect on their actions and the contribution young people and adults could make in assisting themselves (3) to encourage adults in assisting young people to better deal with behavioral issues.

This forum is timely because it will serve to target audience that exist in Dominica among youth-at-risk. Topics in conflict resolution is indeed essential to reach individuals who may have had conflict with the law and may have had challenges rehabilitating and being a productive member of their community. The organization also wishes to foster entrepreneurship among young professionals or just talented individuals with innovative ideas.

Project: Enhancing Grenada Heritage Tourism, A Comprehensive Approach
Description: The Grenada National Trust GNT proposes a transformative initiative to revitalize Grenada heritage within tourism. Through seminars led by cultural heritage specialists, licensed tour guides under the Grenada Tourism Authority will gain in depth knowledge of tangible cultural heritage. Two heritage tourism seminars in September 2024 will focus on tangible heritage, customer service skills, and resource utilization. The project, aligns with Grenada vision of becoming a premier cultural destination, emphasizing sustainable and meaningful tourism.

Project: Sustenance of Sandwatch for Longevity in Guyana
Description: substenanance of Sandwatch for Longevity in Guyana is an experimental project designed to maintain interest and efficacy as well as to develop teacher's competencies in implementing the sandwatch programme in their schools and communities for a very long time.  The project entails montoring, coaching, training and incentivizing teachers.  Sandwatch is one of UNESCO's educational programmes/tools designed to enhance the resilence of coastline environments through schools and communities.  it is embedded in the Ministry of Education's Sector Plan (ESP) 2021-2025 (seep ESP, strategy 2.3.3. p 105) to be implemented by the Science Unit under the Stragetic activity, Education for Sustainable Development (ESD).  Due to the COVID-19 pandemic and the movement of trained sandwatch teachers, the programme came to a standstill in Guyana. As a result, the project is paramount towards the sustenance and longevity of sandwatch in Guyana.

Project: Arterial Network-Conférence sur l’Economie Créative

Project: UMEC- Formation des techniciennes de la RD Congo en vue de la réalisation de projets d’accès à l’eau pour tous, assainissement.
Description: La République Démocratique du Congo (R.D.C), est un pays d’Afrique centrale, vaste de 2.345.409 Km 2, sa capitale est Kinshasa. Un pays qui est constitué de 26 provinces. La RD Congo est connue comme pays riche par son sous-sol avec les minerais et aussi par les lacs et rivières. Malgré cette richesse, la population rencontre des difficultés pour avoir accès à l’eau potable. Dans le pays il y a le service pour régir l’eau mais cela ne suffit pas. Project: OMEP-The toy libraries project: learning life through play
Description:
The Toy Libraries project is a high impact, cost effective, programme that gives children, their families, early ECD practitioners and early learning facilitators access to a collection of carefully selected educational and play materials, play spaces and training on how to use these toys to enhance development. 
The main objective of this project is to provide easily accessible quality early learning opportunities for children by establishing a toy library at their reach. Building on OMEP Kenya's previous experience for more than 10 years, this project would empower other countries to set up toy libraries and continue developing current proposals that aim to strengthen the right to play

Project: ICAE- Empowerment in action: Building capacity for transformative gender policy and practice in the Arab states
Description:
Led by ICAE with AHAED and UNESCO Beirut Office and UIL, the project aims to advance women's education and lifelong learning in Republic of Iraq, Republic of Lebanon, The State of Palestine, Jordan, and Syria. Stakeholders develop strategies through assessments and consultations. A preparatory phase precedes a five-day training workshop, fostering knowledge exchange and action planning. Outcomes include mainstreaming gender equality in education policies and practices, enhancing capacity, and fostering collaboration, empowering women in the Arab region through equitable access to quality education.

Key Messages:
•	Advancing women's education and lifelong learning opportunities.
•	Stakeholder collaboration for gender equality.
•	Capacity-building and knowledge exchange for gender equality in lifelong learning.
•	Empowering women through skills development and learning access.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particularly in Africa, developing countries, LDCs, and SIDS

Project: AIF-Formation de 5 Techniciens Hydrologues pour deux projets d’Accès à l’Eau en Mauritanie, selon l’ODD 6 UNESCO.
Description: AIF-Formation de 5 Techniciens Hydrologues pour deux projets d’Accès à l’Eau en Mauritanie, selon l’ODD 6 UNESCO.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particularly in Africa, developing countries, LDCs, and SIDS

Project: Appui au développement des industries culturelles et créatives et auto
Description: L'objectif de ce projet est de doter les jeunes de compétences nécessaires dans le secteur de la culture y compris les TIC aux fins de contribuer à créer des emplois durables et décents et de renforcer leur autonomisation en qualité d'acteurs et opérateurs à travers l'entreprenariat culturel et la mise en valeur marchande des produits culturels.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PAX3 - Impact and visibility of UNESCO's programmes in Africa strengthened through enhanced coordination, monitoring and mobilization of partners in relation to the Operational Strategy for Priority Africa (2022-2029), and better understanding of Africa's development opportunities and challenges

Project: UNESCO-King Hamad Bin Isa Al-Khalifa Prize for the use of ICT in Education
