Description: The objectives of the Prize are consonant with UNESCO's goals and policies aimed at enhancing the quality of learning, teaching and overall educational performance through appropriate use of information and communication technologies (ICT). Its purpose is to reward projects and activities of individuals, institutions, other entities or non-governmental organizations for excellent models, best practice and innovative use of ICT in education.
Outcome EN: Outcome 8 - Foster knowledge sharing and skills development in the digital age
Output EN: 8.ED8 - Technologies and digital innovations leveraged to ensure more inclusive, effective and relevant learning

Project: UNESCO Prize for Global Citizenship Education
Description: The UNESCO Prize for Global Citizenship Education  was proposed by the Republic of Korea, and adopted by 220 EX/13.I (September 2024). The Prize  shall be awarded biennially for an initial period of six years (2024-2029). The Prize shall  consist of two awards of US $50,000 each, recognizing achievements in two categories: (1) youth-led organizations, and (2) individuals, institutions, non-governmental organizations or other entities,  who  have  made  outstanding  contributions  to,  and  achieved  remarkable  outcomes  in,  promoting GCED.
Outcome EN: Outcome 7 - Promote inclusion and combat discrimination, hate speech and stereotypes
Output EN: 7.ED3 - Learners are empowered to lead healthy lives, promote sustainable development and engage with the world as creative and responsible global citizens

Project: UNESCO-Greece Melina Mercouri International Prize for the Safeguarding and Management of Cultural Landscapes
Description: The purpose of the UNESCO-Greece Melina Mercouri International Prize for the Safeguarding and Management of Cultural Landscapes is to reward outstanding examples of action to safeguard and enhance the world's major cultural landscapes. It bears the name of Melina Mercouri, a precursor of integrated conservation and sustainable development, former Minister of Culture of Greece. The objective of the Prize is in conformity with UNESCO's policies and is related to the Programme of the Organization in the field of Culture, the overall strategy of the World Heritage Committee, and the priorities set out in the C/5 on the enhancement of management of World Heritage properties.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: Programme of emergency assistance for Beirut (Culture)
Description: At its 220th session in October 2024, the Executive Board adopted 220 EX/Decision 44, which calls upon UNESCO to prepare an Action Plan covering all relevant fields of competence of UNESCO, to establish a Special Account for extrabudgetary funds for the   emergency   response   in   Lebanon, in   accordance   with   UNESCO’s   Financial   Regulations. This Element concerns the Culture component of this programme.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT3 - Member States capacities strengthened for better preparedness, mitigation and response to emergencies affecting culture, including in situations of armed conflict and disaster

Project: Gaza Special Account - Programme Design, Outreach, Backstopping and Oversight
Description: To strengthen the UNESCO Ramallah Office in its essential role in ensuring on the ground coordination, assessment of needs, monitoring and oversight, as well as engaging in co-creation with partners, and outreach and communication activities. Ensure that an appropriate enabling environment is in place in terms of human resources, logistics and security for UNESCO to exercise its role on the ground.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PAX6 - Cooperation with the United Nations system in the context of the UN Development System Reform is better articulated and strengthened at the global, regional and country level

Project: Advancing National Monitoring and Reporting Mechanisms on SDG indicato
Description:
This project aims at building the national capacity to assess, advocate for and inform about the status of implementation of access to information (ATI) instruments in seven countries, in order to mobilize duty bearers to introduce/improve policies and practices that increase public access to information.

Against this background, this project will support seven countries - Côte d'Ivoire, Ethiopia, Ghana, Morocco, Senegal, and Tunisia - to pilot a data collection mechanism.
Outcome EN: Outcome 6 - Promote freedom of expression and the right to information
Output EN: 6.CI2 - Member States have strengthened capacities and raised awareness to enhance norms and policies related to freedom of expression, press freedom, safety of journalists, including women journalists, and the right to access information, online and offline

Project: Strengthening Media Self-Regulatory Mechanisms in Timor Leste
Description: The project contributes to the strengthening of self-regulatory mechanisms of the media in Timor Leste and in the long term, foster an enabling environment for a sustainable, free, independent, and professional media in the country.
Outcome EN: Outcome 6 - Promote freedom of expression and the right to information
Output EN: 6.CI2 - Member States have strengthened capacities and raised awareness to enhance norms and policies related to freedom of expression, press freedom, safety of journalists, including women journalists, and the right to access information, online and offline

Project: France Secondment to the UN Ocean Decade Coordination Unit
Description: The objective of the proposed support is to contribute to the achievement of the Ocean Decade vision and mission with its ultimate aim of fostering sustainable and integrated ocean management across the global ocean. The Govt of France through this activity will second an expert to the IOC Secretariat to meet its responsibilities regarding the coordination of the Ocean Decade
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health and accelerate the transition towards sustainable management of ocean-related risks and opportunities

Project: Lifting barriers - Educated boys for gender equality
Description:
This  research project aims to understand how addressing harmful masculine gender norms keeps 
boys engaged in school and learning, and promotes gender equality, and what conditions 
facilitate successful implementation and scale-up.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED2 - Gender transformative education systems empower learners, ensure safe learning environments and address the educational barriers, particularly for girls and women, exacerbated by the learning crisis

Project: Gendered approach to Preventing Violent Extremism in Iraq through Educ
Description: The project aims at fostering a new sense of community where community members are more resilient to radicalising narratives and actively participating in processes to build peaceful co-existence living in the liberated areas of Anbar and Ninewa governorates underpinned by education that nurtures critical thinking and values the behaviours associated with mutual respect and co-existence.
Outcome EN: Outcome 7 - Promote inclusion and combat discrimination, hate speech and stereotypes
Output EN: 7.ED3 - Learners are empowered to lead healthy lives, promote sustainable development and engage with the world as creative and responsible global citizens

Project: Promoting Global Citizenship Education in the Asia-Pacific Region thro
Description: This project aims at advancing global citizenship education (GCED) in the Asia-Pacific region by cultivating the awareness of and capacity for a whole-school approach to GCED among teachers and school leaders. It will deliver a Practical Guide on Whole-School Approach to GCED for Teachers and School Leader, as well as provide capacity-building trainings based on the guide for teachers and leaders of pilot schools in the participating countries who will apply the whole-school approach to their work. The pilot-tested Practical Guide will be widely disseminated across and beyond the region.
Outcome EN: Outcome 7 - Promote inclusion and combat discrimination, hate speech and stereotypes
Output EN: 7.ED3 - Learners are empowered to lead healthy lives, promote sustainable development and engage with the world as creative and responsible global citizens

Project: SDCI Phase II
Description: At the end of the project, a self-evaluation will be conducted as part of the final narrative report, which will be validated by an external expert commissioned by WHC, in close cooperation with BSP and/or IOS. The necessary funding has been identified in the budget.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: Rehabilitation and Valorization of Wadi Qadisha
Description:
Within the framework of the management plan approved in December 2015 for the World Heritage Site of Wadi Qadisha , the project which aims to develop properly the cultural resources of the Qadisha valley ,has three components:
a-Social component: Improving mobility within the valley through rehabilitation of pedestrian paths .
b-Heritage component: Conservation and restoration of selected religious historic heritage structures .
c-Academic component: Training and workshops for the conservation and the restoration of cultural assets.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: eDNAqua-Plan: A Plan towards an eDNA reference library and data repository for Aquatic Organisms, navigating Europe towards the next generation biodiversity monitoring
Description: The eDNAqua-Plan project will develop a plan for establishing a digital ecosystem of eDNA repositories and an integrated reference library for marine and freshwater species that is open-access and based on the international data principles of Findable, Accessible, Interoperable and Reusable (FAIR) data to support future aquatic biodiversity monitoring programmes and mapping initiatives.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health and accelerate the transition towards sustainable management of ocean-related risks and opportunities

Project: Inter-regional and cross-cutting action aiming to strengthen the fight
Description: This project aims at reducing the illicit trafficking of cultural property within the European Union and its neighbouring countries by reinforcing capacities and skills of key professionals and by raising awareness of concerned institutions as well as the general public in source, transit and destination countries. The project capitalizes on previous actions undertaken within the framework of two EU-UNESCO joint initiatives, whilst enlarging the scope of target groups and final beneficiaries.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT2 - Member States capacities strengthened to fight the illicit trafficking of cultural property and promote its return and restitution, to protect underwater cultural heritage and to promote the role of museums for societies

Project: Funding the evaluation of nominations to the World Heritage List (2022-2023)
Description:
The WH Fund sub-account for funding the evaluation of nominations by the Advisory Bodies was created in 2019 (Decision 43 COM 14). It aims at sharing the costs of evaluations between the WH Fund and the submitting States Parties through the payment, on a voluntary basis, of a lump sum to the Fund, allowing for a shifting of resources to conservation activities.
In 2021, the Committee decided to use up to 40% of the funds available in this sub-account during the period August 2021-September 2023 to fund the Preliminary Assessment activities that take place in 2023, being mindful that the sub-account shall also be used to support conservation activities (Decision 44 COM 14).
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: Emergency Assistance from the World Heritage Fund
Description:
This reserve fund established by the World Heritage Convention is part of the World Heritage Fund. It supports the States Parties to the World Heritage Convention to face severe damage that occurred to the cultural or natural sites located on their territories and inscribed on the World Heritage List.
The World Heritage Committee has voted a budget of US$400,000 under this reserve fund for 2022-2023.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: Advisory services by ICOMOS for 2022-2023
Description: Under the provisions of Articles 13(7) and 14(2) of the Convention Concerning the Protection of the World Cultural and Natural Heritage, UNESCO is requested to utilize the services of ICOMOS in the preparation of the documentation and agenda of the statutory and other meetings of the World Heritage Committee. This activity covers the Monitoring Services, Evaluation Services and other advisory services to be provided by ICOMOS in the implementation of the Convention during the period 2022-2023.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: Advisory services by ICCROM for 2022-2023
Description: ICCROM's statutory functions in relation to the 1972 World Heritage Convention are to carry out research, documentation, technical assistance, training and public awareness programmes to strengthen conservation of cultural heritage. Its advisory services include training for cultural heritage, monitoring the state of conservation of World Heritage cultural properties, reviewing requests from International Assistance submitted by States Parties, and providing input and support for capacity-building activities.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: World Heritage Committee: participation of experts from developing countries (2022-2023)
Description: "World Heritage Committee: participation of experts from developing countries" is the budget line voted by the World Heritage Committee under the World Heritage Fund for the period 2022-2023, to enable experts from developing countries, who are members of the World Heritage Committee, to attend its sessions in 2022 and 2023.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: Sauvegarde du patrimoine culturel immatériel à travers le renforcement des capacités nationales au Maroc, en Mauritanie et en Tunisie
Description: La seconde phase du projet 'Sauvegarde du patrimoine culturel immatériel à travers le renforcement des capacités nationales au Maroc, en Mauritanie et en Tunisie' réalisé grâce aux contributions financières des gouvernements norvégien et espagnol vise à : (i) Renforcer le cadre législatif et institutionnel pour la sauvegarde du PCI (Tunisie) ; (ii) Donner de la visibilité aux travaux d'inventaire menés au cours de la Phase 1 (Tunisie, Maroc, Mauritanie) ; (iii) Former les parties prenantes nationales à l'élaboration et l'adoption de plans de sauvegarde du PCI (Tunisie, Maroc, Mauritanie) ; (iv) Sensibiliser à l'importance des liens entre le PCI et le développement durable (Maroc).
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT4 - Member States and communities capacities strengthened to identify, safeguard and promote living heritage

Project: Training for teachers on Digital Citizenship
Description: The project will contribute in teacher preparedness and capacity development to ensure the continuity of quality education for all children and adolescents, by equipping them with the necessary skills to leverage the current and emerging digital tools and opportunities to enhance their professional practice.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED5 - Teachers trained and supported to improve learning outcomes and address the changes brought forth by the digital and AI transformation and the COVID-19 crisis

Project: Technical Assistance for Philippines Bangsamoro Education Reform and Development Plan (BERDP) Preparation
Description:
The BARMM is an autonomous region within the Philippines. In 2019, IIEP and UNICEF Philippines executed a UN to UN Agreement on "Technical Assistance for Philippines Education Sector Plan Preparation" which covered technical support to Education Sector Plan (ESP) preparation at DepEd National and also partly the BARMM. 
This Project is a continuation of BARMM technical assistance (TA). UNESCO Bangkok as main responsible office, and IIEP supporting some activities. TA covers support to planners within the Ministry in leading the plan preparation. TA will be done at different points in the strategic planning process and include country missions and contributions to data analysis.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED6 - Resilience, quality and equity of education systems strengthened to flexibly respond to evolving learning environments and to better deliver on SDG4 commitments

Project: Towards equal and quality learning opportunities to meet the diverse needs of youth and children in Palestine
Description: UNESCO Ramallah Office will continue to support both the Ministry of Education and the Ministry of Higher Education and Scientific Research in achieving the SDG 4 to ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and lifelong learning for all. It will support the ministries to improve the system-wide alignment, coherence and relevance of education policies and strategies, including preparing students for work, citizenship, and life skills in the 21st century to implement the Education 2030 agenda. UNESCO will also continue to support both Ministries to address the learning loss and promote the right to education for all, especially those who are being excluded from equal education opportunities on different grounds.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED1 - Education systems are equipped to promote inclusion, address marginalization and advance rights, including in crisis-affected and post-disaster contexts

Project: Improving teacher education and professional development globally
Description: UNESCO will support countries and TTIs to deliver teacher education in key areas, including digital skills and pedagogical competencies for online, remote and hybrid education, gender sensitive and innovative pedagogies including socio-emotional learning, ESD and GCED. This will be done by supporting Member States to develop and update competency standards and frameworks, and by embedding educational resources produced by UNESCO and by partners of the Global Education Coalition in the educational programmes of teacher training institutions. The Global Teacher Campus will broker and adapt these resources based on countries' needs and demands. Africa and SIDS will be prioritized and UNESCO's Institutes and Category II Centers will play a key role to train and support teachers.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED5 - Teachers trained and supported to improve learning outcomes and address the changes brought forth by the digital and AI transformation and the COVID-19 crisis

Project: Enhancing Teacher roles in ensuring learning continuity and quality learning outcomes
Description: UNESCO BEI EO5 programme builds on achievements of the previous Biennium by expanding its activities on teacher roles in ensuring learning continuity and enhancing alignment for learning. Several major resources initiated during the previous Biennium will be finalized (i.e. Alignment for Learning Guide; Learning Assessment Framework for the Arab Region; and Collection/Repository of promising practices and Teacher comprehensive Brief) that will serve as reference for policy dialogue, capacity development activities and new studies/research in the Arab Region. Activities will advocate teacher autonomy and enhanced competencies in mastering ICTs across the curriculum, adjusting curricula to local circumstances and new needs, and engaging in formative assessment/assessment as learning.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED5 - Teachers trained and supported to improve learning outcomes and address the changes brought forth by the digital and AI transformation and the COVID-19 crisis

Project: Program of teacher communities of practice in Guatemala
Description:
The Education Sector of the UNESCO Office in Guatemala, in alliance with other educational institutions in the country, will support the professional development of teachers through their participation in communities of practice aimed to the design of innovative proposals based on their successful experiences during the closure of schools. Likewise, it will be promoted that teacher's communities of practice address their mental health and socio-emotional support of their students.

To this end, a participatory compilation, systematization and pooling of innovative initiatives successfully implemented in the context of the pandemic by Guatemalan school leaders and teachers will be carried out.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED5 - Teachers trained and supported to improve learning outcomes and address the changes brought forth by the digital and AI transformation and the COVID-19 crisis

Project: Supporting the monitoring, evaluation and reporting of the National Education Strategic Plan and SDG4 in Jordan
Description: UNESCO will support the Government of Jordan to strengthen its education system, by way of capacity building for policy/planning, monitoring, evaluation, and reporting of results achieved against the Education Strategic Plan (ESP) 2018-2025, and the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development, in particular SDG4 and the Education 2030 Agenda. At the request of the MoE, UNESCO is committed to supporting the MoE in the strengthening and institutionalization of their M&E system and capacities to manage and conduct M&E activities that supports data-driven and evidence-based decision-making.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED6 - Resilience, quality and equity of education systems strengthened to flexibly respond to evolving learning environments and to better deliver on SDG4 commitments

Project: Resilience and equity of education systems strengthened to flexibly respond to evolving learning needs of learners in the Gulf Countries and Yemen
Description:
Providing technical support to ensure equitable and resilient education systems is a priority more than ever. The programme aims to tackle issues of equity within mainstream education (formal and non-formal) with a specific focus on technical and vocational education and training, while also providing support to education systems in their response to the disruption created by the COVID19 pandemic. 

In some countries, activities build up on initial scoping studies or situational analysis (Qatar and Kuwait), while in other countries (Bahrain, for example) initial assessments and situational analyses are yet to be conducted and will represent the bulk of activities for the next biennium.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED6 - Resilience, quality and equity of education systems strengthened to flexibly respond to evolving learning environments and to better deliver on SDG4 commitments

Project: Responsive Education Systems to Evolving Learning Environment in Afghanistan
Description: The RP Workplan supports ED Output 6 to have resilience and equity of education systems to respond to evolving learning environment and to better deliver on SDG-4 commitments in Afghanistan through supporting the participation of SDG national coordinator, planning, and policy focal points in the regional Education meetings and conducting gender-focused assessments and gender-responsive planning and policies addressing gender inequalities and gender-differentiated needs of the Education sector.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED6 - Resilience, quality and equity of education systems strengthened to flexibly respond to evolving learning environments and to better deliver on SDG4 commitments

Project: Development and maintenance of the global ocean data and information network
Description: Science-informed policies for reduced vulnerability to ocean hazards, for the global conservation and sustainable use of oceans, seas and marine resources, and increased resilience and adaptation to climate change require reliable quality-controlled data and information as well as long-term time series of ocean observations. The IODE programme has, since 1961, established a global network of oceanographic data centres and information centres that manage, share and disseminate data, information, products and services.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health and accelerate the transition towards sustainable management of ocean-related risks and opportunities

Project: Contribute to Member States Capacities for Assessment of Risk
Description: Assessment of tsunami hazard and risk is required to support preparedness measures and effective disaster reduction. Results of Tsunami Hazard assessments translate into coastal inundation maps using a combination of numerical models assuming possible tsunami scenarios. At local scale such maps can be used to guide local tsunami response planning, to enhance the residents' tsunami disaster awareness and response during an event. Support under this element focus on enhancing capacity in coastal hazard assessment in a multi-hazard framework. Within the context of the UN Decade of Ocean Sciences for Sustainable Development, an additional effort will be done on atypical events, not directly caused by earthquake sources (i.e. submarine landslides and volcano).
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health and accelerate the transition towards sustainable management of ocean-related risks and opportunities

Project: Climate Change Adaptation in Coastal Zones
Description: One of the priorities in the context of the ICAM Strategy is to build the capacity of national and local coastal management agencies in designing and implementing coastal hazards mitigations, through the use of best practices advocated within new guidelines, as well as access to resources on the topic of hazards mitigation and climate change adaptation.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health and accelerate the transition towards sustainable management of ocean-related risks and opportunities

Project: Partnerships & Outreach (SDG follow-up)
Description: y acting as the focal point for ocean sciences within the United Nations system, IOC will continue to engage in relevant United Nations inter-agency activities aimed at providing assistance to Member States in the implementation of 2030 Agenda, in accordance with IOC's custodianship role in relation to SDG 14, as well as the implementation of the Paris Agreement on Climate Change, the SAMOA Pathway, and Sendai Disaster Reduction Framework. This activity will also support the IOC role as coordinator for the UN Decade of Ocean Sciences for Sustainable Development
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health and accelerate the transition towards sustainable management of ocean-related risks and opportunities

Project: ICAM & MSP
Description: IOC's Integrated Coastal Area Management Strategy is divided into the following components 1) Coastal and Marine Ecosystem-based Management and Planning; 2) Coastal and Marine Hazards Adaptation and Preparedness through EBM/Area-Based management tools; and 3) Coastal and Marine Data, Information and Decision Support Tools.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health and accelerate the transition towards sustainable management of ocean-related risks and opportunities

Project: Member States capacities strengthened in applying social and human scientific frontier knowledge to devise effective policy solutions to advance an inclusive development agenda with the aim to improve the well-being of people, particularly the most vulnera
Description: In line with the MOST Strategy 2016-2021 and the MOST Action Plan 2016-2021, a regional Schools will be developed relating socio economic impact of COVID-19 Crisis. The UNESCO Inclusive Policy Lab (IPL) will support the co-production of knowledge and its translation into inclusive and equity-weighted policies. The aim is to support the implementation of the SDGs' pillar on inclusive development through policy and practice. In Central America, the IPL will support the revision of policies related to youth and employment. Tools for intercultural dialogue will also be promoted and disseminated in the region targeting particularly afro descendant people.
Outcome EN: Outcome 7 - Promote inclusion and combat discrimination, hate speech and stereotypes
Output EN: 7.SHS2 - Member States capacities strengthened in applying social and human scientific frontier knowledge to devise effective policy solutions to advance an inclusive development agenda with the aim to improve the well-being of people, particularly the most vulnerable, addressing the legacies of the pandemic crisis and face the social impact of climate change

Project: Enhance the cultural heritage protection in Uzbekistan
Description: The activity is a continuation to the UNESCO initiative to support the Government of Uzbekistan to strengthen cultural heritage protection system. UNESCO has conducted an assessment of the cultural heritage protection mechanism/legislation of Uzbekistan and provided recommendations and a cultural heritage protection framework, which includes a comprehensive mechanism to protect, manage and promote the cultural heritage in accordance with the international requirements.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: Intangible cultural heritage and education: implementation of a pilot module on intangible cultural heritage for extra-curricular activities at selected schools in Jordan
Description: In line with the 2003 Convention on the safeguarding of Intangible Cultural Heritage and the Safeguarding intangible cultural heritage in formal and non-formal education initiative, this activity aims to test the pilot ICH module developed during the previous biennia for extra-curricular activities at selected schools part of the Associated Schools Project Network in Jordan. The module provides an overview of intangible cultural heritage including examples of ICH and interactive games to increase the learning experience. To the extent possible, the activity intends to follow a more innovative approach to education, by inviting teachers and learners to explore their living heritage and learn not only about it, but also with and through it.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT4 - Member States and communities capacities strengthened to identify, safeguard and promote living heritage

Project: Programme Operating Costs
Description: Programe Operating Costs CLT
Output EN: CLT Programme-related, operating and staff costs

Project: AGI - HQ indirect programme costs (CLT)
Description: HQ indirect programme costs (CLT)
Output EN: CLT Programme-related, operating and staff costs

Project: Contribution from HQ for UN Common Country Programming
Description: Contribution from HQ for UN Common Country Programming
Output EN: CLT Programme-related, operating and staff costs

Project: Supporting the development of a pluralistic, diverse, independent, gender-sensitive and professionally ethical national media ecosystem
Description: During 2022 and 2023, the UNESCO Office in Mexico will continue the work it began in the last biennium to implement the Media Development Indicators in Mexico, as well as the work to strengthen Community and Indigenous Media. Currently, the country faces a low level of trust in information and media by society, so it is necessary to restore this trust and continue to support the consolidation of an ecosystem of plural, independent, diverse media that integrate the gender approach and are handled ethically in crisis and emergency situations.
Outcome EN: Outcome 6 - Promote freedom of expression and the right to information
Output EN: 6.CI3 - Member States and media institutions enabled to strengthen media development and media pluralism, including through the International Programme for the Development of Communication (IPDC)

Project: Support for Field Office Resource Mobilization
Description: The Bureau of Strategic Planning will continue to strengthen UNESCO Field Offices' resource mobilization efforts by providing strategic support to Field Offices to respond effectively to emerging resource mobilization opportunities at national and (sub-) regional level. Emphasis will be placed on securing resources for UNESCO's Global Priorities Africa and Gender Equality, and for the Organization's priority groups SIDS and Youth.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.FLD4 - UNESCO Field Offices empowered to strengthen resource mobilization at decentralized level

Project: PBF Project - Preventing Hate Speech and Promoting Peaceful Society Through MIL
Description: The project will counter hate speech and disinformation while promoting peaceful and credible elections in 2020 and beyond the election period, and strengthen critical technical aspects of the electoral process to safeguard diversity, inclusivity, and gender equality to reduce the risk of community grievances becoming a trigger for hate speech and tensions. The project will also support the setting up of a multi-stakeholder platform to bring a variety of key national stakeholders, such as media and social influencers together to set strategic directions and lead action on promoting diversity, inclusivity and non-discrimination in Myanmar.
Outcome EN: Outcome 8 - Foster knowledge sharing and skills development in the digital age
Output EN: 8.CI5 - Member States have strengthened institutional and human capacities to integrate media and information literacy (MIL) in policies and strategies, and to bridge the digital and knowledge divides, through the development of digital skills and competencies, particularly in the SIDS, and among women and girls and different marginalized and vulnerable groups

Project: Contributions à la mise en oeuvre de la feuille de route année 2021 de l'UA - "Arts, culture et patrimoine"
Description: Suite à l'adoption de la décision sur le lancement du thème de l'année 2021 lors de la 34e Session de la Conférence de l'Union Africaine qui s'est tenue les 6 et 7 février 2021, cette activité contribuera à la mise en œuvre de la feuille de route de l'année en collaboration avec toutes les parties prenantes, notamment, le Champion des arts de la culture et du patrimoine, le Président du Mali, la Présidence de l'Union Africaine, la CUA et les organes associés ACALAN, CELTHO et AWHF.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PAX4 - Support to Priority Africa enhanced through increased and more efficient strategic partnerships with public and private stakeholders

Project: Core Systems Redesign Programme (UNESCORE)
Description: The purpose of this Special Account is to accommodate income, expenditure and reporting related to the re-started work on the redesign of UNESCO's core planning, monitoring, reporting, and financial systems, and the progressive delivery of a new integrated core digital platform - UNESCORE - delivering transactional, informational and collaborative functions accessible by Member States, Secretariat and other stakeholders.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 11 - Accountable, efficient and effective management in pursuit of the Organization's results
Output EN: 11.DBS1 - More integrated and properly codified project and knowledge management in support of programme delivery

Project: CapED SDG 4 Pilots
Description: CapED will roll-out in 10 CapED countries a pilot approach aiming at equipping beneficiary countries with the capacities and tools to align SDG 4 into their national plans and priorities. The approach will have with two interlinked components. One relates to the identification of policy priorities and gaps in relation to SDG 4 and the other to improving national monitoring data and information systems for SDG 4.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED1 - Education systems are equipped to promote inclusion, address marginalization and advance rights, including in crisis-affected and post-disaster contexts

Project: 41 C/5 OP6: Resilience and equity of education systems strengthened to flexibly respond to evolving learning environments and to better deliver on SDG4 commitments
Description: Resilience and equity of education systems strengthened to flexibly respond to evolving learning environments and to better deliver on SDG4 commitments.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED6 - Resilience, quality and equity of education systems strengthened to flexibly respond to evolving learning environments and to better deliver on SDG4 commitments

Project: CapED Programme - Education Response to the COVID-19 crisis
Description: The CapED Programme is an extrabudgetary programme created in 2003 based on the understanding that education reforms will not be effective if countries lack the capacities to make them operational. With an overarching capacity development approach, CapED seeks to improve the quality of education and increase learning opportunities, especially for girls and women and disadvantaged population groups. Under "Education Response to the COVID-19 crisis", CapED will address urgent needs to respond to school closures and ensure continuity of learning through distance-learning modalities and crisis-sensitive, contingency planning.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED1 - Education systems are equipped to promote inclusion, address marginalization and advance rights, including in crisis-affected and post-disaster contexts

Project: UNESCO-Greece Melina Mercouri International Prize for the Safeguarding and Management of Cultural Landscapes
Description: The purpose of the UNESCO-Greece Melina Mercouri International Prize for the Safeguarding and Management of Cultural Landscapes is to reward outstanding examples of action to safeguard and enhance the world's major cultural landscapes. It bears the name of Melina Mercouri, a precursor of integrated conservation and sustainable development, former Minister of Culture of Greece. The objective of the Prize is in conformity with UNESCO's policies and is related to the Programme of the Organization in the field of Culture, the overall strategy of the World Heritage Committee, and the priorities set out in the C/5 on the enhancement of management of World Heritage properties.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: Supporting the protection of the urban fabric of the devastated areas following the Beirut Blast
Description: This project aims to provide the necessary protection for the urban and heritage core of the devastated parts of the city as the result of 4th of August Beirut Port explosions, in particular strengthening the legal environment for the viable legal protection of the heritage buildings and urban fabric through the provision of international consultancy for the DGA to elaborate the protection and rehabilitation plan of the damaged areas.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT3 - Member States capacities strengthened for better preparedness, mitigation and response to emergencies affecting culture, including in situations of armed conflict and disaster

Project: PCPD Special Account Ukraine
Description: In view of the unfolding unprecedented emergency situation in Ukraine, PAX is providing support to Ukraine to respond to its urgent needs that fall within UNESCO's mandate. In the context of the ongoing conflict, the needs of Ukraine in the areas of access to education, safeguarding of cultural heritage and protection of journalists are enormous. The funds mobilised through this funding mechanism will be directed to address the urgent needs in these vital areas.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PAX6 - Contribution to the United Nations system in the context of the UN Reform articulated and strengthened at the global, regional and country level

Project: 41 C/5 OP1: Education systems are equipped to promote inclusion, address marginalization and advance rights, including in crisis-affected and post-disaster contexts
Description: UNESCO will support countries to integrate the right to education in their legislation and policies in line with international frameworks and commitments, notably the 1960 Convention and Recommendation against Discrimination in Education. Also, UNESCO will scale-up work for the inclusion of the most vulnerable and mar- ginalized groups, with a focus on translating policy frameworks into inclusive curricula, pedagogy and teaching, as well as mainstreaming inclusion in education in programme design and delivery
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED1 - Education systems are equipped to promote inclusion, address marginalization and advance rights, including in crisis-affected and post-disaster contexts

Project: 41 C/5 OP9: Education and learning reimagined through interdisciplinary research, foresight and public policy debate
Description: Education and learning reimagined through interdisciplinary research, foresight and public policy debate
Outcome EN: Outcome 2 - Strengthen international coordination for the achievement of SDG 4 and develop the global education agenda based on research, foresight and innovation
Output EN: 2.ED9 - Education and learning reimagined through interdisciplinary research, foresight and public policy debate

Project: Promoting gender equality and girls' education in the ethnic minorities areas of Viet Nam
Description: The project aims to improve access and retention of ethnic minority children, especially girls in lower secondary schools, and to improve the employment opportunities among ethnic minority women and girls in the three provinces of Ha Giang, Ninh Thuan and Soc Trang. The project will address the issues of: (i) out-of-school children and dropping out from schools, especially for ethnic minority girls, (ii) school-related gender-based violence and child sexual abuse in schools and communities, and (iii) limited employment opportunities for ethnic minority girls and women.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED2 - Gender transformative education systems empower learners, ensure safe learning environments and address the educational barriers, particularly for girls and women, exacerbated by the learning crisis

Project: Projet d'appui au pilotage de la contractualisation
Description:
La gouvernance des système éducatifs devrait être comptabilisée au nombre des axes stratégiques pour améliorer leurs performances. le dispositif de contractualisation appelé à constituer le cœur du système de gouvernance du système éducatif en Côte d'Ivoire s'articule autour de trois composantes essentielles :
•	Composante 1 : Déploiement du Contrat d'Objectifs et de Performance (COP)
•	Composante 2: Définition du cadre réglementaire de mise en œuvre et de pilotage 
•	Conposante 3 : Renforcement des capacités
La présente proposition de projet vise à appuyer le volet "conception des outils de pilotage" de la composante 2.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED6 - Resilience, quality and equity of education systems strengthened to flexibly respond to evolving learning environments and to better deliver on SDG4 commitments

Project: Towards greater inclusion and diversity in education in Jordan
Description: The proposed collaboration between GIZ and UNESCO aims to provide technical assistance to the Jordanian Ministry of Education (MOE) in their efforts towards inclusion in line with the goals and priorities outlined in the National 10-Years Strategy for Inclusive Education. The proposed project is part of the GIZ PROMISE Programme which aims at improving equal access to and quality of primary and secondary public schools in Jordan. UNESCO will support the following two main components: System Strengthening and Capacity Development
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED1 - Education systems are equipped to promote inclusion, address marginalization and advance rights, including in crisis-affected and post-disaster contexts

Project: Increasing TVET Competencies for Youth in the Palestinian Labour Market
Description: Within this project, UNESCO aims to contribute towards bridging the skills gap, minimizing the mismatch between the supply and demand for skills in the labor market, while incorporating cultural factors and awareness into the TVET track, in order to create value and meaning for students which links their educational experience with their forming identity and the process of their self-actualization. It will also provide 21st Century solutions to the student's learning and work experience including anticipated information about skills needed in the TVET track, which will have a great impact on the choice of the youth career path in Palestine.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED4 - Learners are equipped with relevant skills to meet individual, labour market and societal demands through literacy, TVET, STEM and higher education

Project: Strengthening Safety of Journalists and Professional Journalistic Standards in the Philippines
Description:
The project contributes to the strengthening of safety of journalists in the Philippines through capacity building for the journalists. The project will follow a gender sensitive approach including a focus on women journalists. In the long term, it aims to foster an enabling environment for a sustainable, free, independent, and professional media in the country. 
The main output of the project are:
•	Capacity building workshops to strengthen journalists' digital and physical safety skills, 
•	Capacity building workshops to strengthen journalists' skills on professional standards and ethical journalism;
Outcome EN: Outcome 6 - Promote freedom of expression and the right to information
Output EN: 6.CI2 - Member States have strengthened capacities and raised awareness to enhance norms and policies related to freedom of expression, press freedom, safety of journalists, including women journalists, and the right to access information, online and offline

Project: France Secondment to the UN Ocean Decade Coordination Unit
Description: The objective of the proposed support is to contribute to the achievement of the Ocean Decade vision and mission with its ultimate aim of fostering sustainable and integrated ocean management across the global ocean. The Govt of France through this activity will second an expert to the IOC Secretariat to meet its responsibilities regarding the coordination of the Ocean Decade
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health and accelerate the transition towards sustainable management of ocean-related risks and opportunities

Project: Support for the governance and central coordination of the UN Decade of Ocean Science for Sustainable Development
Description:
IOC-UNESCO was mandated to lead the preparatory phase of the Decade, in consultation will all stakeholders. 
Starting in January 2021, the Decade's implementation will be supported by a governance and coordination structure that ensures strategic and operational coherence, while allowing for agility and flexibility. This structure aims to create the enabling conditions to foster and support multi-sector engagement throughout the Decade. 

This project will support priority activities needed for the establishment and operation of the governance and coordination structures for the Decade.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health and accelerate the transition towards sustainable management of ocean-related risks and opportunities

Project: Gendered approach to Preventing Violent Extremism in Iraq through Education
Description: The project aims at fostering a new sense of community where community members are more resilient to radicalising narratives and actively participating in processes to build peaceful co-existence living in the liberated areas of Anbar and Ninewa governorates underpinned by education that nurtures critical thinking and values the behaviours associated with mutual respect and co-existence.
Outcome EN: Outcome 7 - Promote inclusion and combat discrimination, hate speech and stereotypes
Output EN: 7.ED3 - Learners are empowered to lead healthy lives, promote sustainable development and engage with the world as creative and responsible global citizens

Project: Bamiyan Cultural Centre (Phase III)
Description: The Bamiyan Cultural Centre project was planned at the request of the local community and is being implemented with its support. The main goal of the Bamiyan Cultural Centre Phase III is to finalize the activities of the previous phases and to deliver a fully operational and sustainable center which will foster the cultural enjoyment of the community, strengthen the development of its creative industries as a leverage for the economic development of the province and promote outreach activities for an enhanced interpretation of the rich culture of the Bamiyan Valley.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: Senior Programme Specialist (P5) Secondment to Hydrology Division (Theme 4: Water for Human Settlements)
Description: A secondment by the Republic of Korea (RoK) Ministry of Land Infrastructure and Transportation (MoLIT) of a Senior Programme Specialist will support UNESCO's activities in water sciences and in particular the thematic area of Water for Human Settlements of the Future. The secondee will provide guidance in the thematic area, enhance cooperation with RoK and MoLIT and be responsible for the implementation of a project on Climate Change and Water Security. In particular, in the development of policies and countermeasures to support Member States to reduce their water sector's vulnerability to climate change and strengthen their human resources capacities.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.SC2 - Water science, innovation, education, management, cooperation and governance bolstered for a water secure world in a changing environment

Project: Senior Programme Specialist (P5) Secondment to Hydrology Division (Theme 4: Water for Human Settlements)
Description: A secondment by the Republic of Korea (RoK) Ministry of Land Infrastructure and Transportation (MoLIT) of a Senior Programme Specialist will support UNESCO's activities in water sciences and in particular the thematic area of Water for Human Settlements of the Future. The secondee will provide guidance in the thematic area, enhance cooperation with RoK and MoLIT and be responsible for the implementation of a project on Climate Change and Water Security. In particular, in the development of policies and countermeasures to support Member States to reduce their water sector's vulnerability to climate change and strengthen their human resources capacities.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.SC2 - Water science, innovation, education, management, cooperation and governance bolstered for a water secure world in a changing environment

Project: Improving Access to Quality and Inclusive Education with Gender Equality for Out of School Children in Salah Al Din and Baghdad Governorates
Description:
The proposed action aims to provide approximately 17,000 Out of School Children (OOSC) in Salah Al Din and Baghdad governorates with learning opportunities by improving learning environment to be safer and more conducive and enhancing quality of education with capacity development of teaching staff. 

Together with the second phase of Educate A Child Initiative (EACI)'s project "Improving Access to Quality and Inclusive Education with Gender Equality for Out of School Children in Iraq", it will aim to reach the total number of 150,000 OOSC in six governorates of Iraq, including the 17,000 OOSC in Salah Al Din and Baghdad which are the target governorates of this particular proposal.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED1 - Education systems are equipped to promote inclusion, address marginalization and advance rights, including in crisis-affected and post-disaster contexts

Project: Rehabilitation and Valorization of Wadi Qadisha
Description:
Within the framework of the management plan approved in December 2015 for the World Heritage Site of Wadi Qadisha , the project which aims to develop properly the cultural resources of the Qadisha valley ,has three components:
a-Social component: Improving mobility within the valley through rehabilitation of pedestrian paths .
b-Heritage component: Conservation and restoration of selected religious historic heritage structures .
c-Academic component: Training and workshops for the conservation and the restoration of cultural assets.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: ASSISTANCE TO THE REHABILITATION AND REOPENING OF THE SURSOCK MUSEUM IN BEIRUT (LEBANON
Description: The project aims to rehabilitate Sursok Museum form the damages caused by the Beirut Port blast, and to ultimately contribute to the reopening of the Museum to the public by early 2022, and putting the Museum in the conditions to restarting cultural activities. This will be achieved through the implementation of the indispensable rehabilitation works, including: lighting system in the exhibition galleries and service areas, fire rated doors, glass partitions (cafeteria, public toilets and audiovisual room), false ceilings in services areas, electro-mechanical cables, equipment and accessories (smoke detectors, cameras for CCTV system, ducting and AC related accessories etc...)
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT3 - Member States capacities strengthened for better preparedness, mitigation and response to emergencies affecting culture, including in situations of armed conflict and disaster

Project: Secondment JAMSTEC
Description:
Under the direct supervision of the Head of Marine Policy and Regional Coordination section, the Programme Specialist seconded by JAMSTEC will be responsible to assist in matters relating to law of the sea and transfer of marine technology by: 
- providing inputs to IOC initiatives relating to UNCLOS 
- Liaising with Member States on the implementation of activities and programmes on law of the sea, transfer of marine technology and marine scientific research 
- act as technical secretary for GEBCO 
-mobilising extra budget in support of the implementation of IOC's mandate relating to UNCLOS.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health and accelerate the transition towards sustainable management of ocean-related risks and opportunities

Project: Inventing a Shared Science Diplomacy for Europe (InsSciDE)
Description: Domestic and transnational initiatives have long used science in global diplomatic engagements, in a diversity of ways and contexts. But this practice is fragmented, unrecognized, or lacking an overall model for leveraging and consolidation. InsSciDE - Inventing a Shared Science Diplomacy for Europe - will reveal, formalize and communicate this intangible capital, develop its conceptual bases and elaborate tools to help European SD emerge and blossom. From first questions to final tools and training, InsSciDE project will lead this process from inside science diplomacy - hand in hand with its practitioners, potential practitioners and other stakeholders.
Outcome EN: Outcome 4 - Advance international cooperation in science, technology and innovation
Output EN: 4.SC4 - Member States capacities strengthened to improve STI policies, access to scientific and technological advancements and enhance knowledge sharing, including through Open Science
Donor: European Commission/Directorate-General for Research and Innovation

Project: Most Easy, Efficient and Low Cost Geothermal Systems for Retrofitting Civil and Historical
Description: The project aims at applying a pan - European and innovative shallow geothermal solutions particularly targeting historical buildings, including UNESCO designated sites. The green technology to be developed will have specific characteristics, being easier to install, more cost-effective than the current solutions in the market, with drilling methodologies/machines well suited to operate in built heritage and environment and contributing to mitigate claimte change. Finally the proposed solutions will be tested in cooperation with the managing authority of the Ferrara, "City of the Renaissance, and its Po Delta".
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.SC1 - Inclusive knowledge and capacities of Member States strengthened to advance and apply science for sustainable management of natural resources, ecosystem and biodiversity conservation and restoration, and disaster risk resilience
Donor: European Commission/Directorate-General for Research and Innovation

Project: Good Governance for the Sustainable Development Goals: mobilizing UNESCO's water and environmental science networks for the 2030 Agenda
Description: The project accelerates the implementation of good governance and management principles for freshwater and biodiversity resources in Asia and the Pacific. Supported by the best available science, this will be achieved through reinforced engagement by UNESCO's scientific networks, linked to the implementation of site-based good governance initiatives at biosphere reserves, HELP basins, ecohydrology demonstration sites and other UNESCO-designated locations in Asia and the Pacific. Regional UNESCO scientific networks will serve as hubs for the transfer of knowledge and technologies.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.SC1 - Inclusive knowledge and capacities of Member States strengthened to advance and apply science for sustainable management of natural resources, ecosystem and biodiversity conservation and restoration, and disaster risk resilience

Project: Developing Digital skills and Education for Sustainable Development through Distance Learning in Palestine - Phase I
Description: COVID-19 affected education in Palestine as teachers and students moved to online teaching and learning and youth lost job opportunities. It is important to mitigate the impact on education and human resource development by providing digital and transversal skills for sustainable development through distance education platforms and TVET. UNESCO's project will target 300 of the most vulnerable and most affected schools in the West Bank and Gaza Strip during its pilot phase. This will ensure MoE will be capable of developing and uploading online lessons to all grades in Palestine and providing training in soft and digital skills for TVET students in different areas such as WBL.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED4 - Learners are equipped with relevant skills to meet individual, labour market and societal demands through literacy, TVET, STEM and higher education

Project: YouTube Education platform
Description: The project "Educational resources for quality education for all: restructuring of the YouTube Edu platform" aims to restructure YouTube Edu, a large broadcasting platform of educational videos, in order to promote among lower and upper secondary education students and teachers quality educational resources as a tool in the teaching-learning process. The target audience of this project are students, teachers, school community, and education personnel.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED6 - Resilience, quality and equity of education systems strengthened to flexibly respond to evolving learning environments and to better deliver on SDG4 commitments

Project: RENOVA-UNESCO partnership for the local development of the Mariana region
Description: This UNESCO crosscutting (SHS, SC and CLT) 3-year project is focused on fostering local sustainable development, promoting human rights and preserving the historical and intangible heritage affected by the dam collapse (2015) in the region of the city of Mariana (based in the vicinities of Ouro Preto, coincidentally a World Heritage Site since 1980). The project shall also involve the SC expertise, particularly the experience of UNESCO's International Hidrological Programme (IHP) and the MaB programme, in actions of participatory water monitoring and preservation of local biodiversity.
Outcome EN: Outcome 7 - Promote inclusion and combat discrimination, hate speech and stereotypes
Output EN: 7.SHS2 - Member States capacities strengthened in applying social and human scientific frontier knowledge to devise effective policy solutions to advance an inclusive development agenda with the aim to improve the well-being of people, particularly the most vulnerable, addressing the legacies of the pandemic crisis and face the social impact of climate change

Project: Improving access to quality and inclusive education with gender equality for out-of-school children in Iraq
Description: The project aims at providing access to quality and inclusive education with gender equality for 150,000 out-of-school children (OOSC) in Iraq focusing on six governorates with high numbers of OOSC. The main purpose of the project is to accelerate the achievement of universal access to primary education; by considerably lowering the number of OOSC and re-integrate them into the formal education system in Iraq. The three interrelated objectives of the project are highly relevant to improving access to quality education for OOSC in Iraq involving the key education stakeholders in a harmonized approach.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED1 - Education systems are equipped to promote inclusion, address marginalization and advance rights, including in crisis-affected and post-disaster contexts

Project: For the preparation of a conservation management plan for Oscar Niemeyer's Rashid Karami International Fair in Tripoli, Lebanon
Description: A conservation management plan, including as desk based study of the archival material, value based assessment and condition assessment of the physical fabric, in addition to some research and testing of original materials and techniques , will be developed for the International Fair at Tripoli, North Lebanon, one of the most iconic architectural achievements of the modern period in Lebanon designed by the Brazilian architect Oscar Niemeyer in the 1960s. the project will directly benefit the development of the World Heritage dossier including the identification of an outstanding universal value for the site and the definition of its authenticity and integrity.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: Sustainable Tourism Pledge - Promoting sustainable tourism with Expedia Group
Description: The partnership between UNESCO and Expedia Group to develop a Sustainable Tourism Pledge to inspire and provide incentives for local tourism businesses in key tourism destination countries to support sustainable tourism linked to safeguarding heritage and the Sustainable Development Goals. The UNESCO Sustainable Tourism Pledge will launch in Thailand with the parties coordinating to secure the support of the Tourism Authority of Thailand (TAT). The pledge will be used as a mechanism to engage tourism businesses particularly in beach and coastal areas and select World Heritage destinations in Thailand.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: Malaysia/UNESCO Funds-in-Trust Synthesis Programme
Description: Nearly a decade after MUCP's initiation, this activity aims to synthesize the knowledge base developed by the projects as well as the results of external evaluation, lessons learnt, challenges and to share best practices for SDGs under the 2030 Agenda. The synthesis will provide knowledge base for further adoption of products of MUCP framework and the related projects. To elaborate further, identification of patterns vis-à-vis to the output and achievements, design of the projects, relevance, implementation, impact and any finding from the synthesis will be presented, debated and summarized for policy audiences at all levels.
Outcome EN: Outcome 4 - Advance international cooperation in science, technology and innovation
Output EN: 4.SC5 - Institutional and human capacities in basic sciences, technology, research, innovation, and engineering enhanced to advance knowledge for sustainable development

Project: Associate Programme Specialist (JPO) Man and the Biosphere (MAB) Programme
Description: Under the authority the Director of the Division of Ecological and Earth Sciences, and under the direct supervision of the Chief of Section on MAB Research and Policy: Ecology and Biodiversity of the Division of Ecological and Earth Sciences, the JPO will give support to the implementation of the activities of the programme on "The Man and the Biosphere (MAB)".
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.SC1 - Inclusive knowledge and capacities of Member States strengthened to advance and apply science for sustainable management of natural resources, ecosystem and biodiversity conservation and restoration, and disaster risk resilience

Project: Junior Professional Officer, Ocean Science Section
Description: The JPO will assist IOC agendas, policies and knowledge products, ensuring technical accuracy of deliverables, and contribute to the bi-annual work programme & budget of OSS/IOC; assist in the development of international ocean science, delivering scientific advice for ocean policy within IOC expertise, particularly on ocean science & ocean health, including harmful algal blooms, ocean plastics, nutrient pollution & climate change, and the oceans & human health interface; assist to develop, plan and implement scientific training courses, seminars, workshops; prepare background material, manuals, guides, activity reports; organize ocean science & health's data compilation and sharing.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health and accelerate the transition towards sustainable management of ocean-related risks and opportunities

Project: JPO (Saudi Arabia) for Cabinet of the Director General (CAB)
Description:
1. Full time member of the Mosul Initiative Task Force core team
2. Assist the Task Force in ensuring smooth information flows between the various entities involved (mainly Iraq Office, DPI) in order to maintain internal and external communication on the Nouri reconstruction and rehabilitation Project and the overall Initiative
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 11 - Accountable, efficient and effective management in pursuit of the Organization's results
Output EN: 11.CAB1 - Rational and cost-effective functioning of the Directorate and Executive Office improved and UNESCO’s strategic positioning and leadership role as an active and efficient partner within the United Nations system in achieving the Sustainable Development Goals strengthened

Project: JPO Culture and Cultural Heritage
Description: The JPO will be under the direct supervision of the Senior Project Officer of the CLT Team in the Amman Office. Since the Office's portfolio on cultural heritage has been steadily expanding, new capacities, particularly with a law back ground and with a sound level of knowledge about UNESCO and its Conventions are needed. UNESCO Amman office has been playing a prominent role in Jordan in the protection and rehabilitation of the unique cultural heritage of the country. The KSA funded JPO will be placed in the CLT team, so that synergies and an increased level of coordination can be realized. The JPO will be able to contribute to the visibility of the programs in the safeguarding of heritage.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT2 - Member States capacities strengthened to fight the illicit trafficking of cultural property and promote its return and restitution, to protect underwater cultural heritage and to promote the role of museums for societies

Project: Technical assistance to include GCED and ESD in learning materials for Mexico
Description:
The Ministry of public education requires technical assistance in inclusion of GCED and ESD in learning materials. A guideline for revision of learning materials and a report with recommendations will be delivered.The project requires UNESCO to hire and train specialized consultants to develop materials. It involves strengthening the capacity of educational authorities and specialized teams responsible for integrating GCED and ESD into learning materials. The project will assess the relevance and usefulness that the materials have in the classrooms.
The learning materials will reach 1.2 million teachers and 25 million preschool, primary and secondary students in Mexico.
Outcome EN: Outcome 2 - Strengthen international coordination for the achievement of SDG 4 and develop the global education agenda based on research, foresight and innovation
Output EN: 2.ED7 - Education policy and finance decisions to achieve SDG 4 are informed by improved coordination, data and monitoring, knowledge and innovative partnerships

Project: Building a quality education in Parana State
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED6 - Resilience, quality and equity of education systems strengthened to flexibly respond to evolving learning environments and to better deliver on SDG4 commitments

Project: Modernization of the Brazilian Institute of Science and Technology Information (IBICT)
Description: This project aims to expand and modernize the Brazilian Institute of Science and Technology Information (IBICT) actions in order to consolidate its institutional competencies in collection, storage , systematization , analysis, dissemination and preservation of data and information related to STI. Created in 1954, the IBICT is the Brazilian organization responsible for promoting capacity-building and developing the infrastructure related to science and technology for the production, socialization and integration of scientific and technological knowledge.
Outcome EN: Outcome 4 - Advance international cooperation in science, technology and innovation
Output EN: 4.SC4 - Member States capacities strengthened to improve STI policies, access to scientific and technological advancements and enhance knowledge sharing, including through Open Science

Project: Support for the technical and institutional preparation of ADASA for the 8th World Water Forum
