Description: The objective of this project is to provide the ADASA technical and institutional capacities to enable the Agency to work with the Government of the Federal District in the preparation, implementation, monitoring and evaluation of the 8th edition of the World Water Forum, which will take place in Brasilia, March 2018, with the 1st edition of this event to occur in the southern hemisphere.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.SC2 - Water science, innovation, education, management, cooperation and governance bolstered for a water secure world in a changing environment

Project: Challenges to improve the Social Assistance System in the city of São Paulo
Description: Prepare the conditions for the Secretariat of Social Assistance in the city of São Paulo to consolidate the National Social Assistance system in the city, promoting well-being and social protection of families, children, adolescentes and youth, disabled people and the elderly, improving the services rendered by the Secretariat and by private selected organizations in order to improve the synergy between them.
Outcome EN: Outcome 7 - Promote inclusion and combat discrimination, hate speech and stereotypes
Output EN: 7.SHS1 - Member States capacities strengthened to advance effective policies and practices to achieve inclusive development through the promotion of human rights, scientific freedom, intercultural understanding and by tackling all forms of discrimination and racism

Project: Project "Resgate Barão do Rio Branco"
Description: This Project aims to strengthen skills and to broaden the reach of Project Rescue of manuscript and historical documentation already existing abroad regarding Brazil called "Barão do Rio Branco", as well as instigate its institutional enhancement, focusing on the need of identification, preservation of historic information and promotion of represented cultural heritage, be certainly or potentially, by its documental collection.
Outcome EN: Outcome 7 - Promote inclusion and combat discrimination, hate speech and stereotypes
Output EN: 7.SHS1 - Member States capacities strengthened to advance effective policies and practices to achieve inclusive development through the promotion of human rights, scientific freedom, intercultural understanding and by tackling all forms of discrimination and racism

Project: Access to Knowledge for Consumers
Description: The project aims to improve the management of information and knowledge of Brazilian National System of Consumer Protection through institutional strengthening of the National Secretariat of Consumers, also by improving public policies aimed at improving consumer protection Brazil and promoting the National Plan of Consumption and Citizenship.
Outcome EN: Outcome 8 - Foster knowledge sharing and skills development in the digital age
Output EN: 8.CI4 - Member States are enabled to foster universal access to information and knowledge, including through the Information for All Programme (IFAP), as well as through Open Solutions, and through the identification, preservation and accessibility of documentary heritage

Project: Instruments and strategies for sustainable development of the Historic Centre of Salvador, Bahia
Description: The objective of the Project aims is to train Mário Leal Ferreira Foundation - FMLF, public agents, private and social actors for the application of urban instruments foreseen in the Urban Development Director Plan, aiming the conception of strategies and projects directed to the requalification of cultural heritage and sustainable development of the Historic Centre of Salvador, Bahia.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: Open Government: Transparency and Prevention of Corruption
Description: The Project aims to promote the dialogue between government and society through open government initiatives, in order to ensure progress towards sustainable development goals, especially those related to institutional strengthening of public administration, in order to make them more effective and responsible at all levels. The main objectives are to implement programmes and actions that promote transparency, integrity and prevention of corruption in public administration, and to improve the relationship with civil society and private sector.
Outcome EN: Outcome 8 - Foster knowledge sharing and skills development in the digital age
Output EN: 8.CI4 - Member States are enabled to foster universal access to information and knowledge, including through the Information for All Programme (IFAP), as well as through Open Solutions, and through the identification, preservation and accessibility of documentary heritage

Project: APPUI AU DEVELOPPEMENT LOCAL A TRAVERS LES RADIOS COMMUNAUTAIRES
Description: Le principal objectif du projet est de contribuer au développement des médias locaux et partant à la réduction de la pauvreté à travers des émissions spécifiques au développement local comme le stipule le Document de Stratégie pour la Croissance et l'Emploi (DSCE), grâce à un accès élargi à l'information et aux connaissances pertinentes, ainsi que l'amélioration de l'environnement de la liberté d'expression, toute chose qui renforce la capacité des collectivités à participer activement à la vie locale et nationale.
Outcome EN: Outcome 6 - Promote freedom of expression and the right to information
Output EN: 6.CI3 - Member States and media institutions enabled to strengthen media development and media pluralism, including through the International Programme for the Development of Communication (IPDC)

Project: GEF PPG - Implementing Ecosystem Based Management Approaches in the Black Sea LME
Description:
The overall objective of the PPG is to develop the PIF into a Full Project entitled: "Implementing Ecosystem Based Management approaches in the Black Sea LME", that is compliant with UNDP and GEF requirements. 

The final outputs of the GEF PPG are: 
1.	UNDP-GEF Project Document (ProDoc).
2.	Mandatory annexes to the ProDoc listed in the Annotated UNDP-GEF Project Document Template. 
3.	GEF CEO Endorsement Request and all mandatory annexes; and 
4.	Validation Workshop report (required for projects with a high SESP categorization; as appropriate for all others).
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health and accelerate the transition towards sustainable management of ocean-related risks and opportunities

Project: Carry Over International Assistance 2020-2021
Description:
This administrative mechanism was put in place in 2006 to carry forward into the following biennium International Assistance requests funded by the World Heritage Fund which have not been fully implemented in the preceding biennium. 
This carry-forward concerns International Assistance requests approved in 2020-2021 and not yet implemented.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: Information Management System (2022-2023)
Description: "Information Management System" is the budget line voted by the World Heritage Committee under the World Heritage Fund for the period 2022-2023, to support the management of the information systems of the World Heritage Centre.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: Informing and Supporting the Enhancement of Teacher Policies and Practices in the Asia-Pacific Region
Description: The Teacher Regular Programme (RP) of UNESCO Asia and Pacific Regional Bureau aims to produce solid research and evidence-based information, analysis and advice for the member states to enhance their teacher policies and practices, in order to advance the teaching profession and address the emerging educational trends and challenges, especially those brought about by the COVID-19 pandemic and digital transformation. The RP also serves to promote and disseminate good practices and innovations in teacher policy and teacher training, as well as in teaching and learning.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED5 - Teachers trained and supported to improve learning outcomes and address the changes brought forth by the digital and AI transformation and the COVID-19 crisis

Project: Partnerships and outreach for system resilience strengthening
Description: Areas of activities foreseen in this workplan include: (1) communication and knowledge dissemination, including publications; (2) resource mobilization and partnerships, e.g., project document development and advocacy materials and conduct fundraising; (3) development of international communities of practice (COP) for peer learning and joint programmes and knowledge sharing.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED6 - Resilience, quality and equity of education systems strengthened to flexibly respond to evolving learning environments and to better deliver on SDG4 commitments

Project: Ocean data and information products and services to underpin science-informed policies
Description: Science-informed policies for reduced vulnerability to ocean hazards, for the global conservation and sustainable use of oceans, seas and marine resources, and increased resilience and adaptation to climate change, developed and implemented by Member States, requires reliable data and information products and services that are directly usable by predictive models, adaptive strategies and other strategies that will assist the global society with building increased resilience to climate change and other ocean and climate related challenges. IODE and its OBIS will continue developing and disseminating the relevant products and services.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health and accelerate the transition towards sustainable management of ocean-related risks and opportunities

Project: Promote Integrated & Sustained Warning Systems
Description: Tsunami warning systems depend on international collaboration, embodied in formal commitments, with the official support of governments. On the technical side warning systems depend on linking together a large number of national geophysical observations in a regional data network where observations flow in real time to designated regional Tsunami Service providers (TSPs) and National Tsunami Warning Centers (NTWC). IOC provides intergovernmental coordination for development and harmonization of regional Tsunami Warning Systems in accordance with mandate adopted at 23rd IOC Assembly (2005). IOC provides assistance for countries to develop their National Tsunami Warning Centers within a multi-hazard framework and for maximizing community response through creation of education and awareness.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health and accelerate the transition towards sustainable management of ocean-related risks and opportunities

Project: Tsunami Ready - Educating Communities at Risk
Description: IOC coordinates four regional tsunami warning systems. An effective tsunami early warning system is achieved when all persons, especially in vulnerable coastal communities are prepared and respond appropriately to Tsunami alerts. When combined with dedicated public preparedness efforts, early warning enables communities to know what to do in case of tsunami. In extreme cases (Palu, Indonesia, 2018, Tonga 2022), there may be insufficient time to produce any public alerts. In these instances, vulnerable communities must be educated and ready to act based only on natural warning signs. The IOC Tsunami programme for the UN Decade of Ocean Sciences for Sustainable Development aims to achieve 100% of at-risk communities to become Tsunami Ready by 2030.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health and accelerate the transition towards sustainable management of ocean-related risks and opportunities

Project: Follow-up to SDGs, WOA & State of the Ocean Reporting
Description:
The IOC will fulfill its commitment to be custodian for two SDG 14 indicators, 14.3.1 focusing on ocean acidification and 14.a.1 on scientific cooperation/investment. 

In order to meet the increased demand by decision-makers and society at large for current and easily accessible information on the state of the ocean, as well as to contribute to the UN Ocean Decade, the IOC will prepare a pilot 'State of the Ocean Report' (StOR).
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health and accelerate the transition towards sustainable management of ocean-related risks and opportunities

Project: Enhancing the capacities to promote and protect linguistic diversity and multilingualism
Description: The countries in the Jakarta cluster contains a rich linguistic diversity. In Indonesia, around 700 languages are spoken across its 17500 islands, in Malaysia around 130 languages are spoken, in the Philippines around 120 languages are spoken, whereas in Timor-Leste about twelve languages are spoken in the island state. Nevertheless, as in other parts of the world, many of these indigenous languages are under threat and are in danger of being forgotten. Many of these languages are also not available natively on the Internet, making it difficult to attract younger generations to use and interact digitally in their indigenous languages.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CI1 - Member States have enhanced capacities to promote and protect linguistic diversity and multilingualism, including in the framework of the International Decade of Indigenous Languages 2022-2032

Project: Policy advice and capacity building for duty bearers to improve legal and institutional frameworks on freedom of expression online and offline
Description: UNESCO will continue to provide policy advice to and reinforce the capacities of duty bearers to enhance legal and institutional frameworks related to freedom of expression, press freedom, and safety of journalists, including women journalists, both online and offline. This will include: training judicial actors, security forces and policymakers on freedom of expression and the safety of journalists, including in times of elections; and strengthening norms and enhancing international cooperation. New challenges linked to the digital ecosystem will also be addressed, including in countering hate speech and disinformation, promoting the transparency and accountability of internet companies; and taking a human-rights based approach to technologies such as artificial intelligence.
Outcome EN: Outcome 6 - Promote freedom of expression and the right to information
Output EN: 6.CI2 - Member States have strengthened capacities and raised awareness to enhance norms and policies related to freedom of expression, press freedom, safety of journalists, including women journalists, and the right to access information, online and offline

Project: Small project program to support documentary heritage at risk
Description:
In 2018, UNESCO and Qatar National Library joined forces in launching the regional project "Supporting Documentary Heritage Preservation in the Arab Region". 
Following this collaboration, QNL decided to pursue its partnership with UNESCO by reallocating the remaining funds of the project to implement activities in line with the targets of the original project.
This project will seek to support the preservation of documentary heritage in the Arab region through the creation of a "small project program". The program will focus on documentary heritage under threats by funding projects led by documentary heritage institutions at risk of manmade or natural disasters.
Outcome EN: Outcome 8 - Foster knowledge sharing and skills development in the digital age
Output EN: 8.CI4 - Member States are enabled to foster universal access to information and knowledge, including through the Information for All Programme (IFAP), as well as through Open Solutions, and through the identification, preservation and accessibility of documentary heritage

Project: ASIAN PROGRAMME OF EDUCATIONAL INNOVATIO DEVELOPMENT (CHINA)
Description: This is the voluntary contribution from the Chinese National Commission for UNESCO to run APEID activities, in particular activities relating to educational innovations. The Teacher Programme of UNESCO Asia and Pacific Regional Bureau for Education assists the Chinese National Commission and the Chinese Society of Education in organizing the Wenhui Award for Educational Innovations in the Asia-Pacific Region.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED5 - Teachers trained and supported to improve learning outcomes and address the changes brought forth by the digital and AI transformation and the COVID-19 crisis

Project: Building Partnerships to Assist Developing Countries to Minimize the Impacts from Aquatic Biofouling
Description: The GEF-UNDP-IMO GloFouling Partnerships Project is an intervention at the global, regional and national levels, with the aim to develop best practices and build capacity in developing countries for implementing the IMO and other relevant guidelines for biofouling management and to catalyse overall reductions in the transboundary introduction of biofouling-mediated invasive aquatic species. The project will be implemented through a Project Coordinating Unit (PCU) based at IMO. The Recipient Agency will take the lead in coordinating activities for the non-shipping aspects of the Project, including contributions from the private sector through the World Ocean Council
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health and accelerate the transition towards sustainable management of ocean-related risks and opportunities

Project: Enhanced partnerships and resource mobilization in the South Asia Region
Description:
In line with UNESCO's overall Comprehensive Partnership Strategy, the UNESCO New Delhi Office will sustain strategic alliances with key public and private partners (including civil society) from countries within its cluster responsibility, to build long-term partnerships based on a common purpose, mutual accountability and a shared commitment to deliver results.
To that end, and under the overall authority and supervision of the Director of the New Delhi Office, the Partnerships and Resource Mobilization Officer will coordinate the implementation and monitoring of the Office's partnership-building and resource mobilization strategy, in coordination with relevant Central Services and Programme Divisions at Headquarters, for improved programme delivery.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.FLD4 - UNESCO Field Offices empowered to strengthen resource mobilization at decentralized level

Project: Support to coordination and monitoring of Extrabudgetary-related PA activities
Description: This activity will involve providing day-to-day support to the coordination and monitoring of extrabudgetary-related Priority Africa activities, in close coordination with the team members of the Unit for Relations with African Member States, coordination and Partnerships.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PAX3 - Impact and visibility of UNESCO's programmes in Africa strengthened through enhanced coordination, monitoring and mobilization of partners in relation to the Operational Strategy for Priority Africa (2022-2029), and better understanding of Africa's development opportunities and challenges

Project: CapED Programme - Fostering Skills for Life and Work: Youth employment and entrepreneurship
Description: The CapED Programme is an extrabudgetary programme created in 2003. It is based on the understanding that education reforms will not be effective if countries lack the capacities to make them operational. With an overarching capacity development approach, CapED seeks to improve the quality of education and increase learning opportunities, especially for girls and women and disadvantaged population groups. Under "Youth employment and entrepreneurship", CapED will develop capacities across the system to create better coordination and linkages between TVET provision and the labour market and to facilitate more efficient and equitable transition to work.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED4 - Learners are equipped with relevant skills to meet individual, labour market and societal demands through literacy, TVET, STEM and higher education

Project: UNESCO-UNAM Jaime Torres Bodet prize in social sciences, humanities and arts
Description: This prize, sponsored by the National Autonomous University of Mexico (Universidad Nacional Autónoma de México, UNAM) was approved by the Executive Board of UNESCO at its 195th session, on 27 October 2014. The Prize, which consists of a monetary reward of US $50,000, would be awarded every two years with a view to rewarding the efforts of a person, group of people or international institution that have contributed to the development of knowledge and society through art, teaching and research in social sciences and humanities.
Outcome EN: Outcome 7 - Promote inclusion and combat discrimination, hate speech and stereotypes
Output EN: 7.SHS2 - Member States capacities strengthened in applying social and human scientific frontier knowledge to devise effective policy solutions to advance an inclusive development agenda with the aim to improve the well-being of people, particularly the most vulnerable, addressing the legacies of the pandemic crisis and face the social impact of climate change

Project: 41 C/5 OP2: Gender transformative education systems empower learners, ensure safe learning environments and address the educational barriers, particularly for girls and women, exacerbated by the learning crisis
Description: Gender transformative education systems empower learners, ensure safe learning environments and address the educational barriers, particularly for girls and women, exacerbated by the learning crisis
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED2 - Gender transformative education systems empower learners, ensure safe learning environments and address the educational barriers, particularly for girls and women, exacerbated by the learning crisis
