Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT3 - Member States capacities strengthened for better preparedness, mitigation and response to emergencies affecting culture, including in situations of armed conflict and disaster

Project: World Heritage online map platform
Description: The project aims to collect and create georeferenced maps for World Heritage in Europe and North America as a pilot region. This data will be uploaded on a newly developed online map platform, which will be embedded on the website of the UNESCO World Heritage Centre. Users will be able to access, visualize and analyze multiple layers of information related to World Heritage property boundaries and buffer zones. The platform will facilitate identifying factors affecting the Outstanding Universal Value of World Heritage properties and will assist States Parties to better protect properties on their territory.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: 3.1.3.Management of the trust fund at the World Heritage Centre
Description: Management of the Netherlands Funds-in-Trust at the World Heritage Centre
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: Secondment from the Republic of Korea for BEAR II project- Ms Kim Hongsun
Description: UNESCO mobilized extra-budgetary funding from the Government of the Republic of Korea (ROK) to support five selected countries (Ethiopia, Kenya, Madagascar, Tanzania and Uganda) in the TVET sector through a phase II of the Better Education for Africa's Rise (BEAR). The project's time-frame is five years (2017-2022) and the overall envisioned budget is 10 million USD. Ms Kim Hongsun will work under the direct supervision of the YLS section chief to oversee BEAR II implementation, coordinate with UNESCO Nairobi office and provide backstopping to country projects coordinators.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED4 - Learners are equipped with relevant skills to meet individual, labour market and societal demands through literacy, TVET, STEM and higher education

Project: Enhance the Capacity for Species Identification and Genetic Analysis on Marine Organisms in the Coral Reef Ecosystems in the Western Pacific - Third Phase (DRMREEF- III)
Description: This project was developed as the 3rd phase of the UNESCO/KFIT funded project "Enhance the Capacity for Species Identification and Genetic Analysis on Marine Organisms in the Coral Reef Ecosystems in the Western Pacific", aiming to further enhance the capacity of IOC member state in the Western Pacific and adjacent waters for using the genetic method for species identification, encourage data sharing and collection, keep constructing the established portal site, and to apply this tool to marine resources management and biodiversity conservation.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health and accelerate the transition towards sustainable management of ocean-related risks and opportunities

Project: Secondment of Associate Project Officer (project and community manager) to support the implementation of Phase II of the UNESCO e-Platform on intercultural dialogue
Description: To support the implementation of the second phase of implementation of the UNESCO e-Platform on intercultural dialogue (see related FIT workplan 11619), the secondment of an Associate Project Officer (project and community manager) has been agreed (P1, 3/4 FTE).
Outcome EN: Outcome 7 - Promote inclusion and combat discrimination, hate speech and stereotypes
Output EN: 7.SHS1 - Member States capacities strengthened to advance effective policies and practices to achieve inclusive development through the promotion of human rights, scientific freedom, intercultural understanding and by tackling all forms of discrimination and racism

Project: Accelerating the transfer of marine technology for the conservation and sustainable use of oceans, seas and marine resources
Description: This proposed project aims to, building on the tremendous achievement made in the past with the support of JFIT, accelerate the transfer of marine technology in the region on marine biodiversity conservation and seafood safety, through increasing their scientific knowledge, developing their research capacity and transfer of marine technology, in order to assist IOC Member States in the Western Pacific, in achieving not only SDG14 but also all SDGs which would also benefit from improved knowledge of the ocean.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health and accelerate the transition towards sustainable management of ocean-related risks and opportunities

Project: PhosAgro/UNESCO/IUPAC Partnership in Green Chemistry for Life
Description: In essence, the Project's activities cover the launching and implementation over five years of an international research grants programme for innovative one-year research projects in green chemistry and/or the use of its advances. Green chemistry is currently very much in the spotlight since it is a novel area of chemistry developed during the last two decades, and it brings a new approach for the protection of the environment, human health and the quality of life, and represents a significant departure from the traditional methods previously used.
Outcome EN: Outcome 4 - Advance international cooperation in science, technology and innovation
Output EN: 4.SC5 - Institutional and human capacities in basic sciences, technology, research, innovation, and engineering enhanced to advance knowledge for sustainable development
Donor: Open Joint Stock Company PhosAgro AG

Project: Building an Inclusive Asia-Pacific Network of National Information Centres on Recognition
Description: This project will help prepare developing countries to ratify and implement the Tokyo Convention based on fair and transparent recognition of qualifications. Through the project, the Asia-Pacific Network of National Information Centres (APNNIC) launched in September 2019 will become a more inclusive forum for information exchange on emerging recognition issues. Expected results include: 1) Increased understanding of the status and barriers to recognition of qualifications concerning higher education in Asia-Pacific; and 2) Improved national and regional participation in APNNIC. The project will promote a deeper understanding of fair recognition in Asia-Pacific to achieve SDG4.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED4 - Learners are equipped with relevant skills to meet individual, labour market and societal demands through literacy, TVET, STEM and higher education

Project: XB Established staff costs
Description: To cover the salaries of relevant staff.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 11 - Accountable, efficient and effective management in pursuit of the Organization's results
Output EN: 11.FLD3 - Enhanced administrative and operational support by addressing existing and emerging needs

Project: Preparation of sections of Global Partnership for Education Annual Results Report
Description: For its 2021-2025 strategy, GPE proposes to contract with UNESCO to provide the analysis of the SDG 4 indicators in the GPE results report.
Outcome EN: Outcome 2 - Strengthen international coordination for the achievement of SDG 4 and develop the global education agenda based on research, foresight and innovation
Output EN: 2.ED7 - Education policy and finance decisions to achieve SDG 4 are informed by improved coordination, data and monitoring, knowledge and innovative partnerships
Donor: World Bank/International Bank for Reconstruction and Development

Project: Assessment & Information for Policy
Description: This special account supports the IOC Function D: Assessment and information for policy as per the approved IOC Medium Term Strategy 2022-2029. The IOC work in the area of assessments and information for policy is fully consistent with the international commitments related to global assessment of the environment (in particular World Ocean Assessment, IPBES, IPCC and some regional assessments) as well as the role of IOC in the development and reporting on specific SDG indicators, and the Development of pilot report of the State of the Ocean (SToR)
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health and accelerate the transition towards sustainable management of ocean-related risks and opportunities

Project: Sustainable Management & Governance
Description: This special account supports all the activities under IOC Function E in accordance with the IOC Medium Term Strategy 2022-2029
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health and accelerate the transition towards sustainable management of ocean-related risks and opportunities

Project: International Assistance (2022-2023)
Description: "International Assistance" is the budget line voted by the World Heritage Committee under the World Heritage Fund for the period 2022-2023. It finances requests for assistance submitted by States Parties to the World Heritage Convention, in order to help them protect the cultural or natural heritage sites inscribed on the World Heritage List.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: Support to the PROCARIBE + Project
Description: The PROCARIBE + project " is a GEF funded project to which UNOPS has been selected as Executing Entity and IOC of UNESCO is one of Technical and Scientific Agencies and co-implementing partners. The project coordination unit is located and operating at the offices of IOCARIBE in Cartagena Colombia provided free of charge by IOC (UNESCO) as a contribution to the project.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health and accelerate the transition towards sustainable management of ocean-related risks and opportunities
Donor: United Nations Office for Project Services

Project: Reducing Nutrient Enrichment
Description: The objective is to foster research to deliver improved tools for management of nutrient loading to the marine environment. The activity will contribute to the development of the indicator for Sustainable Development Goal 14.1.1. on nutrient pollution, ICEP. The activity establishes a link between several IOC programs and projects as well as the activities of other organizations in particular UN Environment and the Global Partnership on Nutrient Management.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health and accelerate the transition towards sustainable management of ocean-related risks and opportunities

Project: CLT Evaluations
Description: CLT Evaluations
Output EN: CLT Programme-related, operating and staff costs

Project: Strengthening the capacity and raising awareness on freedom of expression, safety of women and men journalists and access to information online and offline
Description: The media in the region faces different challenges and obstacles on the road to becoming a free, safe, independent, and pluralistic media environment. These includes political instability, vague or inconsistent media laws, lack of diversity of media that is partially linked to media viability issues, as well as sporadic attacks, imprisonments, and even death of journalists. There are also classic media development challenges including lack of capacity building, technology, and funding.
Outcome EN: Outcome 6 - Promote freedom of expression and the right to information
Output EN: 6.CI2 - Member States have strengthened capacities and raised awareness to enhance norms and policies related to freedom of expression, press freedom, safety of journalists, including women journalists, and the right to access information, online and offline

Project: Strengthening media development and media pluralism to reinforce independence and pluralism of media institutions
Description: The role of independent media, including community media is vital to ensure the realization of sustainable development and even more in the context of crises and emergency situations. Media also play key roles in addressing the spread of disinformation and hate speech as well as in advancing gender equality, both in and through media. The digital transformation has had a profound impact on the media ecosystem and viability including in Jakarta cluster countries which was also exacerbated by the COVID-19 pandemic. Media organizations in the cluster countries also simultaneously affected by the lack of funding, pressing competition from the internet giants and partly economic recession brought by the pandemic to the media environment.
Outcome EN: Outcome 6 - Promote freedom of expression and the right to information
Output EN: 6.CI3 - Member States and media institutions enabled to strengthen media development and media pluralism, including through the International Programme for the Development of Communication (IPDC)

Project: International Fund for The Promotion Of Culture
Description: The IFPC was created in 1974 by the General Conference at its 18th session. It is intended to fund projects that promote artistic creativity and international and regional cooperation. Priority is given to young artists/creators (18-30 years old), to projects benefitting youth and to projects from or benefitting developing countries.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT6 - Member States capacities strengthened to promote, monitor and measure the contribution of culture to the implementation of the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development at the local, national and regional levels

Project: Semaine Africaine - Editions 2019-2022
Description: La semaine africaine est célébrée tous les ans au Siège de l'UNESCO, pour coincider avec la journée mondiale de l'Afrique (25 mai), à l'initiative du Groupe africain et en coopération avec l'UNESCO/le Département Afrique. L'UNESCO apporte à la fois une contribution financière et sur le plan du contenu pour soutenir cet événement (tables-rondes, communication, visibilité, etc). La contribution financière couvre notamment les frais techniques, l'hospitalité, l'interprétation et la location des espaces utilisés.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PAX3 - Impact and visibility of UNESCO's programmes in Africa strengthened through enhanced coordination, monitoring and mobilization of partners in relation to the Operational Strategy for Priority Africa (2022-2029), and better understanding of Africa's development opportunities and challenges

Project: World Heritage online map platform
Description: The project aims to collect and create georeferenced maps for World Heritage in Europe and North America as a pilot region. This data will be uploaded on a newly developed online map platform, which will be embedded on the website of the UNESCO World Heritage Centre. Users will be able to access, visualize and analyze multiple layers of information related to World Heritage property boundaries and buffer zones. The platform will facilitate identifying factors affecting the Outstanding Universal Value of World Heritage properties and will assist States Parties to better protect properties on their territory.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: Science Outreach and Engagement for Sustainable Development in the framework of the Ocean Decade
Description: The project will support the implementation of the UN Decade of Ocean Science for Sustainable Development (the Ocean Decade) which commenced implementation on 1 January 2021. The Ocean Decade is a UN-led global initiative that aims to convene diverse actors around the work to generate critical ocean science for sustainable development solutions. Structured around ten Ocean Decade Challenges it addresses issues ranging from marine pollution, ecosystem management, and climate change to ocean observations, ocean data management and capacity development.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health and accelerate the transition towards sustainable management of ocean-related risks and opportunities

Project: Secondment from the Republic of Korea for BEAR II project- Ms Kim Hongsun
Description: UNESCO mobilized extra-budgetary funding from the Government of the Republic of Korea (ROK) to support five selected countries (Ethiopia, Kenya, Madagascar, Tanzania and Uganda) in the TVET sector through a phase II of the Better Education for Africa's Rise (BEAR). The project's time-frame is five years (2017-2022) and the overall envisioned budget is 10 million USD. Ms Kim Hongsun will work under the direct supervision of the YLS section chief to oversee BEAR II implementation, coordinate with UNESCO Nairobi office and provide backstopping to country projects coordinators.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED4 - Learners are equipped with relevant skills to meet individual, labour market and societal demands through literacy, TVET, STEM and higher education

Project: Lifelines to Learning: Towards an International Declaration on Connectivity for Education
Description: Since the start of the COVID-19 pandemic, the right to education has become-at the global level-dependent on connectivity, especially internet access. The pandemic forced policy makers, teachers, parents and learners to attempt actions to leverage connectivity for learning at a speed and scale without precedent. The pandemic has revealed the need to rethink connectivity for learning in a transformed global educational landscape. This initiative will facilitate the production and endorsement of an International Declaration on Connectivity for Education, and will involve research and consultation.
Outcome EN: Outcome 2 - Strengthen international coordination for the achievement of SDG 4 and develop the global education agenda based on research, foresight and innovation
Output EN: 2.ED9 - Education and learning reimagined through interdisciplinary research, foresight and public policy debate

Project: JPO (Germany) for Health and Education
Description: Under the overall authority of the Director of the Division for Peace and Sustainable Development, based in the Section of Health and Education, the JPO will support the work of the Division and Section in the development and operationalization of policies and programmes to (i) support efforts in relation to SDG4 efforts and reporting, specifically in relation to Target 4.7; (ii) support the identification of good policies and practices, including through new research; and (iii) assist with support to countries in response to growing demands in relation to school health programmes, in particular:
Outcome EN: Outcome 7 - Promote inclusion and combat discrimination, hate speech and stereotypes
Output EN: 7.ED3 - Learners are empowered to lead healthy lives, promote sustainable development and engage with the world as creative and responsible global citizens

Project: Cooperation with other Conventions & Organisations (2022-2023)
Description: "Cooperation with other Conventions & Organisations" is the budget line voted by the World Heritage Committee under the World Heritage Fund for the period 2022-2023. It enables the Secretariat of the World Heritage Convention to participate in meetings with other Biodiversity-related (BLG) or Cultural (CCLG) Conventions, and to develop joint pilot projects within the UN system for a coordinated approach to the state of conservation or for the strengthening of management methods of World Heritage sites.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: Support to national reporting against SDG4 and CESA
Description: Building on the recommendation of PACE in 2018, regarding the establishment of a joint monitoring and reporting mechanism of Agenda 2030 and Agenda 2063, UIS and the regional offices have offered two workshops in 2018 and 2019, and member states committed to put in place institutional mechanism to report their regularly their progress. Namibia established SDG4 focal persons in all the 14 regions of Namibia to support the reporting process towards SDG4 indicators. Unfortunately, the Covid-19 pandemic has played against this momentum so far. There is therefore need for capacity building of those focal persons to ensure that their subsequent support to the regions yields the desired results through regular and accurate reporting
Outcome EN: Outcome 2 - Strengthen international coordination for the achievement of SDG 4 and develop the global education agenda based on research, foresight and innovation
Output EN: 2.ED7 - Education policy and finance decisions to achieve SDG 4 are informed by improved coordination, data and monitoring, knowledge and innovative partnerships

Project: Invest For Efficient Delivery - Learning and Development Initiatives
Description: The learning initiatives covered under the Invest for Efficient Delivery programme aim to provide a range of relevant learning opportunities and materials that will ensure that the UNESCO workforce has the necessary skills, knowledge and competency-base to effectively deliver the sustainable development goals. HRM has liaised with the relevant Sectors and Bureaux to identify the seven key learning elements to be included in this plan.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 11 - Accountable, efficient and effective management in pursuit of the Organization's results
Output EN: 11.HRM1 - Staffing, learning & development and staff well-being policies developed and implemented in support of a more diverse, efficient and agile working environment.

Project: IOC Governing Bodies
Description:
The Intergovernmental Oceanographic commission is established as a body with functional autonomy within UNESCO. The Commission defines and implements its programme according to its stated purpoe and functions and within the framework of the budget adopted by its Assembly.
The Governing Bodies of the Commission consist of an Assembly, an Executive Council and such subsidiry bodies as it may establish.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health and accelerate the transition towards sustainable management of ocean-related risks and opportunities

Project: Supporting the empowerment of women through social sciences flagship reports
Description: The Management of Social Transformations Programme (MOST) will produce an annual flagship report on inclusive and resilient societies in partnership with the International Center for Social and Human Sciences in Barcelona will contribute to foster the necessary changes to the intellectual underpinnings of the economic and social policy thinking of Member States to deliver better for people, particularly the most vulnerable, with a strong focus on the gendering of contemporary inequalities, including the empowerment of women.
Outcome EN: Outcome 7 - Promote inclusion and combat discrimination, hate speech and stereotypes
Output EN: 7.SHS3 - Member States capacities are strengthened to scale up their policy, institutional and legislative actions towards gender equality, to eliminate gender-based violence and discrimination, gender biases and stereotypes, including in the digital world

Project: Enhance Transparency Portal
Description: Further enhancement of Transparency Portal for 2017 in context of the structured financing dialogue and review of reporting modalities. Knowledge exchange on resource mobilization.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 11 - Accountable, efficient and effective management in pursuit of the Organization's results
Output EN: 11.DBS1 - More integrated and properly codified project and knowledge management in support of programme delivery

Project: Building Partnerships to Assist Developing Countries to Minimize the Impacts from Aquatic Biofouling (GloFouling Partnerships)
Description: The GEF-UNDP-IMO GloFouling Partnerships Project is an intervention at the global, regional and national levels, with the aim to develop best practices and build capacity in developing countries for implementing the IMO and other relevant guidelines for biofouling management and to catalyse overall reductions in the transboundary introduction of biofouling-mediated invasive aquatic species. The project will be implemented through a Project Coordinating Unit (PCU) based at IMO. The Recipient Agency will take the lead in coordinating activities for the non-shipping aspects of the Project, including contributions from the private sector through the World Ocean Council
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health and accelerate the transition towards sustainable management of ocean-related risks and opportunities

Project: FEE CONTRIBUTIONS FOR ACEID ACTIVITIES
Description: Every year APEID unit in UNESCO Bangkok will hold an international conference for about 300 participants and registration fee is charged to these participants. There is a theme for each of the conference and a call for papers. Abstracts of papers are vetted and the authors are invited to present at the concurrent sessions. In addition keynote speakers are invited to speak on the plenary sessions on specific sub-themes of the conference. The target groups are researchers, education administrators, teachers and teacher educators.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED5 - Teachers trained and supported to improve learning outcomes and address the changes brought forth by the digital and AI transformation and the COVID-19 crisis

Project: PRIX FELIX HOUPHOUET-BOIGNY POUR LA RECHERCHE DE LA PAIX
Description: 180 EX/17 (see http://unesdoc.unesco.org/images/0016/001623/162309e.pdf)
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PAX3 - Impact and visibility of UNESCO's programmes in Africa strengthened through enhanced coordination, monitoring and mobilization of partners in relation to the Operational Strategy for Priority Africa (2022-2029), and better understanding of Africa's development opportunities and challenges

Project: CapED Programme - Reinforcing Education Sector-Wide Policies, Plans and Reforms
Description: The CapED Programme is an extrabudgetary programme created in 2003. It is based on the understanding that education reforms will not be effective if countries lack the capacities to make them operational. With an overarching capacity development approach, CapED seeks to improve the quality of education and increase learning opportunities, especially for girls and women and disadvantaged population groups. Under "Reinforcing Education Sector-Wide Policies, Plans and Reforms", CapED assists countries in achieving progress towards national education objectives, including SDG 4 commitments, through relevant policies and improved educational planning, management and monitoring.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED6 - Resilience, quality and equity of education systems strengthened to flexibly respond to evolving learning environments and to better deliver on SDG4 commitments

Project: CapED Programme - Education Response to the COVID-19 crisis
Description: The CapED Programme is an extrabudgetary programme created in 2003 based on the understanding that education reforms will not be effective if countries lack the capacities to make them operational. With an overarching capacity development approach, CapED seeks to improve the quality of education and increase learning opportunities, especially for girls and women and disadvantaged population groups. Under "Education Response to the COVID-19 crisis", CapED will address urgent needs to respond to school closures and ensure continuity of learning through distance-learning modalities and crisis-sensitive, contingency planning.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED1 - Education systems are equipped to promote inclusion, address marginalization and advance rights, including in crisis-affected and post-disaster contexts

Project: UNESCO-Greece Melina Mercouri International Prize for the Safeguarding and Management of Cultural Landscapes
Description: The purpose of the UNESCO-Greece Melina Mercouri International Prize for the Safeguarding and Management of Cultural Landscapes is to reward outstanding examples of action to safeguard and enhance the world's major cultural landscapes. It bears the name of Melina Mercouri, a precursor of integrated conservation and sustainable development, former Minister of Culture of Greece. The objective of the Prize is in conformity with UNESCO's policies and is related to the Programme of the Organization in the field of Culture, the overall strategy of the World Heritage Committee, and the priorities set out in the C/5 on the enhancement of management of World Heritage properties.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: The contribution of universities to the SDGs
Description: With only eight years left to meet the United Nations' 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development, stakeholders across the research community increasingly need to demonstrate progress toward the SDGs. This project seeks to track findings and collect evidence regarding the materialization of universities' contributions towards the attainment of the SDGs at global level.
Outcome EN: Outcome 2 - Strengthen international coordination for the achievement of SDG 4 and develop the global education agenda based on research, foresight and innovation
Output EN: 2.ED9 - Education and learning reimagined through interdisciplinary research, foresight and public policy debate

Project: Output 2 Public policy-making strengthened in Member States based on scientific evidence, humanities-based knowledge, ethics, and human rights frameworks
Description: Strengthen the global projection of the value of the social and human sciences through a set of actions that includes flagship publications and high-level international forums that aims to support UNESCO's strategic function as a global laboratory of ideas, focused on impact in Member States and on influencing global agendas.
Outcome EN: Outcome 7 - Promote inclusion and combat discrimination, hate speech and stereotypes
Output EN: 7.SHS2 - Member States capacities strengthened in applying social and human scientific frontier knowledge to devise effective policy solutions to advance an inclusive development agenda with the aim to improve the well-being of people, particularly the most vulnerable, addressing the legacies of the pandemic crisis and face the social impact of climate change

Project: Foundational and 21st century teaching skills for teachers in the Caribbean
Description: Many teachers in the Caribbean lack basic digital skills; therefore, improving their digital competencies is key to the teaching profession. This project aims to build capacities of teachers, and school leaders on digital skills and blended learning solutions, and establish a community of practice for the exchange and collaboration of teachers on a national, cross-regional and international level. Main activities include: i) training teacher trainers and master teachers to become facilitators and tutors; ii) training teachers on instruction in online environments and 21st century skills; iii) establishing a community of practice; and iv) organizing workshops for policy makers.
Outcome EN: Outcome 8 - Foster knowledge sharing and skills development in the digital age
Output EN: 8.ED8 - Technologies and digital innovations leveraged to ensure more inclusive, effective and relevant learning

Project: OceanTeacher Global Academy Alumni System
Description: The aim of the OceanTeacher Global Academy Alumni System project is to build an interaction between the OTGA administration and the learners through an Alumni System which will be able to manage alumni data of OceanTeacher Global Academy past and present learners. The system will also provide a single registration for learners who currently need to register on two disparate systems (OceanTeacher Moodle LMS and OceanExpert) when enrolling for OTGA courses. The system will also improve the OTGA and overall IOC CD reporting requirements for UNESCO as well as individual Member States.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health and accelerate the transition towards sustainable management of ocean-related risks and opportunities

Project: Capacities developed for improved management of UNESCO designated sites
Description: Based on the ground-breaking experience developed by the Bureau in 2015-2019, the present intersectoral activity will support capacity-building on the management of "UNESCO designated sites" for sustainable development (in this context intended as including World Heritage properties, MAB Biosphere Reserves, UNESCO Creative Cities Network, Global Geoparks, and elements form UNESCO ICH Lists and Register), strengthening their contribution to implement the 2030 Agenda.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: Secondment from the Ministry of Land, Infrastructure, Transport and Tourism (MLIT) of Japan/Development and enhancement of International Platform for Reducing Earthquake Disasters (IPRED)
Description: This is a Secondment from the Ministry of Land, Infrastructure, Transport and Tourism (MLIT) of Japan/Development and enhancement of International Platform for Reducing Earthquake Disasters (IPRED), which is financially supported by MLIT, intends to identify gaps and priorities through the sharing of scientific knowledge and experience in the field of seismology and earthquake engineering worldwide, and to support the development of awareness, for the purpose of ensuring the better preparedness against earthquakes.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.SC1 - Inclusive knowledge and capacities of Member States strengthened to advance and apply science for sustainable management of natural resources, ecosystem and biodiversity conservation and restoration, and disaster risk resilience

Project: Secondment from the Ministry of Land, Infrastructure, Transport and Tourism (MLIT) of Japan/Development and enhancement of International Platform for Reducing Earthquake Disasters (IPRED)
Description: This is a Secondment from the Ministry of Land, Infrastructure, Transport and Tourism (MLIT) of Japan/Development and enhancement of International Platform for Reducing Earthquake Disasters (IPRED), which is financially supported by MLIT, intends to identify gaps and priorities through the sharing of scientific knowledge and experience in the field of seismology and earthquake engineering worldwide, and to support the development of awareness, for the purpose of ensuring the better preparedness against earthquakes.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.SC1 - Inclusive knowledge and capacities of Member States strengthened to advance and apply science for sustainable management of natural resources, ecosystem and biodiversity conservation and restoration, and disaster risk resilience

Project: Secondment of Associate Project Officer (project and community manager) to support the implementation of Phase II of the UNESCO e-Platform on intercultural dialogue
Description: To support the implementation of the second phase of implementation of the UNESCO e-Platform on intercultural dialogue (see related FIT workplan 11619), the secondment of an Associate Project Officer (project and community manager) has been agreed (P1, 3/4 FTE).
Outcome EN: Outcome 7 - Promote inclusion and combat discrimination, hate speech and stereotypes
Output EN: 7.SHS1 - Member States capacities strengthened to advance effective policies and practices to achieve inclusive development through the promotion of human rights, scientific freedom, intercultural understanding and by tackling all forms of discrimination and racism

Project: Communication
Description: Renforcement des activités de communication du secteur de la culture
Output EN: CLT Programme-related, operating and staff costs

Project: Global Water Pathogen Project
Description: The Global Water Pathogen Project will develop a knowledge resource to guide and help reaching future goals of reducing the lack of sustainable access to safe drinking water and basic sanitation through creating, publishing and disseminating the state-of-the-art replacement of the current benchmark reference work on water related disease risks and intervention measures, the book Sanitation and Disease Health Aspects of Excreta and Wastewater Management, Feachem et al. 1983. An online platform will help in re-writing and disseminating the new book in printed and electronic format in at least three official languages of the United Nations and following the open access policy of UNESCO.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.SC2 - Water science, innovation, education, management, cooperation and governance bolstered for a water secure world in a changing environment

Project: Promoting ICT Capacity Building and Open Education in the Era of Artificial Intelligence and Digital Technologies
Description: The project is aimed to support opening up of education to a wide audience of potential students and to develop teacher capacities in using digital technologies and content within formal education and lifelong learning. The project will contribute to UNESCO activities towards achieving the Education 2030 agenda and SDG4 for education through promoting ICT capacity building and Open Education in the era of artificial intelligence and digital technologies to strengthen quality in education and lifelong learning, including digital citizenship education.
Outcome EN: Outcome 8 - Foster knowledge sharing and skills development in the digital age
Output EN: 8.ED8 - Technologies and digital innovations leveraged to ensure more inclusive, effective and relevant learning

Project: Running Costs related to the Project of Cooperation within the office mandate.
Description: Running Cost funds for smooth operation of office.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 11 - Accountable, efficient and effective management in pursuit of the Organization's results
Output EN: 11.FLD3 - Enhanced administrative and operational support by addressing existing and emerging needs

Project: Japanese JPO - ESD for 2030 (2022-)
Description: Contribute to implementing the UNESCO/Japan Prize on ESD and the ESD for 2030 framework in general
Outcome EN: Outcome 7 - Promote inclusion and combat discrimination, hate speech and stereotypes
Output EN: 7.ED3 - Learners are empowered to lead healthy lives, promote sustainable development and engage with the world as creative and responsible global citizens

Project: Support to the Caribbean Large Marine Ecosystem (CLME) Project
Description: The PROCARIBE + project " is a GEF funded project to which UNOPS has been selected as Executing Entity and IOC of UNESCO is one of Technical and Scientific Agencies and co-implementing partners. The project coordination unit is located and operating at the offices of IOCARIBE in Cartagena Colombia provided free of charge by IOC (UNESCO) as a contribution to the project.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health and accelerate the transition towards sustainable management of ocean-related risks and opportunities
Donor: United Nations Office for Project Services

Project: Informing and Supporting the Enhancement of Teacher Policies and Practices in the Asia-Pacific Region
Description: The Teacher Regular Programme (RP) of UNESCO Asia and Pacific Regional Bureau aims to produce solid research and evidence-based information, analysis and advice for the member states to enhance their teacher policies and practices, in order to advance the teaching profession and address the emerging educational trends and challenges, especially those brought about by the COVID-19 pandemic and digital transformation. The RP also serves to promote and disseminate good practices and innovations in teacher policy and teacher training, as well as in teaching and learning.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED5 - Teachers trained and supported to improve learning outcomes and address the changes brought forth by the digital and AI transformation and the COVID-19 crisis

Project: Teacher quality for quality learning in Latin America and the Caribbean
Description: This workplan proposes to support LAC Member States in strengthening teacher quality as a way to address the overall need of improving students' learning outcomes in the region. The workplan is anchored in two main lines of action 1) Improving teacher education with focus on enhancing students' quality learning in foundational skills - literacy and numeracy; 2) improving teachers' professional status with focus on issues related to teachers' autonomy, agency, motivation and accountability in the context of teacher reforms proposing quality standards in the profession.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED5 - Teachers trained and supported to improve learning outcomes and address the changes brought forth by the digital and AI transformation and the COVID-19 crisis

Project: Partnerships and outreach for system resilience strengthening
Description: Areas of activities foreseen in this workplan include: (1) communication and knowledge dissemination, including publications; (2) resource mobilization and partnerships, e.g., project document development and advocacy materials and conduct fundraising; (3) development of international communities of practice (COP) for peer learning and joint programmes and knowledge sharing.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED6 - Resilience, quality and equity of education systems strengthened to flexibly respond to evolving learning environments and to better deliver on SDG4 commitments

Project: Strengthening the inclusion of persons with disabilities across South Asia
Description:
This workstream builds on UNESCO's programming to strengthen policy and practice to improve the inclusion of persons with disabilities, including through the production of various briefs to explore disability-inclusive COVID-19 governance in 2021.

Building on existing sub-regional work, this workplan will support Member States in improving (a) mechanisms, (b) mod-els and (c) capacities required for the routine generation, flow and use of domestically produced knowledge on persons with disabilities for use in social policies and programmes.
Outcome EN: Outcome 7 - Promote inclusion and combat discrimination, hate speech and stereotypes
Output EN: 7.SHS2 - Member States capacities strengthened in applying social and human scientific frontier knowledge to devise effective policy solutions to advance an inclusive development agenda with the aim to improve the well-being of people, particularly the most vulnerable, addressing the legacies of the pandemic crisis and face the social impact of climate change

Project: Fostering universal access to information and knowledge including identification of documentary heritage for Memory of the World
Description: The region is home to a rich and diverse documentary heritage that reflects the cultures, histories, traditions and values which also registered under the UNESCO Memory of the World (MOW) Programme. Member states under Jakarta continues to face persistent challenges in terms of difficulties in securing and having sustained resources, timely and quality preservation action, and utilization of technology in the preservation, making it difficult to the realization of sustainable preservation of documentary heritage. Additionally, none of the Memory of the World Registers in Jakarta cluster countries can be considered as documentary heritage that contributes to gender equality.
Outcome EN: Outcome 8 - Foster knowledge sharing and skills development in the digital age
Output EN: 8.CI4 - Member States are enabled to foster universal access to information and knowledge, including through the Information for All Programme (IFAP), as well as through Open Solutions, and through the identification, preservation and accessibility of documentary heritage

Project: Strengthening the institutional and human capacities on the integration of Media & information Literacy in Policies and Strategies and to bridge the digital & knowledge divides in particular among women, girls and marginalized groups.
Description: Digital technologies fundamentally change the ways individuals produce, share access information and knowledge. Technology offers opportunities for free exp for free expressions, access to intercultural dialogue among of citizens. The rise of digital technologies exacerbated challenges including the rise of misinformation, disinformation, and hate speech. In light of the emerging challenges, Media and Information Literacy serves as a framework and tool for journalists, educators, young people to counter disinformation, misinformation, and hate speech in the region.
Outcome EN: Outcome 8 - Foster knowledge sharing and skills development in the digital age
Output EN: 8.CI5 - Member States have strengthened institutional and human capacities to integrate media and information literacy (MIL) in policies and strategies, and to bridge the digital and knowledge divides, through the development of digital skills and competencies, particularly in the SIDS, and among women and girls and different marginalized and vulnerable groups

Project: Promoting the Use of Information in Educational Planning in Latin America and the Caribbean
Description: This proposal has two objectives. Firstly, to make the necessary adaptations to the current capacity building resources in the use of information for educational planning in order to consolidate them and make them more relevant and appealing to potential donors. Secondly, to implement a resource mobilization strategy focused on governments (national and subnational), and private donors and other international organizations that support governments in improving educational planning and the management and use of data.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.FLD4 - UNESCO Field Offices empowered to strengthen resource mobilization at decentralized level

Project: Knowledge management and information technologies initiatives within the framework of the Invest for Efficient Delivery Fund.
Description: At its 196th session, the Executive Board endorsed the Knowledge Management & Information and Communication Technology (KM & ICT) Strategy. It expressed its satisfaction with the progress made so far and recognized the need for a considerable targeted investment to fully implement the KM & ICT strategy. At the 197th session, five KM & ICT projects were proposed as part of the Invest for Efficient Delivery plan, as these investments could not be absorbed under the 38 C/5 Regular Budget. The Executive Board approved the initial phases of the Invest for Efficient Delivery plan.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 11 - Accountable, efficient and effective management in pursuit of the Organization's results
Output EN: 11.DBS1 - More integrated and properly codified project and knowledge management in support of programme delivery

Project: General History of Africa
Description: Compte tenu du potentiel qu'offre l'HGA pour la connaissance réciproque, la cohésion et la paix sociales, l'UNESCO a lancé en 2009 la deuxième phase de l'HGA, qui consiste en son utilisation pour l'éducation formelle, informelle et en sa mise à jour. Ce programme se trouve au cœur de la Priorité Afrique et contribue à la mise en œuvre des ODD 4, 10 et 16 et de l'Agenda 2063 de l'Union Africaine. Pour le Biennium 2022-2023, l'UNESCO s'efforcera de renforcer la production connaissances sur l'histoire de l'Afrique, travers la publication des nouveaux volumes de la collection et de promouvoir sa vulgarisation et sa dissémination auprès du grand public.
Outcome EN: Outcome 7 - Promote inclusion and combat discrimination, hate speech and stereotypes
Output EN: 7.SHS2 - Member States capacities strengthened in applying social and human scientific frontier knowledge to devise effective policy solutions to advance an inclusive development agenda with the aim to improve the well-being of people, particularly the most vulnerable, addressing the legacies of the pandemic crisis and face the social impact of climate change

Project: Support to coordination and monitoring of Extrabudgetary-related PA activities
Description: This activity will involve providing day-to-day support to the coordination and monitoring of extrabudgetary-related Priority Africa activities, in close coordination with the team members of the Unit for Relations with African Member States, coordination and Partnerships.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PAX3 - Impact and visibility of UNESCO's programmes in Africa strengthened through enhanced coordination, monitoring and mobilization of partners in relation to the Operational Strategy for Priority Africa (2022-2029), and better understanding of Africa's development opportunities and challenges

Project: 41 C/5 OP5: Teachers trained and supported to improve learning outcomes and address the changes brought forth by the digital and AI transformation and the COVID-19 crisis
Description: to be completed
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED5 - Teachers trained and supported to improve learning outcomes and address the changes brought forth by the digital and AI transformation and the COVID-19 crisis

Project: Digital Anthropology
Description: Digital transformations change all aspects of societies - not such specific practices, but also how humans understand and perceive themselves. They have the potential, as explored in an extensive literature, to make us fundamentally different kinds of beings. Making sense of these transformations and building the capacity to manage and to respond to them demands contributions from a range of disciplines and paradigms. Among these, anthropology has a distinctive and crucial role because of its long tradition and well-honed methods to study how practices connect to narratives and to identities to define the texture of a community or a society.
Outcome EN: Outcome 7 - Promote inclusion and combat discrimination, hate speech and stereotypes
Output EN: 7.SHS2 - Member States capacities strengthened in applying social and human scientific frontier knowledge to devise effective policy solutions to advance an inclusive development agenda with the aim to improve the well-being of people, particularly the most vulnerable, addressing the legacies of the pandemic crisis and face the social impact of climate change

Project: Secondment of senior programme specialist GEBCO
Description: Under the direct supervision of the Head of Marine Policy and Regional Coordination section, the Programme Specialist will be responsible to assist in matters relating to ocean mapping, Seabed 2030 and GEBCO.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health and accelerate the transition towards sustainable management of ocean-related risks and opportunities

Project: Rethinking and Redesigning National Smart Education Strategy
Description: The project aims to rethink about the educational ecosystems and policies on ICT in education in different countries to achieve an analytical understanding of the role of ICT in education. The initiative will pursue generating meaningful discussions and action in the context of strengthening the role of ICT in education, learning and teaching in view of the predicted, feasible and preferred futures, share a forward-looking vision of what education might yet become, and offer the most up-to-date and adequate policy agenda. It will effectively consider issues of privacy and security in a digital world with respect to learning and social interaction.
Outcome EN: Outcome 8 - Foster knowledge sharing and skills development in the digital age
Output EN: 8.ED8 - Technologies and digital innovations leveraged to ensure more inclusive, effective and relevant learning

Project: JPO (China) Education Planner and SDG4 Coordinator- for Regional Office for West Africa (Sahel) / Education
Description:
-	Contribute to the planning, implementation and monitoring of the regional coordination group on SDG4
-	Produce and coordinate communication and advocacy materials, briefs, reports, and presentations, soliciting, crafting and publishing news materials, and updating and maintaining the website www.education2030-africa.org
-	Strengthen the visibility of the group through the dissemination of articles on education, training opportunities and dispatch the pertinent information on the activities of the global SGD4 Steering Committee

Output EN: 2.ED7 - Education policy and finance decisions to achieve SDG 4 are informed by improved coordination, data and monitoring, knowledge and innovative partnerships

Project: JPO South Korea - BFM - Budget Monitoring and Reporting
Description: Under the overall authority of the Chief Financial Officer (CFO) and the supervision of the Chief of section for budget, monitoring and reporting, the JPO shall assist in the preparation, monitoring and reporting on the utilization of the Organization's biennial budget, as well as in dealing with various budgetary issues. The CFO oversees the planning and monitoring of the Organization's budget, and the Chief of section will provide guidance to the JPO in all aspects of the daily work in these areas.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 11 - Accountable, efficient and effective management in pursuit of the Organization's results
Output EN: 11.BFM1 - Prudent financial management, while strengthening of the internal controls and the second line of defense, supported by appropriate and timely management and financial reporting

Project: GEF PPG - Implementing Ecosystem Based Management Approaches in the Black Sea LME
Description:
The overall objective of the PPG is to develop the PIF into a Full Project entitled: "Implementing Ecosystem Based Management approaches in the Black Sea LME", that is compliant with UNDP and GEF requirements. 

The final outputs of the GEF PPG are: 
1.	UNDP-GEF Project Document (ProDoc).
2.	Mandatory annexes to the ProDoc listed in the Annotated UNDP-GEF Project Document Template. 
3.	GEF CEO Endorsement Request and all mandatory annexes; and 
4.	Validation Workshop report (required for projects with a high SESP categorization; as appropriate for all others).
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health and accelerate the transition towards sustainable management of ocean-related risks and opportunities

Project: Retrospective inventory of the content of nomination files of properties inscribed on the World Heritage List between 1978 and 1998
Description:
- Elaboration of Retrospective Inventories of the content of nomination files of properties inscribed on the World Heritage List in the timeframe 1978-1998
- Identification of outstanding issues concerning the delimitation and the geographic and cartographic information available for World Heritage properties in those Regions 
- Cooperation with States Parties in order to clarify the boundaries of World Heritage properties inscribed in the first twenty years of the Convention 
- Assistance to States Parties wishing to present proposals for minor boundary modifications (including the establishment of buffer zones)
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: ASPnet contributes to the empowerment of learners through transformative education to lead healthy lives, promote sustainable development and engage with the world as creative and responsible global citizens
Description: ASPnet links over 12,000 educational institutions in more than 180 countries around a common goal: to empower learners to lead healthy lives, promote sustainable development and engage with the world as creative and responsible global citizens. The network makes an important contribution to reaching SDG 4.7 and 4.c. Through pilot projects, members experiment innovative approaches to improve the quality of education and share good practices for scale with the network and wider education community, including policy makers. To effectively support its members to drive educational innovation and transformation, the ASPnet needs to provide substantive impulses, renew its communication and collaboration tools and provide quality assurance in order to play its role effectively.
Outcome EN: Outcome 7 - Promote inclusion and combat discrimination, hate speech and stereotypes
Output EN: 7.ED3 - Learners are empowered to lead healthy lives, promote sustainable development and engage with the world as creative and responsible global citizens

Project: Development and maintenance of the global ocean data and information network
Description: Science-informed policies for reduced vulnerability to ocean hazards, for the global conservation and sustainable use of oceans, seas and marine resources, and increased resilience and adaptation to climate change require reliable quality-controlled data and information as well as long-term time series of ocean observations. The IODE programme has, since 1961, established a global network of oceanographic data centres and information centres that manage, share and disseminate data, information, products and services.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health and accelerate the transition towards sustainable management of ocean-related risks and opportunities

Project: UNESCO's leadership for freedom of expression and building inclusive knowledge societies at United Nations HQs
Description: As the UN conceptualizes its response to the impact of the pandemic, UNESCO-CI mandate has a significant positioning potential. The NY Office will use its diplomatic standing, its communication and its convening power to guarantee UNESCO's positioning on issues such as freedom of expression and press freedom, security of journalists and media development, access to information and the fight against disinformation. These issues are increasingly being taken up by the UN entities; it is therefore essential to carry UNESCO's voice, to ensure its leadership and to work closely with diplomatic missions to ensure that member states take up the issues UNESCO stands for. The NY Office will establish synergies between the UN based entities such as the General Assembly, HLPF, ECOSOC and others.
Outcome EN: Outcome 6 - Promote freedom of expression and the right to information
Output EN: 6.CI2 - Member States have strengthened capacities and raised awareness to enhance norms and policies related to freedom of expression, press freedom, safety of journalists, including women journalists, and the right to access information, online and offline

Project: UNESCO Greening Education Partnership in Asia and the Pacific - Climate Education for Sustainable Development
Description:
The UN Secretary General's Transforming Education Summit and its Greening Education Partnership Initiative have gained significant momentum in Asia and the Pacific. Member States are requesting UNESCO's technical and guiding support towards greening education "getting every learner climate-ready".
 
At global level, various partners have committed to support the Greening Education Partnership which is led by UNESCO. To build on fostered momentum and to translate global commitment into regional and national commitment and action in the Asia Pacific, UNESCO Bangkok is carrying out a set of activities to mobilize voluntary contributions from bi- and multi-lateral development partner.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.FLD4 - UNESCO Field Offices empowered to strengthen resource mobilization at decentralized level

Project: World Philosophy Day
Description: By celebrating World Philosophy Day each year, on the third Thursday of November, UNESCO underlines the enduring value of philosophy for the development of human thought, for each culture and for each individual.
Outcome EN: Outcome 7 - Promote inclusion and combat discrimination, hate speech and stereotypes
Output EN: 7.SHS2 - Member States capacities strengthened in applying social and human scientific frontier knowledge to devise effective policy solutions to advance an inclusive development agenda with the aim to improve the well-being of people, particularly the most vulnerable, addressing the legacies of the pandemic crisis and face the social impact of climate change

Project: Coordination and monitoring of intersectoral extrabudgetary initiatives for Priority Africa
Description: This activity involves the coordination with Programme Sectors, Field Offices, specialized institutes and other stakeholders in Africa, including with donor partners, for the monitoring of and consolidated reporting on intersectoral extrabudgetary activities benefitting Africa.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PAX3 - Impact and visibility of UNESCO's programmes in Africa strengthened through enhanced coordination, monitoring and mobilization of partners in relation to the Operational Strategy for Priority Africa (2022-2029), and better understanding of Africa's development opportunities and challenges

Project: A Science Contribution to the UN 2023 Water Conference
Description:
The project aims to strengthen the Science Research Agenda "Science to Accelerating the Implementation of SDG6 - A contribution to UN Water Conference 2023" by producing two interrelated deliverables:
1)	A wider science policy consultation among scientific institutions, UN agencies and stakeholders with the aim of discussing and finalizing the two blueprint papers.
2)	Two blueprint papers: "Frontiers on Water Sciences and Development Goals",; and "Science policy interlinkages"
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.SC2 - Water science, innovation, education, management, cooperation and governance bolstered for a water secure world in a changing environment

Project: Ocean Decade Capacity Development Facility
Description: The proposed project is for an Ocean Decade Capacity Development Facility that will build on the unique strengths and expertise of IOC-UNESCO in terms of capacity development and provide a flexible and evolutive means of supporting the capacity development needs of individuals and institutions involved in the Ocean Decade. This will include support to actors wishing to engage in co-design of future Decade Actions, as well as support to proponents of existing Decade Actions who require support on targeted capacity development initiatives.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health and accelerate the transition towards sustainable management of ocean-related risks and opportunities

Project: World Heritage online map platform
Description: The project aims to collect and create georeferenced maps for World Heritage in Europe and North America as a pilot region. This data will be uploaded on a newly developed online map platform, which will be embedded on the website of the UNESCO World Heritage Centre. Users will be able to access, visualize and analyze multiple layers of information related to World Heritage property boundaries and buffer zones. The platform will facilitate identifying factors affecting the Outstanding Universal Value of World Heritage properties and will assist States Parties to better protect properties on their territory.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: Management of the trust fund at the World Heritage Centre
Description: Management of the Netherlands Funds-in-Trust at the World Heritage Centre
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: Educational Innovation for Promoting Communication and Integration in Asia-Pacific: Implementing Regional Quality Tools to Facilitate the Cross-border Mobility of Students
Description: Based on the achievements of the project on 'Developing Regional Quality Tools to Facilitate the Cross-Border Mobility of Students' (2015-2018), this new project will implement quality tools in the national or institutional contexts and promote synergies between policies in NQF, QA, and international recognition. In addition, the project will build the Asia-Pacific Network of National Information Centres (NICs) to facilitate cross-border mobility of students among countries in the Asia-Pacific region.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED4 - Learners are equipped with relevant skills to meet individual, labour market and societal demands through literacy, TVET, STEM and higher education

Project: JAMSTEC Secondment to the IOC (Ocean Decade Coordination Unit)
Description: Under the overall authority of the Executive Secretary of the Intergovernmental Oceanographic Commission (IOC) of UNESCO and the direct supervision of the Head of Marine Policy and Regional Coordination (MPR) Section, the Seconded Expert will support the work of IOC-UNESCO in relation to the implementation of the UN Decade of Ocean Science for Sustainable Development, specifically in relation to partnerships and resource mobilisation.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health and accelerate the transition towards sustainable management of ocean-related risks and opportunities

Project: Lifelines to Learning: Towards an International Declaration on Advancing Connectivity for Education
Description: Since the start of the COVID-19 pandemic, the right to education has become-at the global level-dependent on connectivity, especially internet access. The pandemic forced policy makers, teachers, parents and learners to attempt actions to leverage connectivity for learning at a speed and scale without precedent. The pandemic has revealed the need to rethink connectivity for learning in a transformed global educational landscape. This initiative will facilitate the production and endorsement of an International Declaration on Connectivity for Education, and will involve research and consultation.
Outcome EN: Outcome 2 - Strengthen international coordination for the achievement of SDG 4 and develop the global education agenda based on research, foresight and innovation
Output EN: 2.ED9 - Education and learning reimagined through interdisciplinary research, foresight and public policy debate

Project: Building Office Capacities
Description: The principle purpose of this project is to strengthen the activities of the UNESCO Regional Bureau for Science and Culture in Europe through the building of Office Capacities as agreed by the Governance Bodies of the Bureau (Scientific Council and Steering Committee). This project will allow the Director and staff of the Bureau to travel and undertake activities relevant to the execution of the approved programmes. In addition, this project intends to provide the Bureau with the human and financial resources necessary to run the Bureau and its activities, as recommended by the Gov. Bodies and approved by the DG.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 11 - Accountable, efficient and effective management in pursuit of the Organization's results
Output EN: 11.FLD3 - Enhanced administrative and operational support by addressing existing and emerging needs

Project: Capacities developed for the management of World Heritage properties (2021 IC)
Description:
As approved by the Steering Committee of the Regional Bureau for Science and Culture in Europe, this activity will develop professional/institutional capacities for the management of WH properties.
This element is complementary to activity 650RER6000 on improving the integrated management of UNESCO designated sites for sustainable development. The element will also be coordinated with RP funds decentralized to this Bureau, as well as with other relevant extrabudgetary projects, in order to match funds and create synergies whenever feasible and appropriate.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Description: Under the overall authority of the Director of the Division for Peace and Sustainable Development, based in the Section of Health and Education, the JPO will support the work of the Division and Section in the development and operationalization of policies and programmes to (i) support efforts in relation to SDG4 efforts and reporting, specifically in relation to Target 4.7; (ii) support the identification of good policies and practices, including through new research; and (iii) assist with support to countries in response to growing demands in relation to school health programmes, in particular:
Outcome EN: Outcome 7 - Promote inclusion and combat discrimination, hate speech and stereotypes
Output EN: 7.ED3 - Learners are empowered to lead healthy lives, promote sustainable development and engage with the world as creative and responsible global citizens

-	Strengthen the visibility of the group through the dissemination of articles on education, training opportunities and dispatch the pertinent information on the activities of the global SGD4 Steering Committee
