Output EN: 2.ED7 - Education policy and finance decisions to achieve SDG 4 are informed by improved coordination, data and monitoring, knowledge and innovative partnerships

Project: JPO (China) for Hydrological Systems and Climate Change Adaptation (SC/HYD/HCA)
Description: This entry focuses on the JPO post located in Headquarters, in support of the Hydrological Systems, Climate Change and Adaptation Section (SC/HYD/HCA).
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.SC2 - Water science, innovation, education, management, cooperation and governance bolstered for a water secure world in a changing environment

Project: Junior Professional Officer for CI/MID - China
Description: Under the authority of Chief CI/MID, the JPO will assist in the implementation of the regular and extra-budgetary programme activities related to Outputs 6.CI3 and 8.CI5
Outcome EN: Outcome 6 - Promote freedom of expression and the right to information
Output EN: 6.CI3 - Member States and media institutions enabled to strengthen media development and media pluralism, including through the International Programme for the Development of Communication (IPDC)

Project: Strengthening Teacher Education Programmes in Cambodia (STEPCam)
Description:
The objective of the GPE3 is to improve the quality of primary education, especially for children from disadvantaged groups, and to foster effective leadership and management of education staff. The programme is comprised of the fixed with USD 14.40 million (2018-2020) and variable parts with USD 6.20 million (2019-2021), which will be implemented by UNESCO and UNICEF respectively.
The fixed part is called STEPCam, which stands for Strengthening Teacher Education Programmes in Cambodia. The STEPCam will be implemented to support the government's efforts in enhancing competencies of in-service teachers, specifically those in early grades, as part of improving learning outcomes.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED5 - Teachers trained and supported to improve learning outcomes and address the changes brought forth by the digital and AI transformation and the COVID-19 crisis
Donor: World Bank/International Bank for Reconstruction and Development

Project: Strengthening Teacher Education Programmes in Cambodia (STEPCam)
Description:
The objective of the GPE3 is to improve the quality of primary education, especially for children from disadvantaged groups, and to foster effective leadership and management of education staff. The programme is comprised of the fixed with USD 14.40 million (2018-2020) and variable parts with USD 6.20 million (2019-2021), which will be implemented by UNESCO and UNICEF respectively.
The fixed part is called STEPCam, which stands for Strengthening Teacher Education Programmes in Cambodia. The STEPCam will be implemented to support the government's efforts in enhancing competencies of in-service teachers, specifically those in early grades, as part of improving learning outcomes.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED5 - Teachers trained and supported to improve learning outcomes and address the changes brought forth by the digital and AI transformation and the COVID-19 crisis
Donor: World Bank - Global Partnership for Education

Project: Building back better through participation
Description: Through this project, the United Nations Country team, UNESCO and UN Human Rights seek to streamline ongoing support by the United Nations, its agencies, funds and programmes, to advance civic space. It aims to empower journalists and human rights defenders to engage with the Government to address their safety and protection.
Outcome EN: Outcome 6 - Promote freedom of expression and the right to information
Output EN: 6.CI2 - Member States have strengthened capacities and raised awareness to enhance norms and policies related to freedom of expression, press freedom, safety of journalists, including women journalists, and the right to access information, online and offline

Project: Strengthening Teacher Education Programmes in Cambodia (STEPCam) Agency Fees
Description: Support cost for the Cambodia GPE-III implementation.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED5 - Teachers trained and supported to improve learning outcomes and address the changes brought forth by the digital and AI transformation and the COVID-19 crisis
Donor: World Bank - Global Partnership for Education

Project: CapED Lao PDR - Education Response to the COVID-19 crisis
Description: The CapED - COVID-19 in Lao PDR is aimed at supporting the Ministry of Education and Sports to enhance teachers' capacities in applying mixed-mode/blended approach and technologies to ensure the continuity of learning and the quality of pedagogy that is innovative and engaging, with a view to strengthening its education system to be more inclusive and resilient to crises. The main interventions are (1) Development of national capacity on blended learning modalities for teacher education in response to COVID-19 school closures and beyond, and (2) Enhancement of digital resilience through competency-based teacher training reforms to facilitate ICT-pedagogy integration
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED1 - Education systems are equipped to promote inclusion, address marginalization and advance rights, including in crisis-affected and post-disaster contexts

Project: Strengthening the national system in Lao PDR for assessing and mitigating impacts of development projects
Description: The project aims to improve the protection of World Heritage sites and other important heritage sites in Lao PDR, which are significant drivers of sustainable socio-economic development in the country. It will operate on two streams: (1) a Luang Prabang stream, aimed at supporting the urgent impact assessment process and subsequent implementation of mitigation measures at the World Heritage town and its surrounding, and (2) a national stream, including development of improved measures for Impact Assessment and investment review affecting heritage sites within a multi-sectoral approach using the convening power of the UN.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: Promoting Inclusive and Equitable Quality Education for all children in the Islamic Republic of Iran
Description:
With a view to jointly support the Government of the Islamic Republic of Iran towards the implementation of the overarching SDG4 goal, the purpose of this collaboration between the UNICEF Country Office in Iran and UNESCO Tehran Cluster Office is to co-organize event and activities, subject to agreement by the Government. These activities are building on the activities under the previous UN to UN agreement. They are as follows: 
1)Disaster Preparedness Education for Children with Special Needs and Disabilities (2nd phase)
2)Female Afghan Teachers Training (Scale-up)
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED1 - Education systems are equipped to promote inclusion, address marginalization and advance rights, including in crisis-affected and post-disaster contexts

Project: Promoting Inclusive and Equitable Quality Education in the Islamic Republic of Iran - 3
Description:
With a view to jointly support the Government of the Islamic Republic of Iran towards the implementation of the overarching SDG4 goal, the purpose of this collaboration between the UNICEF Country Office in Iran and UNESCO Tehran Cluster Office is to co-organize national events and activities, subject to agreement by the Government. These activities are building on the activities under the previous UN to UN agreement. They are as follows: 
 1) ICT and effective distance Learning in teacher training 
 2) Disaster Preparedness Education for children with special needs and disabilities
 3) Environmental Literacy Assessment
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED1 - Education systems are equipped to promote inclusion, address marginalization and advance rights, including in crisis-affected and post-disaster contexts

Project: Promoting inclusive education and equal opportunities for migrant and refugee children and adolescents and host communities in Peru
Description: The project "Promoting inclusive education and equal opportunities for migrant and refugee children and adolescents and host communities in Peru" has been designed in the frame of the ECW Multi-Year Resilience Program (MYRP) for Peru, financed by Education Cannot Wait (ECW). UNICEF as grantee, UNESCO, and other allies as sub-grantees, will work together on this project to respond to the needs of the most vulnerable children and adolescents as well as working towards improving the inclusivity and quality of the Peruvian education system to include Venezuelan refugees and migrants. The MYRP is divided into four "packs", this document focuses on pack number 2, led by UNESCO Lima.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED1 - Education systems are equipped to promote inclusion, address marginalization and advance rights, including in crisis-affected and post-disaster contexts

Project: JPO Culture and Cultural Heritage
Description: The JPO will be under the direct supervision of the Senior Project Officer of the CLT Team in the Amman Office. Since the Office's portfolio on cultural heritage has been steadily expanding, new capacities, particularly with a law back ground and with a sound level of knowledge about UNESCO and its Conventions are needed. UNESCO Amman office has been playing a prominent role in Jordan in the protection and rehabilitation of the unique cultural heritage of the country. The KSA funded JPO will be placed in the CLT team, so that synergies and an increased level of coordination can be realized. The JPO will be able to contribute to the visibility of the programs in the safeguarding of heritage.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT2 - Member States capacities strengthened to fight the illicit trafficking of cultural property and promote its return and restitution, to protect underwater cultural heritage and to promote the role of museums for societies

Project: Technical assistance for the Ministry of Education's WebGIS School Maintenance System
Description: Building upon UNESCO's past WebGIS achievements and ongoing partnership with MoE and GIZ, UNESCO wil continue its technical support with the integration of the School Maintenance Workflow into the MoE's Educational Management Systems-EMIS (WebGIS & OpenEMIS). The integration of the school maintenance workflow will be done using a capacity development approach aimed at strengthening the education system, where the capture of electronic and automated data, workflows, monitoring and reporting, will facilitate the MoE's systematic, structured and evidence-based decision making related to preventative and corrective school maintenance.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED6 - Resilience, quality and equity of education systems strengthened to flexibly respond to evolving learning environments and to better deliver on SDG4 commitments

Project: Supporting the Institutional Sustainability of Al-Aqsa Mosque Centre for the Restoration of Islamic Manuscripts in Jerusalem: Phase IV: Consolidation of skills and Exit Strategy.
Description: The objective of this project proposal is to make of the Center for the restoration of Islamic Manuscripts of the Haram al Sharif, in Jerusalem, an operational, autonomous and sustainable entity by the end of the project, in 2020, able to safeguard this unique Islamic heritage. The project will include a Conservation assessment of the Center; the elaboration of a 10-year conservation and management strategy; the reinforcement of the capacities of the staff; the restoration of the premises; the digitization and inventory of the collections; and the human and material reinforcement of the Center. The project will be developed over an estimated period of 3 years.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT2 - Member States capacities strengthened to fight the illicit trafficking of cultural property and promote its return and restitution, to protect underwater cultural heritage and to promote the role of museums for societies

Project: ECW MULTI-YEAR RESILIENCE PROGRAMME (MYRP) FOR THE STATE OF PALESTINE 2019-2021
Description: Owing to the chronic crisis state and protracted conflict, this ECW programme in Palestine aims to strengthen the resilience and development of affected children, families and communities in Gaza, East Jerusalem, Hebron and Area C. The programme seeks to achieve the following results: improved access and continuity of inclusive, equitable education and learning opportunities for girls and boys; improved relevance and quality of education in a protective and safe learning environment; and strengthened capacity of the education system to respond to emergency needs and deliver a coordinated response in crises as part of the overall education system.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED1 - Education systems are equipped to promote inclusion, address marginalization and advance rights, including in crisis-affected and post-disaster contexts

Project: Increasing TVET Competencies for Youth in the Palestinian Labour Market
Description: Within this project, UNESCO aims to contribute towards bridging the skills gap, minimizing the mismatch between the supply and demand for skills in the labor market, while incorporating cultural factors and awareness into the TVET track, in order to create value and meaning for students which links their educational experience with their forming identity and the process of their self-actualization. It will also provide 21st Century solutions to the student's learning and work experience including anticipated information about skills needed in the TVET track, which will have a great impact on the choice of the youth career path in Palestine.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED4 - Learners are equipped with relevant skills to meet individual, labour market and societal demands through literacy, TVET, STEM and higher education

Project: Supporting Palestine in the periodic reporting exercise on the implementation of the 2003 Convention at the national level
Description: The Arab States will be the third region to report on the implementation of the 2003 Convention for the Safeguarding of the Intangible Cultural Heritage at the national level using a new mechanism of reporting. Periodic Reporting is based on participatory processes that can strengthen relationships with and among the range of actors involved in the ICH field. Periodic Reporting also links to broader mechanisms for M&E goals in related areas such as cultural policies, media, or formal and non-formal education. Palestine will be supported throughout the multi-stakeholder consultative process that will be conducted at the local and national level to prepare its report on the implementation of the 2003 Convention, including in peer-to-peer and regional exchange and trainings.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT4 - Member States and communities capacities strengthened to identify, safeguard and promote living heritage

Project: Technical assistance to include GCED and ESD in learning materials for Mexico
Description:
The Ministry of public education requires technical assistance in inclusion of GCED and ESD in learning materials. A guideline for revision of learning materials and a report with recommendations will be delivered.The project requires UNESCO to hire and train specialized consultants to develop materials. It involves strengthening the capacity of educational authorities and specialized teams responsible for integrating GCED and ESD into learning materials. The project will assess the relevance and usefulness that the materials have in the classrooms.
The learning materials will reach 1.2 million teachers and 25 million preschool, primary and secondary students in Mexico.
Outcome EN: Outcome 7 - Promote inclusion and combat discrimination, hate speech and stereotypes
Output EN: 7.ED3 - Learners are empowered to lead healthy lives, promote sustainable development and engage with the world as creative and responsible global citizens

Project: Right of access to information and knowledge in Mexico for inclusion and equality of vulnerable groups
Description: The UNESCO Office in Mexico will continue the work initiated in 2021 for the implementation of SDG Indicator 16.10.2, in order to improve the processes and policies of the right of access to information and knowledge, promoting inclusive solutions for the empowerment of people belonging to vulnerable and/or marginalized groups, such as people in mobility, speakers of indigenous languages, people with disabilities, women and girls, etc.
Outcome EN: Outcome 8 - Foster knowledge sharing and skills development in the digital age
Output EN: 8.CI4 - Member States are enabled to foster universal access to information and knowledge, including through the Information for All Programme (IFAP), as well as through Open Solutions, and through the identification, preservation and accessibility of documentary heritage

Project: Fostering Sustainable Development through Creativity in Local Cities
Description: This project aims to recognize creativity as a strategic factor for sustainable development of cities and public spaces within it. It will enhance initiatives to make creativity an essential component of urban development. The project will consider both UCCN and other cities, such as Ensenada, Mexico City, San Cristobal, Morelia, Puebla, Guadalajara (part of UCCN), or Guanajuato (WHL) and Mazatlán ("Islands and Protected Areas of the Gulf of California", WHL), among others. To strengthen cultural diversity, it will mainstream the integration of creativity into local development plans. The project will reinforce the adoption of SDG's to develop creativity in the cities. In addition, it will contribute to stablish a wide framework to improve access and participation in cultural life.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT6 - Member States capacities strengthened to promote, monitor and measure the contribution of culture to the implementation of the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development at the local, national and regional levels

Project: Advancing Gender equality education programmes in Mexico
Description: Mexico is a country that faces challenges in violence against women and girls, in response, the State Government has developed a programme for gender education. Unesco Mexico will support this project by contributing with ther revision and integration of gender equality in the curricula content for basic and middle education and monitoring of the implementation in the schools of the state of Mexico. We will raise awareness of the need for other states to engage in gender education programes.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED2 - Gender transformative education systems empower learners, ensure safe learning environments and address the educational barriers, particularly for girls and women, exacerbated by the learning crisis

Project: Fostering Sustainable Development through Creativity in Local Cities
Description: This project aims to recognize creativity as a strategic factor for sustainable development of cities and public spaces within it. It will enhance initiatives to make creativity an essential component of urban development. The project will consider both UCCN and other cities, such as Ensenada, Mexico City, San Cristobal, Morelia, Puebla, Guadalajara (part of UCCN), or Guanajuato (WHL) and Mazatlán ("Islands and Protected Areas of the Gulf of California", WHL), among others. To strengthen cultural diversity, it will mainstream the integration of creativity into local development plans. The project will reinforce the adoption of SDG's to develop creativity in the cities. In addition, it will contribute to stablish a wide framework to improve access and participation in cultural life.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT6 - Member States capacities strengthened to promote, monitor and measure the contribution of culture to the implementation of the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development at the local, national and regional levels

Project: Supporting the development of a pluralistic, diverse, independent, gender-sensitive and professionally ethical national media ecosystem
Description: During 2022 and 2023, the UNESCO Office in Mexico will continue the work it began in the last biennium to implement the Media Development Indicators in Mexico, as well as the work to strengthen Community and Indigenous Media. Currently, the country faces a low level of trust in information and media by society, so it is necessary to restore this trust and continue to support the consolidation of an ecosystem of plural, independent, diverse media that integrate the gender approach and are handled ethically in crisis and emergency situations.
Outcome EN: Outcome 6 - Promote freedom of expression and the right to information
Output EN: 6.CI3 - Member States and media institutions enabled to strengthen media development and media pluralism, including through the International Programme for the Development of Communication (IPDC)
Donor: United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland

Project: Integrated Water Resources Management in Uzbekistan
Description: The current implementation of IWRM principles to achieve water security in Uzbekistan will be researched in a view to understand better the current situation, map it and propose the way forward. The activity will be done under the prism of climate and global change effects on the country.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.SC2 - Water science, innovation, education, management, cooperation and governance bolstered for a water secure world in a changing environment

Project: Scaling the TPD@SCALE Approach in Uzbekistan
Description: TPD@Scale is the Teacher Professional Development designed for scale by taking advantage of the affordances of information and communication technologies (ICTs) to enable more equitable access to and participation in quality teacher learning experiences not otherwise possible through conventional means. Within this action, and based on UNESCO's previous project results on ICT Competency Development for Teachers, over 600 school teachers will be empowered in delivering their lessons with the wider use of ICTs.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED5 - Teachers trained and supported to improve learning outcomes and address the changes brought forth by the digital and AI transformation and the COVID-19 crisis

Project: Strengthening public policies of Leme Municipal Education Secretariat, regarding the pedagogical and administrative actions
Description: This Technical Cooperation project between the Municipal Education Secretariat of Leme and UNESCO aims at quality education, through democratic management, valued teachers, restructured curriculum, evaluation systems, continuous training plan and strengthening of the management policy that will enable the Municipal Education Network to play a leading role in shaping the new generations of the Municipality.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED6 - Resilience, quality and equity of education systems strengthened to flexibly respond to evolving learning environments and to better deliver on SDG4 commitments

Project: Develpment of innovative solutions in São Paulo State education
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED6 - Resilience, quality and equity of education systems strengthened to flexibly respond to evolving learning environments and to better deliver on SDG4 commitments

Project: SEB
Description: In Brazil there was no regulation of the collaboration regime among the federative actors (municipalities, states and federal) or the definition of legal forms of cooperation, despite the Federal Constitution guidelines. Due to the educational system inequalities between the geographic regions and results on student achievement and educational equity and equality this project aims to contribute to construction of an effective collaboration regime among the federal entities assuring a quality education for all through public policies built democratically and designed based on articulated programs and actions.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED6 - Resilience, quality and equity of education systems strengthened to flexibly respond to evolving learning environments and to better deliver on SDG4 commitments

Project: Fostering local sustainable development in the economic area of the SUAPE industrial and harbour complex
Description: Under this new partnership evolving from social matters already partially covered in the first project document (2016-2018) with UNESCO, the BRZ Office shall now provide external consultants and technical advice on inclusive sustainable development strategies to help the SUAPE harbour administration in a long-term investment and sustainable development plan for the surrounding area. This new 3-year project will now shift from previous SHS components to SC priority areas such as the protection of local biodiversity, a more harmonic relation with the local marine enviornment and other pilot initiatives on biodiversity, including nature-based solutions.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.SC1 - Inclusive knowledge and capacities of Member States strengthened to advance and apply science for sustainable management of natural resources, ecosystem and biodiversity conservation and restoration, and disaster risk resilience

Project: Human Rights Education for the City of Sao Paulo
Description: The following project is a partnership between the Human Rights and Citizenship Secretariat (Secretaria de Direitos Humanos e Cidadania de Sao Paulo) and the UNESCO Brasilia Office. The project is expected to improve the city policies on human rights and culture of peace by reinforcing the concept of "right to the city" and also reinforcing the transversality of human rights throughout all city secretariats, particularly the municipal education secretariat.
Outcome EN: Outcome 7 - Promote inclusion and combat discrimination, hate speech and stereotypes
Output EN: 7.SHS1 - Member States capacities strengthened to advance effective policies and practices to achieve inclusive development through the promotion of human rights, scientific freedom, intercultural understanding and by tackling all forms of discrimination and racism

Project: Shared Management of Brazilian Cultural Heritage
Description: This project aims to enlarge the social appropriation and the capacity of shared management of Brazilian Cultural Heritage, involving federative entities, private sector and civil society organizations.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: Promotion of tourism in cultural and natural heritage sites, the creative economy and other tourism and sustainable development policies
Description: The project pursues to promote the strengthening of the governamental policy for the development of tourism, through the valorization of the cultural and natural heritage, creative economy and other transversal policies, based on the intersectoral and interinstitutional articulation. Also it aims to promote creativity and diversity, and the achievement of a diversification of the national tourism, and the implementation of the UN 2030 Sustainable Development Goals Agenda.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT6 - Member States capacities strengthened to promote, monitor and measure the contribution of culture to the implementation of the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development at the local, national and regional levels

Project: Brazilian capacities and public policies on water, sanitation and adaptation to climate change
Description: 2022 symbolizes half of the period foreseen for the achievement of the SDGs under the 2030 Agenda. Brazil still has immense challenges for the achievement of the SDG 6 on water and sanitation. The high and growing rates of urbanization and unplanned concentration of people in cities put water security at risk, which, with the effects of global warming, tends to aggravate. By this RP element, UNESCO will advance the Megacities Alliance for Water and Climate (MAWAC), foster proper representation of COBRAPHI in the CONAPHI's biannual meeting, publish and launch the 2022 World Water Development Report, support the water components of Amazon Regional Observatory, and implement an ecohydrology demonstrative site in Brazil.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.SC2 - Water science, innovation, education, management, cooperation and governance bolstered for a water secure world in a changing environment

Project: Strengthening social participation and control mechanisms for Human Rights Public Policies
Description: This relatively new project is the third one signed by UNESCO with the Brazilian Human Rights Secretariat. The project was designed after concluding that many of the Brazilian human rights consellors often lack further experience in the area of needed more technical knowledge (or recycling) on the fields they were supposed to provide advice for the Brazilian Government. Although the project will support all advisory committees of the Human Rights Secretariat, it will have a particular focus on capacity-building initatives for counsellors of five major advisory committees: CDDPH, CNCD, CONADE, CONANDA and, finally, CNDI (all the councils are described in the next section)
Outcome EN: Outcome 7 - Promote inclusion and combat discrimination, hate speech and stereotypes
Output EN: 7.SHS1 - Member States capacities strengthened to advance effective policies and practices to achieve inclusive development through the promotion of human rights, scientific freedom, intercultural understanding and by tackling all forms of discrimination and racism

Project: UNESCO-related public policies focused on the rights of eldery people strengthened in Brazil
Description: The decline in fertility rates in Brazil in the last decade has had profound implications upon the demographic trend of its pyramid with a clear trend towards a growing elderly population. If the current trend continues, the Brazilian Institute of Statistics and Geography (IBGE) estimates that by 2050 the age segment above 60 years old will represent 30% of the total Brazilian population. UNESCO's ideals of lifelong learning, education for all (EFA), media literacy and acess to culture and science as fundamental human rights are few of the areas where the Brazilian Government could benefit from UNESCO's expertise.
Outcome EN: Outcome 7 - Promote inclusion and combat discrimination, hate speech and stereotypes
Output EN: 7.SHS1 - Member States capacities strengthened to advance effective policies and practices to achieve inclusive development through the promotion of human rights, scientific freedom, intercultural understanding and by tackling all forms of discrimination and racism

Project: Valuing the Cultural Landscape and the National Park of the Jesuit Missions of the Guaranis
Description: This Project aims to promote a major knowledge of the cultural landscape of the Historical National Park of the Jesuit Missions of the Guaranis and provide subsidies in order to develop management tools able to help the process of installation of the National Park highlighting its value as National and World Heritage through the promotion of its diversity - social, cultural and environmental - as well as strengthen the potentiality of the Park as an impellent to generate regional and local development.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: Basic Education in Porto Alegre
Description: The objective of this International Technical Cooperation Project is the consolidation of pedagogical, curricular and management practices by the education network; the improvement of pedagogical and curricular practices; updating the knowledge of education professionals; the adoption of innovative educational content and methodologies; the improvement of the management capacity of priority educational programs, as well as the expansion and improvement of the offer of places for early childhood education and elementary education.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED6 - Resilience, quality and equity of education systems strengthened to flexibly respond to evolving learning environments and to better deliver on SDG4 commitments

Project: SMUL - Participatory Urban Planning for the City of São Paulo
Description: The Project aims to use innovative and efficient participatory methodologies and tools for urban planning in the City of São Paulo, using strategies to manage information and kwnoledge to develop urban planing public policies for the city of São Paulo.
Outcome EN: Outcome 8 - Foster knowledge sharing and skills development in the digital age
Output EN: 8.CI4 - Member States are enabled to foster universal access to information and knowledge, including through the Information for All Programme (IFAP), as well as through Open Solutions, and through the identification, preservation and accessibility of documentary heritage

Project: Innovation and Technology Secretariat of São Paulo - PMSP/SMIT
Description: The Project aims to strengthen a municipal policy of innovation, to modernize public service provision through improved communication channels with the citizens, the technical cooperation will diagnose, analyse and plan initiatives that are specific to the development of innovation indicators and the management of information through TICs in the municipality of São Paulo, to promote strategic use of innovation by the Municipal Secretariat of Innovation and Technology of the municipality of São Paulo as a tool to improve public municipal administration and improve the provision of services to citizens.
Outcome EN: Outcome 8 - Foster knowledge sharing and skills development in the digital age
Output EN: 8.CI4 - Member States are enabled to foster universal access to information and knowledge, including through the Information for All Programme (IFAP), as well as through Open Solutions, and through the identification, preservation and accessibility of documentary heritage

Project: Support to the Ministry of Education and to the Brazilian Enterprise of Hospital Services- EBSERH for Federal University Hospital's capacity building to become excelency centers for the atention, teaching and research in the health area.
Description: The present project has the purpose to give support to the Ministry of Education and the Brazilian Hospital Services in its primary mission to create appropriate technical conditions for teaching and research in healthcare in hospitals linked to the Brazilian federal universities network. These conditions are created by actions of physical, technological and human resources restructuration and especially creating the management model, seeking the excellence in the provision of health care services and the need to make them suitable for undergraduate training practice scenarios and specialists.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED4 - Learners are equipped with relevant skills to meet individual, labour market and societal demands through literacy, TVET, STEM and higher education

Project: UNESCO-related public policies focused on the rights of eldery people strengthened in Brazil
Description: The decline in fertility rates in Brazil in the last decade has had profound implications upon the demographic trend of its pyramid with a clear trend towards a growing elderly population. If the current trend continues, the Brazilian Institute of Statistics and Geography (IBGE) estimates that by 2050 the age segment above 60 years old will represent 30% of the total Brazilian population. UNESCO's ideals of lifelong learning, education for all (EFA), media literacy and acess to culture and science as fundamental human rights are few of the areas where the Brazilian Government could benefit from UNESCO's expertise.
Outcome EN: Outcome 7 - Promote inclusion and combat discrimination, hate speech and stereotypes
Output EN: 7.SHS1 - Member States capacities strengthened to advance effective policies and practices to achieve inclusive development through the promotion of human rights, scientific freedom, intercultural understanding and by tackling all forms of discrimination and racism

Project: Rural Craft and Cultural Hubs - Phase II
Description: Since 2013, UNESCO with the Department of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises and Textiles (MSME&T), Government of West Bengal, has been working to strengthen livelihood opportunities for the craft artisans and folk artists in rural West Bengal. The current project aims to continue the ongoing efforts among existing and new beneficiaries towards skills up-gradation and transmission, creation of wider public interest in safeguarding intangible cultural heritage (ICH), market linkages, digital education and promotion, and linkages with Government schemes for the socio-economic betterment of the practitioner communities.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT4 - Member States and communities capacities strengthened to identify, safeguard and promote living heritage

Project: Protection of tangible heritage in Iraq
Description:
This activity aims to contribute to the protection of Tangible Heritage in Iraq, with a focus on the 3 sites on WH List in Danger, and those sites in need of urgent interventions.
Technical support will be also provided to the Ministry of Culture, Tourism and Antiquities and to the State Board of Antiquities for the effective implementation of the WH Committee's decisions, and the organization of Reactive Monitoring and Advisory missions. 
This activity may also contribute to the implementation of the Periodic Reporting and the participation of Iraqis in the capacity development workshops.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: Protection of Iraq's Cultural Heritage
Description:
The dramatic situation of cultural heritage in Iraq and its intentional destruction by armed groups reached an unprecedented degree and the state of deterioration of inaccessible cultural sites is very difficult to determine. This situation led to a growing phenomenon of illicit trafficking in Iraq and its neighbouring countries.
The project aims to monitor cultural sites and assess the damage incurred, mitigate the loss of cultural heritage through capacity building activities, fight illicit trafficking, raise awareness to the general public and coordinate with Italian entities which are active in Iraq's cultural heritage protection and documentation.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: Support to Revive the Spirit of Mosul Initiative through strengthening capacities of the Digital Center of Eastern Manuscripts
Description: The funds contributes to the Revive the Spirit of Mosul Initiative through supporting the Digital Center for Eastern Manuscripts in Mosul to restore the manuscripts salvaged from Mosul
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT3 - Member States capacities strengthened for better preparedness, mitigation and response to emergencies affecting culture, including in situations of armed conflict and disaster

Project: Voices of Peace: Promoting live-together in the liberated territories of Iraq through community media
Description: The overall objective of this project is to promote respect for cultural diversity and live together as a basis for stabilization and reconciliation in the multicultural regions of northeastern Iraq.
Outcome EN: Outcome 8 - Foster knowledge sharing and skills development in the digital age
Output EN: 8.CI4 - Member States are enabled to foster universal access to information and knowledge, including through the Information for All Programme (IFAP), as well as through Open Solutions, and through the identification, preservation and accessibility of documentary heritage

Project: Improving Access to Quality and Inclusive Education with Gender Equality for Out of School Children in Babil and Baghdad Governorates, Iraq
Description: Building upon the on-going project "Improving Access to Quality and Inclusive Education with Gender Equality for Out of School Children in Salah Al Din and Baghdad, Iraq" funded by the Italian Development Cooperation Agency/ Government of Italy, the proposed action further aims to provide 10,000 Out of School Children (OOSC) in Babil and Baghdad governorates with learning opportunities, safer and more conducive learning environment and enhanced quality of education.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED1 - Education systems are equipped to promote inclusion, address marginalization and advance rights, including in crisis-affected and post-disaster contexts

Project: Mitigating the impact of COVID-19 on Education through distance learning in Iraq
Description:
To respond to the COVID-19 crisis and the closure of schools since the end of February 2020, UNESCO is building upon the support previously provided to the TV channel, by assisting the MoE's TV to complete the production of television based lectures for full all the subjects for grades 1 - 6 and ALP. 
The overall objective of this project is to mitigate the disruption to learning caused by the COVID-19 crisis by maximizing access to distance learning opportunities for all school age learners across the country through the provision of the continued support to the Federal Ministry of Education TV channel.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED1 - Education systems are equipped to promote inclusion, address marginalization and advance rights, including in crisis-affected and post-disaster contexts

Project: Breaking Silence: enhance accountability and prosecutions for safety of journalist and fighting impunity. Phase 2
Description: The project aims to expand the impact of the Iraqi National Committee of Safety of Journalists and issue of Impunity (INCSJII), by developing the capacity of the Judiciary, Prosecution, and Justice systems in Iraq.
Outcome EN: Outcome 6 - Promote freedom of expression and the right to information
Output EN: 6.CI2 - Member States have strengthened capacities and raised awareness to enhance norms and policies related to freedom of expression, press freedom, safety of journalists, including women journalists, and the right to access information, online and offline

Project: Gendered approach to Preventing Violent Extremism in Iraq through Education
Description: The project aims at fostering a new sense of community where community members are more resilient to radicalising narratives and actively participating in processes to build peaceful co-existence living in the liberated areas of Anbar and Ninewa governorates underpinned by education that nurtures critical thinking and values the behaviours associated with mutual respect and co-existence.
Outcome EN: Outcome 7 - Promote inclusion and combat discrimination, hate speech and stereotypes
Output EN: 7.ED3 - Learners are empowered to lead healthy lives, promote sustainable development and engage with the world as creative and responsible global citizens

Project: Supporting the Digital Center of Eastern Manuscripts in Iraq.
Description:
The proposed project aims at supporting the ongoing efforts in conserving the ancient Christian manuscripts in Iraq that are currently under the custody of the Digital Center of Eastern Manuscripts, especially those salvaged in 2014 by Fr. Najeeb Michaeel at the onset of the takeover of Mosul and its surroundings by ISIL.
Specific objectives of the project are as below:
a)	To conserve a selection of the most historically significant Christian manuscripts salvaged from the Mosul area;
b)	To supply basic needed materials and equipment for manuscript conservation at the Digital Center of Eastern Manuscripts.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT2 - Member States capacities strengthened to fight the illicit trafficking of cultural property and promote its return and restitution, to protect underwater cultural heritage and to promote the role of museums for societies

Project: Restoring the Mosul University library
Description: The overall objective of the project is making the Mosul University Library fully functional and in order to reach the planned result of ensuring that the Mosul University Library is perceived as an essential knowledge resource and an educational and cultural connecting place by students, teachers and other staff at the University as well as by residents of Mosul in general
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED4 - Learners are equipped with relevant skills to meet individual, labour market and societal demands through literacy, TVET, STEM and higher education

Project: Improving Access to Quality and Inclusive Education with Gender Equality for Out of School Children in Babil and Baghdad Governorates, Iraq
Description: Building upon the on-going project "Improving Access to Quality and Inclusive Education with Gender Equality for Out of School Children in Salah Al Din and Baghdad, Iraq" funded by the Italian Development Cooperation Agency/ Government of Italy, the proposed action further aims to provide 10,000 Out of School Children (OOSC) in Babil and Baghdad governorates with learning opportunities, safer and more conducive learning environment and enhanced quality of education.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED1 - Education systems are equipped to promote inclusion, address marginalization and advance rights, including in crisis-affected and post-disaster contexts

Project: Strengthening National Capacities in enhancing the state of conservation of World Heritage sites
Description: Bangladesh's rich cultural heritage comprises archaeological sites dating back to the earliest phases of human settlement in Asia, including two cultural World Heritage Sites, the Monuments of the Historic Mosque City of Bagerhat and the Ruins of the Buddhist Vihara at Paharpur, both inscribed as World Heritage in 1985. Since inscription many programmes and interventions were undertaken, including an UNESCO International Safeguarding Campaign from 1985-2001. However, there is still an urgent need for technical capacity building and management training, as there is a lack of knowledge about and application of current practices for all stages of management (protection, conservation, presentation) and absence of on-site professional management and no monitoring.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: Strengthening National Capacities in enhancing the state of conservation of World Heritage sites
Description: Bangladesh's rich cultural heritage comprises archaeological sites dating back to the earliest phases of human settlement in Asia, including two cultural World Heritage Sites, the Monuments of the Historic Mosque City of Bagerhat and the Ruins of the Buddhist Vihara at Paharpur, both inscribed as World Heritage in 1985. Since inscription many programmes and interventions were undertaken, including an UNESCO International Safeguarding Campaign from 1985-2001. However, there is still an urgent need for technical capacity building and management training, as there is a lack of knowledge about and application of current practices for all stages of management (protection, conservation, presentation) and absence of on-site professional management and no monitoring.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: Strengthening the national capacities in Lebanon to prevent the illicit trafficking in cultural property
Description:
The current situation of the cultural heritage in the Region raises serious concerns: many historical and archaeological sites have or are being affected by violent fights or occupation by armed forces, vandalism and looting of several archaeological sites and museums have been reported.
Since the beginning of the armed conflict in the Region, UNESCO has alerted the international community regarding the risk of illicit export of cultural objects.
Moreover, the UN Security Council Resolutions specifically address the complex situation in the Region. The issue of preventing the illicit traffic in cultural property is becoming very important to Lebanon in particular within the actual situation in the Region.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT2 - Member States capacities strengthened to fight the illicit trafficking of cultural property and promote its return and restitution, to protect underwater cultural heritage and to promote the role of museums for societies

Project: UNESCO Documentation and Advisory Services (UDAS)
Description:
The project UNESCO Documentation and Advisory Services for WH sites in Lebanon aims at helping the Directorate General of Antiquities in the control of works in the World Heritage sites of Tyre and Baalbek as well as meeting the World Heritage requirements of consultation and monitoring of conservation measures to be implemented. This will be achieved through :

1.	Organization of four consultation workshops and events .
2.	Supplying technical assistance to the DGA for preparing various reports to be submitted to the WHC.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: Supporting Distance Learning in areas affected by Lebanon blast (Kodrat)
Description: This project aims to support teachers and build their capacities in distance learning and to provide psychosocial social support to children, parents, teachers and school administrative staff in the areas affected by the Beirut blast to help them recover. It will result in the formation of a national core team that will support the Ministry of Education in Lebanon to promote distance learning and build schools' resilience and preparedness for potential future crises.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED1 - Education systems are equipped to promote inclusion, address marginalization and advance rights, including in crisis-affected and post-disaster contexts
Donor: King Salman Aid and Humanitarian Relief Centre

Project: For the preparation of a conservation management plan for Oscar Niemeyer's Rashid Karami International Fair in Tripoli, Lebanon
Description: A conservation management plan, including as desk based study of the archival material, value based assessment and condition assessment of the physical fabric, in addition to some research and testing of original materials and techniques , will be developed for the International Fair at Tripoli, North Lebanon, one of the most iconic architectural achievements of the modern period in Lebanon designed by the Brazilian architect Oscar Niemeyer in the 1960s. the project will directly benefit the development of the World Heritage dossier including the identification of an outstanding universal value for the site and the definition of its authenticity and integrity.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: Rehabilitation and Valorization of Wadi Qadisha
Description:
Within the framework of the management plan approved in December 2015 for the World Heritage Site of Wadi Qadisha , the project which aims to develop properly the cultural resources of the Qadisha valley ,has three components:
a-Social component: Improving mobility within the valley through rehabilitation of pedestrian paths .
b-Heritage component: Conservation and restoration of selected religious historic heritage structures .
c-Academic component: Training and workshops for the conservation and the restoration of cultural assets.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: GPE ESPDG for Myanmar - Agency Fees
Description: Support costs for GPE Education Sector Plan Development Programme implementation
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED6 - Resilience, quality and equity of education systems strengthened to flexibly respond to evolving learning environments and to better deliver on SDG4 commitments
Donor: World Bank - Global Partnership for Education

Project: Strengthening Costa Rica's SDG Financing Architecture Through Resource Alignment with National Goals and Improved Education Sector Public Spending
Description: Through a 2 pillar approach the Joint Programme (JP) intends to strengthen SDG financing architecture at the national, sectoral (education) and ecosystem levels. Working with the public sector it will develop an integrated financing strategy to mobilize and align multiple sources of capital and planning processes with national development priorities and the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development, while focusing specifically on the education sector to improve its public spending efficiency through the implementation of a gender-responsive, socially inclusive and results-based budget and framework.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED6 - Resilience, quality and equity of education systems strengthened to flexibly respond to evolving learning environments and to better deliver on SDG4 commitments

Project: Appui aux activités en faveur de la République du Congo
Description:
1. Entreprenariat en vue de l'insertion socioprofessionnelle des jeunes du Département du Pool
2. Formation en micro-sciences des élèves du secondaire au Congo
3. Appui aux artistes de l'école de peinture de Poto Poto
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PAX3 - Impact and visibility of UNESCO's programmes in Africa strengthened through enhanced coordination, monitoring and mobilization of partners in relation to the Operational Strategy for Priority Africa (2022-2029), and better understanding of Africa's development opportunities and challenges

Project: Supporting Connectivity for Education in Ukraine
Description: The war in Ukraine has caused major disruptions of educational processes, with a substantial number of teachers and learners currently unable to go to school and with no access to digital devices to engage in teaching and learning processes through distance modalities. Through UNESCO's Global Education Coalition, Google has partnered with the Ministry of Education and Sciences of Ukraine and UNESCO to support the continuity of education with the contribution of 50,000 Chromebook devices for teachers and software licensing. UNESCO will deliver Google's contributed devices to Ukraine for further distribution to teachers under the Ministry's control.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED1 - Education systems are equipped to promote inclusion, address marginalization and advance rights, including in crisis-affected and post-disaster contexts

Project: Support for Ukraine in culture and education through UNESCO
Description: This project provides an emergency mid-term response to support journalists and media in Ukraine through three key outcomes:1)The safety of Ukrainian and international journalists inside Ukraine is reinforced, with a focus on protection, monitoring, psychological support and capacity-building. 2)Ukrainian media outlets and journalists continue or reinstate their operations, providing the population with factual, conflict-sensitive and verified information of public interest, avoiding information vacuum. 3)Independent reporting on the Ukraine war, including crimes against journalists is strengthened
Outcome EN: Outcome 6 - Promote freedom of expression and the right to information
Output EN: 6.CI2 - Member States have strengthened capacities and raised awareness to enhance norms and policies related to freedom of expression, press freedom, safety of journalists, including women journalists, and the right to access information, online and offline

Project: Support to Education Sector Analysis and Development of Education Development Strategic Plan 2021-2030 in Viet Nam
Description: The project will assist the Ministry of Education and Training in conducting an education sector analysis and developing an education development strategic plan (EDSP) 2021-2030. The Education Sector Group (ESG) which consists of development partners active in the education sector in Viet Nam will be involved in the process of the education sector analysis and the education sector plan development.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED6 - Resilience, quality and equity of education systems strengthened to flexibly respond to evolving learning environments and to better deliver on SDG4 commitments
Donor: World Bank/International Bank for Reconstruction and Development

Project: Support to Education Sector Analysis and Development of Education Development Strategic Plan 2021-2030 in Viet Nam - Agency Fees
Description: Agency fees for a project (Support to Education Sector Analysis and Development of Education Development Strategic Plan 2021-2030 in Viet Nam) which will assist the Ministry of Education and Training in conducting an education sector analysis and developing an education development strategic plan (EDSP) 2021-2030.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED6 - Resilience, quality and equity of education systems strengthened to flexibly respond to evolving learning environments and to better deliver on SDG4 commitments

The Education Sector Group (ESG) which consists of development partners active in the education sector in Viet Nam will be involved in the process of the education sector analysis and the education sector plan development.

Project: PROCESSUS DE PREPARATION DU PACTE DE PARTENARIAT POUR LE FINANCEMENT GPE (Côte d'Ivoire)
Description:
Le Gouvernement ivoirien ambitionne de disposer pour son développement économique et socioculturel durable de ressources humaines de qualité et productive.

Les " Etats Généraux de l'Education Nationale et de l'Alphabétisation" ont permis d'identifier une série de solutions pour la transformation durable du système éducatif ivoirien. Son opérationnalisation nécessite un engagement de toutes les parties prenantes pour un nouveau pacte de reconstruction de l'école ivoirienne respectueuse des valeurs citoyennes.

A cet effet il été obtenu l'appui du PME, pour la mise en œuvre de son Plan sectoriel de l'éducation et de la formation. Le Gouvernement et le GLPE ont désigné l'UNESCO Agent Partenaire pour le fonds du PME pour l'appui technique à l'élaboration du Pacte de partenariat.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED6 - Resilience, quality and equity of education systems strengthened to flexibly respond to evolving learning environments and to better deliver on SDG4 commitments

Project: For a balanced, strong, and gender-responsive media environment in Pakistan
Description: Federal and provincial government officials of Pakistan will be equipped and aware of mechanisms enabling them to produce yearly reports on SDG 16 target 10 / The program considers different levels of technical skills and awareness and helps advancing the 2030 Development Agenda & Pakistan's Vision 2025. The activities build on each other & create opportunities for dialogue. Output: awareness-raising workshops for government officials.
Outcome EN: Outcome 6 - Promote freedom of expression and the right to information
Output EN: 6.CI2 - Member States have strengthened capacities and raised awareness to enhance norms and policies related to freedom of expression, press freedom, safety of journalists, including women journalists, and the right to access information, online and offline

Project: Damage and Needs Assessment of Ziarat Juniper Biosphere Reserve
Description: Recent monsoon rainfalls caused floods in Pakistan resulting in loss of human life, damage to property, destruction of crops, loss of livestock. Sixty-six districts have been officially declared to be 'calamity hit' by the Government of Pakistan. UNESCO sites like Moenjodaro, Makli World Heritage Sites in Sindh and Ziarat Juniper Biosphere Reserve (BR) in Balochistan are affected by the exceptional rainfall and floods this year. Ziarat Juniper BR is one of the two unesco biosphere reserves in the country. It is the largest in Pakistan and second largest of its kind in the world. There is not much information available on how much destruction is in the biosphere reserve. So, there is a need to conduct damage and needs assessment of the site.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.SC1 - Inclusive knowledge and capacities of Member States strengthened to advance and apply science for sustainable management of natural resources, ecosystem and biodiversity conservation and restoration, and disaster risk resilience

Project: Transforming Teaching and Learning at Schools for Achieving SGD4: turning theory into practice with ICT
Description:
The joint Project is aimed at supporting the promotion of the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs), recognizing and encouraging excellence with the use of technology in schools through curriculum design, group work, seminars, projects and global interaction, teacher development and training, collection, analysis and dissemination of best practices.
Key Project priorities:
1.	To enrich educational process and experience exchange around SDG's values and priorities.
2.	Develop and disseminate best practices on ICT competencies of schools.
3.	Promote networking and collaboration among targeted schools to meet the challenges and commitments of the interrelated SDGs.
Outcome EN: Outcome 8 - Foster knowledge sharing and skills development in the digital age
Output EN: 8.ED8 - Technologies and digital innovations leveraged to ensure more inclusive, effective and relevant learning
Regional Group: Europe and North America,Asia and the Pacific

Project: Transforming Teaching and Learning at Schools for Achieving SGD4: turning theory into practice with ICT
Description:
