Output EN: 8.ED8 - Technologies and digital innovations leveraged to ensure more inclusive, effective and relevant learning
Regional Group: Europe and North America,Asia and the Pacific

Project: Restoration of the historical centre of Gjirokastra in Albania
Description: The project is focused on restoration of selected monuments and quarters of WH property Gjirokastra ( parte of serial WH property Berat and Gjirokastra)
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: Appui à la préparation de la Participation du gouvernement haïtien au Sommet sur la Transformation de l'Education
Description: Dans le cadre d'une meilleure participation du gouvernement haïtien au Sommet sur la Transformation de l'Education en septembre 2022, l'UNESCO de concert avec le comité de pilotage (UNESCO, UNICEF, PAM et RCO) recrute un consultant national pour accompagner le gouvernement dans la mise en œuvre des Pistes d'action visant à promouvoir les besoins du système éducatif lors de ce sommet.
Outcome EN: Outcome 2 - Strengthen international coordination for the achievement of SDG 4 and develop the global education agenda based on research, foresight and innovation
Output EN: 2.ED7 - Education policy and finance decisions to achieve SDG 4 are informed by improved coordination, data and monitoring, knowledge and innovative partnerships

Project: Preservation of Koguryo Tombs and Mural Paintings in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea (Phase IV)
Description: Following the success of Phases I to III of the FiT project to preserve Koguryo-era tombs in the Democratic People' s Republic of Korea, this fourth phase will focus on scientific research and documentation on the tombs' mural paintings and emergency on-site conservation activities, along with training to further reinforce national capacities in the field of conservation. Coordinated by the World Heritage Centre, in close co-operation with the UNESCO Beijing Office and the Permanent Delegation of the DPRK, the project involves international experts from different fields and focuses on two tombs located within the World Heritage property, the Jinpa-ri Tombs I and IV.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: L'opérationnalisation de la plateforme sectorielle intégrée du SIGE dans la perspective de la production d'un annuaire sectoriel de l'Education et de la Formation au Cameroun
Description: Le présent projet vise à opérationnaliser la plateforme sectorielle intégrée du SIGE des ministères en charge de l'Education et de la Formation et l'Institut National de la Statistique (INS) dans la perspective de l'élaboration d'un annuaire statistique sectoriel. Cette plateforme devra être hébergée à l'INS, accessible en ligne et fédérée les statistiques de l'ensemble des sous-secteurs de l'éducation et de la formation.
Outcome EN: Outcome 2 - Strengthen international coordination for the achievement of SDG 4 and develop the global education agenda based on research, foresight and innovation
Output EN: 2.ED7 - Education policy and finance decisions to achieve SDG 4 are informed by improved coordination, data and monitoring, knowledge and innovative partnerships
Donor: World Bank/International Bank for Reconstruction and Development

Project: Chinese Government 2022 contribution to Beijing office costs
Description: Chinese Government 2022 contribution as additional Appropriation to the RP budget for Beijing office costs
Output EN: FLD Operating and Staff Costs

Project: Emergency Assistance - Saint Lucia - impacted by a tropical wave on 6 November 2022
Description: Torrential rains, related flooding, and landslides have caused major damage to peoples as well as loss of property, but also eight educational institutions on the Island, in particular the Dame Pearlette Louisy Primary School, were severely impacted. The destruction included extensive damage to school facilities, massive losses of equipment, furniture, books and other school materials and supplies.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particularly in Africa, developing countries, LDCs, and SIDS

Project: Bosnia and Herzegovina Emergency Assistance - To support rebuilding schools in the municipalities of Stolac and Ljubinje
Description: Financial contribution of US$49,916 to support urgent construction works in schools in the municipalities of Stolac and Ljubinje which have been damaged by the recent earthquake
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particularly in Africa, developing countries, LDCs, and SIDS

Project: Technical Expert Advice to Establish a National Multi-Hazard Early Warning System - Oman
Description: The Directorate General of Meteorology and Air Navigation (DGMAN) was tasked by the government of Oman to develop and establish a National Multi Hazard Early Warning System (NMHEWS). Within this framework the Ministry of Transport and communication of Oman and UNESCO signed a Self Benefit Fund in Trust (SBFiT) in 2009 towards developing NMHEWS under the technical assistance of UNESCO's Intergovernmental Oceanographic Commission (IOC). The project is fully funded by Oman and was launched in 2010.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health and accelerate the transition towards sustainable management of ocean-related risks and opportunities

Project: Syria emergency response in the domains of Culture and Education
Description:
Following the significant damages caused by the 7.8 magnitude earthquake and aftershocks in Syria the UNESCO Beirut Office undertook a mission to Aleppo and Damascus to prepare the emergency response in the Culture and Education Sectors. 

As a result, UNESCO positioned as lead for the Culture Sector Chapter within the interagency Syria Earthquake Recovery Needs Assessment (SERNA)'and was identified as in important partner in the overall UN response for education. 

The purpose of this activity is to ensure the continued leadership of UNESCO in the domain of Culture and meaningful engagement in the domain of Education in the Syria emergency response.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT3 - Member States capacities strengthened for better preparedness, mitigation and response to emergencies affecting culture, including in situations of armed conflict and disaster

Project: GEBCO
Description: The IOC will also invest in supporting the development of the General Bathymetric Chart of the Oceans (GEBCO), together with the IHO, leading to the expansion of knowledge related to seafloor depths and features which is critical to support marine research, as well as the production of tsunami inundation models in coastal areas
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health and accelerate the transition towards sustainable management of ocean-related risks and opportunities

Project: PRIX FELIX HOUPHOUET-BOIGNY POUR LA RECHERCHE DE LA PAIX
Description: 180 EX/17 (see http://unesdoc.unesco.org/images/0016/001623/162309e.pdf)
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PAX3 - Impact and visibility of UNESCO's programmes in Africa strengthened through enhanced coordination, monitoring and mobilization of partners in relation to the Operational Strategy for Priority Africa (2022-2029), and better understanding of Africa's development opportunities and challenges

Project: CapED Programme - Fostering Skills for Life and Work: Literacy skills for girls' and women's empowerment
Description: The CapED Programme is an extrabudgetary programme created in 2003. It is based on the understanding that education reforms will not be effective if countries lack the capacities to make them operational. With an overarching capacity development approach, CapED seeks to improve the quality of education and increase learning opportunities, especially for girls and women and disadvantaged population groups. Under "Literacy skills for girls' and women's empowerment", CapED assists countries craft non-formal education policies and develop, implement and scale up good quality, relevant and innovative adult education programmes targeting girls and women.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED4 - Learners are equipped with relevant skills to meet individual, labour market and societal demands through literacy, TVET, STEM and higher education

Project: CapED Programme - Improving Quality through Teachers
Description: The CapED Programme is an extrabudgetary programme created in 2003. It is based on the understanding that education reforms will not be effective if countries lack the capacities to make them operational. With an overarching capacity development approach, CapED seeks to improve the quality of education and increase learning opportunities, especially for girls and women and disadvantaged population groups. Under "Improving Quality through Teachers", CapED supports countries develop and implement comprehensive teacher policies, strengthen teacher-training institutions and ensure that programmes for the professional development of teachers are reviewed from a gender-equality perspective.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED5 - Teachers trained and supported to improve learning outcomes and address the changes brought forth by the digital and AI transformation and the COVID-19 crisis

Project: Secondment of Ms. Heejeong Ahn to UNESCO Bangkok (Programme Specialist in Education)
Description: Under the overall authority of the Director of the UNESCO Asia-Pacific Regional Bureau for Education (UNESCO Bangkok) and under the direct supervision of the Chief of EISD, the Programme Specialist in Education contributes to the planning and implementation of EISD programme activities with a special focus on activities in higher education and support the Director of UNESCO Bangkok in implementing the Regional Bureau's Education Support Strategy and developing partnerships with education institutions and private sector.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED4 - Learners are equipped with relevant skills to meet individual, labour market and societal demands through literacy, TVET, STEM and higher education

Project: Accelerating the transfer of marine technology for the conservation and sustainable use of oceans, seas and marine resources
Description: This proposed project aims to, building on the tremendous achievement made in the past with the support of JFIT, accelerate the transfer of marine technology in the region on marine biodiversity conservation and seafood safety, through increasing their scientific knowledge, developing their research capacity and transfer of marine technology, in order to assist IOC Member States in the Western Pacific, in achieving not only SDG14 but also all SDGs which would also benefit from improved knowledge of the ocean.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health and accelerate the transition towards sustainable management of ocean-related risks and opportunities

Project: Sustainable Tourism Pledge - Promoting sustainable tourism with Expedia Group
Description: The UNESCO Sustainable Travel Pledge was developed in partnership with UNESCO and Expedia Group to inspire and provide incentives for local tourism businesses in key tourism destination countries to support sustainable tourism linked to safeguarding heritage and the Sustainable Development Goals. The Pledge was launched in Thailand and a new global Pledge platform was developed in 2021 to help support the tourism industry for a sustainable and resilient recovery from COVID-19. A growing number of hotel chains and destinations joined the Pledge in 2021 and 2022, equating to 10,000 hotels committing to concrete, transparent and achievable action.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: XB Established staff costs
Description: To cover the salaries of relevant staff.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 11 - Accountable, efficient and effective management in pursuit of the Organization's results
Output EN: 11.FLD3 - Enhanced administrative and operational support by addressing existing and emerging needs

Project: JPO (France) for Education Planning (BEI)
Description: Under the general authority of the Director of the UNESCO Office in Beirut and the direct supervision of the Programme Specialist, the JPO will be responsible for contributing to the coordination of UNESCO's actions within the framework of technical support for the implementation of Lebanon Five-Year General Education Plan, and support the implementation of the Li Beirut initiative.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED1 - Education systems are equipped to promote inclusion, address marginalization and advance rights, including in crisis-affected and post-disaster contexts

Project: International Assistance - Additional funding 2022-2023
Description: Additional funds for International Assistance can be provided to help the States Parties to the World Heritage Convention to protect the World Cultural or Natural Heritage located on their territories and inscribed on the World Heritage List, the List of World Heritage in Danger or on Tentative Lists.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: GEF IW:LEARN 5: Supporting Portfolio Coordination Within and Beyond the International Waters Focal Area, particularly in Small Island Developing States, Through Knowledge Sharing, Information Management, Partnership Building and Programmatic Guidance Servi
Description:
The project's objective is to move towards a more impactful GEF portfolio through facilitating
replication of good practice across GEF International Waters projects, including projects across all focal
areas in Small Island Developing States; working in collaboration with development partners; supporting
the delivery of training information management, providing programmatic guidance; and facilitating
partnership building. The project will continue supporting the GEF mandate to support transboundary cooperation. The project's activities will help the portfolio to implement regionally endorsed SAP priorities, mainstream gender considerations, and stimulate private sector investment.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health and accelerate the transition towards sustainable management of ocean-related risks and opportunities

Project: Calculate non-riverine components of coastal nutrient inputs to COSCATs from upwelling and onwelling, and (for N) from marine N fixation and N deposition
Description: The overall goal is to achieve an operational approach for calculating national status and trends for the Index for Coastal Eutrophication Potential (ICEP see https://youtu.be/qW2nV2bsyCs) as an indicator for Sustainable Development Goal 14.1.1 on eutrophication: By 2025, prevent and significantly reduce marine pollution of all kinds, in particular from land-based activities, including marine debris and nutrient pollution.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health and accelerate the transition towards sustainable management of ocean-related risks and opportunities

Project: Enhancing Teacher roles in ensuring learning continuity and quality learning outcomes
Description: UNESCO BEI EO5 programme builds on achievements of the previous Biennium by expanding its activities on teacher roles in ensuring learning continuity and enhancing alignment for learning. Several major resources initiated during the previous Biennium will be finalized (i.e. Alignment for Learning Guide; Learning Assessment Framework for the Arab Region; and Collection/Repository of promising practices and Teacher comprehensive Brief) that will serve as reference for policy dialogue, capacity development activities and new studies/research in the Arab Region. Activities will advocate teacher autonomy and enhanced competencies in mastering ICTs across the curriculum, adjusting curricula to local circumstances and new needs, and engaging in formative assessment/assessment as learning.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED5 - Teachers trained and supported to improve learning outcomes and address the changes brought forth by the digital and AI transformation and the COVID-19 crisis

Project: Informing and Supporting the Enhancement of Teacher Policies and Practices in the Asia-Pacific Region
Description: The Teacher Regular Programme (RP) of UNESCO Asia and Pacific Regional Bureau aims to produce solid research and evidence-based information, analysis and advice for the member states to enhance their teacher policies and practices, in order to advance the teaching profession and address the emerging educational trends and challenges, especially those brought about by the COVID-19 pandemic and digital transformation. The RP also serves to promote and disseminate good practices and innovations in teacher policy and teacher training, as well as in teaching and learning.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED5 - Teachers trained and supported to improve learning outcomes and address the changes brought forth by the digital and AI transformation and the COVID-19 crisis

Project: Informing and Supporting the Enhancement of Teacher Policies and Practices in the Asia-Pacific Region
Description: The Teacher Regular Programme (RP) of UNESCO Asia and Pacific Regional Bureau aims to produce solid research and evidence-based information, analysis and advice for the member states to enhance their teacher policies and practices, in order to advance the teaching profession and address the emerging educational trends and challenges, especially those brought about by the COVID-19 pandemic and digital transformation. The RP also serves to promote and disseminate good practices and innovations in teacher policy and teacher training, as well as in teaching and learning.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED5 - Teachers trained and supported to improve learning outcomes and address the changes brought forth by the digital and AI transformation and the COVID-19 crisis

Project: Climate Change Adaptation in Coastal Zones
Description: One of the priorities in the context of the ICAM Strategy is to build the capacity of national and local coastal management agencies in designing and implementing coastal hazards mitigations, through the use of best practices advocated within new guidelines, as well as access to resources on the topic of hazards mitigation and climate change adaptation.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health and accelerate the transition towards sustainable management of ocean-related risks and opportunities

Project: Development and maintenance of the global ocean data and information network
Description: Science-informed policies for reduced vulnerability to ocean hazards, for the global conservation and sustainable use of oceans, seas and marine resources, and increased resilience and adaptation to climate change require reliable quality-controlled data and information as well as long-term time series of ocean observations. The IODE programme has, since 1961, established a global network of oceanographic data centres and information centres that manage, share and disseminate data, information, products and services.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health and accelerate the transition towards sustainable management of ocean-related risks and opportunities

Project: Development and maintenance of the global ocean data and information network
Description: Science-informed policies for reduced vulnerability to ocean hazards, for the global conservation and sustainable use of oceans, seas and marine resources, and increased resilience and adaptation to climate change require reliable quality-controlled data and information as well as long-term time series of ocean observations. The IODE programme has, since 1961, established a global network of oceanographic data centres and information centres that manage, share and disseminate data, information, products and services.

Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health and accelerate the transition towards sustainable management of ocean-related risks and opportunities

Project: Support to the nomination process
Description: The RP workplan will be affected to provide technical assistance and guidance to States Parties preparing tentative lists and nominations, to support the work relating to the revision of the nomination process, to support the reflection on sites associated with recent conflicts as well as to the implementation of the requests of Upstream Process received by States Parties.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: Promote Integrated & Sustained Warning Systems
Description: Tsunami warning systems depend on international collaboration, embodied in formal commitments, with the official support of governments. On the technical side warning systems depend on linking together a large number of national geophysical observations in a regional data network where observations flow in real time to designated regional Tsunami Service providers (TSPs) and National Tsunami Warning Centers (NTWC). IOC provides intergovernmental coordination for development and harmonization of regional Tsunami Warning Systems in accordance with mandate adopted at 23rd IOC Assembly (2005). IOC provides assistance for countries to develop their National Tsunami Warning Centers within a multi-hazard framework and for maximizing community response through creation of education and awareness.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health and accelerate the transition towards sustainable management of ocean-related risks and opportunities

Project: Tsunami Ready - Educating Communities at Risk
Description: IOC coordinates four regional tsunami warning systems. An effective tsunami early warning system is achieved when all persons, especially in vulnerable coastal communities are prepared and respond appropriately to Tsunami alerts. When combined with dedicated public preparedness efforts, early warning enables communities to know what to do in case of tsunami. In extreme cases (Palu, Indonesia, 2018, Tonga 2022), there may be insufficient time to produce any public alerts. In these instances, vulnerable communities must be educated and ready to act based only on natural warning signs. The IOC Tsunami programme for the UN Decade of Ocean Sciences for Sustainable Development aims to achieve 100% of at-risk communities to become Tsunami Ready by 2030.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health and accelerate the transition towards sustainable management of ocean-related risks and opportunities

Project: Follow-up to SDGs, WOA & State of the Ocean Reporting
Description:
The IOC will fulfill its commitment to be custodian for two SDG 14 indicators, 14.3.1 focusing on ocean acidification and 14.a.1 on scientific cooperation/investment. 

In order to meet the increased demand by decision-makers and society at large for current and easily accessible information on the state of the ocean, as well as to contribute to the UN Ocean Decade, the IOC will prepare a pilot 'State of the Ocean Report' (StOR).
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health and accelerate the transition towards sustainable management of ocean-related risks and opportunities

Project: GEBCO
Description: The IOC will also invest in supporting the development of the General Bathymetric Chart of the Oceans (GEBCO), together with the IHO, leading to the expansion of knowledge related to seafloor depths and features which is critical to support marine research, as well as the production of tsunami inundation models in coastal areas
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health and accelerate the transition towards sustainable management of ocean-related risks and opportunities

Project: IOC Governing Bodies
Description:
The Intergovernmental Oceanographic commission is established as a body with functional autonomy within UNESCO. The Commission defines and implements its programme according to its stated purpoe and functions and within the framework of the budget adopted by its Assembly.
The Governing Bodies of the Commission consist of an Assembly, an Executive Council and such subsidiry bodies as it may establish.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health and accelerate the transition towards sustainable management of ocean-related risks and opportunities
Donor: European Marine Biological Resource Center EMBRC-ERIC

Project: Partnerships & Outreach (SDG follow-up)
Description: y acting as the focal point for ocean sciences within the United Nations system, IOC will continue to engage in relevant United Nations inter-agency activities aimed at providing assistance to Member States in the implementation of 2030 Agenda, in accordance with IOC's custodianship role in relation to SDG 14, as well as the implementation of the Paris Agreement on Climate Change, the SAMOA Pathway, and Sendai Disaster Reduction Framework. This activity will also support the IOC role as coordinator for the UN Decade of Ocean Sciences for Sustainable Development
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health and accelerate the transition towards sustainable management of ocean-related risks and opportunities

Project: CLT Evaluations
Description: CLT Evaluations
Output EN: CLT Programme-related, operating and staff costs

Project: AGI - HQ indirect programme costs (CLT)
Description: HQ indirect programme costs (CLT)
Output EN: CLT Programme-related, operating and staff costs

Project: Strengthening the capacity and raising awareness on freedom of expression, safety of women and men journalists and access to information online and offline
Description: The media in the region faces different challenges and obstacles on the road to becoming a free, safe, independent, and pluralistic media environment. These includes political instability, vague or inconsistent media laws, lack of diversity of media that is partially linked to media viability issues, as well as sporadic attacks, imprisonments, and even death of journalists. There are also classic media development challenges including lack of capacity building, technology, and funding.
Outcome EN: Outcome 6 - Promote freedom of expression and the right to information
Output EN: 6.CI2 - Member States have strengthened capacities and raised awareness to enhance norms and policies related to freedom of expression, press freedom, safety of journalists, including women journalists, and the right to access information, online and offline

Project: Fostering universal access to information and knowledge including identification of documentary heritage for Memory of the World
Description: The region is home to a rich and diverse documentary heritage that reflects the cultures, histories, traditions and values which also registered under the UNESCO Memory of the World (MOW) Programme. Member states under Jakarta continues to face persistent challenges in terms of difficulties in securing and having sustained resources, timely and quality preservation action, and utilization of technology in the preservation, making it difficult to the realization of sustainable preservation of documentary heritage. Additionally, none of the Memory of the World Registers in Jakarta cluster countries can be considered as documentary heritage that contributes to gender equality.
Outcome EN: Outcome 8 - Foster knowledge sharing and skills development in the digital age
Output EN: 8.CI4 - Member States are enabled to foster universal access to information and knowledge, including through the Information for All Programme (IFAP), as well as through Open Solutions, and through the identification, preservation and accessibility of documentary heritage

Project: Promoting intercultural dialogue, mutual understanding, cooperation and peace (International Decade for the Rapprochement of Cultures-2013-2022)
Description: The Decade aims to respond to a dual objective to raise the awareness of the international community on the virtues of diversity and intercultural and interreligious dialogue, using specific examples to show that all cultures, religions, beliefs and civilizations derive from and feed into each other, and to fight for human rights and against new forms of racism, discrimination, intolerance, extremism and radicalization.
Outcome EN: Outcome 7 - Promote inclusion and combat discrimination, hate speech and stereotypes
Output EN: 7.SHS1 - Member States capacities strengthened to advance effective policies and practices to achieve inclusive development through the promotion of human rights, scientific freedom, intercultural understanding and by tackling all forms of discrimination and racism

Project: CapED Programme - Fostering Skills for Life and Work: Youth employment and entrepreneurship
Description: The CapED Programme is an extrabudgetary programme created in 2003. It is based on the understanding that education reforms will not be effective if countries lack the capacities to make them operational. With an overarching capacity development approach, CapED seeks to improve the quality of education and increase learning opportunities, especially for girls and women and disadvantaged population groups. Under "Youth employment and entrepreneurship", CapED will develop capacities across the system to create better coordination and linkages between TVET provision and the labour market and to facilitate more efficient and equitable transition to work.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED4 - Learners are equipped with relevant skills to meet individual, labour market and societal demands through literacy, TVET, STEM and higher education

Project: Special account for the support of the Culture Programme activities
Description: The "Special account for the support of the Culture Programme activities" was established by Executive Board's decision 202 EX/30 (II) with a view to mobilizing flexible funding for Major Programme IV - Culture. The purpose is to attract pooled funding from donors in direct reinforcement of the programme approved by the General Conference with as little earmarking as possible. To make the special account attractive, donors will be able to earmark their funding to any level of the C/5, i.e. Major Programme, Main Line of Action or Expected Result, but not below.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT6 - Member States capacities strengthened to promote, monitor and measure the contribution of culture to the implementation of the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development at the local, national and regional levels

Project: Study of the state of the Latin American postgraduate programmes
Description: Study commissioned and financed by the Technological University of Uruguay.
Outcome EN: Outcome 2 - Strengthen international coordination for the achievement of SDG 4 and develop the global education agenda based on research, foresight and innovation
Output EN: 2.ED9 - Education and learning reimagined through interdisciplinary research, foresight and public policy debate

Project: A Science Contribution to the UN 2023 Water Conference
Description:
The project aims to strengthen the Science Research Agenda "Science to Accelerating the Implementation of SDG6 - A contribution to UN Water Conference 2023" by producing two interrelated deliverables:
1)	A wider science policy consultation among scientific institutions, UN agencies and stakeholders with the aim of discussing and finalizing the two blueprint papers.
2)	Two blueprint papers: "Frontiers on Water Sciences and Development Goals",; and "Science policy interlinkages"
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.SC2 - Water science, innovation, education, management, cooperation and governance bolstered for a water secure world in a changing environment

Project: Junior Professional Officer (JPO) Government of China (JPO)
Description: Under the overall authority of the Chief Financial Officer (CFO) and the supervision of the Chief of section for budget, monitoring and reporting, the JPO shall assist in the preparation, monitoring and reporting on the utilization of the Organization's biennial budget, as well as in dealing with various budgetary issues. The CFO oversees the planning and monitoring of the Organization's budget, and the Chief of section will provide guidance to the JPO in all aspects of the daily work in these areas.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 11 - Accountable, efficient and effective management in pursuit of the Organization's results
Output EN: 11.BFM1 - Prudent financial management, while strengthening of the internal controls and the second line of defense, supported by appropriate and timely management and financial reporting

Project: JPO (Germany) for Health and Education
Description: Under the overall authority of the Director of the Division for Peace and Sustainable Development, based in the Section of Health and Education, the JPO will support the work of the Division and Section in the development and operationalization of policies and programmes to (i) support efforts in relation to SDG4 efforts and reporting, specifically in relation to Target 4.7; (ii) support the identification of good policies and practices, including through new research; and (iii) assist with support to countries in response to growing demands in relation to school health programmes, in particular:
Outcome EN: Outcome 7 - Promote inclusion and combat discrimination, hate speech and stereotypes
Output EN: 7.ED3 - Learners are empowered to lead healthy lives, promote sustainable development and engage with the world as creative and responsible global citizens

Project: Global Water Pathogen Project
Description: The Global Water Pathogen Project aims to develop a knowledge resource to strengthen the knowledge base on fundamental linkages between water, sanitation and human health by publishing and disseminating a state-of-the-art scientific reference book and online knowledge platform on water-related diseases. Through knowledge generation and improved awareness, the project will guide and help the development and implementation of policies and intervention measures in the water and sanitation sector that can help reduce water-related disease risks and their impacts on human health (including the loss of human lives due to water-borne diseases).
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.SC2 - Water science, innovation, education, management, cooperation and governance bolstered for a water secure world in a changing environment

Project: Promoting ICT Capacity Building and Open Education in the Era of Artificial Intelligence and Digital Technologies
Description: The project is aimed to support opening up of education to a wide audience of potential students and to develop teacher capacities in using digital technologies and content within formal education and lifelong learning. The project will contribute to UNESCO activities towards achieving the Education 2030 agenda and SDG4 for education through promoting ICT capacity building and Open Education in the era of artificial intelligence and digital technologies to strengthen quality in education and lifelong learning, including digital citizenship education.
Outcome EN: Outcome 8 - Foster knowledge sharing and skills development in the digital age
Output EN: 8.ED8 - Technologies and digital innovations leveraged to ensure more inclusive, effective and relevant learning

Project: Building Office Capacities
Description: The principle purpose of this project is to strengthen the activities of the UNESCO Regional Bureau for Science and Culture in Europe through the building of Office Capacities as agreed by the Governance Bodies of the Bureau (Scientific Council and Steering Committee). This project will allow the Director and staff of the Bureau to travel and undertake activities relevant to the execution of the approved programmes. In addition, this project intends to provide the Bureau with the human and financial resources necessary to run the Bureau and its activities, as recommended by the Gov. Bodies and approved by the DG.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 11 - Accountable, efficient and effective management in pursuit of the Organization's results
Output EN: 11.FLD3 - Enhanced administrative and operational support by addressing existing and emerging needs

Project: Japanese JPO - ESD for 2030 (2022-)
Description: Contribute to implementing the UNESCO/Japan Prize on ESD and the ESD for 2030 framework in general
Outcome EN: Outcome 7 - Promote inclusion and combat discrimination, hate speech and stereotypes
Output EN: 7.ED3 - Learners are empowered to lead healthy lives, promote sustainable development and engage with the world as creative and responsible global citizens

Project: Climate Science Literacy
Description: The United Nations (UN) recognizes that climate change is a threat to global peace and security, and economic development. Increasing land and ocean temperatures and changing precipitation patterns, as well as the increasing number and intensity of extreme weather events have an adverse impact on arable land and food production, as well as fisheries and aquaculture, bringing the food-water-energy nexus as the potential trigger of sizeable climate related migration and social discontent and unrest. With the current COVID-19 pandemic and its zoonotic origins the focus on the biodiversity-climate change-health nexus has become pertinent.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.SC1 - Inclusive knowledge and capacities of Member States strengthened to advance and apply science for sustainable management of natural resources, ecosystem and biodiversity conservation and restoration, and disaster risk resilience

Project: Improvement of the ANVISA technological capacity as a health regulatory agency
Description: The project is intended to enable new scientific and technological improvements for the Brazilian National Sanitary Surveilance Agency (ANVISA), capacity-building and training opportunities to its technical staff and the development of communication sanitary campaigns and other anti-COVID initiatives.
Outcome EN: Outcome 4 - Advance international cooperation in science, technology and innovation
Output EN: 4.SC5 - Institutional and human capacities in basic sciences, technology, research, innovation, and engineering enhanced to advance knowledge for sustainable development

Project: Basic Education in Porto Alegre
Description: The objective of this International Technical Cooperation Project is the consolidation of pedagogical, curricular and management practices by the education network; the improvement of pedagogical and curricular practices; updating the knowledge of education professionals; the adoption of innovative educational content and methodologies; the improvement of the management capacity of priority educational programs, as well as the expansion and improvement of the offer of places for early childhood education and elementary education.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED6 - Resilience, quality and equity of education systems strengthened to flexibly respond to evolving learning environments and to better deliver on SDG4 commitments

Project: SMUL - Participatory Urban Planning for the City of São Paulo
Description: The Project aims to use innovative and efficient participatory methodologies and tools for urban planning in the City of São Paulo, using strategies to manage information and kwnoledge to develop urban planing public policies for the city of São Paulo.
Outcome EN: Outcome 8 - Foster knowledge sharing and skills development in the digital age
Output EN: 8.CI4 - Member States are enabled to foster universal access to information and knowledge, including through the Information for All Programme (IFAP), as well as through Open Solutions, and through the identification, preservation and accessibility of documentary heritage

Project: Open Government: Transparency and Prevention of Corruption
Description: The Project aims to promote the dialogue between government and society through open government initiatives, in order to ensure progress towards sustainable development goals, especially those related to institutional strengthening of public administration, in order to make them more effective and responsible at all levels. The main objectives are to implement programmes and actions that promote transparency, integrity and prevention of corruption in public administration, and to improve the relationship with civil society and private sector.
Outcome EN: Outcome 8 - Foster knowledge sharing and skills development in the digital age
Output EN: 8.CI4 - Member States are enabled to foster universal access to information and knowledge, including through the Information for All Programme (IFAP), as well as through Open Solutions, and through the identification, preservation and accessibility of documentary heritage

Project: Access to Knowledge for Consumers
Description: The project aims to improve the management of information and knowledge of Brazilian National System of Consumer Protection through institutional strengthening of the National Secretariat of Consumers, also by improving public policies aimed at improving consumer protection Brazil and promoting the National Plan of Consumption and Citizenship.
Outcome EN: Outcome 8 - Foster knowledge sharing and skills development in the digital age
Output EN: 8.CI4 - Member States are enabled to foster universal access to information and knowledge, including through the Information for All Programme (IFAP), as well as through Open Solutions, and through the identification, preservation and accessibility of documentary heritage

Project: Rural Craft and Cultural Hubs - Phase II
Description: Since 2013, UNESCO with the Department of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises and Textiles (MSME&T), Government of West Bengal, has been working to strengthen livelihood opportunities for the craft artisans and folk artists in rural West Bengal. The current project aims to continue the ongoing efforts among existing and new beneficiaries towards skills up-gradation and transmission, creation of wider public interest in safeguarding intangible cultural heritage (ICH), market linkages, digital education and promotion, and linkages with Government schemes for the socio-economic betterment of the practitioner communities.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT4 - Member States and communities capacities strengthened to identify, safeguard and promote living heritage

Project: Support Programme Development of the GPE 2025 System Transformation Grant Cambodia
Description: Testament to the strong results achieved by UNESCO and the MoEYS under GPE-3, the Local Education Group (LEG) in Cambodia comprising the MoEYS and development partners have selected UNESCO as Grant Agent for the $15.39 million System Transformation Grant (STG) under the new GPE 2025 Operating Model, of which UNESCO will manage the 'Fixed Part' and 'Top-up' tranches totalling $12.62 million and UNICEF will manage the $2.77 million 'Variable Part'. As Grant Agent, UNESCO will work closely with the leadership and technical departments of the MoEYS, the LEG and other Grant Agents to develop a high-quality programme document for the successful application of the STG Grant.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.FLD4 - UNESCO Field Offices empowered to strengthen resource mobilization at decentralized level

Project: Support Programme Development of the GPE 2025 System Transformation Grant Cambodia
Description: Testament to the strong results achieved by UNESCO and the MoEYS under GPE-3, the Local Education Group (LEG) in Cambodia comprising the MoEYS and development partners have selected UNESCO as Grant Agent for the $15.39 million System Transformation Grant (STG) under the new GPE 2025 Operating Model, of which UNESCO will manage the 'Fixed Part' and 'Top-up' tranches totalling $12.62 million and UNICEF will manage the $2.77 million 'Variable Part'. As Grant Agent, UNESCO will work closely with the leadership and technical departments of the MoEYS, the LEG and other Grant Agents to develop a high-quality programme document for the successful application of the STG Grant.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.FLD4 - UNESCO Field Offices empowered to strengthen resource mobilization at decentralized level

Project: Voices of Peace: Promoting live-together in the liberated territories of Iraq through community media
Description: The overall objective of this project is to promote respect for cultural diversity and live together as a basis for stabilization and reconciliation in the multicultural regions of northeastern Iraq.
Outcome EN: Outcome 8 - Foster knowledge sharing and skills development in the digital age
Output EN: 8.CI4 - Member States are enabled to foster universal access to information and knowledge, including through the Information for All Programme (IFAP), as well as through Open Solutions, and through the identification, preservation and accessibility of documentary heritage

Project: Gendered approach to Preventing Violent Extremism in Iraq through Education
Description: The project aims at fostering a new sense of community where community members are more resilient to radicalising narratives and actively participating in processes to build peaceful co-existence living in the liberated areas of Anbar and Ninewa governorates underpinned by education that nurtures critical thinking and values the behaviours associated with mutual respect and co-existence.
Outcome EN: Outcome 7 - Promote inclusion and combat discrimination, hate speech and stereotypes
Output EN: 7.ED3 - Learners are empowered to lead healthy lives, promote sustainable development and engage with the world as creative and responsible global citizens

Project: Supporting the protection of the urban fabric of the devastated areas following the Beirut Blast
Description: This project aims to provide the necessary protection for the urban and heritage core of the devastated parts of the city as the result of 4th of August Beirut Port explosions, in particular strengthening the legal environment for the viable legal protection of the heritage buildings and urban fabric through the provision of international consultancy for the DGA to elaborate the protection and rehabilitation plan of the damaged areas.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT3 - Member States capacities strengthened for better preparedness, mitigation and response to emergencies affecting culture, including in situations of armed conflict and disaster

Project: ASSISTANCE TO THE REHABILITATION AND REOPENING OF THE SURSOCK MUSEUM
Description: The project aims to rehabilitate Sursok Museum form the damages caused by the Beirut Port blast, and to ultimately contribute to the reopening of the Museum to the public by early 2022, and putting the Museum in the conditions to restarting cultural activities. This will be achieved through the implementation of the indispensable rehabilitation works, including: lighting system in the exhibition galleries and service areas, fire rated doors, glass partitions (cafeteria, public toilets and audiovisual room), false ceilings in services areas, electro-mechanical cables, equipment and accessories (smoke detectors, cameras for CCTV system, ducting and AC related accessories etc...)
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT3 - Member States capacities strengthened for better preparedness, mitigation and response to emergencies affecting culture, including in situations of armed conflict and disaster

Project: For the preparation of a conservation management plan for Oscar Niemeyer's Rashid Karami International Fair in Tripoli, Lebanon
Description: A conservation management plan, including as desk based study of the archival material, value based assessment and condition assessment of the physical fabric, in addition to some research and testing of original materials and techniques , will be developed for the International Fair at Tripoli, North Lebanon, one of the most iconic architectural achievements of the modern period in Lebanon designed by the Brazilian architect Oscar Niemeyer in the 1960s. the project will directly benefit the development of the World Heritage dossier including the identification of an outstanding universal value for the site and the definition of its authenticity and integrity.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: ECW MULTI-YEAR RESILIENCE PROGRAMME (MYRP) FOR THE STATE OF PALESTINE 2019-2021
Description: Owing to the chronic crisis state and protracted conflict, this ECW programme in Palestine aims to strengthen the resilience and development of affected children, families and communities in Gaza, East Jerusalem, Hebron and Area C. The programme seeks to achieve the following results: improved access and continuity of inclusive, equitable education and learning opportunities for girls and boys; improved relevance and quality of education in a protective and safe learning environment; and strengthened capacity of the education system to respond to emergency needs and deliver a coordinated response in crises as part of the overall education system.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED1 - Education systems are equipped to promote inclusion, address marginalization and advance rights, including in crisis-affected and post-disaster contexts

Project: Supporting Palestine in the periodic reporting exercise on the implementation of the 2003 Convention at the national level
Description: The Arab States will be the third region to report on the implementation of the 2003 Convention for the Safeguarding of the Intangible Cultural Heritage at the national level using a new mechanism of reporting. Periodic Reporting is based on participatory processes that can strengthen relationships with and among the range of actors involved in the ICH field. Periodic Reporting also links to broader mechanisms for M&E goals in related areas such as cultural policies, media, or formal and non-formal education. Palestine will be supported throughout the multi-stakeholder consultative process that will be conducted at the local and national level to prepare its report on the implementation of the 2003 Convention, including in peer-to-peer and regional exchange and trainings.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT4 - Member States and communities capacities strengthened to identify, safeguard and promote living heritage

Project: Increasing TVET Competencies for Youth in the Palestinian Labour Market
Description: Within this project, UNESCO aims to contribute towards bridging the skills gap, minimizing the mismatch between the supply and demand for skills in the labor market, while incorporating cultural factors and awareness into the TVET track, in order to create value and meaning for students which links their educational experience with their forming identity and the process of their self-actualization. It will also provide 21st Century solutions to the student's learning and work experience including anticipated information about skills needed in the TVET track, which will have a great impact on the choice of the youth career path in Palestine.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED4 - Learners are equipped with relevant skills to meet individual, labour market and societal demands through literacy, TVET, STEM and higher education

Project: Supporting Palestine in the periodic reporting exercise on the implementation of the 2003 Convention at the national level
Description: The Arab States will be the third region to report on the implementation of the 2003 Convention for the Safeguarding of the Intangible Cultural Heritage at the national level using a new mechanism of reporting. Periodic Reporting is based on participatory processes that can strengthen relationships with and among the range of actors involved in the ICH field. Periodic Reporting also links to broader mechanisms for M&E goals in related areas such as cultural policies, media, or formal and non-formal education. Palestine will be supported throughout the multi-stakeholder consultative process that will be conducted at the local and national level to prepare its report on the implementation of the 2003 Convention, including in peer-to-peer and regional exchange and trainings.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT4 - Member States and communities capacities strengthened to identify, safeguard and promote living heritage

Project: "Palestine Riwaya Museum in Bethlehem (finalisation of Phase III: Completion the renovation of the Museum's space )"
Description:
The overall objective of the project is to establish a model Palestinian interactive and multimedia museum in Bethlehem, called Riwaya (narrative) Museum. It will be a venue for safeguarding and promoting Palestinian cultural diversity and fostering intercultural dialogue as it will serve as a tourist destination. This particular phase aims at completing the renovation of the museum space started in Phase III of the project.

Note: For detailed information about the scope and concerning the current project, please refer to the "Application for grants from the 
Norwegian Ministry of Foreign Affairs (MFA)" in the attachments section.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT2 - Member States capacities strengthened to fight the illicit trafficking of cultural property and promote its return and restitution, to protect underwater cultural heritage and to promote the role of museums for societies

Project: Supporting the Institutional Sustainability of Al-Aqsa Mosque Centre for the Restoration of Islamic Manuscripts in Jerusalem: Phase IV: Consolidation of skills and Exit Strategy.
Description: The objective of this project proposal is to make of the Center for the restoration of Islamic Manuscripts of the Haram al Sharif, in Jerusalem, an operational, autonomous and sustainable entity by the end of the project, in 2020, able to safeguard this unique Islamic heritage. The project will include a Conservation assessment of the Center; the elaboration of a 10-year conservation and management strategy; the reinforcement of the capacities of the staff; the restoration of the premises; the digitization and inventory of the collections; and the human and material reinforcement of the Center. The project will be developed over an estimated period of 3 years.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT2 - Member States capacities strengthened to fight the illicit trafficking of cultural property and promote its return and restitution, to protect underwater cultural heritage and to promote the role of museums for societies

Project: PMESUT - Virtual Trainning and Teaching Development (Technical Assistance to Peru)
Description: Public bid call made by the Peruvian State in which the IESALC was awarded the projects related to options 5 and 3 of the bidding document.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED4 - Learners are equipped with relevant skills to meet individual, labour market and societal demands through literacy, TVET, STEM and higher education

Project: Rural Education in Secondary School in Peru - Cuzco and Amazonas
Description: The programme promotes the strengthening of intercultural rural secondary schools as part of the Peruvian national education policy. These schools will work in networks integrated to local development and will carry out flexible strategies to develop life skills and inclusion in the world of work.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED4 - Learners are equipped with relevant skills to meet individual, labour market and societal demands through literacy, TVET, STEM and higher education

Project: Emergency Assistance - Peru - Impacted by Cyclone Yaku and the intense rains and floods have caused in the northern part of the country.
Description: This project will provide a response to nine educational institutions in the regions of Lambayeque, Pura and Tumbes declared in a state of National Emergency due to major disasters, as a result of heavy rainfall. Concretely, this project will allow the purchase of educational furniture, and in particularly desks manufactured in a single piece of polyethylene with advanced ergonomic design. As these desks are not disassembled, it guarantees an easy maintenance and a high durability and resistance.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particularly in Africa, developing countries, LDCs, and SIDS

Project: Technical Assistance for the Philippines Bangsamoro Education Reform and Development Plan (BERDP) - Phase II
Description:
UNESCO Bangkok has led the development of the BERDP since 2020 with support from UNESCO-IIEP on selected activities. The BERDP was successfully launched on 6 December 2022 during the MBHTE's first education summit in Davao City, Philippines. 

In May 2023, UNICEF Mindanao Field Office expressed the need for additional technical assistance from UNESCO Bangkok for the implementation of the BERDP. The primary focus of this support will be on the costing and financing aspect of the BERDP, with corresponding capacity building activities for key stakeholders.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED6 - Resilience, quality and equity of education systems strengthened to flexibly respond to evolving learning environments and to better deliver on SDG4 commitments

Project: Intangible cultural heritage and education: implementation of a pilot module on intangible cultural heritage for extra-curricular activities at selected schools in Jordan
Description: In line with the 2003 Convention on the safeguarding of Intangible Cultural Heritage and the Safeguarding intangible cultural heritage in formal and non-formal education initiative, this activity aims to test the pilot ICH module developed during the previous biennia for extra-curricular activities at selected schools part of the Associated Schools Project Network in Jordan. The module provides an overview of intangible cultural heritage including examples of ICH and interactive games to increase the learning experience. To the extent possible, the activity intends to follow a more innovative approach to education, by inviting teachers and learners to explore their living heritage and learn not only about it, but also with and through it.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT4 - Member States and communities capacities strengthened to identify, safeguard and promote living heritage

Project: Responsive Education Systems to Evolving Learning Environment in Afghanistan
Description: The RP Workplan supports ED Output 6 to have resilience and equity of education systems to respond to evolving learning environment and to better deliver on SDG-4 commitments in Afghanistan through supporting the participation of SDG national coordinator, planning, and policy focal points in the regional Education meetings and conducting gender-focused assessments and gender-responsive planning and policies addressing gender inequalities and gender-differentiated needs of the Education sector.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED6 - Resilience, quality and equity of education systems strengthened to flexibly respond to evolving learning environments and to better deliver on SDG4 commitments

Project: Strengthening National Capacities in enhancing the state of conservation of World Heritage sites
Description: Bangladesh's rich cultural heritage comprises archaeological sites dating back to the earliest phases of human settlement in Asia, including two cultural World Heritage Sites, the Monuments of the Historic Mosque City of Bagerhat and the Ruins of the Buddhist Vihara at Paharpur, both inscribed as World Heritage in 1985. Since inscription many programmes and interventions were undertaken, including an UNESCO International Safeguarding Campaign from 1985-2001. However, there is still an urgent need for technical capacity building and management training, as there is a lack of knowledge about and application of current practices for all stages of management (protection, conservation, presentation) and absence of on-site professional management and no monitoring.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: Ukraine - Emergency Assistance - Supporting the needs of the Ministry of Education and Science of Ukraine in the context of the digital transformation of the education process which has been affected by the ongoing war in Ukraine
Description: Financial contribution for supporting the needs of the Ministry of Education and Science of Ukraine in the context of the digital transformation of the education process which has been affected by the ongoing war in Ukraine.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particularly in Africa, developing countries, LDCs, and SIDS

Project: Supporting Connectivity for Education in Ukraine
Description: The war in Ukraine has caused major disruptions of educational processes, with a substantial number of teachers and learners currently unable to go to school and with no access to digital devices to engage in teaching and learning processes through distance modalities. Through UNESCO's Global Education Coalition, Google has partnered with the Ministry of Education and Sciences of Ukraine and UNESCO to support the continuity of education with the contribution of 50,000 Chromebook devices for teachers and software licensing. UNESCO will deliver Google's contributed devices to Ukraine for further distribution to teachers under the Ministry's control.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED1 - Education systems are equipped to promote inclusion, address marginalization and advance rights, including in crisis-affected and post-disaster contexts

Project: Bosnia and Herzegovina - Emergency Assistance - To support rebuilding schools in the municipalities of Stolac and Ljubinje
Description: Financial contribution of US$49,916 to support urgent construction works in schools in the municipalities of Stolac and Ljubinje which have been damaged by the recent earthquake
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particularly in Africa, developing countries, LDCs, and SIDS

Project: Preservation of Koguryo Tombs and Mural Paintings in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea (Phase IV)
Description: Following the success of Phases I to III of the FiT project to preserve Koguryo-era tombs in the Democratic People' s Republic of Korea, this fourth phase will focus on scientific research and documentation on the tombs' mural paintings and emergency on-site conservation activities, along with training to further reinforce national capacities in the field of conservation. Coordinated by the World Heritage Centre, in close co-operation with the UNESCO Beijing Office and the Permanent Delegation of the DPRK, the project involves international experts from different fields and focuses on two tombs located within the World Heritage property, the Jinpa-ri Tombs I and IV.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: FRAIS DE GESTION Projet d'appui au développement du plan sectoriel en Mauritanie (PNDSE III) 2022-2030
Description: Il s'agit des frais de gestion du PROJET Projet d'appui au développement du plan sectoriel en Mauritanie (PNDSE III) 2022-2030 sous financement du Partenariat Mondial pour l'Education (PME/GPE)
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED6 - Resilience, quality and equity of education systems strengthened to flexibly respond to evolving learning environments and to better deliver on SDG4 commitments
Donor: World Bank - Global Partnership for Education

Project: Most Easy, Efficient and Low Cost Geothermal Systems for Retrofitting
Description: The project aims at applying a pan - European and innovative shallow geothermal solutions particularly targeting historical buildings, including UNESCO designated sites. The green technology to be developed will have specific characteristics, being easier to install, more cost-effective than the current solutions in the market, with drilling methodologies/machines well suited to operate in built heritage and environment and contributing to mitigate claimte change. Finally the proposed solutions will be tested in cooperation with the managing authority of the Ferrara, "City of the Renaissance, and its Po Delta".
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.SC1 - Inclusive knowledge and capacities of Member States strengthened to advance and apply science for sustainable management of natural resources, ecosystem and biodiversity conservation and restoration, and disaster risk resilience

Project: Human Resources of the Secretariat-WH Convention (2024-2025)
Description: The sub-account to be used exclusively for enhancing the human capacities of the Secretariat of the 1972 Convention was established in 2013 by the General Assembly of States Parties to the World Heritage Convention (Resolution 19.GA 8). It is funded only by voluntary contributions; it aims at enhancing UNESCO's delivery capacity and addressing the human resource needs of the Secretariat of the Convention Concerning the Protection of the World Cultural and Natural Heritage.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: Periodic Reporting 2024-2025
Description: "Periodic Reporting" is the budget line voted by the World Heritage Committee under the World Heritage Fund for the period 2022-2023, to implement the Third Cycle of Periodic Reporting (2018-2024). As one of the main statutory processes for the 1972 World Heritage Convention, the exercise is a self-assessment tool that allows States Parties to share information on the application of the Convention at all levels. Activities funded under this budget line include the development of communication materials and their dissemination, preparation of regional reports and Action Plans through coordination and support to States Parties. They will include also the reflection period (2024-2025) on the next cycle of Periodic Reporting.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage
