Project: Social cohesion and wellbeing through sport in the Arab region
Description: The activity aims to promote Quality Physical Education (QPE) as a means to promote social cohesion and youth-well being in the Arab region. Good practices will be collected with an emphasis on the inclusion of Persons with Disabilities (PWD).
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.SHS6 - Member States better positioned to develop quality sport and physical education (PE) inclusive and participatory policies that leverage the power of sport for development and active learning, and implement anti-doping policies and frameworks promoting sport values, ethics and integrity

Project: Global Ocean Science Report
Description: Global Ocean Science Report
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health and accelerate the transition towards sustainable management of ocean-related risks and opportunities

Project: Evaluations
Description: The overall purpose of this workplan is ensure a proper evaluation coverage of the sector’s programme and projects, for accountability, learning and decision-making. The key activities are the delivery and dissemination of corporate evaluations on strategic/ global and thematic topics and an annual synthesis report of all UNESCO evaluations. It also involves support to the decentralized evaluation function by building the capacity of UNESCO staff through a dedicated training programme; financing and managing Regional Evaluation Associates in five duty stations (to start in 2025) and animating the Evaluation Focal Point Network and the UNESCO Evaluation Knowledge Hub.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health and accelerate the transition towards sustainable management of ocean-related risks and opportunities

Project: Supporting policy makers and sports practitioners drive equality and tackle gender-based violence in and through sport
Description: In the framework of Fit for Life implementation, the Sport Section will support policy makers and sports practitioners design and deliver inclusive sport policies and programmes that empower girls and women from all backgrounds, and tackle gender-based violence. The Sport Section will launch the Fit for Life Sport and Gender Equality Game Plan, a practical toolkit designed to support decisionmakers implement gender equality commitments and measure both progress in this regard, as well as the return on investments. As part of this work, the Sport Section will mobilize Member States and members of the Fit for Life Global Alliance to promote and adopt the recommendations of the UNESCO-UN Women ‘Handbook on Tackling Violence Against Women and Girls in Sport’, through advocacy campaigns, events, knowledge exchange and coalition-building. Implementation of both the Game Plan and the Handbook will be supported through pilot projects in countries and cities in a later phase, with a special focus on impact measurement and participatory policy-making.
Outcome EN: Outcome 7 - Promote inclusion and combat discrimination, hate speech and stereotypes
Output EN: 7.SHS3 - Member States capacities are strengthened to scale up their policy, institutional and legislative actions towards gender equality, to eliminate gender-based violence and discrimination, gender biases and stereotypes, including in the digital world

Project: IPBC Support
Description: This IPBC Support Project undertakes engagement, communication and coordination activities that support and contribute to the vision and goals of the International Partnership for Blue Carbon (IPBC). The IPBC connects governments, scientists and non-government agencies with the vision to protect, manage or restore blue Carbon (BC) ecosystems for climate change. The IPBC's desired outcome is for countries with significant BC to establish policies for the protection of BC and to be implementing management plans or restoration projects.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health and accelerate the transition towards sustainable management of ocean-related risks and opportunities

Project: Global study on economic, fiscal and social cost of OOSC and young peo
Description: The aim of this project is (1) to develop a global study on the economic, fiscal and social costs of out-of-school children, young people's disengagement from education, including the failure to achieve universal basic skills and higher-level skills such as social and emotional skills, where data is available and (2) to disseminate the results of the study widely and to engage countries in an evidence-based policy dialogue. Ultimately, the aim is to support evidence-based policy decisions at the country level.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED2 - Gender transformative education systems empower learners, ensure safe learning environments and address the educational barriers, particularly for girls and women, exacerbated by the learning crisis

Project: JPO (France) for Freedom of Expression and Safety of Journalists Secti
Description: Under the authority of Chief, CI/FEJ and the guidance of relevant colleagues, the JPO will contribute to the Section's activities to promote freedom of expression and the safety of journalists, with a focus on freedom of expression in the digital ecosystem. This will include a human rights-based approach to countering hate speech and mis- and disinformation; protecting the digital safety of journalists, particularly women journalists; and promoting transparency, human rights due diligence, and regulatory principles for digital platforms. The JPO will support the Section in producing and coordinating the World Trends in Freedom of Expression and Media Development series (World Trends Report).
Outcome EN: Outcome 6 - Promote freedom of expression and the right to information
Output EN: 6.CI2 - Member States have strengthened capacities and raised awareness to enhance norms and policies related to freedom of expression, press freedom, safety of journalists, including women journalists, and the right to access information, online and offline

Description: This entry focuses on the JPO post located in Headquarters, in support of the Hydrological Systems, Climate Change and Adaptation Section (SC/HYD/HCA).

Description: Under the overall authority of the Chief of the Diversity of Cultural Expressions (DCE) Entity and the direct supervision of the Head of Programmes and Stakeholder Outreach Unit of DCE, the incumbent will be responsible for the overall communications of DCE. The communications should encompass a wide range of work of DCE, and particularly the International Fund for Cultural Diversity, the Aschberg Programme and other extrabudgetary projects, in order to create coherent and effective messaging customized to target audiences (e.g., donors, partners, general public, etc.) to support awareness raising and fundraising.

Support will also be provided for the implementation of the regional action plan resulting from the Third Periodic Reporting Cycle, including through the development of expertise and tools for the effective sustainable management of World Heritage properties.

Project: WPFD and IDEI
Description: As the UN specialised agency of the promotion of Freedom of Expression, as well as the lead coordinator of the UN Plan of Action on Safety of Journalists and the Issue of Impunity, UNESCO will, through this WP, provide platforms and support to  partners, particularly Member States, media institutions and civil society organizations, to create awareness on freedom of expression and the safety of media workers through the commemoration  of the World Press Freedom Day (WPFD), and the  International Day to End Impunity for Crimes Against Journalists (IDEI).
Outcome EN: Outcome 6 - Promote freedom of expression and the right to information
Output EN: 6.CI2 - Member States have strengthened capacities and raised awareness to enhance norms and policies related to freedom of expression, press freedom, safety of journalists, including women journalists, and the right to access information, online and offline

Description: The incumbent acts as a key member of the Secretariat to the 2005 Convention on the Protection and Promotion of the Diversity of Cultural Expressions. In particular, she monitors the development and implementation of projects within the framework of the implementation of the global capacity building strategy of the 2005 Convention and the Republic of Korea Funds in Trust (ROK FIT) dedicated to supporting the development of creative industries in Asia and Africa, and beyond.

Output EN: 5.CLT5 - Member States and civil society capacities strengthened to protect and promote the diversity of cultural expressions through dynamic and inclusive cultural and creative industries

Project: Global Media Defence Fund's Crisis Response Mechanism
Description: As part of the broader programme implemented under the Global Media Defence Fund (GMDF), UNESCO shall establish and administer an Crisis Response Mechanism (CRM) to provide time-sensitive emergency support to journalists and media in distress in countries experiencing unforeseen or sudden major crises affecting media community, with the aim of ensuring the immediate safety of media workers facing danger or threat as a direct result of their profession, with a focus on women journalists; as well as supporting the work of journalists and media outlets working on the ground to continue to safely and professionally report the news and avoid an information vacuum in crisis-affected countries.
Outcome EN: Outcome 6 - Promote freedom of expression and the right to information
Output EN: 6.CI2 - Member States have strengthened capacities and raised awareness to enhance norms and policies related to freedom of expression, press freedom, safety of journalists, including women journalists, and the right to access information, online and offline
Donor: United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland

Project: JERICO-S3
Description: JERICO-S3 will provide a state-of-the-art, fit-for-purpose and visionary observational Research e-Infrastructure on European coastal and shelf seas in support to scientists and users by offering access to dedicated services and a more science integrative approach to better observe the coastal ecosystem. Major user-driven improvements will be realised in terms of observing the complexity of coastal seas and continuous observation of the biology, access to facilities, data and services, best practices and performance indicators, innovative monitoring strategies.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health and accelerate the transition towards sustainable management of ocean-related risks and opportunities

Project: Developing in-house consulting capacity for EU Member States
Description:
Reforms to recalibrate the engagement of public administrations with private consulting services and to develop in-house consulting capacities are being initiated across the Member States. The project is designed to support such reforms in the public administrations of Austria, Belgium, Cyprus, the Czech Republic, France, Greece and Latvia. 

The request by the afore-mentioned Member States is funded by, and receives technical support from, the European Commission under Regulation (EU) 2021/240 establishing the Technical Support Instrument, with the Directorate-General for Structural Reform Support acting as the contracting authority and UNESCO as the implementing agency.
Outcome EN: Outcome 7 - Promote inclusion and combat discrimination, hate speech and stereotypes
Output EN: 7.SHS2 - Member States capacities strengthened in applying social and human scientific frontier knowledge to devise effective policy solutions to advance an inclusive development agenda addressing the legacies of the pandemic crisis and face the social impact of climate change

Project: Branding and Merchandising
Description:
The Branding and Merchandising Special Account is aimed at enhancing the visibility of UNESCO’s brand, such as:
I. Marketing and promotion including branding and merchandising, income generating agreements relating to the commercial use of UNESCO’s brand and the licensing of branded products,
II. The development of products and activities aiming at the promotion of UNESCO’s image, brand awareness and brand identity, including books and other merchandising materials, advertising and promotion activities, corporate campaigns (including press relations and public relations in support of UNESCO programme), special events and communication services to support promotion and valorization activities (scenography, content review and communication tools for exhibitions, promotion activities for special events).
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.CPE1 - UNESCO's image enhanced and role recognized as a key solution provider for the 2030 Agenda in the Organization's areas of competence

Project: JPO (Italy) for Freedom of Expression and Safety of Journalism Section
Description: This element aims at reinforcing UNESCO's FEJ's Section work with an additional qualified human resource. The incumbent will fully be integrated in the FEJ's work on promoting freedom of expression as well as safety of journalists. Areas of work, specific objectives and deliverables are agreed with relevant colleagues, and team members manage tasks with a degree of autonomy compatible to their level of responsibility. Clear guidelines and background documentation are provided for each assignment. The Chief of Section takes a special responsibility in mentoring the junior professional officer in the Section.
Outcome EN: Outcome 6 - Promote freedom of expression and the right to information

Description: The JPO will contribute to initiatives and activities related to HR Partnerships (JPO's, Sponsored Traineeships, Loans & Secondments, UNVs) and contribute to their management and promotion by liaising with Partner Institutions; collecting and analyzing the proposals submitted; conducting interviews and assisting in the selection of candidates; liaising with the candidates to provide complete information, and guide them through the appropriate procedures; organize briefings and induction on UNESCO upon their appointment in the Organization. Preparation of documents and presentations for the Committee, General Assembly and their subsidiary bodies, concerning nominations and related processes. Project: Design of educational policies for TVET, STEM and higher education in Guatemala
Description: The educational authorities of the new Government in Guatemala 2024-2027 have requested the support of the UNESCO Office in Guatemala for the design of educational policies that contribute to the successful implementation of the new TVET, STEM and higher education strategies.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED4 - Learners equipped with relevant skills to meet individual, labour market and societal demands through literacy, TVET, STEM and higher education

Project: Soutien à l'élaboration d'une stratégie de sauvegarde et de valorisati
Description: le projet vise à soutenir le Secrétariat d'Etat chargé de l'artisanat et de l'économie sociale dans la préparation d'une stratégie de sauvegarde et de valorisation des savoirs et des savoir-faire liés à l'artisanat du Maroc en tant qu'élément du patrimoine culturel immatériel marocain.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT4 - Member States and communities capacities strengthened to identify, safeguard and promote living heritage

Project: Strengthening Morocco's resilience to earthquakes
Description: As UNESCO is the secretariat of the International Platform for Reducing Earthquake Disaster (IPRED), it is in a unique position to improve the safety of populations through seismic risk assessment and capacity building, by effectively sharing the wealth of knowledge and experience of seismology and seismic engineering globally available. Based on the knowledge in this domain, and following the earthquake of September 8 which affected the Marrakech region, UNESCO is implementing this project to reinforce Morocco's resilience to earthquake. The National Institute of Geophysics is the main partner of UNESCO in implementing this project with the support of other Moroccan institutions.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.SC1 - Inclusive knowledge and capacities of Member States strengthened to advance and apply science for sustainable management of natural resources, ecosystem and biodiversity conservation and restoration, and disaster risk resilience

Project: Formation-emploi et réinsertion professionnelle pour les gens de plus de 15 ans
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particularly in Africa, developing countries, LDCs, and SIDS

Project: Action for Girls and Young Women's Sexual and Reproductive Health and
Description:
Within the implementation of the UN-Joint programme "Action for Girls and Young Women in Mozambique: Strengthening Sexual and Reproductive Health and Rights" funded by the Swedish International Development Cooperation Agency (Sida), UNESCO will provide leadership on the implementation of Comprehensive sexuality education (CSE), which contributes to young people's development. 
This project will support the Ministry of Education and Human Development (MINEDH) up to 2019 to strengthen the implementation of CSE curricula, where a number of elected teachers will be trained as trainers of teachers, using a comprehensive curriculum that effectively addresses HIV and SRH.
Outcome EN: Outcome 7 - Promote inclusion and combat discrimination, hate speech and stereotypes
Output EN: 7.ED3 - Learners are empowered to lead healthy lives, promote sustainable development and engage with the world as creative and responsible global citizens

Project: Projet d'Appui à l'Elaboration de la Carte Scolaire au Ministère de l'
Description: Le projet viser à mettre en place un Système d'Information Géographique (SIG) pour les structures d'enseignement de base (préscolaire, primaire, alphabétisation et éducation non formelle), intégrant une cartographie numérique et offrant des possibilités d'accès facile aux données, indicateurs de scolarisation et aux tableaux de bord des localités et des établissements afin d'établir des mesures efficientes de carte scolaire pour l'appui efficace à la prise de décisions dans le processus de gestion et de pilotage du système éducatif.
Outcome EN: Outcome 2 - Strengthen international coordination for the achievement of SDG 4 and develop the global education agenda based on research, foresight and innovation
Output EN: 2.ED7 - Education policy and finance decisions to achieve SDG 4 are informed by improved coordination, data and monitoring, knowledge and innovative partnerships

Project: PROJET GPE DE RIPOSTE D'URGENCE CONTRE LA COVID-19 DANS L'ENSEIGNEMENT
Description: Le projet s'inscrit dans le cadre de la mise en œuvre des activités du don du GPE octroyé au Cameroun d'un montant de 11 millions de $US pour l'appui à la mise en œuvre du Plan National de riposte contre l'impact de la COVID-19 dans le secteur de l'éducation et de la formation. Il vise à assurer la continuité de l'enseignement de base pour les élèves du public affectés par la crise de la COVID-19, préparer la réouverture des établissements scolaires et l'organisation des cours dans un environnement sanitaire sûr et protecteur et renforcer la résilience du système éducatif face aux crises
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED1 - Education systems equipped to promote inclusion, address marginalization and advance rights, including in crisis-affected and post-disaster contexts
Donor: World Bank - Global Partnership for Education

Project: Les jeunes tisserands de la paix dans les régions transfrontalières du
Description: Face à l'insécurité et à la criminalité grandissantes aux frontières du Gabon, du Cameroun et du Tchad dans un contexte de présence insuffisante des services publics, du manque d'opportunités économiques et de participation citoyenne, ce projet vise à la création d'un réseau de 1 800 jeunes Tisserands de la paix, pour les rendre acteurs dans la prévention des conflits et la consolidation de la paix dans les régions transfrontalières des trois pays.
Outcome EN: Outcome 7 - Promote inclusion and combat discrimination, hate speech and stereotypes
Output EN: 7.SHS4 - Member States capacities strengthened to devise and prioritize effective youth policies and interventions and to scale up youth-led solutions at global, regional, national and local levels

Project: Promoting TVET, Literacy, Higher Education & STEM in Egypt
Description: With a view to supporting Egypt in meeting SDG4 targets 4.3 (equal access to technical/vocational and higher education), 4.4 (relevant skills for decent work), and 4.6 (youth and adult literacy), UNESCO Cairo will implement a range of activities focused on promoting skills development for work and life.

Project: Promoting Technology and AI in Education in Egypt
Description: This work plan will support digital learning and digital transformation in education. Particular emphasis will be placed on promoting digital inclusion and innovation, open educational resources (OERs), the UNESCO ICT Competency Framework for Teachers, digital skills and platforms, and artificial intelligence (AI) in teaching and learning.
Outcome EN: Outcome 8 - Foster knowledge sharing and skills development in the digital age
Output EN: 8.ED8 - Technologies and digital innovations leveraged to ensure more inclusive, effective and relevant learning

Project: Strengthening Teacher Education Programmes in Cambodia (STEPCam)
Description:
The objective of the GPE3 is to improve the quality of primary education, especially for children from disadvantaged groups, and to foster effective leadership and management of education staff. The programme is comprised of the fixed with USD 14.40 million (2018-2020) and variable parts with USD 6.20 million (2019-2021), which will be implemented by UNESCO and UNICEF respectively.
The fixed part is called STEPCam, which stands for Strengthening Teacher Education Programmes in Cambodia. The STEPCam will be implemented to support the government's efforts in enhancing competencies of in-service teachers, specifically those in early grades, as part of improving learning outcomes.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED5 - Teachers trained and supported to improve learning outcomes and address the changes brought forth by the digital and AI transformation and the COVID-19 crisis
Donor: World Bank - Global Partnership for Education

Project: Strengthening heritage to promote culture as a global public good
Description:
In 2024 Brazil will be responsible for the presidency of G20 and 3 of the 4 axes priorities in culture (Cultural diversity and social inclusion; Creative economy and sustainable economic development; and Preservation, safeguarding and promotion of cultural heritage and memory) are in alignment with outputs 5.CLT1 and 5.CLT5 of 42 C/5. So UBO proposal is to take the opportunity to work in alignment with these international priorities in Brazil as a strategy to promote culture as a global public good.
In Output 5.CLT1, UBO will: Strengthen the debate about the G20 proposals on the protection of heritage with governmental actors, NGOs and CSOs; Cooperate with governmental and private actors in the organization of events to discuss heritage, climate change and memory, involving historical heritage, tourism and World Heritage sites; and Produce content to disseminate information about cultural programmatic references.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: RENOVA-UNESCO partnership for the local development of the Mariana region
Description: This UNESCO crosscutting (SHS, SC and CLT) 3-year project is focused on fostering local sustainable development, promoting human rights and preserving the historical and intangible heritage affected by the dam collapse (2015) in the region of the city of Mariana (based in the vicinities of Ouro Preto, coincidentally a World Heritage Site since 1980). The project shall also involve the SC expertise, particularly the experience of UNESCO's International Hidrological Programme (IHP) and the MaB programme, in actions of participatory water monitoring and preservation of local biodiversity.
Outcome EN: Outcome 7 - Promote inclusion and combat discrimination, hate speech and stereotypes
Output EN: 7.SHS2 - Member States capacities strengthened in applying social and human scientific frontier knowledge to devise effective policy solutions to advance an inclusive development agenda addressing the legacies of the pandemic crisis and face the social impact of climate change

Project: National Development Education Fund Articulated Action Plan
Description: This Project aims to improve the institutional capacity of the Management, Articulation and Educational Projects Department (DIGAP), at the National Education Development Funs (FNDE) through the review of processes, provision of subsidies for the review of standards, and definition of strategies for improving effectiveness in the application of education resources, with regard to infrastructure of schools and educational spaces, education staff training, and acquisition of teaching material. The proposed results should contribute to the achievement of greater effectiveness of the public resource and the provision of more efficient school structures.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED6 - Resilience, quality and equity of education systems strengthened to flexibly respond to evolving learning environments and to better deliver on SDG4 commitments

Project: Support for Strengthening education in Brazil: For an equitable and qu
Description: The project aims to provide subsidies to the Ministry of Education for the implementation of integrated policies and programs, monitoring and evaluation of actions aimed at the development and strengthening of Brazilian education through actions aimed at teachers, managers and students, seeking to expand integration of programs and policies, in order to promote equality and quality at all levels of education. Additionally, the present project aims to support for the implementation of the National Policy for the Recovery of Learning in Basic Education with technical support in obtaining data and developing methodologies for institutional strengthening of the education sector in Brazil.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED6 - Resilience, quality and equity of education systems strengthened to flexibly respond to evolving learning environments and to better deliver on SDG4 commitments

Project: Strengthen capacity of member state for protection and management of tangible heritage in Jordan
Description: This activity aims to contribute to the protection of Tangible Heritage in Jordan, with a focus on the 6 sites inscribed on the WH list. A platform will be provided to initiate a dialogue among the Ministry of Tourism and Antiquities, the Department of Antiquities, the site managers as well as management entities and local authorities of the 6 World Heritage Sites inscribed in Jordan (Petra, Quseir Amra, Um er-Rasas, Wadi Rum, Baptism Site, and As-Salt) to 1) exchange  conservation and development experiences, including challenges and good practices;  2) discuss relevant subjects (marketing, visitor management, revenue generation, infrastructure, maintenance, etc.) related to the overall management of World Heritage sites; 3) contribute to the management of World Heritage Sites in Jordan through improved understanding, skills, and practical knowledge; and 4) make recommendations for common strategies and approaches for the sustainable management and development of the World Heritage sites in Jordan.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: Palestine Riwaya Museum in Bethlehem (finalisation of Phase III: Comp
Description:
The overall objective of the project is to establish a model Palestinian interactive and multimedia museum in Bethlehem, called Riwaya (narrative) Museum. It will be a venue for safeguarding and promoting Palestinian cultural diversity and fostering intercultural dialogue as it will serve as a tourist destination. This particular phase aims at completing the renovation of the museum space started in Phase III of the project.

Note: For detailed information about the scope and concerning the current project, please refer to the "Application for grants from the 
Norwegian Ministry of Foreign Affairs (MFA)" in the attachments section.

Project: Promoting Freedom of Expression and Safety of Journalists
Description:
Bangladesh’s media landscape has undergone rapid changes, also facing numerous challenges. Promoting the safety of journalists and the fight against impunity according to the UN Plan of Action (UNPA) with the aims to prevent, protect and support the prosecution of journalists from threats, harassment and violent attacks, and end impunity for the crimes is essential. The longer-term goal of this work plan is to build a wide coalition supporting Press Freedom, starting with NGOs and Embassies and Govt. at some stage.

While media has played pivotal roles in the development of Bangladesh, there exists political complex. To establish a connection between press freedom, freedom of expression, and other rights, the UNESCO office in Dhaka intends to link it with other rights and actively promote the safety of journalists. Also giving focus on the safety of women journalists. This will create an atmosphere that supports freedom of expression amidst evolving digital challenges.
Outcome EN: Outcome 6 - Promote freedom of expression and the right to information
Output EN: 6.CI2 - Member States have strengthened capacities and raised awareness to enhance norms and policies related to freedom of expression, press freedom, safety of journalists, including women journalists, and the right to access information, online and offline

Project: Strengthening of the Comprehensive System for the Improvement of the Quality of Education (SIMECE), in 3rd, 6th and 9th grade students, to ensure the quality of education in the Panamanian System
Description: The cooperation project of the Latin American Laboratory for the Evaluation of the Quality of Education (LLECE) of OREALC UNESCO with the Ministry of Education of Panama (MEDUCA) aims to contribute to the strengthening and renewal of the Integral System for the Improvement of the Quality of Education (SIMECE) of Panama. The project will seek to consolidate a culture of evaluation at all levels of the education system. It will develop tools that provide feedback to the various stakeholders (policy makers, principals, teachers, among others) and technical capability building for evaluation professionals and teachers to understand and use the information provided by the evaluations.

Project: eDNAqua-Plan
Description: The eDNAqua-Plan project will develop a plan for establishing a digital ecosystem of eDNA repositories and an integrated reference library for marine and freshwater species that is open-access and based on the international data principles of Findable, Accessible, Interoperable and Reusable (FAIR) data to support future aquatic biodiversity monitoring programmes and mapping initiatives.

Project: Ocean Decade Coordination Office for Ocean Data Sharing
Description: The Decade Coordination Office (DCO) for Ocean Data Sharing was established in July 2023 to coordinate the implementation of the Ocean Decade Data and Information Strategy published in April 2023. In collaboration with data contributors, this office will contribute to sustainable change by bringing together existing infrastructures, coordinating the development of technical and human capacities, as well as identifying data gaps to be filled. The goal of this project is to provide support to the DCO to implement this strategy through financial assistance. The proposed project would be implemented over 24 months by the Decade Coordination Unit of the IOC in close collaboration with IODE.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction

Project: Earthquake Disaster Risk Reduction through awareness raising and educa
Description: Ghana's seismological history informs that the country has had earthquakes of which the last three major ones occurred in 1862, 1906 and 1939. The recent four minor earthquakes were felt in Ghana within a relatively short space of time on March 24, 2018, December 9, 2018, January 13, 2019 and March 2, 2019 and had estimated magnitudes of 3.3, 3.3, 2.6 and 3.9 on the Richter scale respectively. After undertaking consultations with some Agencies and Ministries, UNESCO and the WFP will produce educational materials on earthquake disaster risk reduction. Also, a 5-minute animation story with content based on the documented information on the 1939 earthquake will be developed.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.SC1 - Inclusive knowledge and capacities of Member States strengthened to advance and apply science for sustainable management of natural resources, ecosystem and biodiversity conservation and restoration, and disaster risk resilience

Project: Fostering preservation of and access to documentary heritage in Asia & Pacific
Description:
In its capacity as regional facilitator of the 2015 UNESCO Recommendation Concerning the Preservation of, and Access to, Documentary Heritage Including in Digital Form, UNESCO Bangkok CI unit will administer a capacity building programme to support digitization, sustainable conservation and public access to documentary collections in the Asia-Pacific region.

The RP programme will serve to increase the awareness and capacity of documentary heritage custodians to engage in the Memory of the World (MoW) Programme by supporting experience sharing and networking activities in the Asia-Pacific region and beyond.

To that end, the programme will engage with custodians of documentary heritage in Asia and the Pacific across multiple activities including information exchange, sharing of good practices across regions, training and networking.

Project: DEVELOPMENT OF A NATIONAL OPEN SCIENCE POLICY
Description:
Science, Technology, and Innovation (STI) are fundamental drivers of socio-economic advancement. As part of efforts to strengthen STI for national development, Government through the Ministry of Environment, Science, Technology and Innovation (MESTI), has recently reviewed its National STI Policy (2024-2030) in line with international trends and national priorities. Key to the policy is the adoption and promotion of Open Science Initiatives as an integral instrument for facilitating this transformative journey. 

To this end, the MESTI intends to initiate steps to develop an Open Science Policy in accordance with the 2021 UNESCO Recommendations on Open Science and Ghana’s STI4SDG Road Map.  MESTI seeks to achieve promotion of   a   common   understanding   of   Open   Science, developing an enabling policy environment for Open Science, investing in Open Science infrastructures and services, investing in human resources, education, digital literacy and capacity building for Open Science, fostering a culture of Open Science and aligning incentives for Open Science and promoting innovative approaches for Open Science at different stages of the scientific process.

Project: Empowerment of Ugandan Youth Networks and Organizations for Youth-Led Gender-responsive Climate Actions, Research and Development
Description:
The Youth Committee of the Uganda National Commission for UNESCO (UNATCOM) established in 2010, has been concerned about the low level of awareness of the youth of Uganda about UNESCO and its programmes designed to empower the youth. Disappointingly, the level of knowledge is not only very low, but even of all the various youth organizations that exist countrywide, only two are associated with UNESCO. These two are UNESCO clubs, one in Gulu University, an upcountry city location and the second at Nakawa Vocational Training College, in Kampala Metropolitan City. This number is too low compared to the situation in the other East African countries such as Rwanda which has 35 UNESCO Clubs and Kenya with 168 UNESCO Clubs and Associations. This is despite the fact that there are many concerns affecting Ugandan youth to address relating to 38.5% of young people aged 10-19 that live in the poorest wealth quintiles, 80% of Uganda’s youth that living  in rural areas and one out of four young people aged 10-24 years residing in urban areas have no means for self-empowerment, 19.6% of young people aged 10-19 years living  in households where the head of household has no education, 22% of adolescents aged 13-18 years dropping out of school while 8.8 million young people aged 15-24 years not engaged in education, employment or under any training1.
Though a National Youth Council Act, 1993 exists, it specifically provides for a National Youth Council which is largely political with no stated focus on the social challenges faced by the youth. There is Uganda Youth Network (UYONET) that purports to be a leading national youth organization working to mainstream young peoples’ engagement in development and governance processes in Uganda and East Africa. This network started in 2002 to respond to the increasing demand for a collective platform for research, training and policy advocacy for young people by young people. However, it does not address the concerns of interest to UNESCO. Statistics indicate  that the youth in Uganda have continued to face multitudes of problems namely: Teenage pregnancy (25% of teenage girls in Uganda age 15-19 have had a child or are pregnant), Health risk behaviors (22% of adolescents have ever had sexual intercourse and  10% of  sexually active adolescents aged 15-19 years had their first sexual encounter before age 15), Child Marriage (10% of women aged 20-24 years married by age 15),  Gender-Based Violence ( 60% of adolescents 10-19 years have experienced physical violence, 42% emotional violence and 10% sexual violence), HIV/AIDS (Every year 9,600 young people aged 15- 19 years are newly infected with HIV)2.  A Cross Sectional Survey Study conducted by scholars show that alcohol, substance use and psychosocial competence of adolescents in selected Secondary Schools in Uganda was at 70% 3. 

1.https://uganda.unfpa.org/sites/default/files/pub-pdf/YoungPeople_FactSheet%20%2811%29_0.pdf).
2.https://uganda.unfpa.org/sites/default/files/pub-pdf/YoungPeople_FactSheet%20%2811%29_0.pdf

3. Abbo, C, Okello, E.S., Muhwezi, W.,   Grace Akello,  G. and  Ovuga, E, (2016): Alcohol, Substance Use and Psychosocial Competence of Adolescents in Selected Secondary Schools in Uganda: A Cross Sectional Survey, Int Neuropsychiatr Dis J. 2016; 7(2): 25387. doi: 10.9734/INDJ/2016/25387

Project: Patrimoine Vivant : Découvrir et Préserver la Culture du Burkina Faso
Description: Pour soutenir les efforts de l’État burkinabè dans la préservation et la protection du patrimoine vivant burkinabè, la Fédération burkinabè des Associations et Clubs pour l’UNESCO a lancé un projet intitulé : “Patrimoine Vivant : Découvrir et Préserver la Culture du Burkina Faso”. Ce projet vise à sensibiliser 1 000 jeunes aux richesses culturelles du Burkina Faso et à les encourager à préserver et à célébrer ce patrimoine. Ce projet s’inscrit également dans le cadre du Plan National de Développement Économique et Social (PNDES) du Burkina Faso et du programme d’urgence de la transition. Le PNDES, qui vise à rétablir la paix et la sécurité, renforcer la résilience de la nation et transformer structurellement l’économie burkinabè pour une croissance forte, durable et inclusive, reconnaît l’importance de la culture comme moteur de développement

Project: Education environnementale, stratégies de conservation de Bombax costatum et résilience communautaire dans un contexte de crise sécuritaire au nord du Burkina Faso
Description:
Le projet met l’accent l’éducation environnementale à travers la régénération d’une plante alimentaire dans un contexte d’insécurité. De par son statut de pourvoyeuse de Produits Forestier Non Ligneux (PFNL), Bombax costatum est surexploitée et éprouvent des difficultés de régénération au moyen de graines. La cueillette des fleurs de l’espèce, souvent menée par écimage presque complet, prive les arbres d’une grande quantité de semences nécessaires à leur régénération.
Au regard des difficultés qu’éprouve l’espèce pour sa régénération au moyen de graines et la pression anthropique sur ses individus, il s’avère nécessaire d’explorer d’autres techniques, notamment celles de la multiplication végétative à faible coût afin de contribuer au maintien et à la domestication de cette espèce alimentaire et économique que les populations rurales (autochtones et personnes déplacées internes) apprécient.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action

Project: Radio Program on Early Childhood Development and Education in Liberia
Description:
Despite the recognized importance of early childhood development and education, there is a lack of widespread awareness and accessible information on best practices and resources for parents, caregivers, and communities in Liberia. Many families, especially in remote or rural areas, may not have access to formal early childhood education programs or may not be fully informed about the critical role they play in fostering their child’s cognitive, social, and emotional development. This gap in knowledge and resources poses a risk to the overall well-being and future success of Liberian children. Therefore, there is an urgent need for a targeted radio program that focuses on raising awareness, providing practical information, and promoting effective strategies for early childhood development and education, ensuring that all children in Liberia have the opportunity to thrive and reach their full potential.

The World Bank (2008), conducted research and provided reports on various aspects of education and development worldwide, offering insights into the importance of investing in early childhood education programs to widen the scope of understanding, especially in the rural areas of the country.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action

Project: Intégration du patrimoine vivant dans le programme scolaire et réactualisation du plan de sauvegarde du savoir-faire du travail du bois Zafimaniry
Description:
Dans la politique générale de l’Etat Malagasy, œuvrer pour l’intérêt de la population malagasy est considéré comme un objectif prioritaire pour rattraper le retard de développement qui sévit dans le pays. Eduquer la population et faire de la culture un levier de développement économique et touristique constituent ainsi un défi pour le gouvernement.  La sensibilisation et la responsabilisation des communautés notamment des jeunes générations sont ainsi mises en avant dans la Politique culturelle nationale.  
C’est pourquoi ce projet est mis en place pour intégrer l’enseignement et l’apprentissage du patrimoine vivant dans le programme scolaire ainsi que pour réactualiser le plan de sauvegarde du savoir-faire du travail du bois Zafimaniry en tant que Patrimoine immatériel de l’humanité.

Project: Support to the development of AI ethical standards in Malawi.
Description: Malawi has embarked on promulgation of the Recommendation on ethics of Artificial Intelligence (AI) by meeting some of the stipulated obligations. To build its capacity for the recommendation implementation, the country conducted a national conference and is currently conducting a study on the country’s readiness in adopting AI ethics, also known as the Readiness Assessment Methodology (RAM).  To continue supporting development of policies for inclusive digital transformation and ethical AI standards for action to meet the challenges of innovative technologies and digital transformation for Malawi, this project will support development of AI Ethics strategy.

Project: GPE LEG Assessment for Zanzibar
Description:
The System Capacity Grant (SCG) Is a funding mechanism provided by GPE to support developing countries in strengthening their education systems. It is designed to help countries improve their education systems by building capacity in planning, management, monitoring, and evaluation areas, ultimately leading to better learning outcomes for children and young people. The current SCG will support Tanzania's Local Education Group (LEG) self-assessment. 
While UNICEF will serve as the Grant Agent for the SCG, the LEG self-assessment will fall under UNESCO as the GPE Coordinating Agent. This partnership between UNICEF and UNESCO is crucial in ensuring that education initiatives are coordinated effectively, and that the government can improve education outcomes for all children in Tanzania. By working together, UNICEF and UNESCO can leverage their respective strengths to support a more comprehensive and sustainable approach to education development in the country.
The purpose of the activity is to undertake the Global Partnership for Education (GPE) Local Education Group (LEG)/ Zanzibar Education Sector Committee (ZESC) self-assessment that aims to enable the LEG to reflect on their performance, identify areas for improvement, and develop a plan for strengthening their work. This process will help to ensure that the LEG can operate more effectively and efficiently and that its efforts are aligned with the priorities and goals of the Global Partnership for Education (GPE) and the Revolutionary Government of Zanzibar. It also aims to support the development of a strong and sustainable education system in Zanzibar by empowering local education stakeholders to identify and address challenges in their communities.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED6 - Resilience, quality and equity of education systems strengthened to flexibly respond to evolving learning environments and to better deliver on SDG4 commitments
Donor: World Bank - Global Partnership for Education

Project: "Empowering EMULI: Enhancing Mother Tongue-Based Multilingual Education in Timor-Leste through Knowledge Exchange and Collaboration"
Description: The Mother Tongue-Based Multilingual Education program (EMULI) in Timor-Leste aims to aid students in remote areas who do not speak the official languages by facilitating early learning in their mother tongue. Currently operating in 10 schools, the program has received 57 proposals from nearby schools for extension. Plans are underway to extend the program to more schools in 2024 and 2025, with a vision to expand further to different municipalities and language groups by 2026. To enhance implementation practices, the EMULI team proposes a study exchange to Cambodia in 2025, involving 10 individuals including EMULI team members, relevant Ministry of Education directors, and teachers. This exchange aims to learn best practices from a similar program and share insights through a follow-up seminar upon return.

Project: National Environmental Education Strategy
Description: This project is aimed at structuring the adoption of collaborative and sustainable values and behaviors throughout Brazilian society. For this purpose, it is necessary to institutionalize and integrate Environmental Education (EA) into various government plans and programs, starting with those managed by the MMA (Ministry of Environment). Additionally, strengthening territorial spaces with promotion policies that enhance the integration and cooperation of educational instances is essential. The reinforcement of this policy will be achieved through activities that seek to engage with the axes of the National Environmental Education Program (ProNEA).

Description: This project aims to promote the improvement of tools, measures and indicators for educational assessments, in its various teaching levels and modalities: from childhood education to higher education and professional education. It is proposed that the National Institute of Educational Studies and Research Anísio Teixeira (Inep), the institution responsible for carrying out the assessments, can act in identifying improvement needs; in conducting studies that identify the best evaluation experiences; in the improvement of evaluation instruments and measures; and promoting innovation in public policies in education.

Project: Promoting Inclusive Sports and Physical Activities Towards Enhancing Children's Holistic Development and Education
Description:
The project aims to enhance the knowledge and skills of school sports instructors (SSIs) in advocating for and implementing sports and physical activities (SPA) using contemporary and inclusive approaches. The first National Fitness Test (FT) conducted in 2023 revealed concerning findings, indicating a significant number of students needing to improve their health and fitness levels. Additionally, the Ministry of Health has highlighted a rise in mental health issues among school youth and the prevalence of non-communicable diseases (NCDs).
While the Scouts and Sports Division continues to promote sports and physical activities, it has been observed that not all children have access to sports due to a lack of resources and sports infrastructure. Therefore, there is a pressing need to focus on non-traditional sports (free play), which are easy to organise, inexpensive, and beneficial to child development and education. The project will prioritize primary schools, as it is crucial to ensure early foundational development and progression in children's physical and mental well-being.

Project: Empowering men and boys for gender equality in India
Description: This workstream builds on UNESCO's programming to engage men and boys in gender equality in India (2019-2021). Responding to the needs, priorities, and demand identified in this first phase of implementation, UNESCO's Social and Human Sciences sector (SHS) will build a follow-on/up programme, 'Transforming MEN-talities II' to strengthen a) knowledge on the behavioural, institutional, and structural factors which enable interventions to engage men and boys for gender equality to be successful; 2) the scale and reach of operational activities to engage men and boys for gender equality within educational and community settings; and 3) the networks available to encourage peer-learning, good practice sharing, and coordination around engaging men and boys for gender equality in India.

Project: Saving Alkap, an intangible cultural heritage of Bangladesh
Description: Traditional culture is the main assets of a nation. Alkap is a type of traditional popular folk song originating in greater Rajshahi district, in the Northern region of Bangladesh. It is performed with a particularly distinctive rhythm, role play and dance with 10-12 male performers discussing a topic to raise social awareness, motivation of the community people for social development. Now a day, Alkap reflects contemporary social problems through dialogue, songs, theatre, dances and jokes. Through their performance they deliver strong message on social and domestic violence, crime situation, early marriage, dowry, WASH issue, Family planning and other social problems. Most of the time they perform Alkap in busy public places like; village market, village fair, bus & train station and cultural celebration in this district.

Project: Disseminating Greening Education Programmes at Selected ASPnet Schools in Bangladesh
Description: Greening education is an approach to tackling the climate crisis by harnessing the role of education. Most of the youth in developing countries are not aware of the impact of the indiscriminate use of resources on lives and nature. This project aims at creating awareness among students in secondary schools about the role of greening education in sustainable development. It is expected that, on the basis of the project outcome, it would be strongly recommended to the competent authority of the government to integrate greening education programmes into co-curricular activities at all secondary schools in Bangladesh.

Description: The seminar aims to explore and share good practices of women's contributions for nature education among members of the Chinese Biosphere Reserves Network. The selection theme and criteria of good practices are not only relevant to the education objective of the Biosphere Reserves, but also promoting the local knowledge and enhancing local engagement, particularly for rural communities. Project: Niue High School Participation at the 51st New Zealand Secondary Schools Track and Field Championship 2024
Description: Niue High School plans to send a small contingent of its top athletes to participate at the 51st New Zealand Secondary Schools' Track, Field and 48th Road Race Championships 2024, to be held in Timaru New Zealand, on the 6th – 8th December 2024.  We have participated at past games with much success, where our students are able to compete against their peers in Athletics disciplines.  Popular for us are the throwing field events like the discus and the javelin.  There are plenty of natural throwers at our school and exposing them to competition at a high level will elevate them to a time when they will become great ambassadors for Niue, through sports.  We have always nurtured high achievers academically with recognition and scholarships.  This is one way of nurturing, recognising, and promoting athletic talent and ability of our sports-oriented students.

Project: World Teachers Day Observation
Description:
Niue High School celebrates World Teachers Day, a UN commemoration day to celebrate teachers and the important roles they play in society.  This is observed on October 5th every year and the school organise programs and events for the day.  Events can include professional development opportunities, awareness programs and community outreach programs to promote what teachers do, fun activities and games, and more serious acknowledgements of the importance of teachers to society.  This year is extra special in that Niue will be celebrating 50 years of self-governing in free association with NZ.  The Teacher Day celebrations will coincide with this national milestone.
The focus this year is on "Empowering Educators: Strengthening Resilience, Building Sustainability." In these challenging times, teachers have emerged as beacons of resilience, adapting and innovating for their students. 
The project seeks funds to finance Niue High School’s observance of World Teachers Day 2024.

Project: Niue High School Girls Craft Shelter
Description: This project seeks funds to construct a shelter and space where our girls can use to learn Niue Craft and weaving.  There is a lack of learning space for our girls to properly engage in Craft classes.  These classes at Niue High School promote national identity and pride, and seek to maintain the practices of weaving and craft making, passed on from our ancestors.  These are unique to Niue and intricate patterns that are traditional to Niue can be taught to the young women, who will then possess this knowledge and skills to pass on to their children.  This project focuses on female students and promotes craft as a focus in the school curriculum.

Project: Raising awareness of children and youth about the activities of biosphere reserves in the context of the Berezinsky Biosphere Reserve
Description:
The project is an educational one, aimed at developing in children and youth a value-based attitude towards nature, increasing their level of environmental education, awareness on issues of environmental protection and rational use of natural resources, nurturing a responsible attitude of the younger generation towards nature, and developing environmentally literate behavior.
The project will be implemented by organizing and conducting a training workshop for children and youth and preparing an illustrated popular and science bilingual publication for a wide range of readers, including children, which will contain background and scientific information, photographs of natural landscapes, ecosystems, as well as species of animals, plants and mushrooms.
The project is timed to coincide with the 100th anniversary of the founding of the Berezinsky Biosphere Reserve and the 45th anniversary of its assignment to the status of a biosphere reserve, and therefore will also raise awareness among the younger generation about the Man and the Biosphere Programme of UNESCO (MAB), the activities of biosphere reserves and, in general, about the activities of UNESCO in the fields of science and education.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action

Project: Fostering peaceful and resilient communities through museums and libraries
Description:
The project aims mobilize the potential of museums and libraries to foster peaceful and resilient communities.
It continues maintaining the museum and library network, established in 2020 to enable museum and library professionals as local actors for sustainable development. It is a growing network that currently includes museum and library professionals from Estonia, Georgia, Latvia, Lithuania, Moldova and Ukraine. The network provides possibilities for capacity building and mutual exchange in relation to localization of Sustainable Development Goals through memory institutions.

Project: International Conference “Astronomical Heritage of the Middle East 2”
Description: International Conference “Astronomical Heritage of the Middle East” is devoted to the role of astronomy in culture and other fields of human activity and development of these fields due to the knowledge obtained from the Universe. In modern era, astronomy plays a leading role in the formation and development of inter- and multi- disciplinary sciences. For a long time, Astrophysics has reached high level of development, recently new science disciplines have been created, such as Astrochemistry, Astrobiology, Planetology, Astroinformatics, etc. Archaeoastronomy and Cultural Astronomy play an important role in culture and in the heritage of nations, chronologies and calendars. The development of scientific tourism and scientific journalism is tightly related as well. The meeting is aimed at the development of problems of astronomy-related interdisciplinary sciences and preparation of a basis for further possible collaborations by means of presentations of available modern knowledge in various areas of culture by experts from different professions and by joint discussions.

Project: ACT (Arts, Creative and Technology) FOR EDUCATION FOR SUSTAINABLE DEVELOPMENT AND SOCIAL ENTERPEISE DEVELOPMENT IN SCHOOLS AND COMMUNITIES OF PRACTISE.
Description: In response to the global learning crisis exacerbated by the COVID-19 pandemic, UNESCO initiated the Transforming Education Summit and three world education conferences in 2022. The ACT initiative, focusing on climate action led by youth, faced challenges in sustainability and identified the need for capacity building among teachers and principals. The project aims to reinforce UNESCO's support for national education systems by developing innovative policies around ICTs in education and promoting education for the green transition. The plan includes establishing research and entrepreneurship hubs in schools, utilizing fruit trees for agroforestry and entrepreneurship, and expanding activities into botanical gardens, beekeeping, fruit processing, and ICT for green revolution. The goal is to create sustainable school hubs for creativity, innovation, and social entrepreneurship, generating income and offering new job opportunities for youth.

Project: SMEF- Idea Management and Innovation System
Description: This project aims to address the challenge of limited innovation in Lesotho, especially within government departments. It proposes an Idea Management and Innovation System to foster collaboration, break down silos, and tap into the untapped potential of the workforce, particularly the youth. The initiative targets youth, with a focus on girls, in all ten districts of Lesotho, aiming to encourage their innovative ideas and contribute to national development. The project aligns with UNESCO's goals of sustainable development, gender equality, and fostering creativity. Overall, it seeks to create a culture of innovation and problem-solving for the benefit of the entire community.

Project: African Union Sports Council Region 5 – Regional Conference on Developing a Comprehensive Vision of Inclusive Access for All, Physical Education and Physical Activity
Description: PEISA, in collaboration with AUSC Region 5, proposes hosting a Regional Physical Education and Sport Conference in Lesotho. Aligned with UNESCO's priorities, the conference aims to address MINEPS policy areas, particularly focusing on inclusive access to sports and physical education. The Fit-for-Life objective, emphasizing values education through sport, is central. The project targets government officials, educational institutions, and stakeholders from Region 5 countries. It aligns with UNESCO's objectives for Africa, youth and gender equality, LDC participation, and the priorities outlined for 2024-2025. The conference, hosted by NUL, will involve around 80 participants and deliver key documents, focusing on topics relevant to UNESCO's goals.

Project: Arterial Network-Conférence sur l’Economie Créative
Description: La Conférence sur l’Economie Créative en Afrique est le plus grand espace de Networking du continent, et donne l’opportunité de contribuer de manière globale au développement des industries culturelles et créatives. C’est une plateforme qui offre une opportunité unique d’explorer l’état du secteur créatif et culturel dans un contexte géopolitique et économique plus global, fournissant une occasion inégalée d’interagir avec les acteurs clés du secteur créatif afin d’en identifier les défis critiques et de trouver des solutions novatrices pour croitre et renforcer le secteur créatif en Afrique. Initiée depuis plus d’une dizaine d’années, cette plateforme est propice au dialogue, à l’échange d’informations, à la mise en réseau et au renforcement des partenariats entre les disciplines artistiques, les secteurs, les frontières nationales et même les continents.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action

Project: ABU-Capacity Building for Advancing Gender Equality, Diversity and Inclusion in Media Organisational Policy
Description: The project aims to enhance regional capacity in promoting gender equality, diversity, and inclusion (GEDI) within media organisations. It focuses on developing and implementing comprehensive strategies to advance GEDI policies and practices, fostering inclusive workplaces. Key components include reviewing organisational policies, conducting needs assessments, helping to develop “Media organisations’ gender, diversity and inclusion action plans”, delivering workshops, engaging stakeholders, monitoring progress, and documenting outcomes. Ultimately, the project seeks to empower media organizations and educational authorities to create more equitable and inclusive spaces for their employees and stakeholders.

Project: IBO-Navigating Contemporary Challenges and Opportunities in Curriculum Design: A regional conversation
Description: To foster regional connections, share knowledge and deepen understanding in the domain of curriculum design, as an education system tool, to affect improvements in learner outcomes via the convening of specialists, academics, ministry teams and international organizations over a two day seminar. The event will build on previous explorations of the domain in the region focusing on contemporary issues of curriculum design e.g. the role of curriculum in supporting equality and equity, the development of competencies, the role of schools and teachers as policy actors implementing, negotiating and interacting with the curriculum, teaching and learning for life, and teaching at the right level.

Project: Projet Aladin- Sport contre la haine
Description:
Depuis plusieurs années, on observe une montée préoccupante de la haine dans la jeunesse, malheureusement trop souvent liée à des facteurs d'exclusion, ou à des soubresauts identitaires et religieux qui contribuent à noircir les relations entre les communautés. Ce projet est né du constat que le sport est un formidable vecteur d'intégration et de promotion du vivre ensemble. Le football est de loin le sport le plus populaire en Europe, avec plus de deux millions de joueurs en France et en Angleterre et sept millions en Allemagne. 
Le Projet Aladin et l'Institut des Accords d'Abraham d'Allemagne ont pris la décision de s'associer pour bâtir une coalition de clubs de footballs, en partenariat avec la FIFA, afin de sensibiliser des jeunes issus de quartiers défavorisés, aux ravages du racisme, de l'exclusion, de l'antisémitisme et plus globalement de la haine.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particul

Project: FWUCA-International Youth Festival “The Planet of ART – 2024
Description: The International Youth Festival “The Planet of ART” is a unique platform, which has been implemented since 1999 and united over 75 000 talented children and youth from over 45 states. The finalists of the project are invited to Kazakhstan for the educational and cultural program, where they have an opportunity to visit a series of trainings and workshops, to learn about different cultures and to gain valuable experience. A particularly significant moment will be the implementation of an exhibition at UNESCO headquarters in Paris in November 2024. This event will open up new horizons for the participants allowing them to present their works to the international community and become part of a global dialogue in the field of art.

Project: World Ort-Phasing Forward: STEM Learning & Leadership in Coastal Ghana
Description:
Advancing four UNESCO priorities—education in Africa, gender equality, developing countries, and youth—World ORT aims to continue the iterative growth of a beloved STEM learning model that’s getting attention in coastal Ghana. Leveraging young Ghanaians’ sincere interest in digital technologies for learning, imagining, creating, sharing, and addressing matters of excitement/concern in their own communities, our participant-driven approach addresses many pressing issues of our time:
•	Education of the most vulnerable.
•	Access to information, data, science knowledge.
•	Community-driven grant-making and initiatives.
•	21st century skills digital literacies, collaborative agenda-setting and problem-solving, consideration/action around future challenges, etc.
•	Inclusion, equality, and equity in STEM

Project: TAFISA-Womens Leadership in Sport for All Programme
Description: TAFISA will collaborate with local partner TIBU Africa to address gender equity in sports across Morocco and Northern Africa. Through workshops, mentorship, and networking, the project aims to empower women leaders, enhance gender equality in sports governance, and promote social inclusion. The initiative aligns with UN Sustainable Development Goals, focusing on training women in Sport for All leadership, fostering regional networks, and advocating for gender equity policies. By empowering local women, the project seeks to catalyse broader social change, promoting women's participation and leadership in sports across the region, with measurable impact and sustainable outcomes.

Project: CCIC-Projet de formation de techniciens hydrologues pour l’Accès à l’Eau pour Tous en Afrique”  pour des ONGs locales de la République de Centrafrique
Description: L’accès à l’eau est l’un des défis majeurs du XXIe siècle. Selon l’OMS 1,1 milliard de personnes dans le monde n’ont pas accès à une eau saine. En conséquence, 4 millions de personnes, dont une majorité d'enfants, meurent chaque année de maladies liées à l’eau. Le manque d’accès à l’eau reste un enjeu sanitaire et humain majeur dans différentes régions de la République centrafricaine. En étroite collaboration avec le centre international de formation 2IE de Ouagadougou, le projet vise à améliorer les conditions de vie de milliers d’habitants de plusieurs régions du pays par la formation et le renforcement des compétences techniques de plusieurs membres d’organisations non-gouvernementales locales, actives dans les domaines de la création de puits, de l’irrigation, de l’assainissement des eaux et œuvrant à la sensibilisation aux questions d’hygiène liées à l’eau.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
