Description: This project aims to raise awareness of the global significance of Saudi Arabian documentary heritage and that of the larger Arab region among stakeholders as well as the public, including by creating the Kingdoms Institute Platform for the Promotion of Documentary Heritage in the Arab World. It also aims to build capacity for the identification, preservation, and accessibility of documentary heritage among memory institutions in AlUla and Saudi Arabia through the creation of a National MoW Committee, and possibly a National Register, and enhancing scholarly research and academic reflection on documentary heritage for intercultural dialogue.
Outcome EN: Outcome 8 - Foster knowledge sharing and skills development in the digital age
Output EN: 8.CI4 - Member States are enabled to foster universal access to information and knowledge, including through the Information for All Programme (IFAP), as well as through Open Solutions, and through the identification, preservation and accessibility of doc

Project: Advancing National Monitoring and Reporting Mechanisms on SDG indicato
Description:
This project aims at building the national capacity to assess, advocate for and inform about the status of implementation of access to information (ATI) instruments in seven countries, in order to mobilize duty bearers to introduce/improve policies and practices that increase public access to information.

Against this background, this project will support seven countries - Côte d'Ivoire, Ethiopia, Ghana, Morocco, Senegal, and Tunisia - to pilot a data collection mechanism.
Outcome EN: Outcome 6 - Promote freedom of expression and the right to information
Output EN: 6.CI2 - Member States have strengthened capacities and raised awareness to enhance norms and policies related to freedom of expression, press freedom, safety of journalists, including women journalists, and the right to access information, online and offl

Project: Promoting the right to education of people with disabilities in Latin America
Description: In partnership with the Ministry of Education and Professional Development of Spain, which hosts the Red Intergubernamental Iberoamericana de Cooperación para la Educación de Personas con Necesidades Educativas Especiales (RIINEE) the project focuses on strengthening inclusive education in RIINEE Member States to ensure the right to education of people with disabilities. The project achieves the above through policy dialogue, development and cooperation among RIINEE Member States, fostering exchange and adaptation of good practices, supported by knowledge production and monitoring pertaining to inclusive education and the status of the right to education of people with disabilities.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED1 - Education systems equipped to promote inclusion, address marginalization and advance rights, including in crisis-affected and post-disaster contexts

Project: Bamiyan Cultural Centre (Phase III)
Description: The Bamiyan Cultural Centre project was planned at the request of the local community and is being implemented with its support. The main goal of the Bamiyan Cultural Centre Phase III is to finalize the activities of the previous phases and to deliver a fully operational and sustainable center which will foster the cultural enjoyment of the community, strengthen the development of its creative industries as a leverage for the economic development of the province and promote outreach activities for an enhanced interpretation of the rich culture of the Bamiyan Valley.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: Korean Secondment on diversity of cultural expressions
Description: The incumbent acts as a key member of the Secretariat to the 2005 Convention on the Protection and Promotion of the Diversity of Cultural Expressions. In particular, she monitors the development and implementation of projects within the framework of the implementation of the global capacity building strategy of the 2005 Convention and the Republic of Korea Funds in Trust (ROK FIT) dedicated to supporting the development of creative industries in Asia and Africa, and beyond.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT5 - Member States and civil society capacities strengthened to protect and promote the diversity of cultural expressions through dynamic and inclusive cultural and creative industries

Project: Support for the Asian Silk Roads World Heritage Serial and Transnation
Description: Phase II of the project "Support for the Asian Silk Roads World Heritage Serial and Transnational Nomination(s)" is designed to continue the progress made in Phase I, particularly by: (1) Continuing and further developing the ICOMOS Silk Roads Thematic Study covering Eastern Asia and Western Asia, with active support from the participating countries; (2) Facilitating the coordination mechanism for the identified Silk Roads nomination(s); and (3) Providing technical and financial support to Asian Developing Countries for the priority transnational heritage corridors for the Silk Roads nomination process.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: Secondment of Official of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Japan to BSP/DPA/SP
Description:
To consolidate, expand and diversify UNESCO's cooperation with donors and other partners, UNESCO seeks to mobilize core competences from public and private sector partners in the form of secondments that will support key functions relating to UNESCO activities that are funded from voluntary contributions (non core funding). These functions include the mobilisation of resources, donor relations including coordination of consultations and formalizing cooperation in line with UNESCO's rules and procedures and up stream guidance on resource mobilization and cooperation with donors and partners. In a spirit of mutual exchange and learning, UNESCO offers secondees the opportunity of gaining experience in a dynamic international environment . Working within a closely integrated team of UNESCO specialists, secondees will contribute to building, maintaining and enhancing relations with Bilateral Government donors. Specific responsibilities will include analysis of donors' regulations and major trends in donors' international development co-operation policies, provision of advice to UNESCO Programme specialists worldwide and senior management on developing cooperation with donors and partners, identification of entry points for cooperation and negotiation of agreements. Secondees may also contribution to efforts to promote donor visibility, and to develop and refine guidelines and training material on cooperation with donors and partners and on resource mobilisation.

The sustainability of the initiative will be ensured through the transfer of know how between secondees and UNESCO staff members during the secondment, and after the return of the secondees to the Releasing Organisations, UNESCO's network of contacts in partner organisations will enhanced and expanded.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.BSP2 - UNESCO’s partnerships and resource mobilization optimized and leveraged to strengthen the impact and visibility of the Organization’s programmes

Project: Secondment JAMSTEC
Description:
Under the direct supervision of the Head of Marine Policy and Regional Coordination section, the Programme Specialist seconded by JAMSTEC will be responsible to assist in matters relating to law of the sea and transfer of marine technology by: 
- providing inputs to IOC initiatives relating to UNCLOS 
- Liaising with Member States on the implementation of activities and programmes on law of the sea, transfer of marine technology and marine scientific research 
- act as technical secretary for GEBCO 
-mobilising extra budget in support of the implementation of IOC's mandate relating to UNCLOS.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health an

Project: Developing in-house consulting capacity for EU Member States
Description:
Reforms to recalibrate the engagement of public administrations with private consulting services and to develop in-house consulting capacities are being initiated across the Member States. The project is designed to support such reforms in the public administrations of Austria, Belgium, Cyprus, the Czech Republic, France, Greece and Latvia. 

The request by the afore-mentioned Member States is funded by, and receives technical support from, the European Commission under Regulation (EU) 2021/240 establishing the Technical Support Instrument, with the Directorate-General for Structural Reform Support acting as the contracting authority and UNESCO as the implementing agency.
Outcome EN: Outcome 7 - Promote inclusion and combat discrimination, hate speech and stereotypes

Project: Strategic investment plan for the UNESCO Courier
Description: This partnership aims to pursue in a sustainable manner The UNESCO Courier as the flagship periodical publication of the Organization targeting the general public. Publishing The UNESCO Courier in the six official languages on different media (traditional and digital) will contribute significantly to increase the visibility of the Organization. By funding the magazine, this partnership will ensure the sustainability of this communication tool whose prestige has no equal in the United Nations system.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.CPE1 - UNESCO's image enhanced and role recognized as a key solution provider for the 2030 Agenda in the Organization's areas of competence

Project: Building resilience through Social and Emotional Learning (SEL)
Description: The project aims to strengthen the capacity of Member States in expanding quality early childhood care and education (ECCE) provisions and mainstream SEL throughout teacher training institutions, whereby equipping ECCE and early primary teachers with knowledge and competencies on SEL to ensure that children develop pro-social and emotional skills and positive relationships within the early stage of the learning process.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED5 - Teachers trained and supported to improve learning outcomes and address the changes brought forth by the digital and AI transformation and the COVID-19 crisis

Project: Building Office Capacities
Description: The principle purpose of this project is to strengthen the activities of the UNESCO Regional Bureau for Science and Culture in Europe through the building of Office Capacities as agreed by the Governance Bodies of the Bureau (Scientific Council and Steering Committee). This project will allow the Director and staff of the Bureau to travel and undertake activities relevant to the execution of the approved programmes. In addition, this project intends to provide the Bureau with the human and financial resources necessary to run the Bureau and its activities, as recommended by the Gov. Bodies and approved by the DG.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 11 - Accountable, efficient and effective management in pursuit of the Organization's results
Output EN: 11.FLD3 - Enhanced administrative and operational support by addressing existing and emerging needs

Project: Projet d'appui à la continuité des apprentissages à distance face à la pandémie Covid-19 au Burundi
Description: Le projet s'inscrit dans le cadre de la mise en œuvre des activités de l'appui du GPE à la mise en œuvre du Plan National de riposte contre l'impact de la COVID-19 dans le secteur de l'éducation par la mise en place d'une plateforme d'enseignement à distance interconnectée à 40 écoles du fondamental (cycle 4). L'objectif du projet est d'assurer la continuité des apprentissages, la sécurité et le bien-être de 12 000 apprenants et 200 enseignants, notamment les plus vulnérables, et la possibilité de poursuivre, à domicile, les activités d'apprentissage minimales en cas de fermeture d'écoles tout en mettant en place des mesures préventives contre tout type de crise y compris la Covid-19.

The project coordination unit is located and operating at the offices of IOCARIBE in Cartagena Colombia provided free of charge by IOC (UNESCO) as a contribution to the project.

Project: Les jeunes tisserands de la paix dans les régions transfrontalières du
Description: Face à l'insécurité et à la criminalité grandissantes aux frontières du Gabon, du Cameroun et du Tchad dans un contexte de présence insuffisante des services publics, du manque d'opportunités économiques et de participation citoyenne, ce projet vise à la création d'un réseau de 1 800 jeunes Tisserands de la paix, pour les rendre acteurs dans la prévention des conflits et la consolidation de la paix dans les régions transfrontalières des trois pays.

Project: Social Protection Programme
Description: Funded by the Joint SDG Fund, the UN Joint Social Protection Programme covers Samoa, Cook Islands, Niue & Tokelau. The objective is to develop evidence based nationally owned social protection (SP) systems to accelerate SDGs through integrated programming in national and sub-national development. The Programme actions are along the following outcome areas: data/evidence, public finance, institutional coordination, partnerships and outreach. UNESCO's portion of the work covers all outcome areas for the persons with disabilities (PWDs).

Project: Mainstreaming gender equality in Southeast Asia through the Transforming MENtalities framework
Description: This workstream builds on best practices of the Social and Human Sciences Sector's programming to engage men and boys in gender equality in other countries and regions. Responding to the needs, priorities, and demand identified in the Southeast Asia SHS will build a follow-on/up programme, to strengthen a) knowledge on the behavioural, institutional, and structural factors which enable interventions to engage men and boys for gender equality to be successful; 2) the scale and reach of operational activities to engage men and boys for gender equality within educational and community settings; and 3) the networks available to encourage peer-learning, good practice sharing, and coordination around engaging men and boys for gender equality in areas of SHS mandate such as inter-cultural dialogue, ethics of science and technology and youth and sports for development.

Project: Policy advice and capacity building for duty bearers to improve legal
Description: UNESCO will continue to provide policy advice to and reinforce the capacities of duty bearers to enhance legal and institutional frameworks related to freedom of expression, press freedom, and safety of journalists, including women journalists, both online and offline. This will include: training judicial actors, security forces and policymakers on freedom of expression and the safety of journalists, including in times of elections; and strengthening norms and enhancing international cooperation. New challenges linked to the digital ecosystem will also be addressed, including in countering hate speech and disinformation, promoting the transparency and accountability of internet companies; and taking a human-rights based approach to technologies such as artificial intelligence.
Outcome EN: Outcome 6 - Promote freedom of expression and the right to information

Description: The project will provide support to the Directorate of Science, Technology, and Innovation to carry out stakeholder consultations for the review of the Science, Technology and Innovation policy for Malawi. The project will involve the carrying out of consultations with key stakeholders at national level, development of a first draft of the policy and its validation through consultations with stakeholders in the three regions of Malawi. It is expected that at the end of the project, the draft validated policy will be ready for submission to Parliament for adoption.

Project: Increasing scientific expertise and the prominence of females in STEM academia and research for a knowledge based economy
Description: Women in STEM form part of the vulnerable group in the COVID-19 pandemic, with challenges emanating from socio-economic aspects, gender equality, girl empowerment, and the Sustainable Development Goals. The inevitable crisis of the COVID-19 pandemic on the University calendar has disrupted and exacerbated challenges for female scientists. Due to  gender inequality, increased disproportionate domestic work and child care responsibilities, and fixed-term funding despite the consequences of COVID-!9 and beyond, the success of their studies and research are lagging. Therefore there is a need to close this gap through funding to contribute towards a diverse, inclusive and equitable quality education for sustainable development.

Project: Capacity Building Workshop For National Impact to Combat GBV
Description: HFF believes that gender equality is reached when women are treated with the respect they deserve. HFF’s research shows that many women have been abused for so long in their homes that they no longer feel they deserve to be treated equally to men. HFF proposes a project which will capacitate community leaders to learn practical tips to help families become healthier. HFF believes that the home is the foundation of each person. If that home is healthy, there is a greater chance the person will be healthy and positively contribute to society. Fix the root. Fix the fruit.

Project: APPUI AUX ELEVES ET ENSEIGNANTS DU LYCÉE-COLLEGE 28 SEPTEMBRE D’ALMAMYA VICTIME DE L’INCENDIE DU DÉPÔT D’HYDROCARBURES DE KALOUM- CONAKRY
Description:
Deux mois après, l’incendie du dépôt pétrolier continue d’affecter les habitants, notamment dans l’éducation, avec plusieurs établissements scolaires endommagés par les incendies. Le complexe scolaire public 28 septembre d’Almamya, a été la victime principale de l’incendie du dépôt d’hydrocarbure. 1 200 élèves, dont 523 filles sont impactées par cet incendie.


Le pays a sollicité ses partenaires multilatéraux, l’UNICEF et l’UNESCO, ainsi que le FMI (Fonds monétaire international) afin qu’une assistance en nature des matériels et fournitures pédagogiques lui soit apportée pour cette crise, conformément aux Résolutions 39 C/61 et 42 C/47, pour assurer la pérennité de l'éducation

Project: IMPROVING THE  ENROLMENT  OF  FEMALE   SAHO  CHILDREN  THROUGH MOBILIZING THE SAHO COMMUNITY.
Description:
Southern Region is one of the densely populated regions of the country (Eritrea). Currently, it has about 800,000 population. It is one of the regions which share common boundary with Ethiopia. Large portion of the population in the region is affected by the 1998-2000 war of aggression, which was waged by the Tigray regime that resulted in the displacement of about 38 Schools with 22,202 students and 372 teachers.  The Tigray claimed some parts of these sub regions. School Facilities were pillaged by the Tigray military force.  
Although virtual demarcation had been given by the Hague, there had been skirmishes until 2022. As a result, there is feeling of trauma in the children.  There is a need of helping the people in general and the children in particular.
The economic activities of the region are predominantly agricultural with a very limited semi-pastoralism in the lowland areas.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particul

Project: Digitization of Eritrean Music Works
Description:
Eritrea has more than sixty thousand analog audio recordings of music works. Within this
collection, the history of Eritrean societies and their interaction with other societies is well
expressed and documented. In some cases, these music recordings are found to be the
sole sources of information concerning the socio-economic and political history of Eritrea.
However, the existence of this precious and unexploited intangible cultural heritage is now
endangered due to technological obsolescence and aging. The Research and
Documentation Centre (RDC) of Eritrea is therefore proposing to professionally take a
frontline initiative for its safeguarding through mapping, digitizing and processing.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action

Project: Establishmeent of Environmental school clubs
Description: The Department of Environment (DOE) of the Ministry of Land, Water and Environment, being the major institution responsible for coordinating environmental actions in Eritrea is struggling to secure a  better environment and health citizens, through active participation. Yet the biggest challenge is low  environmental   awareness   levels   of   the   citizens.   Environmental   awareness   raising   programmes   for capitalizing knowledge and bringing behavioral changes towards knowledge management systems is a top component of sustainable environmental solutions.   Educating, training and organizing the young generation in a manner of environmentally friendly practices is a priority that our future sustainable  environmental protection relies

Description: L’Association congolaise pour l’Assistance sociale - ACAS, en collaboration avec les ministères des enseignements et de le Jeunesse, envisage d’organiser une session de formation en vue de renforcer les capacités des jeunes responsables d’organisations de jeunesse et animateurs des radios de proximité en matière de leadership, d’éducation à la paix, de prévention, de vigilance sur les violences basées sur le Genre et de résolution non violente des conflits. Project: PROJET DE SENSIBILISATION ET DE FORMATION DES FILLES DU SECONDAIRE GENERAL AUX SCIENCES, TECHNOLOGIE, INGENERIE, MATHEMATIQUE (STIM)
Description:
4.	(a) Présentation succincte du projet
Le présent projet vise à sensibiliser, à former et orienter les filles aux domaines scientifiques par une initiation aux pratiques (manipulations) en chimie, en physique, en science de la vie et de la terre, en informatique et mathématique. Par ailleurs des stands d’information et d’orientation seront animés chaque jour dans le domaine des sciences dures par de spécialistes.  Les filles et les enseignantes découvrent à travers les conférences et débats accordés les femmes ingénieurs, médecins spécialistes, pilotes, informaticien le goût du métier pour une bonne orientation.  D’autres spécialistes peuvent être sollicités suivant leur calendrier de disponibilité.  C’est aussi l’occasion de faire venir les enseignants des provinces afin qu’il puisse découvrir comment nous pourrions nous servir des STEM pour séduire et conquérir les filles à être plus nombreuses dans les sciences.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particul

Project: Ethical issues in public healthcare institutions with a focus on gender dynamics and exploration of existing gender equality policies in Kenya
Description: The project is in line with UNESCO commitments on ethics of science and technology. An assessment on clinical ethics a focus on gender dynamics and equality policies will be done, followed by capacity building workshops. A consultant will be contracted. A report from the assessment will be validated. The assessment will be conducted at sampled healthcare institutions in Nyanza Region. The targeted participants will be healthcare workers. A report will be published and disseminated after workshops. The project aim is ensure policy reforms to foster a more ethical and gender sensitive healthcare environment.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action

Project: ATELIERS DE CAPACITATION DES ORGANISATIONS DE FEMMES RURALES SUR L’EXPLOITATION ET LA RENTABILISATION DES TIC
Description: Le présent projet est, comme on peut le voir conforme avec l’objectif stratégique n°4 par lequel « L’UNESCO s’engage activement à réduire la fracture numérique entre les genres en fournissant aux femmes et aux filles une éducation aux médias et à l’information et des compétences numériques, en garantissant un accès équitable à l’information et en favorisant l’autonomisation des femmes par la promotion de l’égalité des genres dans le développement et l’utilisation des technologies numériques »

Project: ATELIER DE SENSIBILISATION DES ELEVES DES ECOLES ASSOCIEES A L’UNESCO DU CAMEROUN  SUR  L’UTILISATION RESPONSABLE D’INTERNET ET DES RESEAUX SOCIAUX
Description: Internet est devenu un espace de divertissement, d’interactions, de connaissances mais également un espace à risques dans lequel on pénètre d’un simple clic. Aujourd’hui, alors que l’âge de la première navigation ne cesse de diminuer, les jeunes représentent la population la plus exposée aux risques et dangers d’Internet. Il est primordial de les former et sensibiliser à l’utilisation de ces outils. Il est également important de les apprendre à communiquer sur les réseaux sociaux. Ceci est l’objet de l’atelier que le Réseau national des écoles associées à l’UNESCO du Cameroun veut organiser.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action

Project: Atelier sur la réorientation du programme national de l’enseignement primaire vers le développement durable
Description:
Alors qu’en 2030 tous les Etats du monde seront appelés à faire l’évaluation de la mise en œuvre des ODD, dans notre pays, seul le programme National de l’école maternelle prend en compte les aspects de ces derniers.

Il est urgent que les programmes d’enseignement scolaire soient réorientés vers le Développement Durable en commençant par l’école primaire avant que les autres niveaux scolaires ne soient également pris en compte, sachant que pour créer un monde plus viable et pour faire face aux enjeux de Développement Durable, chaque individu doit devenir acteur d’un changement axé sur la durabilité. C’est à cette tâche que va s’atteler le présent projet.

Project: Local-Led Climate Adaptation Initiative: Empowering Young People and Women through Solar Powered Water Supply and Sustainable Climate-Resilient Gardening in Muchila Chiefdom, Namwala, Southern Province, Zambia.
Description: The project is being undertaken to address the issue of water access and promote women and youth empowerment in Muchila chiefdom, which has been severely affected by droughts as a result of climate change. The project intends to install solar-powered boreholes and promote climate-smart agriculture through community gardens to address water scarcity, food insecurity, and the impact of climate change. Additionally, it aims to empower women and youth through training and engagement, equipping them with skills for resilient farming practices, fostering economic independence and environmental stewardship. The project's innovative approach not only secures water resources but also cultivates climate-resilient leaders.

Its target women, men and youths involved in charcoal burning. Project: PROMOTION OF DOCUMENTATION, CULTIVATION AND PROCESSING OF VALUE-ADDED TRADITIONAL MEDICINE AND FOOD SUPPLEMENTS
Description: This project proposal aims to explore and document requirements for the integration of traditional medicine into primary care settings, with the goal of enhancing patient-centred healthcare.  Traditional medicine is an important component of the health care system in Tanzania and in other developing countries. However, indigenous knowledge about herbal medicines of many Tanzanian cultures is scarcely investigated, documented for the present and future generation as well as not exploited for socio-economic development for the communities. The aim of the present study is to document traditional and herbal medicines and practices used by communities in the Lake Victoria Basin in Tanzania to treat and manage human diseases and ailments.

Project: La promotion de la femme en vue de son autonomisation à travers la lecture et la lutte contre les Violences basées sur le genre dans les localités de Koua et de Siédja
Description:
Ce projet s’inscrit dans la priorité globale de l’UNESCO sur l’égalité des genres au paragraphe 04011 du document 42C/5 traitant de la priorité globale l’égalité des genres qui stipule que
«  l’UNESCO intensifiera son soutien à l’égalité des genres grâce à des stratégies ciblées visant à lutter contre les stéréotypes et les discriminations dans les cadres juridiques et les institutions, ainsi que contre toutes les formes de préjugés fondés sur le genre, et en œuvrant avec les hommes et les garçons dans le cadre de son initiative « Transformer les mentalités ». Elle s’emploiera également à accroître la résilience par le biais de politiques axées sur le genre ».
Plus spécifiquement dans ce projet, les activités et les actions sont fortement engagées pour la réalisation de l’ODD 5. 
Des actions en droite ligne seront réalisées en lien avec l’agenda de l’Union Africaine 2063 (aspiration 6, paragraphe 51) ; du Plan National de Développement 2021-2025 (Page 153, paragraphe 994 à 999).

Project: Promouvoir la culture de l’anticipation avec les communautés scolaire et universitaire de la ville de Bouaké par l’éducation prospective
Description:
Il est courant d’entendre les gouvernants dire que l’avenir des Etats appartient à la jeunesse. Cette réalité est encore plus vivante en Afrique où la jeunesse représente, selon de nombreuses recherches menées sur le dividende démographique, environ 60 % de la population totale du continent (PNUD, 2023). De ce fait, l’Afrique est un continent avec une population essentiellement jeune qui pourrait stimuler le développement économique. Elle est la principale force active et éduquée de la population. Et pourtant, cette jeunesse se trouve plutôt apeurée par son avenir en raison des tendances actuelles qui n’augurent point d’un futur radieux. Si cette situation a des facteurs explicatifs liés à l’efficacité des politiques publiques dédiées à la jeunesse, elle est aussi liée au fait que cette jeunesse ne dispose pas toujours des rudiments nécessaires pour explorer son avenir, le lire et se projeter raisonnablement dans le futur souhaité. Cet état de fait a pour incidence, tant à l’échelle personnelle que nationale, d’empêcher, d’inhiber voire de détruire le potentiel d’innovation et d’imagination de cette jeunesse qui est censée être au cœur du développement des nations. Dans la ville de Bouaké, en Côte d’Ivoire, cette situation est d’actualité et soutenue par un taux d’analphabétisme estimé à 43% (Mairie de Bouaké, 2023) et 54,9% de taux de chômage (INS, ENV 2015). 

En vue de créer donc un cadre exploratoire de compréhension du futur, la Chaire UNESCO Anticipation, Prospective et Territoires Durables de l’Université Alassane OUATTARA initie le projet « Promouvoir la culture de l’anticipation avec les communautés scolaire et universitaire de la ville de Bouaké par l’éducation prospective» dans le but d’expérimenter l’éducation prospective dans les établissements scolaires et universitaires de la ville de Bouaké afin de promouvoir la culture de l’anticipation auprès de la jeunesse pour la rendre plus créatrice et prospective. Ce projet s’inscrit dans le cadre de l’ODD 4 « Education de qualité » visant à faire en sorte que tous puissent suivre une éducation de qualité dans des conditions d’équité et promouvoir les opportunités d’apprentissage tout au long de la vie.  

Pour des sociétés résilientes et inclusives, il convient de mettre les outils de la prospective à la disposition de tous. Ce projet vise à démocratiser la prospective de sorte à amener les communautés scolaire et universitaire à être lettré du futur en réactivant en elles le pouvoir de l’imagination dans ces moments d’incertitudes. Il ne s’agit plus de faire de la prospective une chasse gardée de l’élite là où l’urgence bat son plein au sein des communautés. Il s’agit de susciter une mobilisation collective pour une meilleure inclusivité de la prospective en préparant les esprits aux changements. Ce projet entend faire de l’imagination, un puissant outil de co-construction et de mobilisation collective des avenirs des communautés scolaire et universitaire de Bouaké.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particul

Project: Projet de promotion d’une société égalitaire par l’éducation et la formation de la jeune fille en vue de son autonomisation
Description:
Ce projet vise à asseoir l’autonomisation de la jeune fille à travers la promotion de l’égalité des genres qui ne va pas sans prôner le principe de l’égalité des chances homme-femme. 

Pour ce faire, il y a lieu de juguler les disparités de genre qui touchent particulièrement l’analphabétisme, la vulnérabilité et la discrimination de la jeune fille. Ce sont les défis visés par l’Organisation porteuse de ce projet. Ainsi il est à distinguer deux groupes de jeunes filles qui méritent un accompagnement : celles dites vulnérables car analphabètes ou déscolarisés ; et celles qui sont scolarisées mais limités à des filières dites « féminines », donc peu représentées dans les domaines scientifiques.

Project: Zero violence and no bullying" project with awareness campaigns and school sports
Description:
The human mind is a complex system of interacting processes that generate, encode, transform, and manipulate information of various kinds. According to Almeida (1988), reasoning is associated with concepts such as intelligence, problem solving, and comprehension/thinking. It can be considered a cognitive valence, especially when approached in the discovery of relationships, comparison of elements and choice of alternatives among the answers.

In a game of chess, the use of reasoning is paramount to make well-defined moves. Vygotsky (1998) states that, "although in the game of chess there is no direct substitution for real-life relations, it is undoubtedly a type of imaginary situation". By learning chess, the student would be developing socially available skills and knowledge, being able to contribute to their self-esteem, that is, without understanding there is no understanding and without understanding there is no learning. 

It should be noted that the game of chess is a form of playful-educational entertainment capable of developing in children and young people the ability to concentrate, memory, judgment, imagination, anticipation, will win, patience, self-control, decision-making, mathematical logic, creativity and intelligence. 

The actions were elaborated in a collaborative and inclusive perspective, which constitute one of the typical principles of UNESCO and by their nature can be an important option to ensure the integration of school activities in times of social isolation and can be used as a way to form values such as respect for differences, non-discrimination and bullying, the reduction of school dropouts and the identification of talents.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particul

Project: Training Program in Environmental Education and Ecological Fair in Allusion to World Environment Day "Solutions to plastic pollution"
Description:
The world is grappling with the issue of protecting and preserving the environment. Climate change is a glaring example, as there are even hotter summers, even colder winters, unusual floods, and many other effects. 

The commemorative dates established in the month of June by the United Nations (UN), with the 5th as the "World Environment Day" and the 8th as the "International Oceans Day", raise the world's awareness of the preservation of the environment, through policy measures and the change of society's attitude to ensure sustainable development.
In addition, the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) has been calling on Member States and in particular Ministries of Education to include content related to climate change, with a view to educating students for behavioural changes in their relationship with the environment.


In view of the above, the National Commission of Angola for UNESCO (CNU-Angola), in partnership with Coca-cola, Jimmi, Nação Verde and Refriango, decided to carry out environmental education actions for the schools of the Associated Schools Program, under the motto: "Protect the environment today so that tomorrow can be lived", which will culminate with an Ecological Fair also involving Higher Education Institutions and social partners,  with a view to exhibiting a set of projects related to the preservation of the environment.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action

Project: NATIONAL WORKSHOP ON THE IMPACTS OF CLIMATE CHANGE ON WATER, SANITATION, AND HYGIENE (WASH) IN NIGERIAN EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTIONS
Description: The National Workshop on the Impacts of Climate Change on Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) aims to strengthen awareness and build the capacity of educational institutions, on the adverse impact of climate change on WASH practices in Nigeria. It will address the urgent need for sustainable practices, climate-resilient measures, provide innovative solutions and strategies for addressing the challenges posed by climate change on WASH in educational institutions. It will further address climate adaptation and mitigation measures into WASH practices, sustainable water conservation, sanitation management, sustainable hygiene practices, climate-resilient WASH infrastructure, and transition in the face of climate change impacts.

Project: Together Towards a Greening Education for Sustainable Development.
Description:
Greening education is one that seeks sustainable development, keeping pace with technological development and benefiting from it in all elements of the educational process with high efficiency and distinct outcomes, according to environmentally friendly standards. It develops environmental programs such as buildings, energy, afforestation, and services. It also focuses on the educational process and providing it with related technologies, applications, strategies, and practices. The concept of green education. 

Greening education also allows effective use of modern educational technologies, which has the greatest impact on: - Quality education, expanding the student’s awareness, and direct and active communication between the student and the teacher. - Developing his creativity and exploration skills and moving away from the traditional learning routine. - Informing the student’s guardian continuously and accurately about his child’s academic level. - Transforming traditional classrooms into a virtual world that simulates reality. - Creating an interactive space with exciting and enriching possibilities for the student’s thinking and knowledge at the same time and in a healthy and safe environment.

So, this project consists of implementing national trainings and initiatives in formal  and non-formal education.

Project: Célébration du cinquantenaire de la disparition de Suzanne Comhaire-Sylvain en association avec l’UNESCO
Description:
La commémoration du cinquantenaire de la disparition de Suzanne Comhaire-Sylvain, première femme anthropologue et linguiste d'Haïti (1898-1975), aura lieu de mars 2024 à juin 2025, avec le soutien de Cuba, de l'Éthiopie et du Gabon. L'événement est intégré aux célébrations de l'UNESCO pour le biennium 2024-2025.  

Écrivaine engagée, Comhaire-Sylvain a créé des liens entre Haïti et l'Afrique, soulignant l'importance de l'héritage africain dans la culture haïtienne. Disciple de Mauss, Malinowski et Métraux, elle a publié des ouvrages majeurs sur la littérature orale africaine et haïtienne, symbolisant une figure clé des sciences humaines et sociales.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particul

Project: Projet d’inventaire des mémoires de l’esclavage en Haïti, avec une phase pilote dans les 19 communes du département du Nord
Description: Le Nord d’Haïti héberge des vestiges intacts liés à la mémoire et à l’histoire de la traite transatlantique des esclaves : habitations coloniales, fortifications, palais, témoignages véhiculés par la tradition orale depuis des générations. Cependant, il n’existe aucun inventaire de ces éléments patrimoniaux. Le présent projet d’inventaire vise à combler ce manque. Il combine collecte de données de terrain et ateliers sur la traite des Noirs, la construction des identités et leur rapport avec les problèmes de racisme, d’inégalité et de clivages sociaux. L’action participe ainsi à la revitalisation du projet « Les Routes des personnes mises en esclavage ».
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action

Project: The Perpetual Plastic Project
Description:
Environmental Protection In the Caribbean - Sint Maarten (EPIC) is currently in the process of initiating 'The Perpetual Plastic Project', a plastic recycling workspace project, of which it is still in the starting up phase. It will entail a few different phases, the one most of relevance here is phase 1: the education phase. Much of what EPIC is intending to achieve through this project, specifically this phase, matches with what UNESCO wishes to attain at many of the schools on Sint Maarten. A more cognizant youth practicing sustainability, thereby protecting the island and themselves and their futures. 

Phase 2 for this recycling initiative, focuses on the setting up a small-scale plastic recycling workplace for which specific machinery is necessary.  There are different types of machines for the different outputs envisioned. It mainly comes down to a shredder which shreds the plastics to small ‘malleable’ pieces, an injector which melts the pieces which can then be injected into small molds for smaller plastic items, an extruder which works similar to an injector but is there to create bigger items through bigger molds (think a keychain vs a beam for a bench), and a sheet press which melts down plastic pieces into big slabs (generally 1x1m – think: table tops etc.).
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action

Project: Promote freedom of expression and the right to information in Chile, and follow-up of the World Press Freedom Day Conference.
Description: Chile and UNESCO will host World Press Freedom Day in 2024. Thirty years have passed since the first World Press Freedom Day celebration in 1994 and of the historic Santiago Declaration adopted during the “Seminar on the Development of Media and Democracy in Latin America and the Caribbean” (May 6, 1994), which marked a new phase in promoting the right to freedom of expression and of the press, as well as the development and recognition of community media, independence, and pluralism of the media in Latin America and the Caribbean. Therefore, the WPFD event is a good opportunity to return to the city of Santiago and reaffirm everyone’s commitment to promote and guarantee freedom of expression worldwide. After the WPFDC, support will be provided to Chile to strengthen capacities and raise awareness to improve current legislation and public policies related to freedom of expression, freedom of the press, safety of journalists, including women journalists, and the right to access information, online and offline.
Outcome EN: Outcome 6 - Promote freedom of expression and the right to information
Output EN: 6.CI2 - Member States have strengthened capacities and raised awareness to enhance norms and policies related to freedom of expression, press freedom, safety of journalists, including women journalists, and the right to access information, online and offl

Project: Understanding the Gaps in Cancer Education and Awareness in Bangladesh and Finding Prospective Solutions: A Special Emphasis on Stigmas and Challenges Among Women
Description: Despite progress in cancer management, Bangladesh faces formidable challenges to overcome stigma and misunderstanding around cancers. The challenge is even bigger for women who suffers from breast and ovarian cancers(1). Bangladesh has enormous problem regarding cancer awareness and education among general people. Proper research is also lacking here to meet these challenges. With the involvement of Sir Walter Bodmer from the University of oxford who has long experience in cancer research and science communication, and leading figures from Bangladesh, this project aims to bridge the gaps through trainings, seminars, social media awareness campaigns, and community outreach by targeting students, communities, and healthcare professionals. Specific strategies include understanding cancer stigmas, gaps in cancer education and cancer prevention, addressing doctor-patient relationship challenges with a practical manual, and engaging diverse speakers. The project plans events in educational institutions, villages, and conference halls/hospitals. Overall, the initiative seeks to enhance the understanding on cancer education, eradicate fear, and foster stronger connections between healthcare providers and patients.

Project: Protection and Promotion of  Boat Race- the Most Popular Water Sports in Bangladesh.
Description: The project addresses the decline of Boat Racing, once of the most popular and the most popular water sports in Bangladesh. Climate change, environmental shifts have led to the drying of water bodies, threatening this cherished water sport. Despite the rising popularity of mainstream sports like cricket and football, Boat Racing persists, particularly during the rainy season. This project strives to document resilient communities of men engaged in Boat Racing, preserving their cultural legacy. Through visual and written records, the initiative seeks to raise awareness about the sport's significance, offering a glimpse into a vanishing tradition, and fostering community empowerment amidst changing environmental dynamics

Project: Empowerment of women and girls in education: from rights to opportunities
Description:
The project "Empowerment of women and girls in education: from rights to opportunities" aims to promote the creation of an educational environment free from gender-based discrimination, fostering the development and self- realization of every girl and woman, regardless of gender.
Running from May 1st to December 31st, 2024 it seeks to provide a platform for discussing the challenges faced by women in the field of education and seeking solutions to address them
Expected results include improved knowledge and skills through conducting a two conferences and one workshop, the creation of a support network of educational professionals willing to collaborate and support each other in gender equality matters.
Project activities include two conferences addressing key practices and stereotypes in education and workshop on women's potential in education leadership, issuance of booklets on women's statistics in education, and the development of recommendations.

Project: THE COLLECTION and DOCUMENTATION OF THE TRADITIONAL COSTUMES
Description:
Vanuatu is a vibrant and culturally diverse archipelago in terms of traditional costumes. Each village on the island of Vanuatu has its respective traditional costumes. The practice of making these traditional costumes is also very diverse depending on the villages and the islands. Moreover, with natural disasters, more particularly climate change, and the rise of the sea level, which is advancing at high speed, we must imperatively protect and safeguard our traditional knowledge as well as the plants for manufacturing these cultural artifacts. For this, an inventory should be urgently carried out to assess the situation concerning the plants from which plant is derived and lost. Emphasis should be placed on strategies to re-establish viable stocks of these plants on an island. Traditional exchanges of these costumes should be encouraged to perpetuate their know-how and their manufacture. Knowledge and oral knowledge of the traditional origins of these costumes should be urgently recorded by collecting from the men or women of each village.
The production and use of traditional costumes play an essential role in many rituals for the indigenous people of Vanuatu and should be revived and perpetuated. For this, a documentation and photography project should be undertaken for this purpose to document and archive all the stages of the production chain of these traditional costumes.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particul

Description:
The project is aimed at creating a full-fledged educational environment in hospital schools of the Kyrgyz Republic for oncologically ill children and other categories of seriously ill children with the possibility of education, taking into account the individual characteristics of each child, ensuring smoother reintegration of children into everyday life after treatment. In the Kyrgyz Republic, the problem of hospital education has not been given due attention. Therefore, the creation of new hospital schools in all regions of the country and the training of qualified tutors is a very urgent issue today. 
The project is also aimed at social support of female teachers, improvement of their qualifications, professional development, improvement of the quality of educational services, and attracting public attention to the contribution of women to the development of hospital pedagogy in the Kyrgyz Republic.

Project: Sensibiliser et initier les jeunes filles à la culture entrepreneuriale en milieu  scolaire
Description: L'emploi des jeunes est un défi pour les pays africains et encore plus pour la Gabon où les moins de 25 ans constituent plus de 54% de la population. Face à la capacité limitée du marché de travail d’offrir des possibilités d’emplois décents à ces jeunes diplômés ou pas, il devient plus qu’impératif de promouvoir de nouvelles stratégies permettant aux jeunes de créer leurs emplois et de contribuer positivement à l’économie. Parmi ces stratégies, l’entrepreneuriat est sans nul doute une des réponses clé pour libérer le potentiel productif et innovant des jeunes. La promotion de la culture de l’entreprenariat dès le jeune âge chez les jeunes filles en milieu scolaire serait un atout qui peut permettre de les sensibiliser à l’auto-emploi et la création des entreprises pour leur autonomisation et surtout pour surmonter les obstacles liés au chômage.

Project: ELIMINATE: Elodea Management Initiative for St. Naum Springs
Description: ELIMINATE is a 12-month initiative addressing the invasive Elodea canadensis threatening St. Naum Springs in North Macedonia. Focused on community collaboration, the project aims to reduce Elodea coverage by 80%, restoring native habitats and water quality. Empowering 50 trained community members ensures ongoing management, fostering resilience, and sustaining eco-tourism. With a $26,000 budget, ELIMINATE combines workshops, removal campaigns, and awareness to protect this UNESCO-listed site, promoting a participatory and sustainable approach for a thriving ecosystem.

Project: Elaboration d’un manuel harmonisé de formation des alphabétiseurs en charge de l’alphabétisation des groupes organisés des jeunes et des femmes
Description: Le projet « Elaboration d’un manuel harmonisé de formation des alphabétiseurs en charge de l’alphabétisation des groupes organisés des jeunes et des femmes » s’inscrit dans la réalisation des activités de l’axe stratégique 2 relatives à l’amélioration de la qualité de l’Alphabétisation et de l’éducation non formelle (AENF) du document de la Stratégie nationale d’alphabétisation et de l’éducation non formelle 2024-2028. Il s’agit de doter les acteurs du sous-secteur de l’AENF d’un premier manuel harmonisé de formation des alphabétiseurs élaboré selon l’approche par les compétences (APC). Pour y arriver, il est envisagé la tenue d’un atelier formation production regroupant les acteurs intervenant en AENF. Un consultant indépendant sera recruté pour conduire le processus sur la base des divers modules de formation des alphabétiseurs existant sur le terrain.

Project: Strengthening iLearn Gambia Platform, a digital tool for fostering knowledge sharing and skills development: Revolutionizing Education Access
Description:
Digitalisation is a critical step towards promoting knowledge sharing and skill development, revolutionising education access across the country. ilearngambia is one of the digital online learning platforms designed by the Ministry in their drive to ensure quality education for all, irrespective of location, gender or any other factor that may limit Gambian access to education. The platform makes passive learning more interactive and dynamic by incorporating interactive elements like scripted lessons across the curricula, quizzes, simulations, and multimedia content. In addition, the platform can be used to analysis data and monitor student progress and identify areas for improvement. By collecting and analysing student performance data, educators can gain insights into individual learning needs and tailor instruction accordingly. This data-driven approach to education allows for personalised learning pathways that address each student’s unique strengths and challenges, resulting in better learning outcomes.

 

By incorporating innovative features such as SD cards, Open Educational Resources (OER) materials, and interactive worksheets, the platform becomes more versatile and adaptable to the diverse needs of Gambian students. Integrating SD cards, Open Educational Resources (OER) materials, and interactive worksheets into the ilearngambia platform improves education access by ensuring flexibility, scalability, and inclusivity. SD cards provide offline access, which is especially important in areas with limited internet access. OER materials democratise learning by making resources available for free and adaptable. Interactive worksheets actively engage students, which improves comprehension and retention. These provisions, taken together, empower learners, educators, and communities in Gambia, fostering knowledge sharing and skill development. The provision of these additional learning infrastructures ensures that students even in remote areas can utilise the platform without being hampered by connectivity issues. SD cards offer offline access to a variety of educational materials, such as textbooks, videos, and interactive exercises, allowing for continuous learning regardless of location or internet access. OER materials democratises education by providing free and openly licenced resources that can be adapted and shared by both educators and learners. Educators can customise learning materials to meet their students' specific needs and interests, resulting in a more personalised and engaging learning experience. Further, worksheets are designed to reinforce key concepts, foster critical thinking skills, and provide immediate feedback, allowing for deeper learning experiences. Soft worksheets increase student engagement and comprehension.

 

In order to realise these efforts, material resources (SD Card, Hard Drives, lesson contents, subject contents, cameras, storage devices, editing tools, among others), human resources for lessons preparation, recording, uploading, and editing, among others and financial resources for honorariums for personnel contracted for effective digitalisation.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particul

Project: Promote Ecosystem Approaches and Collaborative Natural Resource Management for Climate Change Adaptation in disaster-prone, high-risk and UNESCO-designated sites in Uganda.
Description:
Whereas Uganda Government has put in place a legislation called the Uganda wildlife Act 2019 to provide for the conservation and sustainable management of wildlife and streamlining the roles and responsibilities of institutions involved in wildlife conservation and management and for related matters, this law does not make any provisions, let alone mention, the Biosphere Reserves and other globally-designated sites anywhere in the document.  This unfortunate lack of domestication of the MAB principles in the law in the case of the  Biosphere Reserves  means that the principles  of MAB as a scientific Programme for promoting scientific research on human populations’ interaction with ecosystems, the cooperation between all the scientific disciplines to better understand human-nature interactions through science, through education, through training and through building capacities of communities in a Biosphere Reserve setting is not actively promoted.   

 While Section 32 of the Act provides for “Historic rights of communities around conservation areas”, the rights so granted are subject to the guidelines to be provided by the Authority like access to resources which are historically crucial to the survival of those communities. This conditional provision for the indigenous communities who are historically part and parcel of the ecosystem is however different from the Biosphere Reserve management which calls for coexistence between the community and the ecosystem in a consultatively zoned areas designated for the purposes as defined in the MAB Principles. The drive of MAB to overcome conflicts between people’s livelihoods and nature through a “rational” use of natural resources, to establish or re-establish “harmony” between people and their environment is missed out and this has made  it easy to alienate the indigenous communities in these sites from their natural environment. The conflicts between the management of these sites with the indigenous communities have continued due to the, management of these sites without the application of the Biosphere Reserve principles. Although a MAB National Committees exists, the lack of provision for them in the Law governing these protected areas makes it difficult for them to exercise the roles laid down in the MAB Strategy and the WNBR. The same problem exists with the other globally-important sites designated under UNESCO like the 4 World Heritage Sites in the Country. 

 
There are continuing complaints of communities about unfairness in the policies regulating the Biosphere Reserves as punishment is meted out to them when they enter into what should be buffer zones in the Biosphere reserves.  Whereas the communities have complaints of hostility of UWA Officials and Game Rangers towards them (See the Monitor Newspaper January 30th 2024, story below), the UWA Officials also complain of intransigence of the communities, and political interference by the leaders of the communities in the Biosphere reserves. The conservation agency counter-accused the Communities of killing 15 of its staff (rangers) and injuring 35 others between 2002 to 2023. The other BR, Queen Elizabeth, has also experience intermittent conflicts between pastoralists and the conservation managers. 

Other problems associated with land use include the emerging accounts of how nomadic pastoralists called “Balaalo” have migrated to areas of other communities resulting to conflicts in those areas. Such accounts not only depict images of pastoralism as being an outmoded and inefficient livelihood system but also pastoralists as people who are understood almost exclusively through discourses of conflict, insecurity and lawlessness, amongst others. This can potentially contribute to cycles of violence by manipulation of pastoralists against themselves and other local communities. There are also fears of spread of livestock diseases resulting to epidemic in the new areas being migrated to. Some of the encroachments have been to the protected areas of National Forestry Authority. However, all these point to the lack of knowledge appropriate land use practices for climate action, biodiversity, water management and disaster risk reduction (Outcome 3) resulting from non-inclusive development in the country where certain communities have remained excluded from knowledge and skills in  sustainable management of natural resources and disaster risk resilience.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particul

Project: HERFA- A Journey into our History to inspire our Future
Description: Herfa’s overall purpose is to safeguard the Saudi intangible cultural heritage through preserving, documenting and transferring it through generations. Building on the achievement and learning from the previous project “A Tapestry of a Kingdom”, this project proposes a focus on younger generations (primary school children) to contribute to fulfilling Herfa’s mission through exploring and experiencing traditional crafts in addition to documenting their history. It will be a partnership between multiple partners: a local Saudi NGO (Herfa), three government bodies (Ministry of Education, Ministry of Culture and the Royal Institute of Traditional Arts), two local private banks in addition to UNESCO.

Project: SCI-Beyond Borders: a Pan-African approach to international voluntary service
Description:
Beyond Borders seeks to promote regional integration, climate justice, and sustainable development in Africa. Through a Peace Caravan and community-rooted follow-up actions involving 9 voluntary organisations, the initiative aims to empower youth, enhance south-southcooperation, and challenge neocolonial motivations. Focused on eco-village development, climate change mitigation, and permaculture-based food security, the project includes hands-on activities, transformative workshops, and a documentary-video. By fostering collaboration and capacity building among voluntary organisations, the project strives to create a more interconnected, resilient network capable of 
 addressing regional challenges through a decolonial lens.

Project: ICTM- 48th World Conference of the International Council for Traditional Music
Description: The World Conference of the International Council for Traditional Music (ICTM) is held once every two years in different parts of the world. In January 2025, ICTM will hold its 48th World Conference in Wellington, New Zealand, hosted by Te Herenga Waka, Victoria University of Wellington. The 7-day conference will showcase diverse research and practice in music-dance through individual papers, organized panels, workshops, performances, roundtables, and films/video screenings based on seven themes, with specific emphasis on Indigenous communities, environment, displacement, and relocation. Selected presentations will be revised and published in our flagship journal, the Yearbook for Traditional Music in 2026.

Project: ICAE- Empowerment in action: Building capacity for transformative gender policy and practice in the Arab states
Description:
Led by ICAE with AHAED and UNESCO Beirut Office and UIL, the project aims to advance women's education and lifelong learning in Republic of Iraq, Republic of Lebanon, The State of Palestine, Jordan, and Syria. Stakeholders develop strategies through assessments and consultations. A preparatory phase precedes a five-day training workshop, fostering knowledge exchange and action planning. Outcomes include mainstreaming gender equality in education policies and practices, enhancing capacity, and fostering collaboration, empowering women in the Arab region through equitable access to quality education.

Key Messages:
•	Advancing women's education and lifelong learning opportunities.
•	Stakeholder collaboration for gender equality.
•	Capacity-building and knowledge exchange for gender equality in lifelong learning.
•	Empowering women through skills development and learning access.

Project: Preliminary Assessment 2024-2025
Description: The Preliminary Assessment is a mandatory desk-based process for all sites that may be nominated to the World Heritage List and is undertaken following a request by the relevant State(s) Party(ies). It provides States Parties with an opportunity for enhanced dialogue with the Advisory Bodies, and it helps to establish the feasibility of a potential nomination and avoid the use of resources in the preparation of nominations that may be unlikely to succeed. The current budget will fund the requests for Preliminary Assessment received as of September 2024 and deemed complete.

Project: Strengthening tsunami early warning in the North-West Indian Ocean reg
Description: While a powerful earthquake in the Makran region could generate destructive tsunami capable of inundating coastlines within 20 minutes, most coastal communities in the region are still not prepared to respond effectively of a near-field tsunami threat. This is the phase-2 project following the achievement of Phase 1: enhancement of the scientific understanding of the MSZ and the strengthen national warning chains and SOP. Phase 2 aims to enhance the hazard and inundation mapping capabilities and strengthen capacities in tsunami evacuation planning in line with the near-field tsunamis threat for self-protection at the community level in India, Iran, Pakistan Oman and United Arab Emirates.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction

Project: Green education concept for environment sustainability in changing climate.
Description: Green Education in the service sector is expected to transform education sector and is combined with the trend of world economy development. Environmental benefits and sustainability are two characteristics of green education. Academicians, administrators, students need to incorporate awareness and adoption of environmentally friendly practices in the learning process (Rao and Aithal, 2016). When higher education goes green it also creates a high public image, helps in attracting and retaining the best and committed employees and having best students who would aspire to be under such colleges and universities. The United Nations had constituted 2005-2014 as the decade for green education development. This was done to create a positive impact on the society at large by bringing greenness with sustainability in higher education sector (Han and Liu, 2009; and Grand Valley State University, 2008).

Project: Séminaire de vulgarisation de la convention Internationale de la Lutte contre le Dopage dans le sport en vue de la sensibilisation des jeunes sportifs sur les méfaits du dopage.
Description:
D’après plusieurs observations in situ, les jeunes sportifs congolais ne font pas de différence entre les produits dopants et les autres substances médicamenteuses. Beaucoup se livrent au dopage dès le jeune âge sans le savoir ni même être conscient des dangers encourus pour leur santé. Dans plusieurs fédérations est ignorée la liste des produits interdits figurant à l’Annexe I de la convention et renouvelée chaque année.  
  
 Le présent projet vise à faire connaitre davantage auprès des jeunes sportifs et leurs encadreurs, la Convention internationale de lutte contre le dopage dans le sport ainsi que ses instruments notamment son Annexe I, les sensibiliser et les mettre en garde contre les méfaits du dopage, afin de prévenir le dopage en milieu sportif jeune. Car beaucoup de sportifs ne sont pas conscients des répercutions des produits dopants dans l’organise, et leurs connaissances des procédures de contrôle repose beaucoup sur des rumeurs ou le récit d’expériences de professionnels plus anciens.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particularly in Africa, developing countries, LDCs, and SIDS

Project: Collecte des données pour documenter et publier le patrimoine culturel et naturel  du Burundi
Description: Dans le domaine de l’enseignement de la culture du Burundi, il se pose un problème sérieux lié au manque de documents scientifiques de référence, riches et temporairement et spatialement représentatif. A travers ce projet, des données sur des thématiques clés et variées de la culture burundaise seront collectés à travers toutes les régions culturelles. Elles seront ensuite étudiées et analysées scientifiquement pour en extraire des articles et un document de référence guide dans lequel l’on puisera des données pour les enseignements scolaires et universitaire ainsi que pour la recherche. Il servira aussi de guide en matière de politique culturelle au Burundi.

Project: Lutte contre les grossesses non désirées en milieu scolaire burundais

Constatant  que les  grossesses précoces et non désirées  constituent un facteur limitant des effectifs des jeunes filles pour poursuivre leurs études, la Commission Nationale du Burundi pour l’UNESCO souhaite organiser un atelier à l’endroit des jeunes/adolescents  scolarisés et d’autres personnalités ayant un rôle dans l’éducation de ces dernières  pour réduire ce phénomène. Cela permettrait de  garantir l’éducation des garçons et des filles aux mêmes pieds d’égalité  en matière d’autonomisation tels que prôné par l’UNESCO

Project: Atelier sur la réorientation du programme national de l’enseignement primaire vers le développement durable
Description:
Alors qu’en 2030 tous les Etats du monde seront appelés à faire l’évaluation de la mise en œuvre des ODD, dans notre pays, seul le programme National de l’école maternelle prend en compte les aspects de ces derniers.

Il est urgent que les programmes d’enseignement scolaire soient réorientés vers le Développement Durable en commençant par l’école primaire avant que les autres niveaux scolaires ne soient également pris en compte, sachant que pour créer un monde plus viable et pour faire face aux enjeux de Développement Durable, chaque individu doit devenir acteur d’un changement axé sur la durabilité. C’est à cette tâche que va s’atteler le présent projet.

Project: REINSERTION SOCIO-PROFESSIONNELLE DES ENFANTS DESCOLARISES ET/OU NON SCOLARISES ŒUVRANT DANS LES MINES DE DIAMANT : CAS DE TSHIKAPA DANS LA PROVINCE DU KASAÏ EN REPUBLIQUE DEMOCRATIQUE DU CONGO
Description:
Ces dernières décennies, l’humanité entière est confrontée à des défis nouveaux parmi lesquels figure le travail des enfants mineurs.
Le présent Projet vise à la réinsertion socio-professionnelle des enfants déscolarisés et/ou non scolarisés œuvrant dans les mines de diamant à Tshikapa dans la province du Kasaï en République Démocratique du Congo.
Face à cette situation il sera question d’assurer leur  formation par des petits métiers tels que : la cordonnerie, menuiserie, maçonnerie et petit élevage.

Project: Sensitizing Participation of Girls from Less Privileged Areas of Tanzania in Science Technology Engineering and Mathematics (STEM) Education (in Specific the Mafia Island and around the Marine Park)
Description:
The project aims at conducting sensitization workshops in Mafia Island in Tanzania to attract young girls to opt for science subjects in order to increase girls’ participation in STEM education. The sensitization workshops will not only target girls but also parents, teachers, education administrators at local levels and the community at large.  

The workshop will provide opportunity for the participants to learn from others experiences especially those who have excelled in science world. The workshop will also discuss different barrier that can hinder participation of women and girls in STEM and the group will brainstorm and possible solution. The workshop will also demonstrate how STEM will promote Blue economy and ocean protection in the Island as we all know were in the decade of ocean science.

It is expected that the workshops will lead to positive attitudes among members of the community on the rights of girls including the right of girls to opt for science education

Project: PROMOTION OF DOCUMENTATION, CULTIVATION AND PROCESSING OF VALUE-ADDED TRADITIONAL MEDICINE AND FOOD SUPPLEMENTS
Description: This project proposal aims to explore and document requirements for the integration of traditional medicine into primary care settings, with the goal of enhancing patient-centred healthcare.  Traditional medicine is an important component of the health care system in Tanzania and in other developing countries. However, indigenous knowledge about herbal medicines of many Tanzanian cultures is scarcely investigated, documented for the present and future generation as well as not exploited for socio-economic development for the communities. The aim of the present study is to document traditional and herbal medicines and practices used by communities in the Lake Victoria Basin in Tanzania to treat and manage human diseases and ailments.

Project: Local-Led Climate Adaptation Initiative: Empowering Young People and Women through Solar Powered Water Supply and Sustainable Climate-Resilient Gardening in Muchila Chiefdom, Namwala, Southern Province, Zambia.
Description: The project is being undertaken to address the issue of water access and promote women and youth empowerment in Muchila chiefdom, which has been severely affected by droughts as a result of climate change. The project intends to install solar-powered boreholes and promote climate-smart agriculture through community gardens to address water scarcity, food insecurity, and the impact of climate change. Additionally, it aims to empower women and youth through training and engagement, equipping them with skills for resilient farming practices, fostering economic independence and environmental stewardship. The project's innovative approach not only secures water resources but also cultivates climate-resilient leaders.

Project: APPUI AUX ELEVES ET ENSEIGNANTS DU LYCÉE-COLLEGE 28 SEPTEMBRE D’ALMAMYA VICTIME DE L’INCENDIE DU DÉPÔT D’HYDROCARBURES DE KALOUM- CONAKRY
Description:
Deux mois après, l’incendie du dépôt pétrolier continue d’affecter les habitants, notamment dans l’éducation, avec plusieurs établissements scolaires endommagés par les incendies. Le complexe scolaire public 28 septembre d’Almamya, a été la victime principale de l’incendie du dépôt d’hydrocarbure. 1 200 élèves, dont 523 filles sont impactées par cet incendie.


Le pays a sollicité ses partenaires multilatéraux, l’UNICEF et l’UNESCO, ainsi que le FMI (Fonds monétaire international) afin qu’une assistance en nature des matériels et fournitures pédagogiques lui soit apportée pour cette crise, conformément aux Résolutions 39 C/61 et 42 C/47, pour assurer la pérennité de l'éducation

Project: Training Program in Environmental Education and Ecological Fair in Allusion to World Environment Day "Solutions to plastic pollution"
Description:
The world is grappling with the issue of protecting and preserving the environment. Climate change is a glaring example, as there are even hotter summers, even colder winters, unusual floods, and many other effects. 

The commemorative dates established in the month of June by the United Nations (UN), with the 5th as the "World Environment Day" and the 8th as the "International Oceans Day", raise the world's awareness of the preservation of the environment, through policy measures and the change of society's attitude to ensure sustainable development.
In addition, the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) has been calling on Member States and in particular Ministries of Education to include content related to climate change, with a view to educating students for behavioural changes in their relationship with the environment.


In view of the above, the National Commission of Angola for UNESCO (CNU-Angola), in partnership with Coca-cola, Jimmi, Nação Verde and Refriango, decided to carry out environmental education actions for the schools of the Associated Schools Program, under the motto: "Protect the environment today so that tomorrow can be lived", which will culminate with an Ecological Fair also involving Higher Education Institutions and social partners,  with a view to exhibiting a set of projects related to the preservation of the environment.
