Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particularly in Africa, developing countries, LDCs, and SIDS

Project: AIC -Formation a l’hydrologie de 6 techniciens béninois en vue de la   réalisation de 3 projets d’accès a l’eau -groupe de travail « sciences et hydrologie »
Description: GRAIND-ONG- Formation et accompagnement à la mise en réseau des maintenanciers et artisans réparateurs dans les communes de Toffo, Allada, Zè, Kpomassè, Tori Bossito et So-Ava. Il s’agit d’un projet de formation et d’accompagnement des artisans réparateurs des adductions d’eau potable qui a pour but d’améliorer la qualité du service fourni aux populations. L’objectif général est de renforcer leurs capacités et de les accompagner dans leur mise en réseau. ;
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particularly in Africa, developing countries, LDCs, and SIDS

Project: IASA 55th Annual conference - “Interdisciplinary Connections"
Description:
The International Association of Sound and Audiovisual Archives (IASA) and L’Institut Valencià de Cultura will co-host the 55th annual Conference in Valencia, Spain. The goal of the conference is to spotlight instances of cross-disciplinary interactions and collaborations, fostering a culture of creativity, innovation, and partnership, especially during times of crises.
With UNESCO support we will make possible the participation of delegates from least developed countries, countries facing conflicts or dealing with post-disasters. This support will be used in its entirety to support as many travel grants as possible for delegates from least developed countries who wish to participate in the conference.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particularly in Africa, developing countries, LDCs, and SIDS

Project: IEA-Transforming LaNa Assessment results into relevant policy writing to improve policy interventions to facilitate policy interventions
Description: In 2023, six countries participated in LaNA, the IEA’s Literacy and Numeracy Assessment. Targeted to students at the end of primary school in LMICs, LaNA will deliver data including an indication of the percentage of students achieving minimum proficiency levels in reading and mathematics as means to monitor progress towards SDG 4.1.1.b. Country teams of most participating LaNA countries only have limited experiences in using data from international large-scale assessments for national policymaking; responding to this need, this proposal details further support in transforming assessment results into relevant policy writing in order to facilitate policy interventions in their countries.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particularly in Africa, developing countries, LDCs, and SIDS

Project: Underwater Forests
Description:
L'UNESCO (sous !'impulsion de la COi et de CPE) travaillent depuis plusieurs annees avec la fondation 1 Ocean (sous l'egide du CNRS), pilotee par le photographe - plongeur Alexis Rosenfeld, en vue de constituer une banque d'images et de videos susceptibles d'illustrer et de nourrir le discours scientifique de !'UNESCO sur l'Ocean:
•	Prevention des Tsunamis en Mediterranee
•	Protection de la biodiversite (Les Gorgones rouges)
•	Documentaire sur les grandes migrations marines
Ces images, de tres haute qualite, le plus souvent inedites, resonnent tres fortement avec plusieurs programmes de !'UNESCO (Education a !'Ocean, Programme des Biospheres, Patrimoine mondial Marin, COi). Elles ont deja permis d'assurer une belle visibilite de l'UNESCO, et une meilleure reconnaissance des actions de l'UNESCO dans le domaine oceanique, dans la presse et aupres du grand public. Elles peuvent renforcer la communication et la mise en valeur de nos activites en vue de la grande Conference de Nice en 2025.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.CPE1 - UNESCO's image enhanced and role recognized as a key solution provider for the 2030 Agenda in the Organization's areas of competence

Project: Design of Flagship Program on Education for Peace
Description:
At its 220 session, the Director-general has proposed to the Executive Board of UNESCO to launch a new flagship program on Education for Peace that will seek to safeguard and valorise UNESCO’s longstanding efforts to build the defences of peace through education by providing a set of global standards to support countries in implementing education for peace, while upholding the institutions, norms and standards that secure human rights and the dignity of all women and men.

The implementation of the program will be supported by a reinforced central team at UNESCO Headquarters and a network of regional and national/country-based officers.

In the current geopolitical context, it appears that the Middle East region will be a priority in the implementation of this program, requiring specific and dedicated approaches given the several challenges that the region faces.
To further elaborate on the initial proposal and provide member States with a detailed implementation plan for this new flagship program in the Middle East region, the senior consultant will:

1.	Provide a mapping of all existing tools, resources and partners on Education for Peace and identify specific needs relevant to the targets of the new flagship program in the region;
2.	Provide a 2-year draft implementation plan of the Program, including organizational structure at Headquarters, at intersectoral level, and regional and national level;
3.	Contribute to the preparation of documents that will be submitted to the 220th session of the Executive Board on the Flagship Program
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 11 - Accountable, efficient and effective management in pursuit of the Organization's results
Output EN: 11.CAB1 - Rational and cost-effective functioning of the Directorate and Executive Office improved and UNESCO’s strategic positioning and leadership role as an active and efficient partner within the United Nations system in achieving the Sustainable Development Goals strengthened

Project: Une mission de conseil en communication
Description: La mission consiste a renforcer la communication sur la mise en ceuvre des priorites strategiques de l'UNESCO et en particulier a former les porte-paroles de l'UNESCO a la communication de crise, dans le cadre du renforcement du role de !'Organisation en reponse aux situations de conflits et desastres naturels.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.CPE1 - UNESCO's image enhanced and role recognized as a key solution provider for the 2030 Agenda in the Organization's areas of competence

Project: UNESCO International Conference on Women and Girls in Afghanistan
Description: Transversal budget code "UNESCO International Conference on Women and Girls in Afghanistan" to support the organization of the UNESCO's Conference on Women and Girls in Afghanistan. The conference aims to ensure meaningful participation of Afghan women and girls, focusing on their access to, retention in, and completion of education.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PAX6 - Cooperation with the United Nations system in the context of the UN Development System Reform is better articulated and strengthened at the global, regional and country level

Project: Ocean Decade Capacity Development Facility
Description: The proposed project is for an Ocean Decade Capacity Development Facility that will build on the unique strengths and expertise of IOC-UNESCO in terms of capacity development and provide a flexible and evolutive means of supporting the capacity development needs of individuals and institutions involved in the Ocean Decade. This will include support to actors wishing to engage in co-design of future Decade Actions, as well as support to proponents of existing Decade Actions who require support on targeted capacity development initiatives.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health and accelerate the transition towards sustainable management of ocean-related risks and opportunities

Project: Preservation of Koguryo Tombs and Mural Paintings in the Democratic Pe
Description: Following the success of Phases I to III of the FiT project to preserve Koguryo-era tombs in the Democratic People' s Republic of Korea, this fourth phase will focus on scientific research and documentation on the tombs' mural paintings and emergency on-site conservation activities, along with training to further reinforce national capacities in the field of conservation. Coordinated by the World Heritage Centre, in close co-operation with the UNESCO Beijing Office and the Permanent Delegation of the DPRK, the project involves international experts from different fields and focuses on two tombs located within the World Heritage property, the Jinpa-ri Tombs I and IV.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: SAFEGUARDING OF BAYON TEMPLE OF ANGKOR THOM, PHASE VI
Description: This project was designed to assist the Royal Government of Cambodia and more in particular the APSARA National Authority, to enhance management and operational capacities and to benefit from international exchange to conserve and restore one of the most important monuments of the site of Angkor- "The Bayon Temple".
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: DTO-BioFlow: Integration of biodiversity monitoring data into the Digital Twin Ocean
Description: DTO-BioFlow will transform access to data on ocean biodiversity and the human activities that impact them, enabling the sustainable integration of these data flows into the EU Digital Twin Ocean, enriching digital tools and services thus unlocking the societal value of these data within the biological component of the DTO, i.e., the digital replica of marine ecological processes.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health and accelerate the transition towards sustainable management of ocean-related risks and opportunities

Project: Enhancing the Human Capacities of the Secretariat for the World Heritage Convention (2022-2023)
Description: The sub-account to be used exclusively for enhancing the human capacities of the Secretariat of the 1972 Convention was established in 2013 by the General Assembly of States Parties to the World Heritage Convention (Resolution 19.GA 8). It is funded only by voluntary contributions; it aims at enhancing UNESCO's delivery capacity and addressing the human resource needs of the Secretariat of the Convention Concerning the Protection of the World Cultural and Natural Heritage.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: Education and World Heritage (2022-2023)
Description:
Awareness-raising and capacity building activities, in the framework of the World Heritage Education Programme, shall be implemented to facilitate the greater involvement of young people, including women and indigenous communities to contribute to World Heritage protection, preservation and promotion.
The activities shall contribute to UN decades as well as to the implementation of the 2030 Agenda and main Strategies and Programs. Actions shall be conducted in a manner that is cost-effective and based on cooperation with civil society, youth and NGOs and in close collaboration and/or coordination with States Parties, Culture Ministries, National Commissions and UNESCO Field Offices.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: Securing the right to education for crisis-affected girls and boys in Lebanon
Description: The project will support the implementation of the General Education 5 Year Plan for Lebanon. It will be achieved through the following components: a) Crisis-affected girls and boys in formal and non-formal education are provided with flexible access, and relevant, gender-responsive blended learning; b) Supporting quality of teaching and learning languages; c) Modelling scenarios undertaken to outline the scale of demand in shaping future investments within and beyond the MYRP and within the Lebanese government for medium-term planning of formal and non-formal education.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED6 - Resilience, quality and equity of education systems strengthened to flexibly respond to evolving learning environments and to better deliver on SDG4 commitments

Project: Estudio comparado sobre aspectos seleccionados de las políticas de introducción de las tecnologías de la información y comunicación en la educación con el objetivo de ofrecer insumos para la consolidación y desarrollo continuo de la Política Pública de TIC
Description: The proposed activity aims at providing technical assistance to the Government of the City of Buenos Aires. The project includes the development of a comparative study on the teaching of programming from primary school until the completion of secondary school. It also foresees analyzing existing policies for introducing information and communication technologies in education with the aim of giving input to the consolidation and continuous development of the Public Policy of ICT for Education in the City of Buenos Aires, in line with the main international standards, particularly those approved by UNESCO and having the Sustainable Development Goals as a horizon, particularly the SDG4.
Outcome EN: Outcome 8 - Foster knowledge sharing and skills development in the digital age
Output EN: 8.ED8 - Technologies and digital innovations leveraged to ensure more inclusive, effective and relevant learning
Donor: United Nations Office for Project Services

Project: Ensuring inclusive equitable and transformative quality education opportunities for all
Description:
Despite enhanced focus of Gulf States on ESD and GCED and despite progress in these areas, there is the need to support Member States in their efforts to raise awareness amongst youth and learners on global citizenship, sustainable development and climate change as well as enhancing policy dialogues amongst Ministries of Education and other relevant sectors/ministries. 

The programme aims to support Member States in providing transformative education opportunities that:
-	 Equip learners with citizenship education related skills, knowledge of climate change and action; and 
-	Promote inclusion, building peace and combatting discrimination, hate speech and stereotypes.
Outcome EN: Outcome 7 - Promote inclusion and combat discrimination, hate speech and stereotypes
Output EN: 7.ED3 - Learners are empowered to lead healthy lives, promote sustainable development and engage with the world as creative and responsible global citizens

Project: SAFEGUARDING OF THE CULTURAL HERITAGE,PA THE ISLAMIC MONUMENTS OF THE CITY OF JERUSALEM
Description: This Special Account, established by the Executive Board in 1988 (130EX/Decision 5.4.1) aims at the Safeguarding of the cultural heritage, particularly the Islamic monuments, of the Old City of Jerusalem. The remaining funds are to be utilised within the framework of the UNESCO Action Plan for the safeguarding of the cultural heritage of the Old City of Jerusalem, when the local context's conditions permit.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: SDG 4-Education 2030 effectively coordinated through UNESCO's global leadership and mandate
Description: Building on the achievements and lessons learned during 40C5, Beirut Office will consolidate its office-wide efforts with HQ and FOs in the region to strengthen the leadership role in support of Member States' continued progress towards the Education 2030 progress. During the 41C5 biennium, UNESCO Beirut office will aspire to reflect the newly established Global Education Coordination Mechanism (GCM) in the Arab region that is expected to accelerate SDG 4 efforts toward the year 2030, supported by relevant evidence and policies. Thus, the C5 workplan will center around supporting this effort through continued capacity development, analysis, and policy and technical dialogue.
Outcome EN: Outcome 2 - Strengthen international coordination for the achievement of SDG 4 and develop the global education agenda based on research, foresight and innovation
Output EN: 2.ED7 - Education policy and finance decisions to achieve SDG 4 are informed by improved coordination, data and monitoring, knowledge and innovative partnerships

Project: Education policy and finance decisions to achieve SDG 4 are informed by improved coordination, data and monitoring, knowledge and innovative partnerships in LAC
Description: UNESCO Santiago will continue to lead and coordinate the E2030 Agenda in LAC by implementing the regional roadmap 2022-2025 that will be agreed at the Third Ministerial Meeting (March 2022). Through the regional coordination and partnership mechanism, the work envisaged is anchored in two lines of action: policy and technical dialogue and regional and national monitoring. UNESCO Santiago oversees progress in achieving the SDG4 goals in Latin America and the Caribbean, including the launching of the first regional monitoring report. Based on this evidence, the proposal for the roadmap will be structured to deepen the political and technical dialogue at the regional level that supports decision-making on educational public policy to accelerate the fulfillment of SDG 4.
Outcome EN: Outcome 2 - Strengthen international coordination for the achievement of SDG 4 and develop the global education agenda based on research, foresight and innovation
Output EN: 2.ED7 - Education policy and finance decisions to achieve SDG 4 are informed by improved coordination, data and monitoring, knowledge and innovative partnerships

Project: Support to the implementation of global and other related priorities
Description: This workplan will support the contribution of World Heritage to UNESCO global priorities such as Africa, gender and youth (on an ad hoc basis, considering the amount available), as well as the implementation of other priorities in relation to Historical Urban Landscapes or architecture.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: Coordination and programme management
Description: Budget to support the Executive Office functions in providing strategic advice, quality control and management support to the ADG and overall coordination of the development, implementation and monitoring of the approved programme and budget of the Culture Sector, as well as the Sector's communication with other Sectors/Bureaux/Offices at UNESCO, with other agencies of the UN System and with external partners.
Output EN: CLT Programme-related, operating and staff costs

Project: ICC-Angkor/Sambor Prei Kuk
Description: As the follow-up of the decision of the First ICC-Angkor, held in Tokyo in 1993, the working procedures of the Committee were established. It was decided that the Committee would be co-chaired by France and Japan in collaboration with the APSARA Authority, UNESCO provides the Secretariat. The financial mechanism established on the initiative of Japan and France also foresaw that the cost of the ICC-Angkor meetings should be borne by these two countries and UNESCO. Respectively, since 2009, 2019 the APSARA and Sambor Prei Kuk National Authorities have also financially contributed to the ICC meetings. The Site of Sambor Prei Kuk, inscribed on the World Heritage List, was officially included in the mechanism of ICC-Angkor in 2019.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: Fostering universal access to information and knowledge including identification of documentary heritage for Memory of the World
Description: The region is home to a rich and diverse documentary heritage that reflects the cultures, histories, traditions and values which also registered under the UNESCO Memory of the World (MOW) Programme. Member states under Jakarta continues to face persistent challenges in terms of difficulties in securing and having sustained resources, timely and quality preservation action, and utilization of technology in the preservation, making it difficult to the realization of sustainable preservation of documentary heritage. Additionally, none of the Memory of the World Registers in Jakarta cluster countries can be considered as documentary heritage that contributes to gender equality.
Outcome EN: Outcome 8 - Foster knowledge sharing and skills development in the digital age
Output EN: 8.CI4 - Member States are enabled to foster universal access to information and knowledge, including through the Information for All Programme (IFAP), as well as through Open Solutions, and through the identification, preservation and accessibility of documentary heritage

Project: Tonle Sap Biosphere Reserve Project (component of FAO CAPFISH-Capture)
Description: Tonle Sap was designated as a UNESCO Biosphere Reserve in 1997. This project funded by FAO, is part of their EU-funded "Cambodia Programme for Sustainable and Inclusive Growth in the Fisheries Sector: Capture Component", which aims at ensuring a sustainable, climate-resilient and inclusive development of Cambodia's fisheries. The project facilitates establishment of a "High-level Coordination Committee for the Tonle Sap Biosphere Reserve (TSBR)" to protect biodiversity and strengthen livelihoods, developing and leading an effective "Community of Practice", to administer the three complementary functions of the TSBR i.e. conservation, development and logistic support.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.SC1 - Inclusive knowledge and capacities of Member States strengthened to advance and apply science for sustainable management of natural resources, ecosystem and biodiversity conservation and restoration, and disaster risk resilience
Donor: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations

Project: CapED Programme - Improving Quality through Teachers
Description: The CapED Programme is an extrabudgetary programme created in 2003. It is based on the understanding that education reforms will not be effective if countries lack the capacities to make them operational. With an overarching capacity development approach, CapED seeks to improve the quality of education and increase learning opportunities, especially for girls and women and disadvantaged population groups. Under "Improving Quality through Teachers", CapED supports countries develop and implement comprehensive teacher policies, strengthen teacher-training institutions and ensure that programmes for the professional development of teachers are reviewed from a gender-equality perspective.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED5 - Teachers trained and supported to improve learning outcomes and address the changes brought forth by the digital and AI transformation and the COVID-19 crisis

Project: UNESCO Sultan Qaboos Prize for Environmental Conservation
Description: The purpose of the UNESCO Sultan Qaboos Prize for Environmental Preservation is to afford recognition to outstanding contributions by individuals, groups of individuals, institutes or organizations who have contributed to environmental and natural resources research, environmental education and training, creation of environmental awareness through the preparation of environmental information materials and activities aimed at establishing and managing protected areas such as biosphere reserves and natural world heritage sites.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.SC1 - Inclusive knowledge and capacities of Member States strengthened to advance and apply science for sustainable management of natural resources, ecosystem and biodiversity conservation and restoration, and disaster risk resilience

Project: Support to Education Sector Analysis and Development of Education Development Strategic Plan 2021-2030 in Viet Nam - Agency Fees
Description: Agency fees for a project (Support to Education Sector Analysis and Development of Education Development Strategic Plan 2021-2030 in Viet Nam) which will assist the Ministry of Education and Training in conducting an education sector analysis and developing an education development strategic plan (EDSP) 2021-2030.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED6 - Resilience, quality and equity of education systems strengthened to flexibly respond to evolving learning environments and to better deliver on SDG4 commitments
Donor: World Bank/International Bank for Reconstruction and Development

Project: 41 C/5 OP4: Learners are equipped with relevant skills to meet individual, labour market and societal demands through literacy, TVET, STEM and higher education
Description: Learners are equipped with relevant skills to meet individual, labour market and societal demands through literacy, TVET, STEM and higher education
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED4 - Learners are equipped with relevant skills to meet individual, labour market and societal demands through literacy, TVET, STEM and higher education

Project: Preservation and safeguarding of the cultural heritage in Bukhara, Uzbekistan
Description: The project will contribute to the preservation and safeguarding of tangible and intangible cultural heritage (ICH) of Bukhara. In particular, it aims at protecting the Outstanding Universal Value of the Historic Centre of Bukhara, World Heritage property through strengthening of the site management and conservation practices, and safeguarding the music heritage of the region through the promotion and transmission of the traditional music of Shashmaqom, which is inscribed on the UNESCO Representative list, to the next generation. Moreover, the project will contribute to the sustainability of the livelihoods of local communities of Bukhara.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: Appui aux partenaires sociaux dans l'accompagnement et le suivi de la mise en œuvre du PSE 2018-2030 VN 81251177
Description: Sur financement de backup-GIZ, UNESCO appuiera le Secrétariat technique permanent de la coordination du programme sectoriel éducation, dans le renforcement des capacités des partenaires sociaux en vue d'adopter une stratégie d'apaisement du climat social et de professionnalisation des enseignants. Il est prévu i) l'organisation d'un voyage d'étude au Rwanda - pays identifié pour ses bonnes pratiques; ii) la tenue d'ateliers de conception d'outils / documents cadres; iii) la production d'un guide méthodologique, iv) la mise en place d'une plateforme d'échange et, v) une communication tout au long du processus. Cet appui fait suite à la politique nationale enseignante appuyée par l'UNESCO.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED5 - Teachers trained and supported to improve learning outcomes and address the changes brought forth by the digital and AI transformation and the COVID-19 crisis

Project: Comité international de coordination pour la sauveguarde et le développement du site historique d'Angkor.
Description:
As the follow-up of the decision of the First ICC-Angkor, held in Tokyo in 1993, the working procedures of the Committee were established. It was decided that the Committee would be co-chaired by France and Japan in collaboration with the APSARA Authority, UNESCO provides the Secretariat. It was reconfirmed by the Angkor International Conference recently held in Cambodia on 5/12/2013 where the French and Japan co-Chairs have re-endorsed their co-chairmanship.
The financial mechanism established on the initiative of Japan and France also foresaw that the cost of the ICC-Angkor meetings should be borne by these two countries.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: Costing and Financing SDG4-Education 2030 in the Asia-Pacific Region
Description: Three years since the adoption and implementation of Education 2030 agenda, the lack of adequate financing remains one of the biggest obstacles in realizing SDG4 targets. In addition, there is little effort made to systematically review and analyse the resources required and financial gap to achieve these goals at the regional and national levels. Hence, this Project aims to examine closely the costing and financing aspect of achieving SDG4 targets, specifically Target 4.1 (primary and secondary), Target 4.2 (pre-primary) and Target 4.5 (Gender equality and Inclusion).
Outcome EN: Outcome 2 - Strengthen international coordination for the achievement of SDG 4 and develop the global education agenda based on research, foresight and innovation
Output EN: 2.ED7 - Education policy and finance decisions to achieve SDG 4 are informed by improved coordination, data and monitoring, knowledge and innovative partnerships

Project: International Coordinating Committee for the Safeguarding and Development of the Historic Site of Angkor (ICC-Angkor)
Description:
As the follow-up of the decision of the First ICC-Angkor, held in Tokyo in 1993, the working procedures of the Committee were established. It was decided that the Committee would be co-chaired by France and Japan in collaboration with the APSARA Authority, UNESCO provides the Secretariat. It was reconfirmed by the Angkor International Conference recently held in Cambodia on 5/12/2013 where the French and Japan co-Chairs have re-endorsed their co-chairmanship.
The financial mechanism established on the initiative of Japan and France also foresaw that the cost of the ICC-Angkor meetings should be borne by these two countries.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: Overall coordination and management of the partnership on the Arabic Language
Description: With the aim to enhance multilinguism, and address the many-faceted relations between Arabic and the system of knowledge acquisition, a set of activities will be implemented within the Framework of this partnership. This work plan intends to ensure coordination and reinforce intersectoral cooperation to enhance delivery and impact of the Organization's work. It will also enhance communication for dissemination and outreach of the results achieved. Adequate support to evaluation and reporting will also be provided, in line with the Organization's reporting Framework..
Outcome EN: Outcome 7 - Promote inclusion and combat discrimination, hate speech and stereotypes
Output EN: 7.SHS2 - Member States capacities strengthened in applying social and human scientific frontier knowledge to devise effective policy solutions to advance an inclusive development agenda with the aim to improve the well-being of people, particularly the most vulnerable, addressing the legacies of the pandemic crisis and face the social impact of climate change

Project: Cambodia GPE-III Implementation Agency Fees
Description: Support cost for the Cambodia GPE-III implementation.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED5 - Teachers trained and supported to improve learning outcomes and address the changes brought forth by the digital and AI transformation and the COVID-19 crisis
Donor: World Bank/International Bank for Reconstruction and Development

Project: JPO for Strategic Transformation
Description: Under the oversight of the International Coordinator of the Biennale of Luanda the JPO will support the team in building partnerships and moblising resources.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 11 - Accountable, efficient and effective management in pursuit of the Organization's results
Output EN: 11.CAB1 - Rational and cost-effective functioning of the Directorate and Executive Office improved and UNESCO’s strategic positioning and leadership role as an active and efficient partner within the United Nations system in achieving the Sustainable Development Goals strengthened

Project: Annual SDG 4-Education 2030 agenda workplan (2018-2019-AE), agency execution, with the Ministry of Education - National Museum Rio de Janeiro
Description: A fired occurred on 2 September 2018 destroyed one of the most important scientific and anthropological institutions in Latin America, the National Museum at Rio de Janeiro, constituting the greatest tragedy for Brazilian culture and education in recent times. After the fire, an UNESCO Emergency Mission was mobilized to act at the National Museum, in coordination with national and local authorities and technical teams. The Mission contributed to plan the first rescue and emergency actions and a final report proposed an action plan for the reconstruction of the National Museum.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED6 - Resilience, quality and equity of education systems strengthened to flexibly respond to evolving learning environments and to better deliver on SDG4 commitments

Project: Expansion and update of the processes of formulation, implementation and evaluation of public policies of Science, Technology, Innovation and Communications in Brazil
Description: The project provides structural mechanisms to the Brazilian Ministry of Science, Technology, Innovation and Communications (MCTIC) to reinforce and implement the Brazilian National Strategy for Science, Technology and Innovation (Estratégia Nacional de Ciência, Tecnologia e Inovação - ENCTI, 2016-2019). The project is also an important enabler for the fullfilment of SDG 9 in Brazil, particularly its target "b" ('Support domestic technology development, research and innovation in developing countries, including by ensuring a conducive policy environment for, inter alia, industrial diversification and value addition to commodities").
Outcome EN: Outcome 4 - Advance international cooperation in science, technology and innovation
Output EN: 4.SC4 - Member States capacities strengthened to improve STI policies, access to scientific and technological advancements and enhance knowledge sharing, including through Open Science

Project: Public Policies for Telecommunications and Radio Broadcasting in Brazil
Description: The Ministry of Communications in Brazil main attribution is to plan and define the country's public communications policies, including broadcasting, Telecommunications, Portal Services and the federal government's communication policy. The constant technological evolution challenges the State to keep its regulatory framework up to date. In Cooperation with UNESCO the project will focus on strenthening institutional capacity observing international standards and trends in order to promote inclusive communication policies and information for all.
Outcome EN: Outcome 8 - Foster knowledge sharing and skills development in the digital age
Output EN: 8.CI4 - Member States are enabled to foster universal access to information and knowledge, including through the Information for All Programme (IFAP), as well as through Open Solutions, and through the identification, preservation and accessibility of documentary heritage

Project: Ocean Research
Description: Fostering Ocean Research to combat climate change and other ocean stressors is crucial to achieving SDG 14, maintaining ocean services . Main actions under this activity will include the support the implementation and coordination of Ocean Decade programmes addressing multiple ocean stressors, in particular the Global Ocean Oxygen Decade (GOOD) and the Ocean Acidification Research for Sustainability (OARS) and Blue Carbon.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health and accelerate the transition towards sustainable management of ocean-related risks and opportunities

Project: Learning with intangible cultural heritage for a sustainable future in Latin America and the Caribbean
Description: Under the overall coordination of the UNESCO Regional Bureau for Education in Santiago and funded by the generous support of the Netherlands to the ICH Fund, this project focuses on implementing, and evaluating pilot projects in Ecuador, Guatemala, Peru and Chile to demonstrate how living heritage can effectively be integrated in education programs. The project will facilitate the integration of ICH in formal and non-formal education and policy dialogue, thereby contributing to Target 4.7. It will also strengthen teachers and educators' capacities in this new area and promote the sharing of information and lessons learned among policymakers and practitioners at the regional level.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT4 - Member States and communities capacities strengthened to identify, safeguard and promote living heritage

Project: Resource mobilization pilot projects
Description:
Decisions taken in document 211 EX/5.II.A "Strengthening UNESCO's engagement with the private sector" foresaw a number of targeted pilots relating to private sector fundraising, in particular:
1) Launch of individual giving fundraising campaigns, seen as the most promising channel in terms of volume, predictability, regularity and ability to produce unearmarked funds.
2) Optimize tax exemption opportunities worldwide through third parties' partners at country level.
3) Reinforce UNESCO's brand as a fundraising tool including through licensing partners and elaborate clear guidelines for its commercial use.
The present project aims to implement and evaluate those pilots.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.FLD4 - UNESCO Field Offices empowered to strengthen resource mobilization at decentralized level

Project: 355GLO5004.1 - Output 1: Capacities of Member States reinforced and advocacy conducted to develop and integrate evidence-based, human-rights centered recommendations on media and internet policy into national development priorities.
Description:
This concerns earmarked projects supported by the IPDC through the 2021 earmarked project series, Output 1, to carry out assessments on media development, journalists safety, internet universality using internationally recognized sets of indicators developed by UNESCO. Such assessments provide a reliable resource for policy makers in guiding media- and internet-related policies with reference to international standards. The IPDC is no longer the implementing unit for these activities. 

Implementing units: MID, FEJ, DIT.
Outcome EN: Outcome 6 - Promote freedom of expression and the right to information
Output EN: 6.CI3 - Member States and media institutions enabled to strengthen media development and media pluralism, including through the International Programme for the Development of Communication (IPDC)

Project: Coordination and monitoring of intersectoral extrabudgetary initiatives for Priority Africa
Description: This activity involves the coordination with Programme Sectors, Field Offices, specialized institutes and other stakeholders in Africa, including with donor partners, for the monitoring of and consolidated reporting on intersectoral extrabudgetary activities benefitting Africa.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PAX3 - Impact and visibility of UNESCO's programmes in Africa strengthened through enhanced coordination, monitoring and mobilization of partners in relation to the Operational Strategy for Priority Africa (2022-2029), and better understanding of Africa's development opportunities and challenges

Project: 41 C/5 OP8: Technologies and digital innovations leveraged to ensure more inclusive, effective and relevant learning
Description: UNESCO will strengthen its observatory function by supporting research on frontier technologies and their implications for education, and share foresight on digital innovation and the futures of learning. Additonally, UNESCO will develop a framework to guide the planning and building of technology-enabled inclusive and resilient school systems. Efforts will be made to support and expand the reach of repositories of digital public goods for education by curating open digital learning platforms, digital tools, and openly licensed content with a view to promoting equity and inclusion and bridging the digital divide.
Outcome EN: Outcome 8 - Foster knowledge sharing and skills development in the digital age
Output EN: 8.ED8 - Technologies and digital innovations leveraged to ensure more inclusive, effective and relevant learning

Project: New Regional Convention for the Recognition of Studies, Titles and Diplomas of Higher Education in Latin America and the Caribbean
Description: IESALC undertakes advocacy work toward the ratification of the New Regional Convention for the Recognition of Studies, Titles and Diplomas of Higher Education in Latin America and the Caribbean (Buenos Aires, 2019).
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED4 - Learners are equipped with relevant skills to meet individual, labour market and societal demands through literacy, TVET, STEM and higher education

Project: OceanTeacher Global Academy Alumni System
Description: The aim of the OceanTeacher Global Academy Alumni System project is to build an interaction between the OTGA administration and the learners through an Alumni System which will be able to manage alumni data of OceanTeacher Global Academy past and present learners. The system will also provide a single registration for learners who currently need to register on two disparate systems (OceanTeacher Moodle LMS and OceanExpert) when enrolling for OTGA courses. The system will also improve the OTGA and overall IOC CD reporting requirements for UNESCO as well as individual Member States.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health and accelerate the transition towards sustainable management of ocean-related risks and opportunities

Project: Costing and Financing SDG4-Education 2030 in the Asia-Pacific Region
Description: Three years since the adoption and implementation of Education 2030 agenda, the lack of adequate financing remains one of the biggest obstacles in realizing SDG4 targets. In addition, there is little effort made to systematically review and analyse the resources required and financial gap to achieve these goals at the regional and national levels. Hence, this Project aims to examine closely the costing and financing aspect of achieving SDG4 targets, specifically Target 4.1 (primary and secondary), Target 4.2 (pre-primary) and Target 4.5 (Gender equality and Inclusion).
Outcome EN: Outcome 2 - Strengthen international coordination for the achievement of SDG 4 and develop the global education agenda based on research, foresight and innovation
Output EN: 2.ED7 - Education policy and finance decisions to achieve SDG 4 are informed by improved coordination, data and monitoring, knowledge and innovative partnerships

Project: CapED Programme - Fostering Skills for Life and Work: Literacy skills for girls' and women's empowerment
Description: The CapED Programme is an extrabudgetary programme created in 2003. It is based on the understanding that education reforms will not be effective if countries lack the capacities to make them operational. With an overarching capacity development approach, CapED seeks to improve the quality of education and increase learning opportunities, especially for girls and women and disadvantaged population groups. Under "Literacy skills for girls' and women's empowerment", CapED assists countries craft non-formal education policies and develop, implement and scale up good quality, relevant and innovative adult education programmes targeting girls and women.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED4 - Learners are equipped with relevant skills to meet individual, labour market and societal demands through literacy, TVET, STEM and higher education

Project: Meeting of the Scientific Council and Steering Committee of the UNESCO Regional Bureau for Science and Culture in Europe
Description: The Regional Bureau for Science and Culture in Europe (Venice) is unique in that it has two governing bodies to help monitor and plan the use of the voluntary annual contribution received from the Italian Government, as set out in Italian Law n.163 (1997). The Scientific Council provides advice on the design and implementation of the programme, while the Steering Committee provides oversight on both the programme and the budget. Both bodies should meet regularly once per year with additional meetings ad-hoc as needed to ensure the smooth functioning of the Office in Venice.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 11 - Accountable, efficient and effective management in pursuit of the Organization's results
Output EN: 11.FLD3 - Enhanced administrative and operational support by addressing existing and emerging needs

Project: XB Established staff costs
Description: To cover the salaries of relevant staff.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 11 - Accountable, efficient and effective management in pursuit of the Organization's results
Output EN: 11.FLD3 - Enhanced administrative and operational support by addressing existing and emerging needs

Project: Output 1 - Capacities of MS reinforced & advocacy conducted to develop and integrate evidence-based, human-rights centred recommendations on media/ internet policy into national development priorities
Description: Producing and using internationally recognized sets of indicators, IPDC conducts assessments of national media landscapes, identifying their strengths and weaknesses, and proposing evidence-based recommendations on how to strengthen media pluralism and independence. The assessments are nationally-driven, inclusive, participatory, and based on a gender-sensitive approach. Such assessments enable a more effective targeting of media development efforts based on objectively identified priorities and the needs expressed by national stakeholders. They also provide a reliable resource for policy makers in guiding media-related reform with reference to international standards.
Outcome EN: Outcome 6 - Promote freedom of expression and the right to information
Output EN: 6.CI3 - Member States and media institutions enabled to strengthen media development and media pluralism, including through the International Programme for the Development of Communication (IPDC)

Project: Culture and Urban Development Initiative
Description:
The Special Account aims to finance the "Culture and Urban Development" initiative, which encompasses the activities related to the culture's contribution to sustainable urban development, in line with the Post-2015 Development Agenda, and in view of the Habitat-III Conference (October 2016,Quito, Ecuador). 
The initiative will notably allow to launch the elaboration of a first UNESCO Global Report on Culture and Sustainable Urban Development, which will consolidate strategic analyses and recommendations based on data collected from partner institutions from all regions and the implementation of the UNESCO Culture Conventions on cultural heritage and the cultural and creative industries.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT6 - Member States capacities strengthened to promote, monitor and measure the contribution of culture to the implementation of the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development at the local, national and regional levels

Project: Communication
Description: Renforcement des activités de communication du secteur de la culture
Output EN: CLT Programme-related, operating and staff costs

Project: Secondment of a Programme Specialist from ROK to the World Heritage Centre
Description: Under the overall authority of the Director of the Division for Heritage and the UNESCO World Heritage Centre (WHC) and the direct supervision of the Chief of Asia and the Pacific Unit, the incumbent shall assist in the implementation of the 1972 World Heritage Convention and assist in the monitoring of state of conservation of World Heritage properties in a cluster of 8 States Parties in the Pacific and the Republic of Korea.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: #CoronavirusFacts: Addressing the infodemic by empowering journalists and citizens
Description:
As part of the Covid-19 response,this project will bring WHO and UNESCO's strengths into a multi-layered approach aiming to achieve two overall objectives:
•	Journalists trained over six months through regular interactive briefings with experts and mentors 
•	Citizens have access to accurate and understandable information on #CoronavirusFacts. The project also aims to enhance radio producers' capacity to ensure continuity of their work in case of confinement or financial difficulties, thus ensuring misinformation will continue to be countered by information.
Outcome EN: Outcome 6 - Promote freedom of expression and the right to information
Output EN: 6.CI3 - Member States and media institutions enabled to strengthen media development and media pluralism, including through the International Programme for the Development of Communication (IPDC)

Project: JPO (France) for Education Planning (BEI)
Description: Under the general authority of the Director of the UNESCO Office in Beirut and the direct supervision of the Programme Specialist, the JPO will be responsible for contributing to the coordination of UNESCO's actions within the framework of technical support for the implementation of Lebanon Five-Year General Education Plan, and support the implementation of the Li Beirut initiative.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED1 - Education systems are equipped to promote inclusion, address marginalization and advance rights, including in crisis-affected and post-disaster contexts

Project: Partnerships and outreach for system resilience strengthening
Description: Areas of activities foreseen in this workplan include: (1) communication and knowledge dissemination, including publications; (2) resource mobilization and partnerships, e.g., project document development and advocacy materials and conduct fundraising; (3) development of international communities of practice (COP) for peer learning and joint programmes and knowledge sharing.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED6 - Resilience, quality and equity of education systems strengthened to flexibly respond to evolving learning environments and to better deliver on SDG4 commitments

Project: SAFEGUARDING OF THE CULTURAL HERITAGE, PARTICULARLY THE ISLAMIC MONUMENTS OF THE CITY OF JERUSALEM
Description: This Special Account, established by the Executive Board in 1988 (130EX/Decision 5.4.1) aims at the Safeguarding of the cultural heritage, particularly the Islamic monuments, of the Old City of Jerusalem. The remaining funds are to be utilised within the framework of the UNESCO Action Plan for the safeguarding of the cultural heritage of the Old City of Jerusalem, when the local context's conditions permit.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: Semaine Africaine - Editions 2019-2023
Description: La semaine africaine est célébrée tous les ans au Siège de l'UNESCO, pour coincider avec la journée mondiale de l'Afrique (25 mai), à l'initiative du Groupe africain et en coopération avec l'UNESCO/le Département Afrique. L'UNESCO apporte à la fois une contribution financière et sur le plan du contenu pour soutenir cet événement (tables-rondes, communication, visibilité, etc). La contribution financière couvre notamment les frais techniques, l'hospitalité, l'interprétation et la location des espaces utilisés.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PAX3 - Impact and visibility of UNESCO's programmes in Africa strengthened through enhanced coordination, monitoring and mobilization of partners in relation to the Operational Strategy for Priority Africa (2022-2029), and better understanding of Africa's development opportunities and challenges

Project: Implementation of the Future Teacher Kit Approach. Foundational and 21st century teaching skills for teachers in the Caribbean
Description: Many teachers in the Caribbean lack basic digital skills; therefore, improving their digital competencies is key to the teaching profession. This project aims to build capacities of teachers, and school leaders on digital skills and blended learning solutions, and establish a community of practice for the exchange and collaboration of teachers on a national, cross-regional and international level. Main activities include: i) training teacher trainers and master teachers to become facilitators and tutors; ii) training teachers on instruction in online environments and 21st century skills; iii) establishing a community of practice; and iv) organizing workshops for policy makers.
Outcome EN: Outcome 8 - Foster knowledge sharing and skills development in the digital age
Output EN: 8.ED8 - Technologies and digital innovations leveraged to ensure more inclusive, effective and relevant learning

Project: JPO (China) for the IOC Sub-Commission for the Western Pacific (IOC/WESTPAC)
Description: Under the overall authority of the Director of the UNESCO Regional Bureau for the Asia and Pacific, and the direct supervision of the Head of the IOC/WESTPAC Office, the JPO will provide technical and logistic support for international programme development and implementation for the sustainable development of ocean, marine and coastal resources; and promote the UN Decade of Ocean Science for Sustainable Development (2021-2030) in the region.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health and accelerate the transition towards sustainable management of ocean-related risks and opportunities

Project: International Coordinating Committee for the Safeguarding and Development of the Historic Site of Angkor (ICC-Angkor)
Description: As the follow-up of the decision of the First Intergovernmental Conference on the Safeguarding and Development of the Historic Site of Angkor, held in Tokyo in October 1993, and the first meeting of ICC-Angkor, held in Phnom Penh on 21 and 22 December 1993, the working procedures of the Committee were established. It was decided that the Committee would be co-chaired by the Governments of France and Japan. It foresaw those activities for the preservation and safeguarding of monuments and other cultural heritage as well as a balanced economic development of the region should be adopted in consultation with the Cambodian authorities.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: Supporting the conservation of the WH site of Um Er Rasas through the development of priority conservation interventions
Description: In the framework of the 1972 Convention, the activities proposed aim at supporting the State Party in addressing priority World Heritage Committee recommendations for Jordan's World Heritage properties through the development of urgent conservation interventions at Umm Er Rasas, a Roman, then Byzantine site listed for its outstanding mosaic heritage. This activity will also focus on strengthening the national capacities in the technical application of the World Heritage Convention.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: Technical assistance for the Ministry of Education's WebGIS School Maintenance System
Description: Building upon UNESCO's past WebGIS achievements and ongoing partnership with MoE and GIZ, UNESCO wil continue its technical support with the integration of the School Maintenance Workflow into the MoE's Educational Management Systems-EMIS (WebGIS & OpenEMIS). The integration of the school maintenance workflow will be done using a capacity development approach aimed at strengthening the education system, where the capture of electronic and automated data, workflows, monitoring and reporting, will facilitate the MoE's systematic, structured and evidence-based decision making related to preventative and corrective school maintenance.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED6 - Resilience, quality and equity of education systems strengthened to flexibly respond to evolving learning environments and to better deliver on SDG4 commitments

Project: Towards greater inclusion and diversity in education in Jordan
Description: The proposed collaboration between GIZ and UNESCO aims to provide technical assistance to the Jordanian Ministry of Education (MOE) in their efforts towards inclusion in line with the goals and priorities outlined in the National 10-Years Strategy for Inclusive Education. The proposed project is part of the GIZ PROMISE Programme which aims at improving equal access to and quality of primary and secondary public schools in Jordan. UNESCO will support the following two main components: System Strengthening and Capacity Development
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED1 - Education systems are equipped to promote inclusion, address marginalization and advance rights, including in crisis-affected and post-disaster contexts

Project: Estudio comparado sobre aspectos seleccionados de las políticas de introducción de las tecnologías de la información y comunicación en la educación con el objetivo de ofrecer insumos para la consolidación y desarrollo continuo de la Política Pública de TIC
Description: The proposed activity aims at providing technical assistance to the Government of the City of Buenos Aires. The project includes the development of a comparative study on the teaching of programming from primary school until the completion of secondary school. It also foresees analyzing existing policies for introducing information and communication technologies in education with the aim of giving input to the consolidation and continuous development of the Public Policy of ICT for Education in the City of Buenos Aires, in line with the main international standards, particularly those approved by UNESCO and having the Sustainable Development Goals as a horizon, particularly the SDG4.
Outcome EN: Outcome 8 - Foster knowledge sharing and skills development in the digital age
Output EN: 8.ED8 - Technologies and digital innovations leveraged to ensure more inclusive, effective and relevant learning
Donor: United Nations Office for Project Services

Project: "Palestine Riwaya Museum in Bethlehem (finalisation of Phase III: Completion the renovation of the Museum's space )"
Description:
The overall objective of the project is to establish a model Palestinian interactive and multimedia museum in Bethlehem, called Riwaya (narrative) Museum. It will be a venue for safeguarding and promoting Palestinian cultural diversity and fostering intercultural dialogue as it will serve as a tourist destination. This particular phase aims at completing the renovation of the museum space started in Phase III of the project.

Note: For detailed information about the scope and concerning the current project, please refer to the "Application for grants from the 
Norwegian Ministry of Foreign Affairs (MFA)" in the attachments section.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT2 - Member States capacities strengthened to fight the illicit trafficking of cultural property and promote its return and restitution, to protect underwater cultural heritage and to promote the role of museums for societies

Project: ECW MULTI-YEAR RESILIENCE PROGRAMME (MYRP) FOR THE STATE OF PALESTINE 2019-2021
Description: Owing to the chronic crisis state and protracted conflict, this ECW programme in Palestine aims to strengthen the resilience and development of affected children, families and communities in Gaza, East Jerusalem, Hebron and Area C. The programme seeks to achieve the following results: improved access and continuity of inclusive, equitable education and learning opportunities for girls and boys; improved relevance and quality of education in a protective and safe learning environment; and strengthened capacity of the education system to respond to emergency needs and deliver a coordinated response in crises as part of the overall education system.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED1 - Education systems are equipped to promote inclusion, address marginalization and advance rights, including in crisis-affected and post-disaster contexts

Project: "Palestine Riwaya Museum in Bethlehem (finalisation of Phase III: Completion the renovation of the Museum's space )"
Description:
The overall objective of the project is to establish a model Palestinian interactive and multimedia museum in Bethlehem, called Riwaya (narrative) Museum. It will be a venue for safeguarding and promoting Palestinian cultural diversity and fostering intercultural dialogue as it will serve as a tourist destination. This particular phase aims at completing the renovation of the museum space started in Phase III of the project.

Note: For detailed information about the scope and concerning the current project, please refer to the "Application for grants from the 
Norwegian Ministry of Foreign Affairs (MFA)" in the attachments section.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT2 - Member States capacities strengthened to fight the illicit trafficking of cultural property and promote its return and restitution, to protect underwater cultural heritage and to promote the role of museums for societies

Project: Advancing Gender equality education programmes in Mexico
Description: Mexico is a country that faces challenges in violence against women and girls, in response, the State Government has developed a programme for gender education. Unesco Mexico will support this project by contributing with ther revision and integration of gender equality in the curricula content for basic and middle education and monitoring of the implementation in the schools of the state of Mexico. We will raise awareness of the need for other states to engage in gender education programes.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED2 - Gender transformative education systems empower learners, ensure safe learning environments and address the educational barriers, particularly for girls and women, exacerbated by the learning crisis

Project: Empowering men and boys for gender equality in India
Description: This workstream builds on UNESCO's programming to engage men and boys in gender equality in India (2019-2021). Responding to the needs, priorities, and demand identified in this first phase of implementation, UNESCO's Social and Human Sciences sector (SHS) will build a follow-on/up programme, 'Transforming MEN-talities II' to strengthen a) knowledge on the behavioural, institutional, and structural factors which enable interventions to engage men and boys for gender equality to be successful; 2) the scale and reach of operational activities to engage men and boys for gender equality within educational and community settings; and 3) the networks available to encourage peer-learning, good practice sharing, and coordination around engaging men and boys for gender equality in India.
Outcome EN: Outcome 7 - Promote inclusion and combat discrimination, hate speech and stereotypes
Output EN: 7.SHS3 - Member States capacities are strengthened to scale up their policy, institutional and legislative actions towards gender equality, to eliminate gender-based violence and discrimination, gender biases and stereotypes, including in the digital world

Project: Improving access to quality and inclusive education with gender equality for out-of-school children in Iraq
Description: The project aims at providing access to quality and inclusive education with gender equality for 150,000 out-of-school children (OOSC) in Iraq focusing on six governorates with high numbers of OOSC. The main purpose of the project is to accelerate the achievement of universal access to primary education; by considerably lowering the number of OOSC and re-integrate them into the formal education system in Iraq. The three interrelated objectives of the project are highly relevant to improving access to quality education for OOSC in Iraq involving the key education stakeholders in a harmonized approach.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED1 - Education systems are equipped to promote inclusion, address marginalization and advance rights, including in crisis-affected and post-disaster contexts

Project: Securing the right to education for crisis-affected girls and boys in Lebanon
Description: The project will support the implementation of the General Education 5 Year Plan for Lebanon. It will be achieved through the following components: a) Crisis-affected girls and boys in formal and non-formal education are provided with flexible access, and relevant, gender-responsive blended learning; b) Supporting quality of teaching and learning languages; c) Modelling scenarios undertaken to outline the scale of demand in shaping future investments within and beyond the MYRP and within the Lebanese government for medium-term planning of formal and non-formal education.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED1 - Education systems are equipped to promote inclusion, address marginalization and advance rights, including in crisis-affected and post-disaster contexts

Project: UNESCO Documentation and Advisory Services (UDAS)
Description:
The project UNESCO Documentation and Advisory Services for WH sites in Lebanon aims at helping the Directorate General of Antiquities in the control of works in the World Heritage sites of Tyre and Baalbek as well as meeting the World Heritage requirements of consultation and monitoring of conservation measures to be implemented. This will be achieved through :

1.	Organization of four consultation workshops and events .
2.	Supplying technical assistance to the DGA for preparing various reports to be submitted to the WHC.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: PBF Project - Preventing Hate Speech and Promoting Peaceful Society Through MIL
Description: The project will counter hate speech and disinformation while promoting peaceful and credible elections in 2020 and beyond the election period, and strengthen critical technical aspects of the electoral process to safeguard diversity, inclusivity, and gender equality to reduce the risk of community grievances becoming a trigger for hate speech and tensions. The project will also support the setting up of a multi-stakeholder platform to bring a variety of key national stakeholders, such as media and social influencers together to set strategic directions and lead action on promoting diversity, inclusivity and non-discrimination in Myanmar.
Outcome EN: Outcome 8 - Foster knowledge sharing and skills development in the digital age
Output EN: 8.CI5 - Member States have strengthened institutional and human capacities to integrate media and information literacy (MIL) in policies and strategies, and to bridge the digital and knowledge divides, through the development of digital skills and competencies, particularly in the SIDS, and among women and girls and different marginalized and vulnerable groups

Project: UKRAINE Emergency Assistance - Supporting the needs of the Ministry of Education and Science of Ukraine in the context of the digital transformation of the education process which has been affected by the ongoing war in Ukraine
Description: Financial contribution for supporting the needs of the Ministry of Education and Science of Ukraine in the context of the digital transformation of the education process which has been affected by the ongoing war in Ukraine.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particularly in Africa, developing countries, LDCs, and SIDS

Project: Promoting gender equality and girls' education in the ethnic minorities areas of Viet Nam
Description: The project aims to improve access and retention of ethnic minority children, especially girls in lower secondary schools, and to improve the employment opportunities among ethnic minority women and girls in the three provinces of Ha Giang, Ninh Thuan and Soc Trang. The project will address the issues of: (i) out-of-school children and dropping out from schools, especially for ethnic minority girls, (ii) school-related gender-based violence and child sexual abuse in schools and communities, and (iii) limited employment opportunities for ethnic minority girls and women.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED2 - Gender transformative education systems empower learners, ensure safe learning environments and address the educational barriers, particularly for girls and women, exacerbated by the learning crisis

Project: Appui a l'Elaboration du cadre normatif du secteur de l'éducation au Benin VN 81244697
Description: Approfondir l'analyse du contexte éducatif actuel du Bénin en matière de normes (inventaire des textes et des normes) réalisée dans l'étude préalable en couvrant aussi bien l'éducation formelle que l'éducation non formelle. Sur cette base, définir des normes favorisant la cohésion inter et intra blocs au sein de la nouvelle architecture avec une attention particulière sur le fonctionnement intersectoriel afin d'asseoir le dispositif de la formation tout au long de la vie à travers la diversification des lieux et formes d'apprentissage. Enfin tenir compte de la nouvelle architecture holistique adoptée dans les actes du 2eme forum sur l'Education au Bénin et reprise dans PSE post 2015.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED6 - Resilience, quality and equity of education systems strengthened to flexibly respond to evolving learning environments and to better deliver on SDG4 commitments

Project: PROJET DE RENFORCEMENT DES CAPACITES TECHNOLOGIQUES DES ENSEIGNANTS DE L'ENSEIGNEMENT TECHNIQUE (PRECATE-ET)
Description: Le présent projet vise à renforcer les capacités technologiques des enseignants de l'Enseignement Technique dans le souci d'améliorer l'employabilité des apprenants qui terminent cette formation, ceci en lien avec les orientations de la Stratégie Nationale de l'EFTP. Il releve du Ministere des enseignements secondaire, technique et de la formation professionnelle du Benin. Il s'agit dun des 15 projets de l'Accord-cadre BENIN-UNESCO.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED4 - Learners are equipped with relevant skills to meet individual, labour market and societal demands through literacy, TVET, STEM and higher education

Project: REPUBLIC OF MOLDOVA Emergency Assistance - Creating an inclusive and non-discriminatory environment for Ukrainian refugees in Moldova
Description: The Emergency Assistance project "Creating an inclusive and non-discriminatory environment for Ukrainian refugees in Moldova" to be implemented by the National Commission in collaboration with GENDER-CENTRU (Gender-Centre), aiming to benefit the affected refugees, as well as the host population, including the most vulnerable and marginalized groups, by building the resilience of the target groups (school children, parents/grandparents of refugee children, and schoolteachers with refugee children) in conditions of war and crisis. The requested amount will be used for organizing educational activities, purchasing equipment, producing and distributing information materials related to these activities.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particularly in Africa, developing countries, LDCs, and SIDS

Project: Syrian Arab Republic: Emergency Assistance request to support educational establishments in several areas of Syria which have been affected by the severe earthquakes of 6 February 2023.
