Description: The Syrian National Commission for UNESCO has submitted an emergency assistance request to support educational establishments in several areas of Syria which have been affected by the severe earthquakes of 6 February 2023.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particularly in Africa, developing countries, LDCs, and SIDS

Project: Teacher quality for quality learning in Latin America and the Caribbean
Description: This workplan proposes to support LAC Member States in strengthening teacher quality as a way to address the overall need of improving students' learning outcomes in the region. The workplan is anchored in two main lines of action 1) Improving teacher education with focus on enhancing students' quality learning in foundational skills - literacy and numeracy; 2) improving teachers' professional status with focus on issues related to teachers' autonomy, agency, motivation and accountability in the context of teacher reforms proposing quality standards in the profession.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED5 - Teachers trained and supported to improve learning outcomes and address the changes brought forth by the digital and AI transformation and the COVID-19 crisis

Project: Promote Integrated & Sustained Warning Systems
Description: Tsunami warning systems depend on international collaboration, embodied in formal commitments, with the official support of governments. On the technical side warning systems depend on linking together a large number of national geophysical observations in a regional data network where observations flow in real time to designated regional Tsunami Service providers (TSPs) and National Tsunami Warning Centers (NTWC). IOC provides intergovernmental coordination for development and harmonization of regional Tsunami Warning Systems in accordance with mandate adopted at 23rd IOC Assembly (2005). IOC provides assistance for countries to develop their National Tsunami Warning Centers within a multi-hazard framework and for maximizing community response through creation of education and awareness.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health and accelerate the transition towards sustainable management of ocean-related risks and opportunities

Project: Management of the trust fund at the World Heritage Centre
Description: Management of the Netherlands Funds-in-Trust at the World Heritage Centre
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: DTO-BioFlow: Integration of biodiversity monitoring data into the Digital Twin Ocean
Description: DTO-BioFlow will transform access to data on ocean biodiversity and the human activities that impact them, enabling the sustainable integration of these data flows into the EU Digital Twin Ocean, enriching digital tools and services thus unlocking the societal value of these data within the biological component of the DTO, i.e., the digital replica of marine ecological processes.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health and accelerate the transition towards sustainable management of ocean-related risks and opportunities

Project: Strategic investment plan for the visibility and outreach of The UNESCO Courier
Description: This partnership aims to pursue in a sustainable manner The UNESCO Courier as the flagship periodical publication of the Organization targeting the general public. Publishing The UNESCO Courier in the six official languages on different media (traditional and digital) will contribute significantly to increase the visibility of the Organization. By funding the magazine, this partnership will ensure the sustainability of this communication tool whose prestige has no equal in the United Nations system.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.CPE1 - UNESCO's image enhanced and role recognized as a key solution provider for the 2030 Agenda in the Organization's areas of competence

Project: Capacities developed for the management of World Heritage properties (2022 IC)
Description:
The present proposal aims at developing institutional and professional capacities for the management of World Heritage properties, with special focus on:
- Strengthening participatory approaches through enhanced community engagement
- Supported the integration of site management into broader planning programmes for sustainable development at the local level
- Improving the interpretation of heritage as an educational approach to upholding World Heritage values
- Promoting regional cooperation and networking through the sharing of knowledge experience and good practices between South-East Europe and the broader European region
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: Malaysia-UNESCO Funds-in-Trust Programme Management and Coordination
Description: The Government of Malaysia and UNESCO have decided to establish the Malaysia-UNESCO FIT where the Government of Malaysia will provide the financial contribution for supporting the implementation, through UNESCO, of projects jointly selected under the "Malaysia-UNESCO Cooperation Programme" (MUCP). The MFIT Agreement covers all areas of competence of UNESCO and stimulates South-South cooperation, while building on Malaysian institutions and expertise. As such, this activity aims to support the management and coordination of the Malaysia-UNESCO Funds-in-Trust Programme.
Outcome EN: Outcome 7 - Promote inclusion and combat discrimination, hate speech and stereotypes
Output EN: 7.SHS1 - Member States capacities strengthened to advance effective policies and practices to achieve inclusive development through the promotion of human rights, scientific freedom, intercultural understanding and by tackling all forms of discrimination and racism

Project: Running Costs related to the Project of Cooperation within the office mandate.
Description: Running Cost funds for smooth operation of office.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 11 - Accountable, efficient and effective management in pursuit of the Organization's results
Output EN: 11.FLD3 - Enhanced administrative and operational support by addressing existing and emerging needs

Project: Meeting of the Scientific Council and Steering Committee of the UNESCO Regional Bureau for Science and Culture in Europe
Description: The Regional Bureau for Science and Culture in Europe (Venice) is unique in that it has two governing bodies to help monitor and plan the use of the voluntary annual contribution received from the Italian Government, as set out in Italian Law n.163 (1997). The Scientific Council provides advice on the design and implementation of the programme, while the Steering Committee provides oversight on both the programme and the budget. Both bodies should meet regularly once per year with additional meetings ad-hoc as needed to ensure the smooth functioning of the Office in Venice.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 11 - Accountable, efficient and effective management in pursuit of the Organization's results
Output EN: 11.FLD3 - Enhanced administrative and operational support by addressing existing and emerging needs

Project: JPO Learning and Partnerships Development Saudi Arabia
Description: The JPO is expected to contribute to programme implementation related to Learning and Career Development of UNESCO's staff and non-personnel. HRM/LPD is responsible for attracting and training a diverse, competent, and performance driven workforce. The JPO will play an essential role in providing learning & and career development opportunities to ensure that the staff of the Organization have the skills they need to deliver on SDGs and meet their full potential. The JPO will also participate in setting up outreach events and establishing HR Partnerships with governmental, academic and private sector entities.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 11 - Accountable, efficient and effective management in pursuit of the Organization's results
Output EN: 11.HRM1 - Staffing, learning & development and staff well-being policies developed and implemented in support of a more diverse, efficient and agile working environment.

Project: Support to the nomination process
Description: The RP workplan will be affected to provide technical assistance and guidance to States Parties preparing tentative lists and nominations, to support the work relating to the revision of the nomination process, to support the reflection on sites associated with recent conflicts as well as to the implementation of the requests of Upstream Process received by States Parties.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: ASPnet contributes to the empowerment of learners through transformative education to lead healthy lives, promote sustainable development and engage with the world as creative and responsible global citizens
Description: ASPnet links over 12,000 educational institutions in more than 180 countries around a common goal: to empower learners to lead healthy lives, promote sustainable development and engage with the world as creative and responsible global citizens. The network makes an important contribution to reaching SDG 4.7 and 4.c. Through pilot projects, members experiment innovative approaches to improve the quality of education and share good practices for scale with the network and wider education community, including policy makers. To effectively support its members to drive educational innovation and transformation, the ASPnet needs to provide substantive impulses, renew its communication and collaboration tools and provide quality assurance in order to play its role effectively.
Outcome EN: Outcome 7 - Promote inclusion and combat discrimination, hate speech and stereotypes
Output EN: 7.ED3 - Learners are empowered to lead healthy lives, promote sustainable development and engage with the world as creative and responsible global citizens

Project: Operationalizing the Global Convention & supporting regional conventions outside Europe
Description: This workplan will focus on steering the entry into force and implementation of the Global Convention on the Recognition of Qualifications concerning Higher Education, adopted in November 2019, in order to enhance recognition, mobility and inter-university cooperation among countries and regions. Attention will also be given to refugee qualifications and backstopping provided to regional Secretariats outside Europe in operationalizing regional recognition conventions.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED4 - Learners are equipped with relevant skills to meet individual, labour market and societal demands through literacy, TVET, STEM and higher education

Project: Operationalizing the Global Convention & supporting regional conventions outside Europe
Description: This workplan will focus on steering the entry into force and implementation of the Global Convention on the Recognition of Qualifications concerning Higher Education, adopted in November 2019, in order to enhance recognition, mobility and inter-university cooperation among countries and regions. Attention will also be given to refugee qualifications and backstopping provided to regional Secretariats outside Europe in operationalizing regional recognition conventions.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED4 - Learners are equipped with relevant skills to meet individual, labour market and societal demands through literacy, TVET, STEM and higher education
Donor: United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland

Project: Informing and Supporting the Enhancement of Teacher Policies and Practices in the Asia-Pacific Region
Description: The Teacher Regular Programme (RP) of UNESCO Asia and Pacific Regional Bureau aims to produce solid research and evidence-based information, analysis and advice for the member states to enhance their teacher policies and practices, in order to advance the teaching profession and address the emerging educational trends and challenges, especially those brought about by the COVID-19 pandemic and digital transformation. The RP also serves to promote and disseminate good practices and innovations in teacher policy and teacher training, as well as in teaching and learning.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED5 - Teachers trained and supported to improve learning outcomes and address the changes brought forth by the digital and AI transformation and the COVID-19 crisis

Project: Teacher quality for quality learning in Latin America and the Caribbean
Description: This workplan proposes to support LAC Member States in strengthening teacher quality as a way to address the overall need of improving students' learning outcomes in the region. The workplan is anchored in two main lines of action 1) Improving teacher education with focus on enhancing students' quality learning in foundational skills - literacy and numeracy; 2) improving teachers' professional status with focus on issues related to teachers' autonomy, agency, motivation and accountability in the context of teacher reforms proposing quality standards in the profession.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED5 - Teachers trained and supported to improve learning outcomes and address the changes brought forth by the digital and AI transformation and the COVID-19 crisis

Project: Teacher quality for quality learning in Latin America and the Caribbean
Description: This workplan proposes to support LAC Member States in strengthening teacher quality as a way to address the overall need of improving students' learning outcomes in the region. The workplan is anchored in two main lines of action 1) Improving teacher education with focus on enhancing students' quality learning in foundational skills - literacy and numeracy; 2) improving teachers' professional status with focus on issues related to teachers' autonomy, agency, motivation and accountability in the context of teacher reforms proposing quality standards in the profession.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED5 - Teachers trained and supported to improve learning outcomes and address the changes brought forth by the digital and AI transformation and the COVID-19 crisis

Project: Partnerships and outreach for system resilience strengthening
Description: Areas of activities foreseen in this workplan include: (1) communication and knowledge dissemination, including publications; (2) resource mobilization and partnerships, e.g., project document development and advocacy materials and conduct fundraising; (3) development of international communities of practice (COP) for peer learning and joint programmes and knowledge sharing.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED6 - Resilience, quality and equity of education systems strengthened to flexibly respond to evolving learning environments and to better deliver on SDG4 commitments

Project: Promote Integrated & Sustained Warning Systems
Description: Tsunami warning systems depend on international collaboration, embodied in formal commitments, with the official support of governments. On the technical side warning systems depend on linking together a large number of national geophysical observations in a regional data network where observations flow in real time to designated regional Tsunami Service providers (TSPs) and National Tsunami Warning Centers (NTWC). IOC provides intergovernmental coordination for development and harmonization of regional Tsunami Warning Systems in accordance with mandate adopted at 23rd IOC Assembly (2005). IOC provides assistance for countries to develop their National Tsunami Warning Centers within a multi-hazard framework and for maximizing community response through creation of education and awareness.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health and accelerate the transition towards sustainable management of ocean-related risks and opportunities

Project: Contribute to Member States Capacities for Assessment of Risk
Description: Assessment of tsunami hazard and risk is required to support preparedness measures and effective disaster reduction. Results of Tsunami Hazard assessments translate into coastal inundation maps using a combination of numerical models assuming possible tsunami scenarios. At local scale such maps can be used to guide local tsunami response planning, to enhance the residents' tsunami disaster awareness and response during an event. Support under this element focus on enhancing capacity in coastal hazard assessment in a multi-hazard framework. Within the context of the UN Decade of Ocean Sciences for Sustainable Development, an additional effort will be done on atypical events, not directly caused by earthquake sources (i.e. submarine landslides and volcano).
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health and accelerate the transition towards sustainable management of ocean-related risks and opportunities

Project: ICAM & MSP
Description: IOC's Integrated Coastal Area Management Strategy is divided into the following components 1) Coastal and Marine Ecosystem-based Management and Planning; 2) Coastal and Marine Hazards Adaptation and Preparedness through EBM/Area-Based management tools; and 3) Coastal and Marine Data, Information and Decision Support Tools.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health and accelerate the transition towards sustainable management of ocean-related risks and opportunities

Project: Strengthening the inclusion of persons with disabilities across South Asia
Description:
This workstream builds on UNESCO's programming to strengthen policy and practice to improve the inclusion of persons with disabilities, including through the production of various briefs to explore disability-inclusive COVID-19 governance in 2021.

Building on existing sub-regional work, this workplan will support Member States in improving (a) mechanisms, (b) mod-els and (c) capacities required for the routine generation, flow and use of domestically produced knowledge on persons with disabilities for use in social policies and programmes.
Outcome EN: Outcome 7 - Promote inclusion and combat discrimination, hate speech and stereotypes
Output EN: 7.SHS2 - Member States capacities strengthened in applying social and human scientific frontier knowledge to devise effective policy solutions to advance an inclusive development agenda with the aim to improve the well-being of people, particularly the most vulnerable, addressing the legacies of the pandemic crisis and face the social impact of climate change

Project: Enhancing the capacities to promote and protect linguistic diversity and multilingualism
Description: The countries in the Jakarta cluster contains a rich linguistic diversity. In Indonesia, around 700 languages are spoken across its 17500 islands, in Malaysia around 130 languages are spoken, in the Philippines around 120 languages are spoken, whereas in Timor-Leste about twelve languages are spoken in the island state. Nevertheless, as in other parts of the world, many of these indigenous languages are under threat and are in danger of being forgotten. Many of these languages are also not available natively on the Internet, making it difficult to attract younger generations to use and interact digitally in their indigenous languages.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CI1 - Member States have enhanced capacities to promote and protect linguistic diversity and multilingualism, including in the framework of the International Decade of Indigenous Languages 2022-2032

Project: UNESCO's leadership for freedom of expression and building inclusive knowledge societies at United Nations HQs
Description: As the UN conceptualizes its response to the impact of the pandemic, UNESCO-CI mandate has a significant positioning potential. The NY Office will use its diplomatic standing, its communication and its convening power to guarantee UNESCO's positioning on issues such as freedom of expression and press freedom, security of journalists and media development, access to information and the fight against disinformation. These issues are increasingly being taken up by the UN entities; it is therefore essential to carry UNESCO's voice, to ensure its leadership and to work closely with diplomatic missions to ensure that member states take up the issues UNESCO stands for. The NY Office will establish synergies between the UN based entities such as the General Assembly, HLPF, ECOSOC and others.
Outcome EN: Outcome 6 - Promote freedom of expression and the right to information
Output EN: 6.CI2 - Member States have strengthened capacities and raised awareness to enhance norms and policies related to freedom of expression, press freedom, safety of journalists, including women journalists, and the right to access information, online and offline

Project: Policy advice and capacity building for duty bearers to improve legal and institutional frameworks on freedom of expression online and offline
Description: UNESCO will continue to provide policy advice to and reinforce the capacities of duty bearers to enhance legal and institutional frameworks related to freedom of expression, press freedom, and safety of journalists, including women journalists, both online and offline. This will include: training judicial actors, security forces and policymakers on freedom of expression and the safety of journalists, including in times of elections; and strengthening norms and enhancing international cooperation. New challenges linked to the digital ecosystem will also be addressed, including in countering hate speech and disinformation, promoting the transparency and accountability of internet companies; and taking a human-rights based approach to technologies such as artificial intelligence.
Outcome EN: Outcome 6 - Promote freedom of expression and the right to information
Output EN: 6.CI2 - Member States have strengthened capacities and raised awareness to enhance norms and policies related to freedom of expression, press freedom, safety of journalists, including women journalists, and the right to access information, online and offline

Project: Strengthening media development and media pluralism to reinforce independence and pluralism of media institutions
Description: The role of independent media, including community media is vital to ensure the realization of sustainable development and even more in the context of crises and emergency situations. Media also play key roles in addressing the spread of disinformation and hate speech as well as in advancing gender equality, both in and through media. The digital transformation has had a profound impact on the media ecosystem and viability including in Jakarta cluster countries which was also exacerbated by the COVID-19 pandemic. Media organizations in the cluster countries also simultaneously affected by the lack of funding, pressing competition from the internet giants and partly economic recession brought by the pandemic to the media environment.
Outcome EN: Outcome 6 - Promote freedom of expression and the right to information
Output EN: 6.CI3 - Member States and media institutions enabled to strengthen media development and media pluralism, including through the International Programme for the Development of Communication (IPDC)

Project: Strengthening the institutional and human capacities on the integration of Media & information Literacy in Policies and Strategies and to bridge the digital & knowledge divides in particular among women, girls and marginalized groups.
Description: Digital technologies fundamentally change the ways individuals produce, share access information and knowledge. Technology offers opportunities for free exp for free expressions, access to intercultural dialogue among of citizens. The rise of digital technologies exacerbated challenges including the rise of misinformation, disinformation, and hate speech. In light of the emerging challenges, Media and Information Literacy serves as a framework and tool for journalists, educators, young people to counter disinformation, misinformation, and hate speech in the region.
Outcome EN: Outcome 8 - Foster knowledge sharing and skills development in the digital age
Output EN: 8.CI5 - Member States have strengthened institutional and human capacities to integrate media and information literacy (MIL) in policies and strategies, and to bridge the digital and knowledge divides, through the development of digital skills and competencies, particularly in the SIDS, and among women and girls and different marginalized and vulnerable groups

Project: Promoting the Use of Information in Educational Planning in Latin America and the Caribbean
Description: This proposal has two objectives. Firstly, to make the necessary adaptations to the current capacity building resources in the use of information for educational planning in order to consolidate them and make them more relevant and appealing to potential donors. Secondly, to implement a resource mobilization strategy focused on governments (national and subnational), and private donors and other international organizations that support governments in improving educational planning and the management and use of data.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.FLD4 - UNESCO Field Offices empowered to strengthen resource mobilization at decentralized level

Project: Secondment of a Programme Specialist from ROK to the World Heritage Centre
Description: Under the overall authority of the Director of the Division for Heritage and the UNESCO World Heritage Centre (WHC) and the direct supervision of the Chief of Asia and the Pacific Unit, the incumbent shall assist in the implementation of the 1972 World Heritage Convention and assist in the monitoring of state of conservation of World Heritage properties in a cluster of 8 States Parties in the Pacific and the Republic of Korea.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: BioEcoOcean: Co-Creating Transformative Pathways to Biological and Ecosystem Ocean Observations
Description: The BioEcoOcean project aims to change how we study the ocean and promote sustainable use. We'll work with diverse stakeholders to create a Blueprint for Integrated Ocean Science (BIOS) adhering to FAIR Data Principles. We'll collect data and develop models for BioEco Essential Ocean Variables (EOVs), collaborate with global ocean observation initiatives, and prioritize capacity building. The project will impact and strengthen ocean and biodiversity observation and management at all levels.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health and accelerate the transition towards sustainable management of ocean-related risks and opportunities

Project: Running Costs related to the Project of Cooperation within the office mandate.
Description: Running Cost funds for smooth operation of office.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 11 - Accountable, efficient and effective management in pursuit of the Organization's results
Output EN: 11.FLD3 - Enhanced administrative and operational support by addressing existing and emerging needs

Project: Brazilian capacities and public policies on water, sanitation and adaptation to climate change
Description: 2022 symbolizes half of the period foreseen for the achievement of the SDGs under the 2030 Agenda. Brazil still has immense challenges for the achievement of the SDG 6 on water and sanitation. The high and growing rates of urbanization and unplanned concentration of people in cities put water security at risk, which, with the effects of global warming, tends to aggravate. By this RP element, UNESCO will advance the Megacities Alliance for Water and Climate (MAWAC), foster proper representation of COBRAPHI in the CONAPHI's biannual meeting, publish and launch the 2022 World Water Development Report, support the water components of Amazon Regional Observatory, and implement an ecohydrology demonstrative site in Brazil.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.SC2 - Water science, innovation, education, management, cooperation and governance bolstered for a water secure world in a changing environment

Project: Human Rights Education for the City of Sao Paulo
Description: The following project is a partnership between the Human Rights and Citizenship Secretariat (Secretaria de Direitos Humanos e Cidadania de Sao Paulo) and the UNESCO Brasilia Office. The project is expected to improve the city policies on human rights and culture of peace by reinforcing the concept of "right to the city" and also reinforcing the transversality of human rights throughout all city secretariats, particularly the municipal education secretariat.
Outcome EN: Outcome 7 - Promote inclusion and combat discrimination, hate speech and stereotypes
Output EN: 7.SHS1 - Member States capacities strengthened to advance effective policies and practices to achieve inclusive development through the promotion of human rights, scientific freedom, intercultural understanding and by tackling all forms of discrimination and racism

Project: Instruments and strategies for sustainable development of the Historic Centre of Salvador, Bahia
Description: The objective of the Project aims is to train Mário Leal Ferreira Foundation - FMLF, public agents, private and social actors for the application of urban instruments foreseen in the Urban Development Director Plan, aiming the conception of strategies and projects directed to the requalification of cultural heritage and sustainable development of the Historic Centre of Salvador, Bahia.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: Promotion of tourism in cultural and natural heritage sites, the creative economy and other tourism and sustainable development policies
Description: The project pursues to promote the strengthening of the governamental policy for the development of tourism, through the valorization of the cultural and natural heritage, creative economy and other transversal policies, based on the intersectoral and interinstitutional articulation. Also it aims to promote creativity and diversity, and the achievement of a diversification of the national tourism, and the implementation of the UN 2030 Sustainable Development Goals Agenda.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT6 - Member States capacities strengthened to promote, monitor and measure the contribution of culture to the implementation of the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development at the local, national and regional levels

Project: Preserving Iraqi heritage
Description: The main purpose of the project is the documentation and the preservation of the important archive of books and manuscripts belonging to the Meir Tweg synagogue in Baghdad.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT3 - Member States capacities strengthened for better preparedness, mitigation and response to emergencies affecting culture, including in situations of armed conflict and disaster

Project: Support to Revive the Spirit of Mosul Initiative through strengthening capacities of the Digital Center of Eastern Manuscripts
Description: The funds contributes to the Revive the Spirit of Mosul Initiative through supporting the Digital Center for Eastern Manuscripts in Mosul to restore the manuscripts salvaged from Mosul
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT3 - Member States capacities strengthened for better preparedness, mitigation and response to emergencies affecting culture, including in situations of armed conflict and disaster

Project: Restoring the Mosul library
Description: The overall objective of the project is making the Mosul University Library fully functional and in order to reach the planned result of ensuring that the Mosul University Library is perceived as an essential knowledge resource and an educational and cultural connecting place by students, teachers and other staff at the University as well as by residents of Mosul in general
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED4 - Learners are equipped with relevant skills to meet individual, labour market and societal demands through literacy, TVET, STEM and higher education

Project: Breaking Silence: enhance accountability and prosecutions for safety of journalist and fighting impunity. Phase 2
Description: The project aims to expand the impact of the Iraqi National Committee of Safety of Journalists and issue of Impunity (INCSJII), by developing the capacity of the Judiciary, Prosecution, and Justice systems in Iraq.
Outcome EN: Outcome 6 - Promote freedom of expression and the right to information
Output EN: 6.CI2 - Member States have strengthened capacities and raised awareness to enhance norms and policies related to freedom of expression, press freedom, safety of journalists, including women journalists, and the right to access information, online and offline

Project: Strengthening the national capacities in Lebanon to prevent the illicit trafficking in cultural property
Description:
The current situation of the cultural heritage in the Region raises serious concerns: many historical and archaeological sites have or are being affected by violent fights or occupation by armed forces, vandalism and looting of several archaeological sites and museums have been reported.
Since the beginning of the armed conflict in the Region, UNESCO has alerted the international community regarding the risk of illicit export of cultural objects.
Moreover, the UN Security Council Resolutions specifically address the complex situation in the Region. The issue of preventing the illicit traffic in cultural property is becoming very important to Lebanon in particular within the actual situation in the Region.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT2 - Member States capacities strengthened to fight the illicit trafficking of cultural property and promote its return and restitution, to protect underwater cultural heritage and to promote the role of museums for societies

Project: PALESTINE- Emergency Assistance, with the aim to support Palestinian students residing in Palestine to pursue their academic studies
Description: Emergency Assistance, with the aim to support Palestinian students residing in Palestine to pursue their academic studies
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particularly in Africa, developing countries, LDCs, and SIDS

Project: "Palestine Riwaya Museum in Bethlehem (finalisation of Phase III: Completion the renovation of the Museum's space )"
Description:
The overall objective of the project is to establish a model Palestinian interactive and multimedia museum in Bethlehem, called Riwaya (narrative) Museum. It will be a venue for safeguarding and promoting Palestinian cultural diversity and fostering intercultural dialogue as it will serve as a tourist destination. This particular phase aims at completing the renovation of the museum space started in Phase III of the project.

Note: For detailed information about the scope and concerning the current project, please refer to the "Application for grants from the 
Norwegian Ministry of Foreign Affairs (MFA)" in the attachments section.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT2 - Member States capacities strengthened to fight the illicit trafficking of cultural property and promote its return and restitution, to protect underwater cultural heritage and to promote the role of museums for societies

Project: Promoting inclusive education and equal opportunities for migrant and refugee children and adolescents and host communities in Peru
Description: The project "Promoting inclusive education and equal opportunities for migrant and refugee children and adolescents and host communities in Peru" has been designed in the frame of the ECW Multi-Year Resilience Program (MYRP) for Peru, financed by Education Cannot Wait (ECW). UNICEF as grantee, UNESCO, and other allies as sub-grantees, will work together on this project to respond to the needs of the most vulnerable children and adolescents as well as working towards improving the inclusivity and quality of the Peruvian education system to include Venezuelan refugees and migrants. The MYRP is divided into four "packs", this document focuses on pack number 2, led by UNESCO Lima.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED1 - Education systems are equipped to promote inclusion, address marginalization and advance rights, including in crisis-affected and post-disaster contexts

Project: Umbrella project that brings together the different technical assistance provided by the IESALC strategic pillar "Capacity Building".
Description: Under this project, different technical assistance efforts have been undertaken aimed at strengthening the capacities of a variety of HE actors and stakeholders. It started with a public bid call made by the Peruvian State in which the IESALC was awarded the projects related to options 5 and 3 of the bidding document.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED4 - Learners are equipped with relevant skills to meet individual, labour market and societal demands through literacy, TVET, STEM and higher education

Project: Advancing Gender equality education programmes in Mexico
Description: Mexico is a country that faces challenges in violence against women and girls, in response, the State Government has developed a programme for gender education. Unesco Mexico will support this project by contributing with ther revision and integration of gender equality in the curricula content for basic and middle education and monitoring of the implementation in the schools of the state of Mexico. We will raise awareness of the need for other states to engage in gender education programes.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED2 - Gender transformative education systems empower learners, ensure safe learning environments and address the educational barriers, particularly for girls and women, exacerbated by the learning crisis

Project: Fostering Sustainable Development through Creativity in Local Cities
Description: This project aims to recognize creativity as a strategic factor for sustainable development of cities and public spaces within it. It will enhance initiatives to make creativity an essential component of urban development. The project will consider both UCCN and other cities, such as Ensenada, Mexico City, San Cristobal, Morelia, Puebla, Guadalajara (part of UCCN), or Guanajuato (WHL) and Mazatlán ("Islands and Protected Areas of the Gulf of California", WHL), among others. To strengthen cultural diversity, it will mainstream the integration of creativity into local development plans. The project will reinforce the adoption of SDG's to develop creativity in the cities. In addition, it will contribute to stablish a wide framework to improve access and participation in cultural life.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT6 - Member States capacities strengthened to promote, monitor and measure the contribution of culture to the implementation of the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development at the local, national and regional levels

Project: Supporting the development of a pluralistic, diverse, independent, gender-sensitive and professionally ethical national media ecosystem
Description: During 2022 and 2023, the UNESCO Office in Mexico will continue the work it began in the last biennium to implement the Media Development Indicators in Mexico, as well as the work to strengthen Community and Indigenous Media. Currently, the country faces a low level of trust in information and media by society, so it is necessary to restore this trust and continue to support the consolidation of an ecosystem of plural, independent, diverse media that integrate the gender approach and are handled ethically in crisis and emergency situations.
Outcome EN: Outcome 6 - Promote freedom of expression and the right to information
Output EN: 6.CI3 - Member States and media institutions enabled to strengthen media development and media pluralism, including through the International Programme for the Development of Communication (IPDC)

Project: Supporting the monitoring, evaluation and reporting of the National Education Strategic Plan and SDG4 in Jordan
Description: UNESCO will support the Government of Jordan to strengthen its education system, by way of capacity building for policy/planning, monitoring, evaluation, and reporting of results achieved against the Education Strategic Plan (ESP) 2018-2025, and the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development, in particular SDG4 and the Education 2030 Agenda. At the request of the MoE, UNESCO is committed to supporting the MoE in the strengthening and institutionalization of their M&E system and capacities to manage and conduct M&E activities that supports data-driven and evidence-based decision-making.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED6 - Resilience, quality and equity of education systems strengthened to flexibly respond to evolving learning environments and to better deliver on SDG4 commitments

Project: Supporting the conservation of the WH site of Um Er Rasas through the development of priority conservation interventions
Description: In the framework of the 1972 Convention, the activities proposed aim at supporting the State Party in addressing priority World Heritage Committee recommendations for Jordan's World Heritage properties through the development of urgent conservation interventions at Umm Er Rasas, a Roman, then Byzantine site listed for its outstanding mosaic heritage. This activity will also focus on strengthening the national capacities in the technical application of the World Heritage Convention.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: Damage and Needs Assessment of Ziarat Juniper Biosphere Reserve
Description: Recent monsoon rainfalls caused floods in Pakistan resulting in loss of human life, damage to property, destruction of crops, loss of livestock. Sixty-six districts have been officially declared to be 'calamity hit' by the Government of Pakistan. UNESCO sites like Moenjodaro, Makli World Heritage Sites in Sindh and Ziarat Juniper Biosphere Reserve (BR) in Balochistan are affected by the exceptional rainfall and floods this year. Ziarat Juniper BR is one of the two unesco biosphere reserves in the country. It is the largest in Pakistan and second largest of its kind in the world. There is not much information available on how much destruction is in the biosphere reserve. So, there is a need to conduct damage and needs assessment of the site.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.SC1 - Inclusive knowledge and capacities of Member States strengthened to advance and apply science for sustainable management of natural resources, ecosystem and biodiversity conservation and restoration, and disaster risk resilience

Project: Integrated Water Resources Management in Uzbekistan
Description: The current implementation of IWRM principles to achieve water security in Uzbekistan will be researched in a view to understand better the current situation, map it and propose the way forward. The activity will be done under the prism of climate and global change effects on the country.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.SC2 - Water science, innovation, education, management, cooperation and governance bolstered for a water secure world in a changing environment

Description: The Emergency Assistance project "Creating an inclusive and non-discriminatory environment for Ukrainian refugees in Moldova" to be implemented by the National Commission in collaboration with GENDER-CENTRU (Gender-Centre), aiming to benefit the affected refugees, as well as the host population, including the most vulnerable and marginalized groups, by building the resilience of the target groups (school children, parents/grandparents of refugee children, and schoolteachers with refugee children) in conditions of war and crisis. The requested amount will be used for organizing educational activities, purchasing equipment, producing and distributing information materials related to these activities.

Project: Emergency Assistance - Saint Lucia - impacted by a tropical wave on 6 November 2022
Description: Torrential rains, related flooding, and landslides have caused major damage to peoples as well as loss of property, but also eight educational institutions on the Island, in particular the Dame Pearlette Louisy Primary School, were severely impacted. The destruction included extensive damage to school facilities, massive losses of equipment, furniture, books and other school materials and supplies.

Project: Funding the evaluation of nominations to the WH List (2024-2025)
Description:
The WH Fund sub-account for funding the evaluation of nominations by the Advisory Bodies was created in 2019 (Decision 43 COM 14). At its creation, it aimed at reducing the expenses from the World Heritage Fund for financing evaluation activities, thus potentially saving resources of the WH Fund for allocating them to conservation activities.
In 2023, the Committee decided to use up to 100% of the funds available in this sub-account to contribute to the financing of the nomination process, particularly the Preliminary Assessment requests to be processed by the World Heritage Centre, ICOMOS and IUCN, as from September 2023 (Decision 45 COM 15).
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: World Heritage online map platform
Description: The project aims to collect and create georeferenced maps for World Heritage in Europe and North America as a pilot region. This data will be uploaded on a newly developed online map platform, which will be embedded on the website of the UNESCO World Heritage Centre. Users will be able to access, visualize and analyze multiple layers of information related to World Heritage property boundaries and buffer zones. The platform will facilitate identifying factors affecting the Outstanding Universal Value of World Heritage properties and will assist States Parties to better protect properties on their territory.

Project: PhosAgro/UNESCO/IUPAC Partnership in Green Chemistry for Life
Description: In essence, the Project's activities cover the launching and implementation over five years of an international research grants programme for innovative one-year research projects in green chemistry and/or the use of its advances. Green chemistry is currently very much in the spotlight since it is a novel area of chemistry developed during the last two decades, and it brings a new approach for the protection of the environment, human health and the quality of life, and represents a significant departure from the traditional methods previously used.
Outcome EN: Outcome 4 - Advance international cooperation in science, technology and innovation

Project: Implementation of the Regional Action Plan for Africa (2021-2027)
Description: Under Global Priority Africa, the Secretariat will implement and promote the Regional Action Plan 2021-2027 and Flagship Programme 3: Fostering cultural heritage and capacity development. It will support capacity building, the increase of African experts, and involve youth. The Secretariat will primarily support 11 countries with no properties on the WH List, assist 14 sites on the List of the WH in danger, mentoring experts and support conservation to achieve targets of the SDGs and Aspiration 5 of the Agenda 2063. Support will focus on the participation of the States Parties, the African World Heritage Fund, universities, experts, civil society, youth and other partners in celebrating the 50th anniversary of the 1972 Convention.

Description: The "We Shape" international conference is committed to advancing sustainable gender equality in Creative and Cultural Industries (CCI). Over two days, it will bring together 100+ professionals for collaborative discussions and innovative approaches. The goal is to reshape norms, amplify underrepresented voices, and foster positive change, particularly in the Western Balkans region. The conference's "We Shape" theme inspires collective action, empowering individuals to actively contribute to reshaping the narrative of gender in the creative realm.

Project: Follow-up to SDGs, WOA & State of the Ocean Reporting
Description:
The IOC will fulfill its commitment to be custodian for two SDG 14 indicators, 14.3.1 focusing on ocean acidification and 14.a.1 on scientific cooperation/investment. 

In order to meet the increased demand by decision-makers and society at large for current and easily accessible information on the state of the ocean, as well as to contribute to the UN Ocean Decade, the IOC will develop 'State of the Ocean Report' (StOR).

Project: UN partnerships
Description: By acting as the focal point for ocean sciences within the United Nations system, IOC will continue to engage in relevant United Nations inter-agency activities aimed at providing assistance to Member States in the implementation of 2030 Agenda, in accordance with IOC's custodianship role in relation to SDG 14, as well as the implementation of the Paris Agreement on Climate Change, the SAMOA Pathway, and Sendai Disaster Reduction Framework. This activity will also support the IOC role as coordinator for the UN Decade of Ocean Sciences for Sustainable Development

Project: Green education concept for environment sustainability in changing climate.
Description: Green Education in the service sector is expected to transform education sector and is combined with the trend of world economy development. Environmental benefits and sustainability are two characteristics of green education. Academicians, administrators, students need to incorporate awareness and adoption of environmentally friendly practices in the learning process (Rao and Aithal, 2016). When higher education goes green it also creates a high public image, helps in attracting and retaining the best and committed employees and having best students who would aspire to be under such colleges and universities. The United Nations had constituted 2005-2014 as the decade for green education development. This was done to create a positive impact on the society at large by bringing greenness with sustainability in higher education sector (Han and Liu, 2009; and Grand Valley State University, 2008).

Project: Development of Toolkits for enhancement of the fundamental critical thinking skills aligned with the Lao Qualifications Framework (LQF) in Upper Secondary Schools through Inquiry-Based Learning.”
Description: The latest survey LSIS III 2023 has reported the high out-of-school rate for upper secondary students is reaching 58% while student learning in grades 3, 5 and 9 are below the desired levels of standards also reported in (ASLO 2018, SEA-PLM 2020). These impacts to the human resources development in Lao PDR, lack of ability to think in the young labour force and university or TVET students are mentioned in several workshops. This project aims to develop the supplement learning materials for secondary school students to improve their fundamental critical thinking skills as a short-term improvement measure.

Project: Education sur la gestion durable des sols au Burkina Faso à travers un jeu de rôle appliqué à la culture de l’igname, plante alimentaire, commerciale et culturelle (J’IGNAME)
Description:
L’igname fait partie des cultures les plus historiques et les plus ancrées dans les cultures      
      des peuples qui la cultivent en Afrique de l’Ouest.
Malgré son importance socio-culturel et économique, l’igname est toujours classée parmi les cultures dites orphelines. De telles cultures, malgré leur contribution à la sécurité alimentaire et au revenu d’une proportion importante de la population mondiale, bénéficient très peu d’investissements de la part des gouvernements et de leurs partenaires. Par conséquent, peu d’études ont été conduites dans le sens d’une meilleure connaissance de l’igname, d’une sécurisation de sa diversité génétique gage de son rôle socio-culturel et médicinal et d’un renforcement de sa contribution dans l’économie des ménages à travers un investissement structurant.

Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particul

Project: UNESCO-VISUS Pilot Implementation in Timor-Leste
Description: The main goal of this activity is to introduce the UNESCO-VISUS methodology for assessing school facilities and providing critical information to decision-makers. The objective is to strengthen the safety of students and teaching staff by providing decision-makers, both at the Ministries of Education and Civil Protection Authorities (and the different national or local authorities), with tools and information to take science-based decisions on where and how to invest their available resources.  This will be accomplished by ensuring that the risk to communities is communicated in an easy, simple, effective and accessible manner. It will also help in creating and reinforcing the local capacities of national scientists and university students on assessment methodologies.

Project: Development of cultural policies gender based
Description: This activity will contribute to the reduction of gender inequality and empower all women and girls in line with MONDIACULT declaration and the objectives of the Plan for the Recovery of Cultural Industries and the Arts to 2030 developed by the Ministry of Culture of Peru with the technical assistance of UNESCO. This activity will focus its efforts on building capacity in local governments in the development of cultural plans and other measures that contribute to the reduction of gender inequalities through culture.

Project: Proposal for Emergency Assistance for Disaster Management at the Educational Institutions in Feni- the worst-hit district of Bangladesh in recent flash flood.
Description: This proposal seeks UNESCO's support to address the significant psychological impacts and educational disruptions caused by recent flash floods in Eastern and Southern parts of Bangladesh. The project aims to provide long-term recovery and advocacy for the preventive measures to ensure the resilience of the education sector in affected areas. Key components include psychological support for the teachers, parents, educators, training on disaster preparedness and response and capacity building for teachers, local education managers.

Project: Improvement of the legal framework in the field of tangible cultural heritage of Uzbekistan
Description:
The special status of cultural heritage objects as a unique value of the people of Uzbekistan and an integral part of the world cultural heritage requires a comprehensive and integrated approach to the legal regulation of relations concerning their protection, management, administration and preservation.
Current legislation seems powerless to resolve a number of fundamental issues related to the functioning of certain objects of cultural heritage and their status at the regional legal level (for example, problems of coordination of the actions of numerous specialized agencies, correlation of private interests and their public burdens with respect to preservation and use of historical and cultural monuments, etc.). Thus, it is obvious that in order to effectively implement the existing regulatory framework in the field of cultural heritage it is required to make certain changes in the regulatory framework that correspond to the actual situation.

Project: Sustainable development of mountain regions
Description: Resolution of the Kyrgyz Republic "Sustainable Mountain Development" adopted at the 76th session of the UN General Assembly on December 16, 2021, proclaimed the years 2023-2027 as the "Five-Year Action Plan for the Development of Mountain Regions". On July 19, 2023, the Kyrgyz Republic presented the global action plan for the implementation of the "Five Years of Action for the Development of Mountain Areas" at the UN headquarters in New York. As part of this plan, the National Commission and its partners, have planned various activities to promote sustainable development in mountain areas.

Project: Strengthening National Capacity in Promoting Gender Equality through national fine-Arts and Culture
Description:
Gender inequality remains a pervasive issue in societies around the world and in Tajikistan, impacting women's access to opportunities, resources, and recognition in various sectors, including the arts and culture. UNESCO recognizes the transformative power of arts and culture in challenging stereotypes, promoting diversity, and advancing gender equality. This project aims to harness the potential of arts and culture to promote gender equality and empower women.
	By promoting gender equality through arts and culture, this project contributes to UNESCO's efforts to advance human rights, diversity, creativity, and social inclusion. Through collective action and collaboration across genders, we can work towards a more equitable society where all individuals have equal opportunities to participate in cultural life, express themselves freely, and contribute to positive social change.

Project: UNIMA- Roots & Wings Rencontres internationales sur la marionnette en Afrique – formation et création

Roots & Wings est un projet international en trois temps successifs touchant aux questions de formation, de création et de développement des arts de la marionnette sur le continent africain. Il est porté conjointement par 4 pays, servant de catalyseurs sur leur zone à 19 pays du continent bénéficiaires du projet. Il se prépare et associe des pédagogues de différentes zones du monde et est coordonné par l’UNIMA – Union International de la Marionnette.
Il a pour objectifs principaux de travailler à l’assise de pôles de formation pour les artistes et au développement des arts de la marionnette sur le continent. Il souhaite également permettre aux leaders du continent de s’accorder sur un plan commun stratégique à longue échéance pour le développement des arts de la marionnette en Afrique.

Description: La République Démocratique du Congo (R.D.C), est un pays d’Afrique centrale, vaste de 2.345.409 Km 2, sa capitale est Kinshasa. Un pays qui est constitué de 26 provinces. La RD Congo est connue comme pays riche par son sous-sol avec les minerais et aussi par les lacs et rivières. Malgré cette richesse, la population rencontre des difficultés pour avoir accès à l’eau potable. Dans le pays il y a le service pour régir l’eau mais cela ne suffit pas. Project: Lifelines to Learning: Towards an International Declaration on Advanci
Description: Since the start of the COVID-19 pandemic, the right to education has become-at the global level-dependent on connectivity, especially internet access. The pandemic forced policy makers, teachers, parents and learners to attempt actions to leverage connectivity for learning at a speed and scale without precedent. The pandemic has revealed the need to rethink connectivity for learning in a transformed global educational landscape. This initiative will facilitate the production and endorsement of an International Declaration on Connectivity for Education, and will involve research and consultation.
Outcome EN: Outcome 2 - Strengthen international coordination for the achievement of SDG 4 and develop the global education agenda based on research, foresight and innovation

Project: Projet d'appui pour la réintégration des enfants déscolarisés et touchés par les crues des eaux du Fleuve du Congo et la formation des cadres de l'enseignement sur la prévention des risques de catastrophes en milieux scolaires : cas de Mbandaka
Description: A la suite des crues des eaux du fleuve Congo, notamment à Mbandaka (chef-lieu de la province de l’Equateur) qui ont atteint 6,25 mètres au-dessus du niveau de la mer vers la fin d’année 2023, causant 25 décès, la Commission nationale de RDC a sollicité l'UNESCO et ses partenaires pour une aide d'urgence. Les eaux des crues auraient détruit plus de 300 foyers, 52 écoles, des hôpitaux et des bibliothèques. Les pertes en vies humaines, les infrastructures scolaires, les fournitures, manuels, et autres équipements pédagogiques immergés par les inondations, la fermeture de 52 écoles sinistrées, impactent 6 105 élèves de cette province.

Project: Protecting Kafue Lechwe and Human Health: Addressing Contamination of Natural Water Sources in the Kafue Flats Biosphere Reserve
Description: The Kafue Flats Biosphere Reserve faces a critical threat: contaminated water sources endanger the iconic Kafue Lechwe antelope, leading to increased mortality, reduced reproduction, and negative impacts on tourism and local communities. Open defecation and poor sanitation in fishing camps are the root causes. This project aims to address this through a One Health Approach of key stakeholders for awareness raising, planning and capacity building for monitoring water quality using citizen science or other participatory environmental monitoring approaches. This collaborative effort will safeguard the Kafue Lechwe population, improve human health outcomes, and enhance the sustainability of the biosphere reserve.

Project: 6th National Meeting of Schools Associated with UNESCO "Education for Development: Sustainability at School"
Description:
The world today lacks committed people who contribute to the well-being of all and the achievement of sustainable development. This change can be driven by education, as it sensitizes, raises awareness, and shapes behaviours.

The pursuit of sustainable development requires the involvement of school managers, teachers, and families for the materialization of the SDGs and, especially, in the exercise of the right to quality education. It should be noted that Education for Sustainable Development (ESD) is recognized in the SDGs of the UN 2030 Agenda as part of target 4.7 of SDG 4, when it expresses that by 2030: 

ensure that all students acquire the knowledge and skills necessary to promote sustainable development, including but not limited to through education for sustainable development and sustainable lifestyles, human rights, gender equality, promotion of a culture of peace and non-violence, global citizenship, and appreciation of cultural diversity and culture's contribution to sustainable development." (UNITED NATIONS, 2015).

In Angola, the regulations that govern the Education and Teaching System, within its purposes, guarantee "To train an individual capable of understanding national, regional and international problems in a critical, constructive and innovative way for their active participation in society, (...)", (LBSEE, 17/16, article no. 4, paragraph c), which demonstrates the social responsibility and commitment that Educational Institutions have with the development of current and future generations.

Under the motto "The future begins with education" and the central theme "Education for sustainable development at school (Target 4.7)", the 6th National Meeting of Schools Associated with UNESCO will be held from 4 to 5 October, whose general objective is to provide education agents with theoretical assumptions about Education for Sustainable Development.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particul

Description: The project aims at providing access to quality and inclusive education with gender equality for 150,000 out-of-school children (OOSC) in Iraq focusing on six governorates with high numbers of OOSC. The main purpose of the project is to accelerate the achievement of universal access to primary education; by considerably lowering the number of OOSC and re-integrate them into the formal education system in Iraq. The three interrelated objectives of the project are highly relevant to improving access to quality education for OOSC in Iraq involving the key education stakeholders in a harmonized approach.

Description:
A series of symposiums will be held on entrepreneurship, innovation and creativity in Jordanian universities; to educate the youth on the importance of entrepreneurship, innovation and creativity in planning for their future; through highlighting the experiences of Jordanian entrepreneurs in various fields and sectors, and addressing the social and economic challenges facing them and ways to overcome them. On the other hand, local, Arab and international success stories will be presented to inspire and encourage the youth to plan their future. 
The targeted group of this project is university students in four universities distributed in the three regions of Jordan. As this category needs to be educated about popular trends in the labour market and give ideas on how to start their own businesses in light of the high rates of unemployment in various sectors and the difficult economic conditions in the area. These conferences will inspire the youth and enable them to be creative and innovative in building their future careers in a way that suits the local and global markets' needs and achieving sustainable development goals in the long term.

Description: La Science ouverte, telle que définie par l’UNESCO, « est une série de principes et de pratiques visant à rendre la recherche scientifique de tous les domaines accessible à tout le monde, au bénéfice des scientifiques et de la         société tout entière ».Ce projet sur la médiatisation scientifique s’inscrit dans cette démarche et mobilise les scientifiques, les citoyens, les journalistes scientifiques et les « médiateurs » actifs dans la vulgarisation et la diffusion des informations scientifiques. Project: Start Them Right
Description:
The experiences children have in early childhood shape the brain and the child’s capacity to learn, get along with others and respond to daily stresses and challenges. Research has shown that readiness for primary school, which includes a child’s behaviour, readiness to learn, social and emotional skills, early literacy, and early numeracy are important skills to include on a school readiness tool as these skills had the most predictive validity for later school success. (Duncan,2007)
Early Intervention services are essential to ensure children's success. However, making a referral is only the first step. It's important to recognize that parents may face various obstacles, such as financial constraints, confusion, or discouragement, which may hinder them from following through with the process. Even if a referral is made, not all evaluations lead to services. Nonetheless, every child can benefit from some form of developmental support, and doctors' offices play a critical role in facilitating this. By making referrals and following up on them, we can ensure that children receive the services they need to thrive and reach their full potential. Science has proven how best to support children's development, but accessibility is key. Making referrals and following up on them is a crucial step toward ensuring that every child has access to these services. The ultimate goal of facilitating this kind of fair is to provide an opportunity for children to access services that can positively change the trajectory of their learning outcomes. The organization of the referral fair is grounded in the concept of that of a Health Fair but specifically designed for children who may have special needs. 
Therefore, The Early Childhood Commission, under the Theme Start Them Right, seeks to partner with child developmental specialists with the hopes of facilitating a diagnostic process. This will cater to the children showing delays in their learning or development. These children's records will be extracted from the from the ECC’s secondary-level screening tool data, Ages and Stages Questionnaire-Jamaica (ASQ-J). The Ages and Stages Questionnaire Jamaica is a development assessment tool that has been implemented in screening and referral pathways worldwide. It is designed to monitor a child’s developmental progress and identify children with potential developmental delays. It is used to further screen children who have been identified as “at risk” by the Jamaica School Readiness Assessment. Hence, the ASQ-J is a secondary screening tool which is used to pinpoint specific areas of risk so that interventions can be more targeted.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particul

Project: CHAMP (Child, Home and Mentorship Project)
Description:
Jamaica has made significant strides towards attaining the Sustainable Development Goals. In spite of these achievements, the country is still challenged by socio-economic development issues which range weak economic performance, poor student outcomes and high rates of violent crime. The COVID-19 pandemic has significantly impacted the academic performance of male students, introducing challenges such as disruptions to traditional learning environments and increased disparities in access to educational resources. Addressing these effects is crucial for ensuring equitable academic outcomes for male students during these unprecedented times.

The “Project” is a programme of mentorship and guidance, to support boys as they remain in school and work towards academic and professional goals.  The “Project” is designed to encourage Jamaican students, age 13-18 years old, and selected secondary school students to complete their education. The programme presents strategies which have the potential to make a difference to learning, motivation and engagement in schooling, and consequently to raise levels of academic achievement; personal and socio-economic development. 

To this end, the potential exists for the creation of employment and other opportunities to enhance the life chances of youth. This proposal outlines the CHAMP Project that will engage youth from low income households to develop critical thinking skills and offer them opportunities to promote sustainable development in Jamaica.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particul

Project: Tailor-made heat maps for Caribbean Island States - a climate resilience tool for enhanced decision-making
Description: The proposed project, aligned with UNESCO's 42C/5 Draft Document and Budget for 2024-2025, seeks funding to implement satellite-based mapping for climate heat maps in Caribbean small island states. By enhancing spatial understanding of heat impact, this initiative aims to empower stakeholders and citizens in developing targeted strategies for climate resilience. Key project outcomes include bolstering evidence-based decision-making through heightened climate data accessibility and fostering public awareness of climate effects amidst rising temperatures for Caribbean small island states. This endeavor aligns with UNESCO's commitment to sustainable development, providing a tool for mitigation and adaptation concerning the adverse impacts of climate change on vulnerable island communities.

Project: National Commission Capacity Building Programme
Description:
The Saint Lucia National Commission for UNESCO was established on 2nd February 1981. Since its establishment the National Commission has contributed to the development of Saint Lucia in all of UNESCO’s fields of competence. Despite its obvious impact over the years, the need to clarify its roles and functions is as relevant today as it was over 43 years ago. 
It is within this context that this project proposal has been developed. 
The project will seek to provide capacity building and training to members of the National Commission’s sub-commissions and committees, as well as assist in revitalizing the Associated Schools Project Network.

The project aims at developing a 3-day artistic residency and a public concert in Buenaventura with the participation of 110 children, teenagers and youngsters from Batuta’s from Buenaventura and Cali.
