Project: Girls in Tech: Transforming Futures of Palestinian girls and invest in closing the digital divide between adolescent boys and girls and ensure girls are provided equal opportunities to excel in STEM fields.
Description:
Palestinian women alongside with men have made significant contributions across various sectors including their role in socio- economic development and family and community life. However, women and girls continue to face entrenched discrimination and rights violations. 

In Education, Palestinian women have made meaningful progresses. Literacy rates for women have improved significantly, and women exceeded the number of men in Palestinian universities. As for the percentage of female students enrolled in Palestinian higher education institutions, it reached 62% out of the total number of students enrolled in higher education institutions in 2021-2022, of whom about 10% are enrolled in the ICT major, (59% among males, and 41% among females), and about 3% are enrolled in natural sciences, mathematics and statistics (28% among males, and 72% among females).  However, there remains a gap in translating education into workforce participation. The unemployment rate among women participating in the labor force was about 40% compared to 20% among men in 2022.  Those who do work often face wage gaps and limited opportunities in leadership positions. Women are more likely to work in education, healthcare, and informal sectors.

This intervention will focus on building the capacity of adolescent girls in West Bank in applying digital technologies for the resilience and development of their communities, while nurturing their well-being and promoting their personal and professional development. In particular, the activity is developed to support school students, mainly girls, in creating digital solutions to address women's and girls' equal rights and empowerment using coding, robotics and artificial intelligence (AI) through project-based learning and STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics) education approaches.   


Project Goal
This initiative aims to inspire and support adolescents (80% girls, 20% boys) to embark on a learning journey to be capable of contributing to re-building and re-shaping their communities, their personnel development and their futures. Through the project, students will develop their 21st century, digital technology and innovation skills that can help them gain and create employment while fostering more resilient and sustainable communities by addressing such issues and challenges related to human rights, livelihood, health issues and climate change. All activities will be directed to promote women's and girls' equal rights and empowerment and support the active participation and engagement of girls in all project activities.  


Project objectives
•	Enhance female students’ creativity, sense of collaboration and team building and strengthen their problem-solving, presentation, technical and digital skills, ensuring their personal and professional development.
•	Increase investments in closing the digital divide between adolescent boys and girls and ensure girls are provided equal opportunities to excel in STEM fields.
•	Develop and implement innovative, technology-driven solutions that promote women's and girls' equal rights and empowerment by leveraging emerging technologies to enhance access to opportunities and foster economic and social development opportunities for all.

(GEM) 3 project
This initiative in ICT and STEM aims to reduce disparities and promote women's and girls' equal rights and empowerment by addressing structural barriers, biases, and skill gaps in sciences and ITC. It recognizes that empowering girls in technology, support societies and economies development. Additionally, the proposed capacity building activities help bridge the skills gap by encouraging girls to pursue careers in innovation and STEM fields.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 11 - Accountable, efficient and effective management in pursuit of the Organization's results
Output EN: 11.GE1 - Global Priority Gender Equality is advanced in and through education, science, culture, communication and information

Project: Keep Girls in School an initiative by P&G - Whisper and UNESCO New Del
Description: UNESCO New Delhi and Whisper®?, have come together to raise awareness and educate on Menstrual Health and Hygiene Management under the programme #KeepGirlsInSchool. The total budget for the project is $167,702. Under this Project a total of 5 teaching and learning modules have been developed on vrious thematic areas : MHHM Curriculum from Early Childhood to Tertiary Education, MHHM Teacher Training Curriculum, MHHM and Gender, MHHM and Nutrition, Health and Hygiene, MHHM and Girls with Disabilities; and A Gap Analysis Report. These draft Modules, will be edited and printed in the coming six months. There is also an ongoing Survey and a Thesaurus of Terminology being developed.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED2 - Gender transformative education systems empower learners, ensure safe learning environments and address the educational barriers, particularly for girls and women, exacerbated by the learning crisis
Donor: Procter & Gamble Hygiene and Health Care Limited

Project: South-south cooperation on integrated water management programmes in the LAC region
Description: The objective of the project is to promote training and integration in Latin America and the Caribbean for the management of water resources and the regulation of sanitation. The expected results include: i) the implementation of an education and training plan in water resources and sanitation management over five years; ii) holding training workshops to strengthen integrated water resources management; iii) the implementation of innovative capabilities for water resources management; and iv) strengthening Latin American integration in regional water resources management. Furthermore, an evaluation and a seminar are planned at the end of this Project.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.SC2 - Water science, innovation, education, management, cooperation and governance bolstered for a water secure world in a changing environment

Project: Capacity Building Workshop for Focal Points of ASPnet and UNESCO Clubs in Bhutan
Description:
The Bhutan National Commission for UNESCO has spearheaded the establishment of ASPnet and UNESCO clubs since 2006, with remarkable growth to 102 UNESCO Clubs and 109 ASPnet Schools by 2023. These entities serve as crucial advocates for UNESCO's principles while enhancing its visibility. Focal Points play a pivotal role in advancing UNESCO's mission through various activities. Efforts have been made to train teachers and coordinators through workshops, enabling the effective propagation of UNESCO's ideals.

To further strengthen capacity, a comprehensive workshop series is proposed, aiming to empower coordinators with the knowledge and skills to implement activities aligned with UNESCO's mission and Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). Through cascading training from national to local levels, the project seeks to foster collaboration, knowledge sharing, and resource mobilization among stakeholders.

The project anticipates a deeper understanding and commitment to UNESCO's mission, heightened awareness of its global impact, and enhanced engagement in initiatives promoting sustainable development and cultural preservation. Sustainability is prioritized through equipping Focal Points to continue advocacy and initiative implementation beyond the project's duration. Partnerships with educational institutions, NGOs, and other stakeholders will enrich the program and ensure its success.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particularly in Africa, developing countries, LDCs, and SIDS

Project: the incumbent will contribute to strengthening UNESCO’s political analysis and capacities in an evolving and volatile international environment in particular on specific developments which can have political and operational impact on UNESCO’s action.
Description:
Under the guidance and supervision of DIR/CAB, the incumbent will contribute to strengthening UNESCO’s political analysis and capacities in an evolving and volatile international environment in particular on specific developments which can have political and operational impact on UNESCO’s action.
The incumbent will also participate in strengthening communication channels with Member States and advising the Director-General and DIR/CAB on potential issues that require political coordination, inlcuding :
1.	Liaison with the Sector for Priority Africa and External Relations (PAX), organize and participate in meetings between the Director-General and/or DIR/CAB and the representatives of UNESCO Member States and accompany the Director-General on official visits as required.
2.	Work closely with Cabinet’s members in order to anticipate and manage any sensitive political matters related to the implementation of programmes and initiatives.
3.	Provides Dir/CAB and the Director-General with political analysis on specific and sensitive matters which can impact the Organization’s activities and governance
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 11 - Accountable, efficient and effective management in pursuit of the Organization's results
Output EN: 11.CAB1 - Rational and cost-effective functioning of the Directorate and Executive Office improved and UNESCO’s strategic positioning and leadership role as an active and efficient partner within the United Nations system in achieving the Sustainable Deve

Project: Design of Flagship Program on Education for Peace
Description:
At its 220 session, the Director-general has proposed to the Executive Board of UNESCO to launch a new flagship program on Education for Peace that will seek to safeguard and valorise UNESCO’s longstanding efforts to build the defences of peace through education by providing a set of global standards to support countries in implementing education for peace, while upholding the institutions, norms and standards that secure human rights and the dignity of all women and men.

The implementation of the program will be supported by a reinforced central team at UNESCO Headquarters and a network of regional and national/country-based officers.

In the current geopolitical context, it appears that the Middle East region will be a priority in the implementation of this program, requiring specific and dedicated approaches given the several challenges that the region faces.
To further elaborate on the initial proposal and provide member States with a detailed implementation plan for this new flagship program in the Middle East region, the senior consultant will:

1.	Provide a mapping of all existing tools, resources and partners on Education for Peace and identify specific needs relevant to the targets of the new flagship program in the region;
2.	Provide a 2-year draft implementation plan of the Program, including organizational structure at Headquarters, at intersectoral level, and regional and national level;
3.	Contribute to the preparation of documents that will be submitted to the 220th session of the Executive Board on the Flagship Program
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 11 - Accountable, efficient and effective management in pursuit of the Organization's results
Output EN: 11.CAB1 - Rational and cost-effective functioning of the Directorate and Executive Office improved and UNESCO’s strategic positioning and leadership role as an active and efficient partner within the United Nations system in achieving the Sustainable Deve

Project: PROJETS DE RENOVATION LES PLUS URGENTS AU SIEGE DE L’UNESCO A PARIS
Description:
Le manque de financement des rénovations importantes des bâtiments du Siège au cours des 20 dernières années a entraîné une augmentation des besoins d’entretien, la plupart des travaux devant être effectués en urgence. 
En application de la décision 215 EX/27 du Conseil exécutif, le Secrétariat a présenté au Comité du Siège, à sa 211e session, un Plan directeur actualisé dans lequel les projets  ont été classés par ordre de priorité et d’urgence, selon qu’il s’agit de remédier à des défauts structurels ou d’améliorer le fonctionnement de l’Organisation.
Quatre projets prioritaires cruciaux ont été présentés au Conseil exécutif à sa 216e session, dont l’un, relatif à la rénovation de salle de conférence XVI a obtenu un financement de 1 225 000€ au titre du compte spécial pour les investissements stratégiques et en équipements (CSI).  Le Conseil exécutif prend note de besoins de financement sur des autres projets prioritaires notamment la rénovation du bâtiment VI (Bonvin), la restauration des façades et toitures des bâtiments I et III, et la restauration des patios du bâtiment IV.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 11 - Accountable, efficient and effective management in pursuit of the Organization's results
Output EN: 11.OPS1 - Procurement and contracting function enhanced at HQ and in support of the field network and programme implementation facilities’ effective management and sustainable financing ensured

Elle procède par une méthodologie consultative des parties prenantes intervenant dans le secteur de la recherche et de l’innovation. Ces consultations seront animées par un consultant recruté à cet effet à travers des ateliers et des conférences des parties prenantes et acteurs issues des différentes institutions d’enseignement supérieur, de recherche, des entreprises et des partenaires au développement. Project: SENSIBILISATION DE LA JEUNESSE BURUNDAISE POUR SON ENGAGEMENT A LA CONSOLIDATION DE LA  PAIX ET AUX RESPECTS DES DROITS HUMAINS EN PERIODE ELECTORALE
Description:
Le Burundi se prépare aux élections des législatives et des communales de juin 2025 et les présidentiels en 2027.
Pendant cette période les jeunes sont beaucoup plus sollicités, instrumentalisés et même manipulés par les chefs des partis politiques lors de la campagne électorale. A travers ce projet, nous voulons sensibiliser voir  conscientiser les chefs des partis politiques et les jeunes leaders affiliés aux différents partis politique et la société civile pour qu’ils s’inscrivent inlassablement à un climat sociopolitique apaisé, qui conforte la paix et la sécurité, qui consolide la démocratie et favorise la diversité et la stabilité politique du pays.

Project: Projet d'appui pour la réintégration des enfants déscolarisés et touchés par les crues des eaux du Fleuve du Congo et la formation des cadres de l'enseignement sur la prévention des risques de catastrophes en milieux scolaires : cas de Mbandaka
Description: A la suite des crues des eaux du fleuve Congo, notamment à Mbandaka (chef-lieu de la province de l’Equateur) qui ont atteint 6,25 mètres au-dessus du niveau de la mer vers la fin d’année 2023, causant 25 décès, la Commission nationale de RDC a sollicité l'UNESCO et ses partenaires pour une aide d'urgence. Les eaux des crues auraient détruit plus de 300 foyers, 52 écoles, des hôpitaux et des bibliothèques. Les pertes en vies humaines, les infrastructures scolaires, les fournitures, manuels, et autres équipements pédagogiques immergés par les inondations, la fermeture de 52 écoles sinistrées, impactent 6 105 élèves de cette province.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particularly in Africa, developing countries, LDCs, and SIDS

Project: SEMINAIRE DE SENSIBILISATION DES PARTIES PRENANTES DU PARC DES MANGROVES SUR LA GESTION ET LA CONSERVATION DES ECOSYSTEMES NATURELS
Description: Les mangroves jouent un rôle essentiel en tant que puits carbone atmosphérique et océanique pendant de longues périodes. Elles luttent contre l’érosion côtière. Cependant les écosystèmes forestiers de mangroves subissent quasiment partout dans le monde, des dégradations anthropiques de toutes sortes et diverses amplitudes. Le bois, principale ressource des mangroves des régions côtières d’Afrique, est fortement affecté par la croissance démographique urbaine de population. Raison pour laquelle, la Commission Nationale pour l’UNESCO compte organiser un Séminaire de Sensibilisation pour une bonne conservation et gestion des écosystèmes du Parc des Mangroves.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particularly in Africa, developing countries, LDCs, and SIDS

Project: Appui aux activités des femmes maraichères de la ville-Province de Kinshasa en vue de renforcer leur autonomisation et de contribuer à la lutte contre les effets du changement climatique
Description:
La plupart des catastrophes naturelles sont dues aux effets des changements climatiques qui occasionnent beaucoup de ravages à travers le monde. C’est le cas de la République Démocratique du Congo où la ville de Kinshasa et d’autres sites, ont été frappées par des inondations dues à une crue exceptionnelle du Fleuve Congo. Ces inondations ont touché plusieurs groupes-cibles dont celui des femmes maraîchères qui vivent aujourd’hui dans la précarité et le désespoir et sont presque livrées à elles-mêmes.

Le présent projet est destiné à renforcer leurs capacités opérationnelles en les dotant de petits matériels agricoles et des intrants et en leur permettant ainsi de reprendre leurs activités qui contribuent non seulement à leur propre autonomisation et à la survie de leurs familles mais alimentent aussi la mégapole Kinshasa en légumes.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particularly in Africa, developing countries, LDCs, and SIDS

Project: Appui à la vulgarisation de la Recommandation de l’UNESCO sur la science et les chercheurs scientifiques et au suivi de la mise en œuvre de la Recommandation de l’UNESCO sur la science ouverte
Description:
Ce projet porte sur deux activités distinctes liées au Secteur des Sciences. Il s’agit d’une part, de procéder à la vulgarisation de la Recommandation de l’UNESCO sur la science et les chercheurs scientifiques et d’autre part, d’apporter un appui à la mise en œuvre de la Recommandation de l’UNESCO sur la science ouverte.
Pour la première recommandation, il s’agira d’organiser un atelier de vulgarisation car à ce jour, aucune action d’envergure y relative n’a été entreprise en République Démocratique du Congo.
Quant à la Recommandation sur la science ouverte, il sera question d’élaborer les stratégies de mise en œuvre en vue de rendre son application effective.

Project: CAPACITY BUILDING FOR WOMEN JOURNALISTS AGAINST IMPUNITY AND BRUTALITY
Description:
Female journalists, like men, all over the world have contributed much to building up the society through the creation of well-informed society on different news and information. 

To create safe female journalists work environment, there is need to set up strategies for their protection. Rules and regulations for safeguarding women journalists should be advocated. This should go hand in hand with implementation of punishments in cases of their violation. 

This project unveils the existence of impunity and brutality among women journalist hence calling for the government’s efforts to minimize and eventually end all forms of oppression, harassment, neglection and any other kind of mistreatment that women journalists encounter.

Project: Capacity Building on Curriculum for Tackling Cross-Cutting Issues for Green Learning and Climate Action
Description: In spite of the Ministry of Education (2023) reviewing the curriculum framework, teacher educators remain ill-prepared mainstreaming green learning for learners to tackle issues of national concern, e.g., climate change, environmental health and sustainable development. The Transforming Education Summit (2022) called for teaching to be transformed. It is proposed to conduct capacity development training to understand the alignment among macro level policies, curriculum frameworks, teacher education curriculum and school curriculum, and pedagogical practices at the micro level. Using three crosscutting issues as case examples, they will be supported to reimagine, design and implement model lesson and assessment portfolios for green learning and climate action.

Project: La promotion de la femme en vue de son autonomisation à travers la lecture et la lutte contre les Violences basées sur le genre dans les localités de Koua et de Siédja
Description:
Ce projet s’inscrit dans la priorité globale de l’UNESCO sur l’égalité des genres au paragraphe 04011 du document 42C/5 traitant de la priorité globale l’égalité des genres qui stipule que
«  l’UNESCO intensifiera son soutien à l’égalité des genres grâce à des stratégies ciblées visant à lutter contre les stéréotypes et les discriminations dans les cadres juridiques et les institutions, ainsi que contre toutes les formes de préjugés fondés sur le genre, et en œuvrant avec les hommes et les garçons dans le cadre de son initiative « Transformer les mentalités ». Elle s’emploiera également à accroître la résilience par le biais de politiques axées sur le genre ».
Plus spécifiquement dans ce projet, les activités et les actions sont fortement engagées pour la réalisation de l’ODD 5. 
Des actions en droite ligne seront réalisées en lien avec l’agenda de l’Union Africaine 2063 (aspiration 6, paragraphe 51) ; du Plan National de Développement 2021-2025 (Page 153, paragraphe 994 à 999).
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particularly in Africa, developing countries, LDCs, and SIDS

Project: Contribution à l’opérationnalisation d’une transition verte dans la commune de Cocody / Campus et sites de production de cultures maraîchères
Description:
L’Institut Afrique Monde (IAM), au vu des résultats et recommandations, du projet réalisé pour le biennium 2022-2023 et intitulé « Contribution à l’Education à la citoyenneté mondiale, à l’écocitoyenneté et à la transition verte » , au bénéfice de 50 jeunes, a opté pour une continuité du processus de recherche-action du projet. Aussi se propose-t-elle d’initier des actions en vue de sa « Contribution à l’opérationnalisation d’une transition verte dans la commune de Cocody ».
Cette initiative vise à contribuer à l’atteinte, en particulier, des cibles ; 12.3 , 12.5, 12.8 , 2.4, 11.6 et 4.7 à des objectifs du développement durable.

Project: NATIONAL WORKSHOP ON THE IMPACTS OF CLIMATE CHANGE ON WATER, SANITATION, AND HYGIENE (WASH) IN NIGERIAN EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTIONS
Description: The National Workshop on the Impacts of Climate Change on Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) aims to strengthen awareness and build the capacity of educational institutions, on the adverse impact of climate change on WASH practices in Nigeria. It will address the urgent need for sustainable practices, climate-resilient measures, provide innovative solutions and strategies for addressing the challenges posed by climate change on WASH in educational institutions. It will further address climate adaptation and mitigation measures into WASH practices, sustainable water conservation, sanitation management, sustainable hygiene practices, climate-resilient WASH infrastructure, and transition in the face of climate change impacts.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action

Project: Technological Inclusion: Teacher Training in the Use of Braille Printer in Special Education Schools in Luanda
Description:
Provide a succinct summary, indicating key messages of the project (maximum of 100 words)
In special schools in Angola, managing Braille-Printers presents challenges like limited training, technical issues, high costs, and accessing materials. Despite hurdles, Braille printers benefit by providing accessible learning materials, fostering independence, supporting inclusive education, and enhancing literacy skills for visually impaired students. Efforts to address these challenges and enhance access to resources can maximize Braille printers' potential in promoting inclusive education. A project in Luanda aims to promote technological inclusion by training teachers on Braille-Printers use, based on a prototype from INSTIC. The goal is to empower teachers to effectively use Braille-Printers, improving education for visually impaired students.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particularly in Africa, developing countries, LDCs, and SIDS

Project: Contribution des femmes pour relever les défis du changement climatique en s’appuyant sur  l'intelligence artificielle
Description: L’implication des femmes dans les initiatives prises en s’appuyant sur l’IA permet de répondre à leurs besoins spécifiques et d'éviter les biais et les inégalités. Ce projet réunit des experts et des décideurs pour discuter, partager des connaissances et formuler des recommandations pour intégrer la contribution des femmes dans les programmes et les initiatives liées au changement climatique et à l'IA. L'objectif est de créer un avenir durable où les solutions basées sur l'IA sont justes, équitables et efficaces pour tous, indépendamment du genre.

Project: INVENTORYING AND SAFEGUARDING OF INTANGIBLE CULTURAL HERITAGE IN TAFILA GOVERNORATE
Description: This project aims to inventory the intangible cultural heritage in Tafila Governorate by involving the local community, and association in the inventory process, then providing the Heritage Directorate with elements of intangible cultural heritage to include in the database and identify elements that are threatened with extinction, and raising awareness of the importance of intangible cultural heritage in the Hashemite Kingdom of Jordan, and linking it to sustainable development processes, according to the inventory form certified by the Heritage Directorate in various inventory projects. The form is filled out by the local community according to the domains of the 2003 UNESCO Heritage Convention.

Project: Renforcement des Capacités pour Jeunes Chercheur(ses) Marocains Professionnels en Océanographie (Early  Career Ocean Professionals - ECOP Maroc)
Description:
A travers les missions de l’UNESCO et depuis le lancement de la Décennie des Nations unies pour les sciences océaniques au service du développement durable en 2021, un programme de réseau «Early Career Ocean Professional (ou ECOP) » a été créé pour responsabiliser les ECOP, qui s'identifient comme étant en début de carrière dans n'importe quel domaine lié à l'océan. 
Pour atteindre les objectifs du Développement Durable, ce programme est au cœur de la Décennie des Nations Unies pour les sciences océaniques au service du développement durable et il a été approuvé par la Décennie des Nations Unies sur l'océan en tant que programme de réseau en 2021. 
La vision de ce programme est d'élever et de renforcer les diverses perspectives des nouvelles générations de professionnels de l'océan à travers une voix collective, en garantissant que les connaissances soient transférées entre les professionnels expérimentés et les ECOP afin de promouvoir la durabilité des océans pour « l'océan que nous voulons ». 
La mission est d’intégrer de nouvelles façons de penser aux défis mondiaux en matière de durabilité et de gestion des océans. Cette mission est réalisée en offrant aux ECOP des opportunités significatives de réseautage et de développement professionnel entre elles et avec les institutions locales et mondiales dans le cadre de la Décennie des Nations Unies pour l'océan.
Messages clés du projet 

-	Renforcement des capacités des jeunes chercheur(se)s professionnels du réseau national ECOP – Maroc
-	Suivre les orientations du programme ECOP de la Décennie des Nations Unies des Sciences Océaniques au service du Développement Durable (2021-2030)
-	Mettre l’accent sur la recherche scientifique dans le domaine marin au niveau national  
-	Mettre l’accent sur l’éducation des Océans (ou “Ocean Litteracy”) pour les jeunes chercheur(se)s professionnels 
-	Appuyer les réseautages des jeunes chercheur(ses) nationaux avec ECOP au niveau mondial en general et ECOP-Afrique en particulier.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particularly in Africa, developing countries, LDCs, and SIDS

Project: la lutte contre les effets nocifs de l’orpaillage et la protection de l’environnement
Description:
Ce projet consiste à organiser une session de formation de 5 jours à Nouakchott sur la lutte contre les dangers d’orpaillage et la protection environnementale, pour 100 femmes orpailleuses issues des quatre régions concernées (D. Nouadhibou, Tiris Zemour, Brakna, Guidimagha). Cette session s’appesantira sur deux axes:
Un axe sur la mise en exergue des dangers  des opérations d’orpaillage sur la santé et l’environnement  
Un axe centré sur les mesures de lutte  contre ces dangers et protection de l’environnement.

Project: Second Forum on Transformative Education for ASPnet Teachers and Youth of Lebanon “Building peaceful and sustainable futures through transformative education”
Description:
The Forum will include two parallel workshops one address to teachers and another one for students that will tackle the Transformative Education areas of: 
•	Greening education based on the Whole school approach on climate change (Get climate ready)
•	Introducing Artificial Intelligence into Teaching and Learning
•	Media literacy : critical thinking , raising voices of youth, 
•	the importance of Social Emotional Learning in schools (SEL) Social emotional learning

The two face to face workshops, each one for two days, addressed to ASPnet teachers and Youth, will be followed by a national competition on the best four projects that tackle one of the areas or topic  of the Forum in line with SDG’s goals.

Project: Reservas de Biosfera Costarricenses caminando hacia la autogestión de su comunicación
Description:
La autogestión de la comunicación de las Reservas de Biosfera busca potenciar las capacidades de los actores locales mediante la implementación de herramientas audiovisuales que mejoren los procesos de comunicación que se realizan en cada Reserva de Biosfera.
El proyecto define tres etapas: implementación de talleres de capacitación, laboratorios cinematográficos para generar cortometrajes y un manual para la elaboración de material audiovisual. Con esto, se busca formar las bases de un proceso de comunicación autogestionado que atienda los vacíos de comunicación actuales y sirvan para la planificación en temas de divulgación y planificación de trabajo.

Project: Encuentros de Líderes Estudiantiles de la RedPEA
Description:
El siguiente proyecto tiene el propósito de realizar un encuentro estudiantil para sensibilizar y empoderar estudiantes líderes representantes de los órganos del Gobierno Estudiantil (directivas de sección, Asamblea de representantes, Comités Ejecutivos) de primaria pertenecientes al programa Escuelas Asociadas de la Unesco (RedPEA), en temáticas que fortalezas sus habilidades ciudadanas, utilizando metodologías participativas e innovadoras.
 
En una jornada de un día compartirán 64 estudiantes temas relaciona con participación, equidad de género y cultura de paz. 
 
De manera simultánea 42 personas docentes que acompañas a estudiantes y que son coordinadoras institucionales de la RED PEA llevaran el taller “Liderazgos transformadores” utilizando las tecnologías.

Project: Capacity-building for disaster risk reduction at World Heritage properties in DPRK
Description:
The project aims at capacity-building for site managers, heritage protection authorities and local communities on the disaster preparedness and disaster risk management through training workshops to provide a methodology for identifying, assessing and reducing disaster risks at World Heritage properties, and finally producing a recommendation adapted to each World Heritage property for decision-makers and management offices.

For this, training materials will be prepared in consultation with the latest technical references such as guidelines and manuals from UNESCO, and training workshops and field missions are scheduled respectively at Pyongyang and Kaesong City.

Project: Sustainable Hydrosystems: Integrating Ecohydrology and Local Ecological Knowledge (LEK) into Inclusive Water Resource Management
Description: Recognizing the significance of local ecological knowledge (LEK), as demonstrated by traditional practices such as Bali's Subak system, becomes imperative in fostering sustainable integrated water resource management (IWRM), underscores the importance of considering social, environmental, and economic factors. In this context, Ecohydrology, combining hydrological and biological processes, is crucial for ensuring water security and biodiversity in Indonesia. To achieve this, a proposed project aims to enhance knowledge co-production between Ecohydrology and LEK, aiming to improve integrated water resource management. The project aims to develop a framework strategy and improve Ecohydrology adoption, emphasizing stakeholder engagement through workshops and seminars.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action

Project: Promoting Local Natural Dyes to Young Generations to Achieve the Sustainable Development Goals
Description: The revival of natural dyes in Indonesia aligns with the national industrial agenda, focusing on eco-friendly dye industries for textiles. Since 2019, UGM researchers under INDI have driven community-oriented initiatives, recognized by UNESCO. INDI's holistic approach targets revitalizing the natural dye industry and meeting global sustainability goals. To advance as a UNESCO Chair, INDI UGM proposes "Promoting Local Natural Dyes to Young Generations to Achieve the Sustainable Development Goals," engaging undergraduate and high-school students with a vulnerable society of craftswomen. The program aims to raise awareness, empower youth, and foster collaboration within the natural dye community through education, research, and community empowerment by 3 main activities of 8 workshops/conference/meetings, 2 trainings, and 2 publications.

Project: Citizen Science on Natural Disaster: Raising Public Awareness through the Engagement of Vulnerable Groups into Inclusive Disaster Risk Reduction
Description: In the practice of citizen science, the way that physical, social, and digital infrastructures mediate citizen and communities to respond the natural disasters. As a consequence, reaching out these goals would have support poverty eradication and empowerment toward vulnerable groups on the disaster risk reduction context. Through this program, it will implement to the citizen science that targeted communities at large in natural disaster prone-areas, the management of citizen science through innovation and preparedness that targeted the youth as a force during the digital age in post natural disasters, and capacity building to bounce back better that targeted the vulnerable groups particilarly people who become physically disables in post natural disasters. The goals are to raise awareness of the types of citizen science on natural disaster and the activities that communities and others have engaged in, to provide guidance on how to design a project on citizen science on natural disaster and identify resources to support activities, and to facilitate partnership between various type of communities and other entities such as governments or research institutions, to carry out citizen science activities.

Project: Study of Floristic Composition of Lawachara and Satchari forests with special emphasis on the conservation status of two Reserved Forests of Bangladesh.
Description: The Lawachara and Satchari- two reserve forests in Bangladesh are rich in invaluable plant resources. They are also abode of rare birds and animals. In recent years, there has been increasing use of resources of the forests including rise of ecotourism in these areas. At this backdrop, the objective of this project is to study the floristic composition of these forests, mapping the forests and assess the conservation status with a view to ensure sustainable use of resources by the forest goers and users. The project aims to raise awareness about the importance of conserving these forests' biodiversity among the stakeholders and ultimately to prepare an application for Biosphere Reserve.

Project: Saving Alkap, an intangible cultural heritage of Bangladesh
Description: Traditional culture is the main assets of a nation. Alkap is a type of traditional popular folk song originating in greater Rajshahi district, in the Northern region of Bangladesh. It is performed with a particularly distinctive rhythm, role play and dance with 10-12 male performers discussing a topic to raise social awareness, motivation of the community people for social development. Now a day, Alkap reflects contemporary social problems through dialogue, songs, theatre, dances and jokes. Through their performance they deliver strong message on social and domestic violence, crime situation, early marriage, dowry, WASH issue, Family planning and other social problems. Most of the time they perform Alkap in busy public places like; village market, village fair, bus & train station and cultural celebration in this district.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particularly in Africa, developing countries, LDCs, and SIDS

Project: Understanding the Gaps in Cancer Education and Awareness in Bangladesh and Finding Prospective Solutions: A Special Emphasis on Stigmas and Challenges Among Women
Description: Despite progress in cancer management, Bangladesh faces formidable challenges to overcome stigma and misunderstanding around cancers. The challenge is even bigger for women who suffers from breast and ovarian cancers(1). Bangladesh has enormous problem regarding cancer awareness and education among general people. Proper research is also lacking here to meet these challenges. With the involvement of Sir Walter Bodmer from the University of oxford who has long experience in cancer research and science communication, and leading figures from Bangladesh, this project aims to bridge the gaps through trainings, seminars, social media awareness campaigns, and community outreach by targeting students, communities, and healthcare professionals. Specific strategies include understanding cancer stigmas, gaps in cancer education and cancer prevention, addressing doctor-patient relationship challenges with a practical manual, and engaging diverse speakers. The project plans events in educational institutions, villages, and conference halls/hospitals. Overall, the initiative seeks to enhance the understanding on cancer education, eradicate fear, and foster stronger connections between healthcare providers and patients.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particularly in Africa, developing countries, LDCs, and SIDS

Project: Protection and Promotion of  Boat Race- the Most Popular Water Sports in Bangladesh.
Description: The project addresses the decline of Boat Racing, once of the most popular and the most popular water sports in Bangladesh. Climate change, environmental shifts have led to the drying of water bodies, threatening this cherished water sport. Despite the rising popularity of mainstream sports like cricket and football, Boat Racing persists, particularly during the rainy season. This project strives to document resilient communities of men engaged in Boat Racing, preserving their cultural legacy. Through visual and written records, the initiative seeks to raise awareness about the sport's significance, offering a glimpse into a vanishing tradition, and fostering community empowerment amidst changing environmental dynamics
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action

Project: Kazakhstan's Diplomacy and Overseas Relationship in 15th – 17th centuries: Introducing the New Artifacts from Overseas Museums and Archives and Shaping the Scholar's Vision (International Conference and round table)
Description: The project aims to assist Kazakhstan and Central Asian States in applying social and human scientific frontier knowledge in recovering the national history and ethnic identity. For two recent decades Kazakhstan academicians and scholars have identified in the museums' collections and archives a significant number of documents and material objects related to the history of the Kazakh Khanate in 15th – 17th centuries. It is necessary to focus active discussions of the newly identified archival documents and artifacts to shape adequately the Kazakhstan sovereignty historical concept. The conference will involve the knowledgeable international academic community in renewal of the Kazakhstan history.

Project: Empowering Young Women in Data Science and AI
Description:
“Empowering Young Women in Data Science and AI”
The project addresses the rapidly increasing demand for Data Science professionals in a global IT job market. It is planned to be implemented by the Digital Education Development Center under the Ministry of Digital technologies. The initiative selects 70 talented girls from local IT universities with special attention to girls with economically disadvantaged backgrounds and those with disabilities. Through comprehensive training, the project aims to bridge the gender digital gap, empowering participants to contribute actively to the AI investigation. Expected outcomes of the project include enhanced skills, increased employability, and the creation of role models, fostering long-term economic and societal development in Uzbekistan’s technology landscape.

Project: National Seminar on Good Practices of Women's Contributions to Nature Education in the Chinese Biosphere Reserves Network (CBRN)：Supporting the Fifth World Congress of Biosphere Reserves
Description: The seminar aims to explore and share good practices of women's contributions for nature education among members of the Chinese Biosphere Reserves Network. The selection theme and criteria of good practices are not only relevant to the education objective of the Biosphere Reserves, but also promoting the local knowledge and enhancing local engagement, particularly for rural communities. The expected results include a seminar involving female experts, policymakers, indigenous people and stakeholders, and a special report which will describe the diverse examples and support the Fifth World Congress of Biosphere Reserves to be held in Hangzhou,  China, in 2025.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particularly in Africa, developing countries, LDCs, and SIDS

Project: UNESCO-VISUS Pilot Implementation in Timor-Leste
Description: The main goal of this activity is to introduce the UNESCO-VISUS methodology for assessing school facilities and providing critical information to decision-makers. The objective is to strengthen the safety of students and teaching staff by providing decision-makers, both at the Ministries of Education and Civil Protection Authorities (and the different national or local authorities), with tools and information to take science-based decisions on where and how to invest their available resources.  This will be accomplished by ensuring that the risk to communities is communicated in an easy, simple, effective and accessible manner. It will also help in creating and reinforcing the local capacities of national scientists and university students on assessment methodologies.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action

Project: Three Day Workshop on Cultural (and National Heritage) Policy   Development
Description:
The idea of the preservation of natural and cultural heritage has entered into the international arena with the adoption of the ‘Convention Concerning the Protection of the World Cultural and Natural Heritage in 1972. This convention was introduced considering the global context that disturbs or harms the cultural and natural heritages in the world. Therefore, this proposed project will cover the subject area that was emphasized by the 1972 convention. 
Even Though government has paid more attention to the culture and heritage sector, absence of a national policy for culture and heritage to ensure the long-lasting safeguard of the sector is a critical issue. Hence, the main objective of the proposed project is to to develop a national policy for the Cultural and National Heritage sector in Sri Lanka through a residential workshop. 
Since the culture and heritage are a very sensitive and dynamic area, policy preparation to satisfy all stakeholders is a challenge. Therefore, this workshop will be designed as a three-day residential workshop and includes consultation sessions with the participation of relevant stakeholders in the public sector, private sector and NGO sector. It is expected to have around 40 participants for the workshop.
Facilitation of the reputed resource person who has both national and international experience on making cultural and heritage policy will be taken to conduct the workshop. Especially his experiences and active participation in UNESCO, will be an additional valuve for success for the task. During the workshop, the first draft of the national policy document will be done and shared among all stakeholders to obtain their comments and opinion. As the final output of the project there will be a policy document for the culture and heritage sector in Sri Lanka.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particularly in Africa, developing countries, LDCs, and SIDS

Project: An analysis of barriers to Sri Lankan women’s human capital accumulation in STEM subjects
Description: Human capital accumulation extends from general education from school years to training in job markets. While gender gaps in education and labor market outcomes for women in Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics (STEM) has improved, women still face various challenges in selecting STEM at school levels and transitioning to employment following their education. This study explores the barriers at both the school level as students make decisions on STEM subject selection and at the level of entrance to the labor market following the completion of tertiary education.

Description: This proposed project by the UNESCO Madanjeet Singh Centre for South Asia Water Management at the University of Moratuwa strongly aligns with UNESCO's priorities in Education, Science for Sustainable Development, Capacity Building, and Gender Equality. It endeavours to enhance climate resilience and water management practices in Sri Lanka through education, scientific advancements, and community capacity building. This initiative will contribute significantly to fostering a sustainable and resilient future for the nation.

Project: Strengthening National Capacity in Promoting Gender Equality through national fine-Arts and Culture
Description:
Gender inequality remains a pervasive issue in societies around the world and in Tajikistan, impacting women's access to opportunities, resources, and recognition in various sectors, including the arts and culture. UNESCO recognizes the transformative power of arts and culture in challenging stereotypes, promoting diversity, and advancing gender equality. This project aims to harness the potential of arts and culture to promote gender equality and empower women.
	By promoting gender equality through arts and culture, this project contributes to UNESCO's efforts to advance human rights, diversity, creativity, and social inclusion. Through collective action and collaboration across genders, we can work towards a more equitable society where all individuals have equal opportunities to participate in cultural life, express themselves freely, and contribute to positive social change.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action

Project: National Conference and Workshop on Teachers and Emerging Technologies in Education
Description: The National Conference and Workshop, entitled: Emerging Education Technologies for Iranian Teachers is an opportunity to provide a premier interdisciplinary platform for policymakers, researchers, practitioners and educators to present and discuss the most recent innovations, trends, and concerns as well as practical challenges encountered in the global as well as the country level and the best solutions adopted in the field of ICT in Education and Training, with a focus on teachers training and education and it is an opportunity for capacity building on the issue in the country. Through the workshop, the participants will be acquainted with the major educational technologies and the best ICT practices currently available for teachers across the world and the ways which make teachers capable of taking a more effective role in ensuring equitable use of technology and creating world-class educational digital content and capacity. It is supposed this event would provide an opportunity to recover the current situation of ICT’s application in Education in Iran and develop the academic networks for collaboration and partnership to promote new technologies in school and teacher education and training, in the country.

Project: Digital Transformation and Leadership
Description:
The project will build the capacity of the state owned university administrators, mid-level managers and relevant specialists on digital transformation and leadership based on studies that reveal effective digital transformation as positive changes in teaching, learning, research, engagement, administrative processes and organizational culture.

The project purpose is in line with the UN SDG-4 to ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all and to foster knowledge sharing and skills development in the digital age as well as with UNESCO’s medium term strategy of developing institutional and human capacities and building partnership at the national level.

Project: Empowering women in STEM
Description:
“Empowering women in STEM” is a program aimed at eliminating gender inequality in STEM-related fields by enhancing their skills and advancing social participation of young women pursuing STEM-related fields. Zorig Foundation has a proven track record of successfully implementing such programs, with a total of 40 graduates as of 2024. 

This initiative will mainly focus on empowering women in the STEM fields, and will strengthen the leadership and soft skills of female professionals that will help them challenge the barriers faced by women in STEM fields. The project will also expand their network and assist them in identifying potential opportunities in STEM fields.

Project: Mongolia: Enhancing Educational Resilience in Response to Dzud Disaster.
Description: The emergency project addresses immediate educational challenges caused by dzud disaster while fortifying readiness for future emergencies. Amidst the current crisis, it provides essential support to mitigate disruptions and enhance educational resilience. By supplying connectivity resources, training, and guidelines, the project ensures continuity of education. Simultaneously, it lays the groundwork for future emergencies, equipping communities with the knowledge and resources needed to respond effectively. Through this dual approach, the project aims to safeguard education during crises while fostering long-term resilience to similar emergencies.

Project: Developing a comprehensive Science, Technology and Innovation Strategy in Lao PDR (2026-2040) through public private consultation and partnerships
Description: As Lao PDR aims to graduate from the LDC status by 2026, there is a pressing need for an official national science, technology and innovation (STI) strategy and action plan that is aligned to the national development priorities. The government needs to work on the current challenge of technological and globalization changes, as well as social transformation through a comprehensive STI strategy, according to the standards of UNESCO Recommendation on Science and Scientific Researchers (2017). The Strategy will integrate and articulate the national and social and human sciences in a unified way, in support of the implementation of the 10th National Socioeconomic Development Plan 2026-2023. This project will build on the ongoing collaboration (since 2023) between the Ministry and the UNESCO Regional Office (based in Bangkok) by assisting the government in broadening the national consultations with the private sector (including SME) in order to enact an comprehensive and participatory approach while drafting the STI policy.

Project: FIR ASSESSMENT AND TRAINING, LEVUKA WORLD HERITAGE SITE
Description:
The Fiji Department of Culture, Heritage and Arts, and the Fiji National Fire Authority have prepared a proposal to reduce fire risk to the World Heritage Town of Levuka, Fiji. This includes: 
- Previewing the Levuka Heritage Resister and Values.
- Identify fire protection and life safety objectives.
- Identify fire Hazards.
- Determine the best solutions for protection that meet safety objectives and regulations while minimizing impact on the attributes of the World Heritage Town.
This will be conducted through assessments, planning workshops with key stakeholders, by fire management experts from NFA, who will link into their pool of national and international experts.

Project: Boosting CCIs in Montenegro at policy and implementation level
Description: Leveraging diverse research methodologies, this project aims to update and quantify the economic impact of Cultural and Creative Industries (CCIs) on local and regional development since 2019. It seeks to assess the current landscape and satisfaction within the CCI sector, employing desk research, as well as quantitative and qualitative methods involving creative entrepreneurs. The findings will highlight key lessons, offer strategic recommendations for the sector's growth, and guide future financing and support mechanisms for CCI entrepreneurs. This analysis will assist the Ministry of Culture and Media of Montenegro in strategic planning for the enhancement of cultural and creative industries.

Project: Bridging Cultures: Education and Wellbeing for Ukrainian Refugees and local population through Art and Technology
Description:
The request is submitted in the context of the ongoing humanitarian crisis related to the armed conflict between the Russian Federation and Ukraine. According to UN data, more than 2.4 million people have already fled Ukraine in fear for their lives and the lives of their children to neighboring countries. According to Moldovan border control, more than 100,000 Ukrainian refugees are housed in the Republic of Moldova.

The National Commission requested US$25,522 for the project aiming to benefit the affected refugees. 60 adults and at least 120 children would benefit directly from the project, which should also have a positive impact on the host communities and families. The requested amount will be used for organizing artistic, cultural, and intercommunity activities, provide psychological support and emotional wellbeing to beneficiaries.

Pupils will learn about the actuality of the main research directions that are developed in the country and will have the possibility to develop their own research project under the guidance of a scientist.

Project: International Conference “Astronomical Heritage of the Middle East 2”
Description: International Conference “Astronomical Heritage of the Middle East” is devoted to the role of astronomy in culture and other fields of human activity and development of these fields due to the knowledge obtained from the Universe. In modern era, astronomy plays a leading role in the formation and development of inter- and multi- disciplinary sciences. For a long time, Astrophysics has reached high level of development, recently new science disciplines have been created, such as Astrochemistry, Astrobiology, Planetology, Astroinformatics, etc. Archaeoastronomy and Cultural Astronomy play an important role in culture and in the heritage of nations, chronologies and calendars. The development of scientific tourism and scientific journalism is tightly related as well. The meeting is aimed at the development of problems of astronomy-related interdisciplinary sciences and preparation of a basis for further possible collaborations by means of presentations of available modern knowledge in various areas of culture by experts from different professions and by joint discussions.

Project: Raising awareness of children and youth about the activities of biosphere reserves in the context of the Berezinsky Biosphere Reserve
Description:
The project is an educational one, aimed at developing in children and youth a value-based attitude towards nature, increasing their level of environmental education, awareness on issues of environmental protection and rational use of natural resources, nurturing a responsible attitude of the younger generation towards nature, and developing environmentally literate behavior.
The project will be implemented by organizing and conducting a training workshop for children and youth and preparing an illustrated popular and science bilingual publication for a wide range of readers, including children, which will contain background and scientific information, photographs of natural landscapes, ecosystems, as well as species of animals, plants and mushrooms.
The project is timed to coincide with the 100th anniversary of the founding of the Berezinsky Biosphere Reserve and the 45th anniversary of its assignment to the status of a biosphere reserve, and therefore will also raise awareness among the younger generation about the Man and the Biosphere Programme of UNESCO (MAB), the activities of biosphere reserves and, in general, about the activities of UNESCO in the fields of science and education.

Project: ELIMINATE: Elodea Management Initiative for St. Naum Springs
Description: ELIMINATE is a 12-month initiative addressing the invasive Elodea canadensis threatening St. Naum Springs in North Macedonia. Focused on community collaboration, the project aims to reduce Elodea coverage by 80%, restoring native habitats and water quality. Empowering 50 trained community members ensures ongoing management, fostering resilience, and sustaining eco-tourism. With a $26,000 budget, ELIMINATE combines workshops, removal campaigns, and awareness to protect this UNESCO-listed site, promoting a participatory and sustainable approach for a thriving ecosystem.

Project: ACT (Arts, Creative and Technology) FOR EDUCATION FOR SUSTAINABLE DEVELOPMENT AND SOCIAL ENTERPEISE DEVELOPMENT IN SCHOOLS AND COMMUNITIES OF PRACTISE.
Description: In response to the global learning crisis exacerbated by the COVID-19 pandemic, UNESCO initiated the Transforming Education Summit and three world education conferences in 2022. The ACT initiative, focusing on climate action led by youth, faced challenges in sustainability and identified the need for capacity building among teachers and principals. The project aims to reinforce UNESCO's support for national education systems by developing innovative policies around ICTs in education and promoting education for the green transition. The plan includes establishing research and entrepreneurship hubs in schools, utilizing fruit trees for agroforestry and entrepreneurship, and expanding activities into botanical gardens, beekeeping, fruit processing, and ICT for green revolution. The goal is to create sustainable school hubs for creativity, innovation, and social entrepreneurship, generating income and offering new job opportunities for youth.

Project: SMEF- Idea Management and Innovation System
Description: This project aims to address the challenge of limited innovation in Lesotho, especially within government departments. It proposes an Idea Management and Innovation System to foster collaboration, break down silos, and tap into the untapped potential of the workforce, particularly the youth. The initiative targets youth, with a focus on girls, in all ten districts of Lesotho, aiming to encourage their innovative ideas and contribute to national development. The project aligns with UNESCO's goals of sustainable development, gender equality, and fostering creativity. Project: Empowering Young Ghanaian Voters: A Media and Information Literacy Project for Informed Elections
Description: Electoral disinformation has emerged as a threat to democratic processes. A recent study by UNESCO estimates 85% of people worry about disinformation, especially its impact on elections. Ghana, considered an exemplary democracy in West Africa goes to the polls this year and the issue of electoral disinformation is one that stakeholders are looking out for. This project seeks to use the tool of media and information literacy (MIL) to address this issue. The project aims to build a critical mass of young voters who are MIL literate to safely navigate the media landscape and at the same time curb disinformation.
