Project: Introducing Living Heritage and Cultural Expressions in Gambian Schools to Safeguard the National Inventoried List of Intangible Cultural Heritage
Description:
The Gambia’s culture sector is characterized by diversity and heterogeneity. As Gambia subscribes to most of the UNESCO cultural conventions, this calls for strengthening the safeguarding of both the tangible and intangible aspects of its cultural heritage, including the arts, for a more peaceful and inclusive society. It is pertinent to rally around the country’s cultural diversity as a source of inspiration to galvanize its people for better understanding and mutual respect of each other’s values and traditions. 

Upon ratifying the UNESCO 2003 Convention on the Safeguarding of the Intangible Cultural Heritage (ICH), the Government of The Gambia committed to safeguarding ICH elements in its territory. This includes inventorying ICH, raising public awareness about the importance of safeguarding ICH and its contribution to sustainable development, and supporting communities in their efforts to safeguard ICH. To this end, the country has recently inventoried 30 ICH elements in its national list of endangered living heritages. This new initiative augurs very well with the vision of the country to enliven these intangible cultural elements with the younger generations of The Gambia. Some of these elements have both gender and sustainable development connotations and it would be a good drive to engage children and their teacher coordinators in ASPnet and Clubs for UNESCO schools to understand and adapt them into their lives in order to foster the appreciation of Gambian culture and values.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particularly in Africa, developing countries, LDCs, and SIDS

Project: Strengthening iLearn Gambia Platform, a digital tool for fostering knowledge sharing and skills development: Revolutionizing Education Access
Description:
Digitalisation is a critical step towards promoting knowledge sharing and skill development, revolutionising education access across the country. ilearngambia is one of the digital online learning platforms designed by the Ministry in their drive to ensure quality education for all, irrespective of location, gender or any other factor that may limit Gambian access to education. The platform makes passive learning more interactive and dynamic by incorporating interactive elements like scripted lessons across the curricula, quizzes, simulations, and multimedia content. In addition, the platform can be used to analysis data and monitor student progress and identify areas for improvement. By collecting and analysing student performance data, educators can gain insights into individual learning needs and tailor instruction accordingly. This data-driven approach to education allows for personalised learning pathways that address each student’s unique strengths and challenges, resulting in better learning outcomes.

 

By incorporating innovative features such as SD cards, Open Educational Resources (OER) materials, and interactive worksheets, the platform becomes more versatile and adaptable to the diverse needs of Gambian students. Integrating SD cards, Open Educational Resources (OER) materials, and interactive worksheets into the ilearngambia platform improves education access by ensuring flexibility, scalability, and inclusivity. SD cards provide offline access, which is especially important in areas with limited internet access. OER materials democratise learning by making resources available for free and adaptable. Interactive worksheets actively engage students, which improves comprehension and retention. These provisions, taken together, empower learners, educators, and communities in Gambia, fostering knowledge sharing and skill development. The provision of these additional learning infrastructures ensures that students even in remote areas can utilise the platform without being hampered by connectivity issues. SD cards offer offline access to a variety of educational materials, such as textbooks, videos, and interactive exercises, allowing for continuous learning regardless of location or internet access. OER materials democratises education by providing free and openly licenced resources that can be adapted and shared by both educators and learners. Educators can customise learning materials to meet their students' specific needs and interests, resulting in a more personalised and engaging learning experience. Further, worksheets are designed to reinforce key concepts, foster critical thinking skills, and provide immediate feedback, allowing for deeper learning experiences. Soft worksheets increase student engagement and comprehension.

 

In order to realise these efforts, material resources (SD Card, Hard Drives, lesson contents, subject contents, cameras, storage devices, editing tools, among others), human resources for lessons preparation, recording, uploading, and editing, among others and financial resources for honorariums for personnel contracted for effective digitalisation.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particularly in Africa, developing countries, LDCs, and SIDS

Project: Etude pour la mise en place d’une base de données sensibles au genre dans les domaines des science, technologie et innovation (STI) et de la recherche développement (R&D) au Togo
Description: La disponibilité en temps opportun de données de qualité sur les STI et la recherche-développement est fondamentale pour définir des politiques et stratégies pertinentes pour faire de ces dernières un levier de développement. Malheureusement, hormis quelques données parcellaires produites de façon isolée par certaines structures de recherche, le pays ne dispose pas de données actualisées et désagrégées selon le genre pour apprécier les progrès réalisés dans le sous-secteur et surtout pour déterminer la contribution réelle de la recherche et de l’innovation au développement du pays. Dès lors, collecter, traiter, analyser et diffuser des données de base actualisées permettra de mettre à la disposition des décideurs et des acteurs du sous-secteur des données sensibles au genre utiles à la prise de décision.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particularly in Africa, developing countries, LDCs, and SIDS

Project: séminaire national de formation et de renforcement des capacités des nouveaux et anciens responsables/encadreurs des écoles associées de l’UNESCO pour une éducation inclusive et de qualité au Togo en vue d’un développement durable
Description: Le réseau des écoles associées a démarré au Togo dans les années 1980 avec deux écoles affiliées.  En 2015 on en dénombrait cent dix. Ces écoles menaient des activités qui favorisaient le brassage culturel, l’amitié, la fraternité, la tolérance entre les jeunes scolaires. Malheureusement, pour plusieurs raisons, ces réseaux ne sont plus actifs. On assiste aujourd’hui à la recrudescence des violences de tout genre. Redynamiser le réseau des écoles associées permettra à ces structures de jouer pleinement leur rôle d’éducateurs par la transmission des compétences au savoir-faire et vivre ensemble, faisant des jeunes, des agents de paix.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particularly in Africa, developing countries, LDCs, and SIDS

Project: CONSERVATION, VALORISATION ET SAUVEGARDE DES FOSSILES DU BASSIN SEDIMENTAIRE COTIER DU TOGO (CVSF_BSCT).
Description: Le Projet de conservation, valorisation et sauvegarde des fossiles du bassin sédimentaire côtier du Togo (CVSF_BSCT) est né d’un constat de la mauvaise conservation et de la dispersion du patrimoine paléontologique togolais. Ce patrimoine d’une valeur inestimable (restes de tortues, crocodiles, requins, raies, serpents, ancêtres d’éléphants et baleines archaïques…), d’âge compris entre 59 et 40 Millions d’années, découvert dans le bassin sédimentaire côtier du Togo est en danger alors qu’il présente des intérêts scientifiques, pédagogiques et géotouristique pour le Togo. Il urge l’aménagement une salle de conservation pour la sauvegarde et la valorisation de ce patrimoine.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particularly in Africa, developing countries, LDCs, and SIDS

Project: Empowerment of Ugandan Youth Networks and Organizations for Youth-Led Gender-responsive Climate Actions, Research and Development
Description:
The Youth Committee of the Uganda National Commission for UNESCO (UNATCOM) established in 2010, has been concerned about the low level of awareness of the youth of Uganda about UNESCO and its programmes designed to empower the youth. Disappointingly, the level of knowledge is not only very low, but even of all the various youth organizations that exist countrywide, only two are associated with UNESCO. These two are UNESCO clubs, one in Gulu University, an upcountry city location and the second at Nakawa Vocational Training College, in Kampala Metropolitan City. This number is too low compared to the situation in the other East African countries such as Rwanda which has 35 UNESCO Clubs and Kenya with 168 UNESCO Clubs and Associations. This is despite the fact that there are many concerns affecting Ugandan youth to address relating to 38.5% of young people aged 10-19 that live in the poorest wealth quintiles, 80% of Uganda’s youth that living  in rural areas and one out of four young people aged 10-24 years residing in urban areas have no means for self-empowerment, 19.6% of young people aged 10-19 years living  in households where the head of household has no education, 22% of adolescents aged 13-18 years dropping out of school while 8.8 million young people aged 15-24 years not engaged in education, employment or under any training1.
Though a National Youth Council Act, 1993 exists, it specifically provides for a National Youth Council which is largely political with no stated focus on the social challenges faced by the youth. There is Uganda Youth Network (UYONET) that purports to be a leading national youth organization working to mainstream young peoples’ engagement in development and governance processes in Uganda and East Africa. This network started in 2002 to respond to the increasing demand for a collective platform for research, training and policy advocacy for young people by young people. However, it does not address the concerns of interest to UNESCO. Statistics indicate  that the youth in Uganda have continued to face multitudes of problems namely: Teenage pregnancy (25% of teenage girls in Uganda age 15-19 have had a child or are pregnant), Health risk behaviors (22% of adolescents have ever had sexual intercourse and  10% of  sexually active adolescents aged 15-19 years had their first sexual encounter before age 15), Child Marriage (10% of women aged 20-24 years married by age 15),  Gender-Based Violence ( 60% of adolescents 10-19 years have experienced physical violence, 42% emotional violence and 10% sexual violence), HIV/AIDS (Every year 9,600 young people aged 15- 19 years are newly infected with HIV)2.  A Cross Sectional Survey Study conducted by scholars show that alcohol, substance use and psychosocial competence of adolescents in selected Secondary Schools in Uganda was at 70% 3. 

1.https://uganda.unfpa.org/sites/default/files/pub-pdf/YoungPeople_FactSheet%20%2811%29_0.pdf).
2.https://uganda.unfpa.org/sites/default/files/pub-pdf/YoungPeople_FactSheet%20%2811%29_0.pdf

3. Abbo, C, Okello, E.S., Muhwezi, W.,   Grace Akello,  G. and  Ovuga, E, (2016): Alcohol, Substance Use and Psychosocial Competence of Adolescents in Selected Secondary Schools in Uganda: A Cross Sectional Survey, Int Neuropsychiatr Dis J. 2016; 7(2): 25387. doi: 10.9734/INDJ/2016/25387
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particularly in Africa, developing countries, LDCs, and SIDS

Project: PROJET DE SENSIBILISATION ET DE FORMATION DES FILLES DU SECONDAIRE GENERAL AUX SCIENCES, TECHNOLOGIE, INGENERIE, MATHEMATIQUE (STIM)
Description:
4.	(a) Présentation succincte du projet
Le présent projet vise à sensibiliser, à former et orienter les filles aux domaines scientifiques par une initiation aux pratiques (manipulations) en chimie, en physique, en science de la vie et de la terre, en informatique et mathématique. Par ailleurs des stands d’information et d’orientation seront animés chaque jour dans le domaine des sciences dures par de spécialistes.  Les filles et les enseignantes découvrent à travers les conférences et débats accordés les femmes ingénieurs, médecins spécialistes, pilotes, informaticien le goût du métier pour une bonne orientation.  D’autres spécialistes peuvent être sollicités suivant leur calendrier de disponibilité.  C’est aussi l’occasion de faire venir les enseignants des provinces afin qu’il puisse découvrir comment nous pourrions nous servir des STEM pour séduire et conquérir les filles à être plus nombreuses dans les sciences.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particularly in Africa, developing countries, LDCs, and SIDS

Project: Formation des jeunes du Canton Bidyo aux techniques d’entretien, de réparation et de montage de forages manuels, électriques et solaires.
Description:
4. (a) Présentation succincte du projet
Il s’agit de doter le canton d’un corps de jeunes formés à intervenir à tout moment et partout où un forage manuel, à pompe électrique ou solaire tomberait en panne. Ce corps de techniciens pourrait également prévenir les pannes en assurant l’entretien et le suivi des forages dès leur réalisation. La formation d’une quarantaine des jeunes aux techniques d’entretien, de réparation, de forages manuels, à pompe électrique et solaire s’avère donc nécessaire pour assurer  la permanence de l’eau potable aux populations des villages du canton Bidyo bénéficiaires de ces ouvrages de production d’eau potable.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particularly in Africa, developing countries, LDCs, and SIDS

Project: Campagne de sensibilisation sur les opportunités de la Réserve de Biosphère de Sena Oura à Pala au Mayo Kebbi
Description:
5.	 (a) Présentation succincte du projet
Grâce à une gouvernance ouverte entre la République du Tchad et l’UNESCO, la réserve de biosphère de Sena-Oura a été créée et est la première réserve de biosphère du Tchad. Elle couvre une surface totale de 173 520 ha constituant les derniers vestiges intacts de la savane soudanaise du pays et abrite des éléphants, des Elans de Derby et des girafes. Grâce à la profusion de terres fertiles et aux conditions agro climatiques favorables, l’agriculture traditionnelle et l’élevage du bétail en particulier assurent la subsistance de près de 90 % de la population. La sylviculture joue également un rôle important dans l’économie locale, avec la production de produits très prisés comme le miel et l’huile de karité.
Afin de reconnaître le rôle majeur que jouent les réserves de biosphère pour l’ensemble de la zone de Sena-Oura, l’Association des Jeunes pour l’Assainissement et la Protection de l’Environnement (AJAPE), une ONG nationale partenaire à l’UNESCO en collaboration avec le Ministère de l’Environnement, de la Pêche et du Développement Durable compte organiser des campagnes d’information et de sensibilisation, en faveur des populations (jeunes, femmes, chefs de village, chefs de canton, autorités locales…). La date précise de cette manifestation est programmée du 12 au 20 juin 2024 à Pala.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particularly in Africa, developing countries, LDCs, and SIDS

Project: Action citoyenne pour  la promotion de la culture de la paix et la cohabitation pacifique      dans la province du Guerra.
Description: Le présent projet est conçu pour mener des activités de lutte et de prévention des conflits intercommunautaires dans la province du Guéra. Les activités concernent la sensibilisation de masse, les formations des comités de gestion de conflits, la diffusion des messages de la cohabitation pacifique et du vivre ensemble à travers les antennes de radios pour toucher un grand public et un grand événement rassemblant beaucoup des gens sous forme de fête pour une communion entre les communautés vivant dans le Guéra. Ce qui permettra un développement socioéconomique de la Guéra et du Tchad en général. Le projet sera mis en œuvre dans tous les cinq départements que compte la province du Guera à savoir Abtouyour, Guera, Mangalmé, Bar Signakha et Garada. La durée du projet est six mois à compter du 1er mai au 31 octobre 2024 avec une enveloppe de 25 913 dollars.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action

Project: ATELIER DE SENSIBILISATION DES ELEVES DES ECOLES ASSOCIEES A L’UNESCO DU CAMEROUN  SUR  L’UTILISATION RESPONSABLE D’INTERNET ET DES RESEAUX SOCIAUX
Description: Internet est devenu un espace de divertissement, d’interactions, de connaissances mais également un espace à risques dans lequel on pénètre d’un simple clic. Aujourd’hui, alors que l’âge de la première navigation ne cesse de diminuer, les jeunes représentent la population la plus exposée aux risques et dangers d’Internet. Il est primordial de les former et sensibiliser à l’utilisation de ces outils. Il est également important de les apprendre à communiquer sur les réseaux sociaux. Ceci est l’objet de l’atelier que le Réseau national des écoles associées à l’UNESCO du Cameroun veut organiser.

Project: « Apprendre pour vivre ensemble :  Contribution du réseau des écoles associées de l’UNESCO du BURKINA FASO »
Description:
Les messages forts à travers le projet intitulé : « Apprendre pour vivre ensemble : Contribution du réseau des écoles associées de l’UNESCO du BURKINA FASO » sont que :
Le Burkina Faso, à l’instar des autres pays de la région du Sahel traverse une crise sécuritaire difficile marquée par des attaques terroristes qui affectent beaucoup le système éducatif. Selon le rapport de l’Éducation en Situation d’Urgence du Ministère de l’Éducation nationale et de l’Alphabétisation et de la Promotion des Langues nationale  du 31 décembre 2023, 5330 écoles sont fermées avec 820 865 élèves déplacés internes  et 23955 enseignants soit 20% de l’ensemble des structures éducatives.  Au nombre des écoles fermées figurent les écoles associées à l’UNESCO. Il convient de relever qu’il existe au Burkina Faso, plus de deux cent (200) écoles associées à l’UNESCO mais la plupart sont fermées à cause de la situation sécuritaire. Cette situation préjudiciable à une éducation de qualité compromet les actions de l’UNESCO.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particularly in Africa, developing countries, LDCs, and SIDS

Project: Education sur la gestion durable des sols au Burkina Faso à travers un jeu de rôle appliqué à la culture de l’igname, plante alimentaire, commerciale et culturelle (J’IGNAME)
Description:
L’igname fait partie des cultures les plus historiques et les plus ancrées dans les cultures      
      des peuples qui la cultivent en Afrique de l’Ouest.
Malgré son importance socio-culturel et économique, l’igname est toujours classée parmi les cultures dites orphelines. De telles cultures, malgré leur contribution à la sécurité alimentaire et au revenu d’une proportion importante de la population mondiale, bénéficient très peu d’investissements de la part des gouvernements et de leurs partenaires. Par conséquent, peu d’études ont été conduites dans le sens d’une meilleure connaissance de l’igname, d’une sécurisation de sa diversité génétique gage de son rôle socio-culturel et médicinal et d’un renforcement de sa contribution dans l’économie des ménages à travers un investissement structurant.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particularly in Africa, developing countries, LDCs, and SIDS

Project: Atelier de sensibilisation et d’Appui à l’Elaboration d’une Stratégie nationale de l’Intelligence Artificielle (IA) au Gabo
Description:
Les progrès technologiques rapides dans le domaine de l’intelligence artificielle (IA), ainsi que d'autres avancées technologiques tels que la robotique, l’informatique en nuage et l'Internet des objets, transforment les disciplines, les économies, les industries et remettent en question ce que signifie d’être humain.
En Afrique, et particulièrement au Gabon, la compréhension, l’image, la bonne gouvernance de l'IA restent encore des défis importants de notre époque. Cela un apprentissage mutuel basé sur les leçons et les bonnes pratiques émergeant des différentes juridictions à travers le monde, en respectant les normes et standards mondiaux, et en étant ancrée dans la paix pour un développement durable. Madame Audrey Azoulay, Directrice Générale de l’UNESCO, soulignait encore à ce propos lors de la 41ème session de la Conférence générale que : « L’intelligence artificielle peut être une chance formidable pour accélérer la réalisation des objectifs de développement durable. Mais toute révolution technologique entraîne de nouveaux déséquilibres qu’il faut essayer d’anticiper ».
Après l’adoption de la Recommandation sur l’Ethique de l’Intelligence Artificielle, l’UNESCO a apporté son soutien aux différents Etats membres, dont le Gabon, dans le processus d’évaluation de l’état de préparation sur l’IA. Ce projet a pour objectif l’organisation d’un atelier de sensibilisation et d’appui à l’élaboration d’une stratégie nationale de l’IA pour impulser une transformation numérique en vue d’un développement durable au Gabon
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particularly in Africa, developing countries, LDCs, and SIDS

Project: Séminaire – Atelier de contribution à une stratégie nationale de promotion et développement du Handisport au Gabon
Description:
Le sport de masse est un puissant instrument pour promouvoir l’inclusion et rassembler les gens. Lorsqu’il est ciblé et fondé sur des valeurs et une éducation physique de qualité, il peut avoir un impact positif sur la vie des personnes, en particulier celles se trouvant dans des situations vulnérables, telles que les personnes en situation de handicap. 
Créée en 1976, la Conférence Internationale des Ministres et Hauts Fonctionnaires responsables de l'Education Physique et du Sport (MINEPS) est un forum qui facilite l’échange intellectuel et technique en matière d’éducation physique et de sport. Au terme de sa Septième (7e) Conférence internationale (MINEPS VII), organisée à Bakou (République d'Azerbaïdjan) du 26 au 29 juin 2023, les Etats membres ont encore donné au sport la place qui lui revient dans l'agenda international par l’adoption de l’Alliance Fit4Life « en forme pour la vie ».
« En forme pour la vie » est programme basé sur le sport et conçu pour soutenir et améliorer  l’élaboration de politiques inclusives et intégrés de la pratique du sport comme facteur d’épanouissement des populations et de transformation. 
Au Gabon, du fait de sa nature, le Comité Intergouvernemental pour l’Education Physique et le Sport (CIGEPS) de la Commission Nationale Gabonaise pour l’UNESCO, a le potentiel pour engager le gouvernement gabonais dans un effort national coordonné pour optimiser les bénéfices socio-économiques tangibles des programmes de sport et d’éducation physique, et de défendre des investissements intelligents dans le sport pour un développement durable dans le cadre global du Programme à l’horizon 2030.

Project: Support to the Review of the Science and Technology Policy for Malawi
Description: The project will provide support to the Directorate of Science, Technology, and Innovation to carry out stakeholder consultations for the review of the Science, Technology and Innovation policy for Malawi. Description: The project is aimed to raise awareness for Malawi to ratify the Conventions and UNESCO Recommendations. Project: Workshop on Climate Change and Sustainable Development
Description:
Despite efforts to promote sustainable development, Liberia remains highly vulnerable to the impacts of climate change. The country’s long coastline and reliance on agriculture make it particularly susceptible to sea-level rise, storm surges, and changing rainfall patterns. These impacts pose significant challenges to the country’s development goals, including efforts to reduce poverty and promote economic growth. Moreover, it is proven that Liberia is facing numerous challenges related to climate change and sustainable development, including increasing frequency and severity of extreme weather events, deforestation, and limited access to clean water and energy, there is a lack of widespread awareness and capacity at the community level to address these issues effectively. Communities often lack the knowledge, resources, and support needed to develop and implement climate-resilient strategies and sustainable development practices. Additionally, there may be a disconnection between national policies and local priorities, hindering coordinated action at the grassroots level. Consequently, there is an urgent need to empower communities with the tools, information, and skills necessary to adapt to climate change, mitigate its impacts, and promote sustainable development practices that enhance resilience and improve livelihoods across Liberia.
To address some of these challenges, there is a need to build climate resilience and promote sustainable development at the community level. Community-based strategies can help to ensure that interventions are tailored to local needs and realities, while also empowering communities to take action to adapt to climate change and build resilience. However, there are significant barriers to implementing such strategies in Liberia, including limited resources, capacity gaps, and a lack of awareness and understanding of climate change issues among communities.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action

Project: Cultural Evolution: Empowering Community through Human Sciences and Sustainable Tourism
Description:
Project’s main overall objective
To create a platform that intertwines cultural heritage, human science, and sustainable tourism, fostering community engagement and economic empowerment in Musanze District.
Project’s specific objectives and planned activities to achieve expected results
Objective 1: Cultural Heritage documentation and Preservation Activities:
Conducting Comprehensive Cultural Heritage Surveys: The project will initiate comprehensive surveys within the local communities to meticulously document and preserve their rich cultural heritage. These surveys will encompass various elements, including traditions, folklore, rituals, traditional practices, indigenous knowledge, and customs unique to the community. Utilizing a participatory approach, the surveys will involve community members, elders, artisans, and local experts to gather in-depth information and personal narratives that capture the essence of the community's identity and heritage.
Workshops for community engagement: This includes conducting a series of interactive and educational workshops aimed at involving the local communities actively in the preservation and promotion of their cultural heritage. These workshops will serve as platforms for sharing knowledge, traditions, and stories among community members. Through hands-on activities, discussions, and presentations, participants will learn about the significance of their cultural heritage and ways to protect it for future generations.
Objective 2: Capacity building and Knowledge Sharing
Activities:
Training Sessions for Cultural Appreciation and Sustainable Tourism Practices: The project will conduct tailored training sessions aimed at enhancing the understanding of cultural appreciation and sustainable tourism practices among locals and stakeholders involved in the tourism industry. These sessions will offer insights into the importance of preserving cultural heritage, promoting tourism, and fostering positive interactions between tourists and local communities. By providing practical knowledge and tools, these sessions will empower participants to contribute effectively to sustainable tourism development while respecting cultural diversity.
Seminars for Knowledge Exchange: The project will organize seminars, inviting experts, community leaders, and stakeholders to share insights and experiences on culture, human science, and sustainable development. These events will serve as platforms for intellectual discussions, knowledge dissemination, and the exchange of innovative ideas. Through interactive sessions, participants will explore best practices, emerging trends, and strategies for leveraging cultural heritage in fostering social inclusion and sustainable growth.
Objective 3: Sustainable Tourism and Economic Development
Activities:
Development of Sustainable Tourism Initiatives: In collaboration with Red Rocks Initiative for
Sustainable	Development	(RRISD),	the	project	will	develop	innovative	sustainable	tourism initiatives. These initiatives will be designed to offer tourists authentic cultural experiences while concurrently generating economic opportunities for the local community. By focusing on cultural immersion and travel practices, these initiatives aim to attract visitors interested in experiencing the area's cultural heritage firsthand. Ikirenga Art and Culture Promotion will work closely with RRISD to identify and develop tourism activities that promote cultural understanding, preserve traditions, and contribute to the socio-economic development of the community.
Establishment of Market Linkages and Platforms: The project will create market linkages and platforms aimed at empowering local artisans, performers, and entrepreneurs within the community. These platforms will provide opportunities for these individuals to showcase their traditional crafts, artworks, performances, and entrepreneurial ventures to visiting tourists. By facilitating these connections, the project seeks to create a direct channel for artisans to market and sell their products, thereby enhancing their visibility, income, and sustainability.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particularly in Africa, developing countries, LDCs, and SIDS

Project: Biodiversity Assessment of Mukura Biosphere Reserve Forest, Western Rwanda
Description:
Project’s main overall objective 

The overall objective of the study is to conduct the biodiversity assessment of Mukura biosphere reserve forest focussing on insects, birds, mammals, reptiles, amphibians, and aquatic biodiversity.  

Project’s specific objectives and planned activities to achieve expected results

The project will consist of assessing the biodiversity of Mukura biosphere reserve forest. Targeted groups of biodiversity are leaf-litter arthropods, butterflies, water macroinvertebrates, algae, birds, mammals, reptiles, plants, and amphibians. Data will be collected from the buffer and core zones and in the rivers located either in the buffer or in the core zones of the forest. Specific objectives consist of (1) sampling and identifying arthropods to the family level, and other taxa to species level. Sampled and identified biodiversity will be statistically analysed to assess (2) species richness and species diversity in the forest. Further, (3) data will be used to communicate the importance of the Mukura Forest as suitable habitat for biodiversity, and (4) a preliminary checklist of each group of biodiversity will be published to communicate the existing biodiversity in the area. Further, (5) specimens of great importance will be housed in the RNH and RZC. Furthermore, data will be recorded in the RBIS and made free accessible.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action

Project: Utilisation responsable des réseaux sociaux
Description:
Trois grandes activités seront prévues pour ce projet :
Une activité de plaidoyerqui a pour objectif principal de mobiliser l’attention des acteurs locaux et les parties prenantes en vue de l’éducation permanente des adolescents/jeunes sur l’utilisation des réseaux sociaux. 
La deuxième activité consiste à sensibiliser les jeunes sur « l’utilisation responsable des réseaux sociaux ». Sur ce, des adolescents/jeunes auront bénéficié des séances d’animation en salle dont la première partie concerne le téléphone portable (précaution technique et comportement convenable de son utilisateur) et l’autre partie sur les connaissances requises pour l’utilisation des réseaux sociaux ainsi que les règlements en vigueur applicable aux utilisateurs (lois sur la protection de la personne, charte de la communication, droit de diffusion des images et la cybercriminalité).
La troisième activité est une activité interactive du projet, par l’organisation des concours en trois volets : production de vidéo, présentation des talents, image de déviance positive.

Project: Séminaire sur « Jeunesse et migration irrégulière au Sénégal »
Description:
L’objectif général poursuivi à travers ce séminaire est de sensibiliser les jeunes sur les risques, de diagnostiquer les causes profondes de la migration irrégulière et de proposer des solutions pour stopper le fléau afin de lutter contre le phénomène.
•	Encourager et soutenir des initiatives de recherches sur les causes, les effets et les dynamiques de la migration.
•	Analyser les conséquences sociales, économiques et politiques de la migration pour les terroirs, la communauté en particulier la jeunesse et l’état central.
•	Examiner les politiques nationales et internationales liées à la migration.
•	Rechercher et mettre en œuvre des stratégies de sensibilisation des jeunes sur les questions migratoires.
•	Promouvoir dans les Médias et à l’école des récits, narratifs et informations vrais sur les migrations.
•	Créer des réseaux de partage d’expérience et de débats sur la migration.
•	Proposer des solutions pour la gestion efficace des flux migratoires.

Project: UNLOCKYOUNG POTENTIAL FOR SUSTAINABLE DEVELOPMENT
Description:
The project is titled as ‘’unlock young potential for the sustainable development’’ which will be implemented in all six targeted zobas (administrative regions) by NUEYS in coordination with ministry of education. The main aim of the project is to lay conducive platform to turn promising ideas into practical social solutions and to give an opportunity to the young people with brilliant ideas through an innovative method to turn their ideas into reality. Therefore, the effects of the program will ignite the anticipated movement of encouraging entrepreneurship and stimulate young Eritreans to act on their dreams that helps their communities in the near future.
The main activities of the project are namely. exhibition, nationwide call for innovation projects, consultancy, equipping innovation center an additional activity will be providing startup budget to the best projects in order to attract youth to come up with brilliant ideas that can bring sustainable solution to the main problems of the community.it is also a plat form to cultivate inventive creative ideas among young people.
Formulation of innovation clubs will take place in all REGIONS. So as 18 clubs with 15-20 members in each club will be formulated. Further for enhancing and upgrading innovation ideas among young people competition will be organized during one-day exhibition time in all targeted zobas and the best ones will be awarded by the regional innovation committee. To this end, regional innovation committee (formulated by NUEYS in three zobas) will be in charge of all innovation activities in their respective regions. 
Innovation rooms (in existing youth centers will be equipped with different necessary materials including hand tools which can help young people to practice and a center for the development of models initiated by the youth.
Finally, the best three project will get financial support (start-up budget) to reach the desired level of production.

Description: The proposed project, aligned with UNESCO's 42C/5 Draft Document and Budget for 2024-2025, seeks funding to implement satellite-based mapping for climate heat maps in Caribbean small island states. By enhancing spatial understanding of heat impact, this initiative aims to empower stakeholders and citizens in developing targeted strategies for climate resilience. Key project outcomes include bolstering evidence-based decision-making through heightened climate data accessibility and fostering public awareness of climate effects amidst rising temperatures for Caribbean small island states. This endeavor aligns with UNESCO's commitment to sustainable development, providing a tool for mitigation and adaptation concerning the adverse impacts of climate change on vulnerable island communities.

Project: Projet d’inventaire des mémoires de l’esclavage en Haïti, avec une phase pilote dans les 19 communes du département du Nord
Description: Le Nord d’Haïti héberge des vestiges intacts liés à la mémoire et à l’histoire de la traite transatlantique des esclaves : habitations coloniales, fortifications, palais, témoignages véhiculés par la tradition orale depuis des générations. Cependant, il n’existe aucun inventaire de ces éléments patrimoniaux. Le présent projet d’inventaire vise à combler ce manque. Il combine collecte de données de terrain et ateliers sur la traite des Noirs, la construction des identités et leur rapport avec les problèmes de racisme, d’inégalité et de clivages sociaux. L’action participe ainsi à la revitalisation du projet « Les Routes des personnes mises en esclavage ».

Project: Prévention et lutte contre les incendies à Forêt-des-Pins (Unité I), réserve de biosphère La Selle
Description: Le double parc national naturel de la Forêt-des-pins, situé à 1 894 m d’altitude, est la plus grande réserve de Pinus occidentalis d'Haïti. Cet espace est toutefois sous la menace d’incendies chaque année, en raison surtout d’activités humaines. Par exemple, 150 hectares de Pinus ont brulé en février 2023. Le présent projet aborde cette problématique d’incendie par une prévention ciblée avec les communautés proches du parc. Il vise à mettre en place un processus de mobilisation communautaire et d’accompagnement de la population sur la prévention et la gestion des feux de forêt.

Project: Célébration du cinquantenaire de la disparition de Suzanne Comhaire-Sylvain en association avec l’UNESCO
Description:
La commémoration du cinquantenaire de la disparition de Suzanne Comhaire-Sylvain, première femme anthropologue et linguiste d'Haïti (1898-1975), aura lieu de mars 2024 à juin 2025, avec le soutien de Cuba, de l'Éthiopie et du Gabon. L'événement est intégré aux célébrations de l'UNESCO pour le biennium 2024-2025.  

Écrivaine engagée, Comhaire-Sylvain a créé des liens entre Haïti et l'Afrique, soulignant l'importance de l'héritage africain dans la culture haïtienne. Disciple de Mauss, Malinowski et Métraux, elle a publié des ouvrages majeurs sur la littérature orale africaine et haïtienne, symbolisant une figure clé des sciences humaines et sociales.

Project: Improving Literacy and Numeracy at the Kindergarten Level
Description:
Division of Public Education’s focus is to strengthen the quality of the education that we offer to our students. In doing so, it is the intention to focus on the earlier age groups specifically the kindergarten year 1 and 2 classes. This is where formal education begins for most children entering the public schools, as most of the students who are enrolled in Public Education do not attend preschool (1-3 years).  Our kindergarten classes begin with the kindergarten 1- or the 4-year old’s and then the student moves on into the second year of kindergarten, or the 5- years old’s.  

The focus is to restructure the teaching instruction for this group. In doing, so it is essential to have the early childhood material which will allow the teachers to work more effectively with these students.  The expectation is not only to see that the students are academically ready, but to also see that they have developed socially and emotionally as well. Therefore, the early childhood materials purchased must be aligned with the learning standards and teaching objectives of our curriculum.  The materials should reflect diverse backgrounds, and the learning styles of students.  It is the belief that the students will be successful learners in the long run because a solid foundation for learning has been developed for these young children. 

Research shows that high-quality learning resources can boost student engagement, motivation, and comprehension.  Research also shows that if kindergarten children can explore while learning during play, it helps to stimulate their creativity and higher thinking skills.  They will not be passive learners but will be actively engaged in their daily learning activities. This is what we would like to achieve with our students. We are hoping that with this grant we can enhance our kindergarten classrooms and make them more conducive for learning.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action

Project: “Danses et spiritualité des peuples indigènes du Paraguay” - documentation, registre, systématisation et diffusion de danses originaires référentiel de peuples indigènes
Description: L'Association Culturelle ACCEL, propose d'enregistrer, documenter, systématiser et diffuser la mémoire orale et la corporéité qui marquent la spiritualité des peuples indigènes, cultures ancestrales du Paraguay, en prenant comme référence les danses de 3 peuples, Guana, Nivaclé et Mbya Guaraní, de différentes familles linguistiques. Ce projet « Danses et spiritualité des peuples indigènes du Paraguay », enregistrement audiovisuel et écrit, pourrait faire partie du Conseil International de la Danse CID-UNESCO. Grâce aux résultats obtenus du Programme de Participation, le thème de la spiritualité dans la danse des communautés indigènes peut être présenté comme candidature au patrimoine immatériel du Paraguay
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action

Project: Creación y Conformación del Comite Nacional del MOST Paraguay
Description:
El objetivo de este proyecto es la instalación del Comité Nacional del MOST en Paraguay.

A lo largo de los años, el Consejo Intergubernamental del Programa MOST ha subrayado el papel crucial Comités Nacionales y el valor de su contribución, destacando la importancia de mantenerlos en el contexto específico de cada país. Se alienta a los Estados Miembros de la UNESCO a establecer un comité nacional para alcanzar los objetivos del Programa MOST y, en particular, para desarrollar las capacidades nacionales en el área de las ciencias sociales.

El objetivo fundamental de un Comité Nacional MOST es el de fortalecer las capacidades nacionales de investigación en ciencias sociales (1), a fin de contribuir en el logro de las prioridades nacionales, y fomentar el vínculo entre la investigación social y los actores políticos que trabajan en el sector del desarrollo social.

Para cumplir con las formalidades necesarias, se inscribiría el Comité Nacional MOST Paraguay, en el Consejo Intergubernamental (CIG) del Programa de Gestión de las Transformaciones Sociales (MOST).

Los Comités Nacionales tienen la misión de lograr los objetivos del Programa MOST a nivel país. Persiguen los mismos objetivos, pero cada comité nacional tiene sus propias prioridades.

En el caso paraguayo, el desarrollo de las ciencias sociales, ha logrado avances en la última década como la creación de la Facultad de Ciencias Sociales en la Universidad Nacional de Asunción, el desarrollo de investigaciones y el apoyo a investigadores a través de programas del Consejo Nacional de Ciencias y Tecnología (CONACYT), la posibilidad de realizar cursos de postgrado en universidades extranjeras a través del Programa de Becas Carlos Antonio López (BECAL). La creación de universidades públicas y privadas en diferentes partes del país.

A pesar de estos avances todavía se necesita en el país un mayor impulso en el campo de la investigación, la difusión de los resultados y la utilización de los mismos en la formulación de las políticas públicas. Las políticas no siempre dialogan con las ciencias sociales y en ocasiones, a pesar de contar con datos e informes provenientes de investigaciones, estos no son aprovechados para el diseño y el mejoramiento de las políticas públicas, los planes y programas.

Además, Paraguay requiere mayor comunicación e intercambio con grupos académicos y e investigadores y centros académicos a nivel regional e internacional.

A partir de la instalación del Comité Nacional MOST, se elaborará una Agenda de Trabajo, con reuniones mensuales, observando las problemáticas sociales y coyunturales del país.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particularly in Africa, developing countries, LDCs, and SIDS

Project: Aruba Youth Media Lab
Description:
The Aruba Youth Media Lab
Fostering a youth-led media hub to bring stories from young people in Aruba ages between 11 to 16 years old to the community.. The Aruba Youth Media Lab is not just about learning the basics of journalism; it's about actively participating and using their voice. Throughout this program, participants will delve into print, audio, visual, and digital journalism, focusing on their storytelling abilities to cater specifically to their peers. During the program, the participants will learn from media experts and journalists how to make news bytes and reels resulting in five news broadcasts they will also have written, produced, and recorded.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action

Project: Communication and Information as a Public Good: Designing a national communication framework for Aruba
Description:
The proposed project seeks funding to design a framework for the development of communication and information as a public good in Aruba.  The innovative design research-approach involves multilateral and intergenerational stakeholders in an inclusive manner, to develop a communication ecosystem suitable for a small island developing state (SIDS) like Aruba. The project contributes to knowledge development, while building professional capacity and designing toolkits for a future CI-ecosystem in Aruba. The project will dissemminate the outcomes to the stakeholders and the general public.

UNESCO Aruba commissioned the project Communication and Information as a Public Good: Designing a national communication framework for Aruba.

Project: ABU-Capacity Building for Advancing Gender Equality, Diversity and Inclusion in Media Organisational Policy
Description: The project aims to enhance regional capacity in promoting gender equality, diversity, and inclusion (GEDI) within media organisations. It focuses on developing and implementing comprehensive strategies to advance GEDI policies and practices, fostering inclusive workplaces. Key components include reviewing organisational policies, conducting needs assessments, helping to develop “Media organisations’ gender, diversity and inclusion action plans”, delivering workshops, engaging stakeholders, monitoring progress, and documenting outcomes. Ultimately, the project seeks to empower media organizations and educational authorities to create more equitable and inclusive spaces for their employees and stakeholders.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particularly in Africa, developing countries, LDCs, and SIDS

Project: ACWW-Planting the Seeds of Peace
Description: This training project will empower Ukrainian refugee students and women teachers in the Educational Hub hosted by Școala Gimnazialǎ “Uruguay”. It will strengthen the capacities and resilience of survivors of violence and war with practical tools, helping them become builders of a safer, happier future grounded in human rights and gender equality.  Horticultural training will address trauma caused by conflict and displacement. By supporting a conscious approach to horticulture and life on earth, it builds on the understanding that gardening reduces stress, anxiety, and depression and improves psychological wellbeing. Horticulture classes and practical sessions will run throughout the year.

Description:
T4NA is a unique youth grass-roots initiative that promotes co-leadership and collaborative governance in Africa. It has its origins in a group of African students at Sophia University Institute (Italy) who in 2014 felt
the urge to transform their continent

Project: FMTS-Formation à l’hydrologie de 3 techniciens tchadiens en vue de la réalisation de 2 projets d’accès à l’eau pour tous
Description:
Former au Centre 2IE de Ouagadougou X Techniciens Hydrologues pour conduire X projets locaux d’accès à l’eau, à savoir :
•	Le projet SOLIDEV consiste en la réalisation de forages dans le département d’Assoungha, à proximité de la frontière du Soudan
•	Le projet CAPROSEC consiste en la formation d’un technicien supérieur géographe en vue d’assurer à son tour  la formation intégrée de 20 jeunes producteurs en zone pétrolière aux techniques d’irrigation pour la promotion de la culture de contresaison au bord de la rivière Nya (Riz, maraichage, pépinière, etc.).

Project: IBO-Navigating Contemporary Challenges and Opportunities in Curriculum Design: A regional conversation
Description: To foster regional connections, share knowledge and deepen understanding in the domain of curriculum design, as an education system tool, to affect improvements in learner outcomes via the convening of specialists, academics, ministry teams and international organizations over a two day seminar. The event will build on previous explorations of the domain in the region focusing on contemporary issues of curriculum design e.g. the role of curriculum in supporting equality and equity, the development of competencies, the role of schools and teachers as policy actors implementing, negotiating and interacting with the curriculum, teaching and learning for life, and teaching at the right level.

Project: APICE-Hacia la formación integral de los jóvenes de educación superior en ALC, provenientes de entornos vulnerables, con perspectiva de género, mediante el fomento del aprendizaje socio emocional que contribuye a su salud mental,
Description: ÁPICE presenta este proyecto dirigido a fomentar el aprendizaje socio emocional para fortalecer la salud mental de los jóvenes de educación superior en ALC, provenientes de entornos vulnerables, con perspectiva de género, y de esta manera contribuir a su formación integral, su permanencia y éxito académico; y a la construcción de sociedades justas, pacíficas y sostenibles, mediante la identificación, formulación y/o fortalecimiento, e intercambio de planes de acción generados en Instituciones de Educación Superior, IES, y en Instituciones, Programas y Servicios de Crédito Educativo, IPSCE.

Project: UNIMA- Roots & Wings Rencontres internationales sur la marionnette en Afrique – formation et création
Description:
Roots & Wings est un projet international en trois temps successifs touchant aux questions de formation, de création et de développement des arts de la marionnette sur le continent africain. Il est porté conjointement par 4 pays, servant de catalyseurs sur leur zone à 19 pays du continent bénéficiaires du projet. Il se prépare et associe des pédagogues de différentes zones du monde et est coordonné par l’UNIMA – Union International de la Marionnette.
Il a pour objectifs principaux de travailler à l’assise de pôles de formation pour les artistes et au développement des arts de la marionnette sur le continent. Il souhaite également permettre aux leaders du continent de s’accorder sur un plan commun stratégique à longue échéance pour le développement des arts de la marionnette en Afrique.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particularly in Africa, developing countries, LDCs, and SIDS

Project: CCIC-Projet de formation de techniciens hydrologues pour l’Accès à l’Eau pour Tous en Afrique”  pour des ONGs locales de la République de Centrafrique
Description: L’accès à l’eau est l’un des défis majeurs du XXIe siècle. Selon l’OMS 1,1 milliard de personnes dans le monde n’ont pas accès à une eau saine. En conséquence, 4 millions de personnes, dont une majorité d'enfants, meurent chaque année de maladies liées à l’eau. Le manque d’accès à l’eau reste un enjeu sanitaire et humain majeur dans différentes régions de la République centrafricaine. En étroite collaboration avec le centre international de formation 2IE de Ouagadougou, le projet vise à améliorer les conditions de vie de milliers d’habitants de plusieurs régions du pays par la formation et le renforcement des compétences techniques de plusieurs membres d’organisations non-gouvernementales locales, actives dans les domaines de la création de puits, de l’irrigation, de l’assainissement des eaux et œuvrant à la sensibilisation aux questions d’hygiène liées à l’eau.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particularly in Africa, developing countries, LDCs, and SIDS

Project: ICTM- 48th World Conference of the International Council for Traditional Music
Description: The World Conference of the International Council for Traditional Music (ICTM) is held once every two years in different parts of the world. In January 2025, ICTM will hold its 48th World Conference in Wellington, New Zealand, hosted by Te Herenga Waka, Victoria University of Wellington. The 7-day conference will showcase diverse research and practice in music-dance through individual papers, organized panels, workshops, performances, roundtables, and films/video screenings based on seven themes, with specific emphasis on Indigenous communities, environment, displacement, and relocation. Selected presentations will be revised and published in our flagship journal, the Yearbook for Traditional Music in 2026.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particularly in Africa, developing countries, LDCs, and SIDS

Project: the incumbent will contribute to strengthening UNESCO’s political analysis and capacities in an evolving and volatile international environment in particular on specific developments which can have political and operational impact on UNESCO’s action.
Description:
Under the guidance and supervision of DIR/CAB, the incumbent will contribute to strengthening UNESCO’s political analysis and capacities in an evolving and volatile international environment in particular on specific developments which can have political and operational impact on UNESCO’s action.
The incumbent will also participate in strengthening communication channels with Member States and advising the Director-General and DIR/CAB on potential issues that require political coordination, inlcuding :
1.	Liaison with the Sector for Priority Africa and External Relations (PAX), organize and participate in meetings between the Director-General and/or DIR/CAB and the representatives of UNESCO Member States and accompany the Director-General on official visits as required.
2.	Work closely with Cabinet’s members in order to anticipate and manage any sensitive political matters related to the implementation of programmes and initiatives.
3.	Provides Dir/CAB and the Director-General with political analysis on specific and sensitive matters which can impact the Organization’s activities and governance
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 11 - Accountable, efficient and effective management in pursuit of the Organization's results
Output EN: 11.CAB1 - Rational and cost-effective functioning of the Directorate and Executive Office improved and UNESCO’s strategic positioning and leadership role as an active and efficient partner within the United Nations system in achieving the Sustainable Development Goals strengthened

Project: Preservation and Awareness-raising of Documentary Heritage in AlUla an
Description: This project aims to raise awareness of the global significance of Saudi Arabian documentary heritage and that of the larger Arab region among stakeholders as well as the public, including by creating the Kingdoms Institute Platform for the Promotion of Documentary Heritage in the Arab World. It also aims to build capacity for the identification, preservation, and accessibility of documentary heritage among memory institutions in AlUla and Saudi Arabia through the creation of a National MoW Committee, and possibly a National Register, and enhancing scholarly research and academic reflection on documentary heritage for intercultural dialogue.
Outcome EN: Outcome 8 - Foster knowledge sharing and skills development in the digital age
Output EN: 8.CI4 - Member States are enabled to foster universal access to information and knowledge, including through the Information for All Programme (IFAP), as well as through Open Solutions, and through the identification, preservation and accessibility of documentary heritage

Project: Enhancing the Safety of Journalists in Africa and the Arab Region
Description: This project will contribute to peace, sustainable development, and democracy through promoting the safety of journalists in support of the UN Plan of Action on the Safety of Journalists and the Issue of Impunity (UN Plan), by focusing on the UN Plan's "Three Ps": the prevention, protection against, and prosecution of crimes and attacks against journalists in ODA-eligible countries. It will build on past experience and years of successful initiatives, including those implemented by the Multi Donor Programme on Freedom of Expression and Safety of Journalists, since its inception in 2017.
Outcome EN: Outcome 6 - Promote freedom of expression and the right to information
Output EN: 6.CI2 - Member States have strengthened capacities and raised awareness to enhance norms and policies related to freedom of expression, press freedom, safety of journalists, including women journalists, and the right to access information, online and offline

Project: PROJETS DE RENOVATION LES PLUS URGENTS AU SIEGE DE L’UNESCO A PARIS
Description:
Le manque de financement des rénovations importantes des bâtiments du Siège au cours des 20 dernières années a entraîné une augmentation des besoins d’entretien, la plupart des travaux devant être effectués en urgence. 
En application de la décision 215 EX/27 du Conseil exécutif, le Secrétariat a présenté au Comité du Siège, à sa 211e session, un Plan directeur actualisé dans lequel les projets  ont été classés par ordre de priorité et d’urgence, selon qu’il s’agit de remédier à des défauts structurels ou d’améliorer le fonctionnement de l’Organisation.
Quatre projets prioritaires cruciaux ont été présentés au Conseil exécutif à sa 216e session, dont l’un, relatif à la rénovation de salle de conférence XVI a obtenu un financement de 1 225 000€ au titre du compte spécial pour les investissements stratégiques et en équipements (CSI).  Le Conseil exécutif prend note de besoins de financement sur des autres projets prioritaires notamment la rénovation du bâtiment VI (Bonvin), la restauration des façades et toitures des bâtiments I et III, et la restauration des patios du bâtiment IV.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 11 - Accountable, efficient and effective management in pursuit of the Organization's results
Output EN: 11.OPS1 -  Procurement and contracting function enhanced at HQ and in support of the field network and programme implementation facilities’ effective management and sustainable financing ensured

Project: Secondment JAMSTEC
Description:
Under the direct supervision of the Head of Marine Policy and Regional Coordination section, the Programme Specialist seconded by JAMSTEC will be responsible to assist in matters relating to law of the sea and transfer of marine technology by: 
- providing inputs to IOC initiatives relating to UNCLOS 
- Liaising with Member States on the implementation of activities and programmes on law of the sea, transfer of marine technology and marine scientific research 
- act as technical secretary for GEBCO 
-mobilising extra budget in support of the implementation of IOC's mandate relating to UNCLOS.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health and accelerate the transition towards sustainable management of ocean-related risks and opportunities

Project: GRRIP
Description: GRRIP is an European Funded project ( Horizon 2020) of 4 years aiming at embeding sustainable RRI practices in four European research public organisations and one funding body through Action Plans (AP) for institutional and cultural change. This will be accompanied by establishing a platform for engagement with the Quadruple Helix and a platform for mutual learning . UNESCO will be leading WP 3 reviewing the Status of the Art of RRI and creating a Library of actions on existing practices for public research and funding bodies to promote RRI keys: society engagement, science education, women in science, ethics and open acces.
Outcome EN: Outcome 7 - Promote inclusion and combat discrimination, hate speech and stereotypes
Output EN: 7.SHS2 - Member States capacities strengthened in applying social and human scientific frontier knowledge to devise effective policy solutions to advance an inclusive development agenda addressing the legacies of the pandemic crisis and face the social impact of climate change

Project: ICEP global modelling - SDG Indicator 14.1.1
Description: The overall goal is to achieve an operational approach for calculating national status and trends for the Index for Coastal Eutrophication Potential (ICEP see https://youtu.be/qW2nV2bsyCs) as an indicator for Sustainable Development Goal 14.1.1 on eutrophication: By 2025, prevent and significantly reduce marine pollution of all kinds, in particular from land-based activities, including marine debris and nutrient pollution.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health and accelerate the transition towards sustainable management of ocean-related risks and opportunities

Project: ASPnet contributes to the empowerment of learners through transformative education to lead healthy lives, promote sustainable development and engage with the world as creative and responsible global citizens
Description: ASPnet links over 12,000 educational institutions in more than 180 countries around a common goal: to empower learners to lead healthy lives, promote sustainable development and engage with the world as creative and responsible global citizens. The network makes an important contribution to reaching SDG 4.7 and 4.c. Through pilot projects, members experiment innovative approaches to improve the quality of education and share good practices for scale with the network and wider education community, including policy makers. To effectively support its members to drive educational innovation and transformation, the ASPnet needs to provide substantive impulses, renew its communication and collaboration tools and provide quality assurance in order to play its role effectively.
Outcome EN: Outcome 7 - Promote inclusion and combat discrimination, hate speech and stereotypes
Output EN: 7.ED3 - Learners are empowered to lead healthy lives, promote sustainable development and engage with the world as creative and responsible global citizens

Project: Strengthening resilience and effectiveness of education systems in LAC to better deliver SDG4
Description: UNESCO Santiago will carry out analytical work on the state of education in the region and coordinates the response to the needs of Member States in the areas of education planning and management, including monitoring, information systems, education statistics, and their use and impact on the coverage and quality of education. Additionally, its Latin American Laboratory for Assessment of the Quality of Education (LLECE) will support Member States in the better use of information of the results generated by the Regional Comparative and Explanatory Study (ERCE) to know where they are in the educational trajectory, to build evidence on what works to achieve greater coherence of education policies, and better alignment between policy goals and processes within and across systems.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED6 - Resilience, quality and equity of education systems strengthened to flexibly respond to evolving learning environments and to better deliver on SDG4 commitments

Project: Member States capacities are strengthened to scale up their policy, institutional and legislative actions towards gender equality, to eliminate gender-based violence and discrimination, gender biases and stereotypes, including in the digital world
Description: The COVID19 pandemic affected women in a differentiated pattern, deepening existing gender gaps and causing a significant setback in terms of human rights and gender equality. Such impact has been more evident in employment, in the accentuated burden regarding care work and reproductive work, or in relation to a greater exposure of women to cases of physical, psychological, sexual, and patrimonial violence. The pandemic had an especially severe impact on women who face multiple discrimination, based on race, ethnicity, age, disability, and other factors, deepening pre-existing gaps and challenges. Extreme violence against women is femicide/feminicide. In Latin America and the Caribbean, there are 14 of the 25 countries with the highest number of femicides/feminicides in the world
Outcome EN: Outcome 7 - Promote inclusion and combat discrimination, hate speech and stereotypes
Output EN: 7.SHS3 - Member States capacities are strengthened to scale up their policy, institutional and legislative actions towards gender equality, to eliminate gender-based violence and discrimination, gender biases and stereotypes, including in the digital world

Project: Apppui à l'accès à l'information
Description:
A un moment où les médias de nos pays en développement sont confrontés à un avenir économique incertain, la question de la viabilité des médias se trouve sous le feu des projecteurs.
Une initiative visant à renforcer la viabilité des médias ivoiriens permettra d'étudier l'ampleur de la crise des médias d'information indépendants et consultera les parties prenantes pour trouver des solutions.
Cela en vue de partager les connaissances entre les médias et de produire des recommandations politiques pour soutenir la viabilité des médias d'information.
Outcome EN: Outcome 8 - Foster knowledge sharing and skills development in the digital age
Output EN: 8.CI4 - Member States are enabled to foster universal access to information and knowledge, including through the Information for All Programme (IFAP), as well as through Open Solutions, and through the identification, preservation and accessibility of documentary heritage

Project: 355GLO5004.1 - Output 1: Capacities of Member States reinforced and advocacy conducted to develop and integrate evidence-based, human-rights centered recommendations on media and internet policy into national development priorities.
Description:
This concerns earmarked projects supported by the IPDC through the 2021 earmarked project series, Output 1, to carry out assessments on media development, journalists safety, internet universality using internationally recognized sets of indicators developed by UNESCO. Such assessments provide a reliable resource for policy makers in guiding media- and internet-related policies with reference to international standards. The IPDC is no longer the implementing unit for these activities. 

Implementing units: MID, FEJ, DIT.
Outcome EN: Outcome 6 - Promote freedom of expression and the right to information
Output EN: 6.CI3 - Member States and media institutions enabled to strengthen media development and media pluralism, including through the International Programme for the Development of Communication (IPDC)

Project: CapED Programme - Reinforcing Education Sector-Wide Policies, Plans and Reforms
Description: The CapED Programme is an extrabudgetary programme created in 2003. It is based on the understanding that education reforms will not be effective if countries lack the capacities to make them operational. With an overarching capacity development approach, CapED seeks to improve the quality of education and increase learning opportunities, especially for girls and women and disadvantaged population groups. Under "Reinforcing Education Sector-Wide Policies, Plans and Reforms", CapED assists countries in achieving progress towards national education objectives, including SDG 4 commitments, through relevant policies and improved educational planning, management and monitoring.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED6 - Resilience, quality and equity of education systems strengthened to flexibly respond to evolving learning environments and to better deliver on SDG4 commitments

Project: 41 C/5 OP7: Education policy and finance decisions to achieve SDG 4 are informed by improved coordination, data and monitoring, knowledge and innovative partnerships
Description: Education policy and finance decisions to achieve SDG 4 are informed by improved coordination, data and monitoring, knowledge and innovative partnerships

Project: Ocean InfoHub (OIH)
Description: The Project will create an ecosystem wherein stakeholders can provide, discover, and use diverse content and services in a coherent and easily implementable manner. The Project will thus promote closer interaction across regions and themes, leading to improved mutual understanding and collaboration as well as to strengthening of inter-, multi-, and transdisciplinary science, technology and innovation systems and policies.
