Project: Education response to COVID-19- Consortium of Grant Agents: UNESCO, UNICEF and the World Bank
Description: UNESCO, UNICEF and the World Bank are joining forces to achieve the principal goal of keeping children learning through COVID-19 crisis. The consortium will do this by helping GPE ESPIG-eligible countries adopt evidence-based strategies and measures to respond to the crisis.
Outcome EN: Outcome 2 - Strengthen international coordination for the achievement of SDG 4 and develop the global education agenda based on research, foresight and innovation
Output EN: 2.ED7 - Education policy and finance decisions to achieve SDG 4 are informed by improved coordination, data and monitoring, knowledge and innovative partnerships
Donor: World Bank - Global Partnership for Education

Project: The Role of Sediments and Hydropower in River Basin Management.
Description: The transport of sediments is a natural process in river systems. However, human activities have led to significant changes of natural sediment loads in rivers over the past decades. These changes negatively influence important issues such as flood risk, inland navigation, ecology and hydropower production. For the latter, the loss of storage capacity due to sedimentation is a significant problem. The World bank has undertaken a global project on the issue, in the framework of which UNESCO has been assigned tasks including the implementation of 3 case studies and the contribution to the organization of 3 regional capacity building workshops on sediment management at river basin level.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.SC2 - Water science, innovation, education, management, cooperation and governance bolstered for a water secure world in a changing environment
Donor: World Bank/International Bank for Reconstruction and Development

Project: JPO (France) for ICC in Culture (CLT/PNP)"
Description: The JPO shall contribute to the safeguarding of the World Heritage sites in Cambodia, notably by serving as a secretariat member for the ICC-Angkor and ICC-Preah Vihear in the organization of the "International Coordination Committee for the Safeguarding and the Development of the Archaeological Sites (ICC). The main tasks shall include preparation of documents for the ICC-Angkor and Preah Vihear, organization of the ICC, follow-up on Recommendation adopted by the ICC, coordination of cultural projects to preserve and promote cultural and natural heritage sites in Cambodia, as well as project development.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: JPO (Austria) for Cultural and Natural Heritage, Europe and North America Unit
Description: The JPO shall assist in advising States Parties to the Convention concerning the protection of World Cultural and Natural Heritage in the Europe and North America Region concerning the planning, development and implementation of outreach strategies and activities aimed at strengthening the credibility of the World Heritage List and achieving the strategic objectives defined by the World Heritage Committee as well as raising awareness of the World Heritage Convention towards young adults and professionals, including through social media.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: Appui au développement local à travers les médias communautaires, phase 2
Description: L'objectif de projet est d'aménager un cadre qui facilite l'accroissement du niveau de participation et de responsabilisation des communautés à la base aux différents processus de transformation sociale qui s'opèrent dans le pays. Il va à cet effet accompagner la création de 40 radios communautaires pour améliorer l'accès des populations vulnérables à l'information, leur donner une tribune d'expression et de dialogue communautaire sur les solutions locales aux questions de développement durable, de prévention et de gestion des catastrophes et des crises. Le projet vise pareillement l'adoption de politiques normes qui assurent la durabilité des radios communautaires au Cameroun.
Outcome EN: Outcome 6 - Promote freedom of expression and the right to information
Output EN: 6.CI3 - Member States and media institutions enabled to strengthen media development and media pluralism, including through the International Programme for the Development of Communication (IPDC)

Project: UNESCO/Juan Bosch Prize for the Promotion of Social Science Research in Latin America and the Caribbean
Description: This prize, sponsored by the Government of the Dominican Republic, was instituted in 2009. It rewards every two years young Latin American and Caribbean researchers whose work has made a significant contribution to the strengthening of links between research and public policy in the field of social sciences, and is worth $10,000 and a diploma.
Outcome EN: Outcome 7 - Promote inclusion and combat discrimination, hate speech and stereotypes
Output EN: 7.SHS2 - Member States capacities strengthened in applying social and human scientific frontier knowledge to devise effective policy solutions to advance an inclusive development agenda with the aim to improve the well-being of people, particularly the most vulnerable, addressing the legacies of the pandemic crisis and face the social impact of climate change

Project: Support to the Caribbean Large Marine Ecosystem (CLME) Project
Description: The PROCARIBE + project " is a GEF funded project to which UNOPS has been selected as Executing Entity and IOC of UNESCO is one of Technical and Scientific Agencies and co-implementing partners. The project coordination unit is located and operating at the offices of IOCARIBE in Cartagena Colombia provided free of charge by IOC (UNESCO) as a contribution to the project.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health and accelerate the transition towards sustainable management of ocean-related risks and opportunities
Donor: United Nations Office for Project Services

Project: Semaine Africaine - Editions 2019-2022
Description: La semaine africaine est célébrée tous les ans au Siège de l'UNESCO, pour coincider avec la journée mondiale de l'Afrique (25 mai), à l'initiative du Groupe africain et en coopération avec l'UNESCO/le Département Afrique. L'UNESCO apporte à la fois une contribution financière et sur le plan du contenu pour soutenir cet événement (tables-rondes, communication, visibilité, etc). La contribution financière couvre notamment les frais techniques, l'hospitalité, l'interprétation et la location des espaces utilisés.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PAX3 - Impact and visibility of UNESCO's programmes in Africa strengthened through enhanced coordination, monitoring and mobilization of partners in relation to the Operational Strategy for Priority Africa (2022-2029), and better understanding of Africa's development opportunities and challenges

Project: Management of the trust fund at the World Heritage Centre
Description: Management of the Netherlands Funds-in-Trust at the World Heritage Centre
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: MARCO-BOLO: MARine COastal BiOdiversity Long-term Observations
Description: The MARCO-BOLO project aims to structure and strengthen European coastal and marine biodiversity observation capabilities, linking them to global efforts (e.g. MBON, GOOS, OBIS and UN Ocean Decade Programmes Marine Life 2030, OBON, ODIS, Ocean Practices for the Decade) to understand and restore ocean health, and ensuring outputs respond to explicit stakeholder needs from policy, planning, and industry.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health and accelerate the transition towards sustainable management of ocean-related risks and opportunities

Project: Emergency Assistance from the World Heritage Fund
Description:
This reserve fund established by the World Heritage Convention is part of the World Heritage Fund. It supports the States Parties to the World Heritage Convention to face severe damage that occurred to the cultural or natural sites located on their territories and inscribed on the World Heritage List.
The World Heritage Committee has voted a budget of US$400,000 under this reserve fund for 2022-2023.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: Junior Professional Officer (JPO) Government of China (JPO)
Description: Under the overall authority of the Chief Financial Officer (CFO) and the supervision of the Chief of section for budget, monitoring and reporting, the JPO shall assist in the preparation, monitoring and reporting on the utilization of the Organization's biennial budget, as well as in dealing with various budgetary issues. The CFO oversees the planning and monitoring of the Organization's budget, and the Chief of section will provide guidance to the JPO in all aspects of the daily work in these areas.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 11 - Accountable, efficient and effective management in pursuit of the Organization's results
Output EN: 11.BFM1 - Prudent financial management, while strengthening of the internal controls and the second line of defense, supported by appropriate and timely management and financial reporting

Project: ECW MULTI-YEAR RESILIENCE PROGRAMME (MYRP) FOR THE STATE OF PALESTINE 2019-2021
Description: Owing to the chronic crisis state and protracted conflict, this ECW programme in Palestine aims to strengthen the resilience and development of affected children, families and communities in Gaza, East Jerusalem, Hebron and Area C. The programme seeks to achieve the following results: improved access and continuity of inclusive, equitable education and learning opportunities for girls and boys; improved relevance and quality of education in a protective and safe learning environment; and strengthened capacity of the education system to respond to emergency needs and deliver a coordinated response in crises as part of the overall education system.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED1 - Education systems are equipped to promote inclusion, address marginalization and advance rights, including in crisis-affected and post-disaster contexts

Project: "Palestine Riwaya Museum in Bethlehem (finalisation of Phase III: Completion the renovation of the Museum's space )"
Description:
The overall objective of the project is to establish a model Palestinian interactive and multimedia museum in Bethlehem, called Riwaya (narrative) Museum. It will be a venue for safeguarding and promoting Palestinian cultural diversity and fostering intercultural dialogue as it will serve as a tourist destination. This particular phase aims at completing the renovation of the museum space started in Phase III of the project.

Note: For detailed information about the scope and concerning the current project, please refer to the "Application for grants from the 
Norwegian Ministry of Foreign Affairs (MFA)" in the attachments section.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT2 - Member States capacities strengthened to fight the illicit trafficking of cultural property and promote its return and restitution, to protect underwater cultural heritage and to promote the role of museums for societies

Project: Supporting the Institutional Sustainability of Al-Aqsa Mosque Centre for the Restoration of Islamic Manuscripts in Jerusalem: Phase IV: Consolidation of skills and Exit Strategy.
Description: The objective of this project proposal is to make of the Center for the restoration of Islamic Manuscripts of the Haram al Sharif, in Jerusalem, an operational, autonomous and sustainable entity by the end of the project, in 2020, able to safeguard this unique Islamic heritage. The project will include a Conservation assessment of the Center; the elaboration of a 10-year conservation and management strategy; the reinforcement of the capacities of the staff; the restoration of the premises; the digitization and inventory of the collections; and the human and material reinforcement of the Center. The project will be developed over an estimated period of 3 years.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT2 - Member States capacities strengthened to fight the illicit trafficking of cultural property and promote its return and restitution, to protect underwater cultural heritage and to promote the role of museums for societies

Project: Instruments and strategies for sustainable development of the Historic Centre of Salvador, Bahia
Description: The objective of the Project aims is to train Mário Leal Ferreira Foundation - FMLF, public agents, private and social actors for the application of urban instruments foreseen in the Urban Development Director Plan, aiming the conception of strategies and projects directed to the requalification of cultural heritage and sustainable development of the Historic Centre of Salvador, Bahia.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: Tribal Freedom Fighters Museum of India
Description: India is on the cusp of developing leading edge museums honouring Tribal Freedom fighters. There are ten such museums in the making across India. There is an urgent need to develop a systematic approach to the development of these museums and provide inclusive cultural leadership. Ministry of Tribal Affairs, UNESCO and UNDP are coming together for a two-day workshop to further this momentum.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT2 - Member States capacities strengthened to fight the illicit trafficking of cultural property and promote its return and restitution, to protect underwater cultural heritage and to promote the role of museums for societies

Project: Preserving Iraqi heritage
Description: The main purpose of the project is the documentation and the preservation of the important archive of books and manuscripts belonging to the Meir Tweg synagogue in Baghdad.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT3 - Member States capacities strengthened for better preparedness, mitigation and response to emergencies affecting culture, including in situations of armed conflict and disaster

Project: UNESCO Documentation and Advisory Services (UDAS)
Description:
The project UNESCO Documentation and Advisory Services for WH sites in Lebanon aims at helping the Directorate General of Antiquities in the control of works in the World Heritage sites of Tyre and Baalbek as well as meeting the World Heritage requirements of consultation and monitoring of conservation measures to be implemented. This will be achieved through :

1.	Organization of four consultation workshops and events .
2.	Supplying technical assistance to the DGA for preparing various reports to be submitted to the WHC.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: Strengthening Costa Rica's SDG Financing Architecture Through Resource Alignment with National Goals and Improved Education Sector Public Spending
Description: Through a 2 pillar approach the Joint Programme (JP) intends to strengthen SDG financing architecture at the national, sectoral (education) and ecosystem levels. Working with the public sector it will develop an integrated financing strategy to mobilize and align multiple sources of capital and planning processes with national development priorities and the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development, while focusing specifically on the education sector to improve its public spending efficiency through the implementation of a gender-responsive, socially inclusive and results-based budget and framework.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED6 - Resilience, quality and equity of education systems strengthened to flexibly respond to evolving learning environments and to better deliver on SDG4 commitments

Project: Strengthening Costa Rica's SDG Financing Architecture Through Resource Alignment with National Goals and Improved Education Sector Public Spending
Description: Through a 2 pillar approach the Joint Programme (JP) intends to strengthen SDG financing architecture at the national, sectoral (education) and ecosystem levels. Working with the public sector it will develop an integrated financing strategy to mobilize and align multiple sources of capital and planning processes with national development priorities and the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development, while focusing specifically on the education sector to improve its public spending efficiency through the implementation of a gender-responsive, socially inclusive and results-based budget and framework.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED6 - Resilience, quality and equity of education systems strengthened to flexibly respond to evolving learning environments and to better deliver on SDG4 commitments

Project: JPO (China) for the IOC Sub-Commission for the Western Pacific (IOC/WESTPAC)
Description: Under the overall authority of the Director of the UNESCO Regional Bureau for the Asia and Pacific, and the direct supervision of the Head of the IOC/WESTPAC Office, the JPO will provide technical and logistic support for international programme development and implementation for the sustainable development of ocean, marine and coastal resources; and promote the UN Decade of Ocean Science for Sustainable Development (2021-2030) in the region.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health and accelerate the transition towards sustainable management of ocean-related risks and opportunities

Project: Support to the Caribbean Large Marine Ecosystem (CLME) Project
Description: The PROCARIBE + project " is a GEF funded project to which UNOPS has been selected as Executing Entity and IOC of UNESCO is one of Technical and Scientific Agencies and co-implementing partners. The project coordination unit is located and operating at the offices of IOCARIBE in Cartagena Colombia provided free of charge by IOC (UNESCO) as a contribution to the project.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health and accelerate the transition towards sustainable management of ocean-related risks and opportunities
Donor: United Nations Office for Project Services

Project: Teacher quality for quality learning in Latin America and the Caribbean
Description: This workplan proposes to support LAC Member States in strengthening teacher quality as a way to address the overall need of improving students' learning outcomes in the region. The workplan is anchored in two main lines of action 1) Improving teacher education with focus on enhancing students' quality learning in foundational skills - literacy and numeracy; 2) improving teachers' professional status with focus on issues related to teachers' autonomy, agency, motivation and accountability in the context of teacher reforms proposing quality standards in the profession.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED5 - Teachers trained and supported to improve learning outcomes and address the changes brought forth by the digital and AI transformation and the COVID-19 crisis

Project: Partnerships and outreach for system resilience strengthening
Description: Areas of activities foreseen in this workplan include: (1) communication and knowledge dissemination, including publications; (2) resource mobilization and partnerships, e.g., project document development and advocacy materials and conduct fundraising; (3) development of international communities of practice (COP) for peer learning and joint programmes and knowledge sharing.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED6 - Resilience, quality and equity of education systems strengthened to flexibly respond to evolving learning environments and to better deliver on SDG4 commitments

Project: Ocean data and information products and services to underpin science-informed policies
Description: Science-informed policies for reduced vulnerability to ocean hazards, for the global conservation and sustainable use of oceans, seas and marine resources, and increased resilience and adaptation to climate change, developed and implemented by Member States, requires reliable data and information products and services that are directly usable by predictive models, adaptive strategies and other strategies that will assist the global society with building increased resilience to climate change and other ocean and climate related challenges. IODE and its OBIS will continue developing and disseminating the relevant products and services.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health and accelerate the transition towards sustainable management of ocean-related risks and opportunities

Project: Reducing Nutrient Enrichment
Description: The objective is to foster research to deliver improved tools for management of nutrient loading to the marine environment. The activity will contribute to the development of the indicator for Sustainable Development Goal 14.1.1. on nutrient pollution, ICEP. The activity establishes a link between several IOC programs and projects as well as the activities of other organizations in particular UN Environment and the Global Partnership on Nutrient Management.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health and accelerate the transition towards sustainable management of ocean-related risks and opportunities

Project: IOC Governing Bodies
Description:
The Intergovernmental Oceanographic commission is established as a body with functional autonomy within UNESCO. The Commission defines and implements its programme according to its stated purpoe and functions and within the framework of the budget adopted by its Assembly.
The Governing Bodies of the Commission consist of an Assembly, an Executive Council and such subsidiry bodies as it may establish.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health and accelerate the transition towards sustainable management of ocean-related risks and opportunities

Project: Supporting the empowerment of women through social sciences flagship reports
Description: The Management of Social Transformations Programme (MOST) will produce an annual flagship report on inclusive and resilient societies in partnership with the International Center for Social and Human Sciences in Barcelona will contribute to foster the necessary changes to the intellectual underpinnings of the economic and social policy thinking of Member States to deliver better for people, particularly the most vulnerable, with a strong focus on the gendering of contemporary inequalities, including the empowerment of women.
Outcome EN: Outcome 7 - Promote inclusion and combat discrimination, hate speech and stereotypes
Output EN: 7.SHS3 - Member States capacities are strengthened to scale up their policy, institutional and legislative actions towards gender equality, to eliminate gender-based violence and discrimination, gender biases and stereotypes, including in the digital world

Project: Programme Operating Costs
Description: Programe Operating Costs CLT
Output EN: CLT Programme-related, operating and staff costs

Project: Small project program to support documentary heritage at risk
Description:
In 2018, UNESCO and Qatar National Library joined forces in launching the regional project "Supporting Documentary Heritage Preservation in the Arab Region". 
Following this collaboration, QNL decided to pursue its partnership with UNESCO by reallocating the remaining funds of the project to implement activities in line with the targets of the original project.
This project will seek to support the preservation of documentary heritage in the Arab region through the creation of a "small project program". The program will focus on documentary heritage under threats by funding projects led by documentary heritage institutions at risk of manmade or natural disasters.
Outcome EN: Outcome 8 - Foster knowledge sharing and skills development in the digital age
Output EN: 8.CI4 - Member States are enabled to foster universal access to information and knowledge, including through the Information for All Programme (IFAP), as well as through Open Solutions, and through the identification, preservation and accessibility of documentary heritage

Project: Enhanced partnerships and resource mobilization in the South Asia Region
Description:
In line with UNESCO's overall Comprehensive Partnership Strategy, the UNESCO New Delhi Office will sustain strategic alliances with key public and private partners (including civil society) from countries within its cluster responsibility, to build long-term partnerships based on a common purpose, mutual accountability and a shared commitment to deliver results.
To that end, and under the overall authority and supervision of the Director of the New Delhi Office, the Partnerships and Resource Mobilization Officer will coordinate the implementation and monitoring of the Office's partnership-building and resource mobilization strategy, in coordination with relevant Central Services and Programme Divisions at Headquarters, for improved programme delivery.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.FLD4 - UNESCO Field Offices empowered to strengthen resource mobilization at decentralized level

Project: UNESCO Greening Education Partnership in Asia and the Pacific - Climate Education for Sustainable Development
Description:
The UN Secretary General's Transforming Education Summit and its Greening Education Partnership Initiative have gained significant momentum in Asia and the Pacific. Member States are requesting UNESCO's technical and guiding support towards greening education "getting every learner climate-ready".
 
At global level, various partners have committed to support the Greening Education Partnership which is led by UNESCO. To build on fostered momentum and to translate global commitment into regional and national commitment and action in the Asia Pacific, UNESCO Bangkok is carrying out a set of activities to mobilize voluntary contributions from bi- and multi-lateral development partner.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.FLD4 - UNESCO Field Offices empowered to strengthen resource mobilization at decentralized level

Project: Knowledge management and information technologies initiatives within the framework of the Invest for Efficient Delivery Fund.
Description: At its 196th session, the Executive Board endorsed the Knowledge Management & Information and Communication Technology (KM & ICT) Strategy. It expressed its satisfaction with the progress made so far and recognized the need for a considerable targeted investment to fully implement the KM & ICT strategy. At the 197th session, five KM & ICT projects were proposed as part of the Invest for Efficient Delivery plan, as these investments could not be absorbed under the 38 C/5 Regular Budget. The Executive Board approved the initial phases of the Invest for Efficient Delivery plan.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 11 - Accountable, efficient and effective management in pursuit of the Organization's results
Output EN: 11.DBS1 - More integrated and properly codified project and knowledge management in support of programme delivery

Project: Ensuring Inclusive Engagement of Indigenous Peoples and Local Communities in Ocean Decade Actions, Structures, and Processes
Description: The Ocean Decade seeks to stimulate ocean science and knowledge generation to reverse the decline of the state of the ocean and its biodiversity. To achieve this goal, the Ocean Decade defines ocean science to include the traditional knowledge of Indigenous Peoples and that of local communities. The proposed project will refine and finalise an engagement framework with IPLC and facilitate meaningful and sustained engagement of IPLC in the Ocean Decade activities and structures.
Outcome EN: Outcome 3 - Enhance knowledge for climate action, biodiversity, water and ocean management, and disaster risk reduction
Output EN: 3.IOC1 - Member States critically supported in strengthening their capacity to conduct marine scientific research, generate knowledge, and develop and implement science-based tools, services, and policies in order to reverse the decline in ocean health and accelerate the transition towards sustainable management of ocean-related risks and opportunities

Project: Culture for development promoted and inputs provided for policy improvement (2021 IC)
Description:
As approved by the Steering Committee of the Regional Bureau for Science and Culture in Europe, this activity aims at increasing the visibility of culture for the implementation of the 2030 Agenda in the region, and at better integrating culture into regional, national and local development programmes, by supporting the implementation of the thematic Indicators for Culture in the 2030 Agenda (Culture|2030 Indicators) in selected pilot countries and cities.
The indicators will assess both the role of culture as a sector of activity, as well as the transversal contribution of culture across different Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) and policy areas.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: Japanese JPO in World Heritage Centre (WHC) for the Policy and Statutory meetings Unit
Description: Under the overall authority of the Director of the UNESCO World Heritage Centre and the general supervision of the Chief of the Policy and Statutory meetings Unit the incumbent shall participate in the planning and implementation of the activities related to statutory meetings.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: JPO (France) for Education Planning (BEI)
Description: Under the general authority of the Director of the UNESCO Office in Beirut and the direct supervision of the Programme Specialist, the JPO will be responsible for contributing to the coordination of UNESCO's actions within the framework of technical support for the implementation of Lebanon Five-Year General Education Plan, and support the implementation of the Li Beirut initiative.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED1 - Education systems are equipped to promote inclusion, address marginalization and advance rights, including in crisis-affected and post-disaster contexts

Project: Develpment of innovative solutions in São Paulo State education
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED6 - Resilience, quality and equity of education systems strengthened to flexibly respond to evolving learning environments and to better deliver on SDG4 commitments

Project: Empowering men and boys for gender equality in India
Description: This workstream builds on UNESCO's programming to engage men and boys in gender equality in India (2019-2021). Responding to the needs, priorities, and demand identified in this first phase of implementation, UNESCO's Social and Human Sciences sector (SHS) will build a follow-on/up programme, 'Transforming MEN-talities II' to strengthen a) knowledge on the behavioural, institutional, and structural factors which enable interventions to engage men and boys for gender equality to be successful; 2) the scale and reach of operational activities to engage men and boys for gender equality within educational and community settings; and 3) the networks available to encourage peer-learning, good practice sharing, and coordination around engaging men and boys for gender equality in India.
Outcome EN: Outcome 7 - Promote inclusion and combat discrimination, hate speech and stereotypes
Output EN: 7.SHS3 - Member States capacities are strengthened to scale up their policy, institutional and legislative actions towards gender equality, to eliminate gender-based violence and discrimination, gender biases and stereotypes, including in the digital world

Project: Building back better through participation
Description: Through this project, the United Nations Country team, UNESCO and UN Human Rights seek to streamline ongoing support by the United Nations, its agencies, funds and programmes, to advance civic space. It aims to empower journalists and human rights defenders to engage with the Government to address their safety and protection.
Outcome EN: Outcome 6 - Promote freedom of expression and the right to information
Output EN: 6.CI2 - Member States have strengthened capacities and raised awareness to enhance norms and policies related to freedom of expression, press freedom, safety of journalists, including women journalists, and the right to access information, online and offline

Project: Developing Digital skills and Education for Sustainable Development through Distance Learning in Palestine - Phase I
Description: COVID-19 affected education in Palestine as teachers and students moved to online teaching and learning and youth lost job opportunities. It is important to mitigate the impact on education and human resource development by providing digital and transversal skills for sustainable development through distance education platforms and TVET. UNESCO's project will target 300 of the most vulnerable and most affected schools in the West Bank and Gaza Strip during its pilot phase. This will ensure MoE will be capable of developing and uploading online lessons to all grades in Palestine and providing training in soft and digital skills for TVET students in different areas such as WBL.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED4 - Learners are equipped with relevant skills to meet individual, labour market and societal demands through literacy, TVET, STEM and higher education

Project: PALESTINE- Emergency Assistance, with the aim to support Palestinian students residing in Palestine to pursue their academic studies
Description: Emergency Assistance, with the aim to support Palestinian students residing in Palestine to pursue their academic studies
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particularly in Africa, developing countries, LDCs, and SIDS

Project: Emergency Assistance - Peru - Impacted by Cyclone Yaku and the intense rains and floods have caused in the northern part of the country.
Description: This project will provide a response to nine educational institutions in the regions of Lambayeque, Pura and Tumbes declared in a state of National Emergency due to major disasters, as a result of heavy rainfall. Concretely, this project will allow the purchase of educational furniture, and in particularly desks manufactured in a single piece of polyethylene with advanced ergonomic design. As these desks are not disassembled, it guarantees an easy maintenance and a high durability and resistance.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particularly in Africa, developing countries, LDCs, and SIDS

Project: Strengthening Safety of Journalists and Professional Journalistic Standards in the Philippines
Description:
The project contributes to the strengthening of safety of journalists in the Philippines through capacity building for the journalists. The project will follow a gender sensitive approach including a focus on women journalists. In the long term, it aims to foster an enabling environment for a sustainable, free, independent, and professional media in the country. 
The main output of the project are:
•	Capacity building workshops to strengthen journalists' digital and physical safety skills, 
•	Capacity building workshops to strengthen journalists' skills on professional standards and ethical journalism;
Outcome EN: Outcome 6 - Promote freedom of expression and the right to information
Output EN: 6.CI2 - Member States have strengthened capacities and raised awareness to enhance norms and policies related to freedom of expression, press freedom, safety of journalists, including women journalists, and the right to access information, online and offline

Project: GPE LEG Assessment for Tanzania Mainland
Description: The Purpose of the Activity is to undertake The Global Partnership for Education (GPE) Local Education Group (LEG)/ Education Sector Development Committee (ESDC) self-assessment aims to enable the LEG to reflect on their performance, identify areas for improvement, and develop a plan for strengthening their work.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED6 - Resilience, quality and equity of education systems strengthened to flexibly respond to evolving learning environments and to better deliver on SDG4 commitments

Project: Advancing Gender equality education programmes in Mexico
Description: Mexico is a country that faces challenges in violence against women and girls, in response, the State Government has developed a programme for gender education. Unesco Mexico will support this project by contributing with ther revision and integration of gender equality in the curricula content for basic and middle education and monitoring of the implementation in the schools of the state of Mexico. We will raise awareness of the need for other states to engage in gender education programes.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED2 - Gender transformative education systems empower learners, ensure safe learning environments and address the educational barriers, particularly for girls and women, exacerbated by the learning crisis

Project: Advancing Gender equality education programmes in Mexico
Description: Mexico is a country that faces challenges in violence against women and girls, in response, the State Government has developed a programme for gender education. Unesco Mexico will support this project by contributing with ther revision and integration of gender equality in the curricula content for basic and middle education and monitoring of the implementation in the schools of the state of Mexico. We will raise awareness of the need for other states to engage in gender education programes.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED2 - Gender transformative education systems empower learners, ensure safe learning environments and address the educational barriers, particularly for girls and women, exacerbated by the learning crisis

Project: Fostering Sustainable Development through Creativity in Local Cities
Description: This project aims to recognize creativity as a strategic factor for sustainable development of cities and public spaces within it. It will enhance initiatives to make creativity an essential component of urban development. The project will consider both UCCN and other cities, such as Ensenada, Mexico City, San Cristobal, Morelia, Puebla, Guadalajara (part of UCCN), or Guanajuato (WHL) and Mazatlán ("Islands and Protected Areas of the Gulf of California", WHL), among others. To strengthen cultural diversity, it will mainstream the integration of creativity into local development plans. The project will reinforce the adoption of SDG's to develop creativity in the cities. In addition, it will contribute to stablish a wide framework to improve access and participation in cultural life.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT6 - Member States capacities strengthened to promote, monitor and measure the contribution of culture to the implementation of the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development at the local, national and regional levels

Project: Supporting the development of a pluralistic, diverse, independent, gender-sensitive and professionally ethical national media ecosystem
Description: During 2022 and 2023, the UNESCO Office in Mexico will continue the work it began in the last biennium to implement the Media Development Indicators in Mexico, as well as the work to strengthen Community and Indigenous Media. Currently, the country faces a low level of trust in information and media by society, so it is necessary to restore this trust and continue to support the consolidation of an ecosystem of plural, independent, diverse media that integrate the gender approach and are handled ethically in crisis and emergency situations.
Outcome EN: Outcome 6 - Promote freedom of expression and the right to information
Output EN: 6.CI3 - Member States and media institutions enabled to strengthen media development and media pluralism, including through the International Programme for the Development of Communication (IPDC)

Project: Right of access to information and knowledge in Mexico for inclusion and equality of vulnerable groups
Description: The UNESCO Office in Mexico will continue the work initiated in 2021 for the implementation of SDG Indicator 16.10.2, in order to improve the processes and policies of the right of access to information and knowledge, promoting inclusive solutions for the empowerment of people belonging to vulnerable and/or marginalized groups, such as people in mobility, speakers of indigenous languages, people with disabilities, women and girls, etc.
Outcome EN: Outcome 8 - Foster knowledge sharing and skills development in the digital age
Output EN: 8.CI4 - Member States are enabled to foster universal access to information and knowledge, including through the Information for All Programme (IFAP), as well as through Open Solutions, and through the identification, preservation and accessibility of documentary heritage

Project: PROCESSUS DE PREPARATION DU PACTE DE PARTENARIAT POUR LE FINANCEMENT GPE (Côte d'Ivoire)
Description:
Le Gouvernement ivoirien ambitionne de disposer pour son développement économique et socioculturel durable de ressources humaines de qualité et productive.

Les " Etats Généraux de l'Education Nationale et de l'Alphabétisation" ont permis d'identifier une série de solutions pour la transformation durable du système éducatif ivoirien. Son opérationnalisation nécessite un engagement de toutes les parties prenantes pour un nouveau pacte de reconstruction de l'école ivoirienne respectueuse des valeurs citoyennes.

A cet effet il été obtenu l'appui du PME, pour la mise en œuvre de son Plan sectoriel de l'éducation et de la formation. Le Gouvernement et le GLPE ont désigné l'UNESCO Agent Partenaire pour le fonds du PME pour l'appui technique à l'élaboration du Pacte de partenariat.
Outcome EN: Outcome 1 - Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
Output EN: 1.ED6 - Resilience, quality and equity of education systems strengthened to flexibly respond to evolving learning environments and to better deliver on SDG4 commitments

Project: Local Communities and Sustainable Tourism in Petra and Wadi Rum
Description: The overall purpose of this project is to ensure the sustainable conservation of the World Heritage Sites of Petra and Wadi Rum, while offering local communities the possibility to take part in the preservation of the sites through limited cash-for-works activities, enhance their capacity in tourism and hospitality-related activities, and raise their awareness on the importance of their role in the safeguarding of their own cultural heritage. In addition, the project intents to promote gender equality, and will support economic growth by creating job opportunities through the development of female-owned local businesses.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: For a balanced, strong, and gender-responsive media environment in Pakistan
Description: Federal and provincial government officials of Pakistan will be equipped and aware of mechanisms enabling them to produce yearly reports on SDG 16 target 10 / The program considers different levels of technical skills and awareness and helps advancing the 2030 Development Agenda & Pakistan's Vision 2025. The activities build on each other & create opportunities for dialogue. Output: awareness-raising workshops for government officials.
Outcome EN: Outcome 6 - Promote freedom of expression and the right to information
Output EN: 6.CI2 - Member States have strengthened capacities and raised awareness to enhance norms and policies related to freedom of expression, press freedom, safety of journalists, including women journalists, and the right to access information, online and offline

Project: Enhance the cultural heritage protection in Uzbekistan
Description: The activity is a continuation to the UNESCO initiative to support the Government of Uzbekistan to strengthen cultural heritage protection system. UNESCO has conducted an assessment of the cultural heritage protection mechanism/legislation of Uzbekistan and provided recommendations and a cultural heritage protection framework, which includes a comprehensive mechanism to protect, manage and promote the cultural heritage in accordance with the international requirements.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: Strengthening National Capacities in enhancing the state of conservation of World Heritage sites
Description: Bangladesh's rich cultural heritage comprises archaeological sites dating back to the earliest phases of human settlement in Asia, including two cultural World Heritage Sites, the Monuments of the Historic Mosque City of Bagerhat and the Ruins of the Buddhist Vihara at Paharpur, both inscribed as World Heritage in 1985. Since inscription many programmes and interventions were undertaken, including an UNESCO International Safeguarding Campaign from 1985-2001. However, there is still an urgent need for technical capacity building and management training, as there is a lack of knowledge about and application of current practices for all stages of management (protection, conservation, presentation) and absence of on-site professional management and no monitoring.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT1 - Member States capacities strengthened to identify, protect and manage tangible heritage

Project: Syrian Arab Republic: Emergency Assistance request to support educational establishments in several areas of Syria which have been affected by the severe earthquakes of 6 February 2023.
Description: The Syrian National Commission for UNESCO has submitted an emergency assistance request to support educational establishments in several areas of Syria which have been affected by the severe earthquakes of 6 February 2023.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particularly in Africa, developing countries, LDCs, and SIDS

Project: Syria emergency response in the domains of Culture and Education
Description:
Following the significant damages caused by the 7.8 magnitude earthquake and aftershocks in Syria the UNESCO Beirut Office undertook a mission to Aleppo and Damascus to prepare the emergency response in the Culture and Education Sectors. 

As a result, UNESCO positioned as lead for the Culture Sector Chapter within the interagency Syria Earthquake Recovery Needs Assessment (SERNA)'and was identified as in important partner in the overall UN response for education. 

The purpose of this activity is to ensure the continued leadership of UNESCO in the domain of Culture and meaningful engagement in the domain of Education in the Syria emergency response.
Outcome EN: Outcome 5 - Enhance the protection and promotion of the diversity of heritage and cultural expressions
Output EN: 5.CLT3 - Member States capacities strengthened for better preparedness, mitigation and response to emergencies affecting culture, including in situations of armed conflict and disaster

Project: Republic of Moldova - Emergency Assistance - Creating an inclusive and non-discriminatory environment for Ukrainian refugees in Moldova
Description: The Emergency Assistance project "Creating an inclusive and non-discriminatory environment for Ukrainian refugees in Moldova" to be implemented by the National Commission in collaboration with GENDER-CENTRU (Gender-Centre), aiming to benefit the affected refugees, as well as the host population, including the most vulnerable and marginalized groups, by building the resilience of the target groups (school children, parents/grandparents of refugee children, and schoolteachers with refugee children) in conditions of war and crisis. The requested amount will be used for organizing educational activities, purchasing equipment, producing and distributing information materials related to these activities.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particularly in Africa, developing countries, LDCs, and SIDS

Project: Armenia - Emergency Assistance - Inclusion of forcibly displaced refugee children from Nagorno-Karabakh in education process through promoting their psycho-social resilience
Description:
The request is submitted in the context of the ongoing humanitarian crisis in Nagorno-Karabakh, due to the blockade of the Lachin corridor by Azerbaijan, which has caused an exodus of the entire population of Nagorno-Karabakh. According to the Armenian authorities, nearly 101.000 refugees, including 30.000 children, are currently being accommodated across the country. These children experience psychological trauma, stress, communication challenges and grievances caused by the loss of their homes and the horrors of humanitarian crisis. The situation created gaps in the educational program. 
The requested amount will be used for organizing educational activities, purchasing equipment, producing and distributing information materials related to these activities.
Outcome EN: Enabling Outcome 10 - Reinforced partnerships, outreach and advocacy in support of UNESCO’s action
Output EN: 10.PPF1 - Participation Programme management significantly improved allowing greater transparency, timely coordination among sectors and responsiveness, and an increase in the number of projects approved for gender equality and countries in need, particularly in Africa, developing countries, LDCs, and SIDS
